Description:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO HELP LOW-INCOME, SNOHOMISH COUNTY RESIDENTS IMPROVE WELL-BEING THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN HEALTH, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, AND/OR RECOVERY AND ADDITION PROGRAMS; ACQUIRE THE SKILLS AND NATURAL SUPPORTS NEEDED TO SECURE AND MAINTAIN LONG-TERM EMPLOYMENT; MITIGATE THE NEGATIVE IMPACTS OF POVERTY THROUGH ACCESS TO FEDERAL BENEFIT PROGRAMS AND IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF HOW TO MAXIMIZE HEALTH AND RESOURCES THROUGH BUDGETING, HEALTHY LIFESTYLE CHOICES, SHOPPING AND COOKING FOR OPTIMAL NUTRITIONAL VALUE, ETC; AND MAXIMIZE THEIR EXPERIENCE AS A VALUED MEMBER OF A HEALTHY, RESILIENT, AND ENVIRONMENTALLY SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY THAT IS INCLUSIVE TO ALL DESPITE RACE AND ETHNICITY, GENDER IDENTITY, ABILITY, OR SOCIO-ECONOMIC STATUS. TO DO THIS, VILLAGE COMMUNITY SERVICES WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: CAPACITY BUILDING OF PROJECT SITES WHILE HELPING PEOPLE IN POVERTY RECEIVE JOB TRAINING, ACCESS TO CARE THROUGH OUTREACH AND COACHING, AND DEVELOPING A HEALTHY AND EQUITABLE COMMUNITY. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME, FORMERLY HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES, INCLUDING THOSE AFFLICTED WITH OPIOID ADDICTION OR DISABILITIES IN SNOHOMISH COUNTY. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE REACHING APPROXIMATELY 2,000 INDIVIDUALS, RAISING $100,000, AND INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF 25 COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS.

THE GRANTEE SHALL BE ENTITLED TO REIMBURSEMENT FOR COSTS INCURRED ON OR AFTER 4/23/23.  ALTHOUGH THE NOTICE OF GRANT AWARD WAS NOT SIGNED BY THE START DATE THE GRANTEE IS APPROVED FOR COSTS INCURRED ON OR AFTER THE START DATE OF THE GRANT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO HELP KING COUNTY RESIDENTS ACCESS THE BASIC NEEDS AND FINANCIAL RESOURCES THEY NEED TO MOVE OUT OF POVERTY. TO DO THIS, 27 VISTA MEMBERS AND 100 SUMMER ASSOCIATE VISTA MEMBERS WILL  CREATE MARKETING AND OUTREACH STRATEGIES, BEST PRACTICE TOOLKITS, SUSTAINABLE CURRICULUM, AND PROGRAM ANALYSIS AND RECOMMENDATIONS, AS WELL AS EXPAND COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS. THIS VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 3,025 LOW-INCOME INCOME AND HOUSING INSECURE INDIVIDUALS, 30,000 FOOD-INSECURE INDIVIDUALS, 1,600 CHILDREN IN SCHOOLS, 10,000 COMMUNITY AND TECHNICAL COLLEGE STUDENTS, AND 230 PARTNER AGENCIES.
THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE FY 2023 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.
THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE 2023 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.
THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE FY23 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO CLOSE THE WEALTH GAP IN NORTH CAROLINA BY ENSURING THAT EVERYONE HAS A PATHWAY TO PROSPERITY. TO DO THIS, IDA AND ASSET BUILDING VISTA PROJECT WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: THROUGH PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, EXPANDING ACCESS TO STATEWIDE FINANCIAL EDUCATION AND COACHING RESOURCES, AND CREATING PATHWAYS TO SELF-EMPLOYMENT FOR LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES IN NORTH CAROLINA. THIS WILL BENEFIT 500 BENEFICIARIES. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED FINANCIAL LITERACY AMONG INDIVIDUALS, AND INCREASED EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS, OR REACH IN ORGANIZATIONS ACROSS THE STATE.

THE GRANTEE SHALL BE ENTITLED TO REIMBURSEMENT FOR COSTS INCURRED ON OR AFTER 4/23/23.  ALTHOUGH THE NOTICE OF GRANT AWARD WAS NOT SIGNED BY THE START DATE THE GRANTEE IS APPROVED FOR COSTS INCURRED ON OR AFTER THE START DATE OF THE GRANT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO INCREASE FOOD SECURITY IN WAKE COUNTY, NORTH CAROLINA. TO DO THIS, WAKE COUNTY VISTA PROJECT WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: CREATE AND CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS, ASSET MAPPING AND ORGANIZE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES FOR SENIORS, CAREGIVERS AND SERVICE PROVIDERS; COLLABORATE WITH A FOOD BANK?S BOARD AND LEADERSHIP/ADVISORY TEAMS TO BUILD THE NECESSARY INFRASTRUCTURE TO INCREASE FUNDING, GRANTS, VOLUNTEER BASE, COMMUNITY RECOGNITION, CONNECTION TO THE COMMUNITY AND TO OTHER PARTNERS AND DONORS; AND CREATE A MARKETING AND OUTREACH PLAN TO INCREASE PARTICIPATION IN A MEAT DONATION PROGRAM, WHEREBY HARVESTED DEER, WITHIN HUNTING SEASON, CAN BE DONATED, PROCESSED AND DISTRIBUTED TO A NETWORK OF COMMUNITY PANTRIES, FOR USE BY THOSE LIVING WITH FOOD INSECURITY. THIS WILL BENEFIT 35,000 LOW-INCOME YOUTH, ADULTS, AND SENIORS. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN INCREASED NUMBER OF YOUTH AND ADULTS REPORTING INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO REDUCE POVERTY IN WINSTON-SALEM AND FORSYTH COUNTIES THROUGH INCREASED ACCESS TO K-12 SERVICES, FOOD SECURITY AND NUTRITION EDUCATION. TO DO THIS, WAKE FOREST UNIVERSITY VISTAS WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: DESIGN CURRICULUM FOR AFTERSCHOOL NUTRITION PROGRAMS AND TUTORING PROGRAMS, AND EXPAND THE VIRTUAL TUTORING PROGRAM THROUGH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME STUDENTS, ADULTS, AND COMMUNITIES. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE STUDENTS REPORTING INCREASED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS AND INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN ENGAGED IN NUTRITION EDUCATION.

THE GRANTEE SHALL BE ENTITLED TO REIMBURSEMENT FOR COSTS INCURRED ON OR AFTER 4/23/23.  ALTHOUGH THE NOTICE OF GRANT AWARD WAS NOT SIGNED BY THE START DATE THE GRANTEE IS APPROVED FOR COSTS INCURRED ON OR AFTER THE START DATE OF THE GRANT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO IMPROVE FOOD SECURITY AND EDUCATIONAL ENGAGEMENT IN HIGH POINT, NORTH CAROLINA. TO DO THIS, HIGH POINT UNIVERSITY WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF THE FOOD CHAIN, INCREASING GARDEN FOOD PRODUCTION, IMPROVED STEAM EDUCATION, CONNECTING STUDENTS AND FAMILIES TO WRAPAROUND SERVICES AND EXPANDING AFTERSCHOOL OPTIONS. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME YOUTH, ADULTS AND COMMUNITIES. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED ORGANIZATION EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS AND PROGRAM REACH, IMPROVED STUDENT ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.

THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE 2023-24 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET. 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY PROGRAMMING PRIORITY. TO DO THIS, HICORIA PINES HOMES, INC.  WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: BUILD HOMES FOR LOW AND VERY LOW INCOME FAMILIES, FUNDRAISING, TRAINING, EDUCATION, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH SUPPORT. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME AND VERY LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN HIGHLANDS COUNTY, FL. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED ORGANIZATIONAL EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS, AND/OR PROGRAM REACH; INCREASED NUMBER OF SAFE, HEALTHY, AFFORDABLE HOUSING UNITS MADE AVAILABLE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO OPEN PATHWAYS FOR CHILDREN IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITES WITH BOOK CHOICE, BOOK OWNERSHIP, AND LITERACY PROGRAMMING. TO DO THIS READ USA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: LEVERAGING RESOURCES, DEVELOPMENT OF VOLUNTEER TRACKING SYSTEM, IDENTIFYING FUNDING SOURCES, AND DEVELOPING RELATIONSHIPS AND PARTNERSHIPS. THIS WILL BENEFIT YOUNG ADOLESCENTS AND TEENS (K-12), COLLEGE STUDENTS, AND PROFESSIONAL EDUCATORS. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED PROGRAM REACH, IMPROVED JOB READINESS, STRENGTHENED PARTNERSHIPS, AND INCREASED VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF ANTI-POVERTY PROGRAMS THROUGH HOUSING SERVICES AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESILIENCY ACROSS THE STATE OF FLORIDA. TO DO THIS VOLUNTEER FLORIDA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: BUILDING VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT AND TRAINING SYSTEMS, ASSESSING AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESILIENCY COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. THIS WILL BENEFIT 1,000 BENEFICIARIES. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY AND EFFECTIVENESS FOR 5 ORGANIZATIONS IN FLORIDA TO MEET THE NEEDS OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN HOUSING AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP.

THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE FY23 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO EXPAND THIS PROJECT'S WORK IN THE AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. TO DO THIS COMMUNITIES OF TRANSFORMATION WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH LEVEL ACTIVITIES: PROVIDE WRAP AROUND SERVICES TO PARTICIPANTS TO BREAK THE GENERATIONAL CYCLE OF POVERTY, CHANGE THE CONVERSATION ABOUT ISSUES OF POVERTY IN THE LARGER COMMUNITY, AND SEEK TO REMOVE THE SYSTEMATIC BARRIERS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY. THIS WILL BENEFIT ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED ADULTS AND FAMILIES. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASING THE SCALE/REACH OF 12 ORGANIZATIONS, IMPROVING THE FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE OF 100 INDIVIDUALS, INCREASING FOOD SECURITY FOR 75 INDIVIDUALS, AND IMPROVING THE JOB READINESS OF 50 INDIVIDUALS.

THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE 2023-24 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT 
DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE ORGANIZATION TO EXPAND CAPACITY AND OUTREACH, CONDUCT COMMUNITY CARE ASSESSMENTS TO UNDERSTAND CURRENT SERVICES, AND TO BUILD PROGRAMS TO THE BENEFIT OF LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS IN CULBERSON, HUDSPETH AND EL PASO COUNTIES. TO DO THIS, EL PASOANS FIGHTING HUNGER FOOD BANK WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH LEVEL ACTIVITIES: HIRE A PROJECT DIRECTOR WHO WILL ASSUME FULL-TIME RESPONSIBILITY OVER THIS PROJECT. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME ADULTS, YOUTHS, VETERANS, INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, AND FORMERLY INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A RECORD OF THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND GAPS IN FOOD SECURITY RESOURCES, PROGRAMMING TO EXPAND/STRENGTHEN PARTNERSHIPS, AND BUILD CAPACITY FOR PROGRAMS THAT INCREASE FOOD SECURITY.

THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE 2023-24 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE RESOURCES TO EXPAND THE CHILD NUTRITION PROGRAM IN LOUISIANA. TO DO THIS FEEDING LA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: SERVE AS AN INTERMEDIARY PROVIDING VISTA RESOURCES TO ELIGIBLE FOOD BANKS, AND ENHANCE THE OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY, AND IMPROVE THE COMMUNITY?S AWARENESS OF NUTRITION PROGRAMS. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME YOUTH AND SMALL TO MIDSIZE NONPROFITS IN LA. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PROVIDING VISTA RESOURCES TO 5 ORGANIZATIONS AND INCREASE FOOD SECURITY FOR 50,000 CHILDREN.

THIS AWARD APPRVES FUNDING FOR THE FY23 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCIRBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO INCREASE SUPPORT SYSTEM FOR YOUTH EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS.  TO DO THIS UNACCOMPANIED STUDENTS INITIATIVE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: RECRUITING ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS AND BUILD PARTNERSHIPS, CONDUCT PROGRAM EVALUATIONS, ANALYZE DATA,  PROVIDE FEEDBACK ON PROGRAM ACTIVITIES, LEVERAGE RESOURCES AND STRENGTHEN INTERNAL GRANT MANAGEMENT, POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND STREAMLINE INITIATIVES FOR STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS.  THIS WILL BENEFIT 50 BENEFICIARIES.  GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED SCALE/REACH, EFFECTIVENESS, LEVERAGING OF RESOURCES AND EFFICIENCY FOR THE PROGRAM.

THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE FY 2023 VISTA SUPPORT GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO AWARD THE VISTA PROGRAM TO INCREASE ECONOMIC STABILITY, EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES, AND MEANINGFUL AND SUBSTANTIAL CONNECTIONS TO IDAHO'S COMMUNITIES. TO DO THIS IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION WILL HAVE 12 VISTA MEMBERS CONTIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS GATHERING COMMUNITY RESOURCES NEEDED WHEN AN INDIVIDUAL IS LEAVING A CORRECTIONAL FACILITY, MENTORSHIP, GATHER AND REPORT RELEVANT DATA, RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS, AND HAS THE GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOME TO INCREASE THE SUSTAINABILITY OF REENTRY EFFORTS FROM INCARCERATION TO REDUCE RECIDIVISM RATE IN IDAHO OVER THE COURSE OF FIVE YEARS. THIS WILL BENEFIT ABOUT 35% OF THE INDIVIDUALS RETURNING TO SOCIETY FROM INCARCERATION OR ABOUT 1,575 RETURNING CITIZENS.

THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE FY2023 VISTA SUPPORT GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.  

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENTS TO CROSS POLITICAL BOUNDARIES, IDENTIFY SHARED OPPORTUNITIES AND CHALLENGES AND DEVELOP COLLABORATIVE STRATEGIES FOR ACTION.  TO DO THIS PIKES PEAK AREA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES:  DEVELOP A VOLUNTEER PROGRAM TO ASSIST SENIORS, INCREASING TRANSPORTATION SAFETY EDUCATION AND CREATE A REGIONAL CONVENING.  THIS WILL BENEFIT 100 BENEFICIARIES.  GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE GROWTH IN TACKLING TOPICS IN AFFORDABLE HOUSING, SAFE STREETS, TRANSIT AND AIR QUALITY.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO STRENGTHEN MINDS AND EMPOWER COMMUNITIES. TO DO THIS MIAMI UNIVERSITY WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: BUILDING CAPACITY IN OFFICES THAT SUPPORT AND PROVIDE SERVICES FOR LOW-INCOME STUDENTS . THIS WILL BENEFIT THE STUDENTS OF MIAMI UNIVERSITY IN BUTLER COUNTY, OHIO. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASING THE GRADUATION RATE OF LOW-INCOME MIAMI STUDENTS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 500 INDIVIDUALS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF RESIDENTS OF KENT BY CONNECTION THEM TO PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES. TO DO THIS KENT CITY HEALTH DEPARRMENT WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: IMPROVING AND EXPANDING COMMUNITY OUTREACH, PLANNING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVES, GRANT WRITING, AND SUPPORTING DATA ANALYSIS . THIS WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS OF KENT, OHIO. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASING THE EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS, AND PROGRAM REACH OF THE KENT CITY HEALTH DEPARTMENT.

THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE FY 2023 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO BUILD CAPACITY IN THE DETROIT METROPOLITAN AREA BY FOCUSING ON HEALTHY FUTURES. TO DO THIS VISTA MEMBERS WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: RECRUIT COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS, COORDINATE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR FOOD ACCESS, TRANSPORTATION, AND MEDICATION ACQUISITION OVER THE COURSE OF FIVE YEARS. THIS WILL BENEFIT 4,000 BENEFICIARIES IN THE DETROIT METROPOLITAN AREA. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED NUTRITION AND HEALTHCARE ACCESS TO THE COMMUNITY.
THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE 2023-24 VISTA SUPPORT GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE RESOURCES TO ASSIST THE ORGANIZATION AS IT CONTINUES TO EXPAND THE SCALE AND REACH OF ITS SERVICES STATE-WIDE. TO DO THIS THE CENTER FOR FAMILY SERVICES WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE ORGANIZATION THROUGH OUTREACH, EMPLOYEE TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT, AND VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT. THIS WILL BENEFIT THE LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS OF 12 COUNTIES ACROSS THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE 100 YOUTH WITH GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, 100 YOUTH WITH IMPROVED ATTENDANCE, 100 INDIVIDUALS REPORTING INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, AND 50 INDIVIDUALS REPORTING A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH.
THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE 2023-24 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO HELP LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN WATCOM, ISLAND, AND SAN JUAN COUNTIES, IMPROVE THEIR LIVES THROUGH EDUCATION, SUPPORT, AND DIRECT ASSISTANCE WHILE ADVOCATING FOR JUST AND EQUITABLE COMMUNITIES. TO DO THIS, THE OPPORTUNITY COUNCIL WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: CAPACITY BUILDING OF PROJECT SITES WHILE HELPING PEOPLE IN POVERTY GAIN ACCESS TO AFFORDABLE HOUSING, ACHIEVE FOOD SECURITY, RECEIVE SERVICES FOR OPIOID SUBSTANCE ABUSE RECOVERY, AND ADDRESS EDUCATIONAL AND HOUSING NEEDS FOR AT-RISK AND MARGINALIZED YOUTH. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES, INCLUDING THOSE AFFLICTED WITH OPIOID ADDICTION OR DISABILITIES AS WELL AS VETERANS AND THOSE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS IN WATCOM, ISLAND AND SAN JUAN COUNTIES. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE REACHING APPROXIMATELY 9540 OF INDIVIDUALS INCLUDING 100 VETERANS, RAISING $620,000 OF CASH AND IN-KIND RESOURCES, AND INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF 22 COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS.
THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE 2022-2023 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO INCREASE PUBLIC HEALTH ORGANIZATIONS' CAPACITY TO DEVELOP SUSTAINABLE PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS SOCIAL, HEALTH, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, AND ECONOMIC ISSUES IN MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE OF HAWAII, WHO HAVE BEEN ADVERSELY IMPACTED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, AND BUILDING CAPACITY FOR ORGANIZATIONS WORKING FOR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. TO DO THIS, HAWAII PUBLIC HEALTH INSTITUTE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: CAPACITY BUILDING OF PROJECT SITES WHILE HELPING PEOPLE IN POVERTY RECEIVE JOB TRAINING, ACCESS TO CARE THROUGH OUTREACH AND COACHING, AND DEVELOPING A HEALTHY AND EQUITABLE COMMUNITY. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME, NATIVE HAWAIIAN AND PACIFIC ISLANDERS AND THEIR FAMILIES, INCLUDING THOSE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS, AND UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF HAWAII. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE REACHING APPROXIMATELY 500 INDIVIDUALS AND INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF 30 COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS.
THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE 2022?23 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO EXPAND THE PROJECTS WORK IN THE AREA OF EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION AND SCHOOL READINESS. TO DO THIS, SOUTH CAROLINA FIRST STEPS WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: EXPAND CAPACITY BUILDING SERVICES FOR SOUTH CAROLINA FIRST STEPS PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW INCOME, RURAL, AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES SERVING PARTNERSHIP ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT SOUTH CAROLINA'S 46 COUNTIES. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE HAVING 1000 CHILDREN DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS. 

THIS AMENDMENT REVISES THE BUDGET TO INCLUDE $50,000 IN ARP FUNDING. ALL OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THIS AWARD REMAIN UNCHANGED.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF SUSTAINING WAY, A BIPOC LED ORGANIZATION, TO ACHIEVE ANTI-POVERTY GOALS IN THE NICHOLTOWN NEIGHBORHOOD OF GREENVILLE, SOUTH CAROLINA. TO DO THIS SUSTAINING WAY WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: INCREASE PROGRAM FUNDING AND PROGRAM PARTICIPATION. THIS WILL BENEFIT THE HIGH POVERTY COMMUNITY OF NICHOLTOWN. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASE FOOD ACCESS, LOWER HOME ENERGY COSTS, AND INCREASE ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMENDMENT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO EXPAND THIS PROJECT?S WORK IN THE AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. TO DO THIS THE URBAN LEAGUE OF GREATER ATLANTA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH-LEVEL ACTIVITIES: DESIGNING POLICIES, PROCEDURES, AND PROTOCOL AS WELL AS DESIGNING PROGRAMMING, GOALS, OBJECTIVES, OUTCOMES, AND IMPACT MEASURES, AND ASSISTING WITH DEVELOPING PERTINENT AND CROSS-SECTIONAL PARTNERSHIPS ACROSS ALL AGENCY PROGRAMS.  THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS IN METRO ATLANTA.  GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PROVIDING INFORMATION AND RESOURCES REGARDING AFFORDABLE HOUSING, POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION, JOB SKILLS TRAINING, FINANCIAL LITERACY, AND SOCIAL JUSTICE TO APPROXIMATELY 6,000 INDIVIDUALS IN YEAR ONE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO EXPAND THE PROJECT'S WORK IN ADVANCING RACIAL EQUITY. TO DO THIS COLLEGE OF COASTAL GEORGIA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH LEVEL ACTIVITIES:  RECRUIT STUDENTS INTO THE AFRICAN-AMERICAN MALIE INITIATIVE PROGRAM, CMMUNICATE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES, TRAIN CAMPUS MENTORS, DEVELOP LEADERSHIP CURRICULUM, AND EXPAND FUNDING SOURCES. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME FIRST YEAR MALE COLLEGE STUDENTS. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED STUDENT SUCCESS METRICS FOR AFRICAN AMERICAN MALES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO GPA, ONE-YEAR RETENTION RATES, AND OVERALL GRADUATION RATES FOR AT LEAST 25 INDIVIDUALS IN YEAR ONE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ENHANCE -- THROUGH RESPONSIBLE COMMUNITY COLLABORATION -- THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN MOREHOUSE COLLEGE AND ADJACENT COMMUNITIES, LOCAL GOVERNMENT, AND CIVIC ORGANIZATIONS. TO DO THIS MOREHOUSE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH LEVEL ACTIVITIES: CULTIVATE ENTREPRENEURIAL SKILL AMONG STUDENTS WITH AN EMPHASIS IN THE STEM AREAS. 2. ENHANCE STUDENTS' INTEREST IN ATTENDING COLLEGE. 3. INCREASE OCCUPATIONAL INTEREST AMONG ALL STUDENTS, PARTICULARLY IN THE STEM AREAS. 4. ESTABLISH AN ENTREPRENEURSHIP PIPELINE THAT WILL CONNECT YOUTH WITH MOREHOUSE COLLEGE'S ENTREPRENEURSHIP CENTER. THIS WILL BENEFIT ADJACENT COMMUNITIES, LOCAL GOVERNMENT, AND CIVIC ORGANIZATIONS. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS FOR 50 ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS.

THIS APPROVES THE 2023-24 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET. 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE SUPERVISORY SERVICES TO THE VISTA PROJECT. TO DO THIS, FRANK CALLEN BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH LEVEL ACTIVITES INCLUDING YOUTH OUTREACH, EXPANDING COMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, AND INCREASING FUNDING. THESE PROJECTS SHARE THE COMMON GOAL OF INCREASING THE AMOUNT AND VARIETY OF HEALTHY PRODUCE AVAILABLE TO LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS ACROSS THE COUNTRY, IN ORDER TO IMPROVE FOOD SECURITY AND HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR PEOPLE EXPERIENCING POVERTY. TO DO THIS CLAFLIN UNIVERSITY WILL HAVE FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WHO  PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH LEVEL ACTIVITIES: BUILD ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY OF VARIOUS CAMPUS DEPARTMENTS, INCREASE OUTREACH EFFORTS AND VOLUNTEER SERVICES WITH CURRENT ANTI-POVERTY PROGRAMS, AND ENHANCE STRATEGIES TO ATTRACT YOUNG ADULTS TO POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION THAT WILL IMPROVE OVERALL LIFESTYLE FOR THEM AND THEIR FAMILIES AND STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY. THIS WILL BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 1,000 LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INNOVATIVE PROGRAM STRATEGIES AND ACTIVITIES THAT WILL HAVE AN IMPACT ON REDUCING POVERTY IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND BUILDING SUSTAINABILITY.

NORTH CAROLINA CAMPUS COMPACT IS A COLLABORATIVE NETWORK OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES COMMITTED TO EDUCATING STUDENTS FOR CIVIC AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY, PARTNERING WITH COMMUNITIES FOR POSITIVE CHANGE, AND STRENGTHENING DEMOCRACY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. 
TO ADDRESS THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA, THE PROJECT WILL CREATE THE NC AFTERSCHOOL CORPS. THIS CORPS WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL AND SOCIAL OUTCOMES FOR UNDER-SERVED K-12 CHILDREN BY BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS THAT SERVE LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES IN PARTNERSHIP WITH A LOCAL COLLEGE OR UNIVERSITY. WE CURRENTLY HAVE FIVE POTENTIAL AFTERSCHOOL CORPS HOST SITES.  DURING THE JULY/AUG 2021 RECRUITMENT SEASON WE PLACED THREE VISTAS SERVING AT THREE DIFFERENT HOST SITE LOCATIONS ACROSS THE STATE.  
THESE MEMBERS WILL WORK TO RECRUIT AND TRAIN AFTERSCHOOL VOLUNTEERS, INCREASE FUNDING AND RESOURCES, AND EXPAND LOCAL AWARENESS OF THE VALUE OF AFTERSCHOOL, ESPECIALLY BY SUPPORTING "LIGHTS ON AFTERSCHOOL" AND SIMILAR COMMUNITY EVENTS.  THE NC AFTERSCHOOL CORPS WILL ALSO HELP AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAMS AND THEIR COLLEGE PARTNERS IMPLEMENT STEM-RELATED, LITERACY, COLLEGE-ACCESS, ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS, AND COVID-19 LEARNING LOSS CURRICULA.
TO ADDRESS THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA, THE PROJECT WILL CREATE THE NC HUNGER CORPS. THIS CORPS WILL SUPPORT PROGRAMS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY AND HEALTHY EATING AMONG LOW-INCOME CHILDREN, STUDENTS, FACULTY, STAFF, AND FAMILIES, WHILE DEVELOPING OPPORTUNITIES FOR HIGHER EDUCATION CIVIC AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. WE CURRENTLY HAVE 10 POTENTIAL HUNGER CORPS HOST SITES. DURING THE JULY/AUG 2021 RECRUITMENT SEASON WE PLACED SIX VISTAS SERVING AT SIX DIFFERENT HOST SITE LOCATIONS ACROSS THE STATE.  
IN ADDITION TO SERVING LOW-INCOME CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, THE ON-CAMPUS OR OFF-CAMPUS FOOD SECURITY AND NUTRITION PROGRAMS THESE VISTAS SUPPORT MAY INCLUDE PROGRAMS THAT SERVE LOW-INCOME OR DISADVANTAGED COLLEGE STUDENTS AND STAFF AS WELL AS MEMBERS FROM THE LOCAL COMMUNITY EXPERIENCING FOOD INSECURITY. MEMBERS WILL MOBILIZE VOLUNTEERS, DEVELOP FINANCIAL RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT OR EXPANSION. EXAMPLES OF HUNGER RELATED PROJECTS INCLUDE CAMPUS OR COMMUNITY GARDENS, FOOD RECOVERY EFFORTS MODELED ON THE CAMPUS KITCHEN PROJECT OR THE FOOD RECOVERY NETWORK, CAMPUS OR COMMUNITY-BASED FOOD PANTRIES, FRESH PRODUCE DISTRIBUTION (MOBILE MARKETS), AND NUTRITION EDUCATION CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT. NC HUNGER CORPS MEMBERS MAY ALSO WORK TO RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT NUTRITION AND HEALTHY EATING.
FINALLY, THE PROJECT WILL HOST ONE VISTA LEADER TO SUPPORT THE NC AFTERSCHOOL CORPS AND THE NC HUNGER CORPS.  THE VISTA LEADER WILL WORK WITH THE VISTAS AND THE HOST SITES TO PROVIDE SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGEMENT WHILE ENSURING PROGRESS IS BEING MADE TOWARD THEIR GOALS.  ADDITIONALLY, THE VISTA LEADER WILL SUPPORT THE PROGRAM DIRECTOR WITH THE DAY TO DAY MANAGEMENT OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDING DEVELOPING A PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, SOCIAL MEDIA AND ALUMNI OUTREACH STRATEGY FOR THE PROGRAM.

UNITED WAY OF THE CENTRAL SAVANNAH RIVER AREA, INC. (UWCSRA)'S MISSION IS TO UNITE PEOPLE AND MOBILIZE COMMUNITY RESOURCES TO CREATE LASTING CHANGES THAT TRANSFORM LIVES. PROJECT UNITE PROVIDES VOLUNTEER-BASED BEST PRACTICE INTERVENTION PROGRAMS FOR EARLY LEARNING WHERE SCHOOLS ARE IDENTIFIED AS LOW-PERFORMING BY THE GOVERNOR'S OFFICE OF STUDENT ACHIEVEMENT AND WHERE THE RICHMOND AND COLUMBIA COUNTY BOARDS OF EDUCATION HAVE IDENTIFIED COMMUNITIES WHERE CHILDREN ARE ENTERING KINDERGARTEN UNPREPARED, POVERTY RATES ARE THE AREA'S HIGHEST, AND THE CONCENTRATION OF YOUNG SINGLE PARENT-HEADED HOUSEHOLDS IS GREATEST. OUR WORK PLAN INCLUDES BORN LEARNING WHICH WOULD PREPARE CHILDREN FOR SUCCESS IN SCHOOL BY IMPROVING THE LITERACY COMPETENCIES OF YOUNG CHILDREN BOTH BEFORE ENTERING SCHOOL AND DURING ELEMENTARY YEARS AND BY ENGAGING PARENTS IN THE LEARNING PROCESS. THE WORK PLAN ALSO SUPPORTS THE WRAPAROUND SUPPORT PROGRAM (WSP), A DISTRICT-WIDE INITIATIVE WITHIN RICHMOND AND COLUMBIA COUNTY SCHOOL DISTRICTS FOCUSED ON ALLOWING STUDENT VOICE TO GUIDE THE DEVELOPMENT AND ATTAINMENT OF NEEDED RESOURCES AND SERVICES.   

IN NEIGHBORING RICHMOND COUNTY AND COLUMBIA COUNTY, PROJECT UNITE EXPECTS TO SERVE THE PARENTS AND/OR GUARDIANS AND SIBLINGS OF OVER 11,000 STUDENTS ENROLLED IN STRUGGLING SCHOOLS. THE STUDENTS AND SIBLINGS OF STUDENTS, AGES 0-6, ENROLLED IN THESE SCHOOLS ARE LIVING IN POVERTY AND FACE BARRIERS TO SCHOOL SUCCESS SUCH AS FOOD INSECURITIES, UNSTABLE HOUSING, AND PARENTS WITHOUT A HIGH SCHOOL EDUCATION.  SEVENTEEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS TO MENTOR AND READ TO YOUNG CHILDREN, RECRUIT FACILITATORS TO PROVIDE PARENTING WORKSHOPS, AND WORKING WITH LOCAL COMPANIES TO DEVELOP SPONSORSHIPS FOR THE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE ACTIVITIES AND PROGRAMMING IMPLEMENTED. AS SCHOOLS BEGIN TO ENGAGE BOTH THE PARENTS AND COMMUNITIES IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE STUDENTS AND THE SCHOOL IS NO LONGER DESIGNATED AS A LOW-PERFORMING SCHOOL, VISTA MEMBERS WILL REPLICATE THEIR SUCCESSES AT A NEW SCHOOL IDENTIFIED AS LOW- PERFORMING WITHIN THE RICHMOND COUNTY AND COLUMBIA COUNTY SCHOOL SYSTEMS.   

 IN COLUMBIA COUNTY, EIGHT VISTA MEMBERS, AND IN RICHMOND COUNTY, EIGHT VISTA MEMBERS, AND 1 VISTA MEMBER IN WILKES COUNTY WILL FACILITATE PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN STUDENTS, SCHOOLS, FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS TO ENHANCE STUDENTS' SOCIO-EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING WHILE ASSISTING IN THEIR TRANSITION TO POST-SECONDARY LIFE. THE GOAL OF THE WSP IS TO ESTABLISH STUDENT LIFE "CENTERS" WITHIN EACH OF THE HIGH SCHOOLS, MIDDLE SCHOOLS, AND AGENCIES WHERE NEEDED SERVICES CAN BE OFFERED BEFORE, DURING, AND AFTER SCHOOL HOURS. ONCE ESTABLISHED IN THE HIGH SCHOOLS AND MIDDLE SCHOOLS, THESE SERVICES WILL EVENTUALLY BE EXTENDED DOWN TO THE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL SETTINGS.

YOUTHBUILD USA REQUESTS FUNDING TO CONTINUE A NATIONAL AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM THAT PLACES 50 AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS AT APPROXIMATELY 35 YOUTHBUILD PROGRAMS TO HELP OPPORTUNITY YOUTH GAIN ENHANCED CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS, PREPARE FOR PLACEMENT AND SUCCESS IN MEANINGFUL EMPLOYMENT OR POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION, AND DEVELOP A LOVE FOR LIFELONG LEARNING. WITHIN THE OPPORTUNITY YOUTH POPULATION, THE YOUTHBUILD MOVEMENT PRIMARILY SERVES YOUNG PEOPLE WHO LACK A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA AND FINANCIAL RESOURCES; THESE YOUNG PEOPLE ARE IN GREATEST NEED OF OUR SUPPORT, AND THEY ARE OUR GREATEST SOURCE OF UNTAPPED POTENTIAL. YOUTHBUILD VISTA MEMBERS RESPOND TO AMERICORPS VISTA'S PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY (EMPLOYMENT/WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT) AND EDUCATION (K-12 SUCCESS AND COLLEGE ACCESS & SUCCESS). SPECIFICALLY, THE GOALS OF THE YOUTHBUILD VISTA PROGRAM ARE TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF YOUTHBUILD STUDENTS WHO: 

* ACQUIRE A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA OR HIGH SCHOOL EQUIVALENCY 
* ADVANCE ACADEMICALLY IN LITERACY OR NUMERACY 
* ENTER POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION 
* GAIN EMPLOYMENT 

YOUTHBUILD VISTA MEMBERS CONTRIBUTE TO THESE GOALS BY SECURING FINANCIAL RESOURCES, RECRUITING COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS, DEVELOPING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, TRAINING YOUTHBUILD STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS, AND IMPLEMENTING NEW SYSTEMS. THESE CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECTS CLOSELY ALIGN WITH YOUTHBUILD USA'S MISSION: WITH LOVE AND RESPECT, WE PARTNER WITH OPPORTUNITY YOUTH TO BUILD THE SKILLSETS AND MINDSETS THAT LEAD TO LIFELONG LEARNING, LIVELIHOOD, AND LEADERSHIP. 

YOUTHBUILD VISTA ASSIGNMENTS ARE STRUCTURED SO THAT EACH VISTA MEMBER CAN REASONABLY COMPLETE THEIR ASSIGNMENTS IN ONE YEAR, WHILE CONTRIBUTING TO A LARGER CAPACITY BUILDING GOAL THAT CAN BE COMPLETED WITHIN A THREE-YEAR CYCLE. YOUTHBUILD USA IS ALSO REQUESTING ONE VISTA LEADER TO ENHANCE RECRUITMENT OF YOUTHBUILD VISTAS, CREATE RESOURCES TO HELP GUIDE VISTA MEMBERS TOWARD SUCCESS IN COMPLETING THEIR ASSIGNMENTS, AND COLLECT INFORMATION AND DATA TO HELP IMPROVE YOUTHBUILD USA'S VISTA PROGRAM.

MISSION: ST. LOUIS (M:STL) IS A COMMUNITY-BASED 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION THAT EXISTS FOR MEN, WOMEN AND CHILDREN TO HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY FOR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC MOBILITY. WE DO SO THROUGH OUR CORE PROGRAMMING -- BEYOND SCHOOL, BEYOND JOBS, AND BEYOND CHARITY. THESE PROGRAMS WORK IN TANDEM TO ADDRESS THE POVERTY PIPELINE BY FOCUSING ON EDUCATION, EMPOWERMENT AND OPPORTUNITY. TO MEET THE EMERGING NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY, AMERICORPS VISTA HAS PLAYED AN INTEGRAL ROLE IN GROWING ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO FIGHT POVERTY. THIS HAS ALSO BEEN THE CASE FOR OTHER ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT MISSOURI UNDER M:STL'S INTERMEDIARY MANAGEMENT OVER THE LAST 10+ YEARS. SINCE THAT TIME, WE HAVE CONNECTED A TOTAL OF 100+ OTHER ORGANIZATIONS TO VISTA! WE ARE REQUESTING TO CONTINUE THIS LEGACY AND REMAIN A VISTA INTERMEDIARY THAT CONNECTS, TRAINS AND MANAGES OTHER AGENCIES TO VISTA. WE ANTICIPATE WORKING WITH OVER 34 ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT MISSOURI AND EAST ST. LOUIS, IL. EACH ORGANIZATION IS FIGHTING POVERTY AND WITH THE HELP OF VISTA, ORGANIZATIONAL IMPACT WILL BE GREATER. THE GOAL OF THE "VISTA UMBRELLA" PROJECT IS TO TRANSFORM THE COMMUNITIES WHERE VISTA MEMBERS SERVE BY PROVIDING A STRONG SERVICE CORPS, BUILDING SUSTAINABLE NONPROFITS, AND ALLEVIATING POVERTY. IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE OUR GOAL, WE ARE REQUESTING 60 MSY (54 STANDARD, 6 COST SHARE) TO SERVE IN ORGANIZATIONS KNOWN AS "SUBSITES" OVER THE COURSE OF 12 MONTHS. 

SUBSITE PROJECTS WILL ALIGN WITH AMERICORPS PRIORITY MEASURES: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND VETERANS & MILITARY FAMILIES. OUR VISTA UMBRELLA CONTINUOUSLY IDENTIFIES POTENTIAL SUBSITE ORGANIZATIONS AND PROVIDES HANDS-ON ASSISTANCE IN THE APPLICATION PROCESS. SUBSITE PROJECTS SUBMIT APPLICATIONS TO THE DIRECTOR OF AMERICORPS SERVICES. THE AMERICORPS SERVICES TEAM CONSISTS OF TWO FULL-TIME EMPLOYEES: DIRECTOR OF AMERICORPS SERVICES AND THE AMERICORPS SERVICES MANAGER. THE DIRECTOR OF AMERICORPS SERVICES WORKS WITH POTENTIAL SITES THROUGHOUT THE APPLICATION PROCESS PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND APPLICATION FEEDBACK. EACH SITE CREATES VADS FOR THEIR MEMBER(S) THAT OUTLINES THE MEMBER'S GOALS AND ACTIVITIES FOR THE YEAR. ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: RECRUITING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS, DEVELOPING FUNDRAISING PLANS OR RESOURCE GUIDES, CREATING MARKETING MATERIALS, ESTABLISHING DATA MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS, INCREASING VISIBILITY IN THE COMMUNITY, DEVELOPING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, AND DESIGNING SUSTAINABLE PROGRAMS. ONCE AN APPLICATION HAS BEEN APPROVED, THE DIRECTOR OF AMERICORPS SERVICES TRAINS SUPERVISORS, MANAGES AND OVERSEES SITE PROJECTS. THE AMERICORPS SERVICES MANAGER PROVIDES MEMBER SUPPORT AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO ENSURE MEMBER RETENTION. THE VICE PRESIDENT OF COMMUNITY IMPACT, WHO HAS BEEN WITH THE PROJECT SINCE ITS INCEPTION, WILL OVERSEE THE PROJECT. WITH THE COMBINED EFFORTS OF THESE TEAM MEMBERS, WE ARE ABLE TO OFFER A ROBUST, HANDS-ON VISTA UMBRELLA PROGRAM THAT EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY PUTS "BOOTS ON THE GROUND" TO FIGHT POVERTY.

THE CITY OF SAINT PAUL VISTA PROGRAM'S HAS A DUAL MISSION IS TO BUILD CAPACITY OF ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE AFFORDABLE AND ACCESSIBLE HIGH-QUALITY EARLY CHILDHOOD PROGRAMS AND TO BUILD CAPACITY OF ORGANIZATIONS RESPONDING TO THE ECONOMIC FALLOUT OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECTS ALIGNS WITH CNCS' EDUCATION FOCUS AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO SUPPORT SERVICE MEMBERS AND CREATE COMMUNITY-INFORMED SOLUTIONS WHICH WILL: * INCREASE ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY BIRTH TO THREE PROGRAMMING; * CREATE AND IMPROVE PROGRAMS OFFERING SUPPORT TO FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS FACING FINANCIAL HARDSHIP IN LIGHT OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. * CREATE SPACE FOR CITY AGENCIES, PROGRAMS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO COLLABORATE AND SHARE RESOURCES TO MEET THE AFOREMENTIONED GOALS; * RECRUIT VISTA MEMBERS FROM THE COMMUNITIES IN WHICH THEY SERVE; * CREATE A COHORT THAT IS REPRESENTATIVE OF THE MANY TYPES OF DIVERSITY OF OUR CITY- RACE, RELIGION, SOCIO-ECONOMIC STATUS, COUNTRY OF ORIGIN AND EDUCATION LEVEL. THE EARLY CHILDHOOD PORTION OF THE PROGRAM EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 3,500 CHILDREN FROM BIRTH TO THREE AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE COVID-19 ECONOMIC RESPONSE PROGRAM HAS THE POTENTIAL TO IMPACT ANY OF THE 312,000 SAINT PAUL RESIDENTS EXPERIENCING ECONOMIC IMPACTS FROM THE GLOBAL PANDEMIC. 14 VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL IMPLEMENT THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING AND IMPLEMENTING COMMUNITY OUTREACH PLANS, CREATING VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, DEVELOPING FUNDS TO EXPAND THE REACH OF PROGRAMS, AND EVALUATING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF PROGRAMS. 7 VISTAS WILL BE IN PLACEMENTS PRIMARILY FOCUSED ON COVID-19 RESPONSE AND 7 VISTAS WILL BE IN PLACEMENTS PRIMARILY FOCUSED ON EARLY CHILDHOOD.

THE WICHITA STATE UNIVERSITY COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT INSTITUTE (WSU) HAS A MISSION TO PARTNER WITH COMMUNITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS TO STRENGTHEN KANSAS THROUGH EDUCATION, LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, FACILITATION, AND RESEARCH. THE VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOCUS AREAS OF: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO PLACE VISTA MEMBERS WITH ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE MISSIONS AND ACTIVITIES DIRECTLY IMPACT PEOPLE IN POVERTY EXPERIENCING THESE NEEDS.
WSU IS REQUESTING A SUPPORT GRANT BECAUSE OF THE SUCCESS AND ONGOING REQUEST FROM ORGANIZATIONS FOR ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT FOR THE PAST YEAR AND PRIOR SUCCESS FOR SIX YEARS WITH A PROGRAM GRANT. WSU IS REQUESTING A SUPPORT GRANT WITH THE GOAL OF PLACING 22 FULL-TIME VISTA MEMBERS (WHICH INCLUDES 5 COST SHARE MEMBERS AND 2 VISTA LEADERS) AND 5 SUMMER ASSOCIATE VISTA MEMBERS. VISTA MEMBERS WILL SERVE IN ORGANIZATIONS IN ORDER TO STRENGTHEN AND BUILD THE ORGANIZATIONS' CAPACITIES TO DELIVER PROGRAMS ADDRESSING CONTRIBUTING FACTORS OF POVERTY. VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES THAT WILL DEVELOP, EXPAND OR HELP SUSTAIN VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING, FUND DEVELOPMENT (SUSTAINABILITY EFFORTS), COMMUNITY AND PARTNERSHIP ENGAGEMENT FOR PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, SERVICES OR SYSTEMS CHANGE, MARKETING, PROMOTION, OUTREACH AND DATA MANAGEMENT. A SUPPORT GRANT WILL ADDRESS ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY WITHIN ORGANIZATIONS IN THE WICHITA METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA AS WELL AS SITES ACROSS KANSAS.

VOLUNTEER IOWA'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO CREATE AN ENVIRONMENT WHERE LOW-INCOME YOUTH AND ADULTS CAN ACCESS RESOURCES TO OVERCOME BARRIERS TO POVERTY. THIS WILL BE DONE THROUGH EDUCATION, TRANSPORTATION, ACCESSIBILITY, EMPLOYMENT, FINANCIAL LITERACY, AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING SERVICES. AND, IN GENERAL, GAIN SKILLS AND RESOURCES TO BETTER EQUIP THEMSELVES TO RISE OUT OF POVERTY AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT LOW-INCOME FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF IOWA IN AREAS OF GREATEST NEED BOTH RURAL AND URBAN. THIRTY VISTA MEMBERS, AND TWO VISTA LEADERS, WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ESTABLISHING OR EXPANDING THE USE OF VOLUNTEERS, COMPLETING COMMUNITY ASSESSMENTS, CREATING ACTION PLANS FOR PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY IMPROVEMENT OR EXPANSION, CONDUCTING OUTREACH FOR PARTICIPANT RECRUITMENT, DEVELOPING, OR IMPROVING PRESENTATIONS AND COMMUNICATION TOOLS FOR CONDUCTING OUTREACH TO POTENTIAL PARTICIPANTS, AND DEVELOPING OR ENHANCING PROGRAM MATERIALS OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT PERIOD.

ACTION RESOURCES INTERNATIONAL WILL SUPPORT TWENTY-FIVE (25) VISTA MEMBER SERVICE YEARS, THROUGH WHICH MEMBERS WILL BUILD CAPACITY AND COMBAT POVERTY THROUGH COMMUNITY STRENGTHENING PROJECTS THAT PROMOTE AND ENHANCE COMMUNITY HEALTH AND WELLNESS IN WYOMING AND COLORADO THROUGH PROGRAMS THAT AIM TO INCREASE SUSTAINABLE AND EQUITABLE FOOD ACCESS AND SECURITY; ENHANCE SHELTER, SAFETY, PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE, EDUCATION AND OTHER HEALTH-RELATED EFFORTS, WITH PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON ESTABLISHING REGIONWIDE COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS BETWEEN AND AMONG GRASSROOTS COMMUNITY-BASED AND LED PROJECTS. AT THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR HELPING MORE PEOPLE: * LIVE WITH SUSTAINABLE FOOD SECURITY (INCLUDING INCREASED OPTIONS FOR ACCESSING FRESH FOODS; INCREASED FRUITS AND VEGETABLES CONSUMPTION; INCREASED LOCAL PRODUCE PRODUCTION; INCREASED INTEREST IN GARDENING, FOOD PRODUCTION AND HEALTHY EATING; INCREASED OPTIONS AND CAPACITY FOR FOOD DISTRIBUTION; INCREASED FOOD SYSTEM INITIATIVES AND LEADERSHIP BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS; INCREASED SUSTAINABLE FUNDING STREAMS FOR COMMUNITY FOOD SECURITY PROJECTS; INCREASED DIGNITY THROUGH WHICH FOOD IS ACCESSED); * BUILD, LIVE IN AND SUSTAIN SAFE, SUPPORTIVE, HEALTHY COMMUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. IN ADDITION, THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL LEVERAGE 1000 VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL BE ENGAGED IN COMMUNITY-BASED, SUSTAINABLE, COMMUNITY HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROJECTS. AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL BUILD RELATIONSHIPS WITH PEOPLE LIVING WITH POVERTY, PEOPLE LIVING WITH FOOD INSECURITY, PEOPLE STRUGGLING WITH OVERALL HEALTH AND WELLNESS ISSUES, LOCAL FOOD SYSTEM, HEALTH, SHELTER AND EDUCATION, HISTORICAL AND CULTURAL ORGANIZATIONS. VISTA MEMBERS WILL FACILITATE COMMUNITY ORGANIZING FOR COLLABORATIVE NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND SOLUTION BUILDING THAT INCLUDES IDENTIFICATION OF AND ASSISTANCE IN DEVELOPING SUSTAINABLE FUNDING STREAMS; WITH THE HELP OF VISTA SUMMER ASSOCIATES, THEY WILL DEVELOP, ORGANIZE AND IMPLEMENT AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF SUMMER FOOD PROGRAM SITES, WITH A SPECIAL EMPHASIS ON PROGRAMS THAT OFFER HEALTHY FOODS, FUN LEARNING AND ACTIVITY COMPONENTS, ALONG WITH SUPPORT FOR HEALTH, WELLNESS AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AND EVENTS; AND VISTA MEMBERS TOGETHER WILL CONNECT COMMUNITY-BASED EFFORTS TO BUILD REGION-WIDE NETWORKS OF SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS. SPECIAL EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON CREATIVE SOLUTIONS TO CHALLENGES FACING RURAL COMMUNITIES AND UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS WHO ARE HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED.

LEGAL AID CHICAGO'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE HIGH-QUALITY CIVIL LEGAL SERVICES TO PEOPLE LIVING IN POVERTY AND OTHER VULNERABLE GROUPS. THROUGH LITIGATION AND ADVOCACY, IT SECURES INDIVIDUAL RIGHTS TO AFFORDABLE HOUSING, BASIC HEALTHCARE, ECONOMIC STABILITY, FAIR WORKING CONDITIONS, AND PROTECTION FROM ABUSE. AT LEGAL AID CHICAGO, AND EACH OF ITS SUBGRANTEE PARTNERS IN THE CITY OF CHICAGO, ACROSS COOK COUNTY, AND THROUGHOUT ILLINOIS, 45 VISTA MEMBERS, INCLUDING TWO VISTA LEADERS, COORDINATE EFFORTS TO PROVIDE RESPONSIVE AND SUSTAINABLE PROGRAMS THAT EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES TO OBTAIN LEGAL REMEDIES IN ORDER TO BREAK THE CYCLE OF POVERTY. 
ONE OF LEGAL AID CHICAGO?S PRIMARY OBJECTIVES DURING A NEW GRANT CYCLE WILL BE TO DEVELOP AND LAUNCH SEVERAL NEW VISTA PROJECTS TO ADDRESS VARIOUS LEGAL MATTERS THAT LOCAL COMMUNITIES AND REGIONS THROUGHOUT THE STATE ARE ENCOUNTERING AS A RESULT OF THE PANDEMIC. THESE PROJECTS, WHICH WILL BE DEVELOPED WITH INPUT FROM A VARIETY OF SOURCES, INCLUDING CURRENT AND POTENTIAL CLIENTS, WILL SEEK TO ALLEVIATE AND ELIMINATE POVERTY BY MAINTAINING OR INCREASING HOUSEHOLD INCOME AND ADDRESSING SOCIAL DETRIMENTS TO HEALTH. TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS, LEGAL AID CHICAGO AND THE SUBGRANTEE PARTNER PROJECT SITES WILL LAUNCH COMMUNITY OUTREACH INITIATIVES AND ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS TO HELP INDIVIDUALS GAIN FAMILIARITY WITH A VARIETY OF PUBLIC AID PROGRAMS AND LEARN HOW TO NAVIGATE THEM IN ORDER TO ACCESS VITAL SERVICES.  
IN ITS ROLE AS SPONSOR INTERMEDIARY, LEGAL AID CHICAGO WILL MAKE INTERNAL PREPARATIONS, AND WORK CLOSELY WITH ITS PARTNER PROJECT SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE, IN EFFORTS TO ENSURE THAT A GROWING NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS FACING ISSUES SUCH AS FOOD INSECURITY, HOMELESSNESS, AND UNEMPLOYMENT, AMONG OTHERS, WILL BENEFIT FROM GREATER ACCESS TO FREE LEGAL RESOURCES, SERVICES, EDUCATION, AND REPRESENTATION. IN A NEW PROJECT PERIOD, VISTAS WILL COORDINATE A VARIETY OF EFFORTS TO ADDRESS THESE ISSUES IN THE SHORT TERM, WHILE SETTING UP PROCESSES TO ADDRESS THESE ISSUES AFTER THEIR TERMS CONCLUDE AND AFTER THEIR PROJECT SITE HAS TRANSITIONED AWAY FROM VISTA RESOURCES.
BY LEVERAGING VISTA RESOURCES TO MAXIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THESE MANY COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND VOLUNTEER MOBILIZATION INITIATIVES, RESIDENTS OF ILLINOIS WILL BENEFIT FROM COUNTLESS NEW OPPORTUNITIES TO REMOVE BARRIERS TO QUALITY HEALTHCARE AND INCOME SECURITY. THIS PROPOSED PROJECT WOULD ULTIMATELY BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 8,000 INDIVIDUALS AND ALIGN WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREAS. THE RESULT OF THE VISTAS? SERVICE WILL SEE THE PROJECT SITES, PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS, AND THEIR LOCAL COMMUNITIES BEING BETTER PREPARED TO ADDRESS EMERGING POVERTY TRENDS, INCREASING DEMANDS FOR PUBLIC ASSISTANCE, AND PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

TEXAS SOUTHMOST COLLEGE?S MISSION IS TO TRANSFORM OUR COMMUNITIES THROUGH INNOVATIVE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH ALL FOUR OF THE CNLS FOCUS AREAS, WITH ELIMINATING AND ALLEVIATING POVERTY AND ADDRESSING POVERTY-RELATED PROBLEMS AS THE OVERARCHING GOAL. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ACCOMPLISH THREE GOALS: INCREASE THE COLLEGE?S CAPACITY TO PROVIDE ACADEMIC AND PERSONAL COACHING; SUPPORT STUDENT RETENTION AND SUCCESS THROUGH THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A LIBRARY AT TSC; AND RESEARCH, ESTABLISH, AND LAUNCH COURSES DESIGNED TO ALLEVIATE THE EFFECTS OF POVERTY THROUGH THE ACADEMY OF LIFELONG LEARNING (ALL). THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT MORE THAN 8,628 STUDENTS PER YEAR THROUGH THE COLLEGE?S REGULAR ENROLLMENT, DUAL CREDIT PROGRAMS, WORKFORCE TRAINING, AND ACADEMY OF LIFELONG LEARNING. OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS, SEVEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: GATHERING AND ANALYZING DATA SPECIFIC TO LOCAL STUDENTS' BASIC NEEDS, DESIGNING A CUSTOMIZED ANTI-POVERTY INITIATIVE, AND PURSUING COLLABORATION OPPORTUNITIES AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE SUSTAINABILITY FOR IMPLEMENTATION; ASSISTING IN STANDING UP THE DIGITAL LIBRARY AND ASSESSING THE REQUIREMENTS AND PROCESS FOR CREATING AN ARCHIVAL REPOSITORY ON CAMPUS; AND LEADING A SURVEY OF EXISTING ACADEMY OF LIFELONG LEARNING RESOURCES, COLLECTING AND ANALYZING DATA TO INFORM COURSE DESIRABILITY, RECRUITING APPROPRIATE CONTRACT FACULTY, DEVELOPING MARKETING MATERIALS, AND RECRUITING OF ACADEMY PARTICIPANTS.

GIRLS EMPOWERMENT NETWORK'S MISSION IS TO IGNITE POWER IN GIRLS BY TEACHING THEM SKILLS TO THRIVE AND BELIEVE IN THEIR ABILITY TO BE UNSTOPPABLE. WE ACCOMPLISH THIS THROUGH DELIVERING OUR SELF-EFFICACY BUILDING CURRICULUM AT SCHOOLS, CAMPS, AND CONFERENCES. OUR LARGEST SERVICE IS OUR GIRL CONNECT PROGRAM ON SCHOOL CAMPUSES (MOST OF THEM TITLE 1). THROUGH GIRL CONNECT, WE ARE GIVING GIRLS A STRONG BELIEF IN THEMSELVES (SELF-EFFICACY), WHICH HAS AN IMPORTANT IMPACT ON ACADEMIC SUCCESS, FUTURE CAREER ACHIEVEMENT, AND LIFTING WOMEN AND GIRLS (AND THEREBY MORE OF SOCIETY OVERALL) OUT OF POVERTY. 

THE VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION PRIORITY AREA AND WOULD DIRECTLY CONTRIBUTE TO "K-12 SUCCESS IN STUDENT EDUCATIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL OUTCOMES IN LOW-ACHIEVING SCHOOLS." GIRL CONNECT PROGRAMMING SUPPORTS GIRLS IN INCREASED POSITIVE SCHOOL FUNCTIONING AND DECREASED DISCIPLINARY REFERRALS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SUPPORT GROWTH/CAPACITY OF GIRL CONNECT AND WILL SEEK TO INCREASE OUR ORGANIZATIONAL SCALE/REACH TO RESULT IN MORE VOLUNTEERS SUPPORTING OUR WORK, GREATER COMMUNITY AWARENESS/ENGAGEMENT WITH OUR MISSION, AND INCREASED FINANCIAL RESOURCES. THIS WILL ALLOW US TO ULTIMATELY SERVE MANY MORE GIRLS IN THE AUSTIN AND HOUSTON COMMUNITIES WITH THIS LIFE CHANGING CONTENT THROUGH GIRL CONNECT. OUR HOPE WAS TO REACH AT LEAST 1,200 GIRLS IN AUSTIN AND 400 GIRLS IN HOUSTON WITH GIRL CONNECT SERVICES IN THE FIRST YEAR AND FOR THAT TO INCREMENTALLY INCREASE EACH YEAR AFTER. 5 VISTA MEMBERS (2 IN HOUSTON AND 3 IN AUSTIN) CONTRIBUTED TO THESE GOALS BY PERFORMING KEY ACTIVITIES AIMED AT ASSESSING, IMPROVING, AND SCALING OUR FUNDRAISING, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, AND OPERATIONAL ACTIVITIES. WE HAVE NOW BEEN OFFERED A SUPPORT GRANT AND WILL BE EXPANDING OUR VISTA PROGRAM TO INCLUDE 1 VISTA LEADER AND 7 VISTA MEMBERS, ALL OF WHOM WILL HELP GROW OUR CAPACITY AND SUSTAINABILITY OVER THE COURSE OF THE PLACEMENT.

RESPONSE DURING COVID-19 PANDEMIC:
ON MARCH 13, 2020, GIRLS EMPOWERMENT NETWORK PIVOTED. WE WENT FROM WORKING DIRECTLY WITH THOUSANDS OF GIRLS AND THEIR FAMILIES VIA IN-PERSON PROGRAMMING TO PROVIDING VIRTUAL CONNECTION AND SUPPORT PROGRAMS FOR THOSE SAME FAMILIES AND BEYOND.  OUR ORGANIZATION CONSIDERED HOW WE CAN MEET THE MOST CRITICAL NEEDS OF OUR GIRLS EVEN AS WE FACE COVID-19. WE HAVE LEANED INTO WHAT WE DO BEST AND CONVERTED OUR SERVICES TO REACH GIRLS NO MATTER WHERE THEY ARE. 
 
ACCORDING TO THE NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF HEALTH, HIGH STRESS TIMES LIKE COVID-19 PUTS EXTRA PRESSURE ON FAMILIES, AND OUR COMMUNITIES EXPERIENCE INCREASED RATES OF ALCOHOLISM, DRUG USE, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE. IN FACT, UNICEF AND MANY OTHER SOURCES CONFIRM THAT THESE ISSUES ARE RISING NOW. SHELTER-IN-PLACE GIVES ABUSERS MORE OPPORTUNITY TO ISOLATE FAMILY MEMBERS WHILE AT THE SAME TIME OUR GIRLS CAN'T ACCESS THEIR USUAL SUPPORT SYSTEMS. AN ELEVATED PERCENTAGE OF OUR GIRLS ARE AT RISK OF BECOMING VICTIMS OF THESE ISSUES. SOME OF OUR GIRLS WILL RUN AWAY--A DANGEROUS BUT RATIONAL COPING METHOD FOR DEALING WITH ABUSE AT HOME.  COVID-19 EXACERBATES ALL THE ILLNESS, HOMELESSNESS, ARREST, AND TRAUMA THAT COMES WITH RUNNING AWAY. ADDITIONALLY, ACCORDING TO THE FBI, GIRLS ARE AT INCREASED RISK OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING AS THEY ARE SPENDING MORE TIME ONLINE, FEELING A NEED FOR CONNECTION AS A RESULT OF SHELTERING-IN-PLACE DURING THIS PANDEMIC.
 
EVEN IN NORMAL CIRCUMSTANCES, OUR GIRLS ARE IN NEED OF A HEALTHY CONNECTION OUTSIDE OF THEIR HOMES TO COMBAT THE NEGATIVE EFFECTS OF STRESS AND ANXIETY (A SIGNIFICANT RISK FACTOR FOR GIRLS OF ANY BACKGROUND.) THE PANDEMIC HEIGHTENS ALL OF THIS. FOR SOME GIRLS, STRESS AND ANXIETY WILL PRESENT THROUGH SELF-INJURIOUS BEHAVIORS LIKE DISORDERED EATING, POISON, CUTTING AND PILLS. WE ARE MOST CONCERNED ABOUT THIS BECAUSE THE RESEARCH SHOWS EVEN WHEN OUR COMMUNITIES ARE NOT EXPERIENCING PRESSURE FROM COVID-19, GIRLS ARE MORE PRONE TO SELF-HARM THAN BOYS AS A COPING SKILL FOR STRESS AND ANXIETY. THE MISSION OF THE CITY OF NEW ORLEANS IS TO DELIVER EXCELLENT SERVICES TO ITS CITIZENS WITH COURAGE, COMPETENCE AND COMPASSION. WE FOSTER PROGRESSIVE, CREATIVE APPROACHES TO SOLUTIONS AND ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR PROTECTING OUR CITY?S MOST PRECIOUS RESOURCE: ITS PEOPLE. THE VISTA PROGRAM ALIGNS WITH THIS GOAL AND WILL HELP US TO PRESERVE HEALTHY, VIBRANT COMMUNITIES BY ENGAGING WITH DIVERSE LEADERS AND STAKEHOLDERS TO INVOLVE BROAD PERSPECTIVES ON CITY PRIORITIES. THE INDIVIDUAL VISTA PROJECTS WILL SEEK TO ENHANCE THE SERVICES OFFERED BY LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND DETERMINE IF THE CURRENT SERVICES ARE IN LINE WITH ASSISTING OUR MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS, ENSURING THE CITY?S RESPONSE IS RELEVANT TO THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY WITH THE GOAL OF LIFTING INDIVIDUALS OUT OF POVERTY AND ADDRESSING INSTITUTIONALIZED BARRIERS. THE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF EACH DEPARTMENT TO MEET THE PEOPLE WHERE THEY ARE- ENGAGING IN ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY OUTREACH, STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT, FUNDRAISING, POLICY REVIEW AND ANALYSIS, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT, MOBILIZING LOCAL RESOURCES AND STRENGTHENING THE ABILITY OF EACH PROJECT TO CONTINUE SUSTAINABLY. BY/THROUGH BUILDING OUT PERMANENT CAPACITY AND FRAMEWORKS TO ADDRESS THE EVOLVING NEEDS OF OUR RESIDENTS, THE VISTA PROGRAM WILL EMPOWER THE CITY OF NEW ORLEANS AND ITS RESIDENTS TO DEVELOP MORE EQUITABLY AND EFFECTIVELY.

CONSERVATION LEGACY BEGAN WITH THE BELIEF THAT EVERYONE IN OUR COMMUNITIES CAN ADD VALUE AND ENRICH THE LIVES OF ALL WHO LIVE THERE, AND THAT THROUGH CONNECTING PEOPLE TO AN OUTDOOR ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDS EXPERIENCE, WE CAN ENHANCE THAT SENSE OF CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY AND PERSONAL LEADERSHIP. THIS BELIEF IS CAPTURED IN OUR MISSION: FOSTERING CONSERVATION SERVICE IN SUPPORT OF COMMUNITIES AND ECOSYSTEMS.  THIS MISSION IS INSPIRED BY A SHARED VISION OF A LEGACY OF HEALTHY LANDS, AIR, AND WATER, THRIVING PEOPLE, AND RESILIENT COMMUNITIES.  

AS A PROGRAM OF CONSERVATION LEGACY, STEWARDS INDIVIDUAL PLACEMENTS VISTA REFLECTS EVERY ASPECT OF OUR MISSION AND VISION IN THE PROJECTS WE SUPPORT. STEWARDS? FOCUS ON ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT THROUGH THE PROMOTION OF CONSERVATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP ASSISTS NONPROFITS AND GRASSROOTS ORGANIZATIONS IN ACHIEVING THEIR QUEST TO COMBAT POVERTY. QUALIFIED STAFF AND MEMBERS LEAD CAPACITY BUILDING, OUTREACH, AND EDUCATION TO FOSTER LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY IN RURAL AND URBAN COMMUNITIES NATIONWIDE. WE SEEK TO PLACE 68 YEAR-LONG NATIONAL SERVICE VISTA MEMBERS AND TWO (2) VISTA LEADERS TO ACCOMPLISH OUR GOALS.

UNITED WAY WAS FOUNDED IN 1887 IN DENVER, COLORADO, AS A COLLABORATIVE ORGANIZATION ADDRESSING THE CITY'S SOCIAL WELFARE NEEDS. UNITED WAY OF WELD COUNTY BEGAN AS THE GREELEY COMMUNITY CHEST IN 1940. OVER TIME, IT HAS BEEN RENAMED AND RESTRUCTURED, ULTIMATELY BECOMING UNITED WAY OF WELD COUNTY IN 1970. AN INDEPENDENT, LOCAL NONPROFIT 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION THAT IS PART OF THE UNITED WAY WORLDWIDE NETWORK, UNITED WAY OF WELD COUNTY IMPROVES LIVES AND CATALYZES SOCIAL CHANGE THROUGH INTENTIONAL COMMUNITY IMPACT EFFORTS. UWWC RAISES AND UTILIZES RESOURCES IN PARTNERSHIP WITH INDIVIDUALS, BUSINESSES, FOUNDATIONS, AND PUBLIC AND PRIVATE AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS TO ACHIEVE DESIRED COMMUNITY IMPACT AND POSITIVE CHANGE FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND FAMILIES; UWWC DOES THIS IN A WAY THAT ENGAGES COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND VOLUNTEERS IN ALL ASPECTS OF THE ORGANIZATION AND PROCESS. 
UWWC FIGHTS FOR THE HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND FINANCIAL STABILITY OF EVERY PERSON IN WELD COUNTY, USING FOUR DISTINCT COMMUNITY INVESTMENT METHODS:
PROVIDE: UWWC USES ITS MANAGEMENT CAPACITY TO DIRECTLY ACHIEVE PROGRAMMATIC RESULTS WHEN COMMUNITY SERVICES ARE NEEDED AND UWWC HAS THE CAPACITY TO RESPOND. THESE INCLUDE:
+ 2-1-1 INFORMATION & REFERRAL: A COMPREHENSIVE PHONE- AND WEB-BASED INFORMATION AND REFERRAL SERVICE THAT CONNECTS USERS TO AN EXHAUSTIVE LISTING OF HUMAN SERVICE RESOURCES THROUGHOUT COLORADO
+ PROMISES FOR CHILDREN: WELD COUNTY'S EARLY CHILDHOOD COUNCIL AND SUITE A PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVES WORKING TO IMPROVE THE WELLBEING OF WELD COUNTY CHILDREN.
+ VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT: CONNECTS INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT WELD COUNTY THROUGH A DATABASE OF CURRENT VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES, AND THE ORGANIZATION OF COMMUNITY-WIDE VOLUNTEER EVENTS.
FUND: UWWC INVESTS IN NEARLY 100 WELD COUNTY AGENCY PROGRAMS USING STRATEGIES THAT ASSURE DECISION-MAKING IS ACCOUNTABLE AND INVOLVES COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS AND CIVIC REPRESENTATION.
COLLABORATE: UWWC ADVANCES COUNTY-WIDE SOLUTIONS BY LEADING AND PARTICIPATING IN COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS, INCLUDING THE THRIVING WELD DASHBOARD, THE WELD REFUGEE COLLABORATION, AND WELD'S WAY HOME.
PARTNER: UWWC CATALYZES INNOVATIVE, RESPONSIVE, RESOURCE-MAXIMIZING PARTNERSHIPS TO PROVIDE INTER-AGENCY PROGRAMMING, INCLUDING THE GREELEY/EVANS BUS PASS PROGRAM AND WELD PROJECT CONNECT.

THE ALLIANCE OF ARIZONA NONPROFITS MISSION IS TO UNITE, STRENGTHEN, AND ADVANCE ARIZONAS NONPROFIT SECTOR. OUR CONTINUED VISTA INTERMEDIARY PROJECTS ALIGN WITH ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND EDUCATION. 
 
AS A STATEWIDE ORGANIZATION, THE ALLIANCE HAS THE UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY AS AN INTERMEDIARY TO WORK WITH LOCAL PARTNER AGENCIES THAT FOCUS ON IMPACTING RURAL COMMUNITIES ACROSS ARIZONA.

THE EDUCATION ALLIANCE?S MISSION IS TO ENSURE EVERY WEST VIRGINIA PUBLIC SCHOOL STUDENT WILL GRADUATE READY TO BEGIN A CAREER OR PURSUE ADDITIONAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING. THE WV READY GRADUATE VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE WV READY GRADUATE VISTA PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO HELP WEST VIRGINIA SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS ENHANCE THEIR CAPACITY TO PROVIDE INNOVATIVE EDUCATION PROGRAMMING, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 6,500 STUDENTS, STAFF AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS. ELEVEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO PROVIDE EDUCATION PROGRAMMING AND SUPPORT PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION; RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS TO ENHANCE PROGRAM OFFERINGS; PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE OPPORTUNITIES FOR TEACHERS; ENGAGING STUDENTS IN INNOVATIVE EDUCATIONAL OFFERINGS; DEVELOPING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN SCHOOLS AND BUSINESS PARTNERS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES; LEVERAGE SUPPORT THROUGH GRANT WRITING AND FUNDRAISING; AND PROMOTING PROGRAM OFFERING THROUGH MARKETING CAMPAIGN.

PLEASE PROVIDE A ONE-PARAGRAPH SUMMARY (4-6 SENTENCES) OF YOUR PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT THAT INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING; A DESCRIPTION OF YOUR ORIGINATION'S MISSION, THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA THAT YOUR PROJECT ALIGNS WITH, A DESCRIPTION OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT GOAL(S) INCLUDING WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PROJECT, THE NUMBER OF VISTA'S AND LEADERS YOU ARE REQUESTING AND AN OVERVIEW OF THE MAJOR ACTIVITIES THEY WILL PERFORM, AND THE ESTIMATED TIME REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT.

UNITED WAY'S MISSION IS "TO IMPROVE LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF OUR COMMUNITY". THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THIS MISSION AND THE CNCS EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES IS OUR FOCUS AREAS.  THE PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND LITERACY-BASED PROGRAMS, FOOD PROGRAMS AND OPIOID PREVENTION AND TREATMENT PROGRAMS.  MEMBERS WILL COORDINATE INITIATIVES THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF THE LOW INCOME COMMUNITY AND BRING LOW-INCOME AND UNDERSERVED FAMILIES OUT OF POVERTY.  THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 5,000 CHILDREN AND ADULTS.  TWELVE STANDARD VISTA MEMBERS, TWO COST SHARE MEMBERS, AND 1 VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, PARTNERSHIP BUILDING, OUTREACH AND MARKETING, AND FINANCIAL RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THEIR SERVICE TIME.  SERVICE TIME FOR SITES WILL VARY DEPENDING ON THE NEED OF THE SITE.  SOME SITES WILL HAVE MEMBERS FOR 1 YEAR PER PROJECT, MOST PROJECTS WILL NEED 3 YEAR VISTA MEMBERS TO BUILD CAPACITY AND ENHANCE THE SITES ABILITY TO REACH OUT TO MORE OF THE COMMUNITY IN NEED.

STEP BY STEP'S MISSION IS TO:

TO ASSIST PEOPLE IN WORKING TOGETHER TO ACHIEVE THEIR DREAMS IN KINDRED COMMUNITIES ACROSS WEST VIRGINIA THROUGH: DIALOGUE, EDUCATION AND THE ARTS, WELLNESS, LOCAL LEADERSHIP AND SERVICE. WE ENVISION SUSTAINABLE, HEALTHY, GROWING, AND DYNAMIC COMMUNITIES IN WHICH PEOPLE THRIVE AND SUPPORT EACH OTHER TO DREAM, LEARN, WORK, AND PLAY, AND WHERE 100% OF OUR STUDENTS NOT ONLY GRADUATE HIGH SCHOOL, BUT SUCCESSFULLY TRANSITION TO CAREER/COLLEGE/TECHNICAL SCHOOL BECAUSE THEY HAVE THE SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND EXPERIENCE NEEDED TO MAKE THIS TRANSITION.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE STEP BY STEP WV DREAMERS HEALTHY AND RESILIENT FUTURES PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE SUPPORT AND RESOURCE OPTIONS FOR THOSE SUFFERING FROM SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER AND SECONDARY SUBSTANCE ABUSE-RELATED ISSUES; INCREASE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOODS FOR THOSE IN RECOVERY; CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR TEENS/YOUNG ADULTS TO ADDRESS CHALLENGES IN THEIR LIVES VIA A STRENGTHS-BASED APPROACH AS THEY ACQUIRE JOB/CAREER/COLLEGE READINESS AND LIFE SKILLS; AND INCREASE ACCESS TO RESOURCES, KNOWLEDGE, AND PEER SUPPORT FOR KINSHIP, FOSTER, AND ADOPTIVE FAMILIES. WE EXPECT 3000 PEOPLE TO BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT, I.E. AT-RISK STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES, PEOPLE IN RECOVERY, AND FOSTER, KINSHIP, AND ADOPTIVE PARENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES TO BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT. 21 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY ASSESSMENTS, BUILDING/NURTURING PARTNERSHIPS, IDENTIFYING GAPS IN RESOURCES AND BARRIERS TO RESOURCES, AND ASSISTING COMMUNITY PARTNERS IN IDENTIFYING AVAILABLE RESOURCES. ALL PROJECT PLANS ARE 3-YEAR CYCLES. TO THIS END WE ARE REQUESTING 17 VISTA MEMBERS, 1 VISTA LEADER, 3 COST SHARE VISTA MEMBERS.

UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT'S MISSION IS TO CONNECT, ENGAGE AND INSPIRE PEOPLE TO TRANSFORM OUR COMMUNITY. SPECIFIC FOCUS WILL BE GIVEN TO INVEST RESOURCES IN RURAL COMMUNITIES SERVED BY UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT. UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THOUSANDS OF CITIZENS IN A THREE-COUNTY FOOTPRINT. UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT WILL RECRUIT & DEPLOY TWENTY VISTA MEMBERS (18 MEMBERS & 2 VISTA LEADERS) WHO WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COORDINATION OF INTER-AGENCY COLLABORATION, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, AND PROGRAM, CURRICULUM, AND DATABASE DEVELOPMENT. THE FSU VISTA PROGRAM CONTRIBUTES TO THE SUPPORTS STATEWIDE PROGRAMMING OBJECTIVES FOR BOTH FSU AND THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE BY PLACING VISTA MEMBERS WITH COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES, AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES RESOURCES, NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES, AND TRAINING FOR VISTA MEMBERS. VISTA MEMBERS WORK TO COMBAT POVERTY THROUGH ENGAGING STUDENTS AND LEVERAGING HIGHER EDUCATION RESOURCES TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF COMMUNITIES, COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES, AND LOCAL NON-PROFITS TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY. VISTA MEMBERS ARE SUCCESSFULLY BUILDING BRIDGES BETWEEN THE CLASSROOMS AND COMMUNITIES BY CONNECTING EDUCATORS, STUDENTS, AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO IMPROVE EDUCATION AND ADDRESS SOCIETAL NEEDS THROUGH CAMPUS-COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, APPLIED CIVIC EDUCATION, AND ENGAGED CITIZENSHIP. STUDENTS ARE LEARNING FROM BEING ENGAGED IN MEANINGFUL SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES THAT CREATE POSITIVE CHANGE IN COMMUNITIES. FSU IS REQUESTING UP TO 36 VISTA MEMBERS (32 STANDARDS/INCLUDES 1 VISTA LEADER & 8 COST-SHARES) TO PLACE WITH HIGHER EDUCATION AND NON-PROFIT PARTNERS TO EMPOWER LOCAL COMMUNITIES TO LEVERAGE HIGHER EDUCATION RESOURCES TO ADDRESS CNCS FOCUS AREAS FROM JULY 2020 TO JULY 2021 (CNCS FY 20-21 GRANT CYCLE). ADDITIONALLY, WE ARE SEEKING TO PLACE UP TO 25 SUMMER VISTA ASSOCIATES (22 STANDARDS & 3 COST-SHARES).

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE CITY OF BIRMINGHAM, UNDER THE LEADERSHIP OF MAYOR RANDALL WOODFIN, CONTINUES TO IMPLEMENT A PROGRESSIVE AGENDA TO "PUT PEOPLE FIRST." WHILE THE NATION FACES FINANCIAL AND SOCIAL UNCERTAINTIES, THE CITY HAS UNIQUELY MAINTAINED ITS FOOTING IN ADDRESSING URBAN BLIGHT, HEALTH DISPARITIES, CRIME, AND DIPS IN EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT. THE ADMINISTRATION STRIVES TO BUILD A BETTER BIRMINGHAM BY INVESTING IN ITS CITIZENS, THEREBY RESTORING PUBLIC CONFIDENCE IN MUNICIPAL PRACTICES AND RETURNING INTEGRITY TO DISENFRANCHISED DEMOGRAPHICS. IN DOING SO, THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM HAS PROVEN TO BE AN INVALUABLE RESOURCE. SINCE 2016 AMERICORPS VISTAS HAS HELPED THE CITY INCREASE ITS CAPACITY TO SERVE WITH A MORE SIGNIFICANT IMPACT. THEIR CONTRIBUTIONS TO HELP STRENGTHEN BIRMINGHAM?S 23 COMMUNITIES IN THE AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, NEIGHBORHOOD REVITALIZATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, PUBLIC SAFETY, SOCIAL JUSTICE, YOUTH SERVICES, OPIOID PREVENTION MEASURES, AND EDUCATION. WITH THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM, WE HAVE BEEN ABLE TO MOVE THE NEEDLE ON SEVERAL CRITICAL COMMUNITY ISSUES TO ADDRESS AND ALLEVIATE POVERTY.
 THE CITY OF BIRMINGHAM IS REQUESTING CONTINUED SUPPORT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FOR OUR CURRENT VISTA PROJECT CONSISTING OF 25 VISTAS, 1 VISTA LEADER, AND 40 SUMMER ASSOCIATES. IN ADDITION TO THE REQUEST FOR VISTA MEMBER RESOURCES, WE ARE REQUESTING THE CONTINUES ADMINISTRATIVE FUNDING TO SUPPORT ONE FULL TIME VISTA SUPERVISOR, TRANSPORTATION FUNDS FOR THE VISTA SUPERVISOR AND VISTA MEMBERS THROUGH 99 NEIGHBORHOODS WHICH VISTAS WILL BE ENGAGED FOR ONE YEAR. ADDITIONALLY, THE CITY EXTENDS ITS REACH TO VULNERABLE POPULATIONS INCLUSIVE OF BUT NOT LIMITED TO: VETERANS, LGBTQ+, HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS, JUSTICE INVOLVED INDIVIDUALS, THOSE IN RECOVERY, AND SENIOR CITIZEN. WE RECOGNIZE THAT POVERTY IS A SERIOUS ISSUE WITH MANY ROOTS, HOWEVER WE ARE CONFIDENT THAT WE CAN CONTINUE TO INCREASE OUR EFFORTS AND OUTCOMES IN SUSTAINABLE POVERTY ALLEVIATION BAY ADDRESSING IT FROM MANY ANGLES. IN THE THREE YEARS THAT WE HAVE HOSTED VISTAS, THEY HAVE SERVED ON THE FRONTLINES IN A MANNER THAT HELPS US TO DO THIS MORE EFFECTIVELY, EFFICIENTLY, AND RESPONSIBLY.

THE PUBLIC SCHOOL PARTNERSHIP'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH ACCESS TO RESOURCES, EDUCATION, AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT HELP THEM ELEVATE THEMSELVES AND THEIR NEIGHBORS OUT OF POVERTY; WE ARE REQUESTING 21 VISTA MEMBERS AND 1 VISTA LEADER TO ACHIEVE THIS OBJECTIVE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE PUBLIC SCHOOL PARTNERSHIP WILL SEEK TO ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS AND LEVERAGE RESOURCES FOR SCHOOLS, COMMUNITY CENTERS, AND UNIVERSITY ENTITIES THAT FOCUS ON EDUCATION OF AT-RISK YOUTH. WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT MORE THAN 17,000 CLIENTS, INCLUDING PRESCHOOL AND K-12 STUDENTS, THEIR FAMILIES, AND PATRONS OF COMMUNITY CENTERS. VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY LEVERAGING HUMAN, IN-KIND, AND CASH RESOURCES TO CREATE, SCALE, AND STREAMLINE SITE-BASED PROGRAMS. WE ANTICIPATE THAT HOST SITES' PROJECTS WILL BE ON A THREE YEAR CYCLE FOR COMPLETION.

THE MONTANA CAMPUS COMPACT'S (MTCC) MISSION IS TO ADVANCE THE PUBLIC PURPOSES OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES BY DEEPENING THEIR ABILITY TO IMPROVE COMMUNITY LIFE AND TO EDUCATE STUDENTS FOR CIVIC AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY. OVER OUR TWENTY SIX YEAR ORGANIZATION HISTORY MTCC'S COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES HAVE SUCCESSFULLY PARTNERED WITH COMMUNITIES TO SUPPORT HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION AND POST-SECONDARY READINESS FOR LOW-INCOME MONTANANS, MOBILIZING TENS OF THOUSANDS OF COLLEGE STUDENTS INTO SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. VISTAS SERVING WITH THE CAMPUS COMPACT NETWORK HAVE PLAYED VITAL ROLES IN BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF CAMPUS-COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS THAT ADDRESS EDUCATIONAL EQUITY AND GENERATIONAL POVERTY. VISTAS SERVING IN MONTANA WITH THE MTCC NETWORK HAVE HELPED START AND SUSTAIN VETERANS CENTERS, LAUNCHED COLLEGE SUCCESS PROGRAMS, AND HELPED COMPREHENSIVELY IMPROVE THE SUPPORT SYSTEMS FOR LOW-INCOME, FIRST GENERATION AND MINORITY STUDENTS AS THEY WORK TO ACHIEVE THE AMERICAN DREAM. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT DIRECTLY ALIGNS WITH THE CORPORATION'S EDUCATION AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREAS. THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED STUDENTS AND VETERANS. MTCC, THROUGH VISTA PROJECTS, EXPECTS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF 25 ORGANIZATIONS, EXPANDING THEIR EFFECTIVENESS, SCALE AND REACH AND LEVERAGED RESOURCES. WE ESTIMATE THAT SUMMER ASSOCIATE VISTAS WILL BENEFIT AT LEAST 2,000 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED K-12 STUDENTS; 1,500 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND FIRST GENERATIONAL COLLEGE STUDENTS; AND 250 VETERANS/INDIVIDUAL MILITARY FAMILY MEMBERS. 24 FULL YEAR AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS, 1 VISTA LEADER AND APPROXIMATELY 30 VISTA SUMMER ASSOCIATES WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT; DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING LOW-INCOME FOCUSED EDUCATION PROGRAMS; DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING OF K-12 COMPLETION AND POST-SECONDARY ACCESS PROGRAMS; DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING OF VETERANS-SERVING PROGRAMS AND THE EXPANSION OF VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT YEAR. THE PROJECTS LAUNCHED DURING THE 2020-21 CYCLE WILL BE MULTI-YEAR IN SCOPE, AND MTCC PLANS TO SUPPORT THESE INITIATIVES OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS, BEFORE TRANSITIONING THEM TO FULL, LOCAL MANAGEMENT.

TECHOS PA' MI GENTE MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH THE RE-BUILDING OF ROOFS OR HOMES AFFECTED BY A NATURAL DISASTER, BASED ON HUMAN RIGHTS AND THE PRINCIPLES OF SOLIDARITY, SELF-SUSTAINABILITY, ALLIANCES AND COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERISM.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ELIMINATION OF POVERTY AND EMPOWERMENT OF COMMUNITIES THROUGH:
1. REPAIRING HOMES ACCORDING TO BUILDING GUIDELINES WHICH WILL RESULT IN STABLE HEALTHY ENVIRONMENTS.
2. TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON CARPENTRY AND MASONRY WHICH WILL PREPARE THEM ON BOTH PARTICIPATION IN THE DISASTER RECOVERY AND THE ACQUISITION OF SKILLS THAT WILL OPEN JOB OPPORTUNITIES FOR THEM.
3. DEVELOPING ALIMENTARY SUSTAINABILITY INITIATIVES THROUGH URBAN COMMUNITY VEGETABLE GARDENS, HOME VEGETABLE GARDENS, WORKSHOPS FOR LEARNING BASIC AGRICULTURE TECHNIQUES TO GROW THEIR OWN FOOD, TO READY WITH FOOD SUPPLIES IN CASE OF ANY EMERGENCY WHERE THE FOOD CHAIN COULD BE AFFECTED.

THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO BECOME PART OF THE VOLUNTEER TEAMS, DEVELOPING AWARENESS ON THE AMOUNT OF FAMILIES THAT NEED HELP TO RECOVER, PROVIDING TRAINING AND VOLUNTEER WORKING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR.  THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO KEEP BENEFITING FAMILIES THAT HAVE NOT YET RECOVERED PROPERLY FROM THE NATURAL DISASTER IN PUERTO RICO, AN APPROXIMATE OF 150 DIRECT PEOPLE PER YEAR AND 300 TO 400 INDIRECT INDIVIDUALS BENEFIT FROM THE RECOVERY OF THEIR NEIGHBOR OR RELATIVE AS WELL. THEREFORE, BASED ON THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FOCUS AREA, WE AIM TO PROVIDE BETTER ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES AND A HEALTHY FUTURE FOR THE PEOPLE IN NEED OF BETTER HOUSING. TEN VISTA MEMBERS AND A VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS:
1.	MANAGING THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF PROMOTIONAL CAMPAIGNS TO GIVE EXPOSURE TO THE ORGANIZATION.
2.	CREATING A DIGITAL CONTENT BANK TO BE AVAILABLE FOR THE USE OF THE WEBPAGE, THE SOCIAL MEDIA AND ANY EDUCATIONAL OR PROMOTIONAL MATERIAL RELATED TO THE ORGANIZATION AND ITS PROJECTS.
3.	MANAGING AND UPDATING WEBPAGE CONTENT WEEKLY, AND SOCIAL MEDIA DAILY ACCORDING TO THE VARIOUS PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES PERFORMED BY THE ORGANIZATION.
4.	COORDINATING EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR VOLUNTEERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS THAT ARE ALIGNED TO THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION.
5.	ELABORATING A FUNDRAISING PLAN FOR THE ORGANIZATION; SHORT AND LONG TERM.
6.	SERVING AS A HUMAN LINK BETWEEN THE ORGANIZATION AND THE PEOPLE THEY SERVE, CREATING A STANDARD OF COMMUNICATIONS TO KEEP COMMUNITIES INFORMED OF OUR WORK IN THEIR AREAS.
7.	FACILITATING THE SORTING PROCESS THROUGH NEEDS ASSESSMENT STRATEGIES AND ALLOWING THE ORGANIZATION TO PROMPTLY IDENTIFY URGENT CASES.
8.	COORDINATING VIRTUAL OR IN-PLACE ACTIVITIES IN THE WESTERN REGION OF PUERTO RICO IN ORDER TO RECRUIT, MOTIVATE AND TRAIN VOLUNTEERS.
9.	COORDINATING VIRTUAL OR IN-PLACE ACTIVITIES IN THE EASTERN REGION OF PUERTO RICO IN ORDER TO RECRUIT, MOTIVATE AND TRAIN VOLUNTEERS.
10.	DEVELOPING SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE INITIATIVES FOR DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.

ALL THESE IS EXPECTED TO BE COMPLETED IN A 1 TO 3 YEARS TIME FRAME.

THE CENTER FOR EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES (CEO) HAS OVER 40 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE IN WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMMING AND PROVIDES IMMEDIATE, EFFECTIVE, AND COMPREHENSIVE EMPLOYMENT SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS WITH CRIMINAL CONVICTIONS. OUR EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAM WAS DEVELOPED IN NEW YORK CITY AS A DEMONSTRATION PROJECT OF THE VERA INSTITUTE OF JUSTICE IN THE 1970S. CEO WAS INCORPORATED AS AN INDEPENDENT NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION SERVING NYC IN 1996 AND IN 2009 BEGAN AN EXPANSION EFFORT TO NEW HIGH-NEED JURISDICTIONS. TODAY, CEO IS THE NATION?S LEADING REENTRY EMPLOYMENT PROVIDER, SERVING ROUGHLY 8,000 PEOPLE PER YEAR ACROSS 28 PROGRAM SITES IN TEN STATES. OUR HIGHLY STRUCTURED AND TIGHTLY SUPERVISED PROGRAM IS PROVEN TO REDUCE RECIDIVISM AND IMPROVE EMPLOYMENT OUTCOMES FOR PEOPLE RETURNING HOME FROM INCARCERATION. CEO WORKS TO HELP PARTICIPANTS OBTAIN THE SKILLS AND CONFIDENCE NEEDED FOR SUCCESSFUL TRANSITIONS TO STABLE, PRODUCTIVE LIVES. CEO'S VISION IS THAT ANYONE WITH A CRIMINAL HISTORY WHO WANTS TO WORK HAS THE PREPARATION AND SUPPORT NEEDED TO FIND A JOB AND TO STAY CONNECTED TO THE LABOR FORCE.

CEO?S VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO DEVELOP NEW FINANCIAL AND IN-KIND RESOURCES, RECRUIT AND COORDINATE THE WORK OF VOLUNTEERS, CULTIVATE EXTERNAL PARTNERSHIPS, AND ENGAGE IN OUTREACH / COMMUNICATION EFFORTS TO GROW CEO?S BRAND AND PRESENCE. THIS WORK WILL SERVE TO BUILD CEO?S CAPACITY TO SERVE APPROXIMATELY 8,000 FORMERLY INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS ANNUALLY. TWENTY VISTA MEMBERS AND TWO VISTA LEADERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS GRANT PROPOSAL RESEARCH AND WRITING, DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS FOR PROGRAM ENHANCEMENTS, AND LOCAL OUTREACH AND PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF A ONE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD.

PANHANDLE COMMUNITY SERVICES IS SEEKING TO EMPOWER LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN THE RURAL REGION OF TEXAS KNOWN AS THE ?TEXAS PANHANDLE? TO BUILD THE CAPACITY IN THESE COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE A PATHWAY OUT OF POVERTY.  OVER A THREE-YEAR PERIOD, FIVE VISTAS WILL WORK WITH THE LOCAL COMMUNITIES TO IDENTIFY THE BARRIERS AND CHALLENGES TO DEVELOP OR ENHANCE SYSTEMS THAT PROVIDE ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND HEALTHY FUTURES.  

 IN THE SPRING OF 2018, PANHANDLE COMMUNITY SERVICES CONDUCTED A COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT THAT INDICATED FIVE MAJOR NEEDS IN THE PANHANDLE- ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT THAT PAY A LIVING WAGE, AVAILABILITY OF SAFE AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING, ACCESS TO HEALTH AND DENTAL CARE, ACCESS TO EDUCATION TO OBTAIN EMPLOYABLE SKILLS  AND FREE ACTIVITIES FOR YOUTH.  

PCS WOULD LIKE TO USE THE VISTAS TO OBTAIN IN-DEPTH INFORMATION TO SUPPORT THESE AND/OR OTHER NEEDS, CRAFT STRATEGIES THAT PCS WANTS TO DEPLOY VISTAS THROUGHOUT THE REGION TO UNCOVER THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN EACH RESPECTIVE COMMUNITY ALL THE WHILE DEVELOPING STRATEGIES WITH COMMUNITY LEADERS AND PROVIDERS TO HELP LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS OVERCOME POVERTY.  

THE VISTAS WILL IMPLEMENT METHODS SUCH AS FOCUS GROUPS, INTERVIEWS AND OTHER DATA COLLECTIONS METHODS TO IDENTIFY THE NEEDS/GAPS OF LOCAL COMMUNITIES.  WORKING WITH THE PARTNERSHIP OF LOW INCOME FAMILIES, SERVICES PROVIDERS, LOCAL GOVERNMENT, BUSINESS AND THE FAITH BASED COMMUNITIES, DEVELOP A SET OF STRATEGIES THAT FITS THE NEED OF THAT COMMUNITY.  THE VISTAS WILL HELP DEVELOP PARTNERSHIPS AGREEMENTS AMONG THE SHAREHOLDERS AND FOLLOWED THE PROGRESS OF THOSE PARTNERSHIPS.

PCS WILL PROVIDE $12,490 TO SUPPORT ONE VISTA FOR THE PROJECT IN YEAR ONE.  THE SOURCE OF THESE FUNDS WILL COME FROM UNRESTRICTED AGENCY DOLLARS.  THIS EXPENDITURE HAS BEEN APPROVED BY THE PCS BOARD OF DIRECTORS.  YEAR 2 AND 3 WILL BE DECIDED AT TIME OF RENEWAL.

WHEN STUDENTS WHO ARE EXPERIENCING POVERTY EARN THEIR HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA AND TRANSITION TO A UNIVERSITY, THOSE STUDENTS LOSE IMPORTANT SUPPORT. IN HIGH SCHOOL, AS STUDENTS ELIGIBLE FOR FREE OR REDUCED LUNCH, THEY ATE TWO IF NOT THREE NUTRITIOUS MEALS, AND MAY HAVE HAD A BACKPACK PROGRAM TO BRING HOME FOOD FOR THE WEEKEND. ALSO IN HIGH SCHOOL, STUDENTS HAD TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM SCHOOL. SCHOOLS OFTEN PROVIDE A DISCRETE MEANS FOR SHOWERING OR GETTING A CHANGE OF CLOTHES FOR STUDENTS WHO ARE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS. BY LAW, SCHOOLS HAVE A HOMELESS COORDINATOR. MANY URBAN DISTRICTS HAVE SOCIAL WORKERS ON STAFF WHO SUPPORT THE FAMILY WITH FINDING RESOURCES. WHEN STUDENTS EXPERIENCING POVERTY COME TO COLLEGE, THEY ARE PELL ELIGIBLE, WHICH MEANS THAT ALL OF THEIR TUITION AND MOST OF THEIR FEES WILL BE COVERED. AT UMKC, THEY HAVE ACCESS TO THE KANGAROO FOOD PANTRY AND TO THE STUDENT HEALTH CLINIC. THAT IS THE EXTENT OF THE SUPPORT AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WHO ARE EXPERIENCING POVERTY.  

UMKC PROPEL PROGRAM AND DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHOLOGY WOULD LIKE TO BUILD DEEP PARTNERSHIPS AMONG UMKC ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS, STUDENT SERVICES, AND KANSAS CITY COMMUNITY NONPROFITS PROVIDING SAFETY NET SUPPORTS. THROUGH PROPEL SOCIAL JUSTICE VISTA, FOUR VISTA CORPS MEMBERS WOULD ENGAGE IN COMMUNITY ORGANIZING, BUILD BRIDGES FROM CAMPUS TO COMMUNITY-BASED RESOURCES, AND HELP EDUCATE UMKC STAFF ABOUT THE NEEDS OF STUDENTS WHO ARE OR HAVE EXPERIENCED HOUSING AND/OR FOOD INSECURITY, AND LACK EMOTIONAL WELLBEING SUPPORT. EACH VISTA CORPS MEMBER WOULD WORK IN TARGETED, SPECIFIC AREAS ANCHOR PARTNERSHIPS AND SERVICES DEEPLY IN BOTH KANSAS CITY COMMUNITIES AND UMKC. OBJECTIVE 1: LEARN FROM COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS KNOWLEDGEABLE ABOUT SAFETY NET SERVICES ABOUT HOW TO MOST EFFECTIVELY SUPPORT UMKC STUDENTS EXPERIENCING FOOD AND HOUSING INSECURITY IN A WAY THAT HELPS THE STUDENTS HELP THEMSELVES AS THEY NAVIGATE, USE, AND ULTIMATELY GIVE BACK TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES. OBJECTIVE 2: BUILD ON THE ESTABLISHED PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE UMKC DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHOLOGY AND THE CHESTNUT AVENUE FAMILY RESOURCE CENTER TO ENGAGE SOCIAL SCIENCE MAJORS INTERESTED IN COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT WORK TO CONTRIBUTE TO AND LEARN FROM THE NEIGHBORS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS. OBJECTIVE 3: BUILD COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS THAT SPECIFICALLY ASSIST STUDENTS WITH DISABILITIES TO EXPLORE AND UNDERSTAND THE INTERSECTIONALITY OF DISABILITY, RACE/ETHNICITY, AND ECONOMIC DISADVANTAGE. OBJECTIVE 4: COLLABORATE WITH KANSAS CITY AREA COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS AND OTHER SAFETY-NET ORGANIZATIONS TO DEVELOP A SYSTEM OF PREVENTATIVE SERVICES AND CARE FOR STUDENTS EXPERIENCING MENTAL HEALTH CRISES. 

UMKC HAS DEVELOPED A THREE-YEAR PLAN FOR WHICH WE REQUEST THE COMMITMENT OF FOUR VISTA MEMBERS PER YEAR, FOR A TOTAL OF SEVEN VISTA MEMBERS, IN ORDER TO FULLY PUT INTO OPERATION THE OBJECTIVES OUTLINED ABOVE. ONE VISTA MEMBER WOULD BE ASSIGNED TO EACH OF THE RESPECTIVE OBJECTIVES TO SPEARHEAD IMPORTANT ELEMENTS OF EACH PROJECT. THE VISTA CORPS MEMBERS WOULD BE BASED OUT OF UMKC PROPEL IN THE DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHOLOGY SO THAT THEY WILL HAVE A SENSE OF OPERATIONAL HOME-BASE AND CAN SHARE IDEAS WITH ONE ANOTHER IN A WAY THAT, HOPEFULLY, BRINGS THE PROJECTS TOGETHER IN MEANINGFUL WAYS.

THE DCS IN-DIRECT WILL BE ABLE TO SUPPORT THE MAIN DCS PROGRAM THROUGH STAFFING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE BY HAVING A INCREASED REVENUE STREAM. THE INTERNATIONAL RESCUE COMMITTEE'S (IRC) KANSAS OFFICE FOR REFUGEES (KSOR) HELPS TO SHAPE THE STATE AND LOCAL CONTEXTS FOR RESETTLEMENT AND INTEGRATION, BUILDING STRUCTURES AND SYSTEMS THAT ENSURE BOTH REFUGEES AND RECEIVING COMMUNITIES ARE SUPPORTED TOWARDS A GREATER GOOD. THERE WILL BE FIVE VISTAS SERVING ON THIS PROJECT AND WILL SPAN ACROSS THREE DIFFERENT STATE AGENCIES AND ONE COMMUNITY PARTNER. THIS IS INTENDED TO BE A THREE YEAR PROJECT.

THE STAND FOUNDATION, INC.'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH LEADERSHIP TRAINING.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS).  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS GRADUATING ON TIME FROM TARGETED TITLE 1 HIGH SCHOOLS AND THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS ENROLLING IN POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION/TRAINING AND EXPECTS TO INITIALLY BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 120 STUDENTS. TEN (10) VISTA, INITIALLY FOUR (4) MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS EXTENSIVE RESEARCH, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT AND EXPANSION, GRANT WRITING, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT, AND MARKETING OVER THE INITIAL DEVELOPMENT PERIOD OF ONE YEAR.  THE ENTIRE PROJECT FROM DEVELOPMENT, IMPLEMENTATION, EVALUATION, AND CHANGE PROCESSES FOR OPTIMAL DELIVERY AND RESULTS IS ESTIMATED TO TAKE APPROXIMATELY FIVE (5) YEARS.

THE URBAN LEAGUE OF THE STATE OF ARKANSAS'S MISSION IS TO ADVANCE ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL PROSPERITY FOR UNDERSERVED ARKANSANS BY CREATING ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITY THROUGH ADVOCACY, COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, PROGRAMS, AND SERVICES.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMICS OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND URBAN LEAGUE VISIBILITY, PROGRAMMING, PARTNERSHIPS, AND MEMBERS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 250 INDIVIDUALS THAT IDENTIFY AS RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITIES AND ARE LOW-INCOME.  FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PROGRAM COORDINATION, OUTREACH, AND PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

THE FOUNDATION FOR THE MID SOUTH'S MISSION IS TO INVEST IN PEOPLE AND STRATEGIES THAT BUILD PHILANTHROPY AND PROMOTE RACIAL, SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC EQUITY IN ARKANSAS, LOUISIANA AND MISSISSIPPI. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO CREATE OPPORTUNITY FOR GROWTH RELATED TO VOLUNTEERISM, PROGRAMMING, OR SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE; AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 1,000 INDIVIDUALS IN UNDER-SERVED POPULATIONS THROUGHOUT THE RURAL ARKANSAS DELTA REGION. TEN VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA TEAM LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS HOSTING VOLUNTEERISM INFORMATION SESSIONS, INFORMING ORGANIZATIONS OF GAPS IN THEIR SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE, AND DEVELOPING SURVEY INSTRUMENTS TO ASSESS COMMUNITY SATISFACTION WITH EXISTING PROGRAMS OVER A PERIOD OF TWELVE MONTHS.
