THE MISSION OF SOUTHERN ARKANSAS UNIVERSITY IS TO EDUCATE STUDENTS FOR PRODUCTIVE AND FULFILLING LIVES IN A GLOBAL ENVIRONMENT BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR INTELLECTUAL GROWTH, INDIVIDUAL ENRICHMENT, SKILL DEVELOPMENT, AND MEANINGFUL CAREER PREPARATION. THE UNIVERSITY BELIEVES IN THE WORTH OF THE INDIVIDUAL AND ACCEPTS ITS RESPONSIBILITY FOR DEVELOPING IN ITS STUDENTS THOSE VALUES AND COMPETENCIES ESSENTIAL FOR EFFECTIVE CITIZENSHIP IN AN EVER-CHANGING, FREE, AND DEMOCRATIC SOCIETY. FURTHER, THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES AN ENVIRONMENT CONDUCIVE TO EXCELLENCE IN TEACHING AND LEARNING, SCHOLARSHIP, CREATIVE ENDEAVORS, AND SERVICE. 

SOUTHERN ARKANSAS UNIVERSITY (SAU) IS A SMALL, STATE SUPPORTED, REGIONAL, LIBERAL ARTS INSTITUTION EDUCATING 3,835 UNDERGRADUATE AND 811 GRADUATE STUDENTS FROM 39 STATES AND 41 COUNTRIES. THE UNIVERSITY HAS EXPERIENCED RECORD FRESHMEN CLASSES FOR THE PAST 6 YEARS. 

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS MOST CLOSELY WITH THE FOCUS AREA ED11 (OUTCOME) -- INCREASE NUMBER OF STUDENTS EARNING A POST-SECONDARY DEGREE. THE SAU VISTA PROJECT WILL BENEFIT SEVERAL THOUSAND STUDENTS AGES 6 THROUGH ADULT. OVER A THREE YEAR PERIOD, THE SAU VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO MEET THE FOLLOWING GOALS:
1. IDENTIFY POVERTY-RELATED BARRIERS AMONG CURRENT AND FUTURE STUDENTS; REDUCE BARRIERS THAT PREVENT COLLEGE COMPLETION.
2. ADVISE, COACH, MENTOR, AND SHEPHERD STUDENTS IN LANDING THEIR FIRST JOB POST-COLLEGE. 
3. CREATE MORE EFFICIENT PROCESSES FOR ENCOURAGING SERVICE AMONG COLLEGE STUDENTS.
4. INSPIRE AND ACTIVELY ENCOURAGE THE NEXT GENERATION OF STUDENTS TO PURSUE A COLLEGE DEGREE. 

EIGHT (8) VISTA MEMBERS AND TWENTY-TWO (22) VISTA SUMMER ASSOCIATES WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS, GENERALLY STRUCTURED AS:
YEAR 1 -- PROGRAM LEARNING, RESEARCH, DESIGN, AND PILOT INITIATIVES
YEAR 2 -- RUN FULL PROGRAM INITIATIVES; DEVELOP SUSTAINABILITY PLAN
YEAR 3 -- EVALUATE PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS; INITIATE SUSTAINABILITY PLAN

SOUTHERN ARKANSAS UNIVERSITY IS DEEPLY COMMITTED TO THE SUCCESS OF THE SAU VISTA PROJECT AS A WAY OF REDUCING POVERTY IN OUR COMMUNITY AND REGION. SAU WILL WORK IN TANDEM WITH VISTA LEADERSHIP, MEMBERS, AND SUMMER ASSOCIATES, TO ESTABLISH, SUPPORT, LEVERAGE RESOURCES FOR, AND ENABLE THE VISTA TEAM TO COMPLETE THEIR GOALS AND THE ASSOCIATED ACTIVITIES.

FOR MORE THAN 135 YEARS, THE AMERICAN RED CROSS HAS HELPED NEIGHBORS DOWN THE STREET, ACROSS THE COUNTRY AND AROUND THE WORLD BY DELIVERING THE MISSION TO PREVENT AND ALLEVIATE HUMAN SUFFERING IN THE FACE OF EMERGENCIES BY MOBILIZING THE POWER OF VOLUNTEERS AND THE GENEROSITY OF DONORS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE DISASTER SERVICES FOCUS AREA. THE PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD THE VOLUNTEER CAPACITY AND PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS OF THE DISASTER ACTION TEAMS PROGRAM AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE SERVICE AREAS COVERED BY THIS PROJECT.  EMPOWERING THE DISASTER ACTION TEAMS TO BUILD A STRONG NETWORK OF COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND RESOURCES WILL HELP BETTER SERVE MORE PEOPLE IMPACTED BY A DISASTER. THIS PROJECT REQUESTS EIGHT (8) VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE (1) LEADER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND BUILDING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE SERVICE YEARS.  WITH SUPPORT OF THIS PROJECT, THE DISASTER ACTION TEAMS EXPECT TO SERVE APPROXIMATELY 2,370 INDIVIDUALS IN THE FIRST YEAR OF THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT WHO EXPERIENCED A DISASTER ESPECIALLY THOSE LIVING IN POVERTY WHICH ARE MORE VULNERABLE TO HOMELESSNESS AND FINANCIAL IMPACTS.

FRIENDS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THIS BODY OF WORK WITH PARTNERS BUILDS ON A BROAD, REGIONAL COLLABORATION AMONG LOCALITIES, STATE AGENCIES, BUSINESSES, AND NONPROFITS TO TRANSFORM THE TRADITIONAL ECONOMY OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE POVERTY RESULTING FROM THE LOSS OF TRADITIONAL INDUSTRIES OF TOBACCO, COAL AND LABOR-BASED MANUFACTURING. THE RESULT SHOULD BE AN INVIGORATED ECONOMY THROUGH CREATIVE ECONOMY DEVELOPMENTS FOCUSING ON THE ARTS, CULTURE, HERITAGE, RECREATION, TOURISM AND SMALL BUSINESSES. THE 19-COUNTY, FOUR CITY FOOTPRINT OF THE PROJECT INCLUDES 77 DISTINCT LOCAL OR COUNTY GOVERNMENTS. 

THIS PROJECT BUILDS UPON CAPACITY BUILDING AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY EFFORTS ALREADY UNDERWAY IN THE REGION AND WILL ALLOW EXPANDED SERVICES FOR MAXIMUM IMPACT.  THIS PROJECT WILL FALL UNDER THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AREA OF THE VISTA PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES AND WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOR NO OR LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS THROUGH IMPROVED JOB SKILLS OR IMPROVED JOB READINESS AND SUPPORT ORGANIZATIONS AS THEY DEVELOP THEIR CAPACITY THROUGH SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT.  

FRIENDS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA REQUESTS FIVE (5) VISTAS TO WORK ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA IN PARTNERSHIP WITH REGIONAL PARTNERS AND LOCALITIES TO BUILD COMMUNITY CAPACITY AND EXPAND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES FOR UNDERSERVED AND LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS THROUGH COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM EXPANSION. 

IN ADDITION TO THE VISTA LEADER, VISTAS WILL BE DIVIDED INTO TWO TEAMS AND FOCUS AREAS TO COMPLIMENT THE WORK CURRENTLY UNDERWAY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA:
*	OPPORTUNITY SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA VISTA COMMUNITY BUILDERS -- FOUR (4) 
*	SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA VISTA MARKETING BRAND BUILDERS -- ONE (1)

THE GREATER WASHINGTON COMMUNITY FOUNDATION'S MISSION STATEMENT IS THAT IT EXISTS TO BUILD THRIVING COMMUNITIES BY PROVIDING COMMUNITY LEADERSHIP, INSPIRING LOCAL GIVING, PROMOTING CIVIC ENGAGEMENT, AND GUIDING STRATEGIC PHILANTHROPY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. OVER THE NEXT YEAR, THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK 2 VISTAS THAT WILL INCREASE SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS IN STUDENT ACHIEVEMENTS IN MONTGOMERY COUNTY, MARYLAND. THE GOAL OF THE COF IS TO PROVIDE A COMMUNITY-BASED APPROACH FOR AGGRESSIVELY SEEKING OUT NEW FUNDING SOURCES, OUTSIDE OF THE SCHOOL SYSTEM BUDGET, TO FUND INNOVATIVE, EVIDENCE-BASED EFFORTS TARGETED AT DISRUPTING THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS THAT CURRENTLY PREDICT THE ACHIEVEMENT GAP.

BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF GREATER LYNCHBURG, BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF CENTRAL VIRGINIA, AND JUBILEE FAMILY DEVELOPMENT CENTER ALL HAVE A MISSION TO FORMALIZE THE COLLABORATIVE PROCESS IN AN EFFORT TO IMPROVE AND EXPAND OUT OF SCHOOL TIME PROGRAMMING IN GREATER LYNCHBURG. THE COLLABORATION?S GOAL IS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF YOUTH AND FAMILIES LIVING IN POVERTY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CAPACITY BUILDING FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO EXPAND RESOURCES FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF COLLABORATION AND DEVELOP A VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT SYSTEM AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THREE NONPROFITS ORGANIZATIONS WHO ALL SERVE YOUTH. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, GRANT WRITING, DEVELOPMENT A VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT SYSTEM AND LEVERAGE IN-KIND GIFTS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE MISSION OF THE COMMUNITY-ACADEMIC IMPACT COALITION OF WASHINGTON AND LEE UNIVERSITY'S SHEPHERD PROGRAM IS TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY IN THE ROCKBRIDGE AREA. ACCORDING TO RECENT US CENSUS DATA, THERE ARE ALMOST 10,000 INDIVIDUALS IN THE ROCKBRIDGE AREA WHO ARE LIVING AT OR BELOW 150% OF THE NATIONAL POVERTY LEVEL. THAT MEANS MORE THAN ONE-THIRD OF THE PEOPLE IN OUR COMMUNITY ARE LIKELY STRUGGLING WITH POVERTY-BASED PROBLEMS SUCH AS INSUFFICIENT NUTRITIOUS FOOD, RISK OF UTILITY SHUT-OFFS OR EVICTION, INADEQUATE TRANSPORTATION, AND THE NEED TO ACCESS SUPPORT SERVICES. POVERTY IS ALSO A MAJOR UNDERLYING FACTOR IN ISSUES LIKE DRUG AND ALCOHOL ADDICTION. 
THE FOLLOWING PROPOSED AIMS TO DECREASE POVERTY BY IMPROVING SYSTEMS TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY IN RURAL AREAS AND BY INCREASING THE ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY AT MULTIPLE ANTI-POVERTY AGENCIES THROUGH IMPROVED VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, MANAGEMENT, AND TRAINING RESOURCES. ONE VISTA WILL WORK WITH THE ROCKBRIDGE AREA RELIEF ASSOCIATION (RARA), THE LARGEST SPECIFICALLY ANTI-POVERTY ORGANIZATION IN THE AREA WITH ALMOST FIFTY YEARS OF EXPERIENCE, TO DRASTICALLY INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF FOOD DISTRIBUTED TO FAMILIES EXPERIENCING FOOD INSECURITY. THE SECOND VISTA MEMBER WILL PARTNER WITH WASHINGTON AND LEE'S COMMUNITY BASED LEARNING OFFICE (CBL) TO SUPPORT CAPACITY BUILDING THROUGH IMPROVED VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT, RECRUITMENT, AND TRAINING AT SOME OF THE MOST ACTIVE ANTI-POVERTY AGENCIES IN THE AREA. IN ADDITION TO WORKING WITH RARA, THE VISTA WILL ALSO WORK WITH THE ROCKBRIDGE AREA PREVENTION COALITION, A GROUP WORKING TO REDUCE SUBSTANCE ABUSE AMONG AREA YOUTH BY BUILDING AWARENESS AND PROMOTING A NETWORK OF PREVENTION AND INTERVENTION SERVICES. BOTH OF THESE ORGANIZATIONS HAVE STRONG REPUTATIONS IN THE COMMUNITY AND A LONG HISTORY OF WORKING TO ADDRESS POVERTY-RELATED PROBLEMS IN ROCKBRIDGE.
HAVING TWO VISTA MEMBERS WHO ARE ABLE TO FOCUS THEIR TIME AND ENERGIES ON DEVELOPING THE NECESSARY PROGRAMMATIC INFRASTRUCTURE WILL ALLOW THE IDENTIFIED ANTI-POVERTY ORGANIZATIONS TO SERVE MORE PEOPLE IN NEED AND TO SERVE THOSE INDIVIDUALS MORE EFFECTIVELY. THIS WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED OUTCOMES FOR INDIVIDUALS AS WELL AS IMPROVED OUTCOMES FOR THE COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE.

TENNESSEE WESLEYAN UNIVERSITY'S AMERICORPS*VISTA PROJECT?S MISSION IS TO SUPPORT RURAL COMMUNITIES IN EASTERN TENNESSEE IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION AND FOOD INSECURITY.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECTS ALIGN WITH THE EDUCATION: K-12 SUCCESS FOCUS AREAS, AND HEALTHY FUTURES: FOOD RESOURCES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECTS SEEK TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY ISSUES AND IMPROVE K-12 EDUCATION SUCCESS RATES IN ATHENS CITY AND MCMINN COUNTY THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH THE ATHENS-FAMILY YMCA, CASA CORRIDOR OF EAST TENNESSEE, CASA CORRIDOR OF MONROE COUNTY, AND WILL ALSO IMPROVE K-12 EDUCATION SUCCESS RATES IN MEIGS, MONROE, AND RHEA COUNTIES BOTH CASA LOCATIONS.  LOVE THY NEIGHBOR PROJECT (LTNP), HOUSED AT TENNESSEE WESLEYAN, IS DEDICATED TO ELIMINATING THE BARRIER OF FOOD INSECURITY FOR INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT THE ATHENS/MCMINN COUNTY AREA, ESPECIALLY FOR STUDENTS IN K-12 AND COLLEGE. THE OVERALL PROJECT IS ESTIMATED TO PROVIDE A BENEFITS MORE THAN 1,000 UNDUPLICATED COMMUNITY MEMBERS OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR. THREE (3) AMERICORPS*VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE WORKING DIRECTLY WITH LTNP.  ADDITIONALLY, TWU IS THE INTERMEDIARY SPONSOR FOR FIVE (5) AMERICORPS*VISTA MEMBERS. TWO AT THE ATHENS-MCMINN FAMILY YMCA, AND THREE VISTAS WILL BE AT TWO COURT APPOINTED SPECIAL ADVOCATES (CASA) ORGANIZATIONS IN THE AREA. THERE WILL BE ONE (1) VISTA LEADER, HOUSED AT TENNESSEE WESLEYAN UNIVERSITY TO PROVIDE SUPPORT IN DEVELOPING EFFECTIVE REPORTING TOOLS, ASSIST WITH COMMUNICATION ACROSS SITES, AND DEVELOP PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR VISTAS.   TOGETHER, THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECTS BY EXPANDING ORGANIZATIONAL AND COMMUNITY CAPACITY, ESTABLISHING NEW AND GROWING EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS, AND ENGAGING IN ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY AND K-12 AND COLLEGE STUDENT SUCCESS, OVER THE COURSE OF THREE-YEAR OVERALL PROJECT TO COMPLETE LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY PLANS.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF TENNESSEE'S MISSION IS "FOLLOWING THE EXAMPLE OF CHRIST, CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE DIOCESE OF NASHVILLE ADVOCATES FOR AND PROVIDES SERVICES WHICH ENHANCE AND ENRICH THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR PEOPLE IN NEED", AND THE TENNESSEE OFFICE FOR REFUGEES' MISSION IS "TO FOSTER GROWTH, INTEGRATION AND SELF-SUFFICIENCY BY PROVIDING FINANCIAL, TECHNICAL AND PROFESSIONAL SUPPORT TO REFUGEES AND THE AGENCIES THAT SERVE THEM IN THE STATE OF TENNESSEE". THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE GOAL OF THE VISTA PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE THE FUTURES OF REFUGEE YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS BY PAIRING THEM WITH A MENTOR WHO WILL ENCOURAGE THEM TO COMPLETE HIGH SCHOOL, AND SET (AND WORK TOWARDS) GOALS THAT WILL PROVIDE THEM WITH GREATER ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES. ADDITIONALLY, A FOCUS ON IN-HOME ENGLISH LANGUAGE TUTORING WILL ENSURE THAT PARTICIPANTS WHO ARE HELD BACK FROM GREATER OPPORTUNITIES BECAUSE OF LIMITED ENGLISH WILL NOW BE ABLE TO REACH HIGHER GOALS. THE PROGRAM EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 225 REFUGEE YOUTH AGES 15-24 AS WELL AS ANOTHER 100 ADULT ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNERS. SEVEN VISTA MEMBERS (SIX MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER) WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING A CURRICULUM FOR REFUGEE YOUTH AND THEIR MENTORS AS WELL AS CREATING ONE FOR ADULT ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNERS AND THEIR IN-HOME TUTORS; RECRUITING, TRAINING, AND MATCHING MENTORS WITH REFUGEE YOUTH TO SUPPORT THEIR EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT GOALS; AND RECRUITING, TRAINING, AND MATCHING ADULT REFUGEE ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNERS WITH VOLUNTEER TUTORS. THIS PROJECT IS ANTICIPATED FOR FOUR YEARS TO ALLOW FOR PROPER DEVELOPMENT, TESTING, ADJUSTMENTS, AND SUSTAINABILITY.

THE MISSION OF THE CHATTANOOGA AREA FOOD BANK IS TO LEAD A NETWORK OF PARTNERS IN ELIMINATING HUNGER AND PROMOTING BETTER NUTRITION IN OUR REGION. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO SCALE THE FOOD BANK PROGRAMS AND CAPACITY TO DISTRIBUTE AT LEAST 15 MILLION POUNDS IN FY20 AND EXPECTS TO PROVIDE 10 ORGANIZATIONS WITH CAPACITY BUILDING SERVICES. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES TO SCALE AND IMPROVE THE EFFICIENCY OF FIVE PROGRAMMATIC AND OPERATIONAL AREAS: DEVELOPMENT, FOOD DONATIONS, MOBILE PANTRY DISTRIBUTIONS, AGENCY PARTNER CAPACITY, AND SUMMER AND AFTERSCHOOL FEEDING. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE EXPANDING AND STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIP NETWORKS, EXPANDING THE DIVERSITY OF THE FOOD BANK'S FUNDING STREAM, DEVELOPING PROGRAM MATERIALS, ASSESSING THE RESULTS OF PROGRAMS, ENHANCING PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY, AND DEVELOPING TECHNOLOGY-DRIVEN SOLUTIONS FOR ORGANIZATIONAL EFFICIENCY. THE PROJECT PERIOD IS 12 MONTHS.

THE MAYOR'S OFFICE FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH AND FAMILIES, HOUSED IN THE CITY OF CHARLESTON'S EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT, EXISTS TO PROMOTE, SUPPORT, AND FACILITATE PARTNERSHIPS AND PROGRAMMING WITHIN THE COMMUNITY THAT PROVIDE CITIZENS WITH THE RESOURCES, SUPPORTS, AND ACCESS TO SERVICES THAT THEY NEED TO THRIVE AND SUCCEED.  WITHIN THIS BROAD MISSION, THE OFFICE ACHIEVES THE WORK BY BEING AN AGENT OF COLLABORATION FOR ENTITIES IN THE COMMUNITY THAT ARE MEETING THE SALIENT NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY.
THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO AUGMENT, CULTIVATE, AND OTHERWISE SUPPORT PROGRAMS AND ENTITIES BENEFITTING LOW-INCOME CITIZENS BY BUILDING THEIR CAPACITY TO CARRY OUT THEIR WORK. THE FOCUS WILL BE ON BUILDING EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT SYSTEMS THAT LEAD TO SUSTAINABILITY. TWENTY-SIX (26) VISTA MEMBER POSITIONS AND TWO (2) VISTA LEADER POSITIONS ARE REQUESTED TO CARRY OUT THIS WORK.  EACH VISTA MEMBER WILL HAVE THEIR OWN PROJECT AND SITES WILL BE SELECTED THROUGH A COMPETITIVE PROCESS.

THE MISSION OF TRANSPLANTING TRADITIONS COMMUNITY FARM IS TO FACILITATE ACCESS TO LAND, HEALTHY FOOD, AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION AND ENTREPRENEURIAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR REFUGEE ADULTS AND YOUTH. CLOSELY ALIGNED WITH THE INTERCONNECTED PRIORITIES OF AMERICORPS VISTA, THE PROJECT, ENTITLED, WOMEN IN TRANSITIONS WILL PRIMARILY FOCUS ON EMPLOYMENT AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT STRATEGIES THROUGH AGRICULTURAL-BASED SOCIAL ENTERPRISE PROGRAMS AS A TOOL FOR OVERCOMING AND PREVENTING POVERTY.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENSURE THAT NORTH CAROLINA WOMEN FACING MAJOR TRANSITIONS (REFUGEES, IMMIGRANTS, FORMERLY INCARCERATED AND OTHERS) GAIN THE EDUCATIONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS NEEDED TO IMPROVE THEIR ECONOMIC SITUATION. THREE (3) AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS BY BUILDING ON AND INCREASING THE CURRENT CAPACITY OF LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS BY HELPING TO DEVELOP FUNDING AND SOCIAL ENTERPRISE PLANS, STRATEGIC METHODS AND TOOLS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE CONSECUTIVE YEARS.  THROUGH AGRICULTURAL-BASED SOCIAL ENTERPRISE PROGRAMS THE WOMEN IN TRANSITION PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY-EMPLOYMENT AND HEALTHY FUTURES-ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND FOOD SECURITY AMERICORPS VISTA PRIORITIES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO EXPAND THIS PROJECT WORK IN THE AREA OF EDUCATION. TO DO THIS GRANTEE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH LEVEL ACTIVITIES: LEVERAGE RESOURCES, RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS, PROVIDE CAPACITY BUILDING SERVICES, EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS AND PERFORM OUTREACH. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW INCOME YOUTH AND INDIVIDUALS IN DURHAM COUNTY, NORTH CAROLINA. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE 30 ORGANIZATIONS, INCREASING THEIR EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS AND OR PROGRAM REACH, 60 STUDENTS ENROLLING IN POST SECONDARY EDUCATION/TRAINING, AND 48 STUDENT WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL SKILLS.

THE TRANSFORMATION IN TEN INITIATIVE IS A PLACE-BASED, DATA-DRIVEN, AND COMMUNITY-LED POVERTY REDUCTION PILOT INITIATIVE OPERATED THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT OF NEIGHBORHOOD IMPROVEMENT SERVICES OF THE CITY OF DURHAM. TRANSFORMATION IN TEN ADDRESSES SIX FOCUS AREAS AS IDENTIFIED BY A COMMUNITY SURVEY OF OVER 200 RESIDENTS IN 2014: HEALTH, HOUSING, JOBS, FINANCE, PUBLIC SAFETY, EDUCATION. TRANSFORMATION IN TEN CONTINUES TO BE GUIDED BY MONTHLY WORKGROUP MEETINGS, WHICH ARE ALWAYS LED BY AND OPEN TO THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY SERVED. THE INITIATIVE PRIORITIZES SERVING LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS OF ALL AGES, WITH PARTICULAR ATTENTION TO RESIDENTS WHO ARE DISABLED, FORMERLY INCARCERATED, SINGLE PARENTS, HOMELESS AND/OR IN TRANSITION. THIS INITIATIVE REQUIRES THREE VISTA: ONE DATA COORDINATOR, ONE OUTREACH COORDINATOR, AND ONE PARTNERSHIP COORDINATOR, ALL OF WHOM WILL SERVE FOR ONE YEAR. THE PROPOSED PROJECT ALIGNS PRIMARILY WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.

EASTERN CAROLINA COUNCIL?S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE REGION?S QUALITY OF LIFE BY PROVIDING PLANNING, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, AND SENIOR SERVICES TO LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND AREA RESIDENTS BY MAXIMIZING RESOURCES AND COLLABORATING REGIONALLY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH BOTH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND DISASTER SERVICES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL: SEEK TO INCREASE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE RESIDENTS IN OUR NINE-COUNTY REGION BY IMPROVING ACCESS TO JOBS, GOODS, AND SERVICES WHILE ALSO PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR LOWER-INCOME FAMILIES THAT MAY NOT HAVE ACCESS TO A CAR, IMPROVE ECONOMIC STABILITY WITHIN OUR REGION BY HELPING TO FUND JOB SKILL TRAINING CENTERS AND INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS, AND ENHANCING PERSONAL AND GOVERNMENTAL RESILIENCY IN AREAS THAT ARE VULNERABLE TO STORMS AND OTHER NATURAL HAZARDS, EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS WITHIN OUR NINE-COUNTY REGION. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS FOR TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS, GRANT RESEARCH, WRITING, AND ADMINISTRATION, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES, AND DISASTER RECOVERY PROJECTS OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR WITH THE POTENTIAL TO RENEW FOR ADDITIONAL YEARS.

NC STEM EAST'S MISSION IS TO BUILD A STEM NETWORK OF SKILLED VOLUNTEERS, YOUTH AGENCIES, PROGRAMS AND RELATED INDUSTRIES TO BROADEN STEM AFTERSCHOOL AND SUMMER ENRICHMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR 350 MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS LIVING IN LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES IN PITT AND TYRRELL COUNTIES. WE WILL ALSO PARTNER WITH PAMLICO ROSE INSTITUTE FOR SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITIES (DBA PAMLICO ROSE) IN BEAUFORT COUNTY, NC AS ONE SITE TO FOCUS ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY FOR FEMALE VETERANS IN ENC. 

OVEARALL THE NC STEM EAST  PROGRAM WILL LARGELY SUPPORT OUR NETWORK OF SKILLED VOLUNTEERS AND YOUTH-SERVING AGENCIES WILL ALLOW BOYS & GIRLS CLUBS OF THE COASTAL PLAIN (BGCCP) AND THE POCOSIN ARTS (PA) TO PROVIDE STEM EXPERIENCES THAT CAN ALTER THE EDUCATIONAL AND CAREER TRAJECTORY FOR YOUTH, ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO LIVE IN POVERTY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT IS ALIGNED WITH THE EDUCATION K-12 SUCCESS FOCUS. FIVE (5) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS MAPPING STEM ASSETS IN OUR REGION, RECRUITING SKILLED VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF STEAM CURRICULA FOR THE SMITH FAB LAB IN COLUMBIA NC, RECRUITING SKILLED VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SUMMER BRAIN GAIN IN BOYS & GIRLS CLUBS IN PITT COUNTY, AND INCREASING RESOURCES TO SUPPORT STEM ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS. 

FOR YEAR ONE, WE WILL WORK TO SUPPORT ONE (1) VISTA PLACED AT PAMLICO ROSE INSTITUTE FOR SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITIES (DBA PAMLICO ROSE) TO SUPPORT CAPACITY BUILDING OF THE THE TOTAL FORCE FITNESS PROGRAM AND VETERAN GARDEN PROGRAMMING; AS WELL THE OVERALL NEED FOR VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT.

UNITED WAY OF PITT COUNTY''S MISSION IS TO INCREASE THE ORGANIZED CAPACITY OF PEOPLE TO CARE FOR ONE ANOTHER. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO (1) STRENGTHEN THE NETWORK OF PARTNERING AGENCIES FOR COMMUNITY WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND / OR EARLY LITERACY PROGRAMMING, (2) BUILD A DATA DRIVEN PLAN OF OUTREACH THAT CONNECTS RESIDENTS TO NETWORK COMMUNITY RESOURCES, (3) BUILD AN INTER-AGENCY REFERRAL PROCESS THAT ALLOWS PARTICIPATING AGENCIES TO MOVE COLLECTIVELY TOWARDS A SYSTEMS-BUILDING APPROACH FOR ADDRESSING DISPARITIES, (4) IMPROVE THE OVERALL SYSTEM OF COMMUNITY COLLABORATION AND RESOURCE DELIVERY, AND (5) ADVOCATE FOR THE COMMUNITY EMPLOYMENT PIPELINE AND THE COMMUNITY SOLUTIONS ACTION PLAN. THIS INITIATIVE EXPECTS TO BENEFIT AN ESTIMATED 27,634 OF BENEFICIARIES, INCLUDING LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS IN THE 5 POVERTY CENSUS TRACTS THAT MAKE UP WEST GREENVILLE AND CHILDREN THROUGHOUT PITT COUNTY, AGE 0 - 5. 
8 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, OUTREACH AND VOLUNTEER COORDINATION, AND DATA COLLECTION FOR PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND INTER-AGENCY COLLABORATIONS OVER THE COURSE OF 5 YEARS.

MISSISSIPPI CENTER FOR RE-ENTRY'S MISSION IS TO ASSIST RETURNING CITIZENS AND THOSE CURRENTLY INCARCERATED TOWARDS SUCCESSFULLY RE-ENTERING SOCIETY THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF EVIDENCED-BASED RELEASE PLANS, ASSISTING WITH DEVELOPING SOCIAL SKILLS, AND OBTAINING NECESSARY AND NEEDED SERVICES IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY PRIORITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT GOALS ARE TO INCREASE THE PERCENTAGE OF EMPLOYERS WHO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL WORK TO UNEMPLOYED LOW-INCOME FORMERLY INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS; TO PROVIDE JOB TRAINING AND OTHER SKILL DEVELOPMENT SERVICES THROUGH THE RECRUITMENT OF COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 20 LOW-INCOME RECENTLY INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS WITH 5 PROJECT PARTICIPANTS BECOMING GAINFULLY EMPLOYED. THE THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL PROVIDE JOB TRAINING AND OTHER SKILL DEVELOPMENT SERVICES, COORDINATE PROJECT INFORMATIONAL MEETINGS, CREATE AND ASSESS A PRE- AND POST-TEST TO EVALUATE AN EMPLOYER'S CONSIDERATION FOR HIRING A LOW-INCOME FORMERLY INCARCERATED INDIVIDUAL AND COORDINATE A SECOND CHANCE JOB FAIR WITH THE IDENTIFIED EMPLOYERS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE OSEOLA MCCARTY YOUTH DEVELOPMENT CENTER (OMYDC) TRULY BELIEVE THAT THE "YOUTH OF TODAY ARE OUR TOMORROW'S FUTURE. "OUR LOCAL COMMUNITY OF FORREST AND PERRY COUNTIES IN OUR IMPOVERISHED, LOW INCOME COMMUNITY WILL BE THE BENEFICIARY OF THIS PROJECT.  THE OSEOLA MCCARTY YOUTH DEVELOPMENT CENTER (OMYDC) PLANS ARE TO SERVE YOUTH OF LOW INCOME FAMILIES WHICH INCLUDES: SINGLE PARENT FAMILIES, FAMILIES OF YOUTH WITH AN INCARCERATED PARENT, AS WELL AS YOUTH BEING RAISED BY GRANDPARENTS.  ONE HUNDRED LOW INCOME YOUTH ARE EXPECTED TO BENEFIT DURING THE FIRST PROGRAM YEAR. THIS PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) PRIORITY AREAS:  HEALTHY FUTURES, EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.  THIS VISTA PROJECT SEEKS 3 VISTA VOLUNTEERS TO HELP  BREAK THE CYCLE OF POVERTY BY DEVELOPING AND BUILDING SUSTAINABLE PROGRAMS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO OUR GOALS AND MISSION OF EMPOWERING YOUTH TO WIN IN EVERY AREA OF THEIR LIVES.  VISTA PROJECT SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING:  (1) MATERIAL DEVELOPMENT SUCH AS AN ONLINE MOBY MAX TUTORING PROGRAM WHICH IS DESIGNED TO ENHANCE READING COMPREHENSION SKILLS, LITERACY AND MATH SKILLS FOR 3RD TO 8TH GRADE STUDENTS ATTENDING COMMUNITY LOW PERFORMING SCHOOLS, (2) COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT  ACTIVITIES INCLUDES INITIATING EFFORTS AND OUTREACH WITH OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO EDUCATE AND PROMOTE HEALTHY EATING BEHAVIORS WHILE USING OUR COMMUNITY GARDEN AS AN EDUCATION TOOL, AND (3) PROMOTE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES BY DEVELOPING TRAINING MATERIALS AND INSTRUCTIONAL MANUALS ON SOFT SKILLS EDUCATION THAT PROVIDE EMPLOYABILITY SKILLS FOR LOW INCOME HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS.  THE PROJECTED LENGTH OF THIS VISTA PROJECT IS FOR UP TO THREE (3) YEARS.

THE JUANITA SIMS DOTY FOUNDATION?S (JSDF) PURPOSE IS TO IGNITE A SPIRIT OF SERVICE AND COLLABORATION, AS WELL AS TO PROMOTE COALITION BUILDING AMONG INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPACT MORE INDIVIDUALS IN LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES BY EXPANDING JSDF?S MENTORING INITIATIVES BY PARTNERING WITH OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO; INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN WE SERVE, ENHANCE AND EMPOWER THE CHILDREN?S VILLAGES MADE UP OF PARENTS, FAMILIES, AND OTHER COMMUNITY MEMBERS. WE EXPECT 250-350 CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES AND VILLAGES TO BENEFIT BY THE VIP PROJECT AND VIP PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS.  FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING FUNDRAISING PLANS, RAISING FUNDS, STRATEGIC PLANNING FOR VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT/MANAGEMENT, AND RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

SPRINGBOARD TO OPPORTUNITIES' MISSION IS TO CONNECT FAMILIES LIVING IN AFFORDABLE HOUSING WITH RESOURCES AND PROGRAMS THAT HELP THEM ADVANCE THEMSELVES IN SCHOOL, WORK, AND LIFE. WE DO THIS BY WORKING DIRECTLY WITH FAMILIES, AS WELL AS BY ESTABLISHING STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS THAT HELP RESIDENTS ACHIEVE THEIR GOALS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD RELATIONSHIPS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY TO EXPAND SPRINGBOARD'S REACH AND EFFECTIVENESS, COORDINATE AND RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS FOR EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING, AND DEVELOP PROGRAMMING THAT SUPPORTS THE GOALS OF SPRINGBOARD'S SPRINGBOARD TO LEARNING STRATEGY AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 1,000 RESIDENTS LIVING IN LOW-INCOME HOUSING. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS EVALUATING THE CURRENT EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING TAKING PLACE, IDENTIFYING NEEDS THAT ARE NOT CURRENTLY BEING MET, DEVELOPING PROGRAMMING AND MATERIALS TO FILL THOSE GAPS, AND CREATING TRUST AND RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE COMMUNITY TO BEGIN RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS AND COORDINATING THESE PROGRAMS OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT.

LOUISVILLE METRO GOVERNMENT'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE A PLATFORM FOR EVERYONE TO ACHIEVE THEIR HUMAN POTENTIAL. OUR PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. OUR VISTA PROJECTS WILL SEEK TO 1) INCREASE IN-HOME INTERNET CONNECTION AMONG HUD-ASSISTED HOUSING RESIDENTS AND LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS, 2) EXPAND THE COMPUTER DONATION AND REFURBISHMENT PROGRAM IN ORDER TO PROVIDE FREE LAPTOP AND DESKTOP COMPUTERS, AND 3) ORGANIZE FREE DIGITAL SKILLS TRAININGS FOR PUBLIC HOUSING AND OTHER UNDERSERVED RESIDENTS IN OUR CITY. WE EXPECT OUR PROGRAM TO BENEFIT OVER 5,000 PEOPLE IN ITS FIRST YEAR WITH THE HELP OF FOUR VISTA MEMBERS AND REACH NEARLY 15,000 PEOPLE DURING THE LENGTH OF THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT. VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CONNECTING UNDERSERVED FAMILIES TO LOW-COST INTERNET PROGRAMS, REFURBISHING AND DISTRIBUTING DONATED COMPUTERS, AND ORGANIZING DIGITAL TRAININGS OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT.

THE DEKALB COUNTY BOARD OF HEALTH?S (BOARD OF HEALTH) MISSION IS TO PROTECT, PROMOTE, AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF THOSE WHO WORK, LIVE, AND PLAY IN DEKALB COUNTY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL ASSIST IN PROMOTING COMMUNITY COLLABORATION AND BUILDING CAPACITY THROUGH OUR NUTRITION/FOOD SYSTEMS, COMMUNITY-CLINICAL LINKAGES, AND INJURY PREVENTION INTERVENTIONS.  WE EXPECT TO IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES IN AFRICAN-AMERICAN COMMUNITIES IN DEKALB COUNTY CENSUS TRACTS WITH AT LEAST 20% OF THE RESIDENTS LIVING BELOW 100% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL.  THESE TRACTS ARE HOME TO 30% OF THE COUNTY?S POPULATION. 

FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: 
(1)	IDENTIFYING AND SECURING FUNDING TO IMPLEMENT THE HEALTH BUCKS NUTRITION INCENTIVE PROGRAM.
(2)	DEVELOPING A COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKER PROGRAM TO SUPPORT ESTABLISHING PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A CLOSED-LOOP REFERRAL NETWORK THAT LINKS THE CLIENTS TO HEALTH-FOCUSED AND OTHER RELATED SUPPORT SERVICES.  
(3)	CONTINUING TO SUPPORT THE PREVIOUS INJURY PREVENTION INITIATIVES, INCLUDING THE PEDESTRIAN AND CAR SEAT SAFETY PROJECTS, YOUTH VIOLENCE PREVENTION INITIATIVE, AND MENTAL HEALTH PROJECTS.  
THE VISTA MEMBERS? RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING ASSIGNMENT RELATED ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT (I.E., FOLLOW-UP PHONE CALLS AND EMAILS RELATED TO THE PROJECT AND STRENGTHENING THE CAPACITY TO INCREASE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE PERFORMED OVER THREE YEARS.

COMMUNITY ACTION FOR IMPROVEMENT (CAFI)'S MISSION IS TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES BY PROVIDING SERVICES AND RESOURCES THAT WILL FACILITATE THE BUILDING OF SELF-ESTEEM AND SELF-SUFFICIENCY THROUGH THE ACTIVE INVOLVEMENT OF THE TOTAL COMMUNITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. CAFI'S VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO USE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS TO BUILD CAPACITY TO ADDRESS POVERTY AND ACCESS TO RESOURCES. CAFI'S PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE AREA'S VULNERABLE, LOW-INCOME, RURAL POPULATIONS INCLUDING PEOPLE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS, VETERANS, YOUTH, AND FAMILIES, ENABLING CAFI TO SERVE AN ESTIMATED 5,000 BENEFICIARIES. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS HELPING TO RECRUIT AND MANAGE VOLUNTEERS, CONDUCTING OUTREACH ACTIVITIES AND FORGING NEW PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS AND BUSINESSES, AND BUILDING CAFI'S CAPACITY TO RAISE FUNDS FROM DIVERSE SOURCES. THE PROJECT PERIOD WILL LAST FOR ONE SERVICE YEAR.

THE WINDER HOUSING AUTHORITY'S MISSION IS TO PROMOTE ADEQUATE AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND AN ENHANCED LIVING ENVIRONMENT FOR OUR COMMUNITY. THE WIMBERLY CENTER VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD THE ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY OF THE ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE WIMBERLY CENTER FOR COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AND THE CENTER AS A WHOLE AS WELL AS LEADING TOWARD IMPROVED OUTCOMES FOR THESE ORGANIZATIONS BENEFICIARIES REGARDING REDUCED POVERTY AND IMPROVED NUTRITIONAL AND HEALTH OUTCOMES, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE APPROXIMATELY 8,000 LOW AND MIDDLE-INCOME CLIENTS SERVED AT THE WIMBERLY CENTER FOR COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ANNUALLY. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES RELATED TO FUNDRAISING, MARKETING, VOLUNTEER PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, GRANT ATTAINMENT, DATA ANALYSIS AND PROGRAM EVALUATION, AS WELL AS CAPACITY BUILDING TRAINING OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.
THE WINDER HOUSING AUTHORITY IS LOCATED WITHIN THE WIMBERLY CENTER FOR COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT--THE PROJECT SITE FOR THE WIMBERLY CENTER VISTA PROJECT. THE WIMBERLY CENTER FOR COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT  (WCCD) WAS ESTABLISHED IN THE ABANDONED WINDER BARROW MIDDLE SCHOOL, IN THE GLENWOOD NEIGHBORHOOD, AS A RESULT OF BOTH THE 2013 CITY OF WINDER'S URBAN REDEVELOPMENT PLAN AND EFFORTS BY THE WINDER HOUSING AUTHORITY. THE WCCD NOW HOUSES ELEVEN NON-PROFITS UNDER A MODEL THAT ALLOWS FOR RENT FREE OFFICE SPACE AND THE SHARING OF UTILITY AND OTHER OVERHEAD COSTS. THE WCCD HAS BECOME A CATALYST FOR CHANGE IN THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY AND A HUB FOR SERVICES SUPPORTING ANTI-POVERTY OUTCOMES.

THE MISSION OF THE CENTER FOR BLACK WOMEN'S WELLNESS (CBWW) IS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF UNDERSERVED BLACK WOMEN AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE PROPOSED AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT--WELLNESS CAPACITY BUILDERS--ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES: ACCESS TO CARE.  THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO: 1) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEER HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS AND LAY VOLUNTEERS RECRUITED AND RETAINED TO PROVIDE FREE MEDICAL CARE TO THE UNINSURED AND OTHER SUPPORT; 2) ENHANCE DONOR MANAGEMENT EFFORTS AND INCREASE RESOURCES TO SUPPORT CORE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES AIMED AT ADDRESSING THE IMPACTS OF POVERTY; AND 3) COORDINATE NEW PARTNERSHIPS TO FACILITATE ADDITIONAL PROGRAMS AND SERVICES FOR LOW INCOME WOMEN AND FAMILIES. THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 3,000 INDIVIDUALS. A TOTAL OF THREE (3) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT OVER A TWO-YEAR PERIOD BY EXECUTING ACTIVITIES TO INCLUDE: ASSIST IN RAISING VISIBILITY OF ORGANIZATION, HELP CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ORGANIZE MEETINGS, HELP DEVELOP PRESENTATIONS, IDENTIFY POTENTIAL NEW PARTNERS AND PLAN INFORMATIONAL MEETINGS, HELP DEVELOP PRESENTATIONS, HELP DEVELOP PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENTS, TRACK DONORS AND DONATIONS, ENHANCE COMMUNICATIONS WITH DONORS, ASSIST WITH CULTIVATION OF POTENTIAL DONORS, DRAFT AND SUBMIT PROPOSALS, PLAN ONGOING FUNDRAISING, REVAMP VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT MATERIALS, MODIFY MATERIALS TO STRENGTHEN PROGRAMMING, ASSESS VOLUNTEER NEEDS, CREATE VOLUNTEER JOB DESCRIPTIONS, DEVELOP VOLUNTEER ORIENTATION AND TRAINING PROCESS, CONDUCT VOLUNTEER RETENTION ACTIVITIES, AND TRAIN STAFF TO MANAGE VOLUNTEER PLAN.

THE GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY AFFAIRS' MISSION IS TO HELP BUILD STRONG, VIBRANT COMMUNITIES.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE UPON AND EXPAND THE GEORGIA BALANCE OF STATE CONTINUUM OF CARE COORDINATED ENTRY SYSTEM FOR THOSE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 800 INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS.  ONE VISTA LEADER AND 18 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS STRATEGIC PLANNING, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, FUND DEVELOPMENT, DATA COLLECTION, AND DATA EVALUATION OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

HISPANIC FEDERATION'S MISSION TO SUPPORT HISPANIC FAMILIES AND STRENGTHEN LATINO INSTITUTIONS IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION, HEALTH, ECONOMIC EMPOWERMENT, AMONG OTHERS, WILL CONTINUE TO ADVANCE THROUGH THE WORK OF THE THREE VISTAS REQUESTED. THEY WILL HAVE A DIRECT IMPACT ON THE GREATER ORLANDO LOW- AND MEDIUM-INCOME LATINO POPULATIONS THROUGH THE HISPANIC OUTREACH AND EDUCATIONAL PROJECT OF CENTRAL FLORIDA, WHICH PROMOTES HEALTHIER LIFESTYLES, TEACH PARENTS HOW TO GUIDE THEIR CHILDREN TOWARDS COLLEGE EDUCATION AND BUILD THE CAPACITY OF NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE THEIR REACH AND SCOPE OF SERVICES. OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR, VISTAS WILL DEVELOP AND CREATE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS, SOCIAL MEDIA AND PROGRAM-RELATED CONTENT AND RESOURCES, TRAIN INSTRUCTORS, COORDINATE LOGISTICS, COLLECT INFORMATION ON SPECIFIC NEEDS AND OPPORTUNITIES, HELP IMPROVE THE PROGRAM'S SUCCESS AND ESTABLISH THE FOUNDATIONS FOR AN ONGOING OUTREACH PROGRAM. THIS PROJECT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED WITHIN A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR TO ESTABLISH THE STRUCTURE AND FOUNDATION FOR AN ON-GOING OUTREACH PROGRAM.

LEARN TO READ'S MISSION IS TO INCREASE LITERACY AWARENESS AND IMPROVE ADULT LITERACY IN JACKSONVILLE (FL) THROUGH A VOLUNTEER-BASED PROGRAM. THIS PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOCUS AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE PROJECT SEEKS TO EXPAND THE SCALE AND REACH OF LEARN TO READ PROGRAMMING, REDUCING POVERTY AND INCREASING SELF-SUFFICIENCY BY IMPROVING LITERACY SKILLS AMONG LOW-INCOME ADULTS IN DUVAL COUNTY. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT AT LEAST 525 ECONOMICALLY AND EDUCATIONALLY DISADVANTAGED ADULTS; AT LEAST 200 PARTICIPANTS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED JOB READINESS. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PROMOTING LITERACY SERVICES, RECRUITING PARTICIPANTS, RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS, AND LEVERAGING ADDITIONAL CASH AND IN-KIND RESOURCES OVER A 14 MONTH PERIOD.

FEEDING FLORIDA?S MISSION IS TO END HUNGER. THE ASSOCIATION HELPS TO COORDINATE THE EFFORTS OF MEMBER FOOD BANKS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF FLORIDA, ENABLING THEM TO BETTER PROVIDE A HEALTHY ADEQUATE FOOD SUPPLY FOR PEOPLE IN NEED.  FEEDING FLORIDA VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH CNCS? HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXTEND COMMUNITY AND STATEWIDE OUTREACH EFFORTS, CREATE COLLABORATIVE SYSTEMS, AND FORGE BENEFICIAL PARTNERSHIPS THAT ARE INSTRUMENTAL IN ENDING HUNGER. IT IS ESTIMATED AT LEAST 20 ORGANIZATIONS OR COMMUNITIES WILL BE IMPACTED AS A PART OF THIS WORK. 3 VISTA MEMBERS PER YEAR WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY OUTREACH, CREATING FRAMEWORK FOR THE ORGANIZATION, AND MANAGING SHORT TERM PROJECTS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO A MORE EFFICIENT FOOD SYSTEM THROUGHOUT THE PROJECTS 3 YEAR SPAN.

PEACEMAKER FAMILY CENTER'S MISSION IS TO SERVE AND MENTOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES AS THEY TRANSITION FROM INSTABILITY TO SELF-SUFFICIENCY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS EDUCATION AND VETERANS & MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO REDUCE POVERTY AMONG TWO TARGET POPULATIONS: VETERANS AND YOUTH AND TO BENEFIT ONE THOUSAND (1,000) MIAMI-DADE COUNTY RESIDENTS. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING AND MANAGING VOLUNTEERS, LEVERAGING CASH AND IN-KIND RESOURCES, AS WELL AS, EXPANDING AND STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS/NETWORKS OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

UNITED WAY OF LAKE & SUMTER COUNTY'S MISSION IS "TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND BUILD A STRONGER COMMUNITY BY LEVERAGING RESOURCES AND UNITING COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO IMPACT EDUCATION, INCOME AND HEALTH." THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CAPACITY BUILDING FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE EFFECTIVENESS IN MARKETING, VOLUNTEERING, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, AND THE FINANCIAL STABILITY OF LOCAL LOW INCOME FAMILIES.  THIS PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 211,000LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS. 4 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING DATABASES, MATERIALS, AND PROCESSES TO STRENGTHEN OUR MARKETING, VOLUNTEERING, AND SERVICES FOR FAMILIES IN NEED OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

TREASURE COAST FOOD BANK?S MISSION IS TO IS TO ALLEVIATE HUNGER BY OBTAINING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD AND OTHER ESSENTIALS IN INDIAN RIVER, MARTIN, ST. LUCIE, AND OKEECHOBEE COUNTIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO 1) INITIATE GREATER FOOD SECURITY AND SOCIAL MOBILITY FOR WORKING FAMILIES BY CREATING A MORE COHESIVE, AND EMPOWERING NETWORK OF SUPPORT; AND 2) FORGE A GREATER SENSE OF COMMUNITY-WIDE EMPATHY TOWARDS THE ROOT CAUSES OF FOOD-INSECURITY AND POVERTY, TO END HUNGER ONCE AND FOR ALL,  AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE MORE THAN 91,000 FOOD INSECURE, AND LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS STRUGGLING WITH HUNGER ACROSS THE TREASURE COAST. THREE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS 1) ASSET MAPPING, TO RESEARCH AND IDENTIFY ALL EXISTING COMMUNITY RESOURCES/PARTNERS/MODELS THAT CAN COMPRISE THE ENDING HUNGER NETWORK; 2) IDENTIFY GAPS IN SERVICES VERSUS CLIENT NEED; 3) FORMALIZE PARTNERSHIPS WITH AGENCIES/PROGRAMS/PARTNERS/ETC.;4) ESTABLISH AND ORGANIZE ADVISORY COUNCILS OF RESOURCE-LIMITED FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS IN EACH OF THE FOUR COUNTIES; AND 5) DEVELOP AN EVALUATIVE TOOL TO MEASURE SOCIAL MOBILITY AND RESOURCE EFFECTIVENESS OVER THE COURSE OF TWO YEARS.

THE GULF COAST VETERANS ADVOCACY COUNCIL, HEREAFTER TO BE REFERRED TO AS GCVAC, HAS SERVED VETERANS ALONG THE GULF COAST OF FLORIDA, ALABAMA, AND MISSISSIPPI SINCE MARCH OF 2010. THE MISSION OF THE GULF COAST VETERANS ADVOCACY COUNCIL, INC. IS TO BE A VOICE FOR ALL VETERANS CONCERNING MENTAL AND PHYSICAL HEALTH CARE, TO ADVOCATE NEEDED CHANGES IN THE VETERAN HEALTH CARE SYSTEM, AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES. 

THE COUNCIL IS A NON-PROFIT 501(C) 3 ORGANIZATION WHOSE OBJECTIVE IS TO SERVE THOSE WHO HAVE SERVED THIS COUNTRY. IN COLLABORATION WITH THE GULF COAST VETERAN HEALTH CARE SYSTEM (GULF COAST VA), ELECTED FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS, FAMILY MEMBERS, COMMUNITY SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS, AND THE VETERANS THEMSELVES, WE WILL FACILITATE PROGRAMS TO END HOMELESSNESS AMONG VETERANS; SEE THAT EVERY VETERAN RECEIVES THE MENTAL AND PHYSICAL CARE THEY DESERVE; IMPLEMENT PROGRAMS TO HELP VETERANS REINTEGRATE BACK INTO THE COMMUNITY; DEVELOP PROGRAMS FOR WOMEN VETERANS WITH SERVICES DIRECTED TOWARDS MEETING THEIR NEEDS; ESTABLISH AN INTERVENTION PROGRAM TO PREVENT INCARCERATION OF VETERANS; HELP OUR CURRENTLY RETURNING VETERANS BECOME PART OF THE VETERAN HEALTH CARE SYSTEM; DEVELOP PROGRAMS FOR DISABLED VETERANS; AND HELP ALL VETERANS OBTAIN BENEFITS, EDUCATION AND EMPLOYMENT.

THE COUNCIL'S PHYSICAL GEOGRAPHIC AREA COVERS THE FOLLOWING COUNTIES IN FLORIDA: ESCAMBIA, SANTA ROSA, OKALOOSA, WALTON, HOLMES, WASHINGTON, AND BAY.  IN ALABAMA: MOBILE, BALDWIN, WASHINGTON, AND ESCAMBIA, AND IN MISSISSIPPI: WASHINGTON, JACKSON, HARRISON, HANCOCK, PEARL RIVER, STONE RIVER, GEORGE, AND GREENE, HOWEVER, THE COUNCIL FEELS THAT BY MAKING USE OF THE INTERNET, WE WILL BE ABLE TO TOUCH THE LIVES OF VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES WHEREVER THEY MAY BE.

GCVAC ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE LOCATED 1603 NORTH 58TH AVE.IN PENSACOLA FL IS COMPRISED OF ALL VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST WITH OUR PROGRAMS, AND SERVICES WE PROVIDE THROUGHOUT THREE (3) STATES WE HAVE OUR LEADERSHIP IN EACH STATE WITH VESTED MEMBERS TO EXPEDITE ALL ASPECT OF FOLLOW-UP TO INSURE THERE IS NO CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND KEEP ALL OUR COMPLIANT MANDATE PROPERLY EXPEDITED. WE HAVE A DIRECTOR, STATE REPRESENTATIVE, ASSOCIATE STATE REPRESENTATIVE, AND COMMITTEE GROUP LEADERS TO ASSIST THE LEADERSHIP MEMBERS.

COMMUNITY PARTNERS OF SOUTH FLORIDA (CPSFL) IS CHANGING GENERATIONS BY CHANGING THE ODDS FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES LIVING IN POVERTY IN PALM BEACH COUNTY.  THE PROPOSED CPSFL AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD SOCIAL CAPITAL AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT FROM RESIDENTS BUILDING THEIR CAPACITY AND ENTERING ROLES OF LEADERSHIP TO CREATE IMPACTFUL CHANGE.  TEN  VISTAS WITH ONE LEAD WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT, EXPANSION OF SERVICES WITHIN UNDER-SERVED AND DISADVANTAGED NEIGHBORHOODS, AND CREATING LEADERSHIP OPPORTUNITIES, OVER THE COURSE OF THREE TO FOUR YEARS.  THIS YEARS' VISTA PROJECTS ALIGN WITH THE FY 21 PROGRAM PRIORITIES OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTHY FUTURES.  NINE SITES ARE FOCUSED ON INCREASING ACCESS FOR A HEALTHIER FUTURE AND THE OTHER SITE IS FOCUSED ON INCREASING ACCESS TO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES.   ALL SITES ARE DIVING DEEPER TO MOBILIZE ON STRATEGIES THAT IMPACT THE ROOT CAUSE OF POVERTY, THE LACK OF RACIAL EQUITY.  THE INCLUSION OF A ORGANIZING AGAINST RACISM SUPPORT MEMBER PROVIDES OUR COUNTY THE MISSING CAPACITY NEEDED TO CONTINUE TO MOBILIZE COUNTY-BASED STRATEGIES TO PROMOTE EQUITY. THERE ARE EIGHT SITES COMPLETING THEIR THREE-YEAR COMMITMENT, ONE NEW SITE ENTERING A THREE-YEAR COMMITMENT, AND ONE SITE REQUESTING A SINGLE-YEAR OPPORTUNITY TO SEED SUSTAINABLE STRATEGIES.
THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE 2022-23 VISTA SUPPORT PROGRAM GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET.

THE BLACK BELT COMMUNITY FOUNDATION (BBCF) , FOUNDED IN 2003, IS A 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION. WE REPRESENT TWELVE COUNTIES IN ALABAMA'S POOREST REGION: BULLOCK, CHOCTAW, DALLAS, GREENE, HALE, LOWNDES, MACON, MARENGO, PERRY, PICKENS, SUMTER, AND WILCOX. THESE COUNTIES RANK, ACCORDING THE SMALL AREA INCOME AND POVERTY ESTIMATES, AS HAVING SOME OF THE HIGHEST RATES OF POVERTY FOR YOUTH BETWEEN THE AGES OF 5-17, AND SOME OF THE LOWEST MEDIAN HOUSEHOLD INCOMES ACROSS THE AMERICAN SOUTH. 

ACCORDING TO STUDY RESULTS PUBLISHED IN 2014, CHILDREN LIVING IN THE BLACK BELT REGION HAVE A POVERTY RATE THAT EXCEEDS THE STATE POVERTY LEVEL BY 143% AND WAS 92% HIGHER THAN THE ENTIRE US AVERAGE. ONGOING ISSUES OF HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT RATES, SUBSTANDARD EDUCATIONAL SYSTEMS, POOR HEALTH CARE ACCESS, ENVIRONMENTAL RACISM, AND RURAL FLIGHT, FEED A LEGACY OF GENERATIONAL POVERTY THAT IS OUR MISSION TO ERADICATE.

WE CHOOSE TO COMBAT THE AFOREMENTIONED NEED IN A VARIETY OF INITIATIVES. WE PROVIDE COMMUNITY AND/OR ARTS PROGRAM GRANTS TO AN AVERAGE OF 100 ORGANIZATIONS EACH YEAR. WE ALSO OFFER A HEAD START PROGRAM IN MULTIPLE COUNTIES. A GRANT FROM THE KELLOGG FOUNDATION FUNDS WORK IN TRUTH RACIAL HEALING AND TRANSFORMATION, AND OUR WORK TO AMPLIFY THE VOICES OF SOUTHERN BLACK GIRLS AND WOMEN IS FUNDED THROUGH THE NOVO FOUNDATION.WE OFFER WORKSHOPS IN LEADERSHIP TRAINING, ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING AND COMMUNITY COLLABORATION. FINALLY, WE ACTIVELY WORK AS A PHILANTHROPIC PARTNER WITH OUR COMMUNITY PARTICIPANTS. 

BBCF IS REQUESTING VISTA'S ASSISTANCE IN BUILDING OUR OWN CAPACITY AND IN REGIONAL ASSET MAPPING.

ENRICH STUDENT ACADEMIC LEARNING, PROMOTE CIVIC ENGAGEMENT AND TO STRENGTHEN AND SUPPORT OUR LOCAL
AND GLOBAL COMMUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS PRIMARILY WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA AND HEALTHY FUTURES.
THE VISTA PROJECT WILL DEVELOP PROJECTS DESIGNED TO INCREASE UAB STUDENT AND FACULTY INVOLVEMENT IN
EDUCATION, HEALTH, AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY INITIATIVES IN COLLABORATION WITH COMMUNITY-BASED
ORGANIZATIONS IN JEFFERSON, WALKER PERRY, WILCOX COUNTIES. THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT MORE THAN 2,000
INDIVIDUALS  PRIMARILY LOW-INCOME K-12 STUDENTS. BASED ON THE SUCCESS AND CONTINUED EXPANSION OF UAB'S AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM,SINCE 2014, WE ARE REQUESTING A PROGRAM GRANT OF $500,000 TO PLACE 30 VISTAS IN THE BIRMINGHAM METROPOLITAN AREA AND THE BLACK BELT REGION LOCATED IN THE SOUTHERN REGION OF ALABAMA. THESE VISTAS WILL WORK TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME CHILDREN AND ADULTS AND THEIR COMMUNITIES BY WORKING WITH NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION, FOOD SECURITY, AND OPIOD PREVENTION EDUCATION

COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY OF SOUTH ALABAMA'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES WHICH PROMOTE AND CREATE SELF-SUFFICIENCY IN INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA OF CNCS.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT PLAN THAT PROVIDE ADDITIONAL REVENUE STREAMS WITH A GOAL OF 10% OF CAASA'S OPERATING BUDGET COMING FROM NON-FEDERAL FUNDING BY JUNE 30, 2022.  THIS WILL IMPROVE THE LONG TERM SUSTAINABILITY OF CAASA, BUT WILL ALSO BENEFIT AT LEAST 10 OF OUR PARTNER REFERRAL ORGANIZATIONS IN OUR SERVICE AREA THROUGH THE INCREASE CAPACITY GAINED THROUGH THIS PROJECT.  CAASA REQUESTS FIVE (5) VISTA MEMBERS WHO WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES RELATED TO RESEARCHING, DESIGNING AND IMPLEMENTING A COMMUNICATIONS AND MARKETING PLAN AS WELL AS A COMPLEMENTARY FUNDRAISING PLAN.

THE WYOMING BUSINESS COUNCIL MISSION IS TO INCREASE WYOMING'S PROSPERITY, AND WITHIN THE WYOMING BUSINESS COUNCIL IS THE COMMUNITY DEVELOP DEPARTMENT AND THE WYOMING MAIN STREET PROJECT, IN WHICH THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH ALL FOUR OF THE FOCUS AREAS:  BY STRENGTHENING A COMMUNITY'S CAPACITY BUILDING AND FINDING SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS THROUGH COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT, IT WILL TRANSLATE INTO AN ANTI-POVERTY FOCUS. OUR GOAL IS TO HELP COMMUNITIES GAIN THE KNOWLEDGE AND SUSTAINABILITY TO INCREASE THEIR COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS AND BECOME STRONG ENOUGH THEY ARE LEADERS IN RURAL COMMUNITIES.  FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WOULD POTENTIALLY AFFECT THE ENTIRE POPULATION OF WYOMING.  THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO OUR GOALS BY HELPING BUILD THE KNOWLEDGE AND CAPACITY OF THESE FOUR COMMUNITIES IN THE AREAS OF BOARD SUSTAINABILITY, ORGANIZATIONAL SUSTAINABILITY AND FUNDRAISING.  THE MEMBERS WILL ALSO HELP THE STATEWIDE HOUSING TOOLKIT ALIGN THEIR MESSAGING TO SHOW THE IMPORTANCE OF HOUSING TO EVERYONE.  THE MEMBERS WILL HELP PRODUCE VALUABLE TOOLS FOR COMMUNITIES TO USE TO HELP THEMSELVES SOLVE THEIR HOUSING CHALLENGES, AND WILL INITIALLY WORK WITH TWO VERY RURAL FRONTIER COMMUNITIES TO HELP DEVELOP PROCESSES FOR IMPLEMENTATION. WE ANTICIPATE THE VISTA MEMBERS CAN COMPLETE THIS WORK WITHIN ONE YEAR, INCLUDING BUILDING THE PROGRAMS SO COMMUNITIES CAN CONTINUE THIS WORK ONCE THE YEAR IS COMPLETE.

HOPEWORKS SOCIAL ENTERPRISES MISSION IS TO HELP LOW-INCOME, SNOHOMISH COUNTY RESIDENTS, ACHIEVE SELF-SUFFICIENCY THROUGH SOCIAL ENTERPRISES THAT PROVIDE TRAINING AND PATHWAYS TO LIVING-WAGE JOBS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE THE ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY OF THE PROJECT SITES WHILE ALSO HELPING PEOPLE IN POVERTY RECEIVE JOB TRAINING, FINANCIAL LITERACY, ACCESS TO CARE THROUGH OUTREACH AND REFERRALS, AND DEVELOP HOUSING AND A HEALTHY, EQUITABLE COMMUNITY. THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT LOW INCOME, FORMERLY HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES, INCLUDING THOSE AFFLICTED WITH OPIOID ADDICTION. EIGHT VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSING AND TRANSPORTATION PLANS, EMPLOYMENT PREPARATION AND RETENTION, FREE TAX PREPARATION FOR FAMILIES, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, AND REFERRAL AND OUTREACH SYSTEMS.

CANYON CREEK SERVICES' MISSION IS, "JOINING COMMUNITY FORCES TO OVERCOME DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE THROUGH PREVENTION AND COMPREHENSIVE SERVICES." THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO HELP DEVELOP AND STRENGTHEN THE NEWLY CREATED HOUSING PROGRAM AND STRENGTHEN AND EXPAND THE DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT AT LEAST 65 CLIENTS EACH YEAR WITH HOUSING NEEDS. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING A HOUSING SKILLS COURSE, CREATING A SURVEY FOR HOUSING CLIENTS, DEVELOPING A GRANT SEARCH AND APPLICATION PROCESS, FINDING GRANTS, AND IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL DONORS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

SHELTER THE HOMELESS' MISSION IS TOGETHER EVERYONE ACHIEVES MORE - WITH THE HELP OF COMMITTED INDIVIDUALS, WE CAN GATHER THE RESOURCES NECESSARY TO DESIGN THE MOST EFFECTIVE DATA AND EVIDENCE-BASED SOLUTIONS TO PREVENT AND END HOMELESSNESS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ANTI-POVERTY FOCUS AREA. THE PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES TO ACCESS TO BROADBAND, DEVICES AND DIGITAL LITERACY TRAINING TO ADDRESS URGENT NEEDS, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 700 INDIVIDUALS ON A DAILY BASIS. 3 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY OUTREACH, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS.

THE UTAH CONSERVATION CORPS, BASED OUT OF THE UTAH STATE UNIVERSITY CENTER FOR COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, HAS A MISSION IS TO DEVELOP THE CONSERVATION LEADERS OF TOMORROW. THE PROPOSED UTAH FOOD CORPS VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO RECRUIT AND/OR MANAGE 385 VOLUNTEERS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 5,004 STUDENTS THAT WILL RECEIVE SUPPORT, EDUCATION, AND/OR REFERRALS FOR HUNGER. THE EIGHT VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT AND SITE CAPACITY BUILDING OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT THREE YEARS.

AT SALT LAKE COUNTY HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT (HCD) WE SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO BE HEALTHY, LIVE IN HEALTHY PLACES, AND HAVE EXPANDED OPPORTUNITIES BY RESPONSIBLY AND RESPONSIVELY DEPLOYING RESOURCES TO ORGANIZATIONS IN SALT LAKE COUNTY.  HCD HAS BEEN IN THE BUSINESS OF SERVING AND IMPACTING THE LIVES OF PEOPLE WHO ARE EXPERIENCING POVERTY FOR OVER 35 YEARS.  THE VISTA PROJECT WHICH IS PROPOSED BY SALT LAKE COUNTY IS THE "SYSTEM NAVIGATOR PILOT PROGRAM" WHICH NATURALLY ALIGNS WITH BOTH OF THE CNCS FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.  OF THE 10,000+ LOW-INCOME AND VERY-LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS THAT ARE SERVED ANNUALLY BY THE PROGRAMS WHICH ARE FUNDED BY HCD, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT AT LEAST 3% OF THE BENEFICIARIES (300 PEOPLE) WILL TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE OPPORTUNITY TO "OWN THEIR OWN STORY" AND BEGIN PARTICIPATING IN THE SYSTEM NAVIGATOR PILOT PROGRAM BY THE END OF 2020.  THE NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE SIGNIFICANTLY AS THE PROGRAM IS TAKEN TO SCALE IN 2021.  THEIR STORIES WILL BE WRITTEN IN PARTNERSHIP WITH SERVICE PROVIDERS AS MORE EFFECTIVE CASE MANAGEMENT IS FACILITATED.  AS THEIR JOURNEYS TOWARDS SELF-RELIANCE ARE MAPPED, DATA WILL BE CONTRIBUTED TO THE SYSTEM NAVIGATOR PROGRAM, AND PERFORMANCE INDICATORS WILL BE TRACKED THAT WILL MEASURE THEIR INDIVIDUAL PROGRESS TOWARDS THE SALT LAKE COUNTY OUTCOMES OF HEALTHY PEOPLE -- STABILIZATION, AND EXPANDED OPPORTUNITY -- ECONOMIC MOBILITY.  THE AVAILABILITY OF MEANINGFUL DATA ABOUT THE EFFECTIVENESS OF INTERVENTIONS WILL GENERATE THE INFORMATION NEEDED FOR DATA DRIVEN DECISION MAKING FOR THE COUNTY.  THE SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SYSTEM NAVIGATOR PILOT WILL BE MADE POSSIBLE BY EFFORTS OF THE TWO VISTA MEMBERS WHO WILL BE PART OF THE CORE TEAM THAT CONDUCTS THE GROUNDWORK AND LAYS THE FOUNDATION FOR THE SYSTEM, AS WELL AS IMPLEMENTS, OPERATIONALIZES AND EVALUATES IT DURING THE CRITICAL FIRST THREE YEARS OF DEVELOPMENT.

CAMPUS COMPACT OF OREGON'S MISSION IS TO CONVENE AND SUPPORT THE WORK OF EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS INDIVIDUALLY AND COLLECTIVELY TO IMPROVE THEIR PRACTICE AROUND INSTITUTIONAL EQUITY, COLLABORATIVE LEARNING, AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO A RACIALLY DIVERSE AND CHANGING OREGON. THE TIME STUDENTS SPEND IN SCHOOL IS BEST LEVERAGED WHEN THEIR LEARNING HAPPENS IN TANDEM WITH SERVICE ON THE MOST PRESSING ISSUES OF THEIR COMMUNITY.  THE CAMPUS COMPACT VISTA PROGRAM ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA AND SEEKS TO ENGAGE HIGHER EDUCATION STUDENTS, FACULTY, AND STAFF IN BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF HIGHER EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY NONPROFITS TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR LOW-INCOME K-12 AND COLLEGE STUDENTS. 16 FULL TIME VISTAS AND 2 VISTA LEADERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS, MENTORING AND TUTORING PROGRAMS THAT CONNECT OREGON COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES TO STRUGGLING K-12 SCHOOLS, AND LEVERAGING RESOURCES TO BUILD SUPPORTS FOR ADDRESSING EDUCATIONAL INEQUITIES AMONG LOW-INCOME STUDENTS AND STUDENTS OF COLOR.  GENERALLY, PROJECTS AT HOST SITES ARE EXPECTED TO BECOME SUSTAINABLE WITHIN THREE YEARS. WE ASSUME THE DEEP INSTITUTIONAL WORK TO ACHIEVE RACIAL JUSTICE AND EQUITY IN EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES WILL BE LONG-TERM, ONGOING GOALS FOR EACH HOST SITE.

MERCY CORPS NORTHWEST (MCNW) HAS COLLABORATED WITH CNCS FOR SIX YEARS TO CREATE, DELIVER, AND ADMINISTER A COHORT OF AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS, THE MERCY CORPS NORTHWEST VISTA TEAM (MCNW VT).  TOGETHER, WE HAVE HELPED BUILD THE ASSETS OF LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN OREGON BY PLACING AND SUPPORTING VISTA MEMBERS AT HOST NONPROFITS AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES THROUGHOUT OUR STATE. DURING THE 2019-2020 SERVICE YEARS MCNW VISTAS WILL CONTINUE TO FOCUS THEIR EFFORTS ON DEVELOPING OR EXPANDING PROGRAMS THAT DIRECTLY TARGET CYCLES OF INTER-GENERATIONAL POVERTY. OUR INITIATIVES FOCUS ON SUPPORTING PROGRAMS THAT ARE INNOVATIVE AND PROVIDE THE SPONSORING AGENCY AND HOST COMMUNITY WITH NEW SERVICES THAT SUPPORT LONG-TERM POVERTY ALLEVIATION. OUR PROGRAM FOCUS AREA WILL INCLUDE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY,  INCLUDING: ASSET DEVELOPMENT, HOUSING, HOMELESS SERVICES, JOB SKILLS TRAINING, AND MICROENTERPRISE. HEALTHY FUTURES PROJECTS, SPECIFICALLY FOOD SECURITY AND NUTRITION EDUCATION WILL ALSO HAVE A SECONDARY PRESENCE. MCNW AND OUR PARTNER AGENCIES HAVE FOUND OUR RELATIONSHIP WITH CNCS TO BE PRODUCTIVE AND REWARDING, AND WE HOPE TO CONTINUE COLLABORATING IN THE COMING YEAR TO ADDRESS POVERTY IN THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST. 

FOR FYS 2019-2020, MCNW IS REQUESTING 19 MSYS MEMBERS AND 1 VISTA LEADER TO SUPPORT AT LEAST 19 YEARLONG PLACEMENTS.
MERCY CORPS NORTHWEST IS THE DOMESTIC FIELD OFFICE FOR MERCY CORPS INTERNATIONAL A 501(C)3 NON-PROFIT,. THE ORGANIZATION WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1998 AS A PROGRAM OF MERCY CORPS, THE PORTLAND-BASED INTERNATIONAL RELIEF AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY AND IS ITS ONLY DOMESTIC PROGRAM.  IN 2002, MERCY CORPS NORTHWEST RECEIVED U.S. TREASURY DESIGNATION AS A COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT FINANCIAL INSTITUTION (CDFI).  .  MCNW EMPLOYS A STAFF OF 17, STUDENT INTERNS, UNIVERSITY PROJECT TEAMS AND MANY VOLUNTEERS.  STAFF LANGUAGE SKILLS INCLUDE SPANISH, ARABIC AND RUSSIAN.

MCNW ASSISTS LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS IN OREGON AND WASHINGTON BY INCREASING THEIR ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND COMMUNITY INTEGRATION THROUGH MICROENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT AND SELF-EMPLOYMENT.  OUR MISSION PROVIDES A DOMESTIC CONTEXT TO THE PARALLEL MISSION OF OUR PARENT ORGANIZATION, MERCY CORPS, WHICH IS TO ALLEVIATE SUFFERING, POVERTY AND OPPRESSION BY HELPING PEOPLE BUILD SECURE, PRODUCTIVE AND JUST COMMUNITIES.  WE VALUE THE POTENTIAL OF PEOPLE TO IMPROVE THEIR LIVES AND GAIN INDEPENDENCE, AND WE ENACT THESE VALUES BY ENGAGING WITH OUR CLIENTS AND COMMUNITIES AS FELLOW COLLABORATORS AND PARTNERS IN OUR EFFORTS. WE BUILD PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESS THE ROOTS OF PERSISTENT ECONOMIC HARDSHIP BY DESIGNING APPROACHES THAT ADDRESS POPULATIONS THAT HAVE BEEN TRAPPED IN POVERTY AND INTER-GENERATIONAL CYCLES OF ECONOMIC NEED.

THE MONTANA CAMPUS COMPACT'S MISSION IS TO ADVANCE THE PUBLIC PURPOSES OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES BY DEEPENING THEIR ABILITY TO IMPROVE COMMUNITY LIFE AND TO EDUCATE STUDENTS FOR CIVIC AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY. OVER OUR TWENTY SIX YEAR ORGANIZATION HISTORY THE COLLEGES COMPRISING MONTANA CAMPUS COMPACT HAVE SUCCESSFULLY PARTNERED WITH COMMUNITIES TO SUPPORT HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION AND POST-SECONDARY READINESS FOR LOW-INCOME MONTANANS, MOBILIZING TENS OF THOUSANDS OF COLLEGE STUDENTS INTO SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. VISTAS SERVING WITH THE CAMPUS COMPACT NETWORK HAVE PLAYED INCREDIBLY VITAL ROLES IN BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF CAMPUS-COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS THAT ADDRESS EDUCATIONAL EQUITY AND GENERATIONAL POVERTY. VISTAS SERVING IN MONTANA WITH THE MTCC NETWORK HAVE HELPED START AND SUSTAIN VETERANS CENTERS, LAUNCHED COLLEGE SUCCESS PROGRAMS, AND HELPED COMPREHENSIVELY IMPROVE THE SUPPORT SYSTEMS FOR LOW-INCOME, FIRST GENERATION AND MINORITY STUDENTS AS THEY WORK TO ACHIEVE THE AMERICAN DREAM. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT DIRECTLY ALIGNS WITH THE CORPORATION'S EDUCATION AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREAS. THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED STUDENTS AND VETERANS. MTCC, THROUGH VISTA PROJECTS, EXPECTS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF 25 ORGANIZATIONS, EXPANDING THEIR EFFECTIVENESS, SCALE AND REACH AND LEVERAGED RESOURCES.  WE ESTIMATE THAT SUMMER ASSOCIATE VISTAS WILL BENEFIT AT LEAST 2,000 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED K-12 STUDENTS; 1,500 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND FIRST GENERATIONAL COLLEGE STUDENTS; AND 250 VETERANS/INDIVIDUAL MILITARY FAMILY MEMBERS. 25 FULL YEAR AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS, 1 VISTA LEADER AND APPROXIMATELY 20 VISTA SUMMER ASSOCIATES WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT; DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING LOW-INCOME FOCUSED EDUCATION PROGRAMS; DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING OF K-12 COMPLETION AND POST-SECONDARY ACCESS PROGRAMS; DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING OF VETERANS-SERVING PROGRAMS AND THE EXPANSION OF VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT YEAR. THE PROJECTS LAUNCHED DURING THE 2019-20 CYCLE WILL BE MULTI-YEAR IN SCOPE, AND MTCC PLANS TO SUPPORT THESE INITIATIVES OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS, BEFORE TRANSITIONING THEM TO FULL, LOCAL OWNERSHIP TO BE RUN WITH OTHER SUPPORT.

THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND MILITARY VETERANS AND WILL STRENGTHEN RESOURCE AND VOLUNTEER DEVELOPMENT IN THE ORGANIZATIONS COMPRISING A STATEWIDE NETWORK OF RECOVERY COMMUNITY CENTERS FOCUSED ON ADDRESSING THE NEEDS OF LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND VETERANS TRAPPED IN ADDICTION AND / OR EXPERIENCING AN OVERDOSE RELATED TO OPIOIDS.  A VISTA MEMBER WILL BE PLACED IN EACH OF NINE RECOVERY COMMUNITY CENTERS AND WITH THE BOISE CENTRAL OFFICE OF RECOVERY IDAHO IN BOISE.  THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL ASSIST CENTERS EXPLORE AND DEVELOP COMMUNITY  RESOURCES TO MEET A VARIETY OF NEEDS PRESENTED BY THOSE WHO RECEIVE RECOVERY SUPPORT SERVICES.  THE VISTA MEMBER PLACED WITH RECOVERY IDAHO IN BOISE WILL HAVE A SPECIAL FOCUS ON IDENTIFYING AND REACHING VETERANS RESOURCES, ALONG WITH OTHER MORE GENERAL RECOVERY RESOURCES AN ELEVENTH VISTA MEMBER WILL SERVE AS VISTA LEADER AND PROVIDE ONGOING PROBLEM-SOLVING SUPPORT, ASSISTANCE WITH TRAINING, AND STATEWIDE COMMUNICATIONS WITH THE OTHER TEN VISTA MEMBERS.

1.PROVIDE A BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT, INCLUDING THE PROJECT GOAL(S) AS WELL AS AN OVERVIEW OF THE ACTIVITIES THE REQUESTED VISTAS AND LEADERS WILL PERFORM. ---

THE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL (WDC) IS A 41-MEMBER ADVISORY COMMISSION COMPRISED OF BOTH PUBLIC AND PRIVATE-SECTOR REPRESENTATIVES.  MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY THE GOVERNOR BASED ON THEIR INTEREST IN AND KNOWLEDGE OF WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS IN HAWAII, AND HOW TO SUPPORT ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT THROUGHOUT THE STATE.  MEMBERS SERVE IN STAGGERED FOUR-YEAR TERMS.   THE WDC IS AN ATTACHED AGENCY TO THE STATE OF HAWAII DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND INDUSTRIAL RELATIONS (DLIR).  
ITS FUNCTION IS TO FACILITATE PARTNERSHIPS WITH FEDERAL, STATE AND COUNTY AGENCIES TO TRAIN AND BUILD A SKILLED WORKFORCE THAT MEETS THE EVOLVING NEEDS OF HAWAII EMPLOYERS AND JOB SEEKERS.  COORDINATION OF ACTIVITY TAKES PLACE AT LOCAL AMERICAN JOB CENTERS (AJCS) ON OAHU, HAWAII ISLAND, MAUI, AND KAUAI.

THE WDC STAFF IS RESPONSIBLE FOR PREPARING AND OVERSEEING THE COMPREHENSIVE STATE PLAN FOR WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, AND FOR ADVISING THE GOVERNOR VIA ANNUAL REPORTS, ON STATE POLICIES AND FUNDING PRIORITIES. 

IN ITS FEDERAL CAPACITY, THE WDC FUNCTIONS AS AN INFORMATION CLEARING HOUSE FOR WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS IN HAWAII.  THESE INCLUDE STATE AND COUNTY TRAINING AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS THAT ARE FEDERALLY FUNDED THROUGH THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT OF 2014 (WIOA) TO SERVE INDIVIDUALS WITH BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT.  

VISTA MEMBERS RECRUITED TO SERVE WITHIN THE WDC NETWORK WILL HELP EXPAND LOCAL AMERICAN JOB CENTER (AJC) CAPACITY AND SUSTAINABILITY.  MEMBERS WILL CREATE CONSISTENT STATEWIDE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND DEVELOP AN OUTREACH PLAN THAT IDENTIFIES AJCS AS THE GO-TO RESOURCE FOR COMMUNITY JOB SEEKERS AND EMPLOYERS/BUSINESSES.  THAT PLAN WILL PROMOTE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS AND SERVICES OFFERED THROUGH THE AJC AND ENGAGE COMMUNITIES IN PLANNING, DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING, AND EVALUATING PROJECTS FOR SUSTAINABILITY.  CONTINUOUS GROWTH AND IMPROVEMENT WILL BE ADVANCED THROUGH EVALUATION, ACCOUNTABILITY, IDENTIFICATION OF BEST PRACTICES, AND DATA DRIVEN DECISION MAKING. 

LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS ARE A SIGNIFICANT SEGMENT OF THE HAWAII POPULATION WITH BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT, AND ONE OF SEVERAL TARGET POPULATIONS SERVED AT LOCAL AJCS.  HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS, LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENT (LEP) INDIVIDUALS, INDIVIDUALS WITH LOW LEVELS OF EDUCATION, AND NATIVE HAWAIIANS AND OTHER PACIFIC ISLANDERS ALSO PRESENT SIGNIFICANT BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT.  OTHER INDIVIDUALS FEDERALLY DEFINED AS HAVING BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT ARE DISPLACED HOMEMAKERS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, OLDER INDIVIDUALS, EX-OFFENDERS, (FORMER) FOSTER YOUTH, SINGLE PARENTS (INCLUDING SINGLE PREGNANT WOMEN), AND LONG-TERM UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS.  HAWAII HAS SOME OF THE NATION'S HIGHEST PERCENTAGES OF THE POPULATIONS WITH BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT.  ALL CAN BE SERVED AT LOCAL AJCS.

WITH A FOCUS ON COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, VISTA PROJECTS WILL BE RESPONSIVE AND RELEVANT TO AJC CUSTOMERS AND TO COMMUNITY SERVICE PARTNERS.  VISTA PROJECTS WILL BUILD STATEWIDE CAPACITY AND EXPAND PATHWAYS OUT OF POVERTY THROUGH ANALYSIS OF SYSTEMS AND NETWORKS, AND IDENTIFICATION OF PROGRAM AND SERVICE GAPS, REDUNDANCIES AND OVERLAPS.  

2.HOW MANY VISTAS AND VISTA LEADERS ARE YOU REQUESTING? --

THE WDC IS REQUESTING A TOTAL OF FOUR (4) VISTAS.  ONE EACH ON MAUI, OAHU AND KAUAI, AND ONE IN HAWAII COUNTY. WE ARE NOT REQUESTING ANY VISTA LEADERS

3.WHAT IS THE ESTIMATED LENGTH OF TIME REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT?  --

THE WDC IS DESIGNING THESE VISTA PROJECTS AS A YEAR-TO-YEAR CONTINUATIONS WITH A THREE-YEAR PROJECT.

4.BRIEFLY DESCRIBE YOUR ORGANIZATION?S MISSION, HISTORY, AND THE BENEFICIARIES OF YOUR ORGANIZATION?S PROGRAMS. --

THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT OF 2014 (WIOA) IS A PUBLICLY-FUNDED WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT SYSTEM THAT PROVIDES A RANGE OF EMPLOYMENT

MAYOR OF LONG BEACH, CALIFORNIA, ROBERT GARCIA IS REQUESTING TWO VISTA MEMBERS TO INCREASE CAPACITY OF THE MAYOR'S OFFICE. WE ARE REQUESTING ONE MEMBER TO BUILD CAPACITY OF THE MAYOR'S FUND FOR THE HOMELESS AND ONE MEMBER TO BUILD CAPACITY OF THE MAYOR'S FUND FOR EDUCATION. THE MEMBER ASSIGNED TO THE FUND FOR THE HOMELESS WILL RESEARCH, DRAFT, AND COMPLETE A FUND DEVELOPMENT PLAN THAT IDENTIFIES SUSTAINABLE FUNDING STREAMS TO SUPPORT THE NEEDS OF SOME OF LONG BEACH'S MOST VULNERABLE RESIDENTS. THE MEMBER ASSIGNED TO THE MAYOR'S FUND FOR EDUCATION WILL RESEARCH, DRAFT AND FINALIZE AN IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY FOR THE LONG BREACH EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION STRATEGIC PLAN THAT WAS ADOPTED EARLIER THIS YEAR. THESE TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL WORK TOWARDS IMPROVING EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR YOUNG PEOPLE AND ALLEVIATING POVERTY BY DEVELOPING THESE TWO GUIDING DOCUMENTS OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR.

DAVID AND MARGARET'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER CHILDREN, YOUTH AND FAMILIES THROUGH CULTURALLY DIVERSE SERVICES THAT FOSTER EMOTIONAL, EDUCATIONAL, SPIRITUAL AND IDENTITY DEVELOPMENT THROUGH SERVICES INCLUDING:  FOSTER/ADOPTION SERVICES, RESIDENTIAL SERVICES, AND SUPPORT SERVICES ACROSS OUR 17.5-ACRE CAMPUS.  ETTIE LEE IS JOINING  DAVID & MARGARET IN OUR EFFORTS TO FIGHT HOMELESSNESS IN THE TAY POPULATION. THEIR MISSION IS HELPING VULNERABLE CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES DEVELOP SKILLS TO LEAD SUCCESSFUL LIVES. SAVING LIVES, CHANGING LIVES, BUILDING HOPE FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES.THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO LEVERAGE RESOURCES, INCREASE EFFECTIVENESS, CREATE LINKAGES IN THE COMMUNITY AND SCALE OUR PROGRAMS IN EFFORT TO DECREASE POVERTY AND HOMELESS.  WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT AN ESTIMATED 2,000 COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGHOUT THE THREE YEARS.  FOUR VISTA MEMBERS AT DAVID & MARGARET YOUTH AND FAMILY SERVICED AND THREE AT ETTIE LEE WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES  FUNDRAISING, OUTREACH AND RECRUITMENT,  TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT, PROGRAM DESIGN AND BUILDING AWARENESS THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA AND OTHER COMMUNICATION PLATFORMS.

HOPE THROUGH HOUSING FOUNDATION (HTHF)'S MISSION IS TO TRANSFORM COMMUNITIES AND HELP BREAK THE GENERATIONAL CYCLE OF POVERTY BY EMPOWERING RESIDENTS THROUGH PROVIDING YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, ECONOMIC MOBILITY AND SENIOR HEALTH/WELLNESS SERVICES ACROSS NATIONAL CORE'S PORTFOLIO OF AFFORDABLE HOUSING COMMUNITIES.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS PRIMARILY WITH CNCS' FOCUS AREA OF CAPACITY BUILDING, WHILE ALSO ADDRESSING THE AREAS OF EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC MOBILITY.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND HTHF'S DIGITAL PRESENCE, DEVELOP A SUSTAINABLE RESIDENT TEEN PROGRAM (THAT EMPHASIZES COLLEGE/CAREER READINESS, FINANCIAL LITERACY AND SOFT-SKILL DEVELOPMENT) AND INCREASE RESIDENT ENGAGEMENT LEVELS ACROSS HTHF PROPERTIES IN ORANGE, RIVERSIDE AND SAN BERNARDINO COUNTIES IN CALIFORNIA.  (7) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY RESEARCHING BEST PRACTICES, CREATING SOCIAL MEDIA TOOLKITS, SURVEYING TEEN RESIDENTS TO CREATE A TEEN PROGRAM CURRICULUM, AND ESTABLISHING/EXPANDING PARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL BUSINESS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO DEVELOP A SUSTAINABLE SOURCE OF VOLUNTEERS AND ADVOCATES FOR HTHF.  FULL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT WILL BE OVER THE COURSE OF 1 YEAR AND AIMS TO HELP HTHF INCREASE THEIR DIGITAL MEDIA PRESENCE BY 25% (MEASURED BY NUMBER OF SOCIAL MEDIA FOLLOWERS) AND PROVIDE NEW TEEN PROGRAMMING FOR 120 TEEN RESIDENTS.

FOR 25 YEARS GLOBAL GREEN HAS WORKED TO ADVANCE SMART SOLUTIONS TO CLIMATE CHANGE THAT IMPROVE LIVES AND PROTECT OUR PLANET. THIS PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO REDUCE ENVIRONMENTAL DEGRADATION AND FOOD WASTE THAT DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACT VULNERABLE AND LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA, BY SHIFTING LOCAL BUSINESS PRACTICES TO CATALYZE THE TRANSFORMATION OF OVER ONE MILLION LBS OF WASTE INTO ASSETS, REDUCING GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS BY 1,500 TONS ANNUALLY, WHILE PREVENTING FOOD WASTE AND RECOVERING 84,000 MEALS TO DISTRIBUTE TO LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING SITES PER YEAR. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY ASSISTING WITH GLOBAL GREEN'S RESOURCE RECOVERY INITIATIVE - BUILDING CAPACITY OF THE COALITION FOR RESOURCE RECOVERY AND THE FOOD WASTE PREVENTION AND RESCUE PROGRAM - OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS. VISTAS WILL BUILD CAPACITY OF GLOBAL GREEN'S TWO RESOURCE RECOVERY INITIATIVES THROUGH DEVELOPING MATERIALS, STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS, SECURING FINANCIAL RESOURCES THROUGH GRANT WRITING, AND HOSTING STAKEHOLDER WORKSHOPS.

BY USING THE COLLECTIVE IMPACT MODEL, WE ACKNOWLEDGE THAT LARGE SCALE SOCIAL CHANGE REQUIRES CROSS-SECTOR COORDINATION. IT INVOLVES A COMMITMENT OF A GROUP OF IMPORTANT ACTORS FROM DIFFERENT SECTORS TO A COMMON AGENDA TO SOLVE A SPECIFIC SOCIAL PROBLEM. USING THE PILLARS OF COLLECTIVE IMPACT, WE HAVE A COMMON AGENDA, SHARED MEASUREMENT, MUTUALLY REINFORCING ACTIVITIES, CONTINUOUS COMMUNICATIONS, AND BACKBONE SUPPORT. WITH THIS IN MIND, THE SAN DIEGO VETERANS COALITION (SDVC) RESPECTFULLY REQUESTS APPROVAL TO ASSUME THE MANTLE OF LEADERSHIP FOR THE SAN DIEGO COUNTY INTERMEDIARY PROGRAM FROM 2-1-1'S ORIGINAL AMERICORPS VISTA GRANT, WHICH THEY HAVE HAD FOR THE PAST THREE YEARS. THE TRANSITION WILL BE SEAMLESS TO EXTERNAL AGENCIES AND PARTNERSHIPS. SDVC WILL CONTINUE WITH THE COLLABORATIVE SUPPORT OF THE EXISTING PARTNERING ORGANIZATIONS: VETS' COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS (VCC) AND SAN DIEGO MILITARY FAMILY COLLABORATIVE (SDMFC).  THESE THREE CORE ORGANIZATIONS AND A TOTAL OF (7) SEVEN VISTAS WITH A VISTA LEADER, WILL PROVIDE CROSS-SECTOR COORDINATION, AND WORK A SUCCESSFUL "COLLECTIVE IMPACT MODEL." THIS MODEL INVOLVES THE COMMITMENT OF A GROUP OF IMPORTANT ACTORS FROM DIFFERENT SECTORS TOWARDS A COMMON AGENDA TO SOLVE A SPECIFIC SOCIAL PROBLEM, SHARED MEASUREMENT, MUTUALLY REINFORCING ACTIVITIES, CONTINUOUS COMMUNICATIONS, WITH BACKBONE SUPPORT. WE HAVE COLLECTIVELY EXPERIENCED GREAT SUCCESS WITH MEASURED OUTCOMES IN THE PROJECT THUS FAR AND CAN SEE AN EVEN MORE SIGNIFICANT IMPACT FOR NOT ONLY OUR PROJECT BUT FOR THE VETERANS, SERVICE MEMBERS AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGHOUT SAN DIEGO COUNTY WITH AN ADDITIONAL YEAR. WE INTEND TO DEMONSTRATE OUR MODEL OF SUCCESS TO OUR SDVC MEMBERSHIP VETERAN CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS AND FIND NEW PATHS TO CAPACITY BUILD AND EXPAND OUR CONTRIBUTIONS TO FIGHT POVERTY AND IMPROVE THE WELLNESS OF OUR VETERAN COMMUNITY AND THEIR FAMILIES, IN THE FUTURE. WE REQUEST THAT THE APPROVAL OF OUR GRANT INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING VISTA RESOURCES: 1 VISTA LEADER 2 VISTAS: VETERANS COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS (VCC) 2 VISTAS: SAN DIEGO MILITARY FAMILY COLLABORATIVE (SDMFC) AND 3 VISTAS: SAN DIEGO VETERAN COALITION (SDVC). PLEASE REFER TO THE VISTA ASSIGNMENT SECTION FOR A DETAILED BREAKDOWN OF THE ACTIVITIES. 
BACKGROUND: SAN DIEGO HAS THE HIGHEST NUMBER OF ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY COMMANDS AND THE MOST SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY PERSONNEL IN THE COUNTRY. THERE ARE NINE MAJOR COMMANDS,120,000 ACTIVE DUTY PERSONNEL, WITH MORE THAN 150,000 DEPENDENTS. WHEN 15,000 MILITARY MEMBERS LEAVE THE SERVICE A YEAR, 33% REMAIN IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY. THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY 267,000 VETERANS IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY. 
VCC IS DESIGNED TO HOLISTICALLY SERVE THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY BY BRIDGING THE GAP BETWEEN THE VETERANS AND ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY PERSONNEL WHO SERVE AND THE BROADER COMMUNITY. ALSO, COLLABORATION IS REQUIRED TO BE SUCCESSFUL. IT PROVIDES BUSINESSES AND INDIVIDUALS WHO WANT TO DO MORE THAN SAY "THANK YOU FOR YOUR SERVICE" THE CHANNEL TO USE THEIR OWN PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE AND EXPERTISE TO RESPOND TO VETERAN AND MILITARY FAMILY RELOCATION AND REINTEGRATION QUESTIONS IN A WIDE VARIETY OF FIELDS. ONLY APPROXIMATELY 1% OF AMERICANS HAVE SERVED IN THE ARMED FORCES, AND RECENT STUDIES SHOW THAT ONLY 5-10% OF AMERICANS PERSONALLY KNOW A VETERAN. THIS DIVIDE HIGHLIGHTS THE IMPORTANCE OF THE COMMUNITY BEING PART OF REINTEGRATION EFFORTS. VCC SPECIFICALLY SERVES VETERANS, ACTIVE DUTY, AND THEIR IMMEDIATE FAMILY MEMBERS AS WELL AS BUSINESSES AND INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE INTERESTED IN OFFERING SERVICES OR PRODUCTS. THE GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO HAVE VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES MORE EASILY AND FULLY REINTEGRATE INTO COMMUNITIES FOLLOWING MILITARY SERVICE, FACILITATING THEIR ABILITY TO LEAD HAPPIER, HEALTHIER, FINANCIALLY SECURE LIVES. BY PARTICIPATING IN THIS INITIATIVE, COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL GAIN A BROADER UNDERSTANDING OF THOSE IN THE MILITARY TRANSITIONING TO VETERAN AND CIVILIAN LIFE, AND THE TALENTS THEY BRING TO THE COMMUNITY.

THE UNITED WAY OF NORTHERN SANTA BARBARA COUNTY?S MISSION IS TO IMPROVES LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF COMMUNITIES AROUND THE WORLD TO ADVANCE THE COMMON GOOD. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. THE SEVEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CAPACITY BUILDING INCLUDING VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT, FUNDRAISING AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE MISSION OF FONTANA ADULT SCHOOL IS TO EMPOWER STUDENTS FOR SUCCESS IN COLLEGE, CAREERS, AND LIFE.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS ANTI-POVERTY FOCUS AREA IN POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION. WE ARE REQUESTING TWO VISTAS TO ACHIEVE THE GOALS OF THE FONTANA CAREER HORIZONS PROJECT.  THE FIRST VISTA, THE "VISTA MENTOR LEADER" WILL RECRUIT AND TRAIN A CADRE OF 10-20 VOLUNTEER ADULT MENTORS WHO WILL BENEFIT 50 OR MORE DISADVANTAGED, LOW-INCOME AND/OR ENGLISH LEARNER ADULTS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH ENCOURAGEMENT AND SUPPORT IN COMPLETING THEIR HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA/GED, ESL, U.S. CITIZENSHIP AND CAREER TECHNICAL EDUCATION COURSES; TEACHING THEM HOW TO COMPLETE COLLEGE AND FINANCIAL AID APPLICATIONS; ADMINISTERING CAREER INTEREST INVENTORIES AND SKILLS ASSESSMENTS; ASSISTING THEM WITH RESUMES, COVER LETTERS, INTERVIEW SKILLS, JOB SEARCH AND JOB RETENTION TECHNIQUES; JOB PLACEMENT ASSISTANCE, AND PROVIDING REFERRALS TO NEEDED SUPPORT SERVICES IN THE COMMUNITY.

THE SECOND VISTA, THE "VISTA COMMUNITY OUTREACH LIAISON", WILL INSPIRE STAKEHOLDERS IN THE COMMUNITY TO SUPPORT THE FONTANA CAREER HORIZONS PROJECT AND OUR NEW COLLEGE, CAREERS AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT (CCED) CENTER; RECRUIT MENTORS AND ADULT MENTEES; MANAGE A STAKEHOLDERS' ADVISORY COMMITTEE; ORGANIZE AND/OR PARTICIPATE IN STUDENT WORKSHOPS, EVENTS, FAIRS, GUEST SPEAKERS AND FIELD TRIPS; CREATE ADVERTISING FLYERS, VIDEOS, POSTCARDS, AND POSTERS; INCREASE FAS'S SOCIAL MEDIA AND WEB PRESENCE, AND ASSIST WITH OBTAINING DONATIONS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND HOLDING FUNDRAISERS ON BEHALF OF OUR DISADVANTAGED ADULT STUDENTS.

THE RURAL ALASKA COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM, INC. (RURAL CAP) MISSION IS TO EMPOWER LOW-INCOME ALASKANS THROUGH ADVOCACY, EDUCATION, AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND DIRECT SERVICES THAT RESPECT OUR UNIQUE VALUES AND CULTURES.
