THE  VISTA LEADER, 20 VISTA MEMBERS AND FOUR SUMMER ASSOCIATES WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ENTREPRENEURSHIP, HEALTH LITERACY OUTREACH, SOCIAL ENTERPRISE, AND IMPROVING ACCESS TO FOOD OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT DECADE.

THE CITY OF FAIRBANKS (COF) WILL SERVE AS THE INTERMEDIARY SPONSOR FOR 12 AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECTS IN THE AREA. FIVE OF THE PROJECTS HAD PREVIOUSLY OPERATED WITH THE FAIRBANKS NORTH STAR BOROUGH (FNSB) AS THE INTERMEDIARY SPONSOR, BUT AS IT BECAME EVIDENT THAT TREATING OPIOID MISUSE WAS ESSENTIAL TO ALLEVIATING POVERTY IN THE AREA, THE FNSB HAD TO TRANSITION THE PROGRAM TO THE COF, BECAUSE THE COF HAS SOCIAL SERVICE AUTHORITIES THE FNSB DOES NOT. THE ANTICIPATED 12 YEAR-LONG VISTA MEMBERS AND 18 SUMMER ASSOCIATES WILL HELP TO BUILD SUSTAINABLE PROJECTS DESIGNED TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY AND COMBAT THE MISUSE OF OPIOIDS IN THE FAIRBANKS AREA. THE VISTA ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE RESEARCH, CAPACITY BUILDING, MARKETING, AND FUND RAISING. THE VISTA LEADER WILL SUPPORT AND COORDINATE THE VISTA PROJECTS AND MEMBERS UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF THE VISTA SPONSOR TO ENSURE PROJECT GOALS AND OBJECTIVES ARE BEING MET WHILE MAINTAINING GRANT COMPLIANCE.

THE WISCONSIN ASSOCIATION OF FREE AND CHARITABLE CLINIC'S MISSION IS TO SUPPORT, STRENGTHEN, AND ADVOCATE FOR THE UNIQUENESS OF THE WISCONSIN FREE AND CHARITABLE CLINICS, THE PATIENTS THEY SERVE, AND THE COMMUNITIES WITH WHOM THEY PARTNER. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF PUBLIC HEALTH CENTERS AND FREE & CHARITABLE CLINICS THROUGHOUT WISCONSIN. THE GOAL IS TO RAISE AWARENESS AND INCREASE FUNDING WHILE DEVELOPING RESOURCES TO COMBAT POVERTY AND THE SUBSTANCE ABUSE EPIDEMIC, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 65,000 WISCONSINITES WHO ARE EITHER UNINSURED, UNDER INSURED, OR BATTLING SUBSTANCE ABUSE. 2 VISTA LEADERS, 30 VISTA MEMBERS AND 15 SUMMER VISTAS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS IMPLEMENTING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES IN ACCORDANCE WITH WAFCC'S STANDARDS OF EXCELLENCE, FUNDRAISING, EVENT PLANNING, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, COMMUNITY EDUCATION, DATA COLLECTION AND COALITION BUILDING OVER THE COURSE OF SIX YEARS.

CENTRO HISPANO'S MISSION IS EMPOWERING YOUTH, STRENGTHENING FAMILIES, ENGAGING COMMUNITY IN SUCH A WAY THAT THE AGENCY CAN FULFILL ITS VISION OF DANE COUNTY BECOMING A COMMUNITY WHERE LATINO FAMILIES CAN ASPIRE UPWARD, TO REACH THEIR PERSONAL GOALS AND DREAMS BECAUSE THEY FEEL ENGAGED AND STRENGTHENED WITH THE TOOLS FOR SUCCESS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THESE THREE CNCS FOCUS AREAS: 1) ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, 2) EDUCATION AND 3) HEALTHY FUTURE.THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY FOR 1) ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY BY STRENGTHENING THE CURRENT EMPLOYMENT SERVICES OFFERED BY CENTRO BY SOLIDIFYING A STRUCTURE AND STANDARDIZING THE PROGRAM'S MATERIALS. THIS VISTA VOLUNTEER WILL SUPPORT THE SPECIAL PRIORITY OF WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT. ADDITIONALLY, A SECOND VISTA VOLUNTEER WILL PROVIDE ADDITIONAL CAPACITY FOR 2) EDUCATION BY SUPPORTING OUR YOUTH PROGRAMS, WITH A SPECIAL PRIORITY FOR STEM THROUGH A MORE INTENTIONAL AND FOCUSED COLLABORATION WITH UW MADISON HEALTH SCIENCES. FINALLY, THE THIRD VISTA VOLUNTEER WILL SUPPORT 3) HEALTHY FUTURE BY BRINGING TOGETHER THE WELLNESS INITIATIVE AND THE NEW ROUTES SERVICES THROUGH PRIMARY PREVENTION TO ADDRESS ALCOHOL AND OTHER DRUG ABUSE (AODA) AND WILL FURTHER WELLNESS' HOLISTIC MISSION OF HEALTH AND WELLBEING BY SUPPORTING ITS PROGRAMS. THE 1) ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE 2,500 FAMILIES CURRENTLY SERVED BY CENTRO. THE 2) EDUCATION PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 200-300 STUDENTS CURRENTLY SERVED THROUGH OUR YOUTH PROGRAMMING AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE 3) HEALTHY FUTURE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT AT LEAST THE 1,000 PLUS CLIENTS SERVED THROUGH THE NEW ROUTES PROGRAM. THE THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS 1) THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY VISTA WILL SUPPORT JOB SEEKERS IN THE COMMUNITY; MATCHING JOB SEEKERS AND EMPLOYERS. THE MAIN FUNCTIONS OF THE VISTA WILL BE TO: 1- ESTABLISH CONTACT WITH, AND HELP FACILITATE THE PROCESS OF, CREATING PARTNERSHIPS WITH POTENTIAL EMPLOYERS FOR CLIENTS IN DANE COUNTY; 2- MAINTAIN AND UPDATE THE 'SCREENED EMPLOYER' DIRECTORY USED TO MATCH JOB-SEEKING CLIENTS WITH APPROPRIATE WORK ADVERTISEMENTS. 3-ASSIST WITH GENERATING OUTREACH MATERIALS AND EFFORTS ON BEHALF OF CENTRO'S EMPLOYMENT SERVICES, AND THE AGENCY'S EXISTING CAMINOS VOCATIONAL PROGRAM. 4- ASSIST WITH GENERATING WORKSHOP MATERIALS NEEDED TO MEET SOFT SKILLS OF JOB SEEKERS COMING TO CENTRO FOR EMPLOYMENT SERVICES. THE 2) EDUCATIONAL VISTA WILL SUPPORT OUR YOUTH PROGRAMS BY 1- SUPPORTING VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND APPRECIATION. 2- ESTABLISH CONTACT WITH, AND HELP FACILITATE THE PROCESS OF, CREATING PARTNERSHIPS WITH SYSTEMS PARTNERS WITH A SPECIAL PRIORITY FOR STEM THROUGH A MORE INTENTIONAL AND FOCUSED COLLABORATION WITH UW MADISON HEALTH SCIENCES. 3-ASSIST WITH GENERATING OUTREACH MATERIALS AND EFFORTS ON BEHALF OF CENTRO'S YOUTH PROGRAMS. THE 3) HEALTHY FUTURES VISTA WILL 1- HELP WITH THE PLANNING AND COORDINATION OF THE EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS BY PREPARING MATERIALS, SCHEDULING PRESENTERS, COORDINATING VOLUNTEERS, GENERATING PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS, AND ASSISTING WITH OTHER LOGISTICS. THEY WILL ALSO ASSIST WITH KEEPING RECORDS ON PROGRAMS AND WORKSHOPS AS WELL AS ORGANIZING DATA. THE VISTA WILL 2- HELP BRING TOGETHER SYSTEMS PARTNERS AND HELP FACILITATE THE PROCESS OF, CREATING PARTNERSHIPS WITH A SPECIAL PRIORITY FOR MENTAL HEALTH AND AODA NEEDS IN ORDER TO FORMALIZE A COALITION. 3-ASSIST WITH GENERATING OUTREACH MATERIALS AND EFFORTS ON BEHALF OF CENTRO'S ADULT PROGRAMS ADDRESSING MENTAL HEALTH AND AODA. THESE GOALS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED OVER THE COURSE OF THE 15 MONTH PROJECT.

HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF WISCONSIN'S MISSION IS TO UNITE HABITAT FOR HUMANITY AFFILIATES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF WISCONSIN IN A COORDINATED EFFORT TO ELIMINATE SUB-STANDARD HOUSING. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL DEVELOP HOME REPAIR PROGRAMS AT LOCAL HABITAT AFFILIATES SEEKING TO ENABLE LOWER INCOME HOMEOWNERS TO REMAIN SAFELY IN THEIR HOMES AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 165 LOWER INCOME HOMEOWNERS IN THE FIRST YEAR, MANY OF THEM SENIORS AND/OR VETERANS LIVING IN RURAL AREAS. TEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY OUTREACH, AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT OVER THE COURSE THREE YEARS.

FAMILY SERVICE COUNCIL OF OHIO, WHO DOES BUSINESS AS OHIO RECOVERY HOUSING, HAS A  MISSION IS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY RECOVERY HOUSING OPTIONS FOR PEOPLE IN RECOVERY FROM SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS.  RECOVERY HOUSING IS A DRUG AND ALCOHOL-FREE LIVING ENVIRONMENT THAT OFFERS PEER SUPPORT AND CONNECTION TO SERVICES AND SUPPORTS THAT SUPPORT LONG TERM RECOVERY.  FSCO SUPPORTS ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY RECOVERY HOUSING BY OFFERING A VOLUNTARY CERTIFICATION AND QUALITY REVIEW PROCESS FOR RECOVERY HOUSING OPERATORS, PROVIDING TRAINING AND INDIVIDUALIZED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON BEST PRACTICES.  FSCO ALSO TRACKS OUTCOMES OF RECOVERY HOUSING THROUGH A RESIDENT SURVEY AND OUTCOMES TRACKING TOOLS.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO STRENGTHEN COUNTY AND COMMUNITY EFFORTS TO COMBAT THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC BY BUILDING CAPACITY FOR RECOVERY HOUSING.  WE EXPECT THIS PROJECT TO BENEFIT OHIOANS IN RECOVERY FROM SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS BY BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE CRITICAL RECOVERY SUPPORT SERVICES.   SIX VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PROVIDING TRAINING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT TO RESIDENTS AND OPERATORS SEEKING TO TRACK RESIDENT OUTCOMES AND USING THE OUTCOMES DATA TO RAISE AWARENESS, ADDRESS STIGMA AND PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ON THE IMPORTANCE OF RECOVERY HOUSING IN THE CONTINUUM OF SERVICES AND SUPPORTS FOR THOSE IMPACTED BY SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS.

RURAL ACTION IS A REGIONAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATION WITH AN 18-COUNTY FOOTPRINT WORKING WITH MEMBERS AND COMMUNITY LEADERS ON A RANGE OF QUALITY OF LIFE, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND ECONOMIC PROJECTS ACROSS APPALACHIAN OHIO. RURAL ACTION'S MISSION IS TO BUILD A MORE JUST ECONOMY BY DEVELOPING THE REGION'S ASSETS IN ENVIRONMENTALLY, SOCIALLY, AND ECONOMICALLY SUSTAINABLE WAYS. RURAL ACTION'S CORE WORK CENTERS ON HELPING COMMUNITIES DO BIG THINGS, GROWING LOCAL BUSINESSES AND JOBS, RESTORING APPALACHIAN OHIO'S ENVIRONMENT, AND CULTIVATING THE NEXT GENERATION OF LEADERS. WE ENVISION A REGION WITH CLEAN STREAMS AND HEALTHY FORESTS; A PLACE WHERE THRIVING FAMILY FARMS, MEANINGFUL LIVELIHOODS, AND VIBRANT COMMUNITIES EXIST FOR EVERYONE, WITH PEOPLE ENGAGED AS GOOD STEWARDS OF THE WORLD THEY LIVE IN AND WORKING TOGETHER TO MAKE THIS VISION A REALITY. RURAL ACTION'S PROPOSED VISTA PROJECTS ALIGN WITH MULTIPLE CNCS PRIORITY AREAS, PRIMARILY IN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT. THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO DEVELOP AND GROW THREE KEY ECONOMIC SECTORS OF THE REGION AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT A THREE-COUNTY AREA. FIVE VISTAS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS EXPANDING FUNDING FOR NONPROFITS, INCREASING DEMAND, PRODUCTION, AND DISTRIBUTION OF LOCAL FOODS, AND GROWING SUSTAINABLE ENERGY EMPLOYMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE MISSION OF THE KIRWAN INSTITUTE FOR THE STUDY OF RACE AND ETHNICITY AT THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY IS TO CREATE A JUST AND INCLUSIVE SOCIETY WHERE ALL PEOPLE AND COMMUNITIES HAVE OPPORTUNITY TO SUCCEED. OUR PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREAS. THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF STATEWIDE PROGRAMMATIC COORDINATION IN EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT FOR LOW INCOME YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES IN THE FOLLOWING OHIO CITIES: AKRON, CANTON, CLEVELAND, COLUMBUS, DAYTON, LIMA, MANSFIELD, SPRINGFIELD, TOLEDO, AND YOUNGSTOWN.

THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING JOB PLACEMENT SERVICES AND OBTAINING JOB PLACEMENT; AND INCREASE THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS GRADUATING FROM HIGH SCHOOL ON TIME WITH A DIPLOMA AND ENTERING POST-SECONDARY INSTITUTIONS FOLLOWING THEIR GRADUATION. OUR PROPOSED INITIATIVE WILL INCREASE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF EXISTING PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESS THESE GOALS BY PILOTING COLLECTIVE IMPACT AND SYSTEMS CHANGE STRATEGIES WITH A COHORT OF MORE THAN 1500 LOW INCOME YOUTH ACROSS THE STATE OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS. 

10 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: 
*	CREATE A YOUTH LEADERSHIP COUNCIL AND WORK WITH COMMUNITY LEADERS TO RECRUIT COUNCIL MEMBERS. 
*	DEVELOP AN INTEGRATED DATA-SHARING AND VOLUNTEER TRACKING PLATFORM FOR EDUCATION-FOCUSED MENTORING 
*	WORK WITH LOCAL LEADERS TO IDENTIFY AND IMPLEMENT EVALUATION PROCEDURES AND BEST PRACTICES
*	UTILIZE FINDINGS TO DEVELOP LOCAL ACTION PLANS
*	BUILD PARTNERSHIPS WITH BUSINESSES AND FORGE COMMITMENTS TO TRAIN, HIRE, AND MENTOR LOW-INCOME YOUTH 
*	DEVELOP A VOLUNTEER HANDBOOK THAT INCORPORATES PRINCIPLES OF CULTURAL COMPETENCE, EQUITY, AND TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE.

SOURIS BASIN PLANNING COUNCIL'S MISSION IS TO SUPPORT COMMUNITIES, LEADERS AND ENTREPRENEURS TO ADVANCE ECONOMIC PROGRESS FOR NORTH DAKOTA REGION 2.  THE SOURIS BASIN COMMUNITY BUILDER PROGRAM WILL SUPPORT THE FY2019 AMERICORPS PROGRAM PRIORITIES OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES AND EDUCATION. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND SBPC'S CAPACITY IN RURAL NORTH DAKOTA AND STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES BY INCREASING CAPACITY OF NORTH DAKOTA'S PUBLIC AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM WILL BE NORTH DAKOTA PUBLIC AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND THE FAMILIES, INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE. EIGHT VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: CONDUCTING RESEARCH ON BEST PRACTICES AND RESOURCES, GRANT WRITING, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND CONDUCTING COMMUNITY OUTREACH OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS

MINNESOTA LITERACY COUNCIL'S MISSION IS TO SHARE THE POWER OF LEARNING THROUGH EDUCATION, COMMUNITY BUILDING AND ADVOCACY. OUR PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA OF EDUCATION BY ENABLING COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS IN MINNESOTA COMMUNITIES TO ENSURE ACCESS TO HIGH-QUALITY LITERACY SERVICES FOR LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. AS A RESULT, INDIVIDUALS AND WHOLE FAMILIES WILL BE EQUIPPED TO REACH HIGHER LEVELS OF EDUCATION, EMPLOYABILITY AND SELF-SUFFICIENCY, ULTIMATELY ALLOWING THEM TO BREAK THE CYCLE OF POVERTY. EIGHTEEN VISTAS, SUPPORTED BY TWO VISTA LEADERS TO INCREASE THE SUCCESS OF PROJECTS, WILL INCREASE CAPACITY THROUGH PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT IN SERVICE AREAS ADULT LITERACY, K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS. THE ESTIMATED LENGTH OF TIME REQUIRED TO COMPLETE PROJECTS IS THREE TO FIVE YEARS. WE ALSO REQUEST 46 SUMMER ASSOCIATES. SUMMER ASSOCIATES WILL SERVE FOR EIGHT WEEKS TO HELP CHILDREN ENTERING GRADES K-4 MAINTAIN OR INCREASE READING SKILLS OVER THE SUMMER.

COLLEGE POSSIBLE'S MISSION IS TO MAKE COLLEGE GRADUATION POSSIBLE FOR CAPABLE, LOW-INCOME STUDENTS THROUGH AN INTENSIVE CURRICULUM OF COACHING AND SUPPORT. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF COLLEGE POSSIBLE AS IT IMPLEMENTS A NEW STRATEGIC PLAN TO INCREASE COLLEGE PERSISTENCE AND ENROLLMENT RATES FOR LOW-INCOME STUDENTS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT OVER 25,000 STUDENTS ANNUALLY , BOTH THROUGH OUR STRATEGIC PILOTS AND OUR TRADITIONAL PROGRAMING. OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR, 12 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SYSTEMS BUILDING, ESTABLISHING AND INCREASING STAKEHOLDER PARTNERSHIPS, INCREASE FINANCIAL RESOURCES, PROMOTING PROGRAM GROWTH AND CHANGE, AND BUILDING A COMMUNITY OF SUPPORT.

SOUTHERN MINNESOTA INITIATIVE FOUNDATION IS A REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT PHILANTHROPIC ORGANIZATION THAT FOSTERS ECONOMIC AND COMMUNITY VITALITY IN 20 COUNTIES OF SOUTHERN MINNESOTA THROUGH A CULTURE OF COLLABORATION AND PARTNERSHIP. WE ENVISION A PROSPEROUS AND GROWING REGION WITH VIBRANT COMMUNITIES, INNOVATIVE AND SUCCESSFUL ECONOMIES, AND ENGAGED AND VALUED CITIZENS. SMIF AIMS TO ADVANCE RURAL MINNESOTA IN WAYS THAT BENEFIT ALL. IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE OUR VISION OF A "PROSPEROUS AND GROWING REGION WITH VIBRANT COMMUNITIES, INNOVATIVE AND SUCCESSFUL ECONOMIES AND ENGAGED AND VALUED CITIZENS WE MUST CONTINUE TO ENCOURAGE AND ENABLE CULTURE AND ECONOMIC CONTRIBUTIONS FROM OUR IMMIGRANT AND REFUGEE COMMUNITIES. SOUTHERN MINNESOTA COMMUNITIES ARE CHANGING. THERE IS A 25% INCREASE IN MINORITY POPULATION FROM 2000-2015 IN THE AREAS WE SERVE. THIS WILL INCREASE BY 65% BY 2035. AT THE SAME TIME INCOME POVERTY RATE IN MINNESOTA IS 2.7 TIMES HIGHER FOR HOUSEHOLDS OF COLOR, SPECIFICALLY 26.6% FOR BLACK HOUSEHOLDS AND 20.1% FOR HISPANIC HOUSEHOLDS. COMMUNITIES NEED ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT THIS NEW POPULATION IN OUR REGION, MOVE THEM OUT OF POVERTY AND INTO PROSPERITY. THIS REQUIRES IN MANY SITUATIONS SYSTEMIC PLANNING, STRATEGIC THINKING AND CAPACITY TO BUILD THE FRAMEWORK TO INSTILL NEW WAYS OF DOING THIS WORK. COMMUNITIES IN BOTH OUR RURAL ENTREPRENEURIAL VENTURES PROGRAM AND PROSPERITY INITIATIVE ARE FINDING THEIR GREATEST OPPORTUNITIES AND YET THEIR BIGGEST CHALLENGES IN THIS POPULATION AS A RESULT OF NOT HAVING THE EXPERIENCE, TOOLS AND PROCESSES TO BUILD A COMMUNITY WHICH REQUIRES ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL LITERACY, EMPLOYMENT AND INDIVIDUAL ASSETS. THIS PROPOSED PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THOSE OPPORTUNITIES AS PART OF THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA OFFERED THROUGH CNCS. THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IDENTIFY WAYS TO BUILD CAPACITY TO CREATE AN ENTREPRENEURIAL ECOSYSTEM WHICH BUILDS KNOWLEDGE PERTAINING TO FINANCIAL LITERACY, CREATES JOBS FOR BOTH EMPLOYER AND EMPLOYEES AND LEVERAGES THE ASSETS OF INDIVIDUALS WHO CAN PROVIDE THE TIME, TALENT AND RESOURCES TO CREATE AND SUSTAIN THIS WORK RESULTING IN LESS POVERTY AND MORE PROSPERITY. WE WILL SEEK FOUR (INCLUDING SMIF) SITES TO PARTICIPATE IN THIS YEAR LONG EFFORT AND SPECIFICALLY FOCUS ON ORGANIZATIONS WHICH DESIRE TO HELP JUMP START THIS WORK TO SUPPORT THE MINORITY POPULATION BASE AND WHO ARE PART OF OUR PROSPERITY INITIATIVE AND RURAL ENTREPRENEURIAL VENTURES INITIATIVES. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO BASELINE UNDERSTANDING OF INVENTORYING MINORITY POPULATIONS STRUGGLING TO START OR GROW A COMPANY, TO CREATING A ROADMAP OF ASSISTANCE THROUGH A BUSINESS ASSESSMENT AND/OR SURVEY TOOL, CAPTURING THIS INFORMATION AND FORMULATING PROCESSES TO HELP INDIVIDUALS SUCCESSFULLY ACHIEVE THEIR GOALS AND ASPIRATIONS. THIS WORK MIGHT INCLUDE CREATING NEW DATABASE SYSTEMS TO TRACK PROGRESS, DESIGNING DIVERSITY TRAINING FOR LEADERSHIP TO CREATE A CLEARER UNDERSTANDING OF INDIVIDUALS WHO THEY WILL BE SERVING, AND CREATING EVALUATION TOOLS TO UNDERSTAND IMPACT AND LEARNING ALONG THE WAY. THIS WORK WILL REQUIRE A FULL 12 MONTHS TO COMPLETE AND/OR MAKE SIGNIFICANT PROGRESS.

HOME LINE'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE FREE LEGAL, ORGANIZING, EDUCATIONAL AND ADVOCACY SERVICES SO TENANTS THROUGHOUT MINNESOTA CAN SOLVE THEIR OWN RENTAL HOUSING PROBLEMS. HOME LINE WORKS TO IMPROVE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE POLICIES RELATING TO RENTAL HOUSING BY INVOLVING AFFECTED TENANTS IN THE PROCESS. HOME LINE'S PROPOSED VISTA COHORT PROJECT ALIGNS WITH SEVERAL CNCS FOCUS AREAS, BUT THE PRIMARY FOCUS IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY IN HOUSING. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD, MAINTAIN, AND IMPROVE FORMAL AND INFORMAL NETWORKS OF LOW-INCOME RENTER HOUSEHOLDS TO BETTER ADDRESS HOUSING QUALITY, INSTABILITY, AND AFFORDABILITY ISSUES IN A VARIETY OF GEOGRAPHIC AND CULTURALLY-BASED COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE TWIN CITIES METRO AREA. WE EXPECT THIS PROJECT TO DIRECTLY BENEFIT SEVERAL HUNDRED LOW-INCOME RENTER HOUSEHOLDS. SIX VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS TENANT EDUCATION, ENGAGEMENT, ORGANIZING, AND LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF ONE TO THREE YEARS.

THE STEVE RUMMLER HOPE NETWORK'S MISSION IS TO HEIGHTEN AWARENESS OF THE DISEASE OF ADDICTION AS IT RELATES TO THE PHYSICAL AND EMOTIONAL BURDENS OF CHRONIC PAIN AND TO IMPROVE THE ASSOCIATED CARE PROCESS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A RESOURCE DATABASE THAT WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION ON ALL OF THE TREATMENT, PREVENTION AND EDUCATION SERVICES AVAILABLE WITHIN EACH GEOGRAPHIC AREA OF THE STATE OF MINNESOTA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENSURE THAT THREE OUTCOMES ARE IN PLACE: 1) COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF CONNECTIONS TO EMERGENCY RESPONSE INCREASES, 2) INTERVENTION AND TREATMENT RESOURCES ARE ACCESSIBLE AND KNOWN, 3) PRIMARY PREVENTION AND PUBLIC HEALTH AWARENESS OF OPIOID ABUSE AND INFORMATION ON TREATMENT OPTIONS ARE EXPANDED. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS EFFORT WILL BE THE COMMUNITIES IN THE 87 MINNESOTA COUNTIES AND 11 NATIVE NATIONS THAT WILL BE DIRECTLY INVOLVED IN THIS EFFORT. FOUR (4) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS MAPPING THE EXISTING ASSETS AND CHALLENGES AS THEY PERTAIN TO OPIOID ABUSE, IDENTIFYING COMMUNITY LEADERS, ORGANIZING A STATEWIDE STEERING COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF NGOS AND COMMUNITY LEADERS WHO WORK TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND COMBAT ADDICTION DISPARITIES IN MINNESOTA, EMPOWERING COMMUNITIES TO BE A VOICE ON THIS ISSUE, MAPPING RATES OF POVERTY, OPIOID ABUSE AND DEATHS, AND SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF WELL-BEING, IDENTIFYING SERVICES AND RESOURCES, AND CREATING A STATEWIDE APPLICATION TO IDENTIFY AND CONNECT EXISTING RESOURCES AND SERVICES TOGETHER OVER THE COURSE OF THREE (3) YEARS.

AS AN AGENCY IN WASHTENAW COUNTY THAT SERVES A DIVERSE, INTERNATIONAL POPULATION, THE MISSION OF JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES IS TO CREATE SOLUTIONS, PROMOTE DIGNITY AND INSPIRE HUMANITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH EMPLOYMENT/WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT OF THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND ECONOMIC INTEGRATION AND OPPORTUNITY FOR LOW INCOME POPULATIONS IN WASHTENAW COUNTY TO INCLUDE AT LEAST 200 REFUGEE AND OTHER IMMIGRANT INDIVIDUALS. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING RESOURCE GUIDES, DEVELOPING A SET OF SKILLS TRAININGS, ESTABLISH TWO ADVISORY BOARDS, DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT AN EMPLOYER ENGAGEMENT STRATEGY, AND INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SOCIAL INTEGRATION OVER AN ANTICIPATED PROJECT PERIOD.

A CORE PART OF MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION IS ADVANCING OUTREACH, ENGAGEMENT, AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE INNOVATIVE, RESEARCH-DRIVEN, AND LEAD TO A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES, AT HOME AND AROUND THE WORLD. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH BOTH MSU'S MISSION AND THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO CREATE OR EXPAND OPIOID PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, AND TREATMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT UP TO 20 HEALTH ORGANIZATIONS AND COALITIONS SERVING RESIDENTS FROM ALL ACROSS MICHIGAN. TWO VISTA LEADERS AND 20 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COORDINATING LOCAL EFFORTS TO ADDRESS SERVICE GAPS, IMPROVE COMMUNICATION WITHIN LOCAL COLLABORATIVES AND ORGANIZATIONS, AND BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THESE ENTITIES TO ADDRESS THE OPIOID ABUSE CRISIS IN PARTNERSHIP WITH A NETWORK OF MSU RESEARCH AND POLICY EXPERTS 
OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS.

MICHIGAN COALITION AGAINST HOMELESSNESS' MISSION IS TO BE DEDICATED TO CREATING A SUSTAINABLE, STATEWIDE VOICE AND THE INFRASTRUCTURE AND SYSTEMIC CHANGE NEEDED TO EMPOWER COMMUNITIES TO END HOMELESSNESS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HOUSING FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ASSIST HOUSING SERVICE PROVIDERS WITH BUILDING THEIR CAPACITY IN ORDER TO BETTER SERVE INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING AND AT-RISK OF HOMELESSNESS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 8 ORGANIZATIONS SERVING THOSE EXPERIENCING OR AT-RISK OF HOMELESSNESS. EIGHT (8) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING/EXPANDING PARTNERSHIPS, FACILITATING COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND AWARENESS, IMPLEMENTING VOLUNTEER SYSTEMS, AND GENERATING FINANCIAL RESOURCES OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

IONIA COUNTY INTERMEDIATE SCHOOL DISTRICT'S MISSION IS TO "COOPERATE AND PROVIDE SERVICES AND LEADERSHIP AS A PARTNER WITH ITS LOCAL DISTRICTS, PUBLIC AND PRIVATE AGENCIES, OTHER ISDS, THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, AND HIGHER EDUCATION, TO DELIVER QUALITY TEACHING AND LEARNING TO STUDENTS AND STAFF." THE PROPOSED PROJECT RELATES TO THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA IN THE VISTA PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES FOR 2019. VISTA MEMBERS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT AND/OR FACILITATE ACCESS TO SERVICES AND RESOURCES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO IMPROVED EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN WITH A FOCUS ON DEVELOPING SUPPORTS FOR AT-RISK CHILDREN 0-5 TO ACHIEVE SUCCESS IN SCHOOL AND PREVENT DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYS, LEARNING DISABILITIES AND REDUCED ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. THE PROPOSED THREE-YEAR PROJECT REQUESTS FOUR FULL-TIME MEMBERS WHO WILL SEEK TO BENEFIT 11,000 AT-RISK, LOW INCOME CHILDREN BY:

-PROVIDING STUDENTS WITH COMPREHENSIVE, MULTIFACETED, AND INTEGRATED SUPPORTS THAT ARE ACCESSIBLE, TIMELY, AND STRENGTH-BASED SO STUDENTS CAN ACHIEVE IN SCHOOL, BE CONFIDENT AND CARING, AND BECOME CONTRIBUTING CITIZENS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES;
-INVOLVING FAMILIES, FELLOW STUDENTS, EDUCATORS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS AS INTEGRAL PARTNERS IN THE PROVISION OF A SUPPORTIVE, RESPECTFUL LEARNING ENVIRONMENT; AND
-INTEGRATING THE HUMAN AND FINANCIAL RESOURCES OF PUBLIC AND PRIVATE AGENCIES TO CREATE CARING COMMUNITIES AT EACH SCHOOL.

*CULTURE IS NOT OPTIONAL'S COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT MISSION IS TO IMAGINE AND BUILD COLLABORATIVE FLOURISHING IN OUR RURAL CITY OF THREE RIVERS, INCLUDING DEVELOPING THE HISTORIC HUSS SCHOOL PROPERTY AS A CENTER FOR CULTIVATING COOPERATION AND CREATIVE SKILLS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD OUR CITY'S CAPACITY FOR IMAGINATION THROUGH FOOD, ART, AND PLAY, THEREBY REDUCING POVERTY, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE 7,500 CITIZENS OF THREE RIVERS WITH A PRIMARY EMPHASIS ON LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORS IN THE 2ND WARD NEIGHBORHOOD. FOUR (4) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ASSET MAPPING, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING, AND SUSTAINABLE JOB CREATION OVER THE COURSE OF THREE (3) YEARS.

THE INDIANA HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY (IHCDA) IS A BODY CORPORATE AND POLITIC OF THE STATE OF INDIANA.  IHCDA SERVES AS THE STATE'S HOUSING FINANCE AUTHORITY, ACTS AS THE COLLABORATIVE APPLICANT FOR THE BALANCE OF STATE CONTINUUM OF CARE AND SERVES THE BALANCE OF STATE AS A PUBLIC HOUSING AUTHORITY.  IHCDA ADMINISTERS A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS WHICH SEEK TO PROVIDE RESOURCES TO LOW INCOME HOOSIERS TO HELP THEM BECOME SELF SUFFICIENT AND STABLY HOUSED.

A: PUBLIC HEALTH INSTITUTE OF METROPOLITAN CHICAGO (PHIMC) ENHANCES THE CAPACITY OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND HEALTHCARE SYSTEMS TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITY AND EXPAND ACCESS TO SERVICES.  THIS PROJECT WOULD DIRECTLY SUPPORT THE WORK OF ILLINOIS SAFE SCHOOLS ALLIANCE (THE ALLIANCE), A PROGRAM OF PHIMC, WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROMOTE SAFETY, SUPPORT, AND HEALTHY DEVELOPMENT FOR LESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL, TRANSGENDER, AND QUESTIONING (LGBTQ+) YOUTH IN ILLINOIS SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITIES, THROUGH ADVOCACY, EDUCATION, YOUTH ORGANIZING, AND RESEARCH. 

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A LGBTQ+ YOUTH CONSORTIA CALLED ILLINOIS SAFE SCHOOLS CONSORTIA. THE GOAL OF THIS CONSORTIA, COMPRISED OF EDUCATIONAL LEADERS THROUGHOUT IL, AIMS TO BUILD MODEL POLICIES, SYSTEMS, AND CULTURES THROUGHOUT IL SCHOOLS  THAT STRENGTHEN ACADEMIC, SOCIAL, AND EMOTIONAL SUCCESS AMONG LGBTQ+ YOUTH GRADES K-12. OVER THE COURSE OF TWO YEARS, FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROJECT GOALS BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING CONSORTIA REPRESENTATIVES, IDENTIFYING REGION-SPECIFIC RESOURCES, DEVELOPING SUSTAINABLE TOOLKITS AND MATERIALS, BUILDING A TRAINING OF TRAINERS SYSTEM, STREAMLINING COMMUNICATIONS, DEVELOPING EVALUATION METHODS, AND BUILDING INFRASTRUCTURE TO COLLECT DATA THAT BETTER TRACKS LGBTQ+ STUDENTS IN GRADES K-12 THROUGHOUT ILLINOIS.

ST. CROIX FOUNDATION FOR COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT?S MISSION IS TO ENCOURAGE GREATER PHILANTHROPIC ACTIVITY, TO MARSHAL RESOURCES AND TO ACT AS CATALYST TO BENEFIT THE PEOPLE OF ST. CROIX. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE AMERICORPS VISTA FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO FIGHT POVERTY AND BUILD CAPACITY AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 300 UNDERSERVED YOUTH. 14 VISTA MEMBERS AND A VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY OUTREACH, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND GRANT RESEARCH OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS.

GROUNDWORK RHODE ISLAND (GWRI) IS A COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO ADDRESSING THE DUAL NEEDS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY IN RHODE ISLAND'S URBAN COMMUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. OUR GOAL IS TO ASSIST LOW-INCOME PEOPLE FROM HIGH-POVERTY AREAS WHO FACE BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT, TO GAIN SKILLS, CERTIFICATIONS, AND AWARENESS THAT WILL HELP THEM MOVE INTO FULFILLING EMPLOYMENT. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO: 1) IMPROVE OUR JOB SKILLS TRAINING PROGRAMS THAT WILL LEAD TO INCREASED EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR 30 LOW-INCOME AND FORMERLY-INCARCERATED YOUTH/ADULTS PER YEAR; AND 2) CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL IMPROVEMENTS THAT BENEFIT HIGH-POVERTY URBAN COMMUNITIES. ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: CONDUCTING OUTREACH TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF LOW-INCOME PEOPLE ENTERING OUR PROGRAM, HELPING MATCH GRADUATES WITH EMPLOYERS, JOBS, AND OTHER PLACEMENTS, DEVELOPING COMMUNICATIONS MATERIALS, AND TRACKING THE SUCCESS OF GRADUATES AFTER THEY LEAVE THE PROGRAM. THE VISTA WILL ALSO BE INVOLVED IN BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF GWRI'S OWN SOCIAL VENTURES IN ORDER TO CREATE NEW EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR GRADUATES OF OUR JOB TRAINING PROGRAM. THE PROJECT THE VISTA WILL BE WORKING ON IS APPROPRIATE FOR A 1-3 YEAR TERM OF SERVICE.

SINCE 1953 THE MISSION OF RHODE ISLAND FOR COMMUNITY AND JUSTICE HAS BEEN TO FIGHT BIAS, BIGOTRY AND RACISM BY PROMOTING UNDERSTANDING AND RESPECT AMONG ALL RACES, CULTURES AND RELIGIONS.  RICJ PROGRAMS SEEK TO END THE RACIAL AND ETHNIC DISPARITIES THAT RESULT IN POVERTY AND TO BUILD INCLUSIVE COMMUNITIES.  

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREAS OF 1-ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY: EMPLOYMENT/WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, 2-EDUCATION: SUCCESS IN K-12 EDUCATION; AND 3-HEALTHY FUTURES: ACCESS TO MENTAL HEALTH CARE FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED YOUTH.  

THE VISTA PROJECT HAS THE GOAL OF EMPOWERING URBAN LOW INCOME YOUTH OF COLOR, PROMOTING SCHOOL AND CAREER SUCCESS AND PREVENTING THE SCHOOL-TO-PRISON PIPELINE THROUGH COMMUNITY-BASED SUPPORTIVE SERVICES.  WE EXPECT THIS PROGRAM WILL BENEFIT 250 LOW INCOME URBAN YOUTH THROUGH LEADERSHIP AND WORKFORCE EDUCATION SERVICES, AND BENEFIT 350 ARRESTED JUVENILES THROUGH INCREASED ACCESS TO COMMUNITY DIVERSION WITH MENTAL HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES.    

TWO (2) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING PARTICIPANTS, MARKETING, EVALUATING AND IMPROVING CURRICULA, REPORTING ON OUTCOME DATA, OUTREACHING TO COMMUNITY, SEEKING RESOURCES, AND COLLABORATING WITH PROGRAM PARTNERS TO SUSTAIN THE PROGRAMS, OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS.

THE RHODE ISLAND COALITION FOR THE HOMELESS?S MISSION IS TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY TO CREATE AND ADVANCE LASTING SOLUTIONS TO PREVENT AND END HOMELESSNESS IN RHODE ISLAND. THE SSI/SSDI, OUTREACH, ACCESS, AND RECOVERY (SOAR) INITIATIVE, COORDINATED BY THE COALITION,  IS DEDICATED TO SERVING THE MOST VULNERABLE MEMBERS OF OUR COMMUNITY BY AIDING THEM IN THE PROCESS OF APPLYING FOR DISABILITY BENEFITS.  THROUGH MEANINGFUL COLLABORATION, WE STRIVE TO EXPEDITE THE PROCESS OF APPLYING FOR BENEFITS AND CONNECT THOSE WE SERVE WITH THE RESOURCES NECESSARY FOR RECOVERY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE ACCESS TO SSI/SSDI BENEFITS FOR INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS AND, BY PROXY, INCREASE HEALTH OUTCOMES AND HOUSING STABILITY.  THE VISTA PROJECT AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT AN ADDITIONAL 200 INDIVIDUALS BY THE CONCLUSION OF THE PROJECT WITH EXPONENTIAL IMPACT FOLLOWING THE CONCLUSION. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROJECT GOAL OF INCREASING ACCESS TO SOCIAL SECURITY DISABILITY BENEFITS BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS FUNDRAISING, GRANT WRITING, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, TRAINING, AND PILOTING NEW INITIATIVES OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ARP RESOURCES TO EXPAND THIS PROJECT'S WORK IN THE AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. TO DO THIS RHODE ISLAND FREE CLINIC WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING HIGH LEVEL ACTIVITIES: PROVIDE MEDICAL CARE AT NO-COST TO LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS, INCREASE EQUITABLE ACCESS TO CARE FOR HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED POPULATIONS, AND EXPAND THEIR EXISTING NETWORK OF PARTNERS AND STAKEHOLDERS TO SUPPORT THIS WORK. THIS WILL BENEFIT LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND. GENERAL EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE RECRUITING AT LEAST 500 VOLUNTEERS, AND LEVERAGING RESOURCES TO SUPPORT THE CLINIC'S BUDGET WHICH IS RAISED ENTIRELY THROUGH DONATIONS AND IN-KIND MEDICAL SERVICES.

THE MISSION OF THE NONVIOLENCE INSTITUTE IS TO TEACH, BY WORD AND EXAMPLE, THE PRINCIPLES AND PRACTICE OF NONVIOLENCE, AND TO FOSTER A COMMUNITY THAT ADDRESSES POTENTIALLY VIOLENT SITUATIONS WITH NONVIOLENT SOLUTIONS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT FITS WITHIN THE PRIORITY AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, INCLUDING EMPLOYMENT/WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND HOUSING. THE GOAL OF THE VISTA PROJECT IS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE NONVIOLENCE INSTITUTE IN ORDER TO EFFECTIVELY SERVE MORE THAN 1800 CLIENTS EACH YEAR THAT ARE IMPACTED BY VIOLENCE IN OUR URBAN CORE CITIES. THE INSTITUTE IS UNIQUE IN THE FIELD IN THAT WE SERVE PERPETRATORS AS WELL AS VICTIMS, AS WE WORK TO BUILD THE BELOVED HEALTHY COMMUNITY ENVISIONED BY REV. DR. MARTIN LUTHER KING. THE TWO VISTAS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE ORGANIZATION AS THEY IDENTIFY NEW DONORS AND NEW FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES TO SUPPORT OUR WORK, ADAPT OUR NONVIOLENCE CONFLICT RESOLUTION CURRICULUM TO MEET THE NEEDS OF NEW AUDIENCES AND DEVELOP THE POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND SYSTEMS THAT SUPPORT EFFECTIVE WORKFLOW WITHIN THE DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT AND THE TRAINING DEPARTMENT. THE WORK UNDERTAKEN BY THE VISTAS OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS WILL ENSURE THAT THE NONVIOLENCE INSTITUTE HAS THE RESOURCES, SYSTEMS AND CAPACITY TO ACCOMPLISH OUR MISSION.

THE PENINSULA OF CANTERA'S COMMUNITY IS A MARGINALIZED, IMPOVERISHED, DENSELY POPULATED NEIGHBORHOOD LOCATED IN THE HEART OF SAN JUAN WITH AN ESTIMATED POPULATION OF 9,412 RESIDENTS (CENSUS, 2012). IT WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1930'S WHEN A GROUP OF RESIDENTS FROM OTHER PARTS OF THE ISLAND SETTLED AND SEQUESTERED THE WETLAND AND MADE POORLY CONSTRUCTED HOUSES WITH NO INFRASTRUCTURE FACILITIES. ACTUALLY, PENINSULA DE CANTERA IS COMPOSED OF SIXTEEN DIFFERENT SECTORS: THREE PUBLIC HOUSING PROJECTS, A MULTIPLE HOUSING COOPERATIVE PROJECT, SEVEN SECTORS CALLED SLUMS AND FIVE NEW MULTIPLE HOUSING PROJECTS. THE MAIN OBJECTIVE OF THE PENINSULA OF CANTERA PROJECT IS TRANSFORMING THE LIVING CONDITIONS OF THE FAMILIES THAT INHABIT ITS DIFFERENT SECTORS THROUGH THE COORDINATED EFFORTS BETWEEN THE COMMUNITY, THE PRIVATE SECTOR, AND THE GOVERNMENT.

THE COMPANY FOR THE INTEGRAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE PENINSULA OF CANTERA (CDIPC, AS ITS INITIALS IN SPANISH) IS A QUASI-PUBLIC CORPORATION CREATED BY LAW, ACT 20 OF JULY 10, 1992, AS AMENDED, TO PROMOTE THE COMPREHENSIVE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PENINSULA OF CANTERA IN SAN JUAN, AS A MODEL DEVELOPMENT PLAN FOR COMMUNITIES ACROSS PUERTO RICO; ENABLE THE INTEGRATION OF THE COMMUNITY, PRIVATE SECTOR, MUNICIPAL GOVERNMENT, AND CENTRAL GOVERNMENT IN SUCH EFFORTS; AND ENSURE THAT THE PENINSULA DE CANTERA'S DEVELOPMENT IS DIRECTED TOWARDS THE BENEFIT OF ITS RESIDENTS, FOR THEM TO CONTINUE TO ENJOY IN BETTER LIVING CONDITIONS THE  PROPERTIES THEY CURRENTLY OCCUPY. SINCE THE CREATION OF THE COMPANY, THESE GOALS HAVE BEEN LARGELY ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF HOUSING PROJECTS, LIGHTING AND SEWAGE SYSTEMS; THE PAVING OF ROADS; THE CONSTRUCTION OF SCHOOLS, RECREATIONAL PARKS, AND TOURIST ATTRACTIONS; AND THE CREATION OF COMMUNITY-BASED EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, SUCH AS THE CASA EDUCATIVA. HOWEVER, IT IS STIPULATED BY LAW THAT THIS PUBLIC CORPORATION WILL CEASE TO EXIST ON JUNE 30, 2033, WHICH IS WHY THERE NEEDS TO BE A TRANSITIONAL PROCESS IN WHICH THE CONSEJO VECINAL ASSUMES THE LEADERSHIP OF THE PENINSULA OF CANTERA PROJECT AND ALL OF ITS ACTIVITIES. FOR THIS REASON, THE COMPANY MUST PURSUE ADDITIONAL FUNDS THAT SUPPORT NEW SOCIO-ECONOMIC PROJECTS THAT PER DUE THE CORPORATION'S CLOSURE AND ARE INHERITED BY THE CONSEJO VECINAL.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CAPACITY BUILDING FOCUS AREA, HAVING AN INDIRECT IMPACT ON OTHERS TWO FOCUS AREA: THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES AND COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT OF LEADERSHIP SKILLS IN THE LEADERS OF THE CONSEJO VECINAL, DEVELOP INSTRUMENTS FOR THE COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS OF DATA, IDENTIFY EXTERNAL SOURCES THAT ATTRACT RESOURCES TO THE SOCIO-ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM OF PENINSULA OF CANTERA AND EXPECTS AN INDIRECTLY BENEFIT TO 9,412 RESIDENTS OF PENINSULA OF CANTERA. THREE (3) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS THE CREATION OF AN INSTRUMENT FOR THE COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS OF DATA THAT REINFORCES THE IDENTIFICATION AND REQUEST OF EXTERNAL FUNDS AND GRANT OPPORTUNITIES, THEY WILL INVESTIGATE THE GENERAL THEORY, PRACTICE, AND IMPACT OF CURRENT AND FUTURE SOCIO-ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS IMPLEMENTED IN PENINSULA OF CANTERA. IN ADDITION, THEY WILL IDENTIFY SOCIO-ECONOMIC INDICATORS THAT WILL BE USED TO INFORM AND EVALUATE DECISION-MAKING THAT INFLUENCES THE PENINSULA OF CANTERA'S RESIDENTS, AND RECOMMEND HOW THOSE INDICATORS SHOULD BE USED TO IDENTIFY PRIORITIES AND DESIGN FUTURE PROJECTS. FINALLY, WITH THE HELP OF THE VISTAS, THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVES COMMITTEE WILL IDENTIFY AND SUBMIT ADDITIONAL LOCAL, FEDERAL, AND PRIVATE SOURCES OF FOUNDING TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY WORK FOR OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS.

SAVE THE CHILDREN
OUR VISION IS A WORLD IN WHICH EVERY CHILD  ATTAINS THE RIGHT TO SURVIVAL, PROTECTION,  DEVELOPMENT AND PARTICIPATION.  
OUR MISSION IS TO INSPIRE BREAKTHROUGHS  IN THE WAY THE WORLD TREATS CHILDREN,  AND TO ACHIEVE IMMEDIATE AND LASTING CHANGE IN THEIR LIVES. SAVE THE CHILDREN PUERTO RICO HAS FOCUSED PROGRAMMING THAT PRIORITIZES THE MOST VULNERABLE CHILD POPULATIONS ACROSS THE ISLAND. THESE INCLUDE CHILDREN LIVING IN AREAS HARDEST HIT BY HURRICANE MARIA; THE MOST ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN; AND THOSE CHILDREN LIVING IN HARDEST TO REACH AREAS WHERE SERVICES ARE LACKING. THE ESTIMATED TIME REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT IS ONE YEAR AS OF TODAY INFORMATION.

CLARION COUNTY HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION'S MISSION IS, REJUVENATE AND DEVELOP THE AFFORDABLE HOUSING STOCK WITHIN CLARION COUNTY AND SURROUNDING AREAS THROUGH COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, FOCUSING ON IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND PROVIDING SERVICES TO THE RESIDENTS OF OUR COMMUNITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO LOWER POVERTY, AND COMBAT COUNTYWIDE BLIGHT FOR THE BETTERMENT OF CLARION COUNTY, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 38,458 INDIVIDUALS. THIS IS THE ENTIRE POPULATION OF CLARION COUNTY DUE TO THE NATURE OF OUR PROJECT, BY COMBATING COUNTYWIDE BLIGHT ALL MEMBERS OF COUNTY WILL REAP THE BENEFITS. WE ANTICIPATE BENEFITING AN AVERAGE OF 75-85 HOUSEHOLDS PER MONTH, THROUGH OUR REENTRY PROGRAMING BASED ON STATISTICS FROM A PREVIOUSLY ADMINISTERED PROGRAM. ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS WORKING TOWARDS PERMANENT FUNDING FOR OUR REGIONAL REENTRY PLAN, CREATING AND MAINTAINING BENEFICIAL CONTACTS, LOWERING POVERTY WITHIN CLARION COUNTY AND COMBATING COUNTYWIDE BLIGHT OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

COMMUNITY ACTION ASSOCIATION OF PENNSYLVANIA'S MISSION IS: CAAP EMPOWERS COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCIES TO SOLVE COMMUNITY PROBLEMS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOLLOWING FOCUS AREAS: CAPACITY BUILDING, HEALTHY FUTURES,  AND EDUCATION. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ASSIST LOW INCOME FAMILIES, VETERANS, AND STUDENTS FROM K-12. THIRTEEN VISTA MEMBERS PLUS 1 VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS LITERACY AND TUTORING, DEVELOPMENT OF A FARMERS MARKET, FOOD SECURITY, IT CURRICULUM,  REBRANDING EFFORTS, AGENCY TOOLKITS TO HELP CHANGE THE DIALOGUE ABOUT POVERTY, PATH WAY TO APPRENTICESHIPS AND OPIOID EDUCATION OVER THE COURSE OF THE THREE YEAR PROJECT.

NATIONALITIES SERVICE CENTER IS A COMPREHENSIVE MULTI-SERVICE IMMIGRANT AND REFUGEE AGENCY SERVING THE GREATER PHILADELPHIA REGION. THIS CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT IN PARTNERSHIP WITH NCS VISTA WILL ALLOW US TO DEVELOP OUR CAPACITY TO PROVIDE ENGLISH LANGUAGE EDUCATION, EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING OPTIONS AND HOUSING SUPPORTS TO VULNERABLE NEWCOMERS IN THE REGION.

CONGRESO DE LATINOS UNIDOS, INC. (CONGRESO) REQUESTS THREE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS TO SUPPORT WITH THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF OUR AGENCY'S MISSION TO IMPACT, A PROJECT THROUGH WHICH CONGRESO IS ENHANCING CURRENT SERVICES AND CREATING NEW PROGRAMMING TO MOST EFFECTIVELY SERVE OUR COMMUNITY. CONGRESO'S MISSION TO IMPACT IS THE RESULT OF OUR RECENTLY REFRESHED THEORY OF CHANGE, WHICH IS BASED ON A "WOMB-TO-WORK" STRATEGY: WE BELIEVE THAT OFFERING QUALITY PROGRAMMING IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, HEALTH, HOUSING, AND PARENTING WILL ENABLE YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES TO ACHIEVE ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND WELL-BEING. ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL BE ASSIGNED TO ONE OF EACH OF CONGRESO'S THREE PROGRAMMATIC DIVISIONS: EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE SERVICES (EWS), FAMILY AND HOUSING SERVICES (FHS), AND HEALTH PROMOTION AND WELLNESS (HPW). EACH PROGRAMMATIC DIVISION CORRESPONDS WITH ONE OF AMERICORPS VISTA'S FOCUS AREAS: EWS CORRESPONDS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS, FHS CORRESPONDS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS, AND HPW CORRESPONDS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS. 

IN YEAR 1 OF THE PROPOSED MISSION TO IMPACT PROJECT, CONGRESO'S THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL PROVIDE CAPACITY BUILDING SUPPORT TO PROGRAM STAFF, LEADERSHIP, AND CONSULTANTS BY CONDUCTING LITERATURE REVIEWS OF BEST PRACTICES IN THE FIELD AND HELPING TO CREATE A COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT THROUGH WHICH CONGRESO STAFF WILL IMPLEMENT CLIENT VOICE TO A HIGHER DEGREE IN PROGRAMMING IN ORDER TO MOST EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS CLIENTS' NEEDS. VISTAS WILL ALSO SUPPORT WITH "DESIGN LAB" WORKSHOPS, THE PROCESS THROUGH WHICH CONGRESO IS IMPLEMENTING HUMAN-CENTERED DESIGN (HCD), INTO ALL PROGRAMMING, BOTH NEW AND CURRENT. HCD IS A MANAGEMENT FRAMEWORK THAT DEVELOPS SOLUTIONS BY INVOLVING THE HUMAN PERSPECTIVE IN ALL STEPS OF THE PROBLEM-SOLVING PROCESS, SIMULTANEOUSLY MATCHING CLIENTS' EXPECTATIONS, PERSONAL VALUES, AND BELIEF SYSTEMS TO PROGRAM DESIGN. TYPICALLY USED IN THE PRIVATE SECTOR, HCD IS INCREASINGLY BECOMING RECOGNIZED IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR FOR ITS TRANSFERABILITY TO SOCIAL SERVICES. 

CONGRESO'S COMMUNITY IN EASTERN NORTH PHILADELPHIA FACES NUMEROUS BARRIERS TO ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND WELL-BEING, INCLUDING UNEMPLOYMENT, LOW EDUCATIONAL LEVELS, UNSAFE AND UNAFFORDABLE HOUSING, HEALTH DISPARITIES, AND VIOLENCE. OF THE 17,567 UNDUPLICATED CLIENTS CONGRESO SERVED IN FY18, 73% WERE LATINO AND 58% SPOKE SPANISH AS A PRIMARY LANGUAGE, WHICH PRESENTS ADDITIONAL BARRIERS (I.E. DISCRIMINATION, LANGUAGE BARRIERS) ON THE JOURNEY OUT OF CHRONIC POVERTY. CONGRESO, AS A MULTISERVICE ORGANIZATION, OFFERS A CONTINUUM OF SERVICES THROUGH OUR THREE PROGRAMMATIC DIVISIONS TO SUPPORT CLIENTS AS THEY WORK TOWARDS ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND WELL-BEING. AS WE STRIVE TO FURTHER ENHANCE THESE SERVICES THROUGH MISSION TO IMPACT, VISTA MEMBERS' SUPPORT WILL ENABLE CONGRESO TO ACHIEVE A LEVEL OF SUSTAINABILITY THAT WILL POSITION THE AGENCY TO MOST EFFECTIVELY SUPPORT CLIENTS AS WE WORK TOGETHER TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY IN THE YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES THAT LIVE IN OUR COMMUNITY.

AUSABLE VALLEY CENTRAL SCHOOL THROUGH OUR REGIONAL PARTNERSHIPS, THE ADIRONDACKS AMERICORPS*VISTA PROJECT (AACV)PROJECT'S MISSION IS TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OUR RURAL, LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY THROUGH COLLECTIVE ACTION AND ASSET BASED COMMUNITY SOLUTIONS BY UTILIZING REGIONAL DATA AND VISTA SUPPORT TO IMPROVE OUTCOMES IN HOUSING AND FOOD INSECURITY, K-12 EDUCATION,  STEM EDUCATION & EMPLOYMENT, AND FAMILY DEVELOPMENT THROUGH AN ANTI-POVERTY FOCUS THAT EMPOWERS THE COMMUNITY THROUGH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS AND CAPACITY BUILDING. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO 1) ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE RURAL, LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY THROUGH COLLABORATIVE AND COLLECTIVE ACTION PROBLEM SOLVING AND ASSET BASED COMMUNITY SOLUTIONS BY UTILIZING REGIONAL DATA TO IMPROVE OUTCOMES FOR THE REGION. 2) DEVELOP SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO SYSTEMIC POVERTY ISSUES BY CREATING PROGRAMS AND SERVICES THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF THE RURAL LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY AND SECURING FUNDING TO SUSTAIN THESE EFFORTS; ALL ACCOMPANIED BY DATA METRICS TO DETERMINE EFFICIENCY AND OUTCOME IMPACT. 3) EDUCATING AND ENGAGING THE GENERAL PUBLIC ABOUT THESE EFFORTS THROUGH VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES AND TARGETED EDUCATIONAL CAMPAIGNS IN OUR REGION THROUGH EVENTS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT AT LEAST 500 OR MORE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS ACROSS ALL SITES.  14 VISTA MEMBERS AND A VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS:  1) VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, TRAINING AND RETENTION 2) CREATING AND IMPLEMENTING MARKETING PLAN AND OUTREACH PLAN TO EDUCATE COMMUNITY ABOUT AVAILABLE SERVICES AND PROVIDING SERVICES TO LOW INCOME PEOPLE AND OTHER VULNERABLE POPULATIONS 3) COORDINATING HEALTHY EATING PROGRAMS AND REGIONAL FOOD SHELF SYSTEMS, ALONG WITH FUNDING AND MARKETING OF SUCH PROGRAMS 4) DESIGNING VOLUNTEER PROGRAMMING FOR TARGETED EDUCATION PROGRAMS WITHIN WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT 4) HELPING TO DESIGN, CONDUCT AND IMPLEMENT RECOMMENDATIONS FROM A HOUSING ASSESSMENT STUDY OF OUR REGION OVER THE COURSE OF 4 YEARS. 5) ENHANCING EFFECTIVENESS WITHIN ALL SPONSOR SITE DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS, SPONSORED EVENTS, FUNDRAISING, AND INFORMATION AND/OR COMMUNICATION PLANS 6) COORDINATE ALL SERVICES ACROSS SPONSOR SITES AND REGIONAL TEAMS INCLUDING THE VOLUNTARY ORGANIZATIONS ACTIVE IN DISASTER OF THE ADIRONDACK REGION 7) INCREASE K-12 EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES AND EFFICIENCIES THROUGH VARIOUS PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT FOR THE 21ST CENTURY LEARNER.

THE MISSION OF CHILDREN'S AID IS TO HELP CHILDREN IN POVERTY TO SUCCEED AND THRIVE. WE DO THIS BY PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE SUPPORTS TO CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND THEIR FAMILIES IN TARGETED HIGH-NEEDS NEW YORK CITY NEIGHBORHOODS, INCLUDING THE SOUTH BRONX. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS DIRECTLY WITH OUR MISSION ON THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AND EXPAND OUR BRONX IMPACT INITIATIVE, A COLLECTIVE IMPACT STRATEGY THAT INCLUDES LAUNCHING AND PROMOTING AN ONLINE SEARCH AND REFERRAL PLATFORM WE ARE CALLING MY.BRONXIMPACT.ORG. WE EXPECT OVER 200 NONPROFITS AND COUNTLESS BRONXITES TO BENEFIT FROM THE PROJECT. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING CAPACITY-BUILDING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DESIGNING TRAINING MATERIALS FOR NONPROFIT PROVIDERS, DEVELOPING "POP-UP" ENGAGEMENT EVENTS TO BE DEPLOYED THROUGHOUT THE BOROUGH, AND SPREADING THE WORD ABOUT THE PLATFORM THROUGH VARIOUS MEDIA OVER THE COURSE OF THEIR VISTA YEAR.

UNITED WAY OF THE GREATER CAPITAL REGION IMPROVES LIVES AND ADVANCES THE COMMON GOOD IN THE GREATER CAPITAL REGION. BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF DONORS, VOLUNTEERS, AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO GIVE, ADVOCATE, AND VOLUNTEER, WE ARE EQUIPPED TO WORK WITH AND HELP LOCAL PEOPLE IN NEED. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THREE OF CNCS'S FOCUS AREAS: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND EDUCATION. THE FUNDED PARTNERS THAT UNITED WAY ACTIVELY SUPPORTS MEETS THE CRITERIA TO FIT INTO THOSE THREE CATEGORIES, AS THEIR INDIVIDUAL MISSION STATEMENTS AND GOALS ALIGN WITH AT LEAST ONE OR MORE OF THE FOCUS AREAS SUPPORTED BY CNCS. THROUGH STRENGTHENING VOLUNTEERISM AT THE COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS THAT WE SERVE, THE VISTAS ARE SUPPORTING ECONOMIC GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT, INCREASING THE ACCESS OF AND SERVICES TO LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS TO MEET THEIR BASIC HEALTH NEEDS, AND ENHANCING EDUCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMS TARGETED AT YOUTH IN LOW-INCOME AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT PROPOSED BY OUR ORGANIZATION WILL POSITIVELY AFFECT THE SEVEN COUNTIES THAT WE SERVE (ALBANY, SARATOGA, SCHENECTADY, SCHOHARIE, RENSSELAER, COLUMBIA, AND GREENE) BY PROMOTING AND EXPANDING VOLUNTEERISM IN THOSE COUNTIES TO DECREASE THE SERVICE GAPS BETWEEN THE COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS UTILIZING THEIR SERVICES. RECEIVING TWO VISTAS WILL ALLOW FOR THEM TO WORK TOGETHER FOR ONE YEAR AT UNITED WAY TO DEVELOP AND EXPAND VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES TO PROMOTE HUMAN CAPITAL BY DIRECTLY ENGAGING WITH THE COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND DONOR COMPANIES TO MAXIMIZE THEIR POTENTIAL TO ADEQUATELY SERVE LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES.

HUNGER FREE AMERICANS (HFA) IS A NATIONAL NONPROFIT GROUP BUILDING A NONPARTISAN, GRASS-ROOTS MEMBERSHIP MOVEMENT TO ENACT THE POLICIES AND PROGRAMS NEEDED TO END DOMESTIC HUNGER AND ENSURE THAT ALL AMERICANS HAVE SUFFICIENT ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD. THE PROPOSED PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL ASSIST UNEMPLOYED AND UNDER-EMPLOYED PEOPLE OBTAIN JOB TRAINING, JOB PLACEMENT, AND FINANCIAL LITERACY SERVICES; IMPROVE ACCESS TO FOOD FROM GOVERNMENT AND NONPROFIT SOURCES FOR TARGETED POPULATIONS IN PARTICULAR AND FOOD INSECURE PEOPLE IN GENERAL; ENABLE RESIDENTS OF FOOD DESERTS TO ACCESS HEALTHIER FOODS THROUGH FARMERS MARKETS AND COMMUNITY GARDENS; ENABLE MORE LOW-INCOME CHILDREN TO OBTAIN FREE SCHOOL BREAKFASTS AND SUMMER MEALS; HELP NONPROFIT GROUPS FIGHTING HUNGER AND POVERTY TO RAISE MORE MONEY AND RECRUIT AND MANAGE MORE VOLUNTEERS, PARTICULARLY HIGH-IMPACT AND SKILLED VOLUNTEERS. TWENTY-ONE MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING OUTREACH MATERIALS, APPLYING FOR GRANTS, AND RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT.

THE HARLEM BUSINESS ALLIANCE'S MISSION IS TO DEVELOP AND ENHANCE HARLEM'S ECONOMIC STATUS BY CREATING AN ENVIRONMENT THAT PRODUCES SUCCESSFUL ENTREPRENEURS AND CREATES JOBS FOR LOCAL RESIDENTS. THE PROJECT CONFORMS TO THE CNCS ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM PRIORITY AREA AND IS A CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITY THAT WILL HELP TO LEVERAGE RESOURCES.  THE RESEARCH AND HBA'S EXPERIENCE DEMONSTRATE THAT HELPING ASPIRING ENTREPRENEURS AND HELPING TO GROW AND SUSTAIN LOCAL BUSINESSES CAN PROVIDE A PATHWAY OUT OF POVERTY FOR HARLEM'S RESIDENTS AND CONTRIBUTE TO THE ECONOMIC HEALTH OF THE COMMUNITY. THE PROJECT GOAL IS TO HIRE A VISTA AS A FUND DEVELOPMENT ASSISTANT WHO WILL HELP TO INCREASE THE ORGANIZATION'S FUND-RAISING CAPABILITY IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN EXISTING PROGRAMS AND SERVICES AND GROW THE CAPACITY TO SERVE HARLEM'S LOWER INCOME CONSTITUENTS AND THE COMMUNITY.  THE VISTA FOCUS WILL INVOLVE GRANT FUNDING FROM CORPORATE, FOUNDATION AND GOVERNMENT SOURCES WITH A PARTICULAR FOCUS ON THE SPECIAL PROGRAMS THAT TARGET LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS AS WELL AS GENERAL OPERATING FUNDS; RESEARCHING OTHER POTENTIAL FUNDING AVENUES; AND DEVELOPING AND MAINTAINING A TRACKING SYSTEM FOR GRANT RELATED ACTIVITIES. THIS PROJECT WILL REQUIRE THE FULL TIME SERVICES OF ONE VISTA FOR ONE YEAR.

NEW YORK STATE HOMES AND COMMUNITY RENEWAL (HCR)'S MISSION IS TO BUILD, PRESERVE AND PROTECT AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND INCREASE HOME OWNERSHIP ACROSS THE STATE. HCR'S UNIT OF HOME OWNERSHIP AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, WHICH CONSISTS OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK MORTGAGE AGENCY (SONYMA) AND THE OFFICE OF COMMUNITY RENEWAL (OCR), IS APPLYING TO SPONSOR THIS AMERICORP VISTA PROJECT. SONYMA OFFERS COMPETITIVE MORTGAGES WITH SPECIFIC FEATURES TO HELP LOW- AND MODERATE-INCOME NEW YORKERS BECOME HOME OWNERS. OCR ADMINISTERS GRANT PROGRAMS TO CREATE AND PRESERVE AFFORDABLE HOME OWNERSHIP FOR LOW- AND MODERATE-INCOME NEW YORKERS AND TO STABILIZE COMMUNITIES BY MAKING INVESTMENTS TO PLANNING AND INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS. 

AS PART OF A NEWLY CREATED HOMEOWNERSHIP PRESERVATION INITIATIVE ("HPI"), THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO PRESERVE AFFORDABLE HOUSING OPPORTUNITIES IN MANUFACTURED HOME PARK COMMUNITIES, OF WHICH THERE ARE NEARLY 2,000 PARK COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE. TO DO SO, THE PROJECT WILL MAKE AVAILABLE AFFORDABLE FINANCING TO IMPROVE SUBSTANDARD HOMES LOCATED ON LEASED LAND IN PARK COMMUNITIES AND MAKE INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS OF ESSENTIAL COMMUNITY AMENITIES IN PARK COMMUNITIES. IN ADDITION, THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENSURE THAT FAMILIES WHO RENT HOMES AND/OR LAND IN THESE PARK COMMUNITIES HAVE ACCESS TO FAIR AND LONG-TERM LEASES, WHILE PRESERVING THEIR OPPORTUNITY TO SHIFT INTO HOMEOWNERSHIP OVER TIME. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES CNCS FOCUS AREA, PARTICULARLY GIVEN ITS EMPHASIS ON HOUSING AND FINANCIAL LITERACY.

THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL BENEFIT VERY-LOW, LOW-, AND MODERATE-INCOME RESIDENTS WHO RESIDE OR WOULD LIKE TO RESIDE IN MANUFACTURED HOME PARK COMMUNITIES. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THE HPI WILL LEND TO AT LEAST 5 MANUFACTURED HOME PARK COMMUNITIES A YEAR, OF WHICH WILL PROVIDE AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND STABILITY TO APPROXIMATELY 175 RESIDENTS ANNUALLY. 

NINE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS (1) TRACKING INDUSTRY TRENDS, (2) BUILDING INDUSTRY RELATIONSHIPS, (3) CONDUCTING EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF HCR HOUSING RESOURCES, INCLUDING AFFORDABLE MORTGAGE PRODUCTS AND HOUSING GRANT PROGRAMS, AND (4) PROVIDING QUALITATIVE INFORMATION AND FEEDBACK TO HCR STAFF TO GUIDE THE PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT.

IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT FOLLOWING TWO CONSECUTIVE YEARS OF UTILIZING VISTA RESOURCES, THE LOCAL ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS AND PARK COMMUNITIES WILL BE SUFFICIENTLY KNOWLEDGEABLE ABOUT HCR?S HOUSING RESOURCES THAT HCR'S ABILITY TO REACH LOW- AND MODERATE-INCOME NEW YORKERS WILL BE MEASURABLY INCREASED AND SELF-SUSTAINING.

THE GREATER NEWARK ENTERPRISES CORPORATION (GNEC) IS BOTH A 501(C)(3) AND CERTIFIED CDFI MICROENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATION WITH A PROVEN RECORD OF DELIVERING CAPITAL AND MICROENTERPRISE SERVICES TO DISADVANTAGED MICROENTREPRENEURS IN THE NORTHERN NEW JERSEY AREAS OF ESSEX, HUDSON, PASSAIC, BERGEN, MIDDLESEX, UNION AND MONMOUTH COUNTIES OF NEW JERSEY.  THE URBAN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROJECT ALLINGS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY PRIORITIES OF CNCS.  THE UEDP WILL SEEK TO ASSIST OVER 500 UNIQUE INDIVIDUALS SECURE SUSTAINABLE INCOMES THROUGH THE CREATION AND EXPANSIONS OF SMALL BUSINESSES.  THE TWO AMERICORP VISTA VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST CLIENTS BY PROVIDING  SMALL BUSINESS AND FINANCIAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
FOR MORE THAN 54 YEARS SINCE ITS FOUNDING IN THE CITY OF NEWARK, THE MISSION OF UNITED COMMUNITY CORPORATION (UCC) HAS BEEN TO ASSIST IMPOVERISHED, HOMELESS, LOW-INCOME, DISADVANTAGED, AT-RISK INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH A CONTINUUM OF CARE, SOCIAL SERVICES, LIFE SKILLS TRAINING AND REFERRALS TO PARTNERING AGENCIES, WHICH WILL MOTIVATE AND EMPOWER THEM TO ACHIEVE ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND STABILITY WHILE ENHANCING THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE AND STANDARD OF LIVING.    
THE PROPOSED UCC VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FY 2019 CNCS FOCUS AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, WHICH IS COMPRISED OF THE PRIORITIES OF EMPLOYMENT/WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND HOUSING. THESE ARE TWO PRIMARY AREAS OF NEED THAT UCC ADDRESSES IN THE CITY OF NEWARK. THE UCC VISTA PROJECT GOAL IS TO HELP INDIVIDUALS GROW OUT OF POVERTY BY IDENTIFYING THE MOST CRITICAL NEEDS IN OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH AN UPDATED AND COMPREHENSIVE NEEDS ASSESSMENT WITH COMMUNITY INPUT THAT WILL ASSIST UCC IN THE RE-ALIGNMENT WHERE NECESSARY OF ITS EXISTING PROGRAMS AND IDENTIFYING NEW OR EMERGING NEEDS THAT ARE BARRIERS TO BUILDING SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO THE WAR ON POVERTY. UCC SERVES APPROXIMATELY 9,000 UNDUPLICATED CLIENTS EACH YEAR THAT WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS VISTA PROJECT. IT OUR THE BELIEF THAT THE NUMBER OF CLIENTS SERVED WILL INCREASE IN YEARS 2 AND 3 OF THE VISTA PROJECT AS NEW COMMUNITY NEEDS ARE IDENTIFIED, UCC CAPACITY IS INCREASED, EXISTING UCC PROGRAMS ARE RE-ALIGNED WHERE NECESSARY AND NEW PROGRAMS IMPLEMENTED AS A RESULT OF THE NEW COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT. THE FIVE (5) VISTA MEMBERS THAT UCC IS REQUESTING WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THIS GOAL DURING THE FIRST YEAR OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING IMPORTANT ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SURVEY DEVELOPMENT, COLLECTION AND EVALUATION OF DATA, COMMUNITY OUTREACH, ENGAGING STAKEHOLDERS AND WORKING WITH UCC STAFF ON PROGRAM DELIVERIES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

SIMILAR TO AMERICORPS, NEW HOPE'S MISSION IS "THROUGH THE LOVE OF CHRIST, WE BUILD RESTORATIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN OUR COMMUNITY, EMPOWERING THEM TO MOVE FROM CRISIS TO SELF-SUFFICIENCY." THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA, SPECIFICALLY IN THE AREAS OF FOOD SECURITY AND MENTAL HEALTH CARE. ADDITIONALLY, THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION K-12 SUCCESS FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY BY LEVERAGING RESOURCES, RESULTING IN AN INCREASED DONOR BASE AND VOLUNTEER BASE, AS WELL AS MORE EFFECTIVE OUTCOMES FOR OVER 700 LOW-INCOME BENEFICIARIES IN PROSPECT PARK AND HALEDON, NJ. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATION AND MAINTENANCE OF DONOR, PARTICIPANT AND VOLUNTEER DATABASES; REPORTING ON FUNDERS; REPORTING ON PROGRAM OUTCOMES; REPORTING ON COMMUNITY PARTICIPANT VOLUNTEERS; EXECUTION OF VOLUNTEER TRAINING AND APPRECIATION EVENTS; AND RECRUITMENT OF VOLUNTEERS. THIS IS THE PROPOSAL FOR THE FIRST YEAR OF A THREE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD.

JEWISH FAMILY SERVICE OF ATLANTIC AND CAPE MAY COUNTIES (JFS) REQUESTS CNCS SUPPORT TO IMPLEMENT A VISTA PROGRAM TO INCREASE CAPACITY FOR ITS FOOD PROGRAMMING AND COMMUNITY INITIATIVES THAT SUPPORT LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND VULNERABLE OLDER ADULTS. JFS' MISSION IS TO MOTIVATE AND EMPOWER PEOPLE TO REALIZE THEIR POTENTIAL TO ACHIEVE PERSONAL GOALS AND ENHANCE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE THROUGH A WIDE RANGE OF SUPPORTS REGARDLESS OF THEIR RELIGION, RACE, GENDER, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, ETHNICITY, AGE OR BACKGROUND. IN KEEPING WITH JEWISH VALUES AND THE SPIRIT OF "TIKKUN OLAM" (HEALING THE WORLD), JFS IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING SERVICES INTEGRITY, COMPASSION, RESPECT AND PROFESSIONALISM.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA, BY MEETING HEALTH NEEDS FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS THROUGH THE VISTA PROGRAMMING PRIORITY OF "FOOD SECURITY: ALLEVIATING HUNGER AND INCREASING ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD." THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DEVELOP A VOLUNTEER WORKFORCE TO OPERATE JFS' FOOD AND COMMUNITY INITIATIVE PROGRAMS, WHICH ARE CURRENTLY RUN BY PAID STAFF AND SUPPORTED BY VOLUNTEERS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WOULD EXPAND THE PROGRAMS' EFFICIENCY AND IMPACT ON REGIONAL POVERTY ALLEVIATION.

THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 1000 LOW-INCOME FAMILIES OR INDIVIDUALS, DEFINED AS BELOW 185% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY INCOME LEVEL THROUGH JFS' FOOD PANTRY AND COMMUNITY INITIATIVES; 10 VULNERABLE OLDER ADULTS THROUGH JFS' KOSHER MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAM (80% OF WHOM THE AGENCY ESTIMATES ARE LOW-INCOME); AND 12 VULNERABLE OLDER ADULTS THROUGH JFS' GROCERY DELIVERY PROGRAM (30% OF WHOM THE AGENCY ESTIMATES ARE LOW-INCOME, AND ALL OF WHOM ARE HOMEBOUND).

TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CONDUCTING RESEARCH OF COMMUNITY NEEDS, RESEARCHING AND DEVELOPING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES ON BEST PRACTICES FOR VOLUNTEER WORKERS AND THEIR SUPERVISORS, SUPPORTING EXPANDED FOOD PANTRY OFFERINGS SUCH AS FRESH VEGETABLES, AND SUPPORTING EXPANDED COMMUNITY INITIATIVES, WHICH IS JFS' TERM FOR DONATION DRIVES THAT RESULT IN DONATED THANKSGIVING DINNERS, BACKPACKS, SCHOOL SUPPLIES, WINTER COATS AND HOLIDAY GIFTS. JFS EXPECTS TO IMPLEMENT THIS PROJECT OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

ATLANTICARE FOUNDATION'S , A MEMBER OF GEISINGER, MISSION IS TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN HEALTH AND HEALING, ONE PERSON AT A TIME, THROUGH CARING AND TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECTS ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION:K-12 SUCCESS, HEALTHY FUTURES: FOOD SECURITY, AND HEALTHY FUTURES: OPIOID RECOVERY FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD RESILIENCY IN CHILDREN WHICH WILL REDUCE THE NUMBER OF STUDENT ABSENCES IN PARTICIPATING SCHOOL PARTNERS THEREFORE LEADING TO MORE SUCCESSFUL STUDENT OUTCOMES, DECREASE THE NUMBER OF FOOD INSECURE PATIENTS AT THE ATLANTICARE HEALTHPLEX IN ATLANTIC CITY, AND INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS IN RECOVERY BASED ACTIVITIES AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 1,500 BENEFICIARIES. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING CONTENT FOR STUDENTS AND FACULTY THAT FOCUSES ON EMOTIONAL WELLNESS, ASSISTING WITH THE PANTRY AT THE PLEX, AND THE MANAGEMENT OF THE RECOVERY COMMUNITY CALENDAR OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR, FOR THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD.

HOPES COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP INCORPORATED'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES THAT RESPOND TO THE SOCIAL, EDUCATIONAL, AND TRAINING NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS IN AN EFFORT TO OVERCOME BARRIERS AND FIGHT THE CAUSES OF POVERTY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO CONTINUE OFFERING HIGH QUALITY COLLEGE READINESS, EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION, FINANCIAL LITERACY, HEALTHCARE NAVIGATION, AND WORKFORCE READINESS PROGRAMS, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT MORE THAN 7,000 PEOPLE. FIVE (5) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING A PLACE-BASED COLLEGE READINESS PROGRAM FRAMEWORK, DEVELOPING A COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL SAFETY AND SECURITY PLAN FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S 15 FACILITIES SPANNING THREE COUNTIES, FORMULATING A NEW STRUCTURE FOR HYPER-LOCALIZED EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING PROGRAMMING, BUILDING A DATABASE OF HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS TO FACILITATE GREATER ACCESS TO MEDICAL, DENTAL, AND MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES, AND REVAMPING THE AGENCIES FINANCIAL LITERACY CURRICULUM TO BETTER SERVE THE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME CLIENTS, OVER THE COURSE OF 36 MONTHS.

THE NEW JERSEY ASSOCIATION ON CORRECTION (NJAC)'S MISSION IS TO ENABLE SOCIAL JUSTICE AND HUMAN DIGNITY TO BE MANIFEST IN THE POLICIES AND INSTITUTIONS GOVERNING VICTIMS OF CRIME AND OFFENDERS, AS WELL AS INDIVIDUALS IN NEED OF SOCIAL SERVICES, THROUGH REHABILITATIVE, EDUCATIONAL, AND LEGISLATIVE PROGRAMS.  ONE OF OUR MAIN GOALS WITHIN THIS IS TO ELIMINATE POVERTY BY SUPPORTING PEOPLE WHO HAVE BEEN INCARCERATED, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURVIVORS AND PEOPLE WITH HIV/AIDS WITH COUNSELING, JOB TRAINING, LEGAL ADVOCACY, AND EMERGENCY SHELTER AND TRANSITIONAL HOUSING IN SEVEN NJ COUNTIES.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA, AS MANY OF OUR PROGRAMS FOCUS ON REDUCING BARRIERS TO ECONOMIC STABILITY, INCLUDING INCREASING JOB READINESS.   THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND NJAC'S CAPACITY TO LEVERAGE RESOURCES AND SPECIFICALLY TO EXPAND NON-GOVERNMENTAL REVENUE STREAMS THROUGH INCREASED INDIVIDUAL GIVING, MORE PROFITABLE FUNDRAISING EVENTS, AND CORPORATE AND FOUNDATION GRANTS.  WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT THE MORE THAN TWENTY THOUSAND PEOPLE LIVING IN POVERTY THAT NJAC SERVES ANNUALLY THROUGH OUR EXPANDED CAPACITY TO FUNDRAISE. PER OUR STRATEGIC PLAN, INCREASED REVENUE WILL BE ALLOCATED TOWARDS NEEDED IMPROVEMENTS TO PROGRAM FACILITIES, SUPPORTING STAFF DEVELOPMENT AND PROGRAM GROWTH TO SERVE MORE PEOPLE, AND TO BUILD ON OUR PRACTICALLY NONEXISTENT RESERVE FUND.  THE COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT WILL ENABLE NJAC TO BETTER SERVE ITS COMMUNITIES WITH SERVICES TARGETED TO CURRENT NEEDS.  NJAC REQUESTS ONE VISTA TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS IMPLEMENTING A NEW DONOR DATABASE, IMPROVING COMMUNICATIONS WITH DONORS AND POTENTIAL DONORS, WRITING AND ASSISTING WITH GRANT PROPOSALS, AND ASSISTING THE DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT IN THE EXECUTION OF A COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT.  THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO TAKE THREE YEARS TO COMPLETE.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES NEW HAMPSHIRE (CCNH) PROPOSES WORK AS A CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) INTERMEDIARY AGENCY IN NEW HAMPSHIRE; PROVIDING OVERSIGHT, MANAGEMENT, AND SUPERVISION FOR UP TO 15CNCS AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS. AS AN INTERMEDIARY AGENCY, CATHOLIC CHARITIES NH WOULD SERVE NUMEROUS COMMUNITIES; MEETING THE NEEDS OF THE LOW-INCOME POPULATION AT A STATEWIDE LEVEL. OUR WORK WITH CNCS WOULD INCLUDE RECRUITMENT OF POTENTIAL AGENCIES FOR PLACEMENT, RECRUITMENT AND ASSESSMENT OF POTENTIAL AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS, MATCHING AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WITH APPROPRIATE COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, SUPERVISING AND SUSTAINING AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS AND MANAGING THE OVERALL AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM. CCNH WILL GIVE HOST SITES UP TO THREE YEARS TO ACHIEVE THEIR GOALS, AND IN TURN WILL THEN BE RE-EVALUATED. 
 CATHOLIC CHARITIES NH IS A MEMBER OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES--USA, WHICH HAS DEVELOPED A NATIONAL AGENDA TO REDUCE POVERTY IN THE UNITED STATES.  CATHOLIC CHARITIES NH IS COMMITTED TO THIS GOAL; AND THROUGH ITS MANY PROGRAMS, JOINS WITH OUR NATIONAL OFFICE IN ESTABLISHING CONCRETE PROGRAMS TO REDUCE POVERTY HERE IN OUR STATE. CATHOLIC CHARITIES NEW HAMPSHIRE IS UNIQUELY POSITIONED TO SERVE AS A STATEWIDE INTERMEDIARY AGENCY FOR CNCS DUE TO OUR STATEWIDE PROGRAM SERVICES AND PARTNERSHIPS. CATHOLIC CHARITIES NEW HAMPSHIRE WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1945 WITH A PRIMARY FOCUS ON SERVING NEGLECTED AND ABANDONED CHILDREN THROUGH A NETWORK OF CHILDREN'S HOMES. OVER THE PAST 65 PLUS YEARS, WE HAVE GROWN TO BECOME ONE OF THE LARGEST NOT-FOR-PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES IN NEW HAMPSHIRE, SERVING MORE THAN 100,000 PEOPLE IN NEED IN 2017.
WE EXIST TO ACHIEVE SOCIAL JUSTICE AND PROVIDE QUALITY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES THAT HEAL, COMFORT, AND EMPOWER NEW HAMPSHIRE RESIDENTS. OUR SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE TO ANYONE IN NEW HAMPSHIRE, REGARDLESS OF THEIR RELIGION, RACE, GENDER, AGE, OR INCOME STATUS. CATHOLIC CHARITIES NH HAS BEEN INSTRUMENTAL IN ESTABLISHING PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF HUNGER, CHILD ABUSE, FAMILY DYSFUNCTION, IMMIGRANTS AND REFUGEES, PARENTHOOD EDUCATION, AND THE ELDERLY. OUR KEY PROGRAMS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: 
*	OUR PLACE--EMPOWERING YOUNG PARENTS THROUGH PREGNANCY, PRE-NATAL, AND PARENTING EDUCATION, AND ENCOURAGING POSITIVE LIFE CHANGES TO BENEFIT THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN
*	ST. CHARLES CHILDREN'S HOME--PROVIDING A SAFE, LOVING AND STABLE HOME ENVIRONMENT FOR CHILDREN WHO CANNOT BE IN THEIR OWN HOMES DUE TO NEGLECT OR ABUSE
*	ADOPTION SERVICES--SUPPORTING BIRTH PARENTS AND ADOPTIVE COUPLES WITH COUNSELING, HOME STUDIES, AND POST-ADOPTION PLACEMENT SERVICES AS WELL AS PRIVATE AND INTERNATIONAL ADOPTION ASSISTANCE
*	COUNSELING SERVICES--HELPING PEOPLE COPE MORE EFFECTIVELY WITH STRESS, REDUCE ISOLATION, AND INCREASE THEIR SELF-ESTEEM, AND STRENGTHENING INDIVIDUAL AND FAMILY COMMUNICATION SKILLS AND HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS
*	NEW HAMPSHIRE FOOD BANK--IN  2018, THE NH FOOD BANK PROVIDED 14.1 MILLION POUNDS OF FOOD TO FEED OVER 180,000 HUNGRY MEN, WOMEN, AND CHILDREN LIVING IN POVERTY THROUGHOUT NH
*	IMMIGRATION AND REFUGEE SERVICES--OFFERING NEWCOMERS A VARIETY OF SERVICES, INCLUDING CASEWORK, GUIDANCE AND IMMIGRATION COUNSELING, AND LEGAL REPRESENTATION THROUGHOUT THE CITIZENSHIP PROCESS
*	PARISH AND COMMUNITY SERVICES--TEN STAFFED DISTRICT OUTREACH OFFICES ACROSS THE STATE, PROVIDE DIRECT ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN NEED. 
IN ADDITION TO THESE DIRECT SERVICE PROGRAMS AS PART OF THE AGENCIES DAILY WORK, CATHOLIC CHARITIES NEW HAMPSHIRE DISTRICT OFFICE STAFF HAVE FORMED CLOSE COLLABORATIVE WORKING RELATIONSHIPS WITH MANY LOCAL HUMAN RESOURCE AGENCIES PROVIDING SERVICES ACROSS THE STATE, INCLUDING (BUT NOT LIMITED TO): * FOOD PANTRIES * SOUP KITCHENS * SHELTERS FOR HOMELESS * SUPPORT FOR UNEMPLOYED * EMERGENCY RESPONSE TO LOCAL DISASTERS * CARE GIVING SUPPORT TO SENIORS * ADVOCACY FOR THE POOR * SERVICES FOR THE DISABLED.

UTEC'S MISSION IS TO IGNITE AND NURTURE THE AMBITION OF OUR MOST DISCONNECTED YOUNG PEOPLE TO TRADE VIOLENCE AND POVERTY FOR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC SUCCESS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF UTEC BY PRODUCING DETAILED AND AUTOMATED GRANT REPORTING AND ASSISTING UTEC IN DEVELOPING IMPROVED HR PROCESSES, WHICH WILL BENEFIT THE ENTIRE AGENCY BY BUILDING THE ORGANIZATION'S CAPACITY. ONE (1) VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DESIGNING AND IMPLEMENTING THE GRANT-REPORTING SYSTEM AND SETTING UP UTEC'S NEW ONLINE HUMAN-RESOURCES SYSTEMS OVER THE COURSE OF ONE (1) YEAR.

THE POLICE ASSISTED ADDICTION AND RECOVERY INITIATIVE (PAARI)'S MISSION IS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT NON-ARREST PROGRAMS THAT CREATE PATHWAYS TO TREATMENT AND RECOVERY FOR THOSE SUFFERING FROM SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT TO ESTABLISH A NATIONAL RECOVERY CORPS TO ADDRESS THE GROWING OPIOID EPIDEMIC ALIGNS WITH THE CAPACITY BUILDING AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO STRENGTHEN THE ABILITY OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES TO INCREASE ACCESS TO CARE AND ADDRESS ADDICTION AND POVERTY THROUGH NON-ARREST APPROACHES, WHICH WILL BENEFIT AT LEAST 500 UNIQUE INDIVIDUALS WITH SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS AND AT LEAST 105 LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES. 15 VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS DEVELOPING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

826 BOSTON?S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER TRADITIONALLY UNDERSERVED STUDENTS AGES 6-18 TO FIND THEIR VOICES, TELL THEIR STORIES, AND GAIN COMMUNICATION SKILLS TO SUCCEED IN SCHOOL AND IN LIFE. THE TORNILLO INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DISTRICT'S (TORNILLO ISD) MISSION IS TO EDUCATE AND INSPIRE ALL STUDENTS IN A SAFE AND SUPPORTIVE ENVIRONMENT WHICH WILL RESULT IN CLOSING THE ACHIEVEMENT GAP BY PREPARING ALL STUDENTS FOR COLLEGE READINESS AND SUCCESS IN A GLOBAL SOCIETY. THE KANSAS CITY SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT AND RECOVERY SUPPORT COALITION (KC-SATRSC) IS COMPRISED OF APPROXIMATELY SIXTY KANSAS CITY-BASED AGENCIES THAT ARE ALIGNED TO FIGHT THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC BY PROVIDING SERVICES TO THOSE WHO ARE AFFLICTED WITH SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS. IT IS MADE UP OF FAITH-BASED PROVIDERS, COMMUNITY SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT CENTERS, LOCAL MEDICAL CENTERS, PREVENTION PROVIDERS, AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, AGENCIES AND INSTITUTIONS. THESE PARTNERS WORK COLLECTIVELY TO PROVIDE A NETWORK OF TREATMENT, PREVENTION, AND RECOVERY SUPPORT SERVICES TO ADDRESS THE MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE ISSUES IN KANSAS CITY AND OTHER AREAS OF THE MISSOURI WESTERN REGION.

THE PURPOSE OF KC-SATRSC IS TO SUPPORT AND ENHANCE EXISTING PROGRAMS IN THE KANSAS CITY AREA FOR INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES WHOSE LIVES ARE IMPACTED BY THE USE OF ALCOHOL AND/OR OTHER DRUGS.  THESE AGENCIES, ALONG WITH OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, CITY, COUNTY, STATE, AND FEDERAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, OPERATE IN A RECOVERY ORIENTED SYSTEM OF CARE (ROSC) TO DELIVER SERVICES TO THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE EVERY YEAR.

THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL BUILD LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY FOR THE COALITION AND ITS FRONT LINE MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS. THE INVOLVEMENT OF VISTAS AT THE INDIVIDUAL AGENCIES WILL ASSIST THEM TO STRENGTHEN THEIR EFFORTS IN THE LOW INCOME, PRIMARILY MINORITY COMMUNITIES OF KANSAS CITY THAT ARE BEING DEVASTATED BY OPIOIDS AND OTHER DRUGS. 

ALONG WITH SIX MEMBER AGENCIES HOSTING A VISTA, TWO FULL-TIME VISTAS WILL SUPPORT OF THE KANSAS CITY ADDICTION TREATMENT AND RECOVERY SUPPORT COALITION TO HELP TAKE ITS MESSAGE TO THE BROADER COMMUNITY. THIS INVOLVES SUPPORTING EFFORTS CURRENTLY UNDERWAY SUCH AS THE "RECOVERY WORKS" AND THE "STAND FOR RECOVERY" MESSAGING CAMPAIGNS. THESE ARE INTENDED TO INCREASE COMMUNITY AWARENESS ABOUT SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER, PROMOTE ACCESS TO SERVICES AND TO REDUCE THE SHAME ASSOCIATED WITH SUDS. INCREASED COMMUNICATION, EDUCATION AND RESHAPING ATTITUDES AROUND RECOVERY WILL ALL WORK TO STRENGTHEN KANSAS CITY'S LOW INCOME, PRIMARILY MINORITY COMMUNITIES.

THE VISTAS ASSIGNED TO THE COALITION WILL ALSO PROVIDE GRANT WRITING AND VOLUNTEER SUPPORT, EVENT PLANNING AND OTHER CAPACITY BUILDING TASKS. THEY WILL ALSO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO MEMBER AGENCIES THROUGH PROVISION OF RESOURCES AND ASSISTANCE WITH THE CERTIFICATION PROCESSES WITH THE STATE DEPARTMENT OF MENTAL HEALTH AND THE NATIONAL ALLIANCE FOR RECOVERY RESIDENCES.

SAVE IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE DEPARTING SERVICE MEMBERS AND VETERANS, PARTICULARLY THOSE WITH INJURIES A BRIDGE TO AGRICULTURE AND A MORE PRODUCTIVE AND FOR-FILLING LIFE. MANY RECENTLY SEPARATED SERVICE MEMBERS AND VETERANS HAVE HAD DIFFICULTY FINDING A PATH FORWARD AND HAVE LANGUISHED; WITH MANY IN RELATIVE POVERTY. NOT ONLY WILL A CAREER IN AGRICULTURE BRING THEM A SUSTAINABLE CAREER, IT WILL PROVIDE A LIFE STYLE THAT WILL BRING THEM RELATIVE SOLACE. THIS PROGRAM WILL HELP TO SUSTAIN THE SINGLE FAMILY FARM MODEL AND WILL PROVIDE A SUSTAINABLE SUPPLY OF AFFORDABLE FOOD FOR LOCAL COMMUNITIES AND MARKETS. 

SAVE IS FORMED AS A KANSAS NOT-FOR-PROFIT CHARITABLE EDUCATIONAL CORPORATION OPERATING UNDER SECTION 501C3 OF THE IRS CODE. IT HAS COMMITTEES FORMED AROUND LAND AND BUILDINGS, PROGRAMS, CLINICS AND STRATEGIC AND BUSINESS PLANS. 

SAVE CURRENTLY HAS TEAMING AGREEMENTS WITH KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY, CLOUD COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE, MANHATTAN AREA TECHNICAL COLLEGE AND DES MOINES AREA COMMUNITY COLLEGE. THIS EFFORT IS BEING CHAMPIONED BY SENATOR MORAN OF KANSAS.

RENO COUNTY COMMUNITIES THAT CARE ASSOCIATION'S MISSION STATEMENT IS TO PROMOTE HEALTHY YOUTH BEHAVIORS THROUGH MENTORING, SUBSTANCE USE PREVENTION, STRENGTHENING FAMILIES, AND YOUTH LEADERSHIP. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH HEALTH FOCUS AREA, SPECIFICALLY OPIOID PREVENTION AND THE REDUCTION OF POVERTY. OUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES OF BUILDING NEW AND STRENGTHENING EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS, DEVELOP NEW PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESS BOTH OPIOID PREVENTION AND ADDRESSING POVERTY, DEVELOP NEW AWARENESS CAMPAIGNS SURROUNDING OPIOID PREVENTION AND POVERTY, AS WELL AS DEVELOPING MATERIALS AND PRESENTATIONS FOR THE COMMUNITY OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS TO CONCLUDE IN 2021.

THE WICHITA STATE UNIVERSITY COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT INSTITUTE (CEI) HAS A MISSION TO PARTNER WITH COMMUNITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS TO STRENGTHEN KANSAS THROUGH EDUCATION, LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, FACILITATION AND RESEARCH. THE VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOCUS AREAS OF: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO PLACE VISTA MEMBERS WITH ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE MISSIONS AND ACTIVITIES DIRECTLY IMPACT PEOPLE IN POVERTY EXPERIENCING THESE NEEDS.
CEI IS REQUESTING A PROGRAM GRANT BECAUSE OF THE SUCCESS AND ONGOING REQUEST FROM ORGANIZATIONS FOR ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT FOR THE PAST FIVE YEARS. CEI WAS RECENTLY AWARDED A SUPPORT GRANT FOR YEAR 5. CEI IS REQUESTING A PROGRAM GRANT WITH THE GOAL OF PLACING 16 VISTA MEMBERS, TWO VISTA LEADERS AND 6 SUMMER ASSOCIATES IN THE FIRST YEAR. VISTA MEMBERS WILL SERVE IN ORGANIZATIONS IN ORDER TO STRENGTHEN AND BUILD THE ORGANIZATIONS' CAPACITIES TO DELIVER PROGRAMS ADDRESSING CONTRIBUTING FACTORS OF POVERTY. VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES THAT WILL DEVELOP, EXPAND OR HELP SUSTAIN VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING, FUND DEVELOPMENT (SUSTAINABILITY EFFORTS), COMMUNITY AND PARTNERSHIP ENGAGEMENT FOR PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, SERVICES OR SYSTEMS CHANGE, AND DATA MANAGEMENT. THE SUMMER ASSOCIATES WILL ADDRESS INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. A PROGRAM GRANT WILL ADDRESS ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY WITHIN ORGANIZATIONS IN THE WICHITA METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA AS WELL AS CONTINUE TO RESPOND TO SITES AND PLACEMENTS IN EASTERN KANSAS WITH THE EXCEPTION OF NEW SITES AND PLACEMENTS IN (ATCHISON, DOUGLAS AND SHAWNEE) COUNTIES SUPPORTED BY THE NEWLY AWARDED GRANT TO WASHBURN UNIVERSITY. CEI IS CURRENTLY WORKING WITH FIVE SITES IN THOSE COUNTIES WHICH HAVE SIX VISTA OPPORTUNITIES.

THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS AND DONORS AND IMPROVE PROGRAMMATIC AND MARKETING EFFORTS AROUND PROGRAMS THAT: 1. IMPROVE ELEMENTARY READING SKILLS; 2. IMPROVE HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION RATES; 3. IMPROVE CAREER TRAINING AND JOB PLACEMENTS; 4. REDUCE HOMELESSNESS. PIKES PEAK UNITED WAY EXPECTS TO USE VISTA MEMBERS TO SERVE APPROXIMATELY 25,400 INDIVIDUALS.
