THE MISSION OF COLORADO YOUTH FOR A CHANGE (CYC) IS TO SOLVE THE DROPOUT CRISIS IN COLORADO. IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA OF EDUCATION, CYC IS REQUESTING 4 VISTAS TO INCREASE CYC'S ABILITY TO SERVE LOW-INCOME, OUT-OF-SCHOOL YOUTH AND STUDENTS AT-RISK OF DROPPING OUT. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT IS ESTIMATED TO FILL THE 12-MONTH SERVICE TERMS OF EACH REQUESTED VISTA. PRIMARY ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INCREASING THE INVOLVEMENT OF VOLUNTEERS, ENHANCING THE ORGANIZATION'S DATABASE TO INCREASE RESOURCES FOR THE YOUTH SERVED, AND DEVELOPING RECRUITMENT AND POST-PROGRAM FOLLOW UP MODELS TO INCREASE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE REENGAGEMENT SERVICES CYC PROVIDES TO OUT-OF-SCHOOL YOUTH.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

THE MISSION OF THE COLORADO COALITION FOR THE HOMELESS (CCH) IS TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY TOWARD THE PREVENTION OF HOMELESSNESS AND THE CREATION OF LASTING SOLUTIONS FOR HOMELESS AND AT-RISK FAMILIES, CHILDREN, AND INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT COLORADO. CCH PROPOSES A VISTA PROJECT TO BE INTEGRATED WITHIN ITS FORT LYON SUPPORTIVE RESIDENTIAL COMMUNITY. THIS COMMUNITY PROVIDES RECOVERY ORIENTED TRANSITIONAL HOUSING TO HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS ON A 525-ACRE, COLLEGIATE-LOOKING CAMPUS, LOCATED 200 MILES SOUTHEAST OF DENVER. FORT LYON OFFERS MILES OF WALKING AND BIKING POSSIBILITIES IN A RURAL, PEACEFUL SETTING. 

THE VISTA PROJECT IS ENTITLED FORT LYON ENGAGEMENT, EMPLOYMENT AND REINTEGRATION PROJECT; IT PRIMARILY ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES CNCS FOCUS AREA AND FOCUSES ON THE CNCS PRIORITY OF ADDRESSING THE NATIONAL OPIOID EPIDEMIC. THE PROJECT ALSO ALIGNS WITH CNCS FOCUS AREAS OF: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. THE FORT LYON ENGAGEMENT, EMPLOYMENT AND REINTEGRATION PROJECT AIMS TO:
1) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT ENHANCED ENGAGEMENT PROTOCOLS TO HELP EASE COMMON BARRIERS TO RECOVERY;
2) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT COMPREHENSIVE AND VARIED EMPLOYMENT SERVICES, ENSURING THAT ALL RESIDENTS OF CCH?S FORT LYON SUPPORTIVE RESIDENTIAL COMMUNITY (RESIDENTS) ARE PROVIDED WITH OPPORTUNITIES TO OBTAIN EMPLOYMENT;
3) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT REINTEGRATION SERVICES, INCLUDING REINTEGRATION SERVICES SPECIFICALLY FOR VETERAN AND MILITARY FAMILIES; AND 
4) DEEPEN COLLABORATION WITH LOCAL COMMUNITY COLLEGES, RESULTING IN IMPLEMENTATION OF SPECIALIZED TRAINING. 

OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT, A TOTAL OF FIVE VISTAS WILL PERFORM ACTIVITIES WHICH CONTRIBUTE TO REACHING SPECIFIED GOALS. THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: ENGAGING NEW RESIDENTS IN RECOVERY SERVICES WHICH INCLUDES PROVIDING INFORMATION ON HOW TO ACCESS  MEDICATION ASSISTED TREATMENT (MAT) FOR OPIOID USE DISORDERS (TWO VISTAS); INVITING RESIDENTS TO PARTICIPATE IN EMPLOYMENT AND EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES (TWO VISTAS); AND ASSISTING RESIDENTS? TRANSITIONS FROM THE FORT LYON CAMPUS TO COMMUNITIES OF THEIR CHOOSING (ONE VISTA).

EACH YEAR, THE OPEN MEDIA FOUNDATION SERVES THOUSANDS OF DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS, DIRECTLY THROUGH OUR EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY MEDIA PROGRAMS, AND INDIRECTLY THROUGH OUR WORK WITH PARTNER NONPROFITS. LAST YEAR, WITH THE SUPPORT OF TWO FULL-TIME VISTA MEMBERS THROUGH CNCS, WE EMBARKED ON A NEW PROGRAM, AIMING TO ADD A NEW PROGRAM THAT CONNECTS THE LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WE SERVE WITH SUPPORT IN SECURING EMPLOYMENT IN THE FIELD OF MEDIA AND COMMUNICATIONS. THOUGH THIS INDUSTRY IS NOT A HUGE SECTOR OF THE LABOR FORCE, THE IMPLICATIONS OF EXPANDING DIVERSITY, EQUITY AND INCLUSION IN OUR MEDIA AND COMMUNICATIONS SPHERE IS HUGE. OUR PROCESS STARTED WITH A USER-CENTERED DESIGN AND RESEARCH PHASE, WITH TWO VISTAS RESEARCHING THE EXISTING LANDSCAPE AND IDENTIFYING THE NEEDS OF JOBSEEKERS AND EMPLOYERS. WE?RE NOW MOVING INTO ESTABLISHING A CAREER RESOURCES, PATHWAYS, AND MENTORSHIP DATABASE FOR INDIVIDUALS SEEKING WORK IN MEDIA AND COMMUNICATIONS. WE?RE APPLYING TO CONTINUE THIS 3-YEAR PROGRAM TO COORDINATE PARTNERS AND TO ESTABLISH MENTORING AND SUPPORT EFFORTS TO SERVE LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WITH A ROADMAP AND HANDS-ON SUPPORT TO GAIN EMPLOYMENT IN THIS DYNAMIC FIELD.

THE MISSION OF ECDC AFRICAN COMMUNITY CENTER OF DENVER (ACC) IS TO HELP NEW MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY BUILD SAFE, SUSTAINABLE LIVES IN DENVER. THE ASU SCHOOL OF SOCIAL WORK'S MISSION IS TO ASSIST DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURVIVORS AND HELP INDIVIDUALS TO SUSTAIN INDEPENDENCE AND STABILITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE GOAL TO PROVIDE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AS MANY SURVIVORS EXPERIENCE EFFECTS OF POVERTY AS A CONSEQUENCE OF THE ABUSE. RECENTLY REPORTED EVIDENCE INDICATES THAT PRESCRIPTION OPIOIDS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH IMPORTANT HARMS, INCLUDING ACCIDENTAL OVERDOSE, ABUSE, ADDICTION, DIVERSION, AND ACCIDENTS INVOLVING INJURIES (SUCH AS FALLS AND MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENTS). PERHAPS OF MOST CONCERN IS THE DRAMATIC INCREASE IN OVERDOSE DEATHS ASSOCIATED WITH OPIOIDS. IN 2011, THERE WERE 16,917 FATAL OVERDOSES INVOLVING PRESCRIPTION OPIOIDS.  IN 2016 PULASKI COUNTY AR REPORTED OVER 156 DEATHS DUE TO OPIOID OVER DOSES.  OFFICIALS REVEALED THAT THE NUMBERS COULD HAVE BEEN HIGHER BECAUSE OF REPORTING.  PRESCRIPTION OPIOID MISUSE AND ABUSE RESULTED IN ALMOST 660,000 EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT VISITS IN 2010, OVER TWICE AS MANY AS IN 2004. SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT ADMISSIONS FOR OPIATES OTHER THAN HEROIN INCREASED MORE THAN SIX-FOLD FROM 1999 TO 2009. 

THE STATE OF ARKANSAS FACES SERIOUS PROBLEMS RELATED TO SUBSTANCE ABUSE DISORDERS SUD). IN PULASKI COUNTY THERE ARE 392,664 RESIDENTS OF WHICH 36% ARE AFRICAN-AMERICANS, AND 19.4% LIVE IN POVERTY. ACCORDING TO 2015 REPORTS BY THE UNIVERSITY OF ARKANSAS MEDICAL SCIENCES (UAMS), INHALANT USE, PARTICULARLY CRACK COCAINE AND METHAMPHETAMINE IS HIGHER IN PULASKI COUNTY WHEN COMPARED TO THE STATE OF AR.  UAMS INDICATES THAT IN PULASKI COUNTY, WHITE WOMEN ARE MORE METHAMPHETAMINE; WHILE AFRICAN-AMERICAN WOMEN USE MORE CRACK. ARKANSAS RANKS 46TH IN POOR MENTAL HEALTH ACCORDING TO THE COUNTY HEALTH RANKINGS. ARKANSAS'S' 2015 BEHAVIORAL HEATH BAROMETER SHOWED THE SERIOUSLY MENTAL ILLNESS RATE IN AR AT 5.2% WHEN COMPARED TO THE US RATE OF 4.2%. IN PULASKI COUNTY WOMEN WITH SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS (SUDS) HAVE DISPROPORTIONATELY HIGH RATES OF DEPRESSION, PTSD, AND OTHER MENTAL HEALTH DISORDERS. 
A NEWLY RELEASED REPORT BY THE U.S. CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC) SHOWS ALL BUT NINE OF ARKANSAS' 75 COUNTIES HAD OVERALL OPIOID PRESCRIBING RATES HIGHER THAN THE NATIONAL AVERAGE OF 66.5 PRESCRIPTIONS PER 100 PEOPLE. AS A STATE, ARKANSAS HAS AN OPIOID PRESCRIPTION RATE OF 114.6 PER 100, WHICH IS SECOND ONLY TO ALABAMA A 2016 AVERAGE OF 121 PER 100 PEOPLE.

CDC DATA RELEASED JULY 26, 2017 ALSO SHOWS THAT SEVERAL ARKANSAS COUNTIES HAD PRESCRIBING RATES EXCEEDING 130 PER 100 PEOPLE, WHICH IS DOUBLE THE NATIONAL AVERAGE. IN GREENE COUNTY, LOCATED IN NORTHEAST ARKANSAS NORTH OF JONESBORO, 177.8 PILLS ARE DISPENSED PER CAPITA. GARLAND AND SEBASTIAN COUNTIES HAVE THE SECOND AND THIRD-HIGHEST OPIOID PRESCRIPTION RATE AT 176 AND 169 PILLS, RESPECTIVELY.
ARKANSAS HEALTH DEPARTMENT DIRECTOR NATE SMITH GAVE A PRESENTATION TO THE JOINT INTERIM COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC HEALTH AT THE STATE CAPITOL. ACCORDING TO SMITH'S REPORT, "LARGE AMOUNTS OF OPIOIDS ARE BEING SOLD IN ARKANSAS," ENOUGH FOR EVERY MAN, WOMAN AND CHILD TO TAKE 80 PILLS EACH OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR. ALTOGETHER, 235.9 MILLION PILLS WERE SOLD ACROSS ARKANSAS IN 2016, SMITH SAID, CITING THE MOST UP-TO-DATE DATA FROM THE CDC.  SMITH'S PRESENTATION TO THE LEGISLATIVE PANEL WAS TO INFORM LEGISLATORS OF THE STATUS OF OPIOID USE AND DRUG RELATED HEALTH PROBLEMS IN ARKANSAS, HIGHLIGHTED BY DRUG USE BY DEMOGRAPHIC GROUP SUCH AS AGE, SEX AND RACE. ADH CREATED A NEW AREA OF FOCUS NAMED THE SUBSTANCE MISUSE AND INJURY PREVENTION BRANCH TO ADDRESS THE OPIOID CRISIS IN ARKANSAS.

ENRICHMOND WAS FORMED IN 1990 WITH THE MISSION IS TO SERVE THE PEOPLE, PARKS, AND PUBLIC SPACE OF THE CITY OF RICHMOND THROUGH CITIZEN INVOLVEMENT, EDUCATION, AND FUNDRAISING. 

ENRICHMOND'S VISTA PARTNERSHIP ALIGNS MOST CLOSELY WITH THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. BABSON CENTER FOR GLOBAL COMMERCE (1): TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF  BETTERFI, TENNESSEE'S FIRST VISTA-INITIATED NONPROFIT LENDING ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO ENDING PREDATORY LENDING BY DEVELOPING A HOLISTIC LOW-INCOME LOAN PROGRAM COMBINED WITH A REQUIRED FINANCIAL COACHING PROGRAM TO ASSIST LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS IN THE TRI-COUNTY AREA OF FRANKLIN, GRUNDY AND MARION TO IMMEDIATELY RESOLVE SHORT-TERM FINANCIAL CRISES AS A STEP TOWARD ACHIEVING INTERMEDIATE AND LONG-TERM FISCAL WELL BEING.

 FOLKS AT HOME:(1): THE SYSTEMS & PROGRAMS COORDINATOR WILL CREATE, EXPAND AND STRENGTHEN SYSTEMS AND PROCESSES TO INCREASE THE ORGANIZATION'S ABILITY TO FUNCTION EFFECTIVELY AND MEET ITS GOAL OF ACTIVELY WORKING TO PREVENT POVERTY IN OLDER ADULTS BY PROVIDING ELDERLY CARE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES.

THE MISSION OF UNITED WAY OF THE OCOEE REGION (UWOR) IS TO BE A COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATION THAT LEADS IN THE EFFORTS OF IDENTIFYING COMMUNITY NEEDS, FACILITATING COLLABORATION, AND MAXIMIZING RESOURCES TO POSITIVELY IMPACT OUR COMMUNITY & THE SURROUNDING AREA. BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF AMERICA (BBBS) PROVIDES PROFESSIONALLY SUPPORTED, LONG TERM, ONE-TO-ONE LIFE CHANGING RELATIONSHIPS WITH MEASURABLE IMPACT TO YOUTH FACING ADVERSITY. BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF ALABAMA BELIEVES THAT INHERENT IN EVERY CHILD IS THE ABILITY TO SUCCEED AND WE HAVE COMMITTED OURSELVES TO SERVING CHILDREN IN ALABAMA FOR OVER 45 YEARS! BBBS OF ALABAMA RECOGNIZES THE NEEDS WITHIN OUR LOCAL COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE POSITIVE ROLE MODELS IN HOPES OF BOOSTING CHILDREN'S SELF-ESTEEM AND IMPROVING THEIR CHANCE TO ACHIEVE SUCCESS IN THEIR ACADEMIC, SOCIAL AND FAMILY LIVES. CURRENTLY IN ALABAMA, THERE ARE SIX BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS AGENCIES AND THREE SATELLITE OFFICES OFFERING FULL TIME SERVICES TO CHILDREN IN NEED THROUGHOUT SUBURBAN, RURAL AND URBAN ALABAMA. COLLECTIVELY, THESE ORGANIZATIONS SERVE APPROXIMATELY 3,000 YOUTH ANNUALLY BETWEEN FIVE AND 18 THROUGH A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS INCLUDING A COMMUNITY AND SITE-BASED INITIATIVE. EACH AUTONOMOUS BBBS ORGANIZATION REPRESENTS THEIR SERVICE AREA THROUGH THE BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF ALABAMA STATE ASSOCIATION THAT STRIVES FOR A COMMON GOAL -- TO PROVIDE MENTORING RELATIONSHIPS FOR ALABAMA YOUTH THAT ADDRESSES ISSUES SUCH AS EDUCATION, SAFETY, CONFIDENCE, COMPETENCE AND CARING. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS REQUEST, BBBS OF ALABAMA WILL USE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS TO: 1) INCREASE CAPACITY FOR ALL BBBS OF ALABAMA?S IMMEDIATE SERVICE AREAS; 2) RESEARCH THE MOST CRITICAL SERVICE AREAS IN NEED OF OPIOID AWARENESS AND EDUCATION; 3) DEVELOP OPIOID CURRICULUM FOR CHILDREN AGES 5-18; AND 4) ASSIST THEIR SERVICE AGENCY IN CREATING A DATABASE FOR OUR ADULT MENTORS. THE EXTENT TO WHICH EACH INDIVIDUAL BBBS AGENCY IMPLEMENTS EACH GOAL IS BASED ON THE DEMOGRAPHICS OF ITS SERVICE AREA. 
PROJECT ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: AMERICORPS*VISTA MEMBERS ASSIGNED TO WORK WITH THE VARIOUS BBBS LOCATIONS STATEWIDE WILL INCREASE BBBS OVERALL CAPACITY TO SERVE AND ENHANCE ITS SERVICES BY: * HELPING WITH LOCAL COMMUNITY OUTREACH, PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, DRUG AWARENESS CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT TASKS; * PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO AGENCY STAFF DIRECTLY INVOLVED IN ENROLLING, MATCHING AND TRACKING THE PARTICIPATING YOUTH IN ALABAMA COMMUNITIES; * IDENTIFYING PARTNERSHIPS WITH VARIOUS COMMUNITY LEADERS AND/OR NONPROFIT/CIVIC ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE TRAINING ACTIVITIES AND TO IDENTIFY YOUTH IN NEED OF A MENTOR; * SERVING AS A LIAISON FOR LOCAL BBBS AGENCIES; * ASSISTING WITH THE EVALUATION OF BBBS PROGRAMS BY UTILIZING VARIOUS MEASUREMENT TOOLS AND FOCUSING ON THE SHORT AND LONG-TERM EFFECTS OF THE RELATIONSHIP ON BOTH MENTORS AND MENTEES.

APC'S MISSION IS TO PREVENT SUBSTANCE ABUSE BY PROVIDING RESOURCES TO AFFECTED INDIVIDUALS, FOSTERING STUDENT-LED CHAPTERS IN LOCAL SCHOOLS, AND HOSTING INFORMATIONAL EVENTS TO SPREAD AWARENESS ABOUT AND REDUCE THE STIGMA SURROUNDING ADDICTION. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT BY ORGANIZING VOLUNTEERS TO MATCH THEM TO FITTING ROLES AND TARGET AT-RISK AREAS OF THE POPULATION THROUGH DIGITAL MARKETING TO PREVENT SUBSTANCE ABUSE. THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO BENEFIT AT LEAST 10,000 COMMUNITY MEMBERS. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS MANAGING VOLUNTEER MEMBERSHIP AND CONDUCTING MULTI-MEDIA CAMPAIGNS OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

STILLMAN COLLEGE IS A 4-YEAR CO-EDUCATIONAL, HISTORICALLY BLACK LIBERAL ARTS INSTITUTION THAT WAS FOUNDED IN 1876 IN TUSCALOOSA, ALABAMA.  STILLMAN IS COMMITTED TO FOSTERING ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE AND PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR DIVERSE POPULATIONS WITH DISPARATE LEVELS OF ACADEMIC PREPARATION. EDUCATION IS A MAJOR FUNCTION IN THE REDUCTION AND ELIMINATION OF POVERTY, THUS STILLMAN'S MISSION ALIGNS WELL WITH AMERICORPS VISTA'S FOCUS ON ANTI-POVERTY AND CAPACITY BUILDING.  THIS VISTA PROJECT FOCUSES ON EDUCATION.  FOR OVER 141 YEARS, STILLMAN COLLEGE HAS BEEN THE EDUCATIONAL AND ECONOMIC ANCHOR IN THE AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITY, TUSCALOOSA'S WEST END.  STILLMAN IS A MAJOR COMMUNITY PARTNER FOR ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT.  AFTER THE CONCLUSION OF THIS 3-YEAR VISTA PROJECT, STILLMAN COLLEGE WILL INSTITUTIONALIZE THE DEVELOPED PROGRAMS INTO OUR RETENTION AND ACADEMIC ENHANCEMENT ACTIVITIES TO SUSTAIN THE PROGRAM OUTCOMES AS PART OF OUR CONTINUED COLLEGE OPERATIONS.

THE STILLMAN COLLEGE VISTA PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME STUDENTS AND BUILD CAPACITY AT STILLMAN TO SUPPORT STUDENTS COMING FROM LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES TO SUCCEED IN COLLEGE.  MOST OF OUR STUDENTS ARE LOW-INCOME; 80 PERCENT RECEIVE THE FEDERAL PELL GRANT; AND 90% BORROW FEDERAL STUDENT LOANS.  EVEN THOUGH STILLMAN IS A PRIVATE COLLEGE, ITS TUITION AND FEES ARE COMPETITIVE WITH STATE INSTITUTIONS.  OUR STUDENTS' FAMILIES RESIDE IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES; AND ARE UNABLE TO CONTRIBUTE A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT TOWARD THEIR CHILD'S EDUCATION; THUS MANY OF OUR STUDENTS WORK TO MAKE ENDS MEET.  THE PROGRAMS THAT THE VISTAS WILL DEVELOP AT STILLMAN COLLEGE WILL BE INSTITUTIONALIZED BY THE COLLEGE. OUR GOAL IS TO INCREASE THE RETENTION AND GRADUATION RATES OF OUR STUDENTS. 

STILLMAN COLLEGE WANTS TO PARTNER WITH AMERICORPS VISTA TO IMPLEMENT THE STILLMAN "TIGER NAVIGATORS" PROJECT. WE PLAN TO USE FIVE (5) AMERICORPS VISTA VOLUNTEERS TO WORK FULL-TIME (40 HOURS PER WEEK). EACH OF THE 5 VISTAS WILL BE DELEGATED TO ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING PROGRAM OBJECTIVES: VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT, FRESHMAN SUCCESS INITIATIVE & OUTREACH, MARKETING & PROMOTION, PARTNERSHIPS DEVELOPMENT, AND INCREASE & DIVERSIFICATION OF RESOURCES. THE PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES OF THE FIVE (5) "TIGER NAVIGATORS" WILL ASSIST STILLMAN COLLEGE DEVELOP PROGRAMS AND RESOURCES TO SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE RETENTION AND GRADUATION OUTCOMES FOR OUR STUDENT POPULATION, WHO ARE LOW-INCOME FIRST GENERATION COLLEGE STUDENTS. WE WILL MEASURE SUCCESS BY COMPARING THE RETENTION RATES BEFORE PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION AND FOLLOWING IMPLEMENTATION. STILLMAN COLLEGE IS COMMITTED TO BEING AN ACTIVE AND EFFECTIVE PARTNER BY SUPPORTING THE REQUIRED FEES FOR TWO OF THE FIVE VISTAS ACCORDING TO THE PROGRAM GUIDELINES.

THE PHENIX CITY HOUSING AUTHORITY'S (PCHA) MISSION IS TO PROVIDE SAFE, AFFORDABLE, QUALITY HOUSING, FREE FROM DISCRIMINATION AND CENTERED ON CUSTOMER SERVICE, WHILE PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR ECONOMIC INDEPENDENCE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENABLE PCHA TO BE ABLE TO DEVELOP THE YOUNG EXCEPTIONAL STUDENTS (YES!) AFTER-SCHOOL AND SUMMER CAMP PROGRAM FOR STEADY AND STABLE GROWTH THROUGH PROGRAM AND POLICY DEVELOPMENT, RESOURCE AND FUNDING GROWTH, AND VOLUNTEER DEVELOPMENT. THIS VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE PHENIX CITY LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY BY EXPANDING NUMBERS FROM 30 TO 60 ELIGIBLE CHILDREN SERVED; THIS WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT THE CHILDREN SERVED IN AN EDUCATIONAL CAPACITY BUT WILL IN-TURN BENEFIT THE WORKING FAMILIES BY PROVIDING THE ONLY AFFORDABLE SUMMER CAMP AND THE LOWEST AFFORDABLE AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAM IN THIS AREA. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: BUILDING A PROGRAM PROCEDURAL MANUAL AND PROGRAM BUDGET, CREATING A VOLUNTEER PROGRAM AND BASE, ENHANCING PARTNERSHIPS, RESEARCH ADDITIONAL FUNDING SOURCES, AND PROVIDE OUTREACH TO THE COMMUNITY TO EDUCATE FAMILIES ON OPPORTUNITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR OVER THE COURSE OF A MINIMUM OF 1 YEAR TO A MAXIMUM OF 3 YEAR TIME-SPAN.

THE CONNECTHOME INITIATIVE IS A COLLABORATION BETWEEN COMMUNITIES, THE PRIVATE SECTOR, AND THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TO EXPAND HIGH-SPEED INTERNET ACCESS TO MORE FAMILIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY. THE INITIATIVE IS BRINGING AFFORDABLE BROADBAND ACCESS, TECHNICAL TRAINING, DIGITAL LITERACY PROGRAMS, AND ELECTRONIC DEVICES TO THOUSANDS OF LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS LIVING IN HUD-ASSISTED HOUSING. CONNECTHOME HAS LAUNCHED IN 28 COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE UNITED STATES, INCLUDING METROPOLITAN AREAS, CITIES, COUNTIES, AND A TRIBAL NATION.
HUD IS PARTNERING WITH AN EXTERNAL RESEARCH TEAM (INSIGHT POLICY RESEARCH) TO EVALUATE THE CONNECTHOME PROGRAM. THE EVALUATION INCLUDES A BASELINE ACCESS SURVEY, TELEPHONE SURVEY AND PROCESS STUDY TO UNDERSTAND HOW SITES APPROACH EARLY IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROGRAM, GAIN INSIGHTS AS TO PRACTICE CHALLENGES AND BREAKTHROUGHS IN THESE SETTINGS, AND TO UNDERSTAND EARLY OUTCOMES.
AS A FIRST-STEP IN ASSESSING THE NEED IN THE COMMUNITY, MCHA WILL CONDUCT A SURVEY TO IDENTIFY WHO QUALIFIES FOR LOW COST INTERNET SERVICE AS WELL CONVERT CURRENTLY CONNECTED TENANTS FROM A HIGHER COST TO LOW COST INTERNET SERVICE.  THE NEXT STEP IS TO SUPPLY AS MANY NEW OR REFURBISHED PC'S LAPTOPS AND TABLETS TO TENANTS WITH A SIGNED AGREEMENT.  FOLLOWING THE ROLLOUT OF PC'S LAPTOPS AND TABLETS, LITERACY CLASSES WILL BE CONDUCTED IN MOBILE AND WASHINGTON COUNTY, AL.   OUR GOAL IS TO HAVE 30% OF TENANTS CONNECTED WITHIN THE 2ND QUARTER OF 2018.
LASTLY, A FOLLOW UP SURVEY WILL BE CONDUCTED TO EVALUATE ALL MCHA'S INTERNET SUBSCRIBERS, DOCUMENT THEIR EXPERIENCES, HOW INTERNET HAS AFFECTED THEIR LIVES, THE EFFECTS OF DIGITAL LITERACY, AND HOW THEY ARE USING INTERNET. WE ARE REQUESTING 5 VISTA MEMBERS, TWO THAT WE WILL COST-SHARE TO HELP IMPLEMENT THE CONNECTHOME INITIATIVE TO OUR RESIDENTS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE SYLACAUGA HOUSING AUTHORITY?S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE DRUG FREE, DECENT, SAFE, AND SANITARY HOUSING FOR ELIGIBLE FAMILIES; PROVIDE THESE FAMILIES WITH OPPORTUNITIES; AND ENGAGE  FAMILIES IN SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND ECONOMIC INDEPENDENCE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA BY SEEKING TO PROMOTE FINANCIAL LITERACY; PREPARING ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED RESIDENTS TO JOIN THE LOCAL WORKFORCE; ENGAGING RESIDENTS IN ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY; AND HELPING RESIDENTS TO TRANSITION FROM PUBLIC HOUSING TO A MIXED-INCOME, PRIVATE SECTOR LIVING MODEL.  ALONG WITH THE SUPPORT OF  THE PROPOSED VISTAS PROJECT, THE SYLACAUGA HOUSING AUTHORITY EXPECTS TO IMPLEMENT THE UPWARD MOBILITY PROGRAM. THROUGH THIS PROGRAM, THE EXPECTATION IS TO BENEFIT ALL OF THE 309 FAMILIES RESIDING IN OUR DREW COURT COMMUNITY. WE ARE REQUESTING TEN (10) VISTA MEMBERS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT BY FUNCTIONING IN AREAS SUCH AS SELF-SUFFICIENCY COORDINATION; FINANCIAL LITERACY; WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT; AFFORDABLE HOUSING COUNSELING; AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. THE SELECTED VISTA MEMBERS WILL ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO ACTIVITIES TO HELP SUSTAIN THE UPWARD MOBILITY PROGRAM SUCH AS GRANT WRITING, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, AND MARKETING OVER THE NEXT THREE (3) YEARS.

ALABAMA KOREA EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC PARTNERSHIP (AKEEP) HAS A PRIMARY MISSION TO PROVIDE MULTICULTURAL DIVERSITY EDUCATION  PROGRAMS TO THE STUDENTS AND PROFESSIONALS OF ALABAMA AND KOREA. THE SECONDARY MISSION IS BRIDGING THE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN INSTITUTIONS AND CORPORATIONS OF ALABAMA AND KOREA FOR LOCAL ECONOMIC  PROSPERITY AS A GLOBAL PARTNERSHIP FACILITATORS.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS PRIMARILY WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL BUILD OUR ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO REACH PRIMARILY LOW-INCOME  K-12 STUDENTS THAT QUALITY FOR FREE TO REDUCE LUNCH WITH PROGRAMS THAT TEACH  KOREAN AS A SECOND LANGUAGE AND CULTURAL DIFFERENCES.THESE PROGRAMS PROVIDED AT AN EARLY AGE WILL HELP STUDENTS WORK WELL IN A MULTICULTURAL SETTING AND DEVELOP LANGUAGE SKILLS THAT WILL SUPPORT THEM IN BEING EMPLOYABLE TO THE LOCAL KOREAN MANUFACTURING INDUSTRY AND OTHER CAREER OPPORTUNITIES REQUIRING THE ABILITY TO BE BILINGUAL.  FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE VISTA PROJECT AND AKEEP'S MISSION BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING OUR ORGANIZATION'S OUTREACH STRATEGY THAT TARGETS LOW INCOME STUDENTS, FAMILIES, AND SCHOOLS, RESEARCH AND WRITE GRANTS FOR AKEEP?S PROGRAM AND SERVICES, DEVELOP A PUBLIC RELATIONS STRATEGY AND EXTERNAL FUNDRAISING STRATEGY, BUILD OUR ORGANIZATION'S SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE, AND HELP THE ORGANIZATION TO DEVELOP A SOUND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL TAKE PLACE OVER THE COURSE OF A THREE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD.

THE MISSION OF THE TROY UNIVERSITY COLEMAN CENTER FOR EARLY LEARNING AND FAMILY ENRICHMENT IS TO ADDRESS MULTIGENERATIONAL POVERTY  THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A 21ST CENTURY STEAM LEARNING CENTER, AIMED AT INCREASING THE NUMBER OF BIRTH THROUGH PRESCHOOL 3 AND 4 YEAR OLD CHILDREN WHO WILL LATER : (1) MASTER EARLY STEAM, AND ARTS-RELATED LEARNING CONCEPTS; (2) BE READY TO ENTER PRIMARY SCHOOL SETTINGS PREPARED TO MASTER CONTENT ACROSS ALL SUBJECT AREAS; (3) GRADUATE FROM SECONDARY PROGRAMS WITH HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMAS, INCLUDING INTERNATIONAL BACCALAUREATE DIPLOMAS; (4) ENGAGE WITH PARENTS/FAMILY MEMBERS THROUGH EDUCATION AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF PARENTING SKILLS SUITABLE FOR REARING HEALTHY CHILDREN BOTH  EMOTIONALLY AND PHYSICALLY; AND (5) PROVIDE A LEARNING LAB FOR 5 VISTA STUDENTS AND CANDIDATES ENROLLED IN TROY UNIVERSITY?S EDUCATION AND HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (HHS) PROGRAMS, SEEKING VARIOUS STATE LICENSURES. IN SUM, THE TARGET POPULATION OF CHILDREN TO BE SERVED ARE BIRTH THROUGH THREE AND FOUR-YEAR-OLDS, AND THEIR PARENTS/RESPONSIBLE FAMILY MEMBER OR CAREGIVER, THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES AND STAKEHOLDERS, AND TROY UNIVERSITY STUDENTS, STAKEHOLDERS, COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS AND OTHER INVOLVED PERSONS FROM HOUSTON COUNTY AND THE SURROUNDING COUNTIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK IN YEAR 1 TO: A) CONDUCT FOCUS GROUPS TO CREATE NEEDS ASSESSMENTS; B) DEVELOP PRE-K CURRICULUM; C) DEVELOP COMMUNITY COLLABORATIONS FOR FAMILY SUPPORT; D) DEVELOP A REFERRAL MATRIX FOR FAMILIES REQUESTING SUPPORT; E) CONDUCT FOCUS GROUPS TO DETERMINE TOPICS OF COMMUNITY TRAINING/OUTREACH; AND F) COLLABORATE TO IDENTIFY AND BUILD COMMUNITY SUPPORTS IDENTIFIED IN FOCUS GROUPS. THIS PROJECT HAS NO EXPIRATION DATE AND IS NOT INTENDED TO BE ONLY A PILOT. THIS PROJECT HAS BUILT INTO THE STRUCTURE A FINANCIAL SUSTAINABILITY MODEL.

THE CATALYST CENTER FOR BUSINESS & ENTREPRENEURSHIP (THE CATALYST) SUBMITS THIS REQUEST FOR SUPPORT FROM THE ALABAMA STATE OFFICE OF THE AMERICORPS VOLUNTEERS IN SERVICE TO AMERICA (VISTA) PROGRAM FOR FIVE (5) VOLUNTEERS -- TWO (2) STANDARD AND THREE (3) COST SHARE.  THE VISTAS WILL BE UTILIZED TO SUPPORT CATALYST PROGRAMMING AND SERVICES THAT IN TURN PROVIDE SUPPORT AND FINANCIAL SECURITY OF ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE AND SMALL BUSINESSES. THROUGH THE CATALYST, THE VISTAS WILL ASSIST TO PROVIDE ANTI-POVERTY STRATEGIES, COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT, CAPACITY BUILDING FOR THE GROWTH OF NEW BUSINESSES, SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS FOR ALL SMALL BUSINESSES, OUTREACH AND SUPPORT FOR RURAL AND DISADVANTAGED BUSINESSES AND COMMUNITIES.  (ANTI-POVERTY, COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT, CAPACITY BUILDING, SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS)
THE CATALYST CENTER FOR BUSINESS & ENTREPRENEURSHIP SERVES AS A DRIVER FOR ECONOMIC GROWTH AND JOB CREATION IN THIRTEEN NORTH ALABAMA COUNTIES BY PROVIDING SUPPORT FOR ENTREPRENEURS AND BUSINESS OWNERS IN EVERY STAGE OF GROWTH. THROUGH QUALITY BUSINESS EDUCATION, PERSONALIZED ONE-ON-ONE COACHING, AND NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES THAT BUILD VALUABLE BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS, WE ENABLE ENTREPRENEURS TO GET STARTED AND PROVIDE ESTABLISHED BUSINESSES THE TOOLS THEY NEED TO SUCCESSFULLY NAVIGATE THEIR BUSINESS JOURNEY.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT -REGIONAL ECONOMIC ACTIVITIES FOR COMMUNICATING HOPE (REACH PROJECT) - CREATES ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE THE FINANCIAL WELL-BEING AND SECURITY OF ECONOMICALLY AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS.  
THE CATALYST IS REQUESTING FIVE (5) VOLUNTEERS FROM THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM FOR REACH PROJECT. IN ORDER TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR CLIENTS THROUGHOUT NORTH ALABAMA, THE REACH PROJECT IS CRITICAL. THE CATALYST IS A SMALL STAFF WITH A BIG MISSION. EACH ONE OF THE VISTA POSITIONS FOCUSES ON ONE SPECIFIC JOB FUNCTION TO ASSIST THE CATALYST IN DELIVERING NECESSARY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. A GREAT DEAL OF ELEMENTS ARE REQUIRED TO BE SUCCESSFUL DURING THE FIRST YEAR OF REACH PROJECT. THEREFORE TO ENSURE SUCCESS, ALL VISTAS WILL BE HOUSED AT THE MAIN CATALYST OFFICE AND WILL TRAVEL AS NEEDED. THE CATALYST PROVIDES ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND SUPPORT SERVICES TO SMALL BUSINESSES THAT ARE STARTING, GROWING AND MATURING. TO ASSIST IN THIS, THE REACH PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS, COORDINATING EVENTS, PUBLIC SPEAKING, CREATING INFRASTRUCTURE, PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND EVALUATION; ASSISTING WITH TRAINING CURRICULUM, DEVELOPING LEADERSHIP TASK FORCE AND ADVISORY BOARDS; SECURING PARTNERS, CONDUCTING OUTREACH, CREATING MARKETING PLANS, AND ORGANIZING FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES.  BY PROVIDING EDUCATION, OUTREACH AND SUPPORT TO THOSE WHO ARE MOST IN NEED TO BECOME SELF-SUFFICIENT, THE CATALYST IS "TEACHING A MAN TO FISH" AND NOT JUST FEEDING A MAN FOR A DAY.  IT IS MORE WORTHWHILE FOR THESE INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES TO REACH THEIR POTENTIAL AND KNOW THEY HAVE SUPPORT TO PURSUE THEIR DREAMS.  THE CATALYST CAN PROVIDE THAT "SPARK" TO INSPIRE THE MOTIVATION TO CHANGE AND IMPROVE THEIR CIRCUMSTANCES, WHICH WILL ALLOW THEM TO BREAK THE CYCLE OF POVERTY.  THE CATALYST'S COACHING IS FREE, AND PROGRAMS ARE OFFERED FOR MINIMAL COSTS. IN ADDITION, SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AVAILABLE FOR THOSE WHO NEED THEM ENSURING THOSE WITH THE MOST NEEDS ARE ABLE TO PARTICIPATE.    
THE CATALYST HAS DEVELOPED AND DELIVERED QUALITY BUSINESS COACHING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION TO THOUSANDS OF INDIVIDUALS IN NORTH ALABAMA, MANY OF WHICH ARE LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES.  THE DEMAND FOR OUR SERVICES CONTINUES TO GROW YEAR AFTER YEAR, AND WE ARE AT THE JUNCTURE WHERE WE NEED ASSISTANCE TO MANAGE THAT GROWTH.  AS SUCH, WE ARE SO BUSY "WORKING IN" THE BUSINESS, WE DON'T HAVE TIME TO "WORK ON" THE BUSINESS.  THIS IS WHERE THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM CAN REALLY MAKE A DIFFERENCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES IN NORTH ALABAMA. THE PROJECTS WE HAVE IDENTIFIED WILL

THE CITY OF RENTON IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING A SAFE AND HEALTHY COMMUNITY, PROMOTING ECONOMIC VITALITY AND PLANNED GROWTH, BUILDING AN INCLUSIVE CITY, AND PROVIDING HIGH-QUALITY CUSTOMER SERVICE.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, AND HEALTHY FUTURES CNCS FOCUS AREAS.  

THE RENTON SUNSET AREA TRANSFORMATION PLAN AND RENTON INNOVATION ZONE VISTA PROJECT WILL: (I) SEEK TO ENGAGE RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES TO COLLECTIVELY ADDRESS PROBLEMS AND CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONAL AND COMMUNITY ENHANCEMENTS, (II) HELP CREATE A MULTI-SERVICE AND CAREER DEVELOPMENT CENTER TO PROVIDE PLACE-BASED SERVICES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED ADULTS AND CHILDREN TO COMBAT POVERTY, (III) PROVIDE SUPPORT AND ACCESS TO JOB TRAINING AND OTHER SKILLS DEVELOPMENT SERVICES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS TO CREATE PATHWAYS OUT OF POVERTY; AND (IV) HELP BUILD THE SYSTEM-WIDE CAPACITY OF PROVIDERS TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL NEEDS OF CHILDREN AND YOUTH WITH AN EMPHASIS ON EARLY CHILDHOOD LEARNING AND OUT OF SCHOOL TIME ACTIVITIES.  

THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 440 RESIDENTS (INCLUDING BOTH ADULTS AND CHILDREN), 15 BUSINESSES, 40 STAFF OR VOLUNTEERS, AND 16 ORGANIZATIONS (POTENTIAL DUPLICATED FIGURES) DURING THE FIRST YEAR OF THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT.  FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS WORKING WITH RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES TO ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS, WRITING GRANT APPLICATIONS TO LEVERAGE FUNDS TO RENOVATE AND OPERATE A MULTI-SERVICE CENTER AND ADDRESS OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS, EXPANDING AND STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS WITH HEALTHCARE, EMPLOYMENT, AND JOB TRAINING ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE SERVICES FOR DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS, AND EXPANDING PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE EARLY LEARNING AND OUT OF SCHOOL TIME SERVICES FOR CHILDREN.  THE RENTON SUNSET AREA TRANSFORMATION PLAN AND RENTON INNOVATION ZONE PROJECT WILL TARGET AND SERVE TWO VERY DIVERSE, HIGH-POVERTY, HIGH-NEED SUBURBAN COMMUNITIES IN THE GREATER SEATTLE AREA IN KING COUNTY IN WASHINGTON STATE:  THE SUNSET AREA AND SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOOD IN THE CITY OF RENTON AND THE WEST HILL/SKYWAY COMMUNITY IN UNINCORPORATED KING COUNTY, ADJACENT TO THE CITY OF RENTON.

THE MISSION OF THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUBS OF UTAH COUNTY IS TO INSPIRE AND ENABLE ALL YOUNG PEOPLE TO REALIZE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AS PRODUCTIVE AND RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS AND LEADERS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO HELP BGCUC AND UVU SCUP SERVE MORE LOW-INCOME CHILDREN MORE EFFECTIVELY. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT OVER 10,000 YOUTH IN UTAH COUNTY. SIX VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, DATA COLLECTION, TRAINING, AND COMMUNICATIONS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

ESTABLISHED IN 1982 AS A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION, THE MISSION OF SAN JUAN FOUNDATION IS TO ASSIST SCHOOLS, COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS IN COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AND BENEFICIAL PURSUITS WITHIN SAN JUAN COUNTY, UTAH.  THE 2 VISTA PROJECTS ALIGN WITH THE MISSION STATEMENT IN THAT HEALTHY FUTURES PROMOTION WILL BE THE MAIN AREA OF CONCERN.
IN THIS PROPOSAL, TWO (2) VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE RECRUITED AND ASSIGNED TO TWO (2) SEPARATE WORK SITES SERVING COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT SAN JUAN COUNTY. THE VISTA ASSIGNMENT WILL BECOME SUSTAINABLE OVER A 2-3 YEAR PERIOD.

THE THAYNE CENTER ENVISIONS A WORLD IN WHICH PEOPLE'S BASIC NEEDS ARE MET AND IN WHICH THE VALUES OF EQUALITY AND SOCIAL JUSTICE ARE REALIZED. WE BELIEVE INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION HAVE A RESPONSIBILITY TO CULTIVATE AN ENGAGED CITIZENRY. WE ARE THEREFORE DEDICATED TO EMPOWERING OUR STUDENTS AND FACULTY TO REALIZE THEY HAVE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO AFFECT POSITIVE CHANGE IN THEIR COMMUNITY. . THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO STRENGTHEN PROGRAMMING IN THE SLCC PANTRIES AND CAMPUS GARDEN, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT SEVERAL HUNDRED MEMBERS OF THE SLCC COMMUNITY. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING
ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PROGRAM DESIGN AND DATA COLLECTION OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE UTAH CONSERVATION CORPS MISSION IS TO DEVELOP THE CONSERVATION LEADERS OF TOMORROW THROUGH SERVICE AND EDUCATION . THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES CNCS FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SELF SUFFICIENCY INFORMATION TO 500 INDIVIDUALS AND WILL RECRUIT AN ADDITIONAL 100 VOLUNTEERS SERVING 500 HOURS. ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

AT SOUTHWEST PREVENTION, A DIVISION OF SOUTHWEST BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CENTER, WE STRIVE TO BE PROACTIVE IN PROMOTING POSITIVE LIFESTYLES, REDUCING AND ELIMINATING DRUG USE AND OTHER RISK FACTORS THAT LEAD TO ANTISOCIAL BEHAVIORS, AND FOLLOWING EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICES TO ENGAGE COMMUNITY LEADERS, ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES IN UNITING THEIR PREVENTION EFFORTS. OUR PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES - OPIOID ADDICTION PREVENTION AND RECOVERY FOCUS AREA. THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO REDUCE YOUTH & ADULT OPIOID MISUSE, PREVENT FUTURE OPIOID ADDICTIONS, RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT THE DANGERS OF OPIOID MISUSE, AND CHANGE THE AVAILABILITY OF OPIOIDS IN OUR COMMUNITIES. WE HOPE TO POSITIVELY IMPACT MOST OF THE 229,000 PEOPLE LIVING IN THE SOUTHWEST REGION OF UTAH AS MANY OF OUR PROPOSED STRATEGIES ARE UNIVERSAL APPROACHES. WE HOPE THAT 2 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES THAT STRENGTHEN OUR COMMUNITY PREVENTION COALITIONS, BUILD NEW PARTNERSHIPS IN OUR AREAS, DEVELOP NEW MESSAGING CAMPAIGNS AND MORE STRATEGIES THAT THEY WILL HELP US TO PLAN FOR OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS.

CATHOLIC COMMUNITY SERVICES OF UTAH'S MISSION IS TO PRACTICE GOSPEL VALUES OF LOVE, COMPASSION AND HOPE THROUGH SERVICE, SUPPORT AND COLLABORATION. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE OUR DATA ANALYSIS AND VOLUNTEER SYSTEMS IN ORDER TO PROVIDE BETTER ECONOMIC AND JOB PLACEMENT SERVICES FOR OUR CLIENTS; AND WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT 1,200 HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS EACH YEAR BY PROVIDING CASE MANAGEMENT/JOB PLACEMENT SERVICES AND ALSO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 650 VOLUNTEERS PER YEAR. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BUILDING NEW DATA CAPTURE AND ANALYSIS TOOLS, AND REVIEWING AND IMPROVING OUR VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION SYSTEMS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE HOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE COUNTY OF SALT LAKE?S MISSION IS PROVIDE AND DEVELOP QUALITY AFFORDABLE HOUSING OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WHILE PROMOTING SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND NEIGHBORHOOD REVITALIZATION. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE AGENCY EFFICIENCY BY DEVELOPING AND PUTTING IN PLACE 5 NEW SYSTEMS/BUSINESS PROCESSES OR ENHANCEMENTS DURING THE FIRST YEAR AND WILL IMPROVE THE EFFICIENCY OF TRANSITIONING INDIVIDUALS INTO HOUSING, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 125 STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS, AND OVER 4200 LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CONDUCTING A COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT, DEVELOPING NEW MATERIALS AND INCREASING THE USE OF TECHNOLOGY TO SIMPLIFY ACCESSING SERVICES, AND MANAGING THE AGENCY REBRAND ROLLOUT BY TRAINING STAFF AND PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

CLACKAMAS COUNTY SOCIAL SERVICES (CCSS) IS DEDICATED TO HELPING PEOPLE IN NEED LIVE WITH SELF-RELIANCE AND INDEPENDENCE, OFFERING MANY OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL COUNTY RESIDENTS TO BE SOCIALLY ENGAGED.  FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, LOW INCOME RESIDENTS, AND VETERANS, THEY OFFER MANY PROGRAMS THAT HELP SUPPORT THE COMMUNITY AND PROVIDE PEOPLE WITH THE INFORMATION AND RESOURCES THEY NEED TO BE HEALTHY AND SAFE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA.  THE PROJECT WILL SERVE LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS OF THE COUNTY LIVING WITH CHRONIC HEALTH CONDITIONS AND/ OR SOCIAL ISOLATION THROUGH THE USE OF EVIDENCE BASED PROGRAMMING. THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT FIFTY RESIDENTS PER YEAR. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS NETWORKING WITH PARTNER AGENCIES, DEVELOPING NEW PARTNERSHIPS, AND DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING PROGRAM POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OVER THE COURSE OF THE THREE YEAR PROJECT.

TRUCKEE MEADOWS PARKS FOUNDATION IS A 501 (C) (3) ORGANIZATION THAT PROVIDES FOR THE LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY AND IMPROVEMENT OF OUR PARKS. THE PARKS FOUNDATION VISTA PROJECT, HEALTHY PARKS HEALTHY PEOPLE, PROVIDES DISADVANTAGED STUDENTS WITH AN ACTIVE,HANDS-ON PROGRAM DESIGNED TO INCREASE PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND MITIGATE CHILDHOOD OBESITY. THIS VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH CNCS'S HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. SEVEN VISTA MEMBERS CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RAISING FUNDS FOR ORGANIZATIONAL SUPPORT, DEVELOPING A VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, IMPROVING ORGANIZATIONAL MARKETING EFFORTS, AND BUILDING HEALTH-BASED CURRICULUM. THREE VISTA MEMBERS SERVE AT CARSON CITY PARKS, RECREATION, AND OPEN SPACE DEPARTMENT WHERE THEY DEVELOP NEW COMMUNITY EDUCATION PROGRAMMING AND HELP GET MORE CITIZENS INTO THEIR PARKS AND GET HEALTHY. TWO VISTA MEMBERS SERVE AT THE WASHOE COUNTY HEALTH DISTRICT WHERE THEY RESEARCH AND DEVELOP SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAMS, PARTICULARLY TARGETING THE OPIOID CRISIS. TWO VISTA MEMBERS SERVE AT NORTHERN NEVADA HOPES, A 501 (C) (3) ORGANIZATION THAT PROVIDES INTEGRATED MEDICAL CARE AND WELLNESS SERVICES FOR MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS. THE MEMBERS AT HOPES PERFORM RESEARCH AND DEVELOP THE CAPACITY OF CHANGE POINT, NEVADA'S FIRST LEGAL SYRINGE SERVICES PROGRAM, AND OTHER MEDICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS THE OPIOID CRISIS IN NORTHERN NEVADA. ONE VISTA LEADER, BASED OUT OF THE PARKS FOUNDATION, ASSISTS IN BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF THE 14 VISTA MEMBERS ACROSS THE FOUR ORGANIZATIONS.

UNITED WAY OF SOUTHERN NEVADA'S MISSION IS TO UNITE THE COMMUNITY TO IMPROVE PEOPLE'S LIVES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT RESULT -DRIVEN, COST EFFECTIVE SOLUTIONS THAT SUPPORT STUDENTS FROM CRADLE TO CAREER. BY IMPLEMENTING THE RESULT DRIVEN SOLUTIONS OVER 1,000 STUDENTS WILL BE GREATLY BE AFFECTED. 10 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING INFLUENTIAL PROGRAMS AND OR TRACKING TOOLS TO MONITOR STUDENT SUCCESS OVER THE COURSE OF 12-36 MONTHS.

THE MISSION OF THE NEVADA HOMELESS ALLIANCE IS TO CREATE IMPACTFUL PARTNERSHIPS AND PROMOTE COLLABORATION AMONG PRIVATE, PUBLIC AND NONPROFIT SECTORS THROUGH ADVOCACY, EVENTS AND EDUCATION.
THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND EFFORTS TO INCREASE RESOURCES FOR ENDING HOMELESSNESS, THROUGH:  INCREASING PUBLIC AWARENESS AND ENHANCING COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT; INCREASING THE FREQUENCY OF COLLABORATIVE OUTREACH EVENTS TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO RESOURCES; AND INCREASING CAPACITY OF HOMELESS SERVICE AGENCIES TO PROVIDE EVIDENCED-BASED PRACTICES. THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT OVER 3,000 PEOPLE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS ANNUALLY, AS WELL AS HOMELESS SERVICE AGENCIES, AND THE SOUTHERN NEVADA HOMELESSNESS CONTINUUM OF CARE. OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR, TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT TOOLS; FUNDRAISING, DEVELOPING A SPEAKER'S BUREAU ON HOMELESSNESS, DEVELOPING PLANS FOR VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT AND OUTREACH, AND DEVELOPING WORKSHOPS AND OTHER LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES FOR HOMELESS SERVICE AGENCIES TO PROVIDE BEST-PRACTICE INTERVENTIONS.  

THE NEVADA HOMELESS ALLIANCE IS PREPARED TO MANAGE AN AMERICORP GRANT. WE FEEL STRONGLY THAT THE GOALS OF OUR ORGANIZATION ARE WELL ALIGNED WITH THE MISSION AND OBJECTIVE OF THE AMERICORP VISTA PROGRAM. THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION.

THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE WAPAAYATAT (NEZ PERCE WORD FOR SERVE) VISTA PROJECT MISSION IS TO COMBAT POVERTY AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE, NEZ PERCE PEOPLE AND THE COMMUNITIES THAT RESIDE ON THE NEZ PERCE RESERVATION (POP. 18,650) IN RURAL NORTH CENTRAL IDAHO.  THE WAPAAYATAT PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOLLOWING FOCUS AREAS INCLUDING CAPACITY BUILDING, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTHY EATING.  THE PROJECT WILL BUILD CAPACITY FOR THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE AND COMMUNITIES BY WORKING WITH FIVE NEZ PERCE TRIBE DEPARTMENTS AND PROGRAMS INCLUDING THE GRANTS MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IN FINANCE DEPARTMENT, I-VISION PROGRAM IN SOCIAL SERVICES DEPARTMENT, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN EXECUTIVE DIRECTION AND ALSO PARTNERS WITH NEZ PERCE TRIBE EXTENSION PROGRAM BASED AND THE NIMIIPUU FUND.  IN THE FUTURE THERE IS POTENTIAL TO EXPAND REACH AND SERVICES BY INCLUDING VISTA MEMBERS IN DEPARTMENTS AND PROGRAMS IN THE TRIBE SUCH AS THE EDUCATION DEPARTMENT, EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, VETERANS PROGRAM AND COMMUNITY NONPROFITS SUCH AS WISTEQN?EEMIT AND THE LAPWAI COMMUNITY COALITION THAT IS FIGHTING THE WAR AGAINST OPIOID AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE.
  CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE GRANT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, GRANT TOOLS AND RESOURCES, TRAINING MANUALS AND CALENDARS, MARKETING AND PROMOTIONAL ACTIVITIES,  CAPACITY INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENT, POLICIES & PROCEDURE DEVELOPMENT, DATA COLLECTION/MANAGEMENT/REPORTING, COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT AND PROJECT SUSTAINABILITY THAT WILL BENEFIT AN ESTIMATED 3,500 TRIBAL MEMBERS OR 18,650 RESIDENTS THAT RESIDE ON THE RESERVATION.  
  THE FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY ENGAGING TRIBAL PROGRAMS/DEPARTMENTS/STAFF AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS.  THEY WILL ALSO DEVELOP GRANTS, VOLUNTEER TRAINING CURRICULA, VOLUNTEER DATABASES, POLICY & PROCEDURE MANUALS, DATA NEEDS/DATABASES AND WILL GENERATE OUTREACH & MARKETING MATERIALS OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT TWO YEARS.  THE FIVE VISTA MEMBERS  WILL ENABLE THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE TO BUILD CAPACITY AND ABILITY TO COMBAT, ALLEVIATE OR ERADICATE POVERTY MORE EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY.

THE IDAHO GOVERNOR'S OFFICE OF DRUG POLICY (ODP) LEADS IDAHO'S SUBSTANCE USE AND MISUSE POLICY AND PREVENTION EFFORTS BY DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING STRATEGIC ACTION PLANS AND COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS TO REDUCE DRUG USE AND RELATED CRIME, THEREBY IMPROVING THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF ALL IDAHOANS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE IDAHO OPIOID MISUSE AND OVERDOSE STRATEGIC PLAN IS A FIVE-YEAR PLAN TO REDUCE THE BURDEN AND PREVENT THE ONSET OF OPIOID USE DISORDERS. THE INVOLVEMENT OF THE VISTA IN THE STRATEGIC PLAN WILL BE CRITICAL IN FACILITATING ODP'S ROLE TO ENSURE THAT STRATEGIES ARE IMPLEMENTED. THIS PROGRAM WILL ULTIMATELY STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY BY FACILITATING THE COMPLETION OF STRATEGIES AMONG 60 DIFFERENT PARTNERS TO COMBAT THE OPIOID ISSUE IN THE STATE, WITH 1.6 MILLION IDAHOANS ULTIMATELY BENEFITTING FROM THE EFFORT. ONE (1) VISTA WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY SCHEDULING MEETINGS, FACILITATING CONFERENCE CALLS, WRITING AND DISSEMINATING MEETING MINUTES, ORGANIZING AND SENDING INFORMATION, PLANNING OPIOID EDUCATION-RELATED EVENTS, DELIVERING PRESENTATIONS, MANAGING DOCUMENT SHARING, AND ASSISTING WITH OPIOID-RELATED DISCRETIONARY FUNDS, AMONG OTHER SIMILAR ACTIVITIES OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

ACROSS IDAHO, INTEREST IN LEARNING TO COMBAT THE EFFECTS OF ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES IS GROWING. THE IDAHO CHILDREN?S TRUST FUND HAS BECOME A CENTRAL POINT OF CONTACT, WITH REQUESTS FOR TRAININGS AND PRESENTATIONS ON A VARIETY OF TOPICS: HOPE CONQUERS ACES (HCA), STRENGTHENING FAMILIES, RESILIENCE, PAPER TIGERS, STEWARDS OF CHILDREN, THE BRAIN ARCHITECTURE GAME AND MORE. AS DEMAND GROWS, SO DOES THE NEED FOR QUALIFIED, KNOWLEDGEABLE TRAINERS ACROSS THE STATE. TO MEET THIS NEED, THE CHILDREN?S TRUST FUND WILL RECRUIT TRAINERS FROM EACH OF THE SEVEN IDAHO REGIONS AND CHARGE THEM WITH TRAINING A MINIMUM OF 500 IDAHOANS IN THE NEXT YEAR. THE LONG-RANGE GOAL IS TO EMBED THESE TRAININGS AND THIS INFORMATION INTO THE FABRIC OF SERVICES OFFERED ACROSS THE STATE AND INTO OUR COMMUNITIES. IDAHO WILL HAVE STATE-WIDE CAPABILITY TO OFFER TRAININGS AND PRESENTATIONS SPECIFIC TO THE NEEDS, INTERESTS AND TIME-FRAMES OF ANY AUDIENCE.

THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON INCREASING THE UNDERSTANDING OF ACES STATEWIDE AND TEACHING THE SKILLS NEEDED TO BUILD RESILIENCY AND OTHER PROTECTIVE FACTORS KNOWN TO MITIGATE THE IMPACTS OF CHILDHOOD TRAUMA.  THE PRIMARY AUDIENCE FOR THESE TRAININGS IN THE FIRST YEAR WILL BE TEACHERS, COACHES, SOCIAL SERVICE PROFESSIONALS, CITY EMPLOYEES (ESPECIALLY THOSE WITH YOUTH RESPONSIBILITIES), CHILD CARE PROGRAMS AND OTHER PROFESSIONALS WHO WORK WITH FAMILIES.   WHILE MUCH WORK IS BEING DONE TO DEAL WITH THE AFTERMATH OF ABUSE AND NEGLECT, LITTLE IS DONE TO STRENGTHEN FAMILIES TO PREVENT ABUSE AND NEGLECT BEFORE IT OCCURS.  THE CHILDREN?S TRUST FUND IS CHARGED WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY OF PREVENTION WHICH WE CAN ACCOMPLISH BY BUILDING COMMUNITIES? AND ORGANIZATIONS? CAPACITY TO PROVIDE PREVENTION AND TRAUMA INFORMED SERVICES.

THE JESSE TREE OF IDAHO'S MISSION IS TO PREVENT HOMELESSNESS BY PROVIDING EMERGENCY RENT AND MERCY ASSISTANCE TO EXTREMELY LOW, VERY LOW, AND LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES AS DEFINED BY HUD'S AREA MEDIAN INCOME GUIDELINES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL AIM TO ALLOW THE JESSE TREE OF IDAHO TO FIND ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO PROVIDE MORE THAN ONE MONTH'S WORTH OF RENT TO ADA AND CANYON COUNTY RESIDENTS.  ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO ASSISTING JESSE TREE IN FUNDRAISING, EVENT MANAGEMENT AND GRANT WRITING.

THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBE LOCATED IN NORTH CENTRAL IDAHO. THERE ARE 3,650 ENROLLED TRIBAL MEMBERS, MOST OF WHOM LIVE ON THE RURAL RESERVATION WHICH ENCOMPASSES 1,208 SQUARE MILES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECTS WILL PROVIDE CAPACITY NEEDED FOR THE TRIBE'S ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS BY PROVIDING MEANINGFUL AND NECESSARY EMPLOYMENT TO UNDER-RESOURCED TRIBAL MEMBERS, PARTICULARLY OPPORTUNITY YOUTH. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO TRIBAL COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CAPACITY BUILDING FOR A SMALL BUSINESS ASSOCIATION, A COMMUNITY-BASED LOCAL FOODS INITIATIVE, AND A CULTURAL PROGRAM DESIGNED TO FURTHER TRIBAL MEMORIES AND STORYTELLING FOR PRESERVATION OF HERITAGE AND CULTURE ESSENTIAL TO TRIBAL SELF IDENTITY AND DEVELOPMENT.

THE MAHONEY HOUSE'S MISSION IS TO STOP, PREVENT, AND HEAL THE EFFECTS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, DATING VIOLENCE, AND STALKING IN LEMHI AND CUSTER COUNTIES. THE SALMON EMPOWERMENT PROJECT'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES TO SALMON'S NEXT GENERATION TO EXPERIENCE OUTDOOR ADVENTURES, ENGAGE IN CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT AND TO ENRICH THE LEMHI VALLEY BY GIVING BACK TO THE COMMUNITY. THE MAHONEY HOUSE BUILDING CAPACITY AND CONNECTIONS PROJECT ADDRESSES THE FOLLOWING VISTA PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES FOR THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, EDUCATION, AND HEALTHY FUTURES. ONE VISTA MEMBER PER YEAR WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING POLICIES AND PROTOCOLS FOR MENTOR AND MENTEE APPLICATIONS; TRAINING INTERVIEWERS FOR MENTORS AND MENTEES FOR POTENTIAL MATCHES; BUILDING A TRAINING PROGRAM FOR MENTORS; COMPLETING A FLEXIBLE CURRICULUM FOR THE SOCIAL AND EMOTION LEARNING GROUPS; AND PROVIDING OUTREACH FOR PARENTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS REGARDING ALL PROGRAMS, INCLUDING EFFECTS OF SUBSTANCE ABUSE--INCLUDING OPIOIDS, OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

HAWAI'I MEALS ON WHEELS (HMOW) IS DEDICATED TO HELPING OAHU'S ELDERS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PRESERVE THEIR INDEPENDENCE AT HOME. WE DO THIS PRIMARILY BY PROVIDING HOT, NUTRITIOUS MEALS AND REGULAR PERSONAL INTERACTION WITH THOSE WE SERVE.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA.THE HAWAII MEALS ON WHEELS VISTA PROJECT ("DATA IS SEXY") WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT DATA SYSTEMS FOR OUR CLIENTS AND VOLUNTEERS.  THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO:
1)	PROVIDE INCREASED QUALITY SERVICES TO CLIENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES 
2)	PROVIDE INCREASED QUALITY VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCES FOR OUR 450+ VOLUNTEERS.

VISTAS ARE KEY TO OUR ORGANIZATION AS THEY WILL BE THE FOUNDATION AND THE IMPETUS TO DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING THIS DATA PROJECT.  VISTAS WILL HELP US COLLECT, ANALYZE, STREAMLINE DATA AND FIND CREATIVE WAYS TO PROBLEM SOLVE.    WE PLAN TO HAVE TWO VISTAS--ONE TO DEVELOP OUR CLIENT DATA AND ONE TO DEVELOP VOLUNTEER DATA.  WE ALSO PLAN TO IMPLEMENT THE PROJECT IN 4 PHASES: 1) COLLECTION OF GOOD DATA, 2) ANALYZING DATA, 3) BRAINSTORMING AND CREATIVE SOLUTIONS, AND 4) PRESENTATION OF DATA THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA AND MARKETING.  

THE TIMELINE OF THE PROJECT IS 3 YEARS:  
YEAR 1- IMPLEMENT PHASE 1 AND THE EARLY STAGES OF PHASE 2. 
YEAR 2- CONTINUE TO COLLECT GOOD DATA, IMPLEMENT PHASE 2 AND EARLY PART OF PHASE 3. 
YEAR 3- CONTINUE WITH PHASE 3 AND ENDING WITH THE COMPLETION OF PHASE 4.

THE MISSION OF THE COUNTY OF HAWAI'I'S DEPARTMENT OF RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT (R&D) IS TO ADVANCE KNOWLEDGE AND INNOVATION TO MAKE HAWAII COUNTY A GREAT PLACE TO LIVE, WORK, AND VISIT. R&D INFORMS PLANNING, POLICY, AND PROGRAMMATIC DECISION-MAKING WITH DATA-DRIVEN RESEARCH AND COLLABORATES IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND FUNDING OF INITIATIVES SEEKING ENVIRONMENTAL, COMMUNITY, AND ECONOMIC SUSTAINABILITY.  

THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES THAT MOST CLOSELY ALIGN WITH THE COUNTY'S NEEDS ARE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTHY FUTURES.  WITH THOSE PRIORITIES IN MIND, THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO ENHANCE THE COMMUNITY'S CAPACITY TO COLLABORATE AS A NETWORK TO ADVANCE COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, WITH A FOCUS ON FOUR CRITICAL HOUSEHOLD CHALLENGES: TRANSPORTATION, AFFORDABLE HOUSING, ENERGY, AND ECONOMIC RECOVERY.  TARGET POPULATIONS INCLUDE PEOPLE WITH LOW INCOMES, REGARDLESS OF AGE, SEX, MARITAL STATUS, OR ETHNIC BACKGROUND.  THIS PROGRAM WILL REQUIRE FOUR VISTAS FOR THREE YEARS.  THESE VISTAS WILL PRACTICE COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT, STRENGTHEN PARTNERSHIPS, AND DEVELOP AND DELIVER COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS THAT INCLUDE COMMUNITY OUTREACH, INFORMATION CLEARINGHOUSES, PUBLIC PRESENTATIONS, AND TRAINING WORKSHOPS.

TO FOSTER BEHAVIOR THAT IS SAFE AND HEALTHY FOR YOUTH, STAFF, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES. PROVIDE  EFFECTIVE TREATMENT AND UNDERSTANDING STAGES OF CHANGE.  MAINTAINING FIDELITY TO OUR MODEL.  
THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA AND FOCUSED ON SERVING THE POPULATION OF VULNERABLE YOUTH. THE  VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO LEVERAGE A VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT SYSTEM BY ENHANCING THE NUMBER OF COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS RECRUITED AND MANAGED TO CREATE RESOURCES, MENTORSHIP TO YOUTH TO ASSIST THEM TOWARDS PATHWAYS OF SELF-SUFFICIENCY, AND CREATING COMMUNITY CENTERS TO SHARE THOSE VALUES AND INTERESTS. 
DJJ INCLUDES A VISTA FOR HEADQUARTERS  FOR OVERALL STATEWIDE COMMUNICATION AND SHARED IDEAS WITH THE EXECUTIVE TEAM, OTHER STAKEHOLDERS, AND VISTAS AT THE THREE FACILITY SITES.  
THE  TRACKING, COLLECTING AND AGGREGATING FOR FACILITY AND DJJ PERFORMANCE MEASURES WILL UTILIZE VISTA CREATED AND EXISTING DJJ VOLUNTEER DATABASES, ASSESSMENTS AND SURVEYS THAT CAN DETERMINE THE IMPACT AND EFFECTIVENESS OF THE PROJECT TOWARDS THE DJJ MISSION OF GUIDING PRINCIPLES. 
COLLABORATION WITH OTHER CNCS PROGRAMS WILL INCLUDE THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN TERMS OF SHARED ACTIVITIES, EVENTS, PARTICIPATION IN VOLUNTEER COMMITTEES AND POSSIBLE MENTORSHIP OF THE VISTAS FROM THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM COMMUNITY MEMBERS. ANY OF THESE COLLABORATIONS WILL NOT INCLUDE ANY MANAGEMENT BY THE VISTAS.

ASCENCIA'S MISSION, "TO LIFT PEOPLE OUT OF HOMELESSNESS ONE PERSON, ONE FAMILY AT A TIME," SPEAKS TO HOW WE PLACE INDIVIDUALIZED CARE AT THE CENTER OF OUR WORK. OUR VISION, "A COMMUNITY WHERE PEOPLE IN NEED ACCESS SERVICES AND FIND SAFE, AFFORDABLE HOUSING," CALLS US TO ADDRESS SYSTEMIC DRIVERS OF HOMELESSNESS -- OUR ANTI-POVERTY FOCUS. ASCENCIA IS A 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION FORMED IN 2006 AS PATH ACHIEVE GLENDALE TO OPERATE A RANGE OF PROGRAMS SERVING HOMELESS FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS IN THE GREATER GLENDALE AREA. IN 2011, WE SEPARATED FROM THE PATH FAMILY OF AGENCIES AND BECAME ASCENCIA. NOW IN OUR 11TH YEAR OF OPERATION, ASCENCIA'S DIVERSE STAFF OF 31 SERVES OVER 1,000 PEOPLE PER YEAR THROUGH OUTREACH, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND HOUSING-BASED PROGRAMS. OUR SERVICE AREA ENCOMPASSES GLENDALE, BURBANK, THE LOS ANGELES COMMUNITIES OF EAGLE ROCK, HIGHLAND PARK, GLASSELL PARK AND ATWATER VILLAGE, AND WEST HOLLYWOOD. ASCENCIA'S 20-MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS APPLIES LESSONS FROM ANNENBERG ALCHEMY TRAINING TO ORGANIZE COMMITTEE WORK AND PROMOTE A CULTURE OF PHILANTHROPY. THE AGENCY'S ANNUAL OPERATING BUDGET FOR FY2019 IS $3.1 MILLION.

ASCENCIA SEEKS TO SERVE AS THE LEAD AGENCY TO BRING SEVEN (7) VISTAS TO FOUR (4) HOMELESS SERVICE AGENCIES LOCATED IN NORTHEAST LOS ANGELES. OUR VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY PRIORITY AREA OF THE CNCS PROGRAMMING. THE VISTAS WILL ESTABLISH COMMUNICATION AND FUNDRAISING INFRASTRUCTURE TO RAISE THE ORGANIZATIONS' PROFILES, TO SOLICIT MORE FUNDING, AND TO DRAW IN NEW DONORS AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS. AS THE VISTAS' WORK HELPS TO GENERATE MORE DONATIONS, THE ORGANIZATIONS WILL BENEFIT BY HAVING MORE FUNDING TO OFFSET BUDGET SHORTFALLS, CONTRACT MATCH REQUIREMENTS, AND HAVE GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO RESPOND TO URGENT NEEDS FROM THE COMMUNITY. FOR EXAMPLE, IN THE MIDDLE OF FY2017, ASCENCIA WAS TOLD THAT ALL CLIENTS IN THE FAMILY SOLUTIONS PROGRAM NEEDED TO BE HOUSED 24 HOURS/7 DAYS A WEEK, WHICH MEANT HIRING A RESIDENT ASSISTANT TO COVER THE HOURS FROM 7 AM - 3 PM. WE HAD NOT ANTICIPATED THAT NEED AND HAD NOT BUDGETED AN ADDITIONAL 1.5 STAFF. THE TIME TO BUILD THE INFRASTRUCTURE MAY VARY SLIGHTLY BY ORGANIZATION, BUT WE ANTICIPATE THE PROJECT TO TAKE THREE (3) YEARS. THE FIRST YEAR WILL FOCUS ON BUILDING, THE SECOND YEAR ON REFINING THE INFRASTRUCTURE BASED ON FIRST YEAR'S ANALYSIS, AND THE THIRD YEAR ON RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING OF VOLUNTEERS AND STAFF TO CONTINUE THE PROJECT.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES -- OPIOID RECOVERY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO STRENGTHEN COUNTY AND COMMUNITY EFFORTS TO COMBAT THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC IN OHIO. THIRTY VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING COMMUNITY OUTREACH PLANS; DEVELOPING EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND TRAININGS; RESEARCHING BEST PRACTICES; BUILDING PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS; AND RESEARCHING AND WRITING GRANTS TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY EFFORTS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE MISSION OF THE LITERACY COUNCIL OF GRAND ISLAND IS TO TEACH THE LITERACY SKILLS NECESSARY TO COMMUNICATE, GROW, AND THRIVE WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY. THROUGH ALL OF OUR PROGRAMMING, WE SEEK TO BUILD BRIDGES THAT UNITE OUR DIVERSE COMMUNITY AND PURSUE OUR VISION OF CREATING A STRONGER, BETTER-CONNECTED, MORE PROSPEROUS COMMUNITY. 

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO LEVERAGE RESOURCES, INCREASE ORGANIZATIONAL EFFECTIVENESS, AND EXPAND OUR ORGANIZATION'S SCALE AND REACH, PROVIDING BENEFIT TO AT LEAST 125 LOW-LITERACY INDIVIDUALS.  THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS IMPLEMENTING STUDENT ASSESSMENT PROCEDURES, IMPROVING AND PROVIDING TRAINING ON CURRICULA, CONDUCTING VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, CREATING NEW PROCESSES FOR VOLUNTEER TRAINING AND SUPPORT, AND CREATING OUTREACH CONTENT TO INCREASE COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE INITIATIVE FOUNDATION SERVES A 14-COUNTY CENTRAL MINNESOTA REGION INCLUDING: BENTON, CASS, CHISAGO, CROW WING, ISANTI, KANABEC, MILLE LACS, MORRISON, PINE, SHERBURNE, STEARNS, TODD, WADENA, AND WRIGHT COUNTIES. OUR MISSION IS TO "UNLOCK THE POWER OF CENTRAL MINNESOTA PEOPLE TO BUILD AND SUSTAIN THRIVING COMMUNITIES" WHICH WE DO BY PROVIDING FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO BUSINESSES AND NONPROFITS (IN THE FORM OF LOANS AND GRANTS, RESPECTIVELY,) LEADERSHIP AND SKILLS TRAINING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND RESOURCE REFERRAL. 
ONE OF OUR MOST EFFECTIVE TOOLS FOR FIGHTING POVERTY AND PROMOTING PROSPERITY HAS BEEN AMERICORPS VISTA. FOR THE PAST 17 YEARS, THE INITIATIVE FOUNDATION HAS SUCCESSFULLY SPONSORED VISTA MEMBERS AND, BECAUSE OF THEIR TREMENDOUS IMPACT, IT IS OUR HOPE TO CONTINUE DOING SO.  

OUR VISTA PROJECT HAS BEEN UNIQUE IN THAT WE SPONSOR A DIVERSITY OF PROJECTS THAT HAVE ALIGNED WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREAS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT WILL CONTINUE TO REPRESENT THESE FOCUS AREAS IN AN EFFORT TO MEET THE DISTINCT NEEDS OF OUR REGION'S LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES WHILE WORKING ACROSS DIFFERENT SECTORS AND THROUGH A WIDE VARIETY OF STRATEGIES. WE PROPOSE SPONSORSHIP OF EIGHT GRANT-FUNDED MEMBERS, ONE GRANT-FUNDED VISTA LEADER, AND THREE COST-SHARE MEMBERS. VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING ROBUST VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS SO NONPROFIT SERVICE AGENCIES CAN BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF THEIR CLIENTS; DEVELOPING LITERACY PROGRAMMING FOR VULNERABLE CHILDREN; AND HELPING TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF PROGRAMS TO BETTER SUPPORT AREA VETERANS, MILITARY MEMBERS, AND THEIR FAMILIES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
TSF'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER YOUTH BY SUPPORTING AND PROMOTING EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT THROUGH IN-SCHOOL AND AFTER SCHOOL SUPPORT, IMPROVE LIVES BY PROMOTING PROGRAMS THAT STRENGTHEN PHYSICAL HEALTH AND SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND UNITE COMMUNITIES BY ADVANCING DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND COMMUNITY WELL-BEING.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH EDUCATION PRIORITY AREA AND K-12 SUCCESS. THE VISTA CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT WILL SEEK TO: 1) COMPLETE A SET OF CAPACITY BUILDING GOALS THAT EXPAND THE EFFICIENCY OF THE ORGANIZATION; 2) HARNESS THE INNOVATION, CREATIVITY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF YOUNG PEOPLE AND INDIVIDUALS JUST OUT OF COLLEGE TO ENHANCE, IMPROVE AND INNOVATE TSF IN THE AREAS OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS, FUNDRAISING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND RESEARCH AND EVALUATION; 3) ASSIST TSF IN BUILDING CAPACITY TO CONCEPTUALIZE, CREATE, IMPROVE, MODIFY, FACILITATE AND IMPLEMENT PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVES WHICH HAVE THE SPECIFIC GOAL OF ELIMINATING AND/OR REDUCING POVERTY IN LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS AND COMMUNITIES THROUGH EDUCATION; AND 4) PROVIDE A MEANINGFUL, EDUCATIONAL, IMPACTFUL, AND POSITIVE LIFE-CHANGING PROFESSIONAL AND SKILL-BUILDING EXPERIENCE FOR VISTA MEMBERS, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 1,000 BENEFICIARIES, ALONG WITH THEIR FAMILY AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS.  SIX (6) VISTA SERVICE MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: USING INNOVATION AND CREATIVITY TO BUILD SYSTEMS WHICH STRENGTHEN THE DREAMLINE PROGRAM'S LOCAL AND REGIONAL PARTNERSHIPS; IDENTIFY ADDITIONAL RESOURCES AND SERVICES WHICH STRENGTHEN DREAMLINE PROGRAM DELIVERY IN THE BENEFICIARY COMMUNITY; RECRUIT DREAMLINE COACHES WHO HAVE A SPECIFIC INTEREST IN PARTNERING AND MENTORING STUDENTS TO ENHANCE ACADEMIC SUCCESS FOR YOUTH POPULATIONS RESIDING IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES AND COMMUNITIES OF COLOR; STRENGTHEN DREAMLINE'S SOCIAL MEDIA CAPACITY WHILE REFINING AND HONING TSF'S ONLINE PRESENCE TO BUILD AWARENESS OF DREAMLINE IMPACT AND TEACHER PATHWAY PROGRAM OPPORTUNITY; BUILD A SYSTEM WHICH HELPS SECURE GREATER FINANCIAL RESOURCES TO SUPPORT DREAMLINE PROGRAMMING AND ACTIVITIES ACROSS ALL BENEFICIARY COMMUNITIES; AND CONTRIBUTE TO THE DEVELOPMENT AND CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT OF MONITORING AND EVALUATING SYSTEMS WHICH CAN BE SUSTAINED THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT'S ANTICIPATED THREE YEARS AND AFTER CNCS RESOURCES ARE EXPENDED.

SERVEMINNESOTA'S MISSION IS A CATALYST TO ADDRESS CRITICAL NEEDS IN MINNESOTA BY WORKING WITH AMERICORPS AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS. WE SHARE OUR PROVEN PRACTICES NATIONALLY. WE GET MEASURABLE RESULTS THROUGH: INNOVATION; RESEARCHING AND APPLYING THE BEST DATA-DRIVEN METHODS TO CREATE POWERFUL LOCAL SOLUTIONS, INVESTMENT; RAISING AND ALLOCATING FUNDS FOR AMERICORPS PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, AND PEOPLE SERVING IN THOSE PROGRAMS, TO MAXIMIZE RETURN, AND ALIGNMENT; ALIGNING WITH LOCAL COMMUNITY AND GOVERNMENT PRIORITIES AND SETTING CONSISTENT PROGRAM STANDARDS TO ENSURE MEASURABLE RESULTS.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA, WITH AN EXPLICIT FOCUS ON IMPROVING ACCESS TO PREVENTATIVE SERVICES AMONG INDIVIDUALS IN RECOVERY FROM OPIOID ADDICTION. EXISTING SUPPORTS ARE LIMITED IN SCOPE, EFFICIENCY, AND EFFECTIVENESS. THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL BUILD ON INFORMATION REGARDING GAPS IN SERVICES TO REFINE OR DEVELOP SOLUTIONS THAT INCREASE THE REACH, EFFICIENCY, OR EFFECTIVENESS OF PARTNER PROGRAMS. VISTA MEMBERS WILL DEVELOP SOLUTIONS TO GAPS THAT MIGHT BE DELIVERED BY AMERICORPS MEMBERS OR VOLUNTEERS, BUILD INSTRUMENTS THAT WILL MEASURE IMPACT, AND CONSTRUCT PLANS FOR SITES TO ADOPT THOSE SOLUTIONS AND DATA INSTRUMENTS.  MEMBERS WILL PARTNER DIRECTLY WITH MINNESOTA RECOVERY CONNECTION, THE MINNESOTA ASSOCIATION OF SOBER HOMES, AND SERVEMINNESOTA DURING THEIR SERVICE YEAR; HOWEVER, ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE ESTABLISHING PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER RELEVANT ORGANIZATIONS. 

FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS THE COORDINATION OF NONPROFIT SERVICE PROVIDERS, DEVELOP TOOLS TO ASSESS THE LEVEL OF IMPACT CURRENT SOLUTIONS OFFER AND DEVELOP TOOLS TO ASSESS THE IMPACT OF SOLUTIONS GENERATED BY THE VISTA TEAM OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR.

THE MISSION OF THE INGHAM COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT IS TO PROTECT, IMPROVE, AND ADVOCATE FOR THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF OUR COMMUNITY BY IDENTIFYING AND ADVANCING THE CONDITIONS UNDER WHICH ALL PEOPLE CAN ACHIEVE OPTIMUM HEALTH.  THE PROPOSED PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREAS. ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY HELPS SITES FOCUS ON PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS IN THE AREAS OF EMPLOYMENT OR WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT FINANCIAL LITERACY. HEALTHY FUTURES SITES WILL FOCUS ON MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SUPPORTING ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE.  EDUCATION SITES WILL FOCUS ON CREATING AND STRENGTHENING PROGRAMMING IN STEM, K-12 SUCCESS, AND POST-SECONDARY SUCCESS.  THE PROJECT SEEKS TO BENEFIT RESIDENTS RESIDING IN INGHAM COUNTY WITH A FOCUS ON THE GREATER LANSING AREA.  TWELVE VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO MEETING THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, ORGANIZATIONAL ASSESSMENTS, AND FUND DEVELOPMENT CAMPAIGNS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

BETHANY CHRISTIAN SERVICES MISSION IS TO DEMONSTRATE THE LOVE AND COMPASSION OF HUMANITY BY PROTECTING AND ENHANCING THE LIVES OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES THROUGH QUALITY SOCIAL SERVICES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT AT BETHANY WILL SEEK TO RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND SUPERVISE 12 FULL-TIME, ON-SITE VISTA MEMBERS AND 1 FULL-TIME VISTA LEADER (AT ANY GIVEN TIME). THESE VISTA MEMBERS OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR WILL GENERATE EXPANDED SOURCES OF SOCIAL CAPITAL AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES IN KENT COUNTY TO HELP ADDRESS THE ROOT CAUSES OF POVERTY. SPECIFICALLY, THESE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT; JOB DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES; TRAINING AND EDUCATION; TUTOR MATCHING; HOUSING; DONOR ENGAGEMENT; EVENT PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION; ESL/ESOL CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT; AND JOINT CULTURAL ORIENTATION AND ENHANCED CULTURAL ORIENTATION CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT. ALL OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE DIRECTLY AIMED AT EXPANDING BETHANY'S CAPACITY TO SERVE THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED IN WEST MICHIGAN. THESE CAPACITY-BUILDING RESOURCES CREATED BY VISTA MEMBERS WILL HELP EMPOWER THE TARGET POPULATIONS TO BUILD EMPLOYMENT AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, FINANCIAL LITERACY, AND STABLE HOUSING IN ORDER TO OVERCOME THE DEBILITATING EFFECTS OF UNSTABLE, DYSFUNCTIONAL, OR NON-EXISTENT FAMILY DYNAMICS; THE LACK OF STABLE ADULT ROLE MODELS AND SUPPORTS; UNDER-DEVELOPED SOCIAL, RELATIONAL, AND LIFE SKILLS; DIFFICULTY ASSIMILATING AND TRANSITIONING INTO THE MAINSTREAM REALITIES OF ADULT LIVING; INADEQUATE EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT; AND OBSTACLES ACCESSING AND UTILIZING BASIC COMMUNITY RESOURCES.

MICHIGAN NONPROFIT ASSOCIATION (MNA) IS A STATEWIDE MEMBERSHIP ORGANIZATION WITH A MISSION TO SERVE NONPROFITS TO ADVANCE THEIR MISSIONS. INCORPORATED IN 1990, AND GOVERNED BY A BOARD THAT REPRESENTS THE DIVERSITY OF THE NONPROFIT SECTOR, MNA IS DEDICATED TO SERVING THE MORE THAN 47,000 NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH CIVIC ENGAGEMENT, CAPACITY-BUILDING, DATA AND TECHNOLOGY, TALENT DEVELOPMENT, TRAINING, AND ADVOCACY. WITH AN ANNUAL OPERATING BUDGET OF $3.4 MILLION, MNA MANAGES MULTIPLE PROGRAMS AND IS A SPONSORING ORGANIZATION FOR AMERICORPS VISTA. MNA?S PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO CREATE PATHWAYS FOR DISADVANTAGED YOUNG ADULTS BY SUPPORTING ACADEMIC SUCCESS AND STRENGTHENING CURRENT EMPLOYABILITY OF DISADVANTAGED ADULTS, WHICH WILL MAKE FOR STRONGER ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOR DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES. THIS PROGRAM IS EXPECTED TO BENEFIT MANY DISADVANTAGED ADULTS AND CHILDREN THROUGHOUT MICHIGAN. THIRTY-TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS STRENGTHENING STAFF AND FUNDING CAPACITY, DEVELOPING OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT MATERIALS, AND CREATING OPPORTUNITIES FOR NETWORKING AND RESOURCE SHARING OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.
