THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF HUNTINGTON COUNTY'S (THE CLUB) MISSION IS: TO ENABLE ALL YOUNG PEOPLE, ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO NEED US MOST, TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AS PRODUCTIVE, CARING, RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS. IN ORDER TO FULFILL THIS MISSION, THE CLUB MUST WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY.

THROUGH THE EMPOWERING COMMUNITIES TASK FORCE, SEVERAL AGENCIES IDENTIFIED TWO LONG-STANDING COMMUNITY NEEDS THAT HAVE BEEN ON THE COUNTY'S RADAR WITH NO CLEAR STRATEGY ON HOW TO ADDRESS THEM: AFFORDABLE HEALTHY LIFESTYLES FOR ALL AND ENHANCING SAFETY FOR OUR COMMUNITY'S YOUTH. AS THE GROUP WORKED AT TACKLING THE ISSUES, THEY LEARNED THEY NEEDED TO FIGURE OUT A WAY TO HIRE A PERSON (OR PERSONS) TO SOLELY FOCUS ON MEETING THESE NEEDS. WHEN THE CLUB BROUGHT THE OPTION OF APPLYING FOR VISTA MEMBERS TO THE GROUP, THE COMMITTEE WAS INSTANTLY EXCITED AS THEY CONTEMPLATED WAYS TO UTILIZE THE MEMBERS TO FULFILL THE GROUP'S VISION. 

THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL ASSIST IN FULFILLING THE GOALS OF THE TASK FORCE: INCREASE VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS, INCREASE THE NUMBER OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS PARTAKING IN AFFORDABLE FITNESS, IMPROVE SAFETY POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR THE CLUB, INCREASE MARKETING OF ALL OF THESE GOALS TO THE COMMUNITY.

THE NAOMI RUTH COHEN INSTITUTE FOR MENTAL HEALTH EDUCATION, PART OF THE CLINICAL COUNSELING DEPARTMENT AT THE CHICAGO SCHOOL OF PROFESSIONAL PSYCHOLOGY'S CHICAGO CAMPUS, IS DEDICATED TO ERADICATING THE STIGMA ASSOCIATED WITH MENTAL ILLNESS. THEIR MISSION IS TO REDUCE THE STIGMA ASSOCIATED WITH MENTAL ILLNESS THAT HAS BECOME A BARRIER FOR INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITIES RECEIVING MUCH-NEEDED SUPPORT. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTH FUTURES FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO REDUCE OPIOID-RELATED DEATHS IN CHICAGO BY PROMOTING SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION, EDUCATION, REDUCTION, AND RECOVERY, IN THREE LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS (AUSTIN, NORTH LAWNDALE, AND HUMBOLDT PARK); AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT A COLLECTIVE POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 183,755 EACH YEAR. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES TOWARDS THIS GOAL WHICH INCLUDE PREVENTING OPIOID USE DISORDERS FROM DEVELOPING BY DECREASING ACCESS TO NONPRESCRIPTION OPIOIDS, PROMOTING SAFE STORAGE OF MEDICATIONS BY DEVELOPING A PLAN FOR SAFE DISPOSAL OF EXCESS MEDICATIONS; HELPING TO IMPLEMENT EVIDENCE-BASED SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION FOR SCHOOL-AGE YOUTH, PROMOTING POSITIVE SOCIAL SKILLS FOR YOUTH AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO USING SUBSTANCES TO COPE WITH LIFE'S STRESSES AND CHALLENGES; AND SUPPORTING A CULTURE OF RECOVERY BY INCREASING COMMUNITY AWARENESS.

THE MISSION OF HOUSING ACTION ILLINOIS IS TO INCREASE AND PRESERVE THE SUPPLY OF DECENT, AFFORDABLE, ACCESSIBLE HOUSING IN ILLINOIS FOR LOW-AND MODERATE-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS.. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND AND PROTECT THE AVAILABILITY OF QUALITY, ACCESSIBLE, AFFORDABLE HOUSING THROUGHOUT ILLINOIS BY INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF NONPROFITS AND PUBLIC AGENCIES THAT SERVE FAMILIES WHO ARE EXPERIENCING OR ARE AT RISK OF EXPERIENCING HOUSING INSTABILITY OR HOMELESSNESS AND EXPECT TO BENEFIT 3,000 HOUSEHOLDS.  30 VISTA MEMBERS AND 38 SUMMER ASSOCIATES WILL CONTRIBUTE TO GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY CREATING AND IMPROVING SUSTAINABLE ORGANIZATIONAL SYSTEMS AND INCREASING THE EFFECTIVENESS AND EFFICIENCY OF PROGRAMS.

CRA-WA-LA VOLUNTEERS IN PROBATION, INC. IS LOCATED IN LAWRENCEVILLE, ILLINOIS. THE ORGANIZATION WAS FOUNDED IN 1970 BY, THEN NEWLY ELECTED, CIRCUIT JUDGE PHILLIP B BENEFIEL. HIS VISION... PROVIDE POSITIVE ADULT ROLE MODELS (MENTORS) "TO REDIRECT THE LIVES OF AT RISK YOUTH TOWARD BECOMING LAW ABIDING, POSITIVE, AND CONTRIBUTING MEMBERS OF SOCIETY THROUGH MENTORING. IN 1971, THE ORGANIZATION EXPANDED ITS SERVICES BEYOND LAWRENCE COUNTY, ADDING CRAWFORD AND WABASH COUNTIES--HENCE THE NAME CRA-WA-LA. 
THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION IS "TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE WITHIN ITS PARTICIPATING COUNTIES BY HELPING REDUCE CRIME, DELINQUENCY, AND RECIDIVISM AND PROMOTE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF ITS CITIZENS WITHIN PARTICIPATING COUNTIES."
THE ORGANIZATION ACCOMPLISHES ITS MISSION BY SEEKING TO CHANGE CONDITIONS THAT WEAKEN THE COMMUNITY AND PUT ITS YOUTH AND FAMILIES AT RISK, THROUGH ACTIVITIES SUCH AS THE BUILDING OF COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AND REDEVELOPMENT, AND EFFORTS DIRECTED AT IMPROVING COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL, EDUCATIONAL, AND POLITICAL AND OTHER PROBLEM CONDITIONS SUCH AS POVERTY AND CRIME. 
PROGRAMS AND SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE ORGANIZATION INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: (1) ONE-ON-ONE MENTORING FOR AT-RISK YOUTH AND REDIRECT THEIR LIVES TOWARD BECOMING POSITIVE AND CONTRIBUTING MEMBERS OF SOCIETY;  (2) ADVOCATING IN BEHALF OF BOTH YOUTH AND FAMILIES DIRECTLY AND INDIRECTLY; (3) COMMUNITY ORGANIZING LOCAL GROUPS TO RESOLVE THE COMMUNITY PROBLEMS SUCH AS SUBSTANCE ABUSE, CRIME, POVERTY, LITERACY, ETC.; AND (4) PROVIDING WHOLESOME, EDUCATIONAL AND RECREATIONAL YOUTH ACTIVITIES, INSTRUCTIONAL COURSES AND OTHER SUPPLEMENTARY SERVICES TO CARRY OUT CRA-WA-LA'S MISSION, AND PROMOTE PUBLIC SAFETY.
THE STAFF OF THE ORGANIZATION IS SMALL. THERE ARE TWO FULL-TIME EMPLOYEES AND ONE PART-TIME EMPLOYEE, AND AN OPENING FOR AN AMERICORPS VISTA. FOR THE PAST 8 YEARS, THE ORGANIZATION HAS SPONSORED A STATEWIDE AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT. FOR THE PAST TWO YEAR THE PROGRAM HAS PRIMARILY FOCUSED ON EDUCATION. THE ORGANIZATION'S STRATEGY HAS BEEN TO PLACE 23 AMERICORPS VISTAS IN COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE OF ILLINOIS HELPING WITH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES (EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS, SCALE/REACH, AND LEVERAGING RESOURCES), AND PROGRAM SUSTAINABILITY (VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT, VOLUNTEER AND STAFF STRAINING, EXPANSION OF SOCIAL MEDIA, SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION, COMMUNITY OUTREACH, ETC.).
THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PROVIDES OVERSIGHT AND GUIDANCE TO THE ORGANIZATION. ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN FUNDRAISING, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, MANAGEMENT, TRAINING, AND PROGRAM MONITORING. THE ORGANIZATION HAS AN ADVISORY BOARD FOR EACH FUNDED PROJECT THE ORGANIZATION IS INVOLVED.

THE GOAL OF THE PEORIA HOUSING AUTHORITY AND PCCEO?S HEAD START PARTNERSHIP IS THE CREATION OF AN EMPLOYMENT TRAINING AND SELF-SUFFICIENCY PROGRAM SPECIFICALLY TAILORED TO PHA RESIDENTS WHO HAVE CHILDREN ENROLLED IN HEAD START. PARTICIPANTS WHO COMPLETE THE EMPLOYMENT TRAINING PROGRAM WILL BE PREPARED FOR EMPLOYMENT AND THEIR CHILDREN WILL RECEIVE THE BENEFITS OF AN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION EXPERIENCE IN PCCEO'S HEAD START PROGRAM.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF FAMILIES ENROLLED IN SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND EARLY LEARNING PROGRAMS THROUGH STRATEGIC OUTREACH, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN PROGRAMS, AND CREATE A ROBUST SCHEDULE OF FAMILY ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES, WORKSHOPS AND FOCUSED TRAINING DESIGNED TO FURTHER ECONOMIC INDEPENDENCE. PEORIA HOUSING AUTHORITY IS PARTNERING WITH PCCEO'S HEAD START PROGRAM TO IDENTIFY SIXTY-FIVE FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN AGES THREE TO FIVE YEARS AND ELIGIBLE TO ENROLL IN PCCEO'S HEAD START PROGRAM. ENROLLMENT IN THE HEAD START PROGRAM IS A PREREQUISITE FOR PARTICIPATION IN THE EMPLOYMENT TRAINING AND SELF- SUFFICIENCY PROGRAM. THE EMPLOYMENT TRAINING AND SELF-SUFFICIENCY PROGRAM WILL ADMINISTER A STRENGTH AND NEEDS ASSESSMENT, A CAREER AND EDUCATION ASSESSMENT, OFFER JOB READINESS TRAINING AND PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT LEADS AND REFERRALS
THE NUMBER OF FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN ELIGIBLE TO ENROLL IN HEAD START DOES NOT MATCH THE NUMBER OF FAMILIES ACTUALLY ENROLLED IN THE PROGRAM.  WHILE OUTREACH IS CURRENTLY HELD IN PUBLIC LOCATIONS AND WITHIN THE HOUSING SITES, IT IS OPEN ENROLLMENT AND NOT SPECIFICALLY TARGETED TO RESIDENTS OF THAT PARTICULAR COMMUNITY.  TARGETED OUTREACH WILL ALLOW US TO BEST IDENTIFY, RECRUIT AND FOLLOW UP WITH ELIGIBLE FAMILIES WITHIN THE PARTNERSHIP. FAMILIES ENROLLED IN SELF SUFFICIENCY PROGRAMMING AND HEAD START PROGRAM RECEIVE A FAMILY CASE MANAGER AND SERVICES TO WORK ON EMPLOYMENT, EDUCATION AND TRAINING GOALS.  CURRENTLY, NO FORMAL PIPELINE EXISTS BETWEEN THE TWO ENTITIES DUE TO LIMITED STAFFING AND HIGH CASELOADS.  THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FORMAL PROCESS FOR IDENTIFICATION AND FOLLOW-UP TO THEIR STRENGTH AND NEEDS ASSESSMENT WILL ALLOW THE PARTNERSHIP TO BEST SERVE EACH OF THE 65 FAMILIES.  FAMILIES WITHIN THE PEORIA HOUSING AUTHORITY SELF SUFFICIENCY PROGRAM DO NOT COMPLETE AN ASSESSMENT; THIS WILL BE A NEW OPPORTUNITY FOR FAMILIES THAT ARE INCLUDED WITHIN THE 65 FAMILIES RECRUITED. 
TO MEET THE GOAL OF TARGET ENROLLMENT AND EMPLOYMENT TRAINING SELF -SUFFICIENCY PROGRAM CREATION, THE VISTAS WILL BE ESTABLISHING MARKETING MATERIALS PER UNIQUE HOUSING SITE, INTERACTING WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND EMPLOYERS, CONDUCTING CLIENT SURVEYS AND ASSESSMENT DATA TO GATHER PROGRAMMING IDEAS AND GOAL SETTING, AND CREATE AND MAINTAINING PRE AND POST SURVEY DATA FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE USAGE.  VISTAS WILL CREATE AN EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM WITH SPECIFIC TRACKS FOR DIFFERENT CAREER CATEGORIES, WITH DATA OBTAINED FROM EMPLOYERS AND THEIR NEEDS AS WELL AS THE RESULTS OF THE CAREER AND EDUCATION ASSESSMENT COMPLETED BY THE 65 FAMILIES ENROLLED.  ALL FAMILIES WOULD COMPLETE THE PROGRAM WITHIN THEIR SPECIFIC IDENTIFIED CAREER TRACK AS WELL AS BASIC TRAINING ON FINANCIAL LITERACY AND HOUSEHOLD BUDGET MAINTENANCE.

THE ILLINOIS ASSOCIATION OF FREE AND CHARITABLE CLINICS' (IAFCC) MISSION IS TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO QUALITY
HEALTH CARE FOR THE 800,000 INDIVIDUALS IN ILLINOIS WHO ARE LIVING IN POVERTY, THOSE WHO ARE UNINSURED/ UNDERINSURED, BY INCREASING THE CAPACITY, FOSTERING PARTNERSHIPS, EDUCATING THE PUBLIC AND ADVOCATING FOR HEALTH POLICY FOR ILLINOIS' 48 FREE AND CHARITABLE CLINICS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA AND DIRECTLY CNCS PRIORITY AREA ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND OPIOID ADDICTION PREVENTION AND RECOVERY.  GOING INTO ITS SECOND YEAR, THIS STATE-WIDE PROJECT REQUESTS AN INCREASE FROM 9 TO 15 VISTAS PLUS ONE VISTA LEADER, FOR A TOTAL OF 16 VISTAS. ONE OF THE 15 WILL BE DESIGNATED AS THE OPIOID ADDICTION RESOURCE VISTA. COMBINED, THE 16 VISTAS WILL CONTINUE THE WORK OF YEAR 1 (2018) -- TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF TEN FREE AND CHARITABLE CLINICS AS WELL AS PROVIDE A NEW DEDICATED VISTA WHO WILL ASSESS THE IMPACT OF OPIOID ADDICTION ON ILLINOIS' FREE AND CHARITABLE CLINICS AND SERVE AS AN OPIOID ADDICTION RESOURCE TO PARTICIPATING IAFCC MEMBER CLINICS. AS A RESULT OF THE VISTA PROJECTS, PARTICIPATING CLINICS WILL BE ABLE TO WORK WITH VISTAS TO EXPAND UPON THEIR WORK FROM YEAR 1. THE VISTAS WORK TO: 1) DEVELOP EFFECTIVE OUTREACH AND FUND DEVELOPMENT RESOURCES THAT WILL INCREASE NUMBER OF PATIENTS THAT ACCESS THE CLINICS AND IMPROVE FINANCIAL SUPPORT INCREASING THE SCALE AND REACH AND 2) INTEGRATE QUALITY ASSURANCE WHICH IMPROVES EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS; 15 VISTAS AND A VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS, DEVELOPING AN OUTREACH CAMPAIGN FOR DONORS AND PATIENTS, ASSISTING IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A MOBILE OUTREACH PROGRAM, CREATING A PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT SYSTEM AND ENGAGING AND IMPLEMENTING IN COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT.

THRIVE CHICAGO'S MISSION IS TO ORGANIZE THE ECOSYSTEM OF YOUTH SERVING ORGANIZATIONS AND DRIVE COLLECTIVE ACTION TO MAKE SYSTEMIC CHANGES FOR CHICAGO'S YOUTH. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS
WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO RECONNECT OPPORTUNITY YOUTH TO WORK AND SCHOOL IN THE NEXT 3 YEARS, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 10,000 OPPORTUNITY YOUTH IN CHICAGO. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING
ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CONDUCT ON-SITE SURVEYS, COLLECT AND ANALYZE DATA, LEAD PRESENTATIONS TO PARTNERS/COMMUNITY GROUPS AND SERVE AS COMMUNITY LIASONS OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT THREE YEARS.

THE GREATER ENGLEWOOD COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (GECDC) PROPOSES TO SERVE AS THE LEAD AMERICORPS VISTA SPONSOR TO COORDINATE EXISTING ACTIVITIES IN THE ENGLEWOOD COMMUNITY. THE GECDC HAS DEVELOPED A SUSTAINABLE, HOLISTIC, COLLECTIVE IMPACT FRAMEWORK UTILIZING A TWO-PRONGED APPROACH TO ADDRESS TO SYSTEMIC ECONOMIC BARRIERS EXISTING IN THE ENGLEWOOD COMMUNITY. THIS TWO-PRONGED APPROACH WILL MOBILIZE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS TO SERVE WITH (1) ENGLEWOOD QUALITY OF LIFE TASK FORCE AND ITS COMMITTEES AND (2) LOCAL SERVICE YEAR PROGRAMS TO INCREASE CAPACITY TO ADDRESS ORGANIZATIONAL, FINANCIAL, EDUCATIONAL, AND HEALTH DISPARITIES IN ORDER TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY IN THE ENGLEWOOD COMMUNITY. 

GECDC WILL ENGAGE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS TO SUPPORT THESE TASK FORCE COMMITTEES AND SERVICE YEAR PROGRAMS TO REBRAND, REBUILD, AND REVITALIZE ENGLEWOOD BY DEVELOPING COMMUNITY RESOURCES, UNCOVERING CAREER OPPORTUNITIES, SECURING FINANCIAL RESOURCES, AND CREATING COLLECTIVE IMPACT PARTNERSHIPS. AS THE AMERICORPS VISTA SPONSOR, WE WILL HELP TASK FORCE COMMITTEES AND SERVICE YEAR PROGRAMS TO ACHIEVE OUTCOMES IN THE INITIATIVE'S DOUBLE-BOTTOM LINE, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION.  

TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, THE GECDC IS REQUESTING 20 AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS TO SUPPORT GECDC AND ITS PARTNERS IN THIS INITIATIVE. THE FOLLOWING PAGES WILL FURTHER OUTLINE THE PLAN TO TRANSFORM THE ENGLEWOOD COMMUNITY WITH THE ASSISTANCE FROM AMERICORPS VISTA.

IOWA ENERGY INDEPENDENCE AMERICORPS STRENGTHENING DAVIS COUNTY'S (IEIA) MISSION IS TO INCREASE RURAL COMMUNITIES' RESILIENCE AND SUSTAINABILITY BY REDUCING DEPENDENCE UPON EXTERNAL ENERGY SOURCES AND DEVELOPING LOCAL ENERGY OPPORTUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE VOLUNTEERISM, COORDINATE ENERGY EFFICIENCY EFFORTS, AND HOUSING INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITIES. THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO IMPACT 400 INDIVIDUALS AND 3 NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS IDENTIFYING HIGH-IMPACT POTENTIAL NEIGHBORHOODS, ESTABLISHING ENERGY EFFICIENCY PROCEDURES, CREATING AND IMPLEMENTING AN INCLUSIVE FINANCING SYSTEM, PERFORMING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES RELATED TO CLEAN ENERGY AND RESIDENTIAL ENERGY EFFICIENCY FUNDING PROGRAMS OVER THE NEXT YEAR.

THE DSM WELCOME PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD CAPACITY AND ELIMINATE POVERTY AMONG DES MOINES AREA NEW IOWANS.  THE PROJECT ALIGNS WITH AMERICORPS VISTA?S PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES FOR FISCAL YEAR (FY) 17, SPECIFICALLY THOSE RELATED TO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES AND EDUCATION. THE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL STRENGTHEN AND SUPPORT THE AGENCIES? EFFORTS TO PROVIDE SUSTAINABLE AND ONGOING ANTI-POVERTY SOLUTIONS THAT WILL BENEFIT LOCAL NEW IOWANS AND THE COMMUNITIES IN WHICH THEY LIVE.  TEN VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY ENGAGING IN CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT, EXPANDING AND STRENGTHENING NETWORKS, BUILDING FINANCIAL RESOURCES, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY, AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

UNIVERSITY OF NORTHERN IOWA'S CENTER FOR ENERGY & ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION EMPOWERS IOWANS WITH SKILLS, TOOLS AND INSPIRATION TO BUILD SUSTAINABLE & DESIRABLE COMMUNITIES. WE IN PARTNERSHIP WITH KEY ENTITIES IN THE REGION, PROPOSE A COMMUNITY BASED INITIATIVE TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOODS TO VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN 16 NE IOWA COUNTIES AS WELL AS LINN COUNTY AREA.  THIS PROPOSAL ADDRESSES THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA OF THE CNCS.

WE SEEK 8 VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF A NUMBER OF COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO:

-- DEVELOP OPPORTUNITY FARMS TO PRODUCE FRESH FRUITS AND VEGGIES WHILE CREATING EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES
-- INCORPORATE FRESH AND LOCAL FRUITS AND VEGGIES INTO FOOD BANK'S DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM
-- BUILD CAPACITY OF THE DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM TO HANDLE FRESH AND LOCAL FRUITS AND VEGGIES
-- IMPROVE ACCESS TO LAND AND GARDENING RESOURCES FOR RECENT REFUGEES AND IMMIGRANTS
-- FURTHER DEVELOP GREENS TO GO, A MOBILE PRODUCE STAND SERVING MANY UNDER-SERVED NEIGHBORHOODS
-- LEVERAGE ACCOMPLISHMENTS TO SECURE MORE RESOURCES AND MORE HEALTH FOOD INITIATIVES IN THE REGION.

WE ENVISION THIS TO BE A 3-YEAR EVOLVING WORK, RE-EVALUATED ANNUALLY.

THE MISSION OF HAWKEYE COMMUNITY COLLEGE IS A GLOBALLY INFORMED COMMUNITY OF SUCCESSFUL LIFELONG LEARNERS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO LEVERAGE RESOURCES AND SCALE AND REACH WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 21,500. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SUPPORTING THE PLANNED INCREASE IN SERVICES AVAILABLE TO INDIVIDUALS SERVED THROUGH THE NEW ADULT LEARNING CENTER. THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE EFFORTS OF HAWKEYE'S IOWAWORKS AJC (AMERICAN JOB CENTER) OFFICE, WHICH SERVES AS A CORE PARTNER WITH THE ADULT EDUCATION AND LITERACY PROGRAMS UNDER THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) OVER THE COURSE OF 4 YEARS.

THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH, DIVISION OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, BUREAU OF HIV, STD, AND HEPATITIS' MISSION IS TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT THE HEALTH OF IOWANS AT RISK OF OR INFECTED WITH HIV, SEXUALLY TRANSMITTED DISEASES, AND/OR VIRAL HEPATITIS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES OPIOID ADDICTION RECOVERY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ASSESS THE NEEDS OF PEOPLE WHO USE DRUGS IN ACCESSING ESSENTIAL HEALTH CARE INFORMATION, DEVELOP A HARM REDUCTION SERVICES INFRASTRUCTURE AMONG HIV AND HEPATITIS C CARE AND PREVENTION PROVIDERS, AND STRENGTHEN KEY CROSS-SECTOR STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT AROUND DRUG USER HEALTH. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COORDINATING WITH STAKEHOLDERS TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY-BASED PARTICIPATORY RESEARCH, FACILITATING AND COORDINATING BEHAVIORAL HEALTH WORKING GROUP WITH CARE AND PREVENTION STAFF, AND DEVELOPING A STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT STRATEGY TO PRIORITIZE TARGETED DRUG USER HEALTH STEERING COMMITTEE RECRUITMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THE FIRST YEAR OF THE PROGRAM.

SHELTER HOUSE'S MISSION IS "PROVIDE SAFE SHELTER AND HELPS PEOPLE IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THEIR LIVES AS THEY MOVE BEYOND HOMELESSNESS." THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO HELP BUILD CAPACITY TO HELP INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES SECURE SAFE/AFFORDABLE PERMANENT HOUSING IN THEIR COMMUNITY.  ALONG WITH SECURING HOUSING, VISTA GOALS ALSO TO HELP BUILD CAPACITY TO HAVE PEOPLE MAINTAIN THIS HOUSING BY INCREASING INCOME AND ACCESS TO OTHER MAINSTREAM RESOURCES.  THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 1,200 WHO ARE EITHER HOMELESS, NEAR HOMELESS, RECENTLY INCARCERATED, AND ARE AT OR BELOW 30% OF THE AREA MEDIAN INCOME LEVEL.  VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS EMPLOYMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES, AFFORDABLE HOUSING SEARCH AND CAPACITY BUILDING, COMMUNITY COLLABORATION, AND INCREASING ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR.

GOODWILL OF CENTRAL IOWA'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL INDIVIDUALS BY PROVIDING SKILLS TRAINING AND HELPING PEOPLE FIND JOBS.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THE GOODWILL VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IDENTIFY COLLABORATIVE AND HOLISTIC PROGRAMMING THAT SUPPORTS SKILLS TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE FOLLOWING CONSTITUENCIES:  RE-ENTERING CITIZENS, YOUTH WITH DISABILITIES AND REFUGEES & IMMIGRANTS AS WELL AS DEVELOP A PIPELINE OF VOLUNTEERS AND MARKETING AND OUTREACH STRATEGIES TO SUPPORT THEM.  THESE PROGRAMS EXPECT TO BENEFIT 100 PEOPLE IN IT'S FIRST YEAR.  5 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS NEEDS ASSESSMENT, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THE YEAR.

THE CENTER FOR PRISONER HEALTH AND HUMAN RIGHTS AT THE MIRIAM HOSPITAL IS DEDICATED TO IMPROVING THE HEALTH AND HUMAN RIGHTS OF JUSTICE-INVOLVED INDIVIDUALS THROUGH EDUCATION, ADVOCACY, AND RESEARCH.  OUR VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO INCREASE COMMUNITY CAPACITY TO SERVE INDIVIDUALS IMPACTED BY THE OPIOID CRISIS, WITH A SUB-FOCUS ON INDIVIDUALS INVOLVED WITH THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM, AND ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 450 RHODE ISLANDERS WHO ARE IMPACTED BY THE OPIOID CRISIS AND/OR INVOLVED IN THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM, AND TO ENGAGE 100 RI REENTRY STAKEHOLDERS AND 20 LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS. OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS, FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL FURTHER THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: EXPANDING ACCESS TO OVERDOSE PREVENTION TRAINING AND NALOXONE DISTRIBUTION; HELPING TO FACILITATE LAYPERSON RESCUES OF VICTIMS OF OPIOID OVERDOSE; SUPPORTING THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STRATEGIC PLAN FOR PRISON REENTRY IN RI; AND EXPANDING ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE FOR CURRENTLY AND FORMERLY INCARCERATED RHODE ISLANDERS.

THE MISSION OF THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF NEWPORT COUNTY IS TO ?INSPIRE AND ENABLE ALL YOUNG PEOPLE, ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO NEED HELP MOST, TO REALIZE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AS PRODUCTIVE, RESPONSIBLE AND CARING CITIZENS?.  AS THE LEADING YOUTH GUIDANCE AGENCY IN THE CITY OF NEWPORT, BGCNC PROVIDES A POSITIVE, SAFE AND EXCITING ENVIRONMENT FOR CHILDREN TO LEARN AND GROW. WITH A MEMBERSHIP OF MORE THAN 1,900 INDIVIDUALS AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES THAT POSITIVELY IMPACT MORE THAN 5,500 YOUTH ANNUALLY, THE CLUB PLAYS A VITAL ROLE IN STRENGTHENING AND SUPPORTING THE COMMUNITY IT SERVES. 

THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB ADMINISTERS THE NEWPORT WORKING CITIES PROJECT, WHOSE VISION IS TO LIFT FAMILIES OUT OF POVERTY THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A WELL-ESTABLISHED, INTEGRATED AND EFFICIENT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT SYSTEM THAT PREPARES UNEMPLOYED AND UNDEREMPLOYED NEWPORT RESIDENTS FOR HIGHER SKILLED, HIGHER PAYING JOBS AND WHICH ENSURES A PIPELINE OF CANDIDATES ARE AVAILABLE TO FILL VACANCIES IN HIGH DEMAND INDUSTRIES WITHIN THIS CITY.

THE PRIORITY AREA THAT THE NEWPORT WORKING CITIES COLLABORATIVE IS ADDRESSING THROUGH THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, WHICH ADDRESSES HOUSING, FINANCIAL LITERACY, AND EMPLOYMENT NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. NEWPORT WORKING CITIES SPECIFICALLY SEEKS TO DECREASE POVERTY IN THE CITY OF NEWPORT OVER THE NEXT DECADE BY 20% THROUGH EMPLOYMENT PROGRAMS AND SYSTEMIC CHANGES THAT WILL BENEFIT UNEMPLOYED AND/OR UNDEREMPLOYED YOUTH AND ADULTS.

TO ACCOMPLISH THIS, NEWPORT WORKING CITIES IS SEEKING 4 VISTA MEMBERS TO HELP THE COLLABORATIVE BUILD CAPACITY AND BEGIN TO MOVE THE NEEDLE ON POVERTY. IN YEAR ONE, WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF THE 4-PERSON VISTA TEAM, NEWPORT WORKING CITIES INTENDS TO PROVIDE JOB SKILLS READINESS TRAININGS AND/OR JOB PLACEMENT ASSISTANCE TO  200 INDIVIDUALS (YOUTH AND ADULTS), WITH 70% OF THOSE SERVED REPORTING INCREASES IN SKILL LEVELS. AN ADDITIONAL GOAL IS TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE ORGANIZATIONS WHO PARTNER IN THIS IMPORTANT ENDEAVOR.

RHODE ISLAND'S SOAR INITIATIVE IS COORDINATED BY RIVERWOOD MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES AND THE KENT CENTER. OUR GOAL IS TO INCREASE EXPEDITED ACCESS TO THE DISABILITY INCOME BENEFIT PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY THE SOCIAL SECURITY ADMINISTRATION (SSA) FOR ELIGIBLE ADULTS WHO ARE HOMELESS OR WHO ARE AT RISK OF HOMELESSNESS AND HAVE A MENTAL ILLNESS AND/OR A CO-OCCURRING SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER.

THE SOAR VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY PROGRAMMING PRIORITY.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DIVERSIFY FUNDING AND EXPAND STATEWIDE SOAR CAPACITY TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF SOAR APPLICATIONS.  WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT AND ADDITIONAL 75 INDIVIDUALS EACH YEAR THROUGH THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT.  TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT OVER A THREE-YEAR PERIOD BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS FUNDING RESEARCH AND APPLICATIONS; CREATING, IMPLEMENTING, AND ANALYZING A STATEWIDE ASSESSMENT; PROVIDING COMMUNITY TRAININGS; PILOTING AND IMPLEMENTING NEW INITIATIVES; AND EXPANDING THE STATEWIDE SOAR INITIATIVE.

THE THIRD MISSION INSTITUTE (I3M) FROM THE CARLOS ALBIZU UNIVERSITY, IS AN APPLIED RESEARCH INSTITUTE GUIDED BY ITS VISION TO BE A CATALYST BRIDGE BETWEEN ACADEMIA AND COMMUNITY, FACILITATING THE DISSEMINATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF SCIENTIFIC INNOVATIONS IN THE FIELD OF PREVENTION AND HEALTH PROMOTION. THE MISSION OF THE I3M IS TO IMPLEMENT INTERVENTION STRATEGIES WITH THE COMMUNITY, PROVIDING KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERT ADVICE IN AREAS SUCH AS PLANNING, ORGANIZATIONAL DEVELOPMENT, DESIGN AND EVALUATION OF PROGRAMS, TRAINING AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY.

THE I3M IS REQUESTING 18 VISTA MEMBERS, OF WHICH 4 WILL BE COST SHARED.  THESE 18 VISTAS WILL BE ALIGNED TO THREE OF THE PRIORITY AREAS OF THE CNCS: HEALTHY FUTURE, EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.  THE I3M PROPOSED PROJECT GOAL IS THE FOLLOWING: TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE ORGANIZATION AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS IN THE DESIGN, DEVELOPMENT AND ASSESSMENT PROCESS TO BUILD LONG-TERM, SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO HELP FIGHT POVERTY. VISTAS WILL MAINLY FOCUS THEIR EFFORTS ON THE FOLLOWING SERVICE ACTIVITIES: PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY, MATERIAL DEVELOPMENT, AND COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT.

THE I3M EXPECTS TO COMPLETE A THREE-YEAR CYCLE WITH THE VISTAS REQUESTED, AND THE BENEFICIARIES WILL INCLUDE THE INSTITUTE, AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS WHICH INCLUDE: NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, STATE AND LOCAL AGENCIES, UNITS OF LOCAL GOVERNMENT, AMONG OTHERS.

PLENITUD'S MISSION IS TO SERVE AND INSPIRE INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES BY SHARING KNOWLEDGE THAT LEADS TO A MORE SUSTAINABLE AND HARMONIOUS LIFE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT, GROWING THE IMPACT: EXPANDING COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS PRIORITY PROGRAMMING AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY DUE TO PLENITUD'S FOCUS ON FOSTERING RESILIENT COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT IN FUNDAMENTAL SYSTEMS SUCH AS SUSTAINABLE FOOD PRODUCTION AND HOUSING. PLENITUD'S HOLISTIC APPROACH ALSO ALIGNS THE PROJECT WITH OTHER CNCS PRIORITY PROGRAMMING AREAS; INCLUDING HEALTHY FUTURES BY ADDRESSING FOOD INSECURITY IN RURAL AREAS; EDUCATION BY PROVIDING HOLISTIC OUTDOOR EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR UNDER-RESOURCED SCHOOLS; AND BY TRAINING COMMUNITIES TO PREPARE AND RECOVER FROM NATURAL DISASTERS. OUR VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF OUR ORGANIZATION TO CONTINUE AND EXPAND THESE PROGRAMS, WHICH WILL IN TURN BENEFIT THE RECIPIENTS OF ALL OUR EDUCATIONAL SERVICES THROUGH WORKSHOPS, INTERNSHIPS, SEMINARS AND PARTNERSHIPS WITH VARIOUS OUTREACH SITES IN SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES. OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS, (4) VISTA MEMBERS WILL HELP BUILD THE ORGANIZATION'S CAPACITY BY UPDATING AND MANAGING PLENITUD'S CONSTITUENT DATABASE; CREATING EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS; SECURING GRANTS AND OTHER SOURCES OF FUNDING; LEVERAGING & ENGAGING COMMUNITY RESOURCES; BUILDING OUR EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH PROGRAM CAPACITY; AND DEVELOPING AND STRENGTHENING YOUTH PROGRAMS.

THE MISSION OF PHENND, A CONSORTIUM OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES IN THE GREATER PHILADELPHIA REGION, IS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF ITS MEMBER INSTITUTIONS TO DEVELOP MUTUALLY BENEFICIAL, SUSTAINED AND DEMOCRATIC COMMUNITY BASED SERVICE-LEARNING PARTNERSHIPS. PHENND ACTIVELY SEEKS TO REVITALIZE LOCAL COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AND FOSTER CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY AMONG THE REGION'S COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH AMERICORPS' EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. WE EXPECT THE WORK OF THE SCHOOL-BASED COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS COORDINATOR VISTAS TO BENEFIT OVER 300 COMMUNITY PARTNERS DIRECTLY AND APPROXIMATELY 6,000 LOW-INCOME STUDENTS INDIRECTLY OVER THE SCHOOL YEAR. IN ADDITION, OUR EIGHT NONPROFIT SUB-SITES, ESTIMATE THAT THEY WILL IMPACT AN ADDITIONAL 240 DISADVANTAGED YOUTH IN AGGREGATE THROUGH THEIR PROGRAMMING. OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT 3-5 YEARS, 27 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE OVERALL GOALS OF THESE PROJECTS BY BUILDING INFRASTRUCTURE THAT ENSURES THAT THE PARTNERSHIPS BUILT ARE MUTUALLY BENEFICIAL, SUSTAINABLE AND EFFECTIVELY SERVING THE TARGETED COMMUNITIES.

THE MISSION THE CITY OF PITTSBURGH OFFICE OF THE MAYOR IS TO PROVIDE LEADERSHIP, STRATEGIC DIRECTION AND ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT TO ALL ASPECTS OF CITY GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS AND TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT POLICY REFLECTIVE OF THE GOALS AND PRIORITIES OF THE CITYWIDE COMMUNITY.

THE MISSION OF THE BUREAU OF NEIGHBORHOOD EMPOWERMENT, CREATED IN 2014 AS A KEY BUREAU WITHIN THE MAYOR?S OFFICE, IS TO BUILD OUR CITY'S LOW AND MODERATE INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS FROM THE GROUND UP BY ADDRESSING ISSUES SURROUNDING AFFORDABLE AND MIXED INCOME HOUSING, EDUCATION AND YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, IMMIGRANT, VETERAN, LGBTQIA+ AND CHALLENGED POPULATIONS, NONPROFIT AND FAITH-BASED COMMUNITY INITIATIVES, SMALL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND EQUITY AND INCLUSION IN THE CITY OF PITTSBURGH.

THE MISSION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY IS TO PROVIDE FOR THE SECURITY AND SAFETY OF ALL RESIDENTS AND PATRONS OF THE CITY OF PITTSBURGH THROUGH THE OVERSIGHT AND EXECUTION OF THE PUBLIC SAFETY OPERATIONAL STRATEGIES THROUGH THE PLANNED AND COORDINATED EFFORTS OF THE BUREAUS OF POLICE (PBP), FIRE (PBF), EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES (EMS), AND ANIMAL CARE AND CONTROL.

THE MISSION FOR THE HOUSING AUTHORITY CITY OF PITTSBURGH (HACP) IS TO BE THE FLAGSHIP AGENCY PROVIDING PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE DEVELOPMENT SERVICES IN THE CITY OF PITTSBURGH, THEREBY CREATING ENVIRONMENTS THAT IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HACP CUSTOMERS.

THE MISSION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN RESOURCES & CIVIL SERVICE IS TO DEVELOP A HIGHLY FUNCTIONING WORKFORCE WHILE RESPECTING INDIVIDUAL DIGNITY, PROMOTING AND CELEBRATING A DIVERSE POPULATION, UPHOLDING APPLICABLE LAWS AND REGULATIONS, AND MOLDING A POSITIVE CORPORATE CULTURE. 

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOCUS AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION K-12, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES AND HEALTHY FUTURES.  

THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE ADDRESSING THE GROWING OPIOID CRISIS, INCREASING THE AWARENESS OF SERVICES AVAILABLE TO YOUTH AND ADULTS EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS OR DIRE NEED, CONNECTING IMMIGRANTS AND REFUGEES TO SERVICES THAT HELP THEM THRIVE IN THE COMMUNITY, CONNECTING VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES TO EMPLOYMENT RESOURCES, AND INCREASING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOR LOW-INCOME CHILDREN BY FOCUSING ON INCREASING SUCCESS IN GRADES K-12 AND HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION RATES.  THIS VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT HUNDREDS OF LOW INCOME FAMILIES AND YOUTH AND ADULTS EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS OR UNSTABLE LIVING ENVIRONMENTS, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, IMMIGRANTS AND REFUGEES WHO SETTLE IN PITTSBURGH, AND HUNDREDS OF SUBSTANCE ABUSERS, THEIR LOVED ONES AND LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES AFFECTED BY THE OPIOID CRISIS IN PITTSBURGH.  

WE ARE REQUESTING FIVE (5) VISTA MEMBERS OVER A PERIOD OF THREE YEARS FOR THIS PROJECT.  THE MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS LISTED ABOVE BY PERFORMING RESEARCH; LIAISING WITH AND PERFORMING OUTREACH WITHIN THE TARGETED POPULATIONS OF THEIR RESPECTIVE PROJECT TO ASSESS THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY; DEVELOPING PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES SERVED WITHIN THEIR RESPECTIVE PROJECT; AND LIAISING WITH APPROPRIATE COMMUNITY PARTNERS.

YWCA TRI-COUNTY AREA (YW3CA), TRICOUNTY COMMUNITY NETWORK (TCN) AND GREENALLIES ARE COLLABORATING IN THE PROPOSED VISTA YOUTH EMPOWERMENT STUDY PROJECT, WHICH ALIGNS WITH THE CAPACITY BUILDING FOCUS AREA.  YW3CA IS DEDICATED TO ELIMINATING RACISM, EMPOWERING WOMEN AND PROMOTING PEACE, JUSTICE, FREEDOM AND DIGNITY FOR ALL. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE EFFECTIVENESS AMONG YOUTH-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS IN THE POTTSTOWN AREA, WHICH WILL BENEFIT 750 CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN POTTSTOWN, PA.  6 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT, COMMUNITY AWARENESS, AND TECHNOLOGY USE, AND VOLUNTEERISM OVER THREE YEARS.

UNITED WAY OF PENNSYLVANIA'S MISSION IS TO ASSIST AND CHAMPION THE EFFORTS OF LOCAL UNITED WAYS IN ADVANCING THE COMMON GOOD. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE SCHOOL READINESS BY PROVIDING INCREASED ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY PRE-K IN LEBANON COUNTY AND DRIVE K-12 SUCCESS BY IMPLEMENTING AN OUT OF SCHOOL PROGRAM IN NORTHUMBERLAND, SYNDER, AND UNION COUNTIES. THE MISSION OF PHILADELPHIA VIP (VIP) IS TO LEVERAGE THE POWERFUL RESOURCES OF THE COMMUNITY TO PROVIDE QUALITY VOLUNTEER LEGAL SERVICES AND ENSURE ACCESS TO JUSTICE FOR LOW-INCOME PHILADELPHIANS. THE MISSION OF COMMUNITY LEGAL SERVICES (CLS) TO FIGHT POVERTY, CHALLENGE SYSTEMS THAT PERPETUATE INJUSTICE, AND CHANGE LIVES THROUGH CUTTING-EDGE ADVOCACY AND EXCEPTIONAL LEGAL REPRESENTATION. 

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD ESSENTIAL CAPACITY IN VIP AND CLS'S HOUSING- AND OUTREACH-RELATED INITIATIVES, WHICH ARE DESIGNED TO ENSURE LOW-INCOME PHILADELPHIANS ARE ABLE TO REMAIN IN SAFE, HEALTHY, AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING, AND ARE EXPECTED TO BENEFIT HUNDREDS OF LOW-INCOME PHILADELPHIANS. THE FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT, COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT, EXPANDING/STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS/NETWORKS, MATERIALS DEVELOPMENT, OUTREACH, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY, TECHNOLOGY USE, AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT/MANAGEMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT.

SIENA COLLEGE IS A COEDUCATIONAL, INDEPENDENT LIBERAL ARTS COLLEGE IN THE CATHOLIC AND FRANCISCAN TRADITION. THE MISSION OF THE COLLEGE IS TO CREATE A LEARNING COMMUNITY THAT IS STUDENT-CENTERED AND FOSTERS RIGOROUS INTELLECTUAL DEVELOPMENT THROUGH A HEALTHY EXCHANGE OF IDEAS BOTH INSIDE AND OUTSIDE THE CLASSROOM. SIENA COLLEGE IS GUIDED BY THE TEACHINGS OF ST. FRANCIS OF ASSISI, SPECIFICALLY, SERVICE WITH THE POOR AND MARGINALIZED; THIS IS AT THE HEART OF OUR DEFINITION OF COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. THE CONNECTING OF ACADEMICS AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT DISTINGUISHES SIENA COLLEGE FROM OTHER COLLEGES IN THE AREA AND POSITIONS OUR INSTITUTION TO ESTABLISH RECIPROCAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH ECONOMICALLY AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES. IN 2008, THE CENTER OF ACADEMIC COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT (ACE), WAS ESTABLISHED ON CAMPUS WITH THE GOAL OF DEVELOPING A BRIDGE BETWEEN THE COMMUNITY AND CAMPUS RESOURCES FOR THE FIGHT AGAINST POVERTY IN THE CAPITAL REGION. TO PARTNER WITH THE COMMUNITY IN THIS FIGHT, ACE HAS IMPLEMENTED 8 PROGRAMS IN ADDITION TO AMERICORPS VISTA INCLUDING: 
 
-BONNER SERVICE LEADERS
UNDERGRADUATES UTILIZE THEIR ACADEMIC TALENTS TO LEAD COMMUNITY CHANGE THROUGH DIRECT SERVICE. 
-COMMUNITY ENGAGED TEACHING AND LEARNING
FACULTY ASSIST WITH COMMUNITY PARTNER RELATIONS AND FOSTER STUDENT AND COMMUNITY PARTNER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT. 
-COMMUNITY POLICY INSTITUTE
FELLOWS TRACK POLICY CHANGES AND PROGRESS AND THE RESULTING EFFECT ON THE RESIDENTS OF THE CAPITAL REGION. THIS INFORMATION IS THEN SHARED WITH NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WHO CAN USE IT TO IMPACT THE COMMUNITY.
-DAKE/STEWART'S SHOPS FELLOWSHIPS
UNDERGRADUATES AND POSTGRADUATES IDENTIFY A COMMUNITY CHALLENGE, STUDY IT, AND SPEND A YEAR ADDRESSING THAT CHALLENGE THROUGH RESEARCH AND SERVICE WITH A CAPITAL REGION COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION.
-GLOBAL SERVICE INTERNSHIPS
UNDERGRADUATES TRAVEL ABROAD AND SPEND THEIR SUMMER CONDUCTING RURAL-PUBLIC HEALTH OUTREACH AND ENGLISH LANGUAGE TEACHING.
-NEXT FELLOWS
TEAMS OF STUDENTS, FACULTY, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS WORK TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY-BASED NON-PROFITS BY PROVIDING BUSINESS, OPERATIONS, AND PROGRAM CONSULTING SERVICES.
-PARTNERING LEADERS AND YOUTH
SIENA'S DIVISION 1 ATHLETES APPLY THEIR PASSION FOR SOCIAL GOOD BY SERVING WITH A COMMUNITY PARTNER THAT FOCUSES ON MENTORING YOUTH THROUGH SPORT.
-SUMMER SERVICE SCHOLARS
UNDERGRADUATES TAKE A SUMMER CLASS WHICH EXAMINES THE ROOT CAUSES OF POVERTY AND BEST PRACTICES IN COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AS THEY PROVIDE DIRECT SERVICE WITH A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION. 

OUR SIENA COLLEGE AMERICORPS VISTA FELLOWS PROGRAM SERVES ALONGSIDE AND SUPPORTS THE EFFORTS OF THESE AND OTHER PROGRAMS TO COORDINATE EFFORTS THAT SEEK TO ERADICATE POVERTY IN THE CAPITAL REGION. THE SERVICE OF THE VISTA FELLOWS INCLUDE: PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND SUSTAINABILITY, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT, DEVELOPMENT OF COMMUNITY PARTNER RELATIONSHIPS, THE COORDINATION OF NEEDS ASSESSMENTS, AND PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION AND COORDINATION. 

OUR PROGRAM PLACES FELLOWS BOTH ON-CAMPUS AND IN THE COMMUNITY. ON-CAMPUS VISTA FELLOWS SERVE WITH A PARTICULAR OFFICE OR DEPARTMENT TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE OFFICE TO ADDRESS POVERTY IN OUR COMMUNITY. THESE VISTA FELLOWS ARE TRAINED TO BUILD BRIDGES BETWEEN THE OFFICE THEY SERVE AND COMMUNITY PARTNER AGENCIES. RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, VOLUNTEER DEVELOPMENT, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, DEVELOPMENT OF COMMUNITY-BASED RESEARCH AND SERVICE-LEARNING CAPABILITIES ARE THE PRIMARY ACTIVITIES OF THESE VISTAS.  

OFF-CAMPUS VISTA FELLOWS ARE PLACED IN A COMMUNITY PARTNER AGENCY THAT HAS DEVELOPED A PLAN OUTLINING AN INCREASINGLY SOPHISTICATED PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THEM AND ACE THROUGH THE VISTA PLACEMENT. ALL VISTA PLACEMENTS ARE PART OF A THREE-YEAR PLANNING PROCESS AND ARE OUTLINED IN THE DESIGN OF A VAD (VISTA ASSIGNMENT DESCRIPTION) FOR A POTENTIAL VISTA PLACEMENT.

FRIENDS OF RECOVERY- NEW YORK'S (FOR-NY) MISSION IS TO DEMONSTRATE THE POWER AND PROOF OF RECOVERY FROM ADDICTIONS AND ITS VALUE TO INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT NYS AND THE NATION. WE ACTIVELY SEEK TO ADVANCE PUBLIC POLICIES AND PRACTICES THAT PROMOTE AND SUPPORT RECOVERY.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL INCREASE PARTICIPATION IN THE RECOVERY MOVEMENT, IMPROVE COMMUNICATIONS BETWEEN FOR-NY AND OUR RECOVERY COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT THE STATE, BUILD RECOVERY COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND RECOVERY CAPITAL THROUGHOUT THE STATE AND HELP FOR-NY BE MORE SUSTAINABLE AS AN ORGANIZATION.  

THE VISTA PROJECT WILL BE A KEY PART OF FOR-NY'S GOAL TO MAKE RECOVERY BOTH COMMON AND CELEBRATED. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT ONE IN TEN INDIVIDUALS IS IMPACTED BY ADDICTION.  HOWEVER, OF THAT NUMBER, ONLY ONE IN TEN HAS BEEN SUCCESSFUL AT FINDING TREATMENT.  THE VISTA PROGRAM WILL PARTICIPATE IN FOR-NY'S WORK TO INCREASE AWARENESS ABOUT AND ACCESSIBILITY TO THE MANY SUPPORT SERVICES AVAILABLE TO PEOPLE IN RECOVERY, THEIR FAMILIES, AND THEIR COMMUNITIES SO THAT THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE IN RECOVERY INCREASES. 

NEW YORK STATE IS IN THE MIDST OF AN OPIOID EPIDEMIC.  IN NEW YORK STATE DEATHS DUE TO OPIOID OVERDOSE BETWEEN THE YEARS 2014 AND 2016 ROSE 61%.  THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL HAVE AN IMPACT ON THE ENTIRE NEW YORK STATE COMMUNITY BY BRINGING ATTENTION TO THE RECOVERY COMMUNITY AND PREVENTING OVERDOSE DEATHS DUE TO OPIOID CONSUMPTION.  THE VISTA PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO BENEFIT THOUSANDS OF BENEFICIARIES/PEOPLE IN RECOVERY, FAMILY MEMBERS, THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND THE LOCAL ECONOMY AS WELL. 

A VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BUILDING AND MAINTAINING OUR CONSTITUENT AND DONOR DATABASE AND IMPROVING OUR COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEM OVER THE NEXT TWO YEARS.

OUR STRATEGY IS ALIGNED WITH THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION, AND THE FRAMEWORK OF ANTI-POVERTY, COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT, SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS AND CAPACITY BUILDING. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOCUS AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES, INCLUDING OPIOID ADDICTION AND RECOVERY, EDUCATION, AND SUPPORTS THE CORE PRINCIPALS OF CNCS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE SCHOOL RETENTION AND RAISE GRADES, PROVIDE PREVENTION AND TREATMENT SERVICES FOR OPIOID ADDICTION, ADDRESS COMMUNITY HEALTH ISSUES, INCREASE FINANCIAL LITERACY AND HOMEOWNERSHIP AND PROVIDE BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES TO THE 5,000 RESIDENTS IN THE RURAL TOWN OF SALEM CITY, NEW JERSEY. MISSION.  THE MISSION OF NEW JERSEY COMMUNITY CAPITAL (NJCC) IS TO TRANSFORM COMMUNITIES THROUGH STRATEGIC INVESTMENTS OF CAPITAL AND KNOWLEDGE.  

CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA.  NJCC WILL WORK WITHIN THE "ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY" PRIORITY AREA.  

PROJECT DESCRIPTION.  FROM THE DEEPENING TO ESCALATING PHASE.  EARLIER THIS YEAR, THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF NEW JERSEY COMMUNITY CAPITAL ALONG WITH MANAGEMENT, STAFF AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS COMPLETED AN INTENSIVE, BOARD-DRIVEN STRATEGIC PLANNING PROCESS THAT, WORKING FROM OUR MISSION STATEMENT AND CORE VALUES, ESTABLISHED OUR VISION FOR THE THREE-YEAR PERIOD OF 2017-19.  THE THEMATIC BASIS DRIVING OUR STRATEGIC DIRECTION IS TO MOVE FROM THE "DEEPENING PHASE" (THE THEMATIC BASIS OF OUR PREVIOUSLY APPROVED STRATEGIC PLAN COVERING THE 2012-16 TIME PERIOD) -- WHERE NJCC STARTED TO EMERGE AS ONE OF NEW JERSEY'S PREDOMINANT INFLUENCERS OF COMMUNITY & ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT -- TO THE "ESCALATING" PHASE WHERE NJCC IS NOT ONLY ONE OF NEW JERSEY'S PRIMARY ANTI-POVERTY MECHANISMS, BUT INCREMENTALLY EXPANDING THROUGHOUT NEW JERSEY AND MOVING OUR BUSINESS MODEL TO OTHER STATES & REGIONS.  THE GOAL STATEMENT ASSOCIATED WITH OUR STRATEGIC PLAN: "TO EMPLOY AN EVIDENCE-BASED FRAMEWORK THAT ESTABLISHES NJCC AS THE CDFI OF CHOICE TO APPROPRIATE STAKEHOLDERS WHILE REALIZING FINANCIAL & INVESTMENT BENCHMARKS IN ORDER TO SUSTAIN & GROW STATUS AS AN INDUSTRY 'THOUGHT LEADER' IN TACTICAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT".  CONSISTENT WITH OUR STRATEGIC PLAN, CORE CAPACITY BUILDING PRIORITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE VISTAS WORK ARE:

*	MARKETING & COMMUNICATIONS -- THE OBJECTIVE STATEMENT: "TO EMPLOY A COMPREHENSIVE BRANDING & MARKETING PLAN THAT REALIZES NJCC'S IMAGE AWARENESS AND ENHANCEMENT OBJECTIVES WITHIN OUR TARGET COMMUNITIES".  

*	INVESTOR RETENTION & RECRUITMENT.  THE OBJECTIVE STATEMENT: "TO ESTABLISH A TARGETED INVESTORS-SEEKING STRATEGY WITH PARTICULAR FOCUS IN ENSURING WE FOCUS ON THE PRIMARY IMPACT INVESTORS IN OUR MARKET WHOSE INVESTMENT INTERESTS DIRECTLY ALIGN WITH NJCC'S STRATEGIC GOALS & OBJECTIVES".    

*	POLICY BUILDING.  THE OBJECTIVE STATEMENT: "TO SUPPORT NJCC'S WORK RELATED TO IMPROVING THE POLICY ENVIRONMENT THAT RECOGNIZES THE VALUE & IMPACT OF NJCC AND OF MISSION-DRIVEN CDFIS OVERALL".  

NUMBER OF VISTAS AND OVERVIEW OF MAJOR ACTIVITIES.  WITH THIS, NJCC REQUESTS FIVE (5) VISTAS TO BE ASSIGNED AS FOLLOWS:  

*	ADDRESS YOURSELF (AY) -- BASED OUT OF OUR NEWARK OFFICE, ONE VISTA ASSIGNED TO AY, OUR MORTGAGE PLATFORM DESIGNED TO PROVIDE AFFORDABLE RESIDENTIAL MORTGAGES FOR LOW- TO MODERATE-INCOME (LMI) HOMEBUYERS, WITH A STRONG PREFERENCE IN TARGETING ETHNIC-MINORITY FAMILIES, INCLUDING NEW IMMIGRANTS WHO ARE LEGAL PERMANENT RESIDENTS THROUGH OUR ITIN MORTGAGE PRODUCT.  

*	EAST TRENTON COLLABORATIVE (ETC) -- ONE VISTA TO EMPLOY A COMMUNICATIONS AND OUTREACH STRATEGY SPECIFIC TO ETC, A COMPREHENSIVE NEIGHBORHOOD REVITALIZATION STRATEGY WITH NJCC AS THE LEAD ADMINISTRATOR.  THIS VISTA WILL BE PLACED IN OUR TRENTON-BASED OFFICE AND REPORT TO ETC'S PROGRAM MANAGER.   

*	COMMUNITY ASSETS PRESERVATION CORPORATION (CAPC) -- WORKING OUT OF CAPC'S NEWARK OFFICE AND WORKING WITH CAPC'S DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS, ONE VISTA TO DEVELOP A COMMUNICATIONS STRATEGY TO MARKET THE WORK OF CAPC ALONG WITH COMMUNICATIONS STRATEGY ASSOCIATED WITH CAPC'S TENANTS & HOMEOWNERS.  

*	CENTRAL OFFICE -- TWO VISTAS: (1) ONE VISTA TO WORK WITH THE CHIEF EXTERNAL AFFAIRS OFFICER & THE MANAGER OF INVESTOR RELATIONS TO EMPLOY ORGANIZATION-WIDE STRATEGIES ASSOCIATED WITH INVESTOR RECRUITMENT & RETENTION; AND (2) ONE VISTA TO WORK WITH CEAO AND THE COMMUNITY STRATEGIES GROUP TO EMPLOY POLICY & SYSTEMS BUILDING STRATEGY.  

ESTIMATED TIME TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT.  THREE YEARS.

GIRL SCOUTS HEART OF NEW JERSEY'S (GSHNJ) MISSION IS TO BUILD GIRLS OF COURAGE, CONFIDENCE, AND CHARACTER, WHO MAKE THE WORLD A BETTER PLACE. IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICES' EDUCATION PRIORITY AREA, GSHNJ SEEKS TO END THE CYCLE OF POVERTY, HOMELESSNESS AND INCARCERATION AMONG LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES BY ENGAGING VULNERABLE NEW JERSEY GIRLS IN STRUCTURED, IMPACTFUL PROGRAMMING. SPECIFICALLY, IN AN EFFORT TO ADDRESS THE UNIQUE CHALLENGES FACED BY HOMELESS CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, AS WELL AS FAMILIES IMPACTED BY THE JUSTICE SYSTEM, GSHNJ IS LAUNCHING TROOP 6000 AND OUR GIRL SCOUTS BEYOND BARS (GSBB) PROGRAMS TO SERVE HIGH-NEEDS GIRLS IN NEWARK AND ELIZABETH. TROOP 6000 WILL SERVE AN INITIAL COHORT OF 26 GIRLS EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS AND TWO ADULT VOLUNTEERS, AND GSBB WILL SERVE TEN GIRLS AND THEIR MOTHERS/CAREGIVERS IN ITS LAUNCH YEAR, WITH THE INTENT TO GROW AND EXPAND BOTH PROGRAMS IN SUBSEQUENT YEARS. THESE PROGRAMS WILL FUNCTION JUST AS ANY OTHER GIRL SCOUT PROGRAM WOULD - EXCEPT TROOP MEETINGS WILL TAKE PLACE IN LOCAL, PARTNERING HOMELESS SHELTERS AND TRANSITIONAL HOUSING FACILITIES, AND WITHIN THE EDNA MAHAN CORRECTIONAL FACILITY IN CLINTON, NEW JERSEY. TROOP MEETINGS WILL BE LED BY TRAINED TROOP LEADERS - WOMEN LIVING IN THE SHELTER SYSTEM AND INCARCERATED MOTHERS - WHO WILL ENGAGE GIRLS IN TYPICAL TROOP ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS EARNING BADGES, SELLING COOKIES, AND PARTICIPATING IN CAMP OUTINGS. GSHNJ PROPOSES TO ENLIST A TOTAL OF TWO VISTA VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL HELP TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF BOTH PROGRAMS. THE VISTA VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS VITAL TEAM MEMBERS, HELPING TO RAISE AWARENESS OF THE TWO PROGRAMS WITHIN LOCAL CENTRAL NEW JERSEY COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND; FORGING PARTNERSHIPS WITH HOMELESS SHELTERS, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, AND THE FUNDING COMMUNITY, INCLUDING GOVERNMENT AND PRIVATE FUNDERS; AND CONTRIBUTING TO ALL ASPECTS OF THE PROJECT, FROM DELIVERING TRAININGS TO ADULT VOLUNTEERS ON THE OUTSET OF THE PROGRAMS' ROLL-OUT, TO DEVELOPING COMPLEMENTARY ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES. IN AN EFFORT TO PROVIDE TROOP 6000 PARTICIPANTS WITH A PLACE TO TRANSITION ONCE THEIR FAMILIES LEAVE THE SHELTER SYSTEM, THE TWO VISTA VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO HELP TO RECRUIT GIRLS AND GROW TRADITIONAL GIRL SCOUT TROOPS IN THE AREAS IN WHICH WE ARE FORMING TROOP 6000 TROOPS. THE TWO VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITH GSHNJ FOR ONE YEAR.

THE FUND FOR EDUCATIONAL EXCELLENCE, ON BEHALF OF MARYLAND OUT OF SCHOOL TIME (MOST) NETWORK, IS REQUESTING SUPPORT 25 FT VSY AND 1 VISTA LEADER- WITH THE GOAL OF RECRUITING 35 FT VSYS BY THE END OF 2019 FISCAL YEAR- TO SUPPORT THE NETWORK AND MOSTS PARTNERS OVER A PERIOD OF THREE YEARS TO BUILD ORGANIZATIONAL STRENGTH, ENSURE SUSTAINABILITY, AND INCREASE RANGE OF IMPACT IN MARYLAND. WE ARE REQUESTING $570,036 FROM CNCS IN ORDER TO EFFECTIVELY SUPPORT OUR 25 PLANNED STATEWIDE VISTA PROJECTS WHILE WE CONTINUE TO EXPAND AND ENHANCE OUR NET IMPACT ON OST IN MARYLAND USING VISTA RESOURCES. THE MOST NETWORK WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2007 AS A STATEWIDE INITIATIVE TO INCREASE THE QUANTITY AND QUALITY OF OUT OF SCHOOL TIME (OST) OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH, AND THE FUND WILL SERVE AS MOSTS FISCAL AGENT UNDER THIS GRANT. THE FOLLOWING ARE OUR PROPOSED AREAS OF FOCUS: 
1) INCREASING ACCESS TO AND PARTICIPATION IN PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE UNIQUE STEM LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES; 2) ELIMINATING YOUTH HUNGER AND IMPROVING HEALTH IN CHILDREN AND FAMILIES BY INCREASING ACCESS TO MEALS, QUALITY NUTRITION EDUCATION, AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY; 3) EXPANDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH WHO HAVE THE LEAST ACCESS TO OUT OF SCHOOL TIME PROGRAMS. 
THE PROPOSED PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA (K-12 SUCCESS), AND SECONDARILY WITH HEALTHY FUTURES. THE MOST NETWORK IS ONE OF 50 STATEWIDE AFTERSCHOOL NETWORKS SUPPORTED BY THE CHARLES STEWART MOTT FOUNDATION WITH MATCHING LOCAL INVESTMENT. MOST HAS A ROBUST AND ACTIVE COALITION WITH
PARTICIPATION FROM ALL TWENTY-FOUR JURISDICTIONS IN MARYLAND AND REPRESENTATION FROM ALL KEY STAKEHOLDERS IN THE OUT OF SCHOOL TIME FIELD, INCLUDING SCHOOL SYSTEMS, LOCAL MANAGEMENT BOARDS (LMBS), RECREATION & PARKS DEPARTMENTS, SMALL-SCALE AND LARGE-SCALE PROGRAM PROVIDERS, AND LOCAL AND STATE GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND OFFICIALS.

BALTIMORE CITY?S DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORK'S (DPW) MISSION IS TO SUPPORT THE HEALTH, ENVIRONMENT, AND ECONOMY OF OUR CITY AND THE REGION BY PROVIDING CUSTOMERS WITH SAFE DRINKING WATER AND KEEPING NEIGHBORHOODS AND WATERWAYS CLEAN. 3. STRENGTHEN DPW'S CONNECTION TO THE COMMUNITY AND BALTIMORE'S YOUTH POPULATION THROUGH SERVICE LEARNING, YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, AND JOB TRAINING PROGRAMS RELATED TO DPW'S MISSION WITH THE PURPOSE OF INCREASING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND FUTURE EMPLOYABILITY WITHIN THE CITY. WORKING WITH DPW SUPERVISORS, DIRECTOR AND OFFICE TEAMS, FOUR (4) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY CREATING AND IMPLEMENTING NEW ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY PROGRAMS SUCH AS A DPW APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM, DPW MARKETING CAMPAIGNS, DPW RECYCLING INITIATIVES, DATABASE MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, GRANTS RESEARCH & WRITING, AND PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ORGANIZING THE MAYOR'S FALL AND SPRING CLEAN UPS ALONG WITH OTHER COMMUNITY EVENTS OVER THE COURSE OF 12 MONTHS.

WILLIAM JAMES COLLEGE (WJC) IS A FULLY-ACCREDITED NON-PROFIT GRADUATE SCHOOL OF PSYCHOLOGY OF APPROXIMATELY 700 MASTER?S AND DOCTORAL LEVEL STUDENTS IN PROGRAMS INCLUDING CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY, COUNSELING PSYCHOLOGY, ORGANIZATIONAL AND LEADERSHIP PSYCHOLOGY, AND SCHOOL PSYCHOLOGY. WJC?S PRIMARY MISSION IS TO EDUCATE STUDENTS FOR CAREERS THAT MEET THE GROWING DEMAND FOR ACCESS TO QUALITY, CULTURALLY COMPETENT PSYCHOLOGICAL SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS, GROUPS, COMMUNITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS BOTH LOCALLY AND AROUND THE GLOBE. WJC FOCUSES ON SERVING VULNERABLE POPULATIONS AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING CHILDREN, LATINOS, VETERANS, IMMIGRANTS AND REFUGEES. THE COLLEGE WORKS COLLABORATIVELY WITH ORGANIZATIONS AND LEADERS ON THE FOREFRONT OF CREATING LONG-LASTING SOCIAL CHANGE AND PROMOTING SOCIAL JUSTICE. THE WJC?S DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT (DCE) PROVIDES DIRECT SERVICES TO YOUTH AND FAMILIES AS WELL AS GRADUATE AND POST-GRADUATE TRAINING IN FORENSIC EVALUATIONS AND INTERVENTIONS, PSYCHOLOGICAL ASSESSMENTS, SCHOOL-BASED INTERVENTIONS WITH HIGH RISK YOUTH, AND PREVENTIVE MENTAL HEALTH WITH YOUNGER CHILDREN. THE PROPOSED AMERICORPS/VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOCUS ON EDUCATION AREA. WE ARE SEEKING TWO FULL-TIME AMERICORPS/VISTA VOLUNTEERS FOR A PERIOD OF TWO YEARS WHO WILL CONTRIBUTE TO MEETING THE OVERARCHING GOAL AND OBJECTIVES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT BY PROVIDING THE FOLLOWING CAPACITY-BUILDING SERVICES: (1) SUPPORT DEC PROGRAMS (E.G., THE JUVENILE COURT CLINIC) TO ENHANCE THEIR ABILITY TO EFFECTIVELY SERVE SOME OF THE MOST VULNERABLE YOUTH AND FAMILIES IN SUFFOLK AND NORFOLK COUNTIES AND PROVIDE GREATER STABILITY, WELL-BEING, AND SAFETY FOR COURT-INVOLVED YOUTH AND FAMILIES AND THE COMMUNITIES IN WHICH THEY LIVE; (2) CREATE LINKAGES WITH COMMUNITY-BASED PROVIDERS THAT OFFER SOCIAL SERVICES, RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES (E.G., SPORTS, ARTS, AND MUSIC), PRE-VOCATIONAL AND VOCATIONAL SUPPORTS, AND EDUCATIONAL SUPPORTS FOR YOUTH AND FAMILIES SERVED BY THE DCE; (3) BE ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN ESTABLISHING RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE DCE AND SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCIES, ADVOCATES, SCHOOLS, AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS; (4) DEVELOP STRATEGIES FOR EFFECTIVE COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT EFFORTS TO INCREASE CLIENT PARTICIPATION IN DCE-RELATED PROGRAMS; (5) IDENTIFY LOCAL SERVICES AND CREATE A DATABASE OF RESOURCES (E.G., HOUSING REFERRALS, CAREER AND JOB TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES, MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING, ETC.) FOR CLIENTS SERVED BY THE DCE; (6) DESIGN PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS (E.G., BROCHURES, FLYERS, NEWSLETTERS) AND SOCIAL MEDIA FORUMS (E.G., FACE BOOK, TWITTER) TO RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT THE NEEDS OF HOMELESS CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, AND OF SERVICES AND PROGRAMS OFFERED THROUGH THE DCE FOR COURT-INVOLVED YOUTH AND FAMILIES; AND (7) ASSIST IN THE CREATION OF A DATABASE TO COLLECT AND ANALYZE DATA FOR PROGRAM EVALUATION PURPOSES.

MORE THAN WORDS IS A NONPROFIT SOCIAL ENTERPRISE THAT EMPOWERS YOUTH WHO ARE IN THE FOSTER CARE SYSTEM, COURT SYSTEM, HOMELESS, OR OUT OF SCHOOL TO TAKE CHARGE OF THEIR LIVES BY TAKING CHARGE OF A BUSINESS. ADDITIONAL MEMBERS MAY CONTRIBUTE IN NEW WAYS OR BY CONTINUING THESE DEVELOPMENTS IN FUTURE YEARS OVER THE COURSE OF THE 3-YEAR PROJECT.

SINCE ITS BEGINNING IN 2009, STORYTIME VILLAGE HAS WORKED TO HELP THE YOUNGEST IN OUR COMMUNITIES THRIVE THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS THAT PROVIDE EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT, FAMILY ENGAGEMENT AROUND READING, AND ACCESS TO BOOKS. IN 2014, THE ORGANIZATION FOCUSED ITS EFFORTS ON THE LITERACY GAP THAT IS SO VITAL TO THE STATE'S ECONOMIC SUSTAINABILITY. WHILE THE NATION'S READING PROFICIENCY RATES HAVE IMPROVED FOR MOST DEMOGRAPHIC GROUPS OVER THE LAST DECADE, LARGE DISPARITIES STILL EXIST BY RACE AND INCOME STATUS. KANSAS IS AMONG STATES WHERE THE LITERACY GAP WIDENED. 

THE LITERACY CHAMPIONS PROGRAM WILL BE THE AMERICORP VISTA PROJECT. THIS PROJECT DEVELOPED FROM STORYTIME VILLAGE'S FIRST-YEAR VISTA PROJECT AND IS A COMMUNITY-BASED ANTI-POVERTY PROGRAM THAT BUILDS ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY.  
LITERACY CHAMPIONS IS A PEER MENTORING PROGRAM THAT BUILDS PARTNERSHIPS WITH TEACHERS, PARENTS, AND COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE TITLE I, THIRD-GRADE STRUGGLING READERS THE SUPPORT THEY NEED TO READ AT GRADE LEVEL. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES WEEKLY READING MENTORING SESSIONS THAT HELP THE PARTICIPATING THIRD-GRADE STUDENTS GROW THEIR READING SKILLS AND BUILDS TEXT-RICH ENVIRONMENTS AT HOME BY PROVIDING TAKE-HOME BOOKS AND OTHER LITERACY RESOURCES. 
 
ACCORDING TO A RECENT ANNIE E. CASEY FOUNDATION KIDS COUNT REPORT, 83 PERCENT OF KANSAS AFRICAN AMERICAN FOURTH-GRADERS ARE BELOW PROFICIENT IN READING. IN WICHITA, ONLY HALF OF AFRICAN AMERICAN FOURTH-GRADERS ARE READING AT GRADE LEVEL. THIS DISTURBING STATISTIC IS FORETELLING FOR THOSE CHILDREN THAT ONLY 30 PERCENT OF THEM WILL HAVE A CHANCE OF BEING PROFICIENT IN READING BY GRADUATION. THEY WILL ALSO BE FOUR TIMES LESS LIKELY TO GRADUATE FROM HIGH SCHOOL. THOSE IN POVERTY WILL BE 13 TIMES LESS LIKELY TO GRADUATE.

EARLY LITERACY IS PROVEN TO BE A CRITICAL BUILDING BLOCK FOR CHILDREN TO FIND THEIR WAY OUT OF POVERTY. THAT IS WHY WE ARE REQUESTING VISTA MEMBERS TO HELP OUR ORGANIZATION WITH CAPACITY-BUILDING ACTIVITIES THAT WILL HELP US BETTER SERVE THE COMMUNITY THROUGH ANTI-POVERTY PROGRAMMING. OUR GOAL IS THAT THROUGH THE SUPPORT OF VISTA MEMBERS STORYTIME VILLAGE WILL BE SUSTAINABLE ONCE THE VISTA MEMBERS LEAVE THE ORGANIZATION.

UNITED WAY IMPROVES LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF COMMUNITIES FROM BATTLEMENT MESA TO ASPEN TO ADVANCE THE COMMON GOOD FOR ALL, FOCUSING ON EDUCATION, FINANCIAL WELL-BEING, AND HEALTH. UNITED WAY BATTLEMENT TO THE BELLS ACTS AS A COMPREHENSIVE FUNDRAISING VEHICLE FOR VARIOUS NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT SERVE GARFIELD, PITKIN, AND THE WESTERN PORTION OF EAGLE COUNTIES ON THE WESTERN SLOPE OF COLORADO. UNITED WAY BATTLEMENT TO THE BELLS (UWBB) SERVES AS A LIAISON BETWEEN THE PUBLIC AND HUMAN SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS AND DEVELOPS AND SUPPORTS PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESS SPECIFIC COMMUNITY ISSUES SUCH AS EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS AND DISASTER RELIEF. THE VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE UWBB RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD CAPACITY IN SIXTEEN MAJOR LOCAL NON-PROFITS. THIRTEEN VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS WRITING GRANTS, DEVELOPING SUSTAINABLE FUNDING STREAMS, CREATING VOLUNTEER TRAINING CURRICULUMS AND MANUALS, DEVELOPING AND MAINTAINING A VOLUNTEER AND/OR DONOR DATABASES, AND HANDLING MARKETING PUBLIC RELATIONS, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH. OUR COMMUNITIES WILL CONTINUE TO WRAPAROUND THE UWBB VISTA MEMBERS BY PROVIDING HOUSING, COMMUNITY SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES, AND SOCIAL AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES.

MILE HIGH UNITED WAY'S MISSION IS TO UNITED PEOPLE, IDEAS, AND RESOURCES TO ADVANCE THE COMMON GOOD. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL HELP EXPAND THE CENTER FOR FAMILY OPPORTUNITY (CFO) PROGRAM TO ADDITIONAL SITES. WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT 500 LOW-INCOME CLIENTS SERVED BY THE CENTER FOR FAMILY OPPORTUNITY SITES. ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS CONDUCTING OUTREACH TO NEW CFO SITES, AND COORDINATING COHORT MEETINGS OF CFO COMMUNITY PARTNERS OVER THE COURSE OF 12 MONTHS.

THE ASSOCIATION OF ARIZONA FOOD BANK'S MISSION IS TO, "DEVELOP SOLUTIONS TO END HUNGER THROUGH FOOD BANKING, PUBLIC POLICY AND INNOVATION." THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE "HEALTHY FUTURES" FOCUS AREA RELATED TO OBESITY AND HUNGER. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY AND POVERTY IN ARIZONA THROUGH A VARIETY OF METHODS UTILIZING AAFB'S FOOD BANK PARTNERS.  THESE INCLUDE: HELPING TO INCREASE ACCESS TO HEALTHIER FOOD, TEACHING COMMUNITIES HOW TO GROW THEIR OWN FOOD, AND WORKING TO EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF RURAL AGENCY PARTNERS.  

THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE NEEDS OF TRIBAL AND RURAL COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE WHERE THE NEED IS GREAT. UP TO SIX VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES RELATED TO DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING SCHOOL PANTRIES, CONDUCTING OUTREACH ON THE USDA SUMMER FOOD SERVICE PROGRAM, CREATING AND IMPLEMENTING CLIENT FEEDBACK CHANNELS, DEVELOPING TRAINING WORKSHOPS ON LOCAL FOOD SOVEREIGNTY TO BE TAUGHT MY COMMUNITY MEMBERS, RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS TO WORK ON A TRIBAL CO-OP FARM, AND DEVELOPMENT OF A COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT TO SUPPORT THE NEEDS OF RURAL PARTNER AGENCIES.  THIS PROJECT IS ENTERING YEAR TWO OF IMPLEMENTATION AND IS EXPECTED TO BE A MINIMUM OF THREE YEARS IN LENGTH TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY AND POVERTY OF RURAL AND TRIBAL POPULATIONS IN ARIZONA.

THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING, REGION ONE IN PHOENIX, ARIZONA IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WITH A MISSION TO ADVOCATE, DEVELOP, AND DELIVER ESSENTIAL SERVICES TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR OLDER ADULTS, ADULTS AGE 18 AND OVER WITH DISABILITIES AND LONG-TERM CARE NEEDS, PEOPLE WITH HIV/AIDS, AND CAREGIVERS. TWO AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS HAVE BEEN ASSIGNED TO TWO AREA AGENCIES ON AGING IN ARIZONA TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE RXMATTERS PROGRAM, WHICH USES AMERICORPS MEMBERS TO EDUCATE LOW-INCOME AND HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS ON HEALTHY USE OF PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION WITH EMPHASIS ON OPIOIDS. ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL SERVE IN MARICOPA COUNTY AT REGION ONE IN MARICOPA COUNTY, AND ONE AT THE PINAL-GILA COUNCIL FOR SENIOR CITIZENS, OUR SUB SITE IN PINAL COUNTY. THE VISTA MEMBERS ASSIST IN BUILDING CAPACITY OF THE RXMATTERS PROGRAM BY RECRUITING (AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS), IDENTIFYING AND MEETING WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO BUILD REFERRALS OF HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS AT RISK FOR MEDICATION/OPIOID MISUSE BY COLLECTING DATA FOR PROJECT EVALUATION EFFORTS. THE LONG-TERM GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO EDUCATE 3,000 HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS USING THE RXMATTERS PROGRAM CURRICULUM ACROSS ALL FOUR COUNTIES OVER A THREE-YEAR PERIOD.

THE AMERICAN INDIAN HIGHER EDUCATION CONSORTIUM (AIHEC) IS THE COLLECTIVE SPIRIT AND UNIFYING VOICE OF OUR NATION'S TRIBAL COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES (TCUS). AIHEC PROVIDES LEADERSHIP AND INFLUENCES PUBLIC POLICY ON AMERICAN INDIAN HIGHER EDUCATION ISSUES THROUGH ADVOCACY, RESEARCH, AND PROGRAM INITIATIVES; PROMOTES AND STRENGTHENS INDIGENOUS LANGUAGES, CULTURES, COMMUNITIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS. AIHEC WILL RECRUIT 20 AMERICORPS VISTAS TO WORK IN 20 DIFFERENT AMERICAN INDIAN TRIBAL COMMUNITIES IN THE US.  THE VISTAS WILL HELP ESTABLISH AND/OR EXPAND NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING IN TRIBAL COMMUNITIES, ASSISTING THEM IN THEIR EFFORTS TO IDENTIFY AND RESPOND TO EMERGING NATURAL RESOURCE ISSUES.  THE FOCUS OF PROJECTS WILL BE PRIMARY ON ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, THROUGH WORK INCLUDING NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, FOOD SECURITY, ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE, AND YOUTH DEVELOPMENT. ESTIMATED TIME REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECTS ARE 1 TO 3 YEARS.

HIGHER GROUND?S MISSION IS REACHING INDIVIDUALS, TRANSFORMING FAMILIES, AND ELEVATING THE COMMUNITY ONE LIFE AT A TIME BY SHOWING LOVE AND BUILDING CHARACTER. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENSURE THE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE TUCSON COMMUNITY SCHOOLS INITIATIVE, HELP BUILD CAPACITY WITHIN HIGHER GROUND, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 1500 STUDENTS AND FAMILY MEMBERS BY CONNECTING THEM WITH VARIOUS SCHOOL BASED PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THE SERVICES AND PROGRAMS WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED ATTENDANCE AMONG CHRONICALLY ABSENT STUDENTS AND INCREASES IN THE RATE OF STUDENTS ATTENDING COLLEGE AFTER GRADUATION. NINE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING SYSTEMS AND PARTNERSHIPS TO EXPAND SCHOOL BASED SERVICES, ENGAGING VOLUNTEERS, SUPPORTING FUNDRAISING EFFORTS, AND DOCUMENTING EFFECTIVE PRACTICES OVER THE COURSE OF TWO YEARS.

THE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOODS RESEARCH GROUP (ATHFRG), FORMERLY THE CHILDHOOD OBESITY PREVENTION RESEARCH PROGRAM (COPRP), AT ARKANSAS CHILDREN'S RESEARCH INSTITUTE (ACRI) AIMS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO, AVAILABILITY OF, AND CONSUMPTION OF, FRUITS AND VEGETABLES FOR THE PURPOSE OF PREVENTING CHILDHOOD OBESITY. THE MISSION OF THE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOODS RESEARCH GROUP IS TO BUILD EVIDENCE, CAPACITY, AND SUPPORT FOR AN EQUITABLE FOOD SYSTEM THAT FOSTERS THE HEALTH AND WELLNESS OF CHILDREN, FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITIES IN ARKANSAS. THE WORK OF THE ATHF RESEARCH GROUP FOCUSES ON THE DEVELOPMENT, DELIVERY, AND EVALUATION OF INDIVIDUAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL-LEVEL INTERVENTIONS SUCH AS FARM TO SCHOOL, SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY GARDENS, AND SUPPORT FOR INCREASED LOCAL AND HEALTHY FOOD PRODUCTION, DISTRIBUTION, AND CONSUMPTION. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES CNCS FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY AND OUTREACH OF CORNERSTONE PROGRAMMING, HEALTHY FOOD ACCESS RESEARCH AND PROGRAM EVALUATION, AND SUPPORT COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS WITH SIMILAR GOALS OF IMPROVING HEALTH AND WELLNESS FOR ARKANSANS. UP TO TEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ASSESSING COMMUNITY NEED, EXPANDING AND STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS AND NETWORKS, AND IMPROVING OR EXPANDING PROGRAM DELIVERY.

THE INDIGENOUS FOOD AND AGRICULTURE INITIATIVE (IFAI) AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ARKANSAS SCHOOL OF LAW WILL RECRUIT 20 AMERICORPS VISTAS TO WORK IN TEN (10) DIFFERENT COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT INDIAN COUNTRY IN THE U.S. TO TACKLE HUNGER, FOOD INSECURITY, AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT THROUGH THE CREATION OF A "COHORT" OF ?NATIVE FOOD SOVEREIGNTY FELLOWS?.  THESE FELLOWS WILL BE COORDINATED BY STAFF AT IFAI ALONG WITH AN ADDITIONAL ONE (1) VISTA LEAD TO BE HOUSED AT IFAI.  THIS TEAM WILL CREATE A SEAMLESS SUPPORT SYSTEM FOR VISTAS WORKING WITHIN NATIVE COMMUNITIES ON IMPORTANT ISSUES RELATED TO FOOD SOVEREIGNTY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT BY BUILDING THE CAPACITIES OF TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, TRIBAL COMMUNITIES, TRIBAL NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, AND INDIVIDUAL AMERICAN INDIAN AND ALASKA NATIVE PEOPLES TO ESTABLISH AND STABILIZE LOCAL FOOD SOVEREIGNTY EFFORTS, LOCAL AND REGIONAL FOOD SYSTEMS, AND LOCAL AND REGIONAL TRIBAL ECONOMIES THAT BUILD ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES AROUND FOOD AND AGRICULTURE.  THE SHAKOPEE MDEWAKANTON SIOUX COMMUNITY WILL PROVIDE IMPORTANT FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE LOCAL NEEDS OF THE COHORT MEMBERS AND THE DAY-TO-DAY COORDINATION AND COLLABORATION SUPPORT WILL PROVIDED BY THE INDIGENOUS FOOD AND AGRICULTURE INITIATIVE WHICH WILL PROVIDE SEAMLESS SUPPORT, NETWORKING, AND COORDINATION FOR THE VISTA RECRUITS ON THE GROUND.   THE VISTAS WILL PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED GRASSROOTS FOCUS COMBINED WITH NATIONAL INTERTRIBAL ASSISTANCE TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF POOR AND FOOD-INSECURE INDIAN COUNTRY COMMUNITIES.  ONE OF THE VISTAS WILL FOCUS ON FOOD SYSTEMS DEVELOPMENT AND THE OTHER WILL FOCUS ON COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND TOGETHER THEY WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY ON DEVELOPING AND EXECUTING ON A COMPREHENSIVE FOOD SOVEREIGNTY ASSESSMENT OF THE ASSIGNED COMMUNITIES WITHIN WHICH THEY ARE ASSIGNED.   BY HELPING COMMUNITIES TO BETTER UNDERSTAND HUNGER IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, IDENTIFY AND REACH UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS, BRING NEW PARTNERS TO THE TABLE, CLOSE GAPS AMONG PROGRAMS, AMPLIFY EXISTING AND IMPORT NEW PROGRAMMING AND IDENTIFY RESOURCES IN THE COMMUNITIES THAT WILL STRENGTHEN AND SUPPORT LOCAL FOOD SYSTEMS, LOCAL FOOD AVAILABILITY AND SECURITY, AND INTERFACING OF HUNGER AND FEEDING ACTIVITIES WITH LOCAL FOOD AND AGRICULTURE SYSTEMS. VISTAS WILL HELP TO REPLICATE SUCCESSFUL STRATEGIES FROM EXISTING ACTIVITIES TO THESE NEW COMMUNITIES, AS WELL AS SERVE AS A LIAISON TO BETTER CONNECT COMMUNITIES AND THE GRASSROOTS ORGANIZERS FOR FOOD SOVEREIGNTY WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES TO OTHER NATIONAL AND INTERTRIBAL EFFORTS UNDERWAY TO ADDRESS HUNGER, NUTRITION, HEALTH AND FOOD SYSTEMS STABILITY.

THE MISSION OF CROWLEY?S RIDGE DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL (CRDC) IS ?TO PROVIDE LEADERSHIP IN THE CREATION OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO ACHIEVE GREATER SELF-SUFFICIENCY IN THEIR LIVES THEREBY ELIMINATING THE CAUSES OF POVERTY IN NORTHEAST ARKANSAS.? FACILITATED BY THE CRDC, ONE OF 16 COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCIES ACROSS ARKANSAS, THE INITIATIVE IS A PARTNERSHIP OF HEALTHCARE, EDUCATION, SOCIAL SERVICE, GOVERNMENT, AND FAITH ORGANIZATIONS TO COORDINATE RESOURCES FOR BETTER POPULATION HEALTH OUTCOMES THAT CAN SERVE AS A MODEL FOR COMMUNITY ACTION INITIATIVES ACROSS THE STATE. CRDC IS REQUESTING FIVE VISTAS TO START IN 2017, THREE IN FEBRUARY AND TWO IN APRIL, TO ENGAGE LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS, CONDUCT FAMILY NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENTS, CONDUCT A RESOURCE INVENTORY AND BUILD AN UPDATED ONLINE SHARED RESOURCE DATABASE, ACT AS LIAISONS TO CARE NAVIGATORS WORKING DIRECTLY WITH THE FAMILIES IN NEED, AND FINALLY TO SERVE IN THE CENTER FOR NONPROFIT AND SMALL TOWN SUPPORT DOING SUCH THINGS AS GRANT RESEARCH, WRITING, AND MANAGEMENT, AS WELL AS, REVIEWING AND PROCESSING APPLICATIONS FROM FAMILIES. AVERETT UNIVERSITY'S CENTER FOR COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND CAREER COMPETITIVENESS (CCECC) IS SEEKING TO BECOME AN INTERMEDIARY SITE FOR AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS. ALONG WITH TEN AREA NONPROFIT PARTNERS, THE CCECC SEEKS TO SERVE AS A HUB TO INCREASE CAPACITY IN SERVICE DELIVERY AND LEADERSHIP.

THE ALLIANCE TO END HUNGER IS APPLYING TO BE AN AMERICORPS VISTA SPONSOR FOR NINE VISTAS AND ONE VISTA LEADER FOR A THREE-YEAR PROJECT.  THE ALLIANCE TO END HUNGER?S HUNGER FREE COMMUNITIES INITIATIVE IS UNIQUELY POSITIONED TO PARTNER WITH AMERICORPS VISTA TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITIES OF COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY TO REDUCE POVERTY AND HUNGER IN THEIR LOCALITIES.
THE ALLIANCE WILL RECRUIT NINE VISTAS TO WORK IN DIVERSE COMMUNITIES IN THE U.S. TO BUILD THE CAPACITIES OF PRIMARILY EMERGING AND NEWLY ESTABLISHED HUNGER FREE COMMUNITY (HFC) NETWORKS TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF POOR AND FOOD-INSECURE COMMUNITY MEMBERS.  ONE VISTA LEADER WILL BE BASED AT THE ALLIANCE TO END HUNGER.  HFCS ARE BROAD-BASED, MULTI-SECTOR COALITIONS THAT ARE COMMITTED TO ENDING HUNGER IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. THESE COALITIONS?TYPICALLY COMPRISED OF LOCAL NONPROFITS, FAITH GROUPS, BUSINESSES AND GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES?RANGE IN GEOGRAPHIC SCOPE AND COMPOSITION BUT AT THEIR CORE SHARE A BELIEF THAT TO END HUNGER A BROAD RANGE OF COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS MUST UNITE BEHIND A COMMON VISION AND STRATEGY.
THE ALLIANCE IS A NATIONAL MODEL FOR HFCS AND OUR HFC INITIATIVE PROVIDES A FORUM FOR COMMUNICATION, RESOURCE SHARING, TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.  AS SUCH, THE ALLIANCE CAN SUPPORT HFCS IN THEIR WORK TO BETTER UNDERSTAND HUNGER IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, IDENTIFY AND REACH UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS, BRING UNCONVENTIONAL PARTNERS TO THE TABLE, CLOSE SERVICE GAPS AMONG PROGRAMS, CREATE HIGH IMPACT PROGRAMMING AND IDENTIFY NEW RESOURCES.  
AMERICORPS VISTAS WILL BE INTEGRAL TO THIS WORK AND CAN PROVIDE MEANINGFUL CAPACITY BUILDING SERVICES.  IN THE FIRST YEAR, THE VISTAS WILL FOCUS ON BUILDING THE INFRASTRUCTURE FOR THESE PROJECTS, INCREASING PARTNERSHIPS, ENGAGING LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS AND CREATING THEIR HUNGER FREE COMMUNITY PLANS.
BUILDING THE CAPACITIES OF HFCS WILL MAKE A LASTING IMPACT IN THE LIVES OF HUNGRY PEOPLE. THE ALLIANCE TO END HUNGER?S HUNGER FREE COMMUNITIES INITIATIVE CAN SUPPORT THESE EFFORTS, LEADING TO:
?             DEEPER UNDERSTANDING OF HUNGER IN OUR COMMUNITIES
?             ENGAGEMENT OF A BROAD RANGE OF COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS
?             COLLECTIVE APPROACHES TO PROBLEM SOLVING
?             GREATER CAPACITY AND BETTER COORDINATION OF PROGRAMS TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY AND HUNGER

THE ALLIANCE HAS A STRONG TRACK RECORD OF WORKING WITH MANY SUCH COALITIONS OVER THE YEARS MAKING US A STRONG CANDIDATE FOR THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM.
