THE MISSION OF PARTNERSHIP FOR FAMILIES, CHILDREN AND ADULTS (PARTNERSHIP) IS EMPOWERING PEOPLE. BUILDING COMMUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES, EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE SERVICES AMONG SENIORS AND DISABLED PEOPLE, INCREASE FOOD SECURITY AND EMPLOYMENT SKILLS AMONG VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND HOMELESSNESS, INCREASE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AMONG CHILDREN WHO MAY HAVE WITNESSED DOMESTIC VIOLENCE OR ARE INVOLVED HIGH CONFLICT FAMILY DISSOLUTION AND INCREASE THE PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT AND EFFECTIVENESS OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 70-75 LOW INCOME SENIORS, DISABLED INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE VICTIMS AND HOMELESS FAMILIES. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING A RETAIL JOB TRAINING PROGRAM, CREATING A FOOD DELIVERY AND PREPARATION SYSTEM, CREATING A SUSTAINABILITY AND MARKETING (OUTREACH) PLAN AND IMPLEMENTING A TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM THAT WILL ALLOW SENIORS AND DISABLED TO GO TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, AND IMPLEMENT A DATA COLLECTION AND STAFF TRAINING PROGRAM TO PROVIDE EFFECTIVE PROGRAM GOAL MEASUREMENT AND REVIEW OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS.

SC THRIVE IS A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION WORKING TO ACHIEVE STABILIZED, HEALTHY COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE.  OUR MISSION IS TO LEAD SOUTH CAROLINIANS TO STABILITY BY PROVIDING INNOVATIVE AND EFFICIENT ACCESS TO QUALITY OF LIFE RESOURCES. SIMILARLY, OUR PARTNER FOR THIS PROPOSED PROJECT, JEFFERSON AWARDS FOUNDATION (JAF), WAS FOUNDED WITH A MISSION TO BUILD A CULTURE OF SERVICE ACROSS THE COUNTRY.  JAF FOCUSES SPECIFICALLY ON YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, EXECUTING THIS MISSION TO CULTIVATE OUR COUNTRY'S NEXT GENERATION OF SERVANT LEADERS AND HELPING RESIDENTS HERE IN SOUTH CAROLINA.  SC THRIVE'S PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THREE OF THIS YEAR'S CNCS PRIORITIES:  ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, AND HEALTHY FUTURES. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DEVELOP A COMMUNITY RESOURCE MOBILE APP; IDENTIFY AND ENHANCE TRAINING AND EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES TO ASSIST LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS; USE RESEARCH-BASED SERVICE-LEARNING AS A VEHICLE TO EMPOWER STUDENTS TO UNDERSTAND LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY ISSUES; AND EMPOWER THESE STUDENTS TO EMPLOY SERVICE-LEARNING ACTIVITIES, PROMOTING THRIVING COMMUNITIES WHILE BUILDING LEADERSHIP AND LIFE SKILLS FOR POST-SECONDARY SUCCESS. THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT STUDENTS, LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES, AND POPULATIONS LOOKING TO IDENTIFY STABILIZING RESOURCES THROUGH BOTH TRADITIONAL AND INNOVATIVE MEANS.  WE ARE REQUESTING 4 VISTA MEMBERS IN YEAR ONE FOR PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT OF THIS ANTI-POVERTY PROJECT TO PERFORM ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT AND DISSEMINATION, MARKETING AND BRAND AWARENESS PLANNING, INCREASING TRAINING PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS, ESTABLISHING EVALUATION TOOLS FOR MEASURING STUDENT BEHAVIOR CHANGE.  FOR YEAR TWO WE ARE REQUESTING SIX VISTA MEMBERS TO CONDUCT IMPLEMENTATION AND SUSTAINABILITY EFFORTS FOR THE SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT.

ANDERSON INTERFAITH MINISTRIES' (AIM) MISSION IS TO CONNECT PEOPLE WITH SUPPORT, RESOURCES, AND EDUCATION SO THEY CAN EMPOWER THEMSELVES TO BECOME SELF-SUFFICIENT. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DEVELOP ADDITIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE TO INCREASE CAPACITY FOR SEAMLESS TRANSITIONS IN STAFFING AND VOLUNTEERS, EVALUATE PROGRAMS TO INCREASE AND MAXIMIZE IMPACT, EXPAND ITS ABILITY TO SERVE MORE LOW-INCOME HOMEOWNERS, AND INCREASE DIVERSIFICATION OF FUNDING STREAMS FOR LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY. AIM EXPECTS TO BENEFIT OVER 13,000 LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS ANNUALLY. THE 6 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING DATABASES, TRAINING RESOURCES, EVALUATION RESOURCES AND PROCESS MANUALS, AS WELL AS COMPLETING RESEARCH RELATED TO THEIR DEPARTMENT OF SERVICE OVER THE COURSE OF 5 YEARS.

AS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR THE SC PROMISE ZONE, THE SOUTHERNCAROLINA REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT ALLIANCE (SCA) LEADS EFFORTS WITHIN THE SIX COUNTY REGION TO CREATE JOBS, INCREASE ECONOMIC ACTIVITY, IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND REDUCE VIOLENT CRIME.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS PRIMARILY WITH THE EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREAS.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL HELP ADDRESS THE SKILLS GAP THAT EXISTS BETWEEN JOB SEEKERS AND EMPLOYERS/POTENTIAL EMPLOYERS IN THE PROMISE ZONE.  VISTAS ADDRESS THIS PROBLEM THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH OTHER APPROPRIATE ORGANIZATIONS THAT WILL STRENGTEN EXISTING PROGRAMS THAT 1) PREPARE STUDENTS FOR THE WORKFORCE BY IMPROVING BOTH HARD AND SOFT SKILLS  2) EDUCATE STUDENTS ON CAREER PATHWAYS THAT LEAD TO BETTER EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES 3) BUILD PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN EMPLOYERS AND SCHOOLS/EDUCATORS.  VISTA ASSIGNMENTS WILL INITIALLY FOCUS ON PARTNERSHIP BUILDING AND RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT TO SUPPORT THESE TYPES OF PROGRAMS IN THE PROMISE ZONE. BY ALIGNING LOCAL CERTIFICATE AND DEGREE PROGRAMS WITH LOCAL EMPLOYER NEEDS, THIS INITIATIVE WILL HELP MOVE LOCAL RESIDENTS FROM LOW TO MODERATE AND HIGH PAYING JOBS, IMPROVING THE ECONOMIC OUTLOOK FOR THE INDIVIDUALS AND THE COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE.

THE INSTITUTE FOR EMERGING ISSUE'S MISSION IS ENSURE NORTH CAROLINA'S LONG TERM PROSPERITY.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO SERVE LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT AT LEAST 650 BENEFICIARIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE THREE CNCS FOCUS AREAS: EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL  CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SUPPORTING THE DOLLY PARTON IMAGINATION LIBRARY TO ENSURE THAT KIDS RECEIVE AGE APPROPRIATE BOOKS (GREENVILLE), BUILDING THE TEXT, TALK, FUTURE PROGRAM TO ENGAGE LOW-INCOME HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS IN CONVERSATIONS ABOUT COLLEGE AND CAREER IEI STATEWIDE), AND SUPPORT PARKVIEW VILLAGE COMMUNITY TO BUILD EFFORTS AROUND CREATING A MODEL FOR MULTI-GENERATIONAL, TRANSFORMATIVE FAMILY SUPPORT (ROCKINGHAM COUNTY)  OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS. 

THREE VISTAS WILL BE PLACED IN UNDER-RESOURCED COMMUNITIES (GREENVILLE, ROCKINGHAM COUNTY, AND WILKES COUNTY), AND ONE VISTA WILL SERVE AT THE INSTITUTE FOR EMERGING ISSUES WORKING ON STATE-WIDE ANTI-POVERTY PROGRAMMING.

POINTS OF LIGHT'S MISSION IS TO INSPIRE, EQUIP AND MOBILIZE PEOPLE TO TAKE ACTION THAT CHANGES THE WORLD. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE EMPLOYABILITY IN LOW-TO-MODERATE INCOME (LMI) YOUNG ADULTS AGED 16-24. UP TO 15 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BUILDING A CADRE OF VOLUNTEERS WHO DELIVER 21ST CENTURY SKILLS TRAINING AND ENGAGE YOUNG ADULTS IN SERVICE LEARNING, FACILITATING SUCCESS COACHING IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.

MEDSERVE IS A SERVICE PROGRAM WITH THE MISSION TO TRANSFORM COMMUNITIES AND CAREERS. OUR MISSION IS DUAL: TO IMMEDIATELY IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF COMMUNITIES AND VITALITY OF PRIMARY CARE PRACTICES WHILE EXPOSING TOMORROW'S MOST PROMISING FUTURE PHYSICIANS TO THE GREAT POTENTIAL FOR COMMUNITY IMPACT POSSIBLE THROUGH PRIMARY CARE PRACTICE IN "MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED" COMMUNITIES.

OUR PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH AMERICORPS VISTA'S HEALTHY FUTURES PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA, IN THAT IT SUPPORTS IMPROVED PRIMARY CARE ACCESS IN COMMUNITIES OF POVERTY IN NORTH CAROLINA. THIS APPLICATION SEEKS 4 VISTAS TO SUPPORT CAPACITY-BUILDING ENDEAVORS EXPANDING MEDSERVE CONNECTIONS WITH COMMUNITY CLINICS; AND SPEARHEADING IMPROVEMENT PROCESSES AND RESOURCES FOR MEDSERVE AND STAKEHOLDERS TO BETTER SERVE LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES. SPECIFICALLY, THESE RESOURCES WILL PROVIDE TANGIBLE ASSETS WHEREBY PRIMARY CARE CLINICS CAN BETTER UTILIZE DIRECT SERVICE PARTICIPANTS TO CARE FOR MORE PATIENTS IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES. WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 40 PRIMARY CARE CLINICS AND 30,000 COMMUNITY MEMBERS TREATED AT THOSE CLINICS PER YEAR.

THE PROJECT WILL RUN IN 1 YEAR INCREMENTS OVER A 3-YEAR PERIOD THAT ALIGNS WITH THE AMERICORPS GRANT PROGRAM. AT THE CONCLUSION OF THIS PROGRAM YEAR, WE EXPECT TO BE ABLE TO TRANSITION ALL VISTA CAPACITY-BUILDING PROJECTS BACK TO STAFF.

THE NC AFTERSCHOOL CORPS WILL BUILD THE CAPACITY OF AFTERSCHOOL AND EXPANDED LEARNING PROGRAMS THAT SERVE LOW-INCOME CHILDREN, WHILE STRENGTHENING THESE PROGRAMS' CONNECTION TO LOCAL COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES. NC AFTERSCHOOL CORPS MEMBERS WILL WORK TO RECRUIT AND TRAIN AFTERSCHOOL VOLUNTEERS, INCREASE FUNDING AND RESOURCES TO THESE PROGRAMS, AND EXPAND LOCAL AWARENESS OF THE VALUE OF AFTERSCHOOL, ESPECIALLY BY SUPPORTING "LIGHTS ON AFTERSCHOOL" OR SIMILAR COMMUNITY EVENT. 
IN KEEPING WITH NORTH CAROLINA CAMPUS COMPACT'S MISSION TO ADVANCE HIGHER EDUCATION CIVIC AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, THE NC AFTERSCHOOL CORPS WILL ALSO HELP AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAMS AND THEIR COLLEGE PARTNERS IMPLEMENT DESIGN FOR CHANGE PROGRAMMING -- A FLEXIBLE, PROJECT-BASED, YOUTH DEVELOPMENT CURRICULUM THAT EMPOWERS YOUNG PEOPLE TO SOLVE LOCAL PROGRAMS THROUGH DESIGN-THINKING AND SERVICE. THE AFTERSCHOOL VOLUNTEERS, AND ESPECIALLY THE DESIGN FOR CHANGE MENTORS, WILL BE RECRUITED FROM LOCAL COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY STUDENTS.
THE NC AFTERSCHOOL CORPS IS A PROJECT OF NORTH CAROLINA CAMPUS COMPACT, WITH SUPPORT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FROM DESIGN FOR CHANGE USA AND THE NC CENTER FOR AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAMS (NC CAP).

HIGH POINT UNIVERSITY'S MISSION IS TO DELIVER EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES THAT ENLIGHTEN, CHALLENGE, AND PREPARE STUDENTS TO LEAD LIVES OF SIGNIFICANCE IN COMPLEX GLOBAL COMMUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES AND EDUCATION CNCS FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE FOOD SECURITY AND EDUCATIONAL ENGAGEMENT IN HIGH POINT, NC. THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 480 PEOPLE BY ENGAGING 410 NEW VOLUNTEERS IN IMPROVED VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PRACTICES. EIGHT VISTA MEMBERS, PLUS ONE VISTA LEADER, WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING TASKS, LIKE BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF THE FOOD CHAIN, FROM GARDEN FOOD PRODUCTION, TO INCREASED FARMERS MARKETS AND CO-OPS, TO IMPROVED FOOD EDUCATION AND COOKING SKILLS, AND ALSO BY CONNECTING STUDENTS AND FAMILIES TO WRAP-AROUND SERVICES, PROVIDING EXPANDED AFTER-SCHOOL EDUCATIONAL OPTIONS, AND DEVELOPING PATHWAYS TO COLLEGE FOR FIRST GENERATION STUDENTS. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
ROCKINGHAM COMMUNITY COLLEGE (RCC) IS A COMPREHENSIVE, OPEN-DOOR COMMUNITY COLLEGE LOCATED IN RURAL NORTH CENTRAL NORTH CAROLINA (WENTWORTH, POP. 2,804) BORDERING VIRGINIA AND THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. THE SERVICE POPULATION DRAWN PRIMARILY FROM ROCKINGHAM COUNTY HAS JUST OVER 92,000 RESIDENTS. THE COLLEGE OFFERS 22 DEGREE, 13 DIPLOMA, AND 38 CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS.  DURING FALL 2017, RCC ENROLLED 1,945 STUDENTS, AMONG THOSE 29% WERE MINORITY STUDENTS. 
     STUDENTS ENROLLING AT ROCKINGHAM COMMUNITY COLLEGE ARE PREDOMINATELY DISADVANTAGED:  FIRST-GENERATION COLLEGE (60%), LOW INCOME (85%), SINGLE PARENT (21%), MINORITY (29%) AND ACADEMICALLY UNDERPREPARED (87%). SIXTY TWO PERCENT OF OUR NEW STUDENTS IN THE FALL 2017 SEMESTER TOOK AT LEAST ONE DEVELOPMENTAL (REMEDIAL) COURSE. THEY COME FROM AN ECONOMICALLY DISTRESSED AREA.  DURING 2010, UNEMPLOYMENT SKYROCKETED (15%) AND, AT 5.4% IN DECEMBER 2016, REMAINS HIGHER THAN THE STATE AVERAGE OF 4.9%. HIGHER EDUCATION IS NOW CRITICAL FOR ECONOMIC GROWTH IN A COUNTY THAT HAS HISTORICALLY RELIED ON MANUFACTURING AND FARMING, AND IN WHICH ONLY 12.9% HELD A COLLEGE DEGREE (2009-2013).  
     AS THE ONLY COMMUNITY COLLEGE SERVING ROCKINGHAM COUNTY, NORTH CAROLINA, ROCKINGHAM COMMUNITY COLLEGE IS WELL-POSITIONED TO PROVIDE LEADERSHIP AND RESOURCES TO HEIGHTEN AWARENESS AND DIRECTLY INFLUENCE THE VERY EVIDENT NEEDS OF INCREASED ACCESS TO EDUCATION AS A MEANS OF IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ITS CITIZENS. WITH SIGNIFICANT NUMBERS OF POTENTIAL STUDENTS WHO ARE FIRST-GENERATION AND LOW-INCOME, ROCKINGHAM COUNTY'S POPULATION PRESENTS DIFFICULT ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL CHALLENGES. 
     ROCKINGHAM COMMUNITY COLLEGE IN PARTNERSHIP WITH AMERICORP VISTA WILL DEVELOP, THROUGH THE WORK OF VISTA MEMBERS, OPPORTUNITIES IN THE COUNTY'S LOCAL SCHOOLS, CHARTER SCHOOLS, AND HOME SCHOOLS TO ATTRACT POTENTIAL STUDENTS WHOSE LIVES CAN BE ENRICHED THROUGH EDUCATION, AND IN SO DOING, CAN ENABLE ECONOMICALLY DISTRESSED STUDENTS IN THE COUNTY TO GAIN INSIGHTS INTO THE VALUE AND IMPORTANCE OF EDUCATION, AND CAN PROVIDE CENTERS OF COMMUNITY INFLUENCE (SUCH AS FAMILIES, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS OF MANY TYPES, AND COMMUNITY LEADERS) TO IMPACT DECISIONS BY FUTURE STUDENTS TO STAY FOCUSED ON THE IMPORTANCE OF EDUCATION FOR A BRIGHTER, MORE PRODUCTIVE FUTURE.

THE CONSERVATION FUND IS A NATIONAL NONPROFIT ESTABLISHED IN 1985 TO PROTECT WORKING LANDS AND PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.  RESOURCEFUL COMMUNITIES (TCF/RC), A SPECIALIZED PROGRAM OF THE FUND, WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1991 TO SUPPORT A GRASSROOTS NETWORK THAT IMPLEMENTS THE "TRIPLE BOTTOM LINE" IN COMMUNITIES ACROSS NORTH CAROLINA.  WE WORK IN NATURAL RESOURCE-RICH AREAS, WHICH ARE HOME TO OUR MOST DISTRESSED COMMUNITIES; OUR TRIPLE BOTTOM LINE APPROACHES ADDRESS THE ROOT SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CAUSES OF ENVIRONMENTAL DEGRADATION.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN RURAL, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN THEIR WORK TO ALLEVIATE HUNGER AND INCREASE HEALTHY FOOD ACCESS.  WE EXPECT THE PROJECT TO BENEFIT 20+ COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS.  SIX VISTA MEMBERS (THREE PLACED AT OUR HOST SITE, AND THREE PLACED WITH THREE COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS) WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY:  DIRECTLY SUPPORTING THE CAPACITY OF ORGANIZATIONS TO GENERATE RESOURCES (FUNDING AND VOLUNTEERS) TO EXPAND COMMUNITY FOOD ACCESS EFFORTS; IMPLEMENTING AND/OR IMPROVING ORGANIZATIONAL SYSTEMS AND PRACTICES TO MORE EFFECTIVELY CARRY OUT HEALTHY FOOD ACCESS PROGRAMMING; AND EXPANDING AN ONLINE COMPILATION OF STRATEGIES, RESOURCES AND REPLICABLE MODELS (WITH EMPHASIS ON RURAL COMMUNITIES) THAT ORGANIZATIONS CAN IMPLEMENT TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD, AS WELL AS SUPPORTING COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN IMPLEMENTING THESE MODELS.

MEN?S SHELTER OF CHARLOTTE?S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE SAFE, EMERGENCY SHELTER WHILE WORKING TO END HOMELESSNESS FOR EACH MAN.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE EMPLOYMENT AND HOUSING OPPORTUNITIES FOR 400 MEN EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS.  FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS REVIEWING BEST PRACTICES FOR HOUSING AND EMPLOYMENT WORK, BUILDING AN INFRASTRUCTURE TO RECRUIT AND SUPPORT VOLUNTEERS FOR HOUSING AND EMPLOYMENT WORK, INCREASING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, HOSTING HOUSING AND EMPLOYMENT BLITZES, AND IMPROVING OUR DATA MEASUREMENT SYSTEMS OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT YEAR.

WITH THE HELP AND LEADERSHIP OF FOUR (4) VISTA MEMBERS, THE WAKE FOOD SECURITY ALLIANCE WILL DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE AND SUSTAINABLE PLAN TO ADDRESS HUNGER RELATED ISSUES AND FOOD INSECURITY VIA A CONSTRUCT TO BUILD HUMAN AND SOCIAL CAPACITY. WHILE A LACK OF RESOURCES IS DISPERSED THROUGHOUT OUR COUNTY, THERE ARE 2 GEOGRAPHIC COMMUNITIES THAT EXPERIENCE AMPLIFIED DISPARITIES: THE EASTERN ZONE AND EAST CENTRAL ZONE (SOUTH EAST RALEIGH). RESIDENTS AND OUR PARTNERS (CAPITAL AREA FOOD NETWORK, AND WAKE COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY SERVICES: PLANNING DEVELOPMENT, & INSPECTIONS) ARE POSTURED TO WORK WITH US TO PROMOTE FOOD EQUITY, SUSTAIN FOOD COOPERATIVES TO DIMINISH THE IMPACT OF FOOD DESERTS, DEVELOP A LONG RANGE PLAN FOR AN INTEGRATED FOOD SECURITY AND HEALTH INDEX - AS WELL AS EXPAND ACCESS TO SUMMER FOOD FOR YOUTH RESIDING IN THESE TARGETED COMMUNITIES. THE VISTA GRANT WILL NOT ONLY SUPPORT OUR IMMEDIATE EFFORTS, BUT WILL ESTABLISH AN ARCHETYPE OF BENCHMARKS TO SHARE AND EXPAND THE WORK OF DISMANTLING HUNGER IN WAKE. WE ARE EMBARKING ON THIS AS A 4 YEAR PROJECT TO ESTABLISH A STANDARD WITHIN OUR COMMUNITIES THAT CAN BE SUSTAINED INTERNALLY ONCE THE SERVICE PERIOD HAS MET ITS DURATION.

SAVE THE CHILDREN?S MISSION IS TO INSPIRE BREAKTHROUGHS IN THE WAY THE WORLD TREATS CHILDREN AND TO ACHIEVE IMMEDIATE AND LASTING CHANGE IN THEIR LIVES.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA OF CNCS.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD CAPACITY THROUGH COMMUNITY RESOURCE MAPPING THAT WILL LEAD TO COMMUNITY INITIATIVES TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN PARTICIPATING IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMMING THAT WILL LEAD TO SCHOOL READINESS. THIS WILL BE THE THIRD YEAR OF A THREE YEAR PROJECT. A MINIMUM OF 25 CHILDREN FROM BIRTH TO 5 YEARS OF AGE IN EACH OF THE ESTABLISHED COUNTIES SERVED WILL BENEFIT AND 10 PRESCHOOL AGE CHILDREN IN ONE NEW COUNTY SERVED WILL BENEFIT.  SIX VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RESOURCE MAPPING, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, ASSISTING TO CREATE AND INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE PLAY AND LEARN GROUPS, LEADING THE COMMUNITY AWARENESS CAMPAIGN FOR KINDERGARTEN READINESS, AND ENGAGING COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND FAMILIES IN SCHOOL READINESS OPPORTUNITIES.

KENTUCKY CAMPUS COMPACT (KYCC) IS PART OF A NATIONAL EFFORT TO ADVANCE THE PUBLIC PURPOSES OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES BY DEEPENING THEIR ABILITY TO IMPROVE COMMUNITY LIFE AND TO EDUCATE STUDENTS FOR CIVIC AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY.  KYCC UTILIZES COLLABORATION AND PARTNERSHIP TO ACHIEVE THREE GOALS: (1) COLLEGE ACCESS, (2) COLLEGE SUCCESS, AND (3) COMMUNITY IMPACT.  THE TOWARD A SUSTAINABLE KENTUCKY (TASK) VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE.
THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD HOPE AND MOMENTUM IN KENTUCKY COMMUNITIES, HELPING CITIZENS LIVING IN POVERTY TO IMPROVE THEIR LIVES.  THE PROGRAM WILL BENEFIT OVER 50,000 KENTUCKY STUDENTS, FAMILIES, AND INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE FACING CHALLENGES.  A COHORT OF TASK VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE SERVING IN EASTERN KENTUCKY,  PROVIDING HUMAN RESOURCES TO BUILD SUSTAINABILITY FOR A GRASSROOTS MOVEMENT CALLED SHAPING OUR APPALACHIAN REGION (SOAR) AND WILL INCLUDE THE NATION'S FIRST RURAL PROMISE ZONE.  
SIXTY-FIVE VISTA MEMBERS SUPPORTED BY TWO VISTA LEADERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS EDUCATIONAL CURRICULUM AND PROGRAMS, FINANCIAL LITERACY, JOB TRAINING AND PLACEMENT, AFFORDABLE HOUSING, ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD, AND ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE OVER THE COURSE OF THIS THREE-YEAR PROJECT.

AUDUBON AREA COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC.'S MISSION STATEMENT READS "HELPING PEOPLE, CHANGING LIVES, BUILDING COMMUNITIES".  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA WITH AN EMPHASIS ON OPIATE ADDICTION RECOVERY.  THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENHANCE THE SERVICE DELIVERY AND BUILD THE CAPACITY OF FIVE (5) ORGANIZATIONS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT A MINIMUM OF 500  INDIVIDUALS INCLUDING THE HOMELESS, THE UNEMPLOYED, LOW INCOME ADULTS, THOSE FORMERLY AND CURRENTLY INCARCERATED, AND OTHER LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES.  FOUR (4) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING RESOURCE DIRECTORIES, PREPARING PRESENTATIONS ON OPIATE USE AND ADDICTION, DEVELOPING LIFE SKILLS CLASSES, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND AWARENESS, AND PREPARING SUPPORTIVE INFORMATIONAL PACKETS FOR THE FAMILIES ON INCARCERATED ADULTS IN TREATMENT PROGRAMS.  VISTA MEMBERS WILL PERFORM DUTIES OVER THE COURSE OF 12 MONTHS.

LOUISVILLE CENTRAL COMMUNITY CENTERS, INC. (LCCC), LOCATED WITHIN WEST LOUISVILLE'S RUSSELL NEIGHBORHOOD, HAS A MISSION TO ADVANCE SELF-RELIANCE BY INCREASING COMPETENCE AND CONFIDENCE AMONG INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN RUSSELL AND THE LARGER COMMUNITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO STRENGTHEN RUSSELL AND SURROUNDING WEST LOUISVILLE NEIGHBORHOODS BY HELPING KEY ANCHOR, COMMUNITY INSTITUTIONS TO BE MORE EFFECTIVE IN ADDRESSING CRITICAL ISSUES THAT INHIBIT THE ECONOMIC MOBILITY OF LOW-INCOME FAMILY MEMBERS. THIS WOULD EXPECT TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 100 LOW-INCOME FAMILIES.  FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS  COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT, BACK-OFFICE ADMINISTRATION, PROMOTIONS AND MARKETING OF INITIATIVES, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, AND OTHER RELATED ACTIVITIES OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR, MAY 1, 2017 TO MAY 1, 2018.  WE SUPPORT THE DOMESTIC VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACT OF 1973, AS AMENDED; 2009 EDWARD M. KENNEDY SERVICE AMERICA ACT AND ALL VISTA REGULATIONS AND POLICIES, AND, WILL FULLY COMPLY WITH THE AFOREMENTIONED REGULATIONS AND POLICIES.

GLOBAL GAME CHANGERS CHILDREN'S EDUCATION INITIATIVE'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE ENRICHING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT EMPOWER ALL CHILDREN TO FIND THEIR INNER SUPERPOWER TO MAKE THE WORLD A BETTER PLACE AND BECOME ENGAGED CITIZENS, USING A SIMPLE EQUATION: MY TALENT + MY HEART = MY SUPERPOWER! THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA, IN PROVIDING AT-RISK AND HIGH-POVERTY STUDENTS WITH ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY IN-SCHOOL AND OUT-OF-SCHOOL TIME PROGRAMS THAT ENGAGE THEM IN LESSONS THAT SUPPORT THEIR DEVELOPMENT CONCURRENTLY WITH THEIR COMMUNITY'S DEVELOPMENT. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENHANCE SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS AND POWER SKILLS AS WELL AS GIVE STUDENTS THE KNOWLEDGE THAT THEY CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE AND HOW THEY CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE, TO INSTILL CONFIDENCE AND BUILD SOCIAL NETWORKS, AND IMPROVE ACADEMIC AND BEHAVIORAL OUTCOMES. WE EXPECT THE PROJECT TO DIRECTLY BENEFIT OVER 6500 STUDENTS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS, AND HOPE THAT THOSE BENEFITS WILL EXTEND TO THEIR FAMILIES, FRIENDS, AND COMMUNITIES. TWENTY-FOUR (24) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PROVIDING ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT AND OVERSIGHT TO SITES WHERE THE PROGRAM WILL BE TAKING PLACE, COORDINATING THE PROGRAM'S IMPLEMENTATION STAFF AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS, IMPLEMENTING AND SUPPORTING PROGRAM QUALITY AND OUTCOME ASSESSMENT TOOLS, SUPPORTING ONGOING PROGRAM EXPANSION, AND BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF EDUCATION PARTNERS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AS RELATES TO IN-SCHOOL AND OUT-OF-SCHOOL TIME. INDIVIDUAL VISTAS MAY ASSIST IN GRANTWRITING, FUNDRAISING, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, EVENT MANAGEMENT, WEBSITE DEVELOPMENT, GRAPHIC DESIGN, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS, AND PROGRAM OUTREACH TO VARIOUS COMMUNITY MEMBERS. THESE PROJECTS WILL TAKE PLACE OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO SUPPORT ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE CLOSELY ALIGNED WITH GLOBAL GAME CHANGERS IN INFORMING THE COMMUNITY REGARDING BARRIERS TO SUCCESS AND EMPOWERING YOUTH THROUGH OUT-OF-SCHOOL-TIME AND IN-SCHOOL NONACADEMIC PROGRAMS FOCUSING ON THE BARRIERS TO, AND THE SOFT SKILLS NEEDED FOR SUCCESS.

THE MISSION OF THE GEORGIA COUNCIL ON SUBSTANCE ABUSE IS TO INCREASE THE IMPACT OF RECOVERY IN GEORGIA'S COMMUNITIES THROUGH EDUCATION, ADVOCACY, AND TRAINING. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH AMERICORPS VISTA'S "INCREASE THE IMPACT OF NATIONAL SERVICE ON COMMUNITY NEEDS IN COMMUNITIES SERVED BY CNCS-SUPPORTED PROGRAMS" FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL WORK WITH NEW AND CURRENT GCSA PARTNERSHIPS TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A CURRICULUM FOR PROVIDING SCREENING, BRIEF INTERVENTION, REFERRAL TO TREATMENT (SBIRT); COORDINATE A RESPONSIVE PEER SUPPORT PROGRAM FOR HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS; CREATE AN OUTREACH CAMPAIGN THAT DISSEMINATES INFORMATION ABOUT FREE LOCAL RECOVERY EVENTS AND AN ONGOING PUBLIC DATABASE OF ALL-RECOVERY MEETINGS; COORDINATE A DONOR DATABASE; AND RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT EQUITABLE COMMUNITY BASED RECOVERY SUPPORTS. VISTA VOLUNTEERS WILL BE AN INTEGRAL PART OF EXPANDING SERVICES AND SUPPORTS IN WAYS THAT HAVEN'T BEEN POSSIBLE WITH PREVIOUS FUNDING AND CAPACITY. THIS YEAR OF VISTA SUPPORT WILL CREATE GUIDELINES AND INFORMATION THAT WILL SERVE AS A FOUNDATION FOR FUTURE OUTREACH AND INFORMATION DISSEMINATION.

THE MISSION OF THE UNITED WAY OF FORSYTH COUNTY IS TO IMPROVE LIVES IN OUR COMMUNITY BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER AND SPIRIT OF OUR CITIZENS.  WE ALSO PROVIDE DIRECT SUPPORTS TO OTHER PREVENTION AGENCIES SUCH AS THE FORSYTH COUNTY DRUG AWARENESS COUNCIL WHOSE MISSION IS TO EDUCATE, ADVOCATE, AND EMPOWER THE COMMUNITY TO PREVENT SUBSTANCE ABUSE ACROSS THE LIFESPAN IN FORSYTH COUNTY, GA, ALONG WITH PROVIDING SUPPORTS TO THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF LANIER THAT FALL INTO ALIGNMENT WITH SAMHSA WELLNESS MODEL OF PREVENTION.  OUR MISSIONS ALIGN WITH CNCS HEALTH FUTURES OPIOID ADDICTION RECOVERY PROGRAMMING PRIORITY FOR 2019 BY SERVING AS ORGANIZATIONS ENGAGED IN PREVENTION EFFORTS AND REDUCTION OF POVERTY BY INCREASING COMMUNITY RESOURCE AVAILABILITY.  

OUR COMBINED MISSIONS WITH THOSE WHOM WE SUPPORT BREAK STIGMAS FOR THOSE TOO AFRAID TO REACH OUT FOR RECOVERY, SUPPORT AND COLLABORATE WITH OTHER AGENCIES FOR PREVENTION AND RECOVERY AND POVERTY REDUCTION, AND ADVOCATES IN MULTIPLE ARENAS INCLUDING COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF SERVICES, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, AND EVIDENCED BASED STRATEGIES AND MEASUREMENTS FOR IMPROVEMENT OF LIVES.   

IN YEAR TWO, OUR INFORMATION & REFERRAL DATABASE SPECIALIST VISTA FROM FEBRUARY 2018 TO FEBRUARY 2019 VERIFIED AND UPDATED INFORMATION ON SERVICE PROVIDERS LISTED IN THE COMMUNITY HELPLIST CURRENTLY PUBLISHED BY UNITED WAY OF FORSYTH COUNTY INCREASING INFORMATION FOR SEVERAL SERVICES INCLUDING NEW PREVENTION AND RECOVERY SERVICES FOR THE COMMUNITY. 

IN YEAR THREE, WE ARE CONTINUING THE INFORMATION AND REFERRAL DATABASE SPECIALIST VISTA POSITION ALONG WITH THE ADDITIONAL UNITED WAY POSITIONS OF PROGRAM ENRICHMENT AND VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR VISTA FOR PROJECT NAME: BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF LANIER-FORSYTH COUNTY CHAPTER AND MARKETING AND PUBLIC RELATIONS SUPPORT VISTA.  PROJECT GOALS ARE OUTLINED IN IN THE NEEDS ASSESSMENT AREA.

DEKALB COUNTY BOARD OF HEALTH'S (DCBOH) MISSION IS TO PROTECT, PROMOTE, AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF THOSE WHO WORK, LIVE, AND PLAY IN DEKALB COUNTY, GEORGIA. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE OPPORTUNITY YOUTH FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO: (1) CONVENE A COUNTYWIDE, MULTI-SECTOR VIOLENCE PREVENTION CONSORTIUM; (2) CREATE CONNECTIONS AMONG LOCAL YOUTH VIOLENCE PROGRAMS; AND (3) ESTABLISH PARTNERSHIPS TO SUSTAIN INJURY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS.  AN ESTIMATED 150,000 PERSONS WHO ARE AT RISK FOR OR PERPETRATORS OF VIOLENCE WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROGRAM. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: (A) CONVENING A COUNTYWIDE, MULTI-SECTOR VIOLENCE PREVENTION CONSORTIUM (B) MONITORING LOCAL YOUTH VIOLENCE PREVENTION , AND (C) PROVIDING PROGRAMMING SUPPORT FOR OTHER INJURY PREVENTION EFFORTS INCLUDING TRAFFIC SAFETY, SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL HEALTH EFFORTS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

IAMBK?S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES THAT ENABLE DISADVANTAGED AND AT-RISK YOUTH AND FAMILIES TO BECOME SELF-SUPPORTIVE AND THRIVE IN THEIR HOMES, SCHOOLS, AND COMMUNITIES. THE ORGANIZATION WAS ESTABLISHED TO HELP PARTICIPANTS DEVELOP MORALS AND CHARACTER, SKILLS FOR THE WORKFORCE, INCREASE THEIR EDUCATION LEVELS, PROMOTE PHYSICAL HEALTH, AND DISCOVER AND NURTURE THEIR TALENTS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD CAPACITY OF THE IAMBK ORGANIZATION, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 60 LOW INCOME YOUTH IN THREE LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BUILDING A VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, EXPANDING, AND STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, RECRUITING ADDITIONAL PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS, CREATING A PLAN FOR SUSTAINABILITY, DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING NEW PROGRAMS, AND IMPLEMENTING A FISCAL MANAGEMENT SYSTEM TO TRACK FUNDING SOURCES AND CONTRIBUTIONS OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR. 

ALL VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE HOUSED AND SUPPORTED BY IAMBK AND WORK TO FORM PARTNERSHIPS IN THE THREE COMMUNITIES THAT IAMBK SERVES (AUBURN, TUSKEGEE, AND NOTASULGA). THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL WORK FROM THE AUBURN OFFICE, AND TWO VISTA WORKERS WILL WORK FROM THE TUSKEGEE OFFICE. THE THREE VISTA MEMBERS WORKING FROM THE AUBURN OFFICE WILL BE THE (1) GRANTS AND CONTRIBUTIONS COORDINATOR, (2) PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT COORDINATOR, AND (3) RECRUITMENT AND VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR. VISTA MEMBERS WORKING FROM THE TUSKEGEE OFFICE WILL BE THE (1) PUBLIC RELATIONS COORDINATOR, AND (2) RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT COORDINATOR.

JEFFERSON STATE COMMUNITY COLLEGE IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING ACCESSIBLE EDUCATIONAL AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS THROUGH WHICH STUDENTS MAY OBTAIN THE SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE NECESSARY TO PURSUE THEIR  LIFE'S WORK AND TO BECOME EDUCATED MEMBERS OF SOCIETY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BE A LEADER IN REMOVING BARRIERS TO COLLEGE ACCESS AND SUCCESS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT OVER 1,000 LOW INCOME HIGH SCHOOL AND CURRENT JEFFERSON STATE STUDENTS. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS BUILDING CAPACITY FOR COLLEGE ACCESS AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS THAT SUPPORT EDUCATIONAL ADVANCEMENT AND ACHIEVEMENT, OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS.

IN ADDITION TO THE PROPOSED STRENGTHENING STUDENT SUCCESS PROGRAM, JEFFERSON STATE REQUESTS TWO ADDITIONAL VISTA MEMBERS TO FOCUS ON REDUCING OPIOID ABUSE AND OVERDOSE FATALITIES IN JEFFERSON, SHELBY, ST. CLAIR AND CHILTON COUNTIES. THE NUMBER OF DEATHS DUE TO DRUG POISONING FROM PRESCRIPTION OPIOID/HEROIN USE CONTINUES TO GROW AT A STAGGERING RATE. IN ALABAMA, TO MANY PRESCRIBED MEDICATIONS USED TO TREAT PAIN END UP IN THE HANDS OF THOSE WHO ARE NOT THE INTENDED RECIPIENT, INCLUDING OUR YOUTH. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL LEAD THE OPIOID ABUSE AWARENESS AND PREVENTION PROGRAM FOCUSING ON TWO MAJOR TARGET AREAS. THE FIRST AREA IS THE TRANSITION FROM PILLS TO NEEDLES. THE MAJORITY OF ALL OPIOID ABUSE BEGINS WITH ADDICTION TO NARCOTICS PRESCRIBED BY PHYSICIANS. PARTNERSHIPS WITH STAKEHOLDER GROUPS WILL ALLOW FOR THE SHARING OF VALUABLE INFORMATION TO STUDENT ATHLETES ABOUT DANGERS OF IMPROPER USE OF MEDICATIONS. THE SECOND FOCUS OF THIS PROGRAM WILL BE ADDRESSING THE COLLECTION OF INTELLIGENCE TO ASSIST INVESTIGATORS WITH TARGETING AREAS WITH HIGH LEVELS OF OPIOID ABUSE.

WALLACE STATE COMMUNITY COLLEGE'S MISSION IS PROVIDING . . . LEARNING THAT TRANSFORMS LIVES. EDUCATION, WHETHER FOR A DEGREE-SEEKING STUDENT OR FOR SKILLS BUILDING IN THE COMMUNITY, HAS THE POWER TO MAKE THAT TRANSFORMATION POSSIBLE.  HIGHER EDUCATION IS ONLY POSSIBLE FOR LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WHEN THE MOST COMMON BARRIERS TO SUCCESS ARE REMOVED.  IN CULLMAN COUNTY THOSE BARRIERS INCLUDE POVERTY, FOOD INSECURITY, UNFAMILIARITY WITH THE SOFT SKILLS REQUIRED FOR EMPLOYMENT.  THIS PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS THREE OF THE FOUR VISTA PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND EDUCATION. THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO PARTNER WITH THE CNCS TO ELIMINATE AND ALLEVIATE POVERTY IN THE COLLEGE'S SERVICE AREA BY ADDRESSING STUDENT HUNGER WITH A FOODBANK AND COMMUNITY GARDEN, ASSISTING WITH FUNDRAISING EFFORTS TO PROVIDE NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, AND ASSISTING WITH PREPARING STUDENTS AND GRADUATES FOR EMPLOYMENT. SIX VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, WRITING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, CONDUCTING COMMUNITY RESEARCH, PLANNING EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, AND BUILDING PROGRAM CAPACITY OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT YEAR.

THE SHERIDAN HEALTH CENTER HOSTED ITS FIRST AMERICORPS VISTAS STARTING EARLY 2018.  THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR HAD BEEN IN A SUPERVISORY POSITION FOR VISTAS FROM 2008 UNTIL 2010 AT ANOTHER POSITION, AND WAS COMFORTABLE IN THE DEVELOPMENT, SUPERVISION, AND MANAGEMENT OF AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS. 

DUE TO THE SUCCESS OF THE FIRST TWO VISTAS AT THE SHERIDAN HEALTH CENTER, AND UNDERSTANDING THE VALUE VISTAS BRING TO NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS DEDICATED TO FIGHTING POVERTY IN OUR COMMUNITIES, WE WOULD GLADLY LIKE TO SUPPORT MORE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS IN THE REGION.

TO DO SO, WE WOULD LIKE TO DEDICATE OUR ASSISTANT DIRECTOR, AMY FLEENOR, TO SUPERVISE THE REGIONAL AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECTS FOR UP TO 20 HOURS PER WEEK. THIS PROGRAM WILL GIVE US THE SUPPORT TO HIRE A FULL-TIME CASE MANAGER TO WORK WITH OUR LOW-INCOME PATIENTS AND OTHER RESIDENTS IN NEED IN OUR COMMUNITY.

AS WE MAKE THE TRANSITION FROM A CHARITABLE CLINIC TO A FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTER, PUBLIC RELATIONS WILL BE NECESSARY TO HELP INFORM THE COMMUNITY ABOUT THE EXPANSION OF SERVICES AND INCREASED HOURS.   WE WOULD LIKE TO CONTINUE OUR PUBLIC RELATIONS POSITION TO HELP US THROUGH THIS TRANSITION.

THE MISSION OF THE LEAD ORGANIZATION, LARAMIE COUNTY COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP (LCCP) IS TO BETTER THE HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF ALL RESIDENTS SERVED. THE HEALTHIER LARAMIE COUNTY COALITION (HLC) MISSION IS COMPRISED OF HUMAN SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS, PRIVATE-SECTOR INDIVIDUALS, FAITH-BASED GROUPS, FUNDERS AND LOCAL AND STATE GOVERNMENT REPRESENTATIVES DEDICATED TO SERVING VULNERABLE RESIDENTS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY AS PART OF A COMPREHENSIVE PLANNING EFFORT. 
THE UNACCOMPANIED STUDENT'S INITIATIVE (USI) MISSION IS TO PROVIDE A SAFE, STABLE HOME FOR HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS, AGES 16-20, EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS. MY FRONT DOOR (MFD) IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND HOME OWNERSHIP OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW-INCOME, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. USI IS FOCUSED ON CHILDREN AND YOUTH EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS.

THE PRIORITY AREAS THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. THE PROJECT TIMELINE WILL BE COMPLETED IN THE REMAINING TWO YEAR TIMEFRAME.

ENCOURAGING FREEDOM OF EXPRESSION AND VALUING DIVERSITY, THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES EXCELLENT EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES FOR STUDENTS THROUGH EXTENSIVE PERSONAL CONTACT AMONG FACULTY, STAFF AND STUDENTS IN AND OUT OF THE CLASSROOM. THROUGH ACADEMIC PROGRAMS, RESEARCH, ARTISTIC EXPRESSION, PUBLIC SERVICE AND COMMUNITY-BASED LEARNING, THE UNIVERSITY SERVES AS AN EDUCATIONAL, CULTURAL AND ECONOMIC LEADER FOR THE REGION. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ANTI-POVERTY FOCUS AREA UTILIZING EDUCATION AND VETERANS PROGRAMMING AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE SERVED, PROVIDE NEW AND EXPANDED TYPES OF SERVICE, AND GENERATE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES AND ASSETS, SUCH AS FUNDING, VOLUNTEERS, IN-KIND SUPPORT AND PARTNERSHIPS. FOUR VISTAS EXPECT TO BENEFIT 769 LOW-INCOME VETERANS AND FAMILIES PER PROJECT YEAR. VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES OVER THE THREE YEARS OF THE PROJECT.

OUR MISSION IS TO PROVIDE FREE MEDICAL SERVICES TO LOW INCOME AND UNINSURED INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES, TO DECREASE THE CYCLE OF POVERTY AND SUFFERING CREATED BY POOR HEALTH.  OUR PROJECT ALIGNS WITH YOUR HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA.  OUR PROJECTS GOAL IS TO EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF 4 FREE CLINICS ACROSS THE STATE OF UTAH BY IMPROVING SYSTEMS IN THE AREAS OF FUND DEVELOPMENT, VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT AND PROGRAM PLANNING.  THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT 4 ORGANIZATIONS AND APPROXIMATELY 10,000 LOW INCOME, UNINSURED INDIVIDUALS. VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT VIA PERFORMING MARKETING AND OUTREACH, FUNDRAISING, GRANT WRITING, CAPACITY BUILDING, VOLUNTEER TRAINING (PER THEIR VAD).

THE MISSION OF THE IDAHO DEPT. OF CORRECTION IS TO PROTECT THE PUBLIC, OUR STAFF AND THOSE WITHIN OUR CUSTODY AND SUPERVISION THROUGH SAFETY, ACCOUNTABILITY, PARTNERSHIPS AND PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR OFFENDER CHANGE.  SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROGRAM TARGETS THE GOAL OF PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR OFFENDER CHANGE THROUGH THE USE OF A PROJECT LEAD AND 7 VISTA VOLUNTEERS WHO, AS PART OF IDOC'S FREE2SUCCEED PROGRAM, WILL WORK TO PLACE COMMUNITY MENTORS WITH OFFENDERS BY RECRUITMENT OF NEW MENTORS AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF PROCESSES FOR LINKING VOLUNTEERS TO BOTH VOLUNTEER AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES.  BY DOING SO, OUR VISTAS WILL WORK TO GIVE NEWLY RELEASED OFFENDERS THE TOOLS NECESSARY FOR A BETTER, HEALTHIER FUTURE BY BRINGING DOWN INSTITUTIONAL BARRIERS TO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.  IF SUCCESSFUL, THE VISTA VOLUNTEERS IN THIS PROGRAM WILL DIRECTLY CONTRIBUTE TO THE REDUCTION IN THE RECIDIVISM RATE OF PARTICIPATING OFFENDERS.

LC SERVICE CORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL SERVE LOW-INCOME STUDENTS WITH A FOOD PANTRY AND ADDITIONAL PROGRAMMING AND ADVISING TO HELP THEM UTILIZE COMMUNITY RESOURCES AND MAKE THE MOST OF THEIR FOOD BUDGETS.  ADDITIONALLY, THEY WILL ASSIST STUDENTS WITH ITEMS THAT MAY NOT BE INCLUDED IN ANY OTHER PUBLIC/PRIVATE FOOD ASSISTANCE THEY MAY BE RECEIVING, SUCH AS HYGIENE AND PAPER PRODUCTS AND BASIC KITCHEN TOOLS. THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL WORK WITH LCSC CAMPUS DEPARTMENTS AND PROGRAMS, INCLUDING SOCIAL WORK, TRIO, LCSC STUDENT CLUBS, SODEXO FOOD SERVICE, AND THE LCSC LEARNING GARDEN, TO COORDINATE EFFORTS TO COMBAT HUNGER AND POOR NUTRITION AMONG LCSC STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES.  THEY WILL ALSO COLLABORATE WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS, INCLUDING THE IDAHO FOOD BANK, COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP, AND BACKYARD HARVEST, TO BRING SERVICES TO CAMPUS AS WELL AS CONNECTING STUDENTS TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES.

LCSC WILL CONTINUE TO ENROLL LOW-INCOME AND FIRST-GENERATION STUDENTS, WHO OFTEN STRUGGLE TO MAINTAIN A HOME AND KEEP FOOD ON THE TABLE.  THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL HELP THEM ADDRESS SHORT-TERM EMERGENCY NEEDS AS WELL AS ENGAGE IN LONG-TERM PLANNING.  THEIR EFFORTS WILL AID IN STUDENT RETENTION AND GRADUATION RATES.  IN ADDITION, THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CREATE A SERVICE-LEARNING ETHIC OF STUDENTS HELPING STUDENTS, BY COORDINATING WITH CAMPUS CLUBS AND ORGANIZATIONS.  

THIS PROGRAM WILL FOCUS ON THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION, BY PROVIDING POST-HIGH SCHOOL SUPPORT THROUGH ADDRESSING THE ISSUE OF STUDENT FOOD INSECURITY, AND BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR SERVICE LEARNING THROUGH ENGAGING THE CAMPUS AND COMMUNITY IN ADDRESSING THE ISSUES OF POVERTY AND FOOD INSECURITY.  THE ANTI-POVERTY FOCUS IS HEALTHY FUTURES, BY CREATING AND RUNNING A CAMPUS FOOD PANTRY THAT PROVIDES HEALTHY, NUTRITIOUS FOODS TO STUDENTS IN NEED.

THE MISSION OF THE SALVATION ARMY IS: THE SALVATION ARMY, AN INTERNATIONAL MOVEMENT, IS AN EVANGELICAL PART OF THE UNIVERSAL CHRISTIAN CHURCH. ITS MESSAGE IS BASED ON THE BIBLE. ITS MINISTRY IS MOTIVATED BY THE LOVE OF GOD. ITS MISSION IS TO PREACH THE GOSPEL OF JESUS CHRIST AND TO MEET HUMAN NEEDS IN HIS NAME WITHOUT DISCRIMINATION.?   THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH ANTI-POVERTY THROUGH ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTHY FUTURES?.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE FUNDING FOR PROGRAMS, INCREASE VOLUNTEERS FOR PROGRAMS AND DEVELOP NEW PROGRAMS, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT OVER 30,000 PEOPLE WHO ARE LIVING IN POVERTY, HOMELESS AS WELL AS TEEN PARENTS.  FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CAPACITY BUILDING, VOLUNTEER COORDINATING, COMMUNITY ASSESSMENTS, FUND RAISING AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

KUPU'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER YOUTH TO SERVE THEIR COMMUNITIES THROUGH CHARACTER-BUILDING, SERVICE-LEARNING, AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP OPPORTUNITIES THAT ENCOURAGE INTEGRITY (PONO) WITH GOD (KE AKUA), SELF AND OTHERS.? THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY CNCS FOCUS AREAS. 

THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO BUILD LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY OF ANTI-POVERTY PROGRAMS IN COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE PACIFIC REGION. PROGRAM GOALS ARE TO (1) CREATE A WORKING NETWORK OF INDIVIDUALS ADDRESSING ISSUES OF RESILIENCE WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES, (2) BUILD CAPACITY WITHIN YOUNG LEADERS TO CREATE A CRITICAL MASS OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND SOCIAL STEWARDS, (3) PROVIDE A SPACE FOR COLLABORATION ON PROJECTS AND INITIATIVES THAT STRENGTHEN RELATIONSHIPS AND EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS TO EMERGE FROM POVERTY. THESE PROJECT GOALS WILL ASSIST VISTA MEMBERS AND COMMUNITIES IN ADDRESSING POVERTY-RELATED PROBLEMS BY SUPPORTING ACCESS TO SERVICES AND RESOURCES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPROVED ECONOMIC WELL-BEING AND FINANCIAL SECURITY OF ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE THROUGHOUT THE PACIFIC. 

THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO DIRECTLY BENEFIT SIX COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE PACIFIC REGION. SIX VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT SYSTEM OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS OF SERVICE. THE ANTI-POVERTY PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVES THAT THE VISTA MEMBERS DEVELOP WILL PERPETUATE POSITIVE CHANGE TO OTHERS WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES LEAD TO A MORE RESILIENT FUTURE FOR ALL.

MALAMA KAUAI'S VISTA PROJECT IS REQUESTING 8 VISTAS TO WORK WITHIN THE FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, ON PROJECTS AND PROGRAMS THAT INCREASE FOOD ACCESS AND SELF-RELIANCE, CREATE CAREER PATHWAYS, AND DEVELOP EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS ON THE ISLAND OF KAUA`I. 

THESE POSITIONS ARE PLACED WITHIN MALAMA KAUA`I AS WELL AS TWO SUB-SITE LOCATIONS KE KULA NI`IHAU O KEKAHA PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL AND KAWAIKINI NEW CENTURY PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL. THE POSITIONS INCLUDE:

- 2 YOUTH & FOOD PROGRAMS: THESE 2 VISTAS WILL SUPPORT SCHOOLS WITHIN THEIR SCHOOL COMPLEX AREA THROUGH CAPACITY BUILDING SUPPORT FOR FOOD AND GARDENING PROGRAMS AT SCHOOL AND AFTERSCHOOL SITES. DURING SCHOOL BREAKS, THEY ALSO SUPPORT OUR AG INTERNSHIP PROGRAM BY RECRUITING LOW-INCOME STUDENT PARTICIPANTS, AND MENTOR VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE EDUCATION TO THE PARTICIPANTS.

- 2 FARM-TO-SCHOOL: SUB-SITED AT 2 OF OUR NEEDIEST HAWAIIAN-FOCUSED PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS, THESE VISTAS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR HELPING TO CREATE AND LAUNCH CULTURALLY-RELEVANT SCHOOL FOOD AND GARDENING PROGRAMS WITH A FOCUS ON FUNDRAISING AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT.

- 1 VILLAGE HARVEST: WORKING WITH WITH KAUA`I MASTER GARDENERS, THE VILLAGE HARVEST VISTA WILL HELP TO TAKE THE PILOT GLEANING PROJECT AND EXPAND IT TO A FULL-TIME PROGRAM THROUGH RESOURCE AND SYSTEMS DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT. THIS PROGRAM DIVERTS AGRICULTURAL FOOD WASTE TO FOOD BANKS AND FEEDING PROGRAMS FOR THE NEEDY.

- 1 VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR: WITH THE INCREASED ACTIVITY, THERE IS AN IMMINENT NEED TO ORGANIZE, STREAMLINE, AND DEVELOP EFFECTIVE SYSTEMS FOR VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, MANAGEMENT, AND RECOGNITION IN SUPPORT OF ALL VISTAS, INCLUDING THOSE SUB-SITED AT OTHER LOCATIONS.

- 1 FUNDRAISING & DEVELOPMENT: THIS VISTA IS FOCUSED ON DEVELOPING PROGRAMS FOR EARNED INCOME GENERATION, AND DEVELOPING FUNDRAISERS THAT CAN BE CONTINUED BEYOND THEIR TERM.

- 1 GRANT WRITER: THIS VISTA IS FOCUSED ON DEVELOPING MORE STREAMLINED PROCESSES AND SYSTEMS FOR GRANT APPLICATIONS, MANAGEMENT, AND REPORTING, WHILE ACTIVELY PARTICIPATING IN THE GRANT WRITING CYCLE. THEY WILL ALSO SUPPORT SHARING BEST PRACTICES FOR GRANT WRITING WITH OTHER VISTAS.

THESE VISTAS WILL CONNECT SCHOOLS AND THE GREATER COMMUNITY TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE FOR SELF-SUFFICIENCY, LOCAL FOOD PRODUCTION AND ACCESS, AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOR KAUA`I, HAWAI`I RESIDENTS. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THESE PROGRAMS INCLUDE THE LOW INCOME COMMUNITY, CONSISTING OF STUDENTS, SCHOOLS, FAMILIES, AND THE GENERAL COMMUNITY ACROSS THE ISLAND.

THE PUBLIC HEALTH INSTITUTE'S (PHI) MISSION IS TO GENERATE AND PROMOTE RESEARCH, LEADERSHIP AND PARTNERSHIPS TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR STRONG PUBLIC HEALTH POLICY, PROGRAMS, SYSTEMS AND PRACTICES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT -- VISTA VOLUNTEERS WORKING IN COMMUNITIES TO REVERSE THE RAVAGES OF THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC -- ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTH FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA VOLUNTEERS WORKING IN COMMUNITIES TO REVERSE THE RAVAGES OF THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENHANCE CAPACITY AND BUILD SUSTAINABILITY INTO A STATEWIDE NETWORK OF OPIOID SAFETY COALITIONS SO THEY HAVE ENOUGH MOMENTUM AND INFRASTRUCTURE TO CONTINUE WORKING UNTIL THE OPIOID DEATH RATE SIGNIFICANTLY DROPS, AND UNTIL ALL CALIFORNIANS CAN ACCESS ADDICTION TREATMENT WITHIN 30-MINUTE DRIVE OF THEIR HOME. THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT INDIVIDUALS TOTAL WHO ARE MISUSING OPIOIDS, WHO HAVE CONSIDERED MISUSING OPIOIDS, WHO HAVE ASSISTED OTHERS IMPROPERLY OBTAIN OPIOIDS, WHO ARE FAMILY MEMBERS OF THOSE USING OPIOIDS, OR WHO ARE EDUCATING OTHERS ABOUT THE DANGERS OF IMPROPER OPIOID USE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE TO CONDUCT COMMUNITY ASSESSMENTS, FOSTER COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT, AND EXPAND AND STRENGTHEN PARTNERSHIPS. UP TO FORTY (40) VISTA MEMBERS AND TWO (2) VISTA LEADERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CONDUCTING AN ENVIRONMENTAL SCAN OF COMMUNITY CONTEXT AND NEED; EXPANDING COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE AND SUPPORT OF THE PROGRAM EFFORT; STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS AND EXPANDING NETWORKS; DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING A DIVERSIFIED FUNDING STREAM; IMPROVING MATERIALS THAT SUPPORT PROGRAMMING; CONDUCTING OUTREACH FOR PARTICIPANT RECRUITMENT; ASSESSING RESULTS OF PROGRAM OFFERINGS; IMPROVING OR EXPANDING PROGRAM DELIVERY; UTILIZING TECHNOLOGY TO DEVELOP SYSTEMS FOR ORGANIZATIONAL EFFECTIVENESS; AND EXPANDING THE POOL OF VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST WITH SERVICE DELIVERY, OVER THE COURSE OF THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT. BY THE CLOSE OF THE THREE-YEAR EFFORT, PHI ANTICIPATES THAT 2,200 STAFF AND COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND 80 ORGANIZATIONS WILL RECEIVE CAPACITY BUILDING SERVICE AS A RESULT OF THE WORK OF THE VISTA MEMBERS.

SAN BERNARDINO COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISTRICT'S (SBCCD'S) VISTA COMMUNITY-COLLEGE-DEVELOPMENT (VISTA CCD) MISSION IS TO ADDRESS POVERTY IN THE SAN BERNARDINO VALLEY THROUGH WORKFORCE READINESS TRAINING. THE VISTA CCD PROGRAM ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.  THE PROGRAM WILL BUILD CAPACITY THROUGH SCALE/REACH, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 800 LOW-INCOME JOBSEEKERS.  TWELVE (12) VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE (1) LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING A MEDIA PLAN, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, COLLABORATING WITH COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS (CBOS), AND PARTICIPANT OUTREACH.  VISTA CCD WILL LAUNCH FOR ONE (1) YEAR, WITH PLANS TO EXPAND AND IMPROVE FOR TWO (2) CONSECUTIVE YEARS.

THE CENTER FOR EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES (CEO) IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING IMMEDIATE, EFFECTIVE, AND COMPREHENSIVE EMPLOYMENT SERVICES TO MEN AND WOMEN WITH RECENT CRIMINAL CONVICTIONS. OUR HIGHLY STRUCTURED AND TIGHTLY SUPERVISED PROGRAMS HELP PARTICIPANTS REGAIN THE SKILLS AND CONFIDENCE NEEDED FOR SUCCESSFUL TRANSITIONS TO STABLE, PRODUCTIVE LIVES. CEO'S VISION IS THAT ANYONE WITH A RECENT CRIMINAL HISTORY WHO WANTS TO WORK HAS THE PREPARATION AND SUPPORT NEEDED TO FIND A JOB AND TO STAY CONNECTED TO THE LABOR FORCE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO LEVERAGE CASH AND IN-KIND DONATIONS, CULTIVATE NEW COMMUNITY PARTNERS, AND ASSIST WITH PROGRAM IMPROVEMENT EFFORTS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF CEO'S FIVE CALIFORNIA SITES, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT MORE THAN 1,800 FORMERLY INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS GRANT PROPOSAL RESEARCH AND WRITING, DEVELOPING NEW PROGRAM PARTNERSHIPS, AND CONDUCTING RESEARCH FOR PROGRAM INNOVATION AND IMPROVEMENT OVER THE COURSE OF A ONE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD.

INSIGHT GARDEN PROGRAM'S (IGP) MISSION IS TO TRANSFORM PRISONERS' LIVES THROUGH CONNECTION TO NATURE AND ROOT & REBOUND'S (R&R) MISSION IS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO JUSTICE AND OPPORTUNITY FOR PEOPLE IN REENTRY FROM PRISON AND JAIL AND TO EDUCATE AND EMPOWER THOSE WHO SUPPORT THEM, FUNDAMENTALLY ADVANCING AND STRENGTHENING THE REENTRY INFRASTRUCTURE ACROSS THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE GOALS OF THIS VISTA PROJECT ARE TO INCREASE THE FINANCIAL RESOURCES, COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT, EXPAND/STRENGTHEN PARTNERSHIPS AND NETWORKS FOR BOTH ORGANIZATIONS, AND WILL BENEFIT UP TO 20,000 PEOPLE INCARCERATED AND IN REENTRY. FIVE (5) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING REVENUE TRACKING SYSTEMS, DEVELOPING COMMUNICATIONS MATERIALS TO SPREAD AWARENESS OF OUR SERVICES, AND BUILDING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS ACROSS CALIFORNIA OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE PARTNERSHIP FOR LOS ANGELES' SCHOOLS MISSION IS TO TRANSFORM SCHOOLS AND REVOLUTIONIZE SCHOOL SYSTEMS TO EMPOWER ALL STUDENTS WITH A HIGH-QUALITY EDUCATION. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT IS A NATURAL OUTGROWTH OF THE PARTNERSHIP'S CAPACITY-BUILDING AND ADVOCACY WORK FOR EQUITABLE EDUCATION IN LOS ANGELES, AND ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA, AND AMERICORPS VISTA'S PRIORITY OBJECTIVES OF "SCHOOL READINESS FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED YOUNG CHILDREN" AND "K-12 SUCCESS IN STUDENT EDUCATIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL OUTCOMES IN LOW-ACHIEVING SCHOOLS". THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF SCHOOLS AND FAMILIES TO SERVE STUDENTS DURING SCHOOL TRANSITIONS AND IN BUILDING COLLEGE-GOING CULTURE IN ORDER TO BENEFIT THE THOUSANDS OF STUDENTS IN 18 PARTNERSHIP NETWORK SCHOOLS, AS WELL AS OTHER STUDENTS AND FAMILIES LIVING IN HIGH-NEED LOS ANGELES COMMUNITIES. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COLLECTING DATA ON COLLEGE-GOING BELIEFS, CODIFYING BEST PRACTICES, STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN SCHOOLS, AND PROVIDING STRATEGIC AND TACTICAL SUPPORT FOR SCHOOL SITE PROGRAMMING.

THE MISSION OF THE MAYOR'S OFFICE IS TO REINVENT STOCKTON INTO A COMMUNITY OF OPPORTUNITY FOR EVERY STOCKTONIAN BY FOCUSING COLLECTIVE IMPACT STRATEGIES ON REDUCING VIOLENT CRIME, INCREASING ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, AND IMPROVING QUALITY OF LIFE. FOR THE VISTA PROJECT, THE MAYOR'S OFFICE AIMS TO SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCE THE OPPORTUNITY AND JOB SKILLS GAPS THAT CONTINUE TO HINDER STOCKTON'S ECONOMIC GROWTH AND POTENTIAL. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION CNCS PRIORITY AREAS, GIVING STOCKTON'S MOST ENVIRONMENTALLY AND SOCIO-ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED RESIDENTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO SUCCEED. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ESTABLISH INFORMATION GATHERING AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS THAT WILL ALLOW THE CITY TO TAILOR ITS WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM, AS WELL AS CULTIVATE TRANSFORMATIVE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE INVESTMENTS, TO THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND STRATEGICALLY DEPLOY SAID INVESTMENTS, TRAININGS, AND PROGRAM OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE CITY. THE MAYOR'S OFFICE AIMS TO ASSIST THOUSANDS OF LOW-INCOME, MINORITY RESIDENTS OF WHICH MANY ARE VETERANS, DISABLED, FORMERLY INCARCERATED OR FOREIGN-BORN INDIVIDUALS. FIVE VISTA VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT THROUGH COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT, AWARENESS, AND ENGAGEMENT, AS WELL AS OUTREACH, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT, AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
SKID ROW HOUSING TRUST (THE TRUST) IS A LOS ANGELES-BASED NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION WITH A MISSION TO DEVELOP AND OPERATE PERMANENT SUPPORTIVE HOUSING SO THAT PEOPLE WHO HAVE EXPERIENCED HOMELESSNESS, PROLONGED EXTREME POVERTY, POOR HEALTH, DISABILITIES, MENTAL ILLNESS AND/OR ADDICTION CAN LEAD SAFE, STABLE LIVES IN WELLNESS. THE PROPOSED VISTA CONTINUATION PROJECT ALIGNS WITH CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE?S ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO LEVERAGE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES, GROW THE SCALE & REACH OF THE TRUST?S ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMMING, AND INCREASE THE TRUST?S EFFECTIVENESS IN HELPING ITS FORMERLY HOMELESS RESIDENTS THRIVE. THE TRUST EXPECTS THIS PROJECT TO BENEFIT 500 OR MORE INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE EXPERIENCED HOMELESSNESS. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING & MANAGING VOLUNTEERS, DEVELOPING & MANAGING A COMPUTER LITERACY CURRICULUM AND TECHNOLOGY AMBASSADOR PROGRAM, AND DEVELOPING OPPORTUNITIES FOR WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND SUPPORTED EMPLOYMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

IT IS THE MISSION OF THE RICHMOND PROMISE TO PROMOTE SOCIAL AND EDUCATIONAL EQUITY BY REMOVING BARRIERS AND CREATING PATHWAYS TO BUILD A COLLEGE GRADUATING CULTURE WHERE EVERY RICHMOND STUDENT EXCELS FROM HIGH SCHOOL TO HIGHER EDUCATION, ATTAINS A POSTSECONDARY DEGREE OR CERTIFICATION, THRIVES IN THE FIELD OF THEIR CHOICE, AND BECOMES A LEADER OF POSITIVE CHANGE IN THEIR COMMUNITY AND THE WORLD. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE WEST CONTRA COSTA PUBLIC EDUCATION FUND (ED FUND), THE PROPOSED PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE K-12 AND COMMUNITY COLLEGE EDUCATION PRIORITY AREA AND SEEKS TO STRENGTHEN REGIONAL PARTNERSHIPS TO BUILD AND ENHANCE PATHWAYS TO SUPPORT A SUCCESSFUL HIGH SCHOOL TO COLLEGE TRANSITION, AND POST-SECONDARY DEGREE ATTAINMENT TO BENEFIT OVER 800 STUDENTS FROM RICHMOND, CA, THE MAJORITY OF WHOM ARE LOW INCOME AND THE FIRST IN THEIR FAMILY TO ATTEND COLLEGE. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SUPPORTING EFFECTIVE OUTREACH AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, ENHANCING PROGRAMS, BUILDING A STUDENT DATABASE, AND STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS TO INSTITUTIONALIZE AND SUSTAIN SUPPORTS. THE SHORT-TERM GOALS OF THIS PROJECT MAY BE ACHIEVED WITHIN 1-YEAR, BUT WE HOPE TO SUSTAIN THE PROJECT FOR 3-YEARS.

THE MISSION OF THE MAYOR ERIC GARCETTI'S OFFICE OF IMMIGRANT AFFAIRS (MOIA) IS TO CREATE PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVES TO SUPPORT IMMIGRANT INTEGRATION IN THE CITY OF LOS ANGELES THROUGH THE COORDINATION OF CITY SERVICES, OUTREACH, AND LEGISLATIVE ADVOCACY.  THE PROPOSED AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITHIN THE CNCS SERVICE AREAS SPECIFIC TO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY BECAUSE MOIA WOULD FOCUS ON ENGAGING AND SERVING POPULATIONS THAT HAVE OFTEN BEEN UNDERREPRESENTED IN THESE TYPE OF EFFORTS, INCLUDING IMMIGRANT AND REFUGEE COMMUNITIES. MOIA'S PROGRAM WOULD TEACH IMMIGRANT COMMUNITIES THE BENEFITS OF FINANCIAL LITERACY AND GAINING CITIZENSHIP AS A TOOL TO COMBAT POVERTY FOR LOW-INCOME OR AT-RISK ADULTS, YOUTH, AND FAMILIES. IN ADDITION, MOIA'S PROGRAM WOULD ALLEVIATE LOW-INCOME LAWFUL PERMANENT RESIDENTS (LPR)S FROM SOME OF THE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH PREPARING FOR THE CITIZENSHIP EXAM, BY PROVIDING THEM WITH CITIZENSHIP CLASSES AT NO-COST, LEGAL SUPPORT, AND FINANCIAL RESOURCES AND INFORMATION TO PAY FOR THE APPLICATION AND BIOMETRICS FEES. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INTEGRATE IMMIGRANT COMMUNITIES BY HELPING MOIA EXPAND THE PROVISION AND EFFECTIVENESS OF THE IMMIGRATION SERVICES WITHIN THE CITY OF LOS ANGELES. MOIA, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL SERVICE PROVIDERS AND COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS, AIMS TO ASSIST 100,000 LPRS TO NAVIGATE AND SUBMIT THEIR CITIZENSHIP APPLICATION FORMS. THREE (3) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BUILDING MOIA'S CAPACITY IN OUR COMMUNICATIONS STRATEGY, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND OUTREACH EFFORTS AMONG IMMIGRANT COMMUNITIES OVER THE COURSE OF THE ONE-YEAR PERIOD.

THE MISSION OF THE SOUTH LOS ANGELES TRANSIT EMPOWERMENT ZONE (SLATE-Z/SOUTH LA PROMISE ZONE), A COLLECTIVE IMPACT PARTNERSHIP LED BY LOS ANGELES TRADE TECHNICAL COLLEGE, IS TO REVITALIZE SOUTH LOS ANGELES BY MOVING RESIDENTS TO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE'S FOCUS AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO: 1) MOVE 10,000 SLATE-Z RESIDENTS INTO LIVING WAGE JOBS; 2) INCREASE ECONOMIC ACTIVITY BY INVESTING IN BUSINESSES, ENTREPRENEURS, AND COMMUNITY-ORIENTED INFRASTRUCTURE; 3) INCREASE STUDENT ATTAINMENT OF CERTIFICATES, DEGREES, AND PREPARATION FOR LIVING WAGE CAREERS BY GUARANTEEING POST-SECONDARY CAREER PATHWAY ENROLLMENT AND SUPPORT; 4) REDUCE VIOLENT CRIME THROUGH PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, RE-ENTRY, AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT; AND 5) IMPROVE COMMUNITY INFRASTRUCTURE BY INCREASING THE SAFETY, AFFORDABILITY, AND USE OF PUBLIC TRANSIT. THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT AN ESTIMATED 10,000 LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS OF THE SLATE-Z AREA OVER 10 YEARS, SPECIFICALLY THE 46% OF RESIDENTS WHO LIVE BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LINE, 45% OF RESIDENTS WHO EXPERIENCE WORKING POVERTY (150% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LINE), AND 53% OF YOUTH WHO EXPERIENCE POVERTY. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS BASED AT LOS ANGELES TRADE TECHNICAL COLLEGE WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF SLATE-Z BY SUPPORTING THE INITIATIVES OF THE FIVE ISSUE-BASED WORK GROUPS (JOBS, ECONOMIC ACTIVITY, EDUCATION, PUBLIC SAFETY, AND TRANSIT) OVER THE COURSE OF 10 YEARS. THIS APPLICATION IS FOR THE INITIAL THREE YEARS OF THE 10 YEAR SLATE-Z VISTA PROGRAM.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
THE CITY OF SALINAS' MISSION IS TO CREATE A SAFE, HEALTHY, PROSPEROUS, VIBRANT, AND EQUITABLE SALINAS. THE VISTA PROJECT THAT WE PROPOSE INCLUDES A MULTIFACETED STRATEGY TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY IN SALINAS' ALISAL NEIGHBORHOOD BY FOCUSING ON THE CNCS PRIORITY FOCUS AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, AND HEALTHY FUTURES. THIS COMPREHENSIVE PROPOSAL ALIGNS WITH CITY OF SALINAS' COMMUNITY-DRIVEN PLANS, THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ELEMENT (EDE) AND THE ALISAL VIBRANCY PLAN (AVP). THE EDE ACTS AS A STRATEGIC PLANNING DOCUMENT TARGETING LONG DISREGARDED ECONOMIC DISPARITIES IN THE CITY, AND WAS FIRST ACCEPTED IN 2014, PRIOR TO FORMAL ADOPTION AS PART OF THE GENERAL PLAN IN 2017 FOLLOWING CEQA REVIEW. AS PART OF THE EDE PROCESS, THE COMMUNITY REQUESTED MORE ATTENTION AND INVESTMENT FOR SALINAS? HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED EAST SIDE, ALSO KNOWN AS THE ALISAL. THE CITY STARTED THE ALISAL ENGAGEMENT SUPPORT TEAM VISTA PROGRAM TO IMPLEMENT ACTIONS FROM THE EDE AND SUPPORT THE CREATION OF A COMMUNITY PLAN FOR THE ALISAL. VISTA MEMBERS CONDUCTED OUTREACH, RECRUITED VOLUNTEERS, AND SUPPORTED RESIDENT-LED WORKING GROUPS THAT CREATED OVER 150 STRATEGIES FOR THE AVP. AS THE CITY PREPARES TO ACCEPT THE AVP THIS SUMMER, YEAR THREE VISTAS WILL WORK ON NEW OR ONGOING PROJECTS IMPLEMENTING THIS PLAN AND THE EDE. 
THE VISTA ALISAL ENGAGEMENT SUPPORT TEAM HAS TWO PRIMARY GOALS; TO ADDRESS POVERTY AND POVERTY RELATED ISSUES AND TO BUILD RESIDENT CAPACITY.  POVERTY RELATED ISSUES INCLUDE OVERCROWDED AND UNAFFORDABLE HOUSING, LOWER WAGES/INCOME LEVELS, LOWER EDUCATION ACHIEVEMENT, AND LIMITED ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE SERVICES, HEALTHY FOOD, AND RECREATIONAL AMENITIES. VISTAS BUILD RESIDENT CAPACITY TO PARTICIPATE IN PLANNING PROCESSES, IMPLEMENT EDE AND AVP ACTIONS AT THE NEIGHBORHOOD LEVEL, AND LAY THE FOUNDATION FOR FUTURE COLLECTIVE ACTION TO TRANSFORM THE ALISAL.

THE VISTA ALISAL ENGAGEMENT SUPPORT TEAM CONSISTS OF FIVE VISTA POSITIONS: EDUCATION VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR, LITERACY VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR, HOUSING RESOURCES, HEALTHY FUTURES AND SMALL BUSINESS SUPPORT.  EDUCATION AND LITERACY VISTA MEMBERS ARE BASED OUT OF THE LIBRARY AND COMMUNITY SERVICES DEPARTMENT (LCS). THE HOUSING RESOURCES AND SMALL BUSINESS SUPPORT VISTA WORK OUT OF THE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT (CD). THE HEALTHY FUTURES VISTA SPLITS TIME BETWEEN LCS AND CD.  PROGRAM OBJECTIVES INCLUDE INCREASING THE VOLUNTEER CAPACITY OF THE LIBRARY?S TUTORING AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS; SUPPORTING IMPLEMENTATION OF CITY HOUSING INITIATIVES AND POLICY DEVELOPMENT AND CONNECTING LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITH HOUSING RESOURCES; WORKING WITH NEIGHBORHOOD BUSINESSES AND ENTREPRENEURS TO FACILITATE GROWTH AND MORE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH INCREASED ACCESS TO CAPITAL; AND STRENGTHENING A HEALTH-SPEAKER CURRICULUM IN LIBRARIES AND RECREATION CENTERS CENTERS. FOR YEAR THREE OF THE PROGRAM WE ARE AGAIN REQUESTING FIVE VISTAS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROGRAM. INDIVIDUAL PROJECTS ARE DESIGNED FOR VISTAS TO COMPLETE WITHIN A ONE-YEAR SERVICE TERM. VISTAS WILL WORK WITH LOW-INCOME TARGET POPULATIONS TO GUIDE THE PROGRAM AND IMPLEMENT EDE AND AVP PROJECTS THAT CAN EXTEND THE ALISAL ENGAGEMENT SUPPORT TEAM?S WORK FOR MULTIPLE YEARS. 

IN THE FIRST YEAR OF THE CITY'S PROGRAM, VISTA MEMBERS BUILT CAPACITY BY CREATING THE FIRST CITY-WIDE SET OF POLICIES AND STANDARDS FOR VOLUNTEERS, EXPANDING A HEALTHY FAMILIES-SPEAKER SERIES TO EDUCATE RESIDENTS, AND HELPED ORGANIZE THE CITY'S FIRST ALL DAY WORKSHOP IN SPANISH SPECIFICALLY FOR LATINO ENTREPRENEURS. SECOND-YEAR MEMBERS BUILT OFF THEIR SUCCESS BY DEVELOPING NEW TRAININGS FOR HOMEWORK CENTER VOLUNTEERS AND A ONE-STOP HUB FOR VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, CREATING OUTREACH MATERIAL FOR A NEW HOMELESS SHELTER/SUPPORTIVE HOUSING PROJECT, AND FORMING A WORKING GROUP OF AGENCIES AND NGOS TO IMPLEMENT THE FARM WORKER HOUSING ACTION PLAN.

THE MISSION OF OUTSIDE THE LENS IS TO EMPOWER YOUTH TO USE DIGITAL MEDIA TO CREATE CHANGE WITHIN THEMSELVES, THEIR COMMUNITY, AND THEIR WORLD. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ADD FIFTEEN PROFESSIONAL MENTORS TO OUR ADVISORY BOARD, DEVELOP MEDIA EDUCATION TRAINING FOR EDUCATORS, AND DEVELOP NEW OUTSIDE PARTNERSHIPS TO SUSTAIN THE PROGRAM IN THE LONG TERM, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 75 STUDENTS DIRECTLY AND 1,500 STUDENTS INDIRECTLY (THROUGH TEACHER TRAININGS, ETC). THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING MEDIA EDUCATION CURRICULUM TO TEACHERS, VOLUNTEERS, AND STUDENTS; COORDINATING THE EXPANSION OF OUR ADVISORY BOARD; MEETING WITH COMMUNITY LEADERS; AND REFINING METHODS OF PROGRAM EVALUATION OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY AND ATTAINMENT REMAIN AMONG THE MOST IMPORTANT CHALLENGES FACING HIGH-DENSITY, LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES. AWARE OF THE ROLE INADEQUATE AND LIMITED EDUCATION PLAYS IN PERPETUATING POVERTY, UCLA'S BRUINCORPS VISTA PROJECT HAS PARTNERED WITH TARGETED COMMUNITIES FOR MORE THAN A DOZEN YEARS TO ADDRESS THIS ENDEMIC ISSUE. SINCE OCTOBER 2000, BRUINCORPS HAS ESTABLISHED MIDDLE SCHOOL AND HIGH SCHOOL COLLEGE PREPAREDNESS CENTERS IN EAST, SOUTH, AND CENTRAL LOS ANGELES, AS WELL AS IN SAN DIEGO, SAN BERNARDINO, AND THE IMPERIAL VALLEY. WORKING WITH SCHOOL ADMINISTRATORS, PARENTS, AND HUNDREDS OF CITIZEN VOLUNTEERS, VISTA MEMBERS STRESS THE VALUE OF HIGHER EDUCATION AS THEY DEBUNK THE MISCONCEPTION OF ITS IMPERMEABILITY TO LOW-INCOME FAMILIES. THE UCLA VISTA PROGRAM WORKS TO COMMUNICATE THAT COMMUNITY, STATE, AND PRIVATE COLLEGE PATHWAYS ARE ACCESSIBLE TO ALL STUDENTS, REGARDLESS OF BACKGROUND, GIVEN THE APPROPRIATE ACADEMIC PREPARATION, UNDERSTANDING OF COLLEGE FINANCING, AND AWARENESS OF ENTRANCE REQUIREMENTS. THE PROJECT HAS ACCOMPLISHED MAJOR INROADS TOWARD CULTIVATING EXPECTATIONS OF COLLEGE SUCCESS AND CAREER OPTIONS THROUGH WORKSHOPS, INDIVIDUAL ATTENTION, AND RESOURCE FACILITIES MEANT TO ADVANCE A COLLEGE-GOING CULTURE. THE PROGRAM PLACES AN EMPHASIS ON ITS WORK IN MIDDLE SCHOOLS, A POINT AT WHICH STUDENTS BEGIN THE CRITICAL YEARS SHAPING THEIR FUTURE ACADEMIC DIRECTION. ADDITIONALLY, HIGH SCHOOLS THAT DO NOT HAVE EXISTING COLLEGE CENTERS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS ARE HIGH PRIORITY TARGETS FOR THE UCLA VISTA PROGRAM. 

THE PROGRAM CONTINUES TO DEVELOP NEW PARTNERSHIPS TO EXPAND THE POSITIVE IMPACT WITHIN COMMUNITIES BECAUSE THE DEMAND FROM THE COMMUNITY CONTINUES TO GROW. THIS YEAR WE ARE PARTNERING WITH GEAR UP TO EXPAND INTO TWO NEW SCHOOLS IN THE LOS ANGELES DOWNTOWN AREA. WE WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH OUR CURRENT COST SHARE PARTNER, THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, SAN DIEGO (UCSD) EARLY ACADEMIC OUTREACH PROGRAM AND THE UCSD CENTER FOR STUDENT INVOLVEMENT; COMBINED, THEY HOUSE FOUR COST-SHARE MEMBERS. ADDITIONAL COST-SHARE PARTNERS INCLUDE NEW VISION CHARTER MIDDLE SCHOOL IN SAN BERNARDINO, AND THE SOCIAL JUSTICE LEARNING INSTITUTE IN INGLEWOOD.  AS WE MOVE FORWARD, THE PROJECT'S DESIGN AND GOALS -- INCREASED COLLEGE AWARENESS AND COMPETITIVENESS FOR COLLEGE ADMISSION -- WILL REMAIN CONSISTENT.  AS SUCH, OUR EMPHASIS ON DEVELOPING SUSTAINABLE COLLEGE CENTERS, A COLLEGE-GOING CULTURE IN SCHOOLS, AN ACTIVE VOLUNTEER BASE, AND RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT WILL CONTINUE TO CENTER OUR WORK.

BLUE SKY CENTER'S MISSION IS TO STRENGTHEN THE RURAL COMMUNITIES IN THE CUYAMA VALLEY BY SUPPORTING ENTREPRENEURS AND BUILDING OUR REGIONAL CREATIVE AND ECONOMIC RESOURCES.
 THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. IN THE THIRD YEAR, THE VISTA PROJECT WILL CONTINUE TO EXPAND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES IN THE COMMUNITY BY DEVELOPING A COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT OF NEEDS AND OPPORTUNITIES, IDENTIFYING AND SUPPORTING INVESTMENT INTO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH THE BLUE SKY CENTER AND ITS PARTNERS IN THE FORM OF IMPACT INVESTMENT, GRANTMAKING, MICROENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT, JOB-TRAINING AND RESKILLING. VISTAS WILL CONTINUE TO WORK TOWARDS IMPROVED AND NEW HOUSING STOCK AND DEVELOPING A LOCAL FOOD SYSTEM FEATURING FOOD ENTREPRENEURSHIP OPPORTUNITIES, MEANS OF LOCAL, SMALL-SCALE PRODUCTION, AND NUTRITION LITERACY. OUR PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 1,000 COMMUNITY MEMBERS. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROJECT GOALS BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DESIGNING, IMPLEMENTING, AND MONITORING A COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT, DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING DIVERSIFIED FUNDING AND INVESTMENT SOURCES, DEVELOPING AND STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATION ACROSS ALL SECTORS, ESTABLISHING EFFICIENT ORGANIZATIONAL PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES, QUANTIFYING AND REPORTING IMPACT AND SCALABLE MODELS, BUILDING AND INCREASING CIVIC EDUCATION AND ENGAGEMENT OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS, AND INCREASING THE CAPACITY FOR BLUE SKY TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ENTREPRENEURS AND BUSINESS ENTERPRISES IN THE COMMUNITY.
IN YEAR THREE, TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO BUILD UPON THE COMMUNITY & HOUSING ASSESSMENT, AND COLLABORATIVE COMMUNITY DESIGN & ENGAGEMENT PROJECTS.  ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTINUE WORKING ON FOOD, NUTRITION, AND AGRICULTURAL NEEDS IN THE VALLEY THROUGH BUILDING PARTNERSHIPS AND DEVELOPING PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS THAT INCREASE ACCESS TO FOOD-RELATED RESOURCES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, AND BUILD NUTRITION EDUCATION IN THE COMMUNITY. THE FOURTH VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD CAPACITY WITHIN BLUE SKY CENTER BY DEVELOPING NEW BUSINESS PROCESSES AND OPERATING SYSTEMS, CULTIVATION OF FINANCIAL AND IN-KIND RESOURCES FROM CURRENT AND NEW SUPPORTERS, DEVELOPMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF OUTREACH AND ADVOCACY MATERIALS, AS WELL AS, ASSISTING IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF MICRO-ENTERPRISES AND ECONOMIC REVITALIZATION PROGRAMS AND OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH BLUE SKY CENTER.

SUPER STARS LITERACY'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER UNDER-RESOURCED STUDENTS TO TRANSFORM THEIR FUTURES BY HELPING THEM DEVELOP THE READING AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS THAT ARE THE FOUNDATION FOR FUTURE LEARNING. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA OF K-12 SUCCESS. THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT INCREASED EFFICIENCY IN PROGRAM DELIVERY AND LEVERAGE RESOURCES NEEDED TO PREPARE THE ORGANIZATION TO SCALE TO SERVE ADDITIONAL STUDENTS IN FUTURE YEARS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL BENEFIT AT LEAST 500 K-2 STUDENTS EACH YEAR AT OUR PARTNER SCHOOL SITES LOCATED IN AREAS OF CONCENTRATED POVERTY IN OAKLAND, CA (ALAMEDA COUNTY), WHO HAVE BEEN REFERRED TO SUPER STARS LITERACY BY THEIR SCHOOL-DAY TEACHERS BASED ON LACK OF AGE-APPROPRIATE READING AND/OR ACADEMIC READINESS SKILLS. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR (YEAR TWO OF A THREE YEAR PROJECT). THE PROGRAM IMPACT ASSOCIATE VISTA WILL SUPPORT INCREASED EFFICIENCY IN PROGRAM DELIVERY BY PILOTING THE ANNUAL IMPLEMENTATION PLAN OF THE LEVELED LITERACY INTERVENTION PROGRAM, A SINGLE DAYTIME INTERVENTION CURRICULUM TO BE USED ACROSS ALL PROGRAM SITES, AND IMPLEMENT THE PILOT PLAN FOR AN IMPROVED STUDENT ENROLLMENT PROCESS. 

THE DEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNICATIONS ASSOCIATE VISTA WILL LEVERAGE RESOURCES NEEDED TO FUND PROGRAM ENHANCEMENTS AND EXPANSIONS BY: (1) PILOTING A SUSTAINABLE FUNDRAISING COMMITTEE STRUCTURE FOR SSL'S YOUNG PROFESSIONALS AND ALUMNI NETWORK (YPAN) COMMITTEE; (2) PILOTING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF "COLLABORATE" WITH DEVELOPMENT STAFF (DEVELOPMENT MANAGER AND GRANTS MANAGER) TO DEVELOP AND EXECUTE AN ANNUAL FUNDRAISING PLAN; AND (3) IMPROVING SUPER STARS LITERACY'S MARKETING MATERIALS AND SOCIAL MEDIA STRATEGY.

THE COMMUNITY CLINIC ASSOCIATION OF LOS ANGELES COUNTY (CCALAC) IS SUBMITTING AN APPLICATION TO THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) REQUESTING TEN (10) AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS TO SUPPORT A THREE (3) YEAR CCALAC AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT AT SIX (6) OF OUR MEMBER CLINICS. CCALAC REPRESENTS 59 NON-PROFIT COMMUNITY CLINICS AND HEALTH CENTERS THAT OPERATE OVER 300 PRIMARY CARE SITES THROUGHOUT LOS ANGELES COUNTY.  CCALAC AND OUR CLINIC MEMBERS SHARE A COMMON MISSION OF SUPPORTING AND EXPANDING ACCESS TO QUALITY, COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH CARE FOR EVERY INDIVIDUAL. CCALAC'S MISSION IS "TO PROMOTE AND COMMUNITY CLINICS AND HEALTH CENTERS AS PROVIDERS AND ADVOCATES FOR EXPANDING ACCESS TO QUALITY COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH CARE FOR MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED PEOPLE IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY."  OUR VISION IS "TO ADVANCE THE HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES OF COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT LOS ANGELES COUNTY, CREATING A COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH CARE SYSTEM FOR UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS TO HELP REDUCE HEALTH DISPARITIES IN THE COUNTY." THE GOAL OF OUR AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT WILL ENHANCE AND INCREASE THE FINANCIAL, VOLUNTEER, AND SERVICES CAPACITY AT CCALAC MEMBER CLINICS THROUGH VOLUNTEER GENERATION, FUNDRAISING, OUTREACH, ENROLLMENT AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES PROGRAMMING. PROGRAM ACTIVITIES WILL ALIGN WITH VISTA PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES AND SPECIFICALLY FOCUSED IN THE AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. VISTA MEMBERS WILL DEVELOP VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS, INCREASE OUTREACH AND ENROLLMENT, FUNDRAISE FOR HOMELESS AND FOOD ASSISTANCE FOCUSED PROGRAMS AND DEVELOP PROGRAMS FOCUSED ON ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. VISTA PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT LOS ANGELES COUNTY'S MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS INCLUDING THE UNINSURED, HOMELESS, VETERANS AND THOSE IN POVERTY.

THE MISSION OF THE LOS ANGELES EDUCATION CORPS IS TO CREATE AND MANAGE CHARTER SCHOOLS THAT PROVIDE SMALL, SUPPORTIVE LEARNING COMMUNITIES THAT MEET THE EDUCATIONAL AND PERSONAL NEEDS OF DISADVANTAGE STUDENTS RESULTING IN CHANGED LIVES, FAMILIES, AND GENERATIONS.  OUR PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA.  OUR GOAL IS TO INCREASE THE NUMBERS OF STUDENTS FROM COMMUNITIES IN POVERTY WHO ENROLL IN OUR SCHOOL AND TRANSITION INTO POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION.  WE ARE REQUESTING THREE VISTA MEMBERS WHO WILL PERFORM OUTREACH AND MARKETING, ASSIST WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF OUR POST-SECONDARY TRANSITION PROGRAM, AND HELP TO DEVELOP FINANCIAL RESOURCES OVER ONE YEAR.

THE JAMESTOWN COMMUNITY CENTER'S MISSION IS TO HELP CHILDREN, YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES DEVELOP AND REALIZE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AS EMPOWERED, PRODUCTIVE, AND ACTIVE MEMBERS OF THEIR COMMUNITY.  JAMESTOWN, A MISSION DISTRICT BASED ORGANIZATION, ENVISIONS THAT ALL OF SAN FRANCISCO'S  CHILDREN, YOUTH AND FAMILIES, PARTICULARLY THOSE FROM UNDER-SERVED POPULATIONS, WILL HAVE ACCESS TO THE OPPORTUNITIES THEY NEED TO THRIVE AND TO CREATE A CITY THAT IS SAFE, EQUITABLE, INTERCONNECTED AND COMMUNITY-LED.  JAMESTOWN SERVES OVER 1500 SAN FRANCISCO YOUTH THROUGH SPORTS, AFTER-SCHOOL, SUMMER, ACADEMIC TUTORING, EDUCATIONAL ENRICHMENT, YOUTH WORKFORCE AND SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL SUPPORT PROGRAMS.  THROUGH OUR 45-YEAR HISTORY, WE HAVE HELPED OPEN DOORS OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR GENERATIONS OF YOUTH.  BY INCREASING THE PARTICIPATION, VOICE AND POWER OF PARENTS WHO HAVE HISTORICALLY NOT PARTICIPATED IN DECISION MAKING, WE BELIEVE OUTCOMES WILL IMPROVE FOR ALL KIDS.  
THE WORK OF THE JAMESTOWN COMMUNITY CENTER ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA
THREE (3) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY:

- ASSISTING IN THE MAPPING OF LEADERSHIP STRUCTURES WITHIN THE THREE SELECTED SCHOOLS

-  IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL PARENT LEADERS BY INTERVIEWING SCHOOL STAFF, OTHER PARENT LEADERS, AFTER-SCHOOL STAFF, AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS.

-  CONDUCTING ONE ON ONE INTERVIEWS WITH PARENTS

-  WORKING WITH JAMESTOWN'S PARENT ORGANIZER, DEVELOP A TRAINING PLAN FOR THE PARENTS IN EACH SCHOOL TO SUPPORT SKILL BUILDING

-WORKING WITH JAMESTOWN'S PARENT ORGANIZER, DEVELOP A WORKPLAN FOR NEW PARENT LEADERS TO PROMOTE SPECIFIC POLICY AND BUDGET PRIORITIES OF LOW INCOME AND ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNER CHILDREN WITHIN THE PTA AND SCHOOL SITE COUNCIL STRUCTURES

-  SUPPORT NEW PARENT LEADERS BY REGULARLY DEBRIEFING AND ASSISTING IN ACQUIRING NEW LEADERSHIP SKILLS NECESSARY TO SUPPORT LEADERSHIP.

THESE ACTIVITIES WILL TAKE PLACE STARTING IN THE FALL OF 2019.  THE VISTAS WILL BEGIN THE SCHOOL YEAR BY GREETING AND MEETING PARENTS AT BACK TO SCHOOL NIGHT, INTRODUCING THEMSELVES AS A RESOURCE, AND CREATING AND MAINTAINING COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS:  A CALENDAR OF PARENT EVENTS, MAINTAINING SOCIAL MEDIA, EMAIL LISTS, RESOURCE BINDERS AND A BULLETIN BOARD FOR PARENT ACTIVITIES.  THE VISTAS WILL MAKE SURE PARENTS GET THE INFORMATION THEY NEED IN A TIMELY MANNER FOR SERVICES PROVIDED AT SCHOOL AS WELL AS SUMMER PROGRAMMING FOR YOUTH.  THE VISTAS WILL COMPLETE THEIR YEAR OF SERVICE AT THE END OF THE SUMMER 2020.

THE MISSION OF THE WISCONSIN ASSOCIATION OF FREE & CHARITABLE CLINICS (WAFCC) IS TO SUPPORT, STRENGTHEN, AND ADVOCATE FOR THE UNIQUENESS OF THE WISCONSIN FREE AND CHARITABLE CLINICS, THE PATIENTS THEY SERVE, AND THE COMMUNITIES WITH WHOM THEY PARTNER.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF WISCONSIN FREE AND CHARITABLE CLINICS (FCCS) TO IMPLEMENT THE STANDARDS OF EXCELLENCE WHICH WILL  CONNECT ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED FOLKS TO PREVENTATIVE AND PRIMARY HEALTHCARE SERVICES. SEVEN (7) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CREATING TRAINING AND WEBINARS, DEVELOPING A DATA REPOSITORY, DEVELOPING PROCESSES AND POLICIES OR PROCEDURES, CREATING PATIENT SATISFACTION SURVEYS, FOSTERING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, SET-UP OR IMPROVE CLINIC VOLUNTEER BASE THROUGH RECRUITMENT EFFORTS, RESEARCHING AND WRITING GRANTS, IMPLEMENTING PDSA CYCLES, RESEARCHING EHRS AND CREATING IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, AND PERFORMING SELF-ASSESSMENTS OF CLINICS OVER THE COURSE OF 36 MONTHS.

THE MISSION OF THE CITY OF MILWAUKEE GOVERNMENT IS ?TO ENHANCE THE SAFETY, PROSPERITY, AND QUALITY OF LIFE OF ALL OF OUR CITIZENS WORKING DIRECTLY AND THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH OUR COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS.? ONE OF THE CITY?S SIX BROAD GOALS IS ?TO PROMOTE RACIAL, SOCIAL, AND ECONOMIC EQUITY FOR ALL CITIZENS.? THE CITY OF MILWAUKEE?S MY BROTHER?S KEEPER (MBK) AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT WILL HELP IN BRINGING TOGETHER THE CITY, MILWAUKEE BLACK MALE ACHIEVEMENT ADVISORY COUNCIL AND ALL OF OUR COMMITTED STAKEHOLDERS (COMMUNITY, BUSINESS, EDUCATION, FAITH, HEALTH, CRIMINAL JUSTICE, AND YOUTH) UNDER ONE UMBRELLA OF THE MBK INITIATIVES TO BETTER SERVE COMMUNITIES OF COLOR, PROVIDE AND ENSURE OPPORTUNITIES, BUILD CAPACITY, CREATE SUSTAINABLE RESOURCES, AND BRING PEOPLE OUT OF POVERTY. OUR PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE WISCONSIN AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAMMING PRIORITY: OPPORTUNITY YOUTH AND MY BROTHER?S KEEPER (COMMUNITIES OF COLOR). WE WILL TARGET LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES OF COLOR TO FIND INNOVATIVE WAYS FOR ALLEVIATING POVERTY. FIVE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL HELP MBK IMPLEMENTATION PARTNERS TO WORK ON PRIORITIES ASSIGNED TO THEM BASED ON THE MBK 2016 ACTION PLAN. AMERICORPS MEMBERS WILL SERVE IN THE AREAS OF VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, DEVELOPING PARTNERSHIPS, PROJECT MANAGEMENT, DATABASE DEVELOPMENT, RESEARCH, AND CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT. THEY WILL HELP IN SETTING UP THE INFRASTRUCTURE AND IN BUILDING CAPACITY FOR THE MILWAUKEE MBK INITIATIVES. THE MBK INITIATIVES WILL REQUIRE EXTENSIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AND PULLING RESOURCES FOR THE MILWAUKEE COMMUNITIES OF COLOR. AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS ARE CRITICAL TO THAT PROCESS OF SETTING UP THE STAGE FOR SIGNIFICANT LIFE IMPROVEMENT FOR BOYS OF AND MEN OF COLOR.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
SOUTH DAKOTA STATE UNIVERSITY (SDSU) EXTENSION'S GROWING STRONG COMMUNITIES THROUGH AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM WILL LEVERAGE THE TIME AND TALENT OF NINE AC VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE AC VISTA LEADER TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE OF AND ACCESS TO PHYSICAL AND FINANCIAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS TECHNIQUES AND RESOURCES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED SOUTH DAKOTANS. MEMBERS WILL SERVE IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES CATEGORY TO ADVANCE A VARIETY OF CURRENT OR DEVELOPING PROGRAMS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO SKILLS NEEDED TO LIFT INDIVIDUALS OUT OF POVERTY. THESE PROGRAMS WILL ADDRESS ISSUES SUCH AS OBESITY/NUTRITION, CHRONIC DISEASE MANAGEMENT, FOOD ACCESS, LIFE/EMPLOYMENT SKILLS AND FINANCIAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE USED TO CONTRIBUTE TO OR STRENGTHEN PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT/DESIGN, PERFORM RESEARCH/NEEDS ASSESSMENTS, ADVANCE A VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT/RETENTION SYSTEM FOR PROGRAMS, PROMOTE PROGRAMS, DEVELOP CURRICULA/EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS, IMPROVE PROGRAMMING SYSTEMS, AND IDENTIFY RESOURCES FOR PROGRAM SUSTAINABILITY. 

SDSU EXTENSION HAS A STATEWIDE PRESENCE AND WHILE SOME OF THE WORK VISTAS DO WILL IN FACT HAVE AN IMPACT ON THE BROADER POPULATION, THE FOCUS OF MUCH OF THE WORK OF VISTA MEMBERS WILL SERVE 1) SOUTH DAKOTA COUNTIES IDENTIFIED AS HIGH HEALTH RISK BY THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL (CDC) (ADULT POPULATION OVER 40% OBESE); 2) AMERICAN INDIAN RESERVATIONS, ALL OF WHICH HAVE SEVERAL ECONOMIC AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES, 3) UNDERSERVED IN AREAS WITHIN AND SURROUNDING THE TWO LARGEST CITIES IN THE STATE.

FAMILY & COMMUNITY SERVICES' MISSION IS TO SUPPORT, STRENGTHEN, AND EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGH A BROAD CONTINUUM OF COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES THAT MEET THE NEEDS AND VALUES OF THE COMMUNITY. THE AGENCY IS GUIDED BY A COMMITMENT TO INDIVIDUAL DIGNITY, SERVICE EXCELLENCE, ACCOUNTABILITY, VOLUNTEERISM AND BELIEF IN THE SOLIDARITY OF THE HUMAN FAMILY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO HELP VETERANS FIND HOUSING AND JOBS AND TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES FOR YOUTH, LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AS WELL AS SENIORS (65+ YEARS OF AGE). FIFTEEN YEAR-LONG VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE YEAR LONG VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY DEVELOPING RELATIONSHIPS WITH EXISTING FAMILY & COMMUNITY SERVICES INC. HUMAN SERVICE PROGRAMS THAT CAN BENEFIT THROUGH SUPPORT BY NATIONAL SERVICE VOLUNTEERS, HOUSING PROVIDERS, RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE SERVICES, AND BY DEVELOPING PROGRAMMING TO PROMOTE THE HEALTH OF LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS, INCLUDING YOUTH AND SENIORS, OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT YEARS.

UNITED WAY SUMMIT COUNTY (UWSC) IMPROVES LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF OUR COMMUNITY TO ADVANCE THE COMMON GOOD. THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT WE ARE PROPOSING ALIGNS WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICE?S (CNCS) EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO COMBAT GENERATIONAL POVERTY FROM BOTH ENDS OF THE SPECTRUM BY WRAPPING HIGH QUALITY SERVICES AROUND THE MOST VULNERABLE INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN OUR COMMUNITY. IN THE FIRST YEAR WE BELIEVE THE PROJECT CAN BENEFIT AS MANY AS 2,475 LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS. EIGHT TALENTED VISTA MEMBERS WILL HELP DRIVE THE PROJECT GOALS, BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING, TRAINING, DATA TRACKING, PROCESS DEVELOPMENT, PROCEDURE ENHANCEMENT AND PILOTING. OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

SINCE 1910, THE DENTAL CENTER OF NORTHWEST OHIO'S MISSION HAS BEEN TO:
* PROVIDE PRIMARY ORAL HEALTH SERVICE FOR UNDERSERVED CHILDREN AND ADULTS IN NORTHWEST OHIO,
* PROMOTE THE VALUE OF GOOD ORAL HEALTH THROUGH EDUCATION, AND
