* SERVE AS AN ADVOCATE FOR THOSE WITH LIMITED ACCESS TO DENTAL CARE. 

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES CNCS FOCUS AREA. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT OVER THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT LENGTH, APPROXIMATELY 75,000 FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS WILL BE SERVED. 

THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS THE FOLLOWING OVER THE THREE YEAR COURSE OF THE PROJECT. 

BUSINESS OPERATIONS: STRATEGIC PLANNING, DEVELOPING A SYSTEM OF BEST PRACTICES FOR EFFICIENT SERVICE DELIVERY, AND EXAMINING THE BUSINESS PRACTICES TO ENSURE THAT WE HAVE A STREAMLINED OPERATION.

SOCIAL MEDIA/MARKETING AND OUTREACH: DEVELOPING A UNIFIED MARKETING AND OUTREACH PLAN, MAINTAINING AND MANAGING SOCIAL MEDIA, THE FORMATION OF COMMUNITY ADVISORY COUNCILS.

PROGRAM EVALUATION: DEVELOPING PATIENT SURVEYS THAT PROVIDE QUALITATIVE DATA TO SUPPLEMENT THE CURRENT QUANTITATIVE DATA WE CURRENTLY GATHER, WORKING WITH FUNDERS TO ENSURE THAT WE ARE COLLECTING THE INFORMATION REQUIRED BY GRANT AGREEMENTS AND CONTRACTS, AND UTILIZING OTHER DATABASES AND SYSTEMS TO ENSURE PATIENTS ARE BEING PROVIDED WITH THE CARE THEY NEED AND IMPROVE OUTCOMES.

THE MISSION OF CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES OF THE MIAMI VALLEY (CSSMV) IS TO STRENGTHEN INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGH ACTIONS OF FAITH, SERVICE AND CHARITY. PROGRAMS OF CSSMV ARE DESIGNED TO PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. 
CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES OFFERS A BROAD RANGE OF PROGRAMMING INCLUDING: EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION, PANTRY SERVICES, PARENTING SUPPORTS, EMERGENCY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, CASE MANAGEMENT, FINANCIAL EDUCATION, MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING, REFUGEE RESETTLEMENT SERVICES, AND SENIOR SERVICES. EACH YEAR, NEARLY 23,000 INDIVIDUALS ARE SERVED THROUGH PROGRAMS OFFERED AT CSSMV. 
THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT IS TO BUILD PROGRAM CAPACITY AND ENHANCE CLIENT OUTCOMES THROUGH THE COORDINATION OF A TWO-GENERATION APPROACH TO SERVICE DELIVERY. PRESENTLY, CSSMV'S BROAD RANGE OF SERVICES PROVIDE SUPPORTS FOR BOTH CHILDREN AND ADULTS. HOWEVER, THERE IS ROOM FOR IMPROVED COLLABORATION BETWEEN PROGRAMS TO OFFER FAMILIES WRAP-AROUND SUPPORTS TO PROMOTE FAMILY STABILITY AND ECONOMIC SECURITY. THE 2 GEN VISTA PROJECT UTILIZES VISTA MEMBERS IN THE PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF SYSTEM CHANGES TO IMPROVE SERVICE DELIVERY, BROADEN CLIENT AND COMMUNITY IMPACT, AND SUPPORT POSITIVE CLIENT OUTCOMES ACROSS AGENCY PROGRAMMING. THE GOAL OF THE 2 GEN VISTA PROJECT IS TO REACH EXISTING CLIENTS IN NEW WAYS BY PROVIDING A PROCESS FOR LINKING CLIENTS OF ONE CSSMV PROGRAM TO APPROPRIATE SERVICES IN ANOTHER PROGRAM IN ORDER TO COMPREHENSIVELY ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF FAMILIES TO PROMOTE STABILIZATION. ADDITIONALLY, THE 2 GEN VISTA PROJECT WILL AIDE IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NEW POINT OF ENTRY SYSTEM FOR CLIENTS SEEKING SERVICES WHICH WILL ALLOW NEW CLIENTS TO BE DIRECTED TO SERVICES MORE EFFICIENTLY. FINALLY, THROUGH A MORE HOLISTIC APPROACH TO SERVICES, THE ULTIMATE GOAL IS TO SUPPORT THE SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND STABILITY OF FAMILIES SEEKING SERVICES.

MULTICULTURAL COALITION'S MISSION IS EMPOWERING INDIVIDUALS, EMBRACING CULTURES, AND STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE PROJECT WILL SERVE OVER 120 IMMIGRANT FAMILIES IN GRAND ISLAND, NEBRASKA, THROUGH COMMUNITY RELATIONSHIP DEVELOPMENT, IMPROVED PARTNER COMMUNICATIONS AND EFFICIENT AGENCY PERFORMANCE MEASURES. A TEAM OF THREE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL SERVE MULTICULTURAL COALITION OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS FULFILLING DUTIES SUCH AS INTERVIEWING COMMUNITY MEMBERS, PLANNING INFORMATIONAL MEETINGS, COMPLETING A MEDIA PLAN, AND DEVELOPING A PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.

LUTHERAN FAMILY SERVICES OF NEBRASKA'S MISSION IS "TO EXPRESS GOD'S LOVE FOR ALL PEOPLE BY PROVIDING QUALITY HUMAN CARE SERVICES THAT BUILD AND STRENGTHEN INDIVIDUAL, FAMILY AND COMMUNITY LIFE." THE PROPOSED LUTHERAN FAMILY SERVICES (LFS) VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE STATED VISTA ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE THREE-YEAR LFS VISTA PROGRAM WILL HELP TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY AMONG NEW AMERICAN COMMUNITIES IN NEBRASKA, AND WILL ANNUALLY BENEFIT 3,000 NEW AMERICANS IN OMAHA AND LINCOLN. OVER THE NEXT TWO YEARS OF THE PROJECT, FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PROMOTING THE NEEDS OF NEW AMERICAN COMMUNITIES, LEVERAGING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS, ANALYZING THE EFFICIENCY AND IMPACT OF LFS PROGRAMS, WRITING CLIENT SUCCESS STORIES AND CAPACITY-BUILDING FOR LFS PROGRAMS.

FOOD BANK FOR THE HEARTLAND (FBFH) WAS FORMED IN 1981 AS THE OMAHA FOOD BANK AND CHARGED WITH PROVIDING EMERGENCY FOOD TO PANTRIES IN DOUGLAS COUNTY, NEBRASKA. BECAUSE OUR CURRENT MISSION IS TO PROVIDE EMERGENCY AND SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD TO 93 COUNTIES IN NEBRASKA AND WESTERN IOWA, FBFH REORGANIZED IN 2009 AND RECOMMITTED ITS RESOURCES TO SERVING ALL COUNTIES IN ITS ASSIGNED SERVICE AREA. 
FOOD BANK FOR THE HEARTLAND IS A MEMBER OF THE ALLIANCE FOR A BETTER OMAHA.  A COLLECTIVE IMPACT WITH TOGETHER AND HEART MINISTRY CENTER.  THIS COLLECTIVE IMPACT AIMS TO DECREASE CHRONIC DEPENDENCE ON SOCIAL SERVICES BY IMPROVING CLIENT ACCESS TO SNAP AND WIC BENEFITS, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND COLLABORATIVE REFERRALS.  THE ALLIANCE ALSO SEEKS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF FOOD PANTRIES BY INTEGRATING BEST PRACTICES THROUGH FORMAL COLLABORATIVE WORK WHILE ALSO IMPROVING ADVOCACY.  TWO OF OMAHA'S LARGEST FOOD PANTRIES PARTICIPATE IN THIS IMPORTANT COLLECTIVE COMMITMENT
THIS VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO (1) ESTABLISH AN EFFICIENT DISTRIBUTION NETWORK FOR EMERGENCY AND SUPPLEMENT FOOD THAT CROSSES THE ENTIRE STATE OF NEBRASKA AND WESTERN IOWA IN A RATIONAL AND ACCESSIBLE MANNER; (2) EXPAND LOCAL CAPACITY TO ELIMINATE HUNGER AND HOMELESSNESS BY IDENTIFYING WHAT CURRENTLY EXISTS AND CREATING INNOVATIVE AND COLLABORATIVE PROJECTS THAT BRING GROUPS AND INTERESTS TOGETHER TOWARD SUSTAINED SOLUTIONS TO HUNGER AND HOMELESSNESS; AND (3) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS WORKING ON HUNGER AND POVERTY ISSUES ACROSS THE STATE.  SEVEN VISTAS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE FOLLOWING GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES OVER THE COURSE OF THIS VISTA GRANT.
THE VISTAS WILL ENGAGE IN THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:
1.	IDENTIFY AND MAKE CONTACT WITH ALL FOOD DISTRIBUTION PARTNERS WITHIN AN ASSIGNED TERRITORY. 
2.	COMMUNICATE THE MAGNITUDE OF HUNGER IN THAT TERRITORY. 
3.	COACH AND SUPPORT PANTRIES, MEAL PROVIDERS AND SCHOOLS TO MAXIMIZE THEIR ABILITY TO DISTRIBUTE EMERGENCY AND SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD IN THEIR AREA. 
4.	ASSIST PANTRIES IN OBTAINING EQUIPMENT, VOLUNTEERS AND OTHER RESOURCES NECESSARY TO INCREASE THE FREQUENCY OF THEIR FOOD DISTRIBUTION. 
5.	COACH AND SUPPORT PANTRIES, MEAL PROVIDERS AND SCHOOLS TO IMPROVE THE NUTRITIONAL LEVEL OF THE FOOD THEY DISTRIBUTE TO HUNGRY NEBRASKANS. 
6.	IDENTIFY SPECIAL NEEDS POPULATIONS SUCH AS SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH CHRONIC HEALTH CONDITIONS IN EACH TERRITORY. 
7.	DETERMINE LEVEL OF UNMET NEED WITHIN ANY SPECIAL POPULATION. 
8.	DEVELOP TARGETED PROGRAMS TO BETTER MEET THE NEED OF ANY UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS. 
9.	ASSIST LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN RECRUITING AND EFFECTIVELY USING DIVERSE VOLUNTEER TALENTS IN ADDRESSING HUNGER ISSUES. 
10.	CREATE OR PARTNER WITH AN EXISTING STATEWIDE DATABASE TO BETTER MATCH VOLUNTEER AVAILABILITY IN RURAL NEBRASKA WITH NEEDS IN LOCAL PANTRIES AND MEAL PROVIDERS. 
11.	DISTRIBUTE SNAP INFORMATION TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE TEAM MEMBER'S TERRITORY. 
12.	CREATE A "HOW TO" MANUAL FOR EACH COUNTY. 
13.  CREATE AND DEVELOP COMPREHENSIVE, COLLABORATIVE, AND MEASURABLE NUTRITION EDUCATION PROGRAMS FOR FOOD PANTRIES THAT PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY.
14. CREATE AND DEVELOP COMPREHENSIVE, COLLABORATIVE AND MEASURABLE NUTRITION EDUCATION PROGRAMS FOR TARGETED COMMUNITY POPULATIONS THAT PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY.
15. CREATE AND DEVELOP NUTRITION MESSAGING IN FOOD PANTRIES THAT ASSIST IN TRANSITIONING FOOD PANTRIES TO NUTRITION CENTERS.
16. CREATE AND STRENGTHEN VOLUNTEER DRIVE EVENTS THAT HELP THE CLIENTS OF THE ORGANIZATIONS IN THE ALLIANCE FOR A BETTER OMAHA AND ADDRESS NEEDS OF CLIENTS.
17. CREATE AND STRENGTHEN VOLUNTEER PROGRAMMING TO BECOME AN ADVOCACY AND EDUCATION PROGRAM AS WELL AS VOLUNTEER PROGRAM.
18. CREATE AND DEVELOP COMMUNITY OUTREACH TO HELP PROGRAMS IN THE ALLIANCE FOR A BETTER OMAHA LISTEN, UNDERSTAND, AND ASSIST VARIOUS MARGINALIZED POPULATIONS IN OMAHA.
19. CREATE AND DEVELOP BEST SUSTAINED PRACTI

PARTNERSHIP 4 KIDS' MISSION IS TO MENTOR KIDS FOR COLLEGE TODAY, AND CAREERS TOMORROW. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECTS ALIGN WITH THE EDUCATION, K-12 CNCS FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECTS WILL SEEK TO LEVERAGE AGENCY RESOURCES, THEREBY INCREASING ITS CAPACITY TO PROVIDE ACADEMIC AND MENTOR SUPPORT FOR LOW-INCOME YOUTH, ULTIMATELY PROVIDING MORE STUDENTS IN NEED WITH A PATHWAY TO OVERCOME POVERTY AND BECOME CONTRIBUTING CITIZENS WITHIN THE OMAHA COMMUNITY. THROUGH THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT GOALS, P4K EXPECTS TO BENEFIT MORE THAN 6,100 OMAHA YOUTH, THE VAST MAJORITY OF WHICH LIVE IN POVERTY. VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RESEARCHING AND SECURING LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL GRANT FUNDING; DEVELOPING AN INTERNAL GOVERNMENT GRANT RESEARCH AND REPORTING SYSTEM; AND STRENGTHENING VOLUNTEER RESOURCES BY DEVELOPING NEW AND/OR STREAMLINING CURRENT VOLUNTEER RETENTION METHODS AND FORGING NEW COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE IMPLEMENTED CONCURRENTLY.

TURTLE MOUNTAIN BAND OF CHIPPEWA INDIANS MISSION IS TO DEVELOP AND ENJOY THE ADVANTAGES OF DEMOCRATIC PROCESSES AND OPPORTUNITIES TO PROMOTE OUR GENERAL WELFARE, EDUCATION, AND PROSPERITY, TO PROMOTE GOOD AND LAW-ABIDING CITIZENS (1).  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN THE PROMISE ZONE COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTER ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT TRIBAL MEMBERS.  THE FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS A COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP SYSTEMS OF ORGANIZATIONAL EFFECTIVENESS USING TECHNOLOGY OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

REFERENCE:
TURTLE MOUNTAIN BAND OF CHIPPEWA CONSTITUTION HTTP://WWW.TM.EDU/WP-CONTENT/UPLOADS/2016/10/TRIBAL-CONSTITUTION-2015.PDF.

EMERGE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT'S MISSION IS TO "PARTNER WITH PEOPLE AS THEY REDEFINE THEMSELVES AND CREATE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES IN OUR COMMUNITIES." THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DECREASE RECIDIVISM AND POVERTY AMONGST EX-OFFENDERS, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 700 CLIENTS. 14 VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS JOB DEVELOPMENT, FINANCIAL LITERACY SERVICES, HOUSING SERVICES, AND CONNECTING EX-OFFENDERS TO JOB-READINESS AND EMPLOYMENT SKILLS TRAININGS OVER THE COURSE OF 5 YEARS.

MINNESOTA CAMPUS COMPACT'S (MNCC) MISSION IS TO SUPPORT COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES IN CIVIC ENGAGEMENT EFFORTS THAT ADDRESS PRESSING PUBLIC ISSUES LIKE EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, PUBLIC HEALTH, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY, WHILE ALSO PREPARING STUDENTS FOR WORK, LIFE, AND CITIZENSHIP. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE LOW-INCOME PEOPLE?S ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE, HEALTH INSURANCE ENROLLMENT, INFORMATION ABOUT HEALTH CARE, HEALTH EDUCATION, EMERGENCY FOOD, AND LONG TERM HUNGER ALLEVIATION PROGRAMS IN COMMUNITY SETTINGS AND ON COLLEGE CAMPUSES WHERE LOW-INCOME PEOPLE ARE SERVED. OUR PROJECTS WILL ALSO FOCUS ON INCREASING ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY FOR PARTICIPATING SITES. WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT MORE THAN 6,000 PEOPLE WHO ARE UNINSURED, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED, OR LIVING IN RURAL AREAS. FOURTEEN VISTA MEMBERS, INCLUDING ONE VISTA LEADER, WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN HIGHER EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, RESEARCHING HEALTH PROMOTION STRATEGIES, RECRUITING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS, FINDING RESOURCES, ADVANCING OUTREACH STRATEGIES, AND ENGAGING COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN CREATING PROGRAMMING, SUCH AS THE DEVELOPMENT OF CULTURALLY-SPECIFIC HEALTH EDUCATION PROGRAMMING. VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THESE GOALS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE-YEAR PROJECT CYCLES AT HOST SITES, AND THE CHC INTERMEDIARY PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS THESE GOALS ON AN ONGOING BASIS BY CONTINUING TO RECRUIT AND SUPPORT NEW HOST SITES AS HOST SITE PROJECTS CONCLUDE.

THE MINNESOTA ASSOCIATION FOR VOLUNTEER ADMINISTRATION'S MISSION IS TO INSPIRE EXCELLENCE IN THE LEADERSHIP OF VOLUNTEERS TO IMPACT COMMUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE'S ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, EDUCATION, AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO UTILIZE VISTA RESOURCES TO HELP ORGANIZATIONS DEVELOP OR EXPAND SYSTEMS AND STRATEGIES FOR ENGAGING VOLUNTEERS, ULTIMATELY RESULTING IN THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDING MORE SERVICE, SERVING IN BETTER WAYS, OR ACHIEVING BETTER COMMUNITY OUTCOMES IN THESE THREE FOCUS AREAS. BY HELPING TO EXPAND, IMPROVE, AND SUSTAIN VOLUNTEER PROGRAMMING THAT DELIVERS ESSENTIAL ANTI-POVERTY SERVICES IN MINNESOTA COMMUNITIES, MAVA EXPECTS LOW INCOME POPULATIONS AROUND THE STATE TO BENEFIT FROM THE VISTA PROJECT. THE NINE REQUESTED VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY HELPING EACH ORGANIZATION IDENTIFY AND IMPLEMENT THREE OR MORE EFFECTIVE VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT BEST PRACTICES IN ORDER TO BUILD STRONGER VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS THAT BRING INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES OUT OF POVERTY OVER THE COURSE OF THIS PROPOSED THREE-YEAR VISTA PROJECT.

THE NORTHWEST INDIAN COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CENTER IS LOCATED IN THE HEART OF OJIBWE COUNTRY IN NORTH CENTRAL MINNESOTA.  MORE THAN HALF OF THE AMERICAN INDIAN POPULATION OF MINNESOTA IS LOCATED WITHIN IN THE 60 MILES RADIUS OF BEMIDJI, MINNESOTA.  NORTHWEST INDIAN COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CENTER HAS BEEN INCORPORATED SINCE 1989 AS A NATIVE CONTROLLED NONPROFIT MISSIONED TO IDENTIFY, COORDINATE AND DELIVER RESOURCES THAT PROMOTE WELLNESS AND EQUITY FOR AMERICAN INDIAN FAMILIES IN NORTHWEST AND NORTH-CENTRAL MINNESOTA.  

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH CNCS PRIORITY AREA EDUCATION AND SEEKS TO INCREASE THE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF THE AMERICAN INDIAN EDUCATION PROGRAMS IN THE REGION THAT WILL IMPACT A MINIMUM OF 200 AMERICAN INDIANS.  FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING VOLUNTEER TUTORS, IMPROVING OUTREACH AND RETENTION TECHNIQUES, INCREASING INVOLVEMENT OF TRADITIONAL ELDERS AND OJIBWEMOWIN CURRICULUM CONTEXTUALIZATION, IMPROVING DATA COLLECTION PRACTICES THAT RESULT IN INCREASED FINANCIAL CAPACITY OF THE PROGRAMS, INSURING SUSTAINABLE GROWTH AND IMPACT.  

THE VISTAS WILL HAVE ONE YEAR PLACEMENT AND THE CONVENING ORGANIZATION, NORTHWEST INDIAN COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CENTER, WILL HAVE TWO YEAR TIMELINE TO RECRUIT, ORIENT, COMPLETE, AND THEN REPORT TO CNCS PROGRAM RESULTS.

ECOLIBRIUM3'S MISSION IS TO LEAD AND INSPIRE CHANGE IN OUR COMMUNITY TOWARD AN EQUITABLE AND SUSTAINABLE FUTURE. THE ECOLIBRIUM3 RESILIENCE CORPS ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS BECAUSE COMMUNITY RESILIENCE IS FOUND AT THE HOUSING/ENERGY/HEALTH/ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT NEXUS FOR VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND PROGRAM SCALE/REACH, IMPROVE EFFECTIVENESS, AND LEVERAGE RESOURCES AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 1,270 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED RESIDENTS AND 28 ORGANIZATIONS. FIFTEEN VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BENCHMARKING CURRENT SERVICE GAPS, IMPROVING INTER- AND INTRA-ORGANIZATIONAL COMMUNICATION, ESTABLISHING STRONG VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, DEVELOPING SUSTAINABLE FUNDING PLANS, AND IMPROVING ALIGNMENT OF POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO INCREASE EQUITY AND ADDRESS NORTHEASTERN MINNESOTA?S MOST CHALLENGING PROBLEMS OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS.

THE CRIM FITNESS FOUNDATION'S MISSION IS TO CULTIVATE ACCESSIBLE, VIBRANT COMMUNITIES IN FLINT AND GENESEE COUNTY THAT ENCOURAGE PEOPLE TO LEAD HEALTHY LIFESTYLES BY INTEGRATING PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, HEALTHY EATING, AND MINDFULNESS INTO THEIR DAILY LIVES AND MENTOR OTHER COMMUNITIES TO DO THE SAME. THE PROPOSED CONTINUING VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO CREATE SYSTEMS TO CONNECT THE SCHOOL ADMINISTRATION, PARENTS, SOCIAL SERVICE SUPPORTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN WAYS THAT IMPROVE ACADEMIC AND ATTENDANCE OUTCOMES, AND RECRUIT AND MANAGE A CORE POOL OF PARENT, PARTNER AND COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS TO HELP DELIVER DURING/AFTER-SCHOOL AND SUMMER PROGRAMS. THIS PROJECT EXPECTS TO CONTINUE TO BENEFIT STUDENTS ATTENDING THE 12 FLINT COMMUNITY SCHOOLS, THE FAMILIES OF THESE STUDENTS, AND THE COMMUNITIES SURROUNDING THE SCHOOL SITES. 23 VISTA MEMBERS (INCLUDING ONE VISTA LEADER) WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ABSENTEE MONITORING, COMMUNITY AND PARENT VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, AND ENRICHMENT PROGRAM CREATION OVER THE COURSE OF AUGUST 2018 TO AUGUST 2019.

VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA OHIO & INDIANA'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE LIFE-CHANGING SERVICES TO ENHANCE THE PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL, AND INTELLECTUAL NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS BY PROVIDING COUNSELING, REHABILITATION, JOB PLACEMENT, AND RESIDENTIAL SERVICES. WE SERVE INDIVIDUALS TRANSITIONING FROM THE CORRECTIONAL SYSTEM, THE ELDERLY, VETERANS, AND THOSE DEALING WITH CHRONIC ADDICTION AND MENTAL ILLNESS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE AGENCY, INCLUDING INCREASING IN-KIND DONATIONS AND VOLUNTEER HOURS, TO SUPPORT THE GROWING NUMBER OF CLIENTS WE SERVE.  THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT OUR AGENCY THROUGH INCREASED EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS, AND OUTREACH, AND THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE, THROUGH INCREASED ACCESS TO NEEDED SERVICES.  THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS MANAGING VOLUNTEERS AND IN-KIND DONATIONS; INCREASING COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT; DEVELOPING MATERIALS; AND EXPANDING/STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS AND NETWORKS; OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR, WITH THE HOPES OF HAVING VISTA MEMBERS IN THE FUTURE.

INDIANA UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH'S MISSION IS TO PROMOTE HEALTH AMONG INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES IN INDIANA, THE NATION, AND THE WORLD THROUGH INTEGRATED MULTIDISCIPLINARY APPROACHES TO RESEARCH AND CREATIVE ACTIVITIES, TEACHING, AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO PROVIDE THE RESOURCES TO FULLY IMPLEMENT COORDINATED SCHOOL HEALTH PROGRAMS IN SIX, PRIMARILY RURAL, SOUTH-CENTRAL INDIANA COUNTIES, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THOUSANDS OF STUDENTS, FAMILIES, AND SCHOOL EMPLOYEES. SIX VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING AND ENGAGING VOLUNTEERS; COMPLETING SCHOOL-BASED COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENTS; AND IMPLEMENTING COORDINATED SCHOOL HEALTH PLANS OVER THE COURSE OF FIVE YEARS.

COLLEGE MENTORS FOR KIDS' MISSION IS TO CONNECT COLLEGE STUDENTS WITH THE MOST TO GIVE TO KIDS WHO NEED IT MOST.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ESTABLISH EFFICIENT SYSTEMS IN PROGRAMMING, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND DEVELOPMENT.  THESE SYSTEMS WILL BUILD ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY SO COLLEGE MENTORS CAN SERVE AND SUPPORT MORE KIDS IN POVERTY.  OVERALL, THE WORK OF THE VISTAS WILL BENEFIT 2,500 1ST-6TH GRADERS AND 2,800 COLLEGE STUDENTS WHO ARE PART OF THE PROGRAM AT MORE THAN 30 CAMPUSES ACROSS THE COUNTRY.  THE THREE VISTA MEMBERS REQUESTED WILL SUPPORT THE AREAS OF DEVELOPMENT, OPERATIONS AND PROGRAMS.  THE VISTAS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING SYSTEMS AND PROCESSES TO TRACK AND MANAGE PROGRAM DATA AND LOGISTICS; BUILDING A COMMUNICATIONS PLAN TO TARGET VARIOUS CONSTITUENTS; AND WORKING WITH FUNDERS AND SUPPORTERS TO DIVERSIFY REVENUE ACROSS MARKETS AND GEOGRAPHY.

THE MISSION OF THE GREATER INDIANAPOLIS PROGRESS COMMITTEE (GIPC) IS TO CONVENE REPRESENTATIVES FROM ALL SECTORS OF THE COMMUNITY TO ADDRESS THE MOST SIGNIFICANT ISSUES OF CONCERN AND AREAS FOR OPPORTUNITY RELATED TO THE PROGRESS OF INDIANAPOLIS. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CITY OF INDIANAPOLIS, THREE VISTA POSITIONS WILL STRIVE TO IMPROVE THE CONDITIONS FOR PERSONS IN POVERTY BY ENSURING THEIR VOICES, NEEDS, AND CONCERNS ARE INCLUDED IN PUBLIC POLICYMAKING, PROMOTION OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, AND BY ADDRESSING LOCAL FOOD ACCESS AND SECURITY CHALLENGES.  
THE PROPOSED VISTA POSITIONS ALIGN WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTHY COMMUNITIES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECTS SEEK TO EXPAND OUTREACH AND PROGRAM CAPACITY TO LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS IN AREAS OF PLANNING, EMPLOYMENT AND FOOD SECURITY. ALL TOGETHER, THIS VISTA PROJECT AND ITS THREE MEMBERS WILL BENEFIT UP TO 1,500 INDIVIDUALS WITH ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES AND ENGAGE 200 LOW-INCOME INDIANAPOLIS RESIDENTS IN PLANNING PROCESSES, IN ADDITION TO REBUILDING THE LOCAL FOOD SYSTEM ORGANIZATION SEEKING TO IMPROVE FOOD ACCESS IN THE CITY.  GIPC AND THE CITY ARE INTERESTED IN CONTINUING INTO ITS SECOND YEAR THE THREE-YEAR, THREE VISTA MEMBER HOSTING AGREEMENT.

HORIZONS NATIONAL'S MISSION IS, "CHANGING THE LIFE TRAJECTORY OF LOW-INCOME STUDENTS BY INSTILLING IN THEM THE JOY OF LEARNING, THE SKILLS FOR SUCCESS, AND THE INSPIRATION TO REALIZE THEIR DREAMS."  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WELL WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA OF CNCS. HIGH QUALITY, OUT-OF-SCHOOL TIME INSTRUCTION RESULTS FROM A CONTINUED AND SIGNIFICANT INVESTMENT OF TIME AND TREASURE.  EACH VISTA WILL BE USED TO CREATE AND IMPROVE ON EXISTING STRUCTURES AND PROCESSES WITHIN EACH AFFILIATE TO SOLIDIFY THE FUTURE OF THE PROGRAM AND ITS IMPACT ON THE COMMUNITY.  THIS PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 7 SITES IN 5 STATES AND AN ESTIMATED 1,750 LOW-INCOME STUDENTS IN GRADES PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE, WITH THE MAJORITY OF THE STUDENTS BEING BETWEEN KINDERGARTEN AND 8TH GRADE. SEVEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS FUND DEVELOPMENT, MARKETING, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, AND LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY OVER THE COURSE OF ONE TO THREE YEARS.

ECHO HOUSING CORPORATION'S (EHC) MISSION IS TO CREATE AFFORDABLE HOUSING, PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES, AND PROMOTE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT IN EVANSVILLE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOCUS AREAS OF CAPACITY BUILDING AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DEVELOP DATABASES AND PROCESSES TO SUPPORT EVANSVILLE PROMISE ZONE (EVANSVILLE PZ) ADMINISTRATION FUNCTIONS WITH REGARDS TO EVALUATION, COMMUNICATION AND REPORTING; DEVELOP A COMMUNICATIONS PLAN FOR EVANSVILLE PZ WITH STRATEGIES AIMED AT REACHING COMMUNITY PARTNERS, RESIDENTS, THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND INVESTORS; INCREASE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE INVESTMENTS IN EVANSVILLE PZ BY PROVIDING ASSISTANCE WITH RESEARCH, DONOR PROSPECTING AND CORRESPONDENCE; EVENT PLANNING AND GRANTS MANAGEMENT; HELP BUILD AND SUSTAIN RESIDENT BUY-IN AND ENGAGEMENT IN THE EVANSVILLE PZ PLAN; AND STRENGTHEN CAPACITY AND SUSTAINABILITY OF GOAL AREA WORKING GROUPS BY PROVIDING ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT. THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 22,257 INDIVIDUALS. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ASSISTANCE WITH TECHNOLOGY, DATABASES AND PROCESSES, FUNDRAISING, MARKETING, COMMUNICATIONS, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, RESIDENT / COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT OVER THE COURSE OF 12-MONTHS.

A SAFE HAVEN FOUNDATION'S (ASHF) MISSION IS TO HELP PEOPLE ASPIRE, TRANSFORM AND SUSTAIN THEIR LIVES AS THEY TRANSITION FROM HOMELESSNESS TO SELF-SUFFICIENCY WITH PRIDE AND PURPOSE. A SAFE HAVEN PROVIDES THE TOOLS FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL TO OVERCOME THE ROOT CAUSES OF HOMELESSNESS THROUGH A HOLISTIC AND SCALABLE MODEL. A SAFE HAVEN'S VISIBLE SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC IMPACT UNITES FAMILIES, STABILIZES NEIGHBORHOODS, AND CREATES VIBRANT, VIABLE COMMUNITIES.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE VISTA OPIOID PROGRAMMING FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL ENHANCE ASHF'S DATA ANALYTICS FOR THE PURPOSE OF IMPROVING TARGETED PROGRAM DELIVERY, WHILE SUPPORTING STAFF THROUGH TRAINING, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, AND TARGETED OUTREACH. ASHF EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 5,000 BENEFICIARIES ANNUALLY. 

THE GOAL FOR EACH OF THE ROLES ARE TO ASSIST WITH THE SCALABILITY OF ASHF'S EXISTING SERVICES AND ENHANCE ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY BY CONTRIBUTING TO MORE DATA-DRIVEN DECISION-MAKING AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF A POPULATION HEALTH MANAGEMENT APPROACH TO OPIOID MANAGEMENT AND TREATMENT FOR CHICAGOANS AND ILLINOISANS.

WE PROPOSE INCREASING THE NUMBER OF AMERICORPS VISTAS SERVING AT ASHF TO 14 MEMBERS IN ORDER TO ENHANCE ITS EVIDENCE-BASED PREVENTION AND TREATMENT INTERVENTIONS FOR THE PURPOSE OF REDUCING OPIOID USE AND ADDICTION AMONGST ASHF'S RESIDENTS. THE GOAL IS TO FURTHER ENHANCE ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY BY CREATING QUALITY IMPROVEMENT AND STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES ACROSS ASHF DIVISIONS. 

ASHF WILL LEVERAGE THE EXPERTISE OF 14 AMERICORPS VISTAS TO ENHANCE ITS EVIDENCE-BASED PREVENTION AND TREATMENT INTERVENTIONS FOR THE PURPOSE OF REDUCING OPIOID USE AND ADDICTION AMONGST ASHF'S RESIDENTS. 

SEVEN OF THE NEW VISTAS WILL SERVE UNDER THE ASHF DIRECTOR OF PROGRAMS MAKING ORGANIZATIONAL REVISING AND UPDATING THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR THE VARIOUS CLIENT SERVING DEPARTMENTS.

THE EIGHTH AND NINTH VISTAS WILL SERVE TO STRENGTHEN THE ORGANIZATIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE, MARKETING COMMUNICATION AND VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT FOR THE ASHF OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT AND DEVELOPMENT OFFICE.

OUR MISSION AT YCC IS TO GUIDE AND MENTOR YOUNG ADULTS USING EDUCATION, JOB SKILLS TRAINING AND COMMUNITY SERVICE TO HELP DEVELOP PRODUCTIVE CITIZENS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENHANCE OUR ABILITY TO SERVICE OUR YOUTHBUILD AND CORPS NETWORK PROGRAM WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 66 TOTAL SOCIOECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED YOUNG ADULTS. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS TUTORING OUR MEMBERS IN OUR GED PROGRAM, PROVIDING IT SUPPORT, ASSIST WITH MARKETING AND RECRUITMENT FOR OUR PROGRAM, AND ASSISTS OUR DIRECTOR TEAM WITH ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR.

YOUTH & OPPORTUNITY UNITED'S (Y.O.U.'S) MISSION IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES AND LEADERSHIP TO MEET THE EMERGING NEEDS OF YOUNG PEOPLE AND THEIR FAMILIES IN EVANSTON, MORTON GROVE, AND SKOKIE, ILLINOIS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD Y.O.U.'S CAPACITY TO BRING ADDITIONAL ACADEMIC, SOCIAL, AND EMOTIONAL RESOURCES, OPPORTUNITIES, AND SUPPORTS TO LOW-INCOME YOUTH AND FAMILIES IN OUR PROGRAMS--FURTHER EMPOWERING THEM TO REALIZE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AND BUILD A PATHWAY OUT OF POVERTY, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 1,600 YOUTH AND 4,000 FAMILY MEMBERS. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BUILDING UPON AND REDEVELOPING OUR VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING PROGRAM, INCREASING OUR OUTREACH AND PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT CAPACITY, ESTABLISHING SUSTAINABLE FACILITIES PRACTICES FOR OUR NEW YOUTH
CENTER AND ADMINISTRATIVE BUILDING, AND BUILDING TO DEVELOP RESOURCES THAT SUPPORT PARENTS OF YOUTH PARTICIPANTS AND ENHANCE ORGANIZATIONAL PARENTAL ENGAGEMENT STRATEGIES.

IOWA CAMPUS COMPACT'S MISSION IS TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES TO PREPARE ALL STUDENTS TO BECOME ENGAGED CITIZENS. OUR PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE READING SCORES, CREATE FINANCIALLY LITERATE COMMUNITIES, SUSTAIN MENTORSHIPS WITH AT-RISK YOUTH, AND ELIMINATE HOMELESSNESS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED FAMILIES, CHILDREN, AND ADULTS. 15 VISTA MEMBERS AND 1 VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITED COLLEGE STUDENT VOLUNTEERS, CONDUCTING PROGRAM OUTREACH, PROVIDE TRAINING TO CHILD ABUSE AND HOMELESS PRACTIONERS, AND CREATE MENTORSHIP PROGRAMS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

IOWA COLLEGE AID?S MISSION IS TO ADVOCATE FOR AND SUPPORT IOWANS AS THEY EXPLORE, FINANCE, AND COMPLETE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES BEYOND HIGH SCHOOL TO INCREASE FAMILY AND COMMUNITY SUCCESS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO HELP STUDENTS ACCESS AND COMPLETE COLLEGE, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 300 STUDENTS. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING FAFSA PROFILES FOR SCHOOLS, HELPING SCHOOLS DEVELOP STRATEGIES FOR INCLUSIVE EVENTS, DEVELOPING TOOLKITS FOR SUSTAINING VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND DEVELOPMENT, AND DEVELOPING A CURRICULUM TO HELP STUDENTS AND PARENTS COMPLETE THE STEPS TO COLLEGE ENROLLMENT AND FOR ADDRESSING SUMMER MELT OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

IOWA CAMPUS COMPACT?S MISSION IS TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES TO PREPARE ALL STUDENTS TO BECOME ENGAGED CITIZENS. OUR PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE READING SCORES, CREATE FINANCIALLY LITERATE COMMUNITIES, SUSTAIN MENTORSHIPS WITH AT-RISK YOUTH, AND ELIMINATE HOMELESSNESS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED FAMILIES, CHILDREN, AND ADULTS. 12 VISTA MEMBERS AND  1 VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITED COLLEGE STUDENT VOLUNTEERS, CONDUCTING PROGRAM OUTREACH, PROVIDE TRAINING TO CHILD ABUSE AND HOMELESS PRACTITIONERS, AND CREATE MENTORSHIP PROGRAMS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF IOWA'S MISSION IS "SEEKING TO PUT GOD'S LOVE INTO ACTION, HABITAT FOR HUMANITY BRINGS PEOPLE TOGETHER TO BUILD HOMES, COMMUNITIES, AND HOPE." THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY - HOUSING FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO 1) INCREASE ACCESS TO CURRENT PROGRAMS AND RESOURCES BY EXPANDING RESOURCES INTO UNDERSERVED RURAL AREAS OF THE STATE AND 2) DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO INCREASE DONATIONS THAT WILL RESULT IN MORE AFFORDABLE HOUSING CONSTRUCTED AND REPAIRED, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT LOW-INCOME IOWA FAMILIES MOVED FROM POVERTY HOUSING TO DECENT AFFORDABLE HOMES. EIGHT VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES OF CAPACITY BUILDING AT HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF IOWA AFFILIATES TO SERVE MORE LOW-INCOME FAMILIES ACROSS THE STATE.

DOWNCITY DESIGN IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO HELPING PEOPLE DESIGN SOLUTIONS FOR THEIR COMMUNITIES. OUR MISSION IS IMPROVE THE CORE CITIES OF RHODE ISLAND BY INVITING CITIZENS TO IMAGINE AND CREATE BETTER FUTURES, USING THE TOOLS OF DESIGN. WE OFFER FREE DESIGN EDUCATION PROGRAMS THAT HELP YOUNG PEOPLE BECOME CHANGE-MAKERS BY INVITING THEM TO CREATE STRUCTURES THAT RESPOND CREATIVELY TO CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. WE ALSO CONVENE COMMUNITY DESIGN DIALOGUES THAT HELP GROUPS REIMAGINE PUBLIC SPACES AND SOLVE CIVIC PROBLEMS USING THE DESIGN PROCESS AS A FRAMEWORK, AND WE OFFER PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR EDUCATORS AND DESIGNERS. OUR VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA, WITH THE PRIMARY GOAL OF EXPANDING OUR CAPACITY TO BRING OUR FREE DESIGN PROGRAMS TO OVER 120 YOUTH IN PROVIDENCE THIS YEAR. OUR ONE (1) AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBER WILL HELP US TO BETTER SHARE THE EXCITING WORK THAT DCD IS DOING WITH OUR EXISTING FRIENDS AND FANS, AND WILL HELP US TO EXPAND OUR REACH TO NEW AUDIENCES THROUGH ENGAGING VISUAL STORYTELLING ON OUR NEW WEBSITE AND ACROSS SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS. OUR VISTA MEMBER WILL ALSO ASSIST US WITH FUND DEVELOPMENT, INCLUDING IMPLEMENTING AND DOCUMENTING SYSTEMS FOR DONOR OUTREACH AND RESEARCHING AND PREPARING GRANT PROPOSALS. AND HE OR SHE WILL HELP TO RECRUIT AND MANAGE VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST WITH OUR PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

NEW URBAN ARTS IS A NATIONALLY-RECOGNIZED COMMUNITY ARTS STUDIO FOR HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WITH AN EXPANSION PROGRAM LOCATED INSIDE THE NEIGHBORING CENTRAL HIGH SCHOOL (NUA KNIGHTS).  THE MISSION IS TO BUILD A VITAL COMMUNITY THAT EMPOWERS YOUNG PEOPLE AS ARTISTS AND LEADERS TO DEVELOP A CREATIVE PRACTICE THEY CAN SUSTAIN THROUGHOUT THEIR LIVES. THE NUA KNIGHTS EXPANSION PROGRAM PROVIDES RESOURCES, SERVICES AND OPPORTUNITIES TO URBAN YOUTH THAT ARE UNAVAILABLE DURING SCHOOL HOURS.  THE GOALS OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, INCREASED ATTENDANCE AS WELL AS LESS DISCIPLINARY REFERRALS FOR PARTICIPATING STUDENTS (K-12 SUCCESS). PROGRAMS WITH A STEAM (SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, ART AND MATH) ARE GIVEN PRIORITY. TWO VISTA POSITIONS ARE BEING REQUESTED THAT WILL HELP BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE NUA KNIGHTS AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS AND PROVIDE STUDENTS WITH THE SKILLS AND OPPORTUNITIES TO  HELP THEM SUCCEED IN THEIR POST SECONDARY CHOICES AND BREAK THE CYCLE OF POVERTY MANY URBAN YOUTH FACE. THE VISTAS WILL DESIGN, REVISE AND IMPLEMENT AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS AND INFRASTRUCTURE. THE ESTIMATED TIME FRAME TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT IS THREE YEARS.

OPENDOORS IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING SERVICES AND ADVOCACY TO PEOPLE WITH CRIMINAL RECORDS. THIS WORK DEALS WITH THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION. THE VISTA WILL SEEK TO COORDINATE VOLUNTEERS, ORGANIZE OUTREACH EVENTS, ASSIST WITH FUNDRAISING, AND HELP PRODUCE PROGRAM REPORTS AND EVALUATIONS.  THE PROJECT SEEKS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 30 NEW BENEFICIARIES (FORMERLY INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS) DURING THIS THIRD YEAR. OPENDOORS IS APPLYING FOR ONE VISTA VOLUNTEER TO CONTINUE THE THREE YEAR PROJECT FOR A THIRD AND FINAL YEAR.

FARM FRESH RHODE ISLAND'S MISSION IS THE CREATION OF A LOCAL FOOD SYSTEM THAT VALUES THE HEALTH, ENVIRONMENT AND QUALITY OF LIFE OF RHODE ISLAND FARMERS AND EATERS. THIS PROJECT ALIGNS WITH VISTA'S HEALTHY FUTURES PRIORITY AREA. THE MAIN ACTIVITIES IN THIS PROPOSAL ARE INCREASING CAPACITY FOR FARM FRESH'S NUTRITION EDUCATION PROGRAMMING BY DEVELOPING VOLUNTEER RESOURCES, ANALYZING AND ENHANCING THE PROGRAM'S CURRICULUM FOR MULTIPLE AUDIENCES AND DEVELOPING THE PROGRAM'S ABILITY TO MONITOR ITS EFFICACY, WITH A GOAL OF PROVIDING LIFE-SKILLS EDUCATION TO 5,000 LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS AT RISK OF DIET-RELATED AILMENTS. WE REQUEST THREE FULL YEAR VISTA MEMBERS TO COMPLETE THESE PROJECTS OVER THE COURSE OF THE YEAR.

FARM FRESH RHODE ISLAND WILL HOST THREE SUMMER VISTA ASSOCIATES WHO WILL BE PLACED IN THREE SEPARATE FARM FRESH RHODE ISLAND PROGRAMS. ONE VISTA POSITION WILL BE PLACED WITH OUR NUTRITION EDUCATION PROGRAM WHICH OFFERS FOOD LITERACY, COOKING ON A BUDGET, AND NUTRITION EDUCATION CLASSES AT FARMERS MARKETS, LIBRARY AND SENIOR CENTERS ACROSS RHODE ISLAND. THIS POSITION WILL ASSIST WITH PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION. THE SECOND VISTA POSITION WILL BE PLACED WITH OUR FARMERS MARKET PROGRAM. FARM FRESH RHODE ISLAND MANAGES 6 OUTDOOR FARMERS MARKETS WHICH ARE PLACED IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES. THIS VISTA WILL SUPPORT FARM FRESH RI PROGRAM STAFF IN FACILITATING USDA FOOD ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS ON-SITE AT FARMERS MARKETS AND PROVIDE SUPPORT TO CUSTOMERS ON HOW TO USE USDA FOOD ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS. OUR THIRD SUMMER VISTA POSITION WILL BE PLACED WITH OUR HOPES HARVEST PROGRAM, WHICH IS A FOOD RESCUE GLEANING PROGRAM. THIS VISTA WILL SUPPORT HOPE'S HARVEST STAFF IN COORDINATING GLEANING VOLUNTEERS FOR GLEANING TRIPS AND OUTREACH FOR NEW VOLUNTEERS AT COMMUNITY EVENTS ACROSS RHODE ISLAND.

ESTABLISHED IN 1992, THE CHILDHOOD LEAD ACTION PROJECT'S MISSION IS TO ELIMINATE CHILDHOOD LEAD POISONING IN RHODE ISLAND THROUGH EDUCATION, PARENT SUPPORT, AND ADVOCACY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT REFLECTS THE VISTA PRIORITY OF SERVING AREAS OF CONCENTRATED POVERTY, AND ALIGNS WITH TWO VISTA FY18 PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES (EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY/HOUSING) AND ONE FY18 PRIORITY POPULATION (GEOGRAPHIC - AREAS OF CONCENTRATED POVERTY). THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO IMPLEMENT THE LEAD PREVENTION EDUCATION AND DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE, SPEARHEADING NEW EDUCATION, FUNDRAISING AND AWARENESS EFFORTS FOR OUR ORGANIZATION, AND BENEFITING UPWARDS OF 100 RHODE ISLAND-BASED REFUGEES AND HUNDREDS OF OTHER LOW-INCOME FAMILIES AT RISK FOR HAVING A CHILD POISONED BY THE TOXIC EFFECTS OF LEAD. OVER THE COURSE OF ONE FULL-TIME YEAR OF WORK, TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL DEDICATE THE MAJORITY OF THEIR TIME TO EXPANDING OUR ORGANIZATION'S FUND DEVELOPMENT CAPACITY AND BUILDING INFRASTRUCTURE IN LOW-INCOME RHODE ISLAND COMMUNITIES THAT WILL REDUCE THE EXPOSURE OF REFUGEES AND OTHER HIGH-RISK CHILDREN TO LEAD HAZARDS IN HOUSING.

SOCIAL ENTERPRISE GREENHOUSE'S MISSION IS CREATES POSITIVE SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC IMPACTS BY SUPPORTING SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURS AND ENTERPRISES WITH THE TOOLS AND NETWORKS THEY NEED TO THRIVE. WE ARE A NETWORK OF ENTERPRISE AND COMMUNITY LEADERS WHO CONTRIBUTE TIME, EXPERTISE AND MONEY TO CREATE JOBS AND SUPPORT POSITIVE SOCIAL CHANGE, INCLUDING POVERTY ALLEVIATION, THROUGH SOCIAL ENTERPRISE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH CNCS'S FOCUS AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION. SEG'S VISTA INTERMEDIARY PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DIVERSIFY OUR CLIENT AND VOLUNTEER BASE, ENGAGE COMMUNITIES THAT ARE UNDERSERVED AND UNDERREPRESENTED, AND SERVICE THESE BENEFICIARIES WITH USEFUL AND BENEFICIAL PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THROUGH SEG, 35 ORGANIZATIONS WILL RECEIVE CAPACITY BUILDING SERVICES, WITH 30 TO REPORT MORE EFFICIENCY DUE TO PROGRAMMING, AND 100 VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE WITH ASSISTING TO BRING CAPACITY BUILDING AND EFFICIENCY TO THESE 35 ORGANIZATIONS. THREE VISTA MEMBERS IN THIS COHORT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE ABOVE MENTIONED SEG PROJECT, THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO RHODE ISLAND FOR COMMUNITY AND JUSTICE, TWO VISTA MEMBERS TO THE INSTITUTE FOR THE STUDY AND PRACTICE OF NONVIOLENCE, AND ONE VISTA MEMBER TO GROUNDWORK RHODE ISLAND. ONE VISTA LEADER WILL BOLSTER THE VISTA COHORT EXPERIENCE THROUGH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, SUPPORT, AND PEER LEARNING AND COMMUNITY BUILDING OPPORTUNITIES. THESE 10 VISTA MEMBERS HOSTED UNDER SEG'S INTERMEDIARY WILL ACHIEVE THEIR PERFORMANCE MEASURES THROUGH ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITMENT, OUTREACH, PROCESS DEVELOPMENT, FINANCIAL DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THEIR ONE YEAR SERVICE PERIOD.

FAMILY SERVICE OF RHODE ISLAND'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE OVERALL HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE THROUGH HIGH IMPACT PARTNERSHIPS AND HIGH QUALITY PROGRAMS.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA IN THAT IT BUILDS FSRI'S CAPACITY TO PARTNER EFFECTIVELY WITH SEVERAL SCHOOLS TO IMPROVE ATTENDANCE THROUGH FSRI'S WALKING SCHOOL BUS PROGRAM AND OTHER ACTIVITIES SUPPORTING/IMPROVING THE SCHOOLS' CAPACITY TO EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS ATTENDANCE CHALLENGES.  PCI WORKS TO DEVELOP AND CONNECT PEOPLE WITH OPPORTUNITIES AND RESOURCES THAT WILL HELP THEM OVERCOME POVERTY AND SUPPORT FAMILY WELL-BEING RESULTING IN INCREASED EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS FOR CHILDREN.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THESE GOALS.  
     SPECIFICALLY, OUR VISTA MEMBER WILL WORK TO INCREASE CAPACITIES IN THE AREAS OF VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND SUSTAINABILITY, EFFECTIVE SCHOOL ENGAGEMENT, AND BUILDING COLLABORATIVE COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS WHICH WILL HELP SUSTAIN PCI. THIS PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE 400+ STUDENTS ATTENDING MARY E. FOGARTY ELEMENTARY AND THEIR FAMILIES AS WELL AS ADDITIONAL STUDENTS AT THE TWO OTHER PROVIDENCE SCHOOLS WHERE WE PROVIDE WALKING SCHOOL BUS (WSB) ROUTES AND/OR OTHER SUPPORT.  IN ADDITION, SUSTAINING PCI EFFORTS WILL BENEFIT THE ENTIRE LSP COMMUNITY.  
     ONE (1) VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS FOR OUR WSB (A PROGRAM WHERE VOLUNTEERS ARE MATCHED WITH CHRONICALLY ABSENT CHILDREN AND ENSURE THEY ARRIVE TO AND FROM SCHOOL SAFELY), IDENTIFYING NEW COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES THAT WILL SUSTAIN PCI EFFORTS, AND IMPROVING ACCESS TO RESOURCES FOR THE SCHOOLS AND THE STUDENTS AS WELL AS THEIR FAMILIES OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT SCHOOL YEAR.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:
RIVERZEDGE ARTS' MISSION IS TO IMPROVE LIVES AND PLACES THROUGH ART, DESIGN, AND CREATIVE PROBLEM SOLVING. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOCUS AREAS OF EDUCATION AND CAPACITY BUILDING. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE OUR PROGRAM'S ABILITY TO GENERATE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES AND PARTNERSHIPS AND ACHIEVE BETTER OUTCOMES FOR BENEFICIARIES, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 200 PARTICIPANTS. OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT THREE YEARS, OUR THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS (1) IMPROVE YOUTH LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT AND CAREER READINESS OPPORTUNITIES, (2) RECRUIT AND MANAGE COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS AND (3) IMPROVE OUR ORGANIZATION'S COMMUNICATION AND ENGAGEMENT WITHIN THE COMMUNITY OF WOONSOCKET, AS WELL AS (4) REVAMP OUR OVERALL MARKETING AND FUNDRAISING EFFORTS THROUGHOUT GREATER RHODE ISLAND.

THE SWEARER CENTER'S MISSION IS TO CREATE A COMMUNITY OF SCHOLARS, STUDENTS, PRACTITIONERS, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS THAT WORK TOGETHER TO BUILD ON COMMUNITY STRENGTHS AND ADDRESS COMMUNITY CHALLENGES TO MAKE POSITIVE IMPACT IN THE FIELDS OF EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, THE ARTS, ECONOMIC JUSTICE AND HEALTH. THE  PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION,  ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS.

THE VISTA PROJECT WILL BUILD CAPACITY OF THE HOST AGENCY AS WELL AS SUB-GRANTEE SITES, AND WILL BENEFIT THESE NINE HOST ORGANIZATIONS, THEIR PARTNERS, AND CLIENTS. THIRTEEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY, AND PARTNERSHIP/ NETWORK BUILDING ACTIVITIES OVER THE COURSE OF THE THREE YEAR PROJECT.  THE PROJECT WILL SUBGRANT VISTA MEMBERS TO PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS AND THE INTERMEDIARY ORGANIZATION WILL PROVIDE VALUE ADDED TO THOSE SUBGRANTEE PARTNERS THROUGH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, MEMBER SUPPORT AND TRAINING, AND AN INTEGRATED APPROACH TO MANAGING VISTA MEMBERS AS A CITY-WIDE TEAM.

DORCAS INTERNATIONAL INSTITUTE OF RHODE ISLAND IS AN INDEPENDENT, MULTI-SERVICE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE PURPOSE IS TO ASSIST THOSE WHO ARE WORKING TO OVERCOME CULTURAL, EDUCATIONAL ECONOMIC, AND LANGUAGE BARRIERS TO ACHIEVE SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN THEIR COMMUNITY.

DORCAS INTERNATIONAL IS SEEKING SUPPORT FOR TWO AMERICORPS VISTAS FOR AGENCY-WIDE CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECTS EXPECTED TO SPAN TWO MORE YEARS. OUR PROJECTS WILL ADDRESS:  1) ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY BY EXPANDING ACCESS TO HOUSING BY WORKING WITH PARTNERS AND LANDLORDS TO INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF SAFE AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR NEWLY ARRIVING REFUGEES AND; 2) OUTREACH AND COMMUNICATIONS TO OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF PARTNERSHIPS.

AS OF 2018, DORCAS INTERNATIONAL IS THE ONLY AGENCY IN RHODE ISLAND RESPONSIBLE FOR RESETTLING REFUGEES IN RHODE ISLAND. IN 2017, WE RESETTLED OVER 200 REFUGEES AND OFFERED SERVICES TO OVER 500 REFUGEES, INCLUDING EVACUEES OF PUERTO RICO'S DEVASTATING HURRICANES, WHO HAVE BEEN IN RHODE ISLAND LESS THAN FIVE YEARS.

A CONTINUATION OF FUNDING FOR YEAR TWO WILL ENABLE US TO INCREASE OUR CAPACITY IN RHODE ISLAND. WITH A CONCENTRATION ON: 1) FINDING AND CATEGORIZING  RESOURCES TO MEET OUR CLIENT NEEDS FOR HOUSING, HEALTHCARE, YOUTH PROGRAMS, FINANCIAL LITERACY PROGRAMS AND EMPLOYMENT WITH A "COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT COORDINATOR," AND 2) INCREASING AWARENESS  AROUND DORCAS INTERNATIONAL SERVICES AND PROGRAMS TO EXPAND THE NUMBER OF CLIENTS SERVED WITHIN OUR IMMIGRATION AND CITIZENSHIP SERVICES, EMPLOYMENT SERVICES, TRANSLATION AND INTERPRETING, AND OUR CLOTHING COLLABORATIVE WITH A NEWLY CREATED VISTA  POSITION "COMMUNITY OUTREACH MARKETING COORDINATOR." 

WITH TWO NEW VISTA MEMBERS, WE PLAN TO 1) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PARTNERSHIPS TO FILL THE GAPS IN SERVICES AND RESOURCES OUR CURRENT CLIENTS NEED AND CREATE A DATABASE THAT CASE MANAGERS AND STAFF CAN REFER TO SERVE CLIENTS MORE EFFICIENTLY AND EXPEDIENTLY. AND 2) INCREASE OUR CLIENT BASE OF 4500, BY AT LEAST 10% (450) OVER THE NEXT YEAR BY INCREASING MARKETING OUTREACH EFFORTS FOR COLLATERAL DISTRIBUTION, OUTREACH TO BUSINESSES, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, SCHOOLS AND OTHER SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS WHERE POTENTIAL CLIENTS MAY ALREADY EXIST, AND HAVE ADDITIONAL NEEDS WE CAN FILL.

INE'S MISSION IS TO ACCOMPANY, TRAIN AND SERVE COMMUNITIES IN PUERTO RICO THROUGH PUBLIC MONTESSORI EDUCATION TO ACHIEVE THE DEVELOPMENT OF HUMAN BEINGS PREPARED TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE COMMON GOOD. THIS VISTA PROJECT IS ALIGNED WITH THE EDUCATION PROGRAMMING PRIORITY FOCUS AREA. THIS PROJECT WILL HAVE EIGHT VISTAS DEVELOPING THE ORGANIZATION INFRASTRUCTURE ON GRANT WRITING / FUNDRAISING, SOCIAL MEDIA AND CROWDFUNDING, EVALUATION AND OUTCOMES SYSTEMS, VOLUNTEER PROGRAM OPERATIONAL STRUCTURE, WORK FORCE DEVELOPMENT, FAMILIAR HOUSE PROGRAM OPERATIONAL STRUCTURE, SPECIAL PROJECTS OPERATIONAL STRUCTURE AND CASE STUDY PROJECT OPERATIONAL STRUCTURE. THE MAIN OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO SOLIDIFY INE'S ADMINISTRATIVE STRUCTURE IN A WAY THAT FACILITATES ORGANIZATIONAL GROWTH AS WELL AS THAT OF THE MONTESSORI PUBLIC EDUCATION PROGRAM. THIS PROGRAM WILL BENEFIT A TOTAL OF 5,600 STUDENTS IN 50 PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IMPACTED BY THE MONTESSORI PROGRAM.

THE PUERTO RICO TOURISM COMPANY IS AN AGENCY THAT PROMOTES THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE ISLAND; AND,  IT IS OUR INTEREST TO ENCOURAGE THE DEVELOPMENT OF MODALITIES TO DIVERSIFY THE OFFER AND POSITION THE ISLAND AS AN ATTRACTIVE SUSTAINABLE DESTINATION.  HOWEVER, FOR THE DEVELOPMENT TO BE PERENNIAL, IT SHOULD BE FRAMED UNDER THE ELEMENTS OF SUSTAINABILITY.  FOR THIS REASON, AND UNDER ACT NO. 254 OF NOVEMBER 30, 2006 KNOWN AS THE ?PUBLIC POLICY FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT OF TOURISM IN PUERTO RICO?, THE SUSTAINABLE TOURISM DIVISION WAS CREATED.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT IS SEEKING TO PROVIDE A FRAMEWORK TO LEAD TO ECONOMIC SELF-SUSTAINABILITY IN EACH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION, AND IS EXPECTING TO BENEFIT THE RURAL POPULATION OF THE FOLLOWING TOWNS: ARECIBO, GUANICA, MAUNABO, MAYAGUEZ, MOROVIS AND UTUADO.  FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS WRITING PROPOSALS, ESTABLISHING A STRUCTURE FOR FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES, IDENTIFYING AND DEVELOPING AN ALLIANCE WITH LOCAL BUSINESSES TO CREATE A SOLIDARY ECONOMY AND A POTENTIAL CREATION OF A TOURISM CIRCUIT, DEVELOPMENT OF A PROMOTIONAL WEB PAGE INCLUDING RESERVATION AND PAYMENT SYSTEMS, MARKETING STRATEGIES WITH SOCIAL MEDIA, DEVELOPMENT OF THE ACCOUNTABILITY AND ADMINISTRATIVE SYSTEM FOR THE TOURISM OFFERS, AND WORK OUT THE STRUCTURE FOR THE VOLUNTARY COMPONENT OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

BOYS & GIRLS CLUBS OF PUERTO RICO'S MISSION IS TARGETED TO PROVIDE CHILDREN AND YOUTH PARTICIPANTS A SAFE AND CREATIVE PLACE IN WHICH THEY CAN DEVELOP SKILLS BY SUPPORTING THE FULFILLMENT OF INDIVIDUAL, ACADEMIC, AND PROFESSIONAL GOALS IN ORDER TO BECOME EFFECTIVE LEADERS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO REDUCE POVERTY AND PROVIDE SUSTAINABLE LIVING OPPORTUNITIES TO PUERTO RICAN LOW-INCOME FAMILIES RESIDING IN THE COMMUNITIES SURROUNDING BGCPR'S CLUB UNITS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 16,215 YOUTHS. EIGHT (8) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS EXPOSITIONS, SPECIAL EVENTS, COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES TO PROMOTE THE SERVICES OF BGCPR, AND TRAINING ACTIVITIES FOR STAFF.  IN ADDITION, THE FOLLOWING PRODUCTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE AVAILABLE AT THE END OF THE PROJECT: EXPOSITIONS, SPECIAL EVENTS, SOCIAL MEDIA CONTENT, FUNDRAISING INITIATIVES, ESTABLISHED FINANCIAL PROCESSES, COMPLIANCE STRATEGIES, COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES TO PROMOTE THE SERVICES OF BGCPR, AND TRAINING ACTIVITIES FOR STAFF AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS. IN ADDITION, THE FOLLOWING PRODUCTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE AVAILABLE AT THE END OF THE PROJECT: ORGANIZATIONAL ANALYSIS RELATED TO NEW STRATEGIC DIRECTION, DESIGN TRAINING AND INDUCTION MODULES, PLANS AND ACTIVITIES FOCUSED ON OUR NEW ORGANIZATIONAL DIRECTION, SOCIAL MEDIA BRAND STRATEGY DIRECTLY RELATED TO OUR NEW ORGANIZATIONAL STRATEGIC PLAN (2019-2024). IN ADDITION, THEY WILL ASSESS AND INNOVATE DEPARTMENTAL POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND DOCUMENTS TO IMPROVE THE EFFECTIVENESS AND SUSTAINABILITY OF ALL ADMINISTRATIVE, TECHNICAL PROCESSES AND FINANCIAL AND OPERATIONAL COMPLIANCE.

THE PLANNED PROGRAM STRATEGY WILL IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN IN EIGHT MUNICIPALITIES OF PUERTO RICO IN THE SAN JUAN BAY ESTUARY WATERSHED: SAN JUAN, GUAYNABO, BAYAMON, CATA?O, TOA BAJA, LOIZA, TRUJILLO ALTO, AND CAROLINA.  THE PROJECTS WILL FOCUS ON POST-SECONDARY SUCCESS; STEM EDUCATION; AND COMMUNITY COLLEGES.  THIS WILL BE ATTAINED BY ENHANCING, FORMALIZING AND EXPANDING UPON PROGRAMS AT THE ENTITY SUCH AS: CITIZEN SCIENCE; INTERNSHIP PROGRAM; GUARDIANS OF THE ESTUARY; AND YOUTH LEADERSHIP. 

THROUGH THE CITIZEN SCIENCE PROGRAM, VOLUNTEERS PERFORM RESTORATION AND WATER QUALITY MONITORING ACTIVITIES THROUGHOUT THE SAN JUAN BAY ESTUARY. THIS ALLOWS THEM TO LEARN OF CAREERS WITHIN THE STEM FIELD AND INTEREST THEMSELVES WITH SCIENCE TOPICS. THOSE THAT ARE IN THEIR FORMATIVE YEARS LEARN IF THEY WISH TO FURTHER EXPAND THEIR EDUCATION. FOR EXAMPLE, A SJBEP VOLUNTEER SINCE THE 9TH GRADE, CHANGED HER CAREER INTEREST TOWARDS STEM -- ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE -- UPON COLLABORATING WITH WATER QUALITY MONITORING ACTIVITIES. THE VOLUNTEERS RECEIVE FORMAL TRAINING FROM SJBEP PERSONNEL. (STEM EDUCATION AND POST-SECONDARY SUCCESS) CITIZEN SCIENCE PROVIDES A WAY TO ENGAGE ALL PARTS OF SOCIETY IN GAINING A DEEPER UNDERSTANDING OF HUMAN ENVIRONMENTS, BUILD AN INFORMED POPULATION THAT CAN ADVOCATE SUCCESSFULLY FOR ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION, AND MORE EFFECTIVELY PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM PROVIDES VOCATIONAL SCHOOL, COMMUNITY COLLEGE, AND UNIVERSITY STUDENTS OPPORTUNITIES TO FURTHER THEIR KNOWLEDGE BY HAVING A HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE WITH A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT WORKS WITH THE GENERAL AND SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF THE SAN JUAN BAY ESTUARY. THIS PROJECT PARTNERS THE ORGANIZATION WITH THE EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION. THE SAN JUAN BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM HAS RECEIVED INTERNSHIP STUDENTS FROM DIFFERENT EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS AND GRADUATE STUDENTS. THE EXPERIENCE HELPS THEM CHANNEL THEIR EDUCATIONAL AND WORK INTERESTS AS WELL AS AN OPPORTUNITY TO ENHANCE THEIR RESUME AND NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH PARTNER ORGANIZATION INTERACTIONS WITH THE SJBEP. (COMMUNITY COLLEGES AND POST-SECONDARY SUCCESS)

GUARDIANS OF THE ESTUARY IS A PROGRAM FOR 6TH GRADERS AND ABOVE THAT HELPS DEVELOP LEADERSHIP SKILLS AS WELL AS KNOWLEDGE REGARDING THE QUALITY OF THE BODIES OF WATER SURROUNDING THEIR COMMUNITY.  THIS HIGHLY SCIENTIFIC PROGRAM ALLOWS DIRECT INTERACTION WITH NATURE.  IT HELPS FOSTER STEM FIELD EDUCATION BY PROVIDING EXPERIENCES IN THE FIELD.  SJBEP HAS OFFERED THIS PROGRAM FOR OVER FIVE YEARS AND IT HAS BEEN IMPLEMENTED IN ENLACE. (STEM EDUCATION).

THE YOUTH LEADERSHIP PROGRAM IS BASED ON A PILOT THAT TOOK PLACE WITH STUDENTS FROM THE MUNICIPALITY OF DORADO. THE STUDENTS PARTICIPATED OF RESTORATION AND MONITORING ACTIVITIES WITH A COMMUNITY FOCUS. AT EACH SITE, STUDENTS WERE RECEIVED BY A COMMUNITY LEADER WHO EXPLAINED FIRST-HAND THE IMPORTANCE OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL WORK BEING DONE; THE STUDENTS INTERACTED WITH THEM AND ASKED QUESTIONS. THE PROGRAM ALLOWS THE STUDENTS A HOLISTIC APPROACH OF PROJECT FORMATION FROM NEEDS IDENTIFICATION, TO PROJECT PLANNING, EXECUTION AND REPORTING.  THE GOAL IS TO PROVIDE STUDENTS WHO ARE INTERESTED IN COMMUNITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES WITH THE TOOLS TO BECOME ESTUARINE LEADERS FROM AN EARLY AGE, IDENTIFYING ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES WITHIN THEIR OWN COMMUNITIES AND WORKING TO SOLVE THEM. (STEM EDUCATION).  VISTAS WILL DEVELOP PLANNING, EXECUTION, AND EVALUATION PROCEDURES THROUGH THE YOUTH LEADERSHIP PROGRAM REGARDING BLIGHT AND ABANDONED LOTS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. (EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY).

HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF PUERTO RICO'S MISSION IS TO HELP INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES ACHIEVE STABILITY, SELF-SUFFICIENCY, AND A BETTER FUTURE THROUGH HOME-OWNERSHIP. ITS VISION IS OF A WORLD WHERE EVERYONE HAS A DECENT PLACE TO LIVE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO CREATE A MORE EFFICIENT AND SUSTAINABLE ORGANIZATION AND BUILD ITS CAPACITY SO THAT IT CAN EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS THE NEED FOR AFFORDABLE HOUSING THROUGHOUT PUERTO RICO. WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS,  COMMUNITIES, NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND MUNICIPALITIES THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS. THE FOUR (INCLUDING ONE UNDER DISASTER) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: COMMUNITY AND ORGANIZATIONAL ASSESSMENT, MATERIAL DEVELOPMENT, OUTREACH, MEASUREMENT, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY, FINANCIAL RESOURCES, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, AMONG OTHER TASKS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR OF SERVICE. HABITAT FOR HUMANITY REQUESTS AN ADDITIONAL VISTA FOR DISASTER SERVICES INCLUDING LONG-TERM DISASTER RECOVERY, PROJECTS
 THAT FOCUS ON PROVIDING HOUSING, PROMOTING RESTORATION, AND SUPPORTING INITIATIVES THAT ADDRESS THE LONG-TERM NEEDS OF AFFECTED, LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS.

THE MISSION OF THE LOCAL REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY FOR ROOSEVELT ROADS IS TO ACCELERATE THE REDEVELOPMENT OF THE FORMER NAVAL STATION ROOSEVELT ROADS (FNSRR) TO BENEFIT THE MUNICIPALITIES OF CEIBA, NAGUABO AND FAJARDO, AND THE WIDER EASTERN REGION OF PUERTO RICO BY CREATING JOBS AND SPURRING ECONOMIC GROWTH IN THE AREA. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE PROGRAM'S FOCUS AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. THE PROJECT SEEKS TO COUNTER THE DEVASTATING EFFECTS OF UNEMPLOYMENT AND POVERTY EXACERBATED BY THE CLOSURE OF THE FNSRR. THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO BENEFIT A CURRENT POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 69,103 PEOPLE WITH AN AVERAGE POVERTY RATE OF 45.7% AND A RISING UNEMPLOYMENT, NOW CLOSE TO A RATE OF 11.3%. TOTAL POPULATION IS DOWN BY NEARLY 10.7% SINCE 2010. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO ACHIEVE THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ASSISTING THE LRA IN FURTHERING REDEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT; SUPPORTING JOB-PLACEMENT AND WORKFORCE READINESS; AND SUPPORTING THE DEVELOPMENT AND ONGOING SUCCESS OF LOCAL ENTREPRENEURS AND SMALL BUSINESS OWNERS. OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR, VISTA MEMBERS WILL ALSO HELP STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY BY DESIGNING AND BUILDING A SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY NETWORKING TO INVOLVE THE COMMUNITY IN THE REDEVELOPMENT EFFORTS AND PROVIDE ITS MEMBERS WITH A PLATFORM TO EXPRESS THEIR CONCERNS AND RAISE ISSUES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE ANA G. MENDEZ UNIVERSITY SYSTEM (SUAGM ACCORDING TO ITS SPANISH ACRONYM) IS A NON-PROFIT ENTITY OF HIGHER EDUCATION WHOSE PRINCIPAL MISSION IS TO PROMOTE THE CULTURAL, SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND WELL-BEING OF THE PUERTO RICAN SOCIETY, AS WELL AS OF OTHER HISPANIC COMMUNITIES OUTSIDE OF PUERTO RICO, BY OFFERING EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITIES WHICH IT SERVES. SUAGM OPERATES AND DEVELOPS ITS EDUCATIONAL MISSION THROUGH AN INTEGRATED SYSTEM COMPOSED OF THE: UNIVERSIDAD DEL ESTE (UNE), UNIVERSIDAD DEL TURABO (UT), UNIVERSIDAD METROPOLITANA (UMET), THE ANA G. MENDEZ UNIVERSITY (AGMU), AND THE SYSTEM TV-ANA G. MENDEZ UNIVERSITY CHANNEL (SITV). 

UNIVERSIDAD DEL TURABO (UT), THROUGH THE UT PLACEMENT CENTER, WILL SERVE AS THE INTERMEDIARY ORGANIZATION OF THE NEW AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT: "ALLIANCE OF VOLUNTEERS IN ACTION AND SERVICE TO PUERTO RICO (VIAS PR)" IN THE ROLE OF COMMUNITY FACILITATOR. THIS ALLIANCE CONSISTS OF THE FOLLOWING SUAGM INSTITUTIONS: UT, UNE AND UMET. THE VIAS PR AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT WILL EXPAND THE ABILITY OF THE ORGANIZATION TO PROMOTE ITS CAPACITY BUILDING ISLAND WIDE TO OVERCOME POVERTY. 

WITH THE PURPOSE OF STRENGTHENING AND SUPPLEMENTING EFFORTS TO ELIMINATE AND ALLEVIATE POVERTY, THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURE FOCUS AREAS OF THE CNCS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO: 

A.STRENGTHEN AND IMPLEMENT THE TECHNOLOGICAL INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE DIFFERENT PLACEMENT CENTERS LOCATED AT THE THREE (3) ALLIANCE INSTITUTIONS TO ENHANCE NEW LABOR MARKET TENDENCIES TO INCREASE COMMUNITY EMPLOYMENT INSERTION AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT.
B.PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY THROUGH STRENGTHENING EMPLOYABILITY AND ENTREPRENEURIAL SKILLS, SO PEOPLE CAN BE EMPLOYED OR SELF-EMPLOYED THROUGH JOB OR INCUBATOR SERVICES.
C.WORK WITH ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS FROM MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES TO INFORM AND HELP THEM IMPROVE THEIR PERSPECTIVE TOWARD CONTINUING THEIR EDUCATION AND HELP THEM ENTER A POST-SECONDARY INSTITUTION, ASSISTING THEM TO ASCERTAIN THEIR NEEDS AND PREFERENCES; THUS, CONTRIBUTING TO INCREASE THE IMPACT OF NATIONAL SERVICES IN COMMUNITIES SERVED BY CNCS SUPPORT PROGRAMS.
D.TO EXPAND UNE'S VOLUNTARISM AND COMMUNITY SERVICE PROJECT WITHIN THE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT STRUCTURE.
E.CREATE AND IMPLEMENT THE UT ALUMNI VOLUNTEER PROGRAM IN ORDER TO DEVELOP MENTORING AND TRAINING PROGRAMS PROMOTING HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS TO ENROLL IN A POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION.
F.TO ENHANCE REMEDIAL EDUCATIONAL SERVICES AND COMPLEMENTARY ACTIVITIES TO PARTICIPANTS WHO STARTED IN THE CNCS SUPPORTED EDUCATION PROGRAM, SO THEY MAY OBTAIN THEIR POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION DEGREE. 
G.IMPROVE THE UT HEALTH BENEFIT PROGRAM IN ORDER TO INCREASE THE DISADVANTAGED POPULATION ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE PROGRAMS.

VIAS PR SITES WITH VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE LOCATED ISLAND WIDE ALLOWING SERVICE PROVISION TO THE PUERTO RICAN POPULATION, AS REQUIRED AND NEEDED. THE VIAS PR PROJECT WILL EMPHASIZE ON COMMUNITIES LOCATED NEAR SUAGM INSTITUTIONS, INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING 44 MUNICIPALITIES: AGUAS BUENAS; AIBONITO; BARCELONETA; BARRANQUITAS; BAYAMON; CAGUAS; CANOVANAS; CAROLINA; CATA?O; CAYEY; CEIBA; CIALES; CIDRA; COMERIO; COROZAL; DORADO; FAJARDO; FLORIDA; GUAYNABO; GURABO; HUMACAO; JUNCOS; LAS PIEDRAS; LOIZA; LUQUILLO; MANATI; MAUNABO; MOROVIS; NAGUABO; NARANJITO; OROCOVIS; RIO GRANDE; SAN JUAN; SAN LORENZO; TOA ALTA; TOA BAJA; TRUJILLO ALTO; VEGA ALTA; VEGA BAJA; YABUCOA; ISABELA; PONCE; JAYUYA AND AGUADILLA.

OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS, TWENTY TWO (22) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: CREATE WORKS PLANS; GENERATE DATA BASES; ESTABLISH ALLIANCES; CREATE, DEVELOP, IMPLEMENT AND EVALUATE NEW TECHNOLOGY PLATFORMS, MAINTAIN NEW TECHNOLOGY PLATFORMS, DEVELOP COMMUNITY VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS; DEVELOP AND DISTRIBUTE EDUCATIONAL AND PROMOTIONAL MATERIAL; TRAIN COMMUNITY LEADERS AND VOL

A DESCRIPTION OF YOUR ORGANIZATIONS MISSION
THE MISSION STATEMENT SAYS UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT CAROLINA STRIVES TO FORM PROFESSIONALS WITH A REFLECTIVE AND CREATIVE CAPACITY, A DESIRE FOR INNOVATION AND CONTINUOUS LEARNING, A REGARD FOR A ESTHETIC VALUES, AN APPRECIATION FOR THE MERITS OF TEAM WORK, AND A HIGH SENSE OF RESPONSIBILITY AND SOCIAL COMMITMENT.

THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA THAT YOUR PROJECT ALIGNS WITH.
THIS MISSION IS ALIGNED WITH THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM GUIDANCE FOR CURRENT AND POTENCIAL PROJECT SPONSORS (FY 2018) PAGES 6-8, WHICH STATES THAT AMERICORPS VISTA ENCOURAGES PROJECTS THAT LEVERAGE COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS AS MENTORS, BUILD THE CAPACITY OF MENTORING ORGANIZATIONS, AND REPLICATE SUCCESSFUL MENTORING MODELS. ALSO, BOTH INSTITUTIONS, UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO CAROLINA CAMPUS AND CNCS, ARE COMMITTED TO PROVIDE MORE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES TO LOW-INCOME POPULATION.

A DESCRIPTION OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT GOAL(S), INCLUDING WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PROJECT:
THE GOAL OF THIS INITIATIVE IS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF LOW-INCOME AND PUBLIC HOUSING RESIDENTS OF THE CAROLINA MUNICIPALITY STUDENTS WHO APPLY, ARE ADMITTED AND SUCCESSFULLY GRADUATE FROM INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION IN PUERTO RICO.

THE NUMBER OF VISTAS AND LEADERS (IF APPLICABLE) YOU ARE REQUESTING AND AN OVERVIEW OF THE MAJORACTIVITIES THEY WILL PERFORM:
THE THREE (3) CUA-VISTA MEMBERS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THIS GOAL BY: REVISING AND DEVELOPING A TRAINING CURRICULUM FOR STUDENTS TO PROMOTE PROFESSIONAL AND COLLEGE GOALS; REVISING AND DEVELOPING A TRAINING FOR PARENTS TO GET INVOLVED IN THE EDUCATIONAL PROCESS OF THEIR CHILDREN; AND STRENGTHENING COLLABORATIVE AGREEMENTS WITH THE COMMUNITY.

THE ESTIMATED TIME REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT.
VISTA MEMBER PARTICIPATION PERIOD WILL BE ONE YEAR.

THE VISTA PROJECT, BEING PART OF CUA/UPR CAROLINA, WILL CONTINUE ESTABLISHING PRECEDENTS AND WILL OPEN A WIDE GAP OF OPPORTUNITIES, BOTH AT THE INSTITUTIONAL AND LOCAL LEVELS. FOR THE SECOND CONSECUTIVE YEAR, UPR CAROLINA WILL HAVE THE HONOR OF COLLABORATING WITH THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM AND RECEIVE AMPLE SUPPORT FROM ITS VOLUNTEERING INITIATIVE. THE VISTA ASSIGNMENT WAS CREATED WITH THE PURPOSE OF EXPANDING PROJECT AREAS THAT PREVIOUSLY DID NOT HAVE SUFFICIENT SUPPORT BECAUSE OF THE PROJECT'S LIMITED RESOURCES. DUE TO THE CUA PROJECT AT UPR CAROLINA, NOT HAVING A LARGE AMOUNT OF FUNDS, IT HAS NOT HAD THE OPPORTUNITY TO START A MENTORING PLAN FOCUSED ON ISSUES OF IMPENDING NEEDS OF MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS AND, AS WELL AS DEVELOPING VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT AND SUPPORT HAVE VOLUNTEERS IN DIFFERENT AREAS. THE VISTA PROGRAM WILL HELP WITH CONTINUE IN THE EXPANSION OF THE PROJECT AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW SKILLS WHILE IMPACTING A GREATER NUMBER OF COMMUNITIES.

THE WRIGHT CENTER'S MISSION IS TO CONTINUOUSLY IMPROVE EDUCATION AND PATIENT CARE IN A COLLABORATIVE SPIRIT TO ENHANCE OUTCOMES, ACCESS AND AFFORDABILITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE PATIENT ENGAGEMENT AND IMPROVE ACCESS TO CARE, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT NEARLY 90,000 LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING A SOCIAL SERVICE REGISTRY, PILOTING AND EVALUATING A SOCIOECONOMIC DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH SCREENING INSTRUMENT, AND LAUNCHING SUPPORT GROUPS AND ACTIVITIES FOR PATIENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES' MISSION IS TO CREATE AN ACCESSIBLE, CULTURALLY COMPETENT, INTEGRATED AND COMPREHENSIVE HUMAN SERVICES SYSTEM THAT ENSURES INDIVIDUALLY TAILORED, SEAMLESS AND HOLISTIC SERVICES TO ALLEGHENY COUNTY RESIDENTS, IN PARTICULAR, THE COUNTY'S VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. THE SUMMER AND AFTER SCHOOL FOOD PROGRAMS PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA AND THE FAMILY SUPPORT CENTERS (FSC) 2GEN PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  BOTH PROJECTS WILL INCREASE ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY SCALE AND REACH OF THE TWO PROGRAMS SERVING ALLEGHENY COUNTY'S MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECTS BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY ASSET MAPPING, BEST PRACTICE RESEARCH, COMMUNITY AND ORGANIZATIONAL OUTREACH, PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT AND INCREASE COMMUNITY AWARENESS, ENGAGEMENT AND PARTICIPATION OVER THE COURSE OF TWO YEARS.

THE CENTER FOR EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES (CEO) BELIEVES IN THE TRANSFORMATIONAL POWER OF WORK. WE PROVIDE IMMEDIATE, EFFECTIVE, AND COMPREHENSIVE EMPLOYMENT SERVICES EXCLUSIVELY TO INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE RECENTLY RETURNED HOME FROM INCARCERATION. OUR VISION IS THAT ANYONE WITH A CRIMINAL RECORD WHO WANTS TO WORK HAS THE PREPARATION AND SUPPORT NEEDED TO FIND A JOB AND STAY CONNECTED TO THE LABOR FORCE. WE BELIEVE THAT EVERYONE, REGARDLESS OF THEIR PAST, DESERVES THE CHANCE TO SHAPE A STRONGER FUTURE FOR THEMSELVES, THEIR FAMILY, AND THEIR COMMUNITIES. CEO?S VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO LEVERAGE CASH AND IN-KIND DONATIONS AS WELL AS CULTIVATE NEW COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF CEO'S THREE PENNSYLVANIA SITES, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 325 FORMERLY INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS GRANT PROPOSAL RESEARCH AND WRITING, DEVELOPING NEW PROGRAM PARTNERSHIPS, AND CONDUCTING RESEARCH FOR PROGRAM INNOVATION AND IMPROVEMENT OVER THE COURSE OF A ONE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD.

THE ROCHESTER YOUTH YEAR PROGRAM IS SPONSORED BY THE ROCHESTER REGIONAL NETWORK OF COLLEGES, WHICH INCLUDES ROBERTS WESLEYAN COLLEGE, ROCHESTER INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY, THE COLLEGE AT BROCKPORT, SUNY GENESEO, NAZARETH COLLEGE, ST. JOHN FISHER COLLEGE, HOBART AND WILLIAM SMITH COLLEGES, AND THE UNIVERSITY OF ROCHESTER, WHERE THE PROGRAM IS ADMINISTERED. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT IS A MULTI-SITE, INTERMEDIARY PROJECT, AND ALIGNS WITH THE FOCUS AREAS OF EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE PROJECT SEEKS TO ALLEVIATE THE EFFECTS OF POVERTY ON YOUTH, TO STRENGTHEN THE 
COMMUNITY BY MOBILIZING THE ASSETS OF THE AREA COLLEGES, AND TO PROMOTE CIVIC ENGAGEMENT AND COMMUNITY-CENTERED LEADERSHIP. ROCHESTER YOUTH YEAR AIMS TO ENGAGE AND EMPOWER AT LEAST 1,000 LOW-INCOME YOUTH IN THE COMING SERVICE YEAR. SEVENTEEN FULL-YEAR VISTA MEMBERS AND 17 SUMMER ASSOCIATES WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT THROUGH INDIRECT, CAPACITY-BUILDING SERVICES LIKE VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, PARTNERSHIP BUILDING, AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THE COMING SERVICE YEAR.

THE NEIGHBORHOOD PRESERVATION COALITION OF NEW YORK STATE, INC. (NPCNYS) IS A 501C (3) ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO UNIFY, EDUCATE, EMPOWER, AND STRENGTHEN COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN THEIR PROVISION OF AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION ACTIVITIES. THE PROJECT NPCNYS IS PROPOSING ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY STRATEGIC PLAN FOCUS AREA IDENTIFIED BY CNCS. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENCOURAGE GREATER COLLABORATION BETWEEN OUR REGIONAL NEIGHBORHOOD PRESERVATION COMPANY (NPC) MEMBERS. ONE VISTA MEMBER WITHIN EACH OF OUR TEN DEFINED REGIONS: LONG ISLAND, QUEENS, BROOKLYN/STATE ISLAND, MANHATTAN, BRONX, HUDSON VALLEY/WESTCHESTER, CAPITAL REGION, CENTRAL/MOHAWK/NORTH COUNTRY, ROCHESTER, BUFFALO/NIAGARA FOR THE PURPOSES OF PROMOTING EXPANDED ACCESS TO AND INCREASED AWARENESS OF AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND ASSOCIATED SERVICES, SUCH AS FINANCIAL LITERACY, WORKFORCE TRAINING, YOUTH DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMMING, HEALTHY FOOD ACCESS, AND NEIGHBORHOOD SAFETY INITIATIVES FOR LOW-AND MODERATE-INCOME RESIDENTS OF THE DEFINED REGIONS. 

FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS PROGRAM, NPCNYS IS REQUESTING TEN (10) VISTA MEMBERS WHO WILL BE PLACED AT SUB-SITES, AND ONE (1) VISTA LEADER WHO WILL WORK OUT OF OUR OFFICES. NPCNYS IS PROPOSING A ONE-YEAR PROJECT THAT WILL IDENTIFY REGIONAL SERVICE GAPS, AND PRODUCE AN OUTREACH AND COMMUNICATIONS PLAN FOR THE REGIONAL NPCS. A TIMELINE HAS BEEN PROVIDED IN A SUBSEQUENT SECTION.

THE TEN SITES ARE AS FOLLOWS:
STATEN ISLAND: NORTHFIELD LDC
BROOKLYN: CARROLL GARDENS ASSOCIATION
QUEENS: NHS OF QUEENS CDC
MANHATTAN: COOPER SQUARE COMMITTEE
BRONX: WEST BRONX HOUSING AND NEIGHBORHOOD RESOURCE CENTER
HUDSON VALLEY, WESTCHESTER: INTERFAITH COUNCIL FOR ACTION (IFCA)
CAPITAL DISTRICT: COMMUNITY LAND TRUST OF SCHENECTADY
CENTRAL: NORTHEAST HAWLEY DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION (NEHDA)
ROCHESTER: NORTH EAST AREA DEVELOPMENT (NEAD)
BUFFALO: CITIZEN'S OPPORTUNITY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND EQUALITY (CODE)

SUNY PLATTSBURGH THROUGH OUR REGIONAL PARTNERSHIP, NORTH COUNTRY THRIVE, NORTH COUNTRY AMERICORPS*VISTA PROJECT?S MISSION IS TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OUR RURAL, LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY THROUGH COLLECTIVE ACTION AND ASSET BASED COMMUNITY SOLUTIONS BY UTILIZING REGIONAL DATA AND VISTA SUPPORT TO IMPROVE OUTCOMES THROUGH AN ANTI-POVERTY FOCUS THAT EMPOWERS THE COMMUNITY THROUGH SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS AND CAPACITY BUILDING. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON 1) HOUSING AND FOOD INSECURITY 2) STEM, EDUCATION AND EMPLOYMENT 3) FAMILY DEVELOPMENT, STRENGTHENING FAMILIES, AND FAMILY EDUCATION.  14 VISTA MEMBERS AND A VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS:  1) VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, TRAINING AND RETENTION. 2) CREATING AND IMPLEMENTING MARKETING PLAN TO EDUCATE LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY ABOUT AVAILABLE SERVICES 3) COORDINATING HEALTHY EATING PROGRAMS AND REGIONAL FOOD SHELF SYSTEMS, ALONG WITH FUNDING AND MARKETING OF SUCH PROGRAMS 4) DESIGNING VOLUNTEER PROGRAMMING FOR TARGETED EDUCATION PROGRAMS WITHIN WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT 4) HELPING TO DESIGN, CONDUCT AND IMPLEMENT RECOMMENDATIONS FROM A HOUSING ASSESSMENT STUDY OF OUR REGION OVER THE COURSE OF 4 YEARS. 5) DEVELOPING A CENTRALIZED DATA AND RESOURCE DIRECTORY FOR THE REGION, AMONG OTHER IMPORTANT PROJECTS TO ENSURE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE VISTA SUPPORT.  NORTH COUNTRY THRIVE AT SUNY PLATTSBURGH WILL BE THE LEAD AGENCY AND IN OUR 2ND  YEAR, SITES WILL INCLUDE CITY OF PLATTSBURGH, LITERACY VOLUNTEERS, CORNELL COOPERATIVE EXTENSION (CLINTON AND FRANKLIN COUNTY), ADIRONDACK P-TECH, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES NORTH, TOWN OF PLATTSBURGH, AND UNITED WAY OF THE ADIRONDACK REGION INC.

GOODWILL INDUSTRIES OF NORTHERN NEW ENGLAND'S MISSION IS TO ' ENABLE PERSONS WITH DIVERSE CHALLENGES TO ACHIEVE PERSONAL STABILITY AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT'. THE GOODWILL VISTA PARTNERSHIP FOCUSES ON SUPPORTING GOODWILL'S CURRENT GOAL TO BRING 10,000 PEOPLE INTO FINANCIAL STABILITY IN 10 YEARS. THE GOODWILL VISTA PARTNERSHIP WILL PLACE 40 AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS OUT AT COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT MAINE WORKING TO HELP REDUCE POVERTY IN STRUGGLING COMMUNITIES.  THE GOODWILL VISTA PARTNERSHIP WILL ALSO PLACE 30 VISTA SUMMER ASSOCIATES OUT IN COMMUNITY AGENCIES TO SUPPORT THIS WORK.

OSC'S MISSION IS: WE ARE PATRIOTIC CITIZENS COMMITTED TO SERVING OUR WOUNDED, INJURED AND ILL COMBAT VETERANS. WE SERVE VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES BY BUILDING RELATIONSHIPS AND IDENTIFYING AND SUPPORTING IMMEDIATE NEEDS AND INTERESTS. WE ARE DEDICATED TO PROMOTING AWARENESS OF THE MANY SACRIFICES MADE BY OUR ARMED FORCES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO PROVIDE VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES WITH SUPPORTS AND EXPERIENCES TO IMPROVE THEIR OVERALL WELL-BEING, INCLUDING PREPARATION FOR THE WORKPLACE OR VOLUNTEERING AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 400 VETERANS AND FAMILY MEMBERS. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CONNECTING VETERANS WITH MENTORS, CREATING FAMILY-FRIENDLY ACTIVITIES FOR VETERAN FAMILIES TO INTERACT PEER-TO-PEER, RECRUIT AND TRAIN NEW VOLUNTEERS, AND CREATE INTERNAL PROCEDURES, INSTRUCTIONS AND RECORD KEEPING MEASURES TO ENSURE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE PROGRAMS OVER THE COURSE OF THE 12-MONTH PROJECT PERIOD. INITIAL PROJECT: INITIALLY OSC PROPOSED TWO VISTA PROJECTS TO ALIGN WITH THE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREA. WE EXPANDED TO FOUR VISTA PROJECTS THE FOLLOWING YEAR. WITH THE CONTINUATION, WE ARE REQUESTING FOUR VISTA PROJECTS. THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL HELP OSC BUILD ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY THROUGH RECRUITMENT OF VOLUNTEERS FOR TWO PROJECTS IN THE EARLY STAGES OF DEVELOPMENT AND TWO THAT ARE MORE ESTABLISHED. THE PROJECTS BOTH PROVIDE SERVICES RELATED TO MENTAL WELLNESS, FAMILY STABILITY, FINANCIAL STABILITY AND PREPARATION FOR EMPLOYMENT OR VOLUNTEER SERVICE FOR DISABLED POST-9/11 COMBAT VETERANS AND THEIR IMMEDIATE FAMILY MEMBERS. WITH CONTINUATION, WE WOULD LIKE TO EXPAND OUR SERVICES TO VETERANS OF EMERGENCY SERVICES, PARTICULARLY FIRST RESPONDERS. OSC SERVES LOW-INCOME, DISABLED VETERANS (70% DISABILITY RATING) AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS, AND THESE TWO PROGRAMS WILL SERVE THIS SAME POPULATION. OSC SERVES FAMILIES WHO ARE A VETERAN'S SPOUSE/CHILDREN OR PARENTS/SIBLINGS, DEPENDING ON WHO HAS PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR CAREGIVING. VISTA PROJECT, TYPE ONE: TO RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS TO ESTABLISH A PROGRAM OF COUNSELING, GROUP THERAPY AND MENTORSHIP ACTIVITIES FOR VETERANS. OUR GOAL WITH THIS PROGRAM IS TO PREVENT VETERAN SUICIDES AND HELP VETERANS AND CAREGIVERS READY THEMSELVES FOR THE "NEXT STEPS" IN THEIR LIVES, SUCH AS EMPLOYMENT OR COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERING. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO SUPPORT VETERANS' CAREGIVERS AND FAMILIES, TO PROMOTE FAMILY STABILITY AND WELL-BEING. THIS PROJECT WILL HAVE THE CAPACITY TO SERVE APPROXIMATELY 25 VETERANS IN THE MONTGOMERY COUNTY AREA. VISTA PROJECT, TYPE TWO: THE VISTA WILL SERVE IN OUR OFFICE IN MONTGOMERY COUNTY, MD. THE SECOND VISTA PROJECT IS TO BUILD A COMPLEMENT OF ACTIVITIES IN THE WASHINGTON, DC AREA AND AT THE PATRIOT POINT FACILITY ON THE EASTERN SHORE (DORCHESTER COUNTY). THIS PROJECT WILL HELP VETERANS BUILD CONFIDENCE, GROW THEIR ABILITIES, BOND WITH THEIR FAMILIES AND IMPROVE EMOTIONAL AND MENTAL WELL-BEING. THE RESULT WILL BE THAT VETERANS WILL GROW IN THEIR READINESS TO SEEK EMPLOYMENT OR COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERING AS A "NEXT STEP." THIS PROJECT WILL HAVE THE CAPACITY TO SERVE APPROXIMATELY 200 VETERANS (AND THEIR FAMILIES) FROM THE MONTGOMERY COUNTY AND EASTERN SHORE AREAS. THE INITIAL REQUEST WAS FOR ONE-YEAR, WITH THE OPTION TO CONTINUE VISTA SUPPORT OF THE TWO PROJECTS FOR A POTENTIAL OF UP TO THREE YEARS. THE CONTINUATION REQUEST ADDS TWO NEW POSITIONS. CONTINUATION AMENDMENT: OSC WILL CONTINUE THE TWO MARYLAND-BASED VISTA ASSIGNMENTS AS ESTABLISHED AND ADD ONE NEW VISTA POSITION IN FLORIDA AND ONE NEW VISTA POSITION IN DELAWARE. THE TWO NEW VISTA POSITIONS WILL BE SIMILAR TO THE VISTA PROJECT TWO DESCRIPTION, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON THE UNIQUE LOCAL NEEDS OF THE FLORIDA GULF COAST AND STATEWIDE DELAWARE COMMUNITIES.

IMPACT LYNN IS A COLLECTIVE IMPACT FORUM COMPRISED OF MULTIPLE ORGANIZATIONS ACROSS MULTIPLE SECTORS IN LYNN, MASSACHUSETTS WHO HAVE COME TOGETHER TO CREATE MEANINGFUL ACTIONS TOWARD THE SAME MEASURABLE GOALS FOR INCREASED INCOME AND EDUCATION LEVELS, AND INCREASED, DIVERSIFIED CIVIC ENGAGEMENT IN THE CITY. WITH A DELIBERATE OVERLAP OF GOALS FOR MORE COMPREHENSIVE IMPACT, THE IMPACT LYNN PROJECT ALIGNS WITH ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, AND HEALTHY FUTURES ASPECTS OF CNCS. WE ENVISION A CITY WHERE EVERY RESIDENT CAN BE GAINFULLY EMPLOYED, EDUCATED AND ENGAGE IN THE COMMUNITY.  WHILE OVERARCHING GOALS FOR HIGHER INCOME AND EDUCATION LEVELS ARE LONG TERM, OUR SHORT-TERM PLANS ARE ALREADY BEING REALIZED. CURRENTLY, THE HOUSING COMMITTEE HAS FOCUSED ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF TWO NEIGHBORHOODS IN LYNN.  IN SAGAMORE HILL, THE PROJECT INCLUDES THE CONSTRUCTION OF A 71-UNIT MULTIPLE PURPOSE DEVELOPMENT MADE OF MIX-INCOME UNITS AND COMMERCIAL SPACE AND A SECOND 27-UNIT BUILDING.  THE SECOND AREA OF FOCUS IS THE OAKVILLE/MINOT NEIGHBORHOOD WHICH HAS BEEN REBRANDED AS ORCHARD GROVE NEIGHBORHOOD AND SUPPORTED BY THE CONSTRUCTION OF FOUR SINGLE-FAMILY HOMES IN PHASE ONE AND FOUR ADDITIONAL HOMES IN PHASE TWO.  IMPACT LYNN EARLY EDUCATION COMMITTEE HAS MADE STRIDES IN ITS PARTNERSHIP WITH UNITED WAY AND THEIR DRIVE INITIATIVE UTILIZING THE AGES AND STAGES QUESTIONNAIRE (ASQ) TO SCREEN YOUNG CHILDREN TO IDENTIFY THOSE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL NEEDS AND PROVIDE REFERRALS AND SUPPORT TO THE FAMILY.  THE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT GROUP CONTINUES TO PARTICIPATE IN COMMUNITY OUTREACH AS WELL AS COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT BY PROVIDING THEIR INPUT IN DECISIONS AT THE CITY LEVEL.  AS THESE INITIAL TEAMS WORK AND MEASURE THEIR EFFORTS, WE WILL THEN A LAUNCH PUBLIC SAFETY AND PUBLIC HEALTH INITIATIVE (ADDRESSING THE OPIOID ADDICTION CRISIS.  WE ARE SEEKING ONE VISTA POSITIONS TO HELP AND SUPPORT A ROLL OUT A MULTI-LANGUAGE COMMUNICATION CAMPAIGN TO PROMOTE ALL EFFORTS OF IMPACT LYNN AND IT'S COMMITTEES AS WELL AS ASSIST WITH RESEARCH AND GRANT WRITING IN ORDER TO GENERATE NEW SOURCES OF REVENUES TO IMPACT LYNN.  A SECOND VISTA POSITION WILL CONTINUE DEVELOPING AND ENHANCING THE CURRENT VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM, WHICH WAS CREATED DURING THE 2017-18 TERM.  THE TWO PROPOSED VISTA ASSIGNMENTS WOULD BE LOCATED AT LYNN ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY (VOLUNTEER/COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND COMMUNICATION AND DEVELOPMENT).

THE MISSION OF THE BROCKTON PUBLIC SCHOOLS (BPS) IS TO ENSURE STUDENT SUCCESS BY FULFILLING THE EDUCATIONAL, SOCIAL, AND EMOTIONAL NEEDS OF ALL STUDENTS IN THE PURSUIT OF INSTRUCTIONAL EXCELLENCE.  THE DISTRICT VISION STATEMENT IS: INSTRUCTIONAL EXCELLENCE FOR EVERY STUDENT EVERY DAY. 

THE BPS VISTA RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT ALIGNS WITH VISTA PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES FOR FY2018 AND ITS EDUCATION FOCUS AREA.  THE PROJECT WILL LEVERAGE EXISTING DISTRICT CAPACITY IN ITS GRANTS OFFICE TO SERVE ITS PREDOMINANTLY LOW INCOME 16,000+ STUDENT POPULATION (PROJECT BENEFICIARIES) IN PRE-KINDERGARTEN TO GRADE 12 OVER THE ONE-YEAR SERVICE PERIOD.

ACCORDINGLY, ONE VISTA VOLUNTEER IS REQUESTED TO UNDERTAKE RELATED PROJECT ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING SPEARHEADING THE ONGOING UPDATE, ENHANCEMENT, AND MAINTENANCE OF THE SUSTAINABLE BPS GRANT DATABASE (BY ACADEMIC CONTENT AREA) AND ASSIST IN PROVIDING BEST-PRACTICE GRANTS DEVELOPMENT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TEACHERS AND ADMINISTRATORS ON BUILDING-LEVEL RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT TEAMS. 

THE BPS VISTA RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT WILL ULTIMATELY STRENGTHEN THE DISTRICT/SCHOOL COMMUNITY AND CREATE A PATHWAY OUT OF POVERTY FOR BROCKTON STUDENTS BY GENERATING MUCH-NEEDED FINANCIAL RESOURCES TO CLOSE ACHIEVEMENT GAPS AND INCREASE ACADEMIC PROFICIENCY SO THAT THESE STUDENTS ARE PREPARED FOR COLLEGE AND CAREER IN A COMPETITIVE GLOBAL ECONOMY.

ACTION FOR BOSTON COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT IS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY WHOSE MISSION IS TO EMPOWER LOW-INCOME PEOPLE AND COMMUNITIES BY PROVIDING THEM WITH THE TOOLS TO OVERCOME POVERTY, LIVE WITH DIGNITY, AND ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL. TO FULFILL THIS MISSION, ABCD USES A COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH THAT SYSTEMATICALLY ADDRESSES THE RANGE OF BARRIERS FACED BY HOUSEHOLDS IN POVERTY - FROM DAY-TO-DAY CRISES TO LONG-TERM NEEDS FOR JOBS AND EDUCATION. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES/OBESITY AND FOOD FOCUS AREA. ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING, ADMINISTERING, AND ANALYZING A SURVEY OF THE FOOD PANTRY CLIENTS? NEEDS; ANALYZING FOOD PANTRY OPERATIONS AND DEVELOPING RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPROVED EFFICIENCY, COORDINATION, AND STANDARDIZATION; AND IDENTIFYING LOCAL BUSINESSES AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE NEIGHBORHOODS SERVED BY THE FOOD PANTRIES THAT COULD BE SOLICITED FOR SUPPORT.

OUR WORK IS GROUNDED IN LOCAL COMMUNITIES THROUGH OUR MEMBER INSTITUTIONS AND THROUGH OUR NETWORK OF STATE AND REGIONAL OFFICES.
