LOWELL, MASSACHUSETTS IS A DIVERSE, URBAN COMMUNITY IN THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES.  LOWELL SUFFERS FROM HIGH RATES OF POVERTY, WHICH LEAD TO OBESITY AND OTHER DIET RELATED ILLNESSES. MILL CITY GROWS (MCG) WORKS TO COMBAT POVERTY AND RELATED ISSUES OF HEALTH EQUITY THROUGH IMPROVING PHYSICAL HEALTH, ECONOMIC INDEPENDENCE AND ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY IN LOWELL THROUGH INCREASED ACCESS TO LAND, LOCALLY-GROWN FOOD, AND EDUCATION. 

MILL CITY GROWS PROPOSES A TWO-YEAR PROJECT, ?GROWING MILL CITY GROWS DEVELOPMENT AND EVALUATION SYSTEMS?, AND REQUESTS TWO STANDARD VISTAS. THE VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT AND EVALUATION (VEE) VISTA WILL FOCUS ON ENHANCING MCG?S SALESFORCE (SF) DATABASE, WHICH WOULD BE USED FOR VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT, EVALUATION DATA AND REPORTING, AND AS A FUNDRAISING DATABASE. THE DEVELOPMENT AND MARKETING (DM) VISTA WILL FOCUS ON CREATING SYSTEMS IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND MARKETING DEPARTMENTS THAT WILL ENHANCE MCG?S ABILITY TO RAISE UNRESTRICTED FUNDS TO SUPPORT OUR FOOD ACCESS AND FOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS HELPING US TO OUTREACH TO POTENTIAL PARTICIPANTS AS WELL AS DONORS. 

OUR GOAL WITH THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE MCG'S CAPACITY TO CARRY OUT OR WORK BY INCREASING THE NUMBER OF RESOURCES INCLUDING VOLUNTEERS AND CASH VIA DONATIONS FOR THE ORGANIZATION. OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT WE WILL MEASURE VARIOUS OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES TO DETERMINE PROGRESS INCLUDING NUMBER OF SYSTEMS IMPROVED, NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS RECRUITED AND TRAINED, AND AMOUNT OF NEW RESOURCES, BOTH CASH AND IN-KIND, RECEIVED BY THE ORGANIZATION. 

MILL CITY GROWS CURRENTLY HOSTS TWO FOODCORPS SERVICE MEMBERS AND TWO TERRACORPS SERVICE MEMBERS AND IS FAMILIAR WITH THE RULES, POLICIES AND COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH WORKING WITH NATIONAL SERVICE MEMBERS. OUR CO-DIRECTOR, FRANCEY SLATER, WOULD SERVE AS SUPERVISOR FOR THE DM VISTA, AND DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS, GALLAGHER HANNAN WOULD SERVE AS SUPERVISOR FOR THE VEE VISTA, ENSURING THEY HAVE REGULAR GUIDANCE ON THEIR PROJECTS AND SUPPORT FOR SUCCESSFULLY MEETING THEIR PROJECT GOALS. 

MILL CITY GROWS WILL WORK TO RECRUIT DIVERSE PEOPLE WHO REFLECT THE POPULATION WE SERVE TO THE REQUESTED VISTA POSITIONS AND PROVIDE THE VISTAS WITH A RIGOROUS ORIENTATION THAT WILL HELP THEM GET ACCLIMATED TO THE CULTURE OF MCG AND THE ENVIRONS OF LOWELL.

THE COALITION FOR NONPROFIT HOUSING AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT'S MISSION IS TO FOSTER JUST AND EQUITABLE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT SOLUTIONS THAT ADDRESS THE NEEDS AND ASPIRATIONS OF LOW- AND MODERATE-INCOME DISTRICT RESIDENTS BY CONVENING, ADVOCATING, AND EDUCATING DIVERSE STAKEHOLDERS. HOPEONESOURCE'S (HOS) MISSION IS TO HELP PREVENT AND END HOMELESSNESS IN THE GREATER METROPOLITAN DC REGION BY EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY INCREASING AWARENESS OF AND ACCESS TO AVAILABLE HOUSING SERVICES, SOCIAL SERVICES, AND CAREER SERVICES AMONGST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS THROUGH THE USE OF OUR GEOLOCATED TEXT MESSAGE PLATFORM. PLEASE NOTE THAT THESE GOALS ARE OUTLINED FOR YEAR 3 ONLY. COMPREHENSIVE DATA WILL CONTINUALLY BE TRACKED AND EVALUATED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR TO INFORM GOALS. SIX VISTA MEMBERS (NO MORE THAN FOUR AT ONCE) ARE REQUESTED TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS EXPANDING COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE AND SUPPORT OF THE EFFORT WITHIN THE ENTIRE DC METROPOLITAN REGION BY EXPANDING AND STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS, INTEGRATING INTO COMMUNITY SYSTEMS, FURTHER DEVELOPING AND REFINING COMMUNICATION CHANNELS, EXPANDING THE POOL OF VOLUNTEERS, AND ENHANCING PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT YEAR.

UNITED WAY OF CENTRAL AND NORTHEASTERN CONNECTICUT'S (UWCNCT) MISSION IS TO ENGAGE AND BRING TOGETHER PEOPLE AND RESOURCES COMMITTED TO THE WELL-BEING OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN OUR COMMUNITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC MOBILITY FOCUS AREAS. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND SUPPORT, FACILITATING COMMUNITY CONVERSATIONS AND CONNECTING FAMILIES WITH SERVICES TO HELP THEM LIVE HEALTHY AND FINANCIALLY STABLE LIVES OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

IN ADDITION, TWO AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WOULD BE FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF OUR WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND FINANCIAL EMPOWERMENT PROGRAMS BY SUPPORTING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF WORKFORCE SOLUTIONS SYSTEMS COORDINATION INITIATIVES AND SUPPORTING THE EXPANSION OF UNITED WAY'S INTEGRATED FINANCIAL CENTER MODEL TO AT LEAST TWO NEW COMMUNITIES IN OUR REGION (ENFIELD AND WINDHAM). THE AGENCY ON AGING OF SOUTH CENTRAL CONNECTICUT (AASCC) IS GUIDED BY THE MISSION TO ?EMPOWER ADULTS TO REMAIN AS INDEPENDENT AND ENGAGED AS POSSIBLE WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES THROUGH ADVOCACY, INFORMATION AND SERVICES.? THE AGENCY PROMOTES COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT WITH VOLUNTEERING AND INTERGENERATIONAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH SPONSORSHIP OF AMERICORPS AND SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS, INCLUDING THE PAVE NEW HAVEN AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT (PAVE).

CENTRAL CARE INTEGRATED HEALTH SERVICES (CCIHS) IS A FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTER (FQHC) WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROVIDE ACCESSIBLE, AFFORDABLE AND HIGH QUALITY COMPREHENSIVE HEALTHCARE AND HEALTH-RELATED SOCIAL SERVICES TO ALL RESIDENTS OF THE GREATER HOUSTON AREA THROUGH PATIENT-CENTERED EDUCATION, COLLABORATIONS, AND WELLNESS AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS TO ELIMINATE HEALTH-RELATED DISPARITIES. THIS 2-YEAR PILOT PROGRAM WILL SERVE TO DEVELOP AND EXPAND OUR CURRENT WORK THAT ENCOMPASSES PROVIDING ELIGIBILITY ASSISTANCE FOR HEALTH CARE SERVICES WHICH WILL INCLUDE FINANCIAL LITERACY AND COUNSELING THROUGH OUTREACH AND COLLABORATION WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS GEARED TOWARD THE LOW-INCOME, UNDER SERVED, AND UNDER INSURED VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN CCIHS SERVICE AREAS, WHICH INCLUDE MANY VETERANS, ELDERLY AND DISABLED. WE ARE REQUESTING SIX VISTA MEMBERS FOR THIS PROGRAM. FIVE MEMBERS WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH OUR OUTREACH DEPARTMENT AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SUPPORT TEAM DEVELOPING CRUCIAL COMMUNITY RELATIONSHIPS RELATED TO SERVICES FOR VETERANS, THE ELDERLY, AND LOW-INCOME ADULTS WHO ALSO MAY BE IN NEED OF PRIMARY, PREVENTATIVE  AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE. OUR SIXTH MEMBERS WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR WORKING WITH OUR PROGRAM DEPARTMENT TO ASSIST WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN ELIGIBILITY PROCESS FOR HEALTH SERVICES AND PATIENT EDUCATION WHICH WILL CONSIST OF FINANCIAL LITERACY FOR THESE POPULATIONS WITHIN OUR SERVICE AREAS.

UNITED WAY OF EL PASO COUNTY'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF EL PASO FAMILIES THROUGH THE CARING POWER OF COMMUNITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE FINANCIAL STABILITY, HOUSING-RELATED ASSISTANCE FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED FAMILIES, PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT-RELATED ASSISTANCE, INCREASE STUDENT SUCCESS, AND INCREASE AWARENESS OF HEALTH CARE COVERAGE OPTIONS TO GAIN ACCESS TO PREVENTIVE AND PRIMARY HEALTH CARE SERVICES IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. MORE THAN 2,000 LOW-INCOME FAMILIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PATHWAYS TO SUCCESS EL PASO VISTA PROJECT. SEVEN (7) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS, LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND LOGISTICS, COMMUNITY DATA ANALYSIS, AND INCREASING PROGRAM SUSTAINABILITY, OVER THE COURSE OF 3 YEARS.

THE EL PASO INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DISTRICT'S MISSION IS TO GRADUATE "EVERY STUDENT PREPARED FOR HIGHER LEARNING AND CAREERS TO EMPOWER THEM AS KNOWLEDGEABLE AND ENGAGED CITIZENS, INNOVATORS, AND DRIVERS OF A ROBUST, BICULTURAL ECONOMY." THE VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH CNCS FOCUS AREAS: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, AND HEALTHY FUTURES. THE VISTA PROJECT IS BUILDING STRONG SUPPORTS FOR STUDENTS, SCHOOLS AND THE COMMUNITY BY FORMING PARTNERSHIPS THAT WILL BRING TOGETHER EDUCATION,
BUSINESS, AND CIVIC AGENCIES, AND HAS BEGUN TO BENEFIT THE 2,900 STUDENTS ENROLLED AT THE SIX PARTICIPATING CAMPUSES, AS WELL AS THEIR FAMILIES. EIGHT (8) VISTA MEMBERS (2 AT BOWIE HS, 2 AT GUILLEN MS, 1 AT AOY ES, 1 AT DOUGLASS ES, 1 AT HART ES AND 1 AT ZAVALA ES) PLUS ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CONDUCTING NEEDS ASSESSMENTS, RECRUITING COMMUNITY MEMBERS, AND ORGANIZING AND MANAGING EVENTS OVER THE COURSE OF 4 YEARS. AOY ES AND DOUGLASS ES ARE NEW CAMPUSES TO THE COMMUNITY SCHOOLS PROGRAM AND BEING ADDED TO EXTEND SERVICES TO ALL COMMUNITIES IN THE  BOWIE HIGH SCHOOL FEEDER PATTERN.

THE BETTER BLOCK IS A 501(C)3 NONPROFIT THAT EDUCATES, EQUIPS, AND EMPOWERS COMMUNITIES AND THEIR LEADERS TO RESHAPE AND REACTIVATE BUILT ENVIRONMENTS TO PROMOTE THE GROWTH OF HEALTHY AND VIBRANT NEIGHBORHOODS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY IN AKRON AND DALLAS BY INCREASING WALKABILITY AND QUALITY OF LIFE, THUS INCREASING THE VIBRANCY OF A NEIGHBORHOOD, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 3,000 PEOPLE. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DESIGNING AND IMPLEMENTING THE PROGRAMMING AT THE EXCHANGE HOUSE/MARKET AND ITS NEXT STEPS, AND CREATING TO THE GROWTH AND STRATEGIC OUTLOOK OF BETTER BLOCK THROUGH DEVELOPING DESIGN STANDARDS AND A MARKETING PLAN OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

PALO ALTO COLLEGE'S MISSION IS TO INSPIRE, EMPOWER, AND EDUCATE OUR COMMUNITY FOR LEADERSHIP AND SUCCESS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES AND DATA COLLECTION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ESTABLISH THE HEALTHY HUB PROJECT, A COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNITY RESOURCE IN HEALTHY FOOD ACCESS AND WELLNESS WITH A COMMUNITY GARDEN FOCAL POINT AT PALO ALTO COLLEGE, IN ORDER TO INCREASE ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS AND AFFORDABLE FOOD, HELP REDUCE RATES OF OBESITY AND RELATED CHRONIC DISEASE, AND INCREASE PARTICIPATION HEALTH AND WELLNESS RESOURCES. THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT AN ESTIMATED 750 LOW-INCOME ADULTS AND YOUTH IN SOUTH SAN ANTONIO'S IMPOVERISHED, PREDOMINANTLY HISPANIC COMMUNITY. TWO VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE COST-SHARE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY 1) PROVIDING ACCESS TO FOOD FOR LOW-INCOME STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES BY BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF PAC?S CAMPUS FOOD PANTRY AND FOOD DISTRIBUTION PROGRAM; 2) ORGANIZING AND PROMOTING HEALTHY LIFESTYLE ACTIVITIES FOR PAC STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES SUCH AS WELLNESS WORKSHOPS, RESOURCE FAIRS AND REFERRALS, COOKING DEMONSTRATIONS, GARDENING, AND FITNESS PROGRAMS; 3) BUILDING CAPACITY FOR THE COLLEGE?S FARMERS MARKET; AND 4) PROMOTING HEALTH AND WELLNESS AND FOOD SECURITY WITHIN THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY.

THE CONCHO VALLEY VISTA PLACEMENT PROJECT (CVVPP) IMPROVES COMMUNITIES BY PLACING AMERICORPS VISTAS IN THE REGION'S NONPROFIT AND PUBLIC AGENCIES WHO WILL CONDUCT INNOVATIVE PROJECTS TO INCREASE CAPACITY TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY. THE CVVPP ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREAS OF CNCS. THIS FISCAL YEAR, CVVPP WILL COST SHARE 24% OF THE VISTAS PLACED IN THE CONCHO VALLEY WITH THE HELP OF FUNDS RECEIVED FROM CNCS.  WITH VISTA SUPPORT, ASU'S CVVPP  WILL EXPAND CURRENT EFFORTS TO REACH INDIVIDUALS NEEDING HIGH SCHOOL EQUIVALENCY/ADULT EDUCATION, CAREER AND COLLEGE READINESS, ACCESS TO HEALTH SERVICES, AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING. 

ANGELO STATE UNIVERSITY, A MEMBER OF THE TEXAS TECH UNIVERSITY SYSTEM, DELIVERS UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE PROGRAMS IN THE LIBERAL ARTS, SCIENCES, AND PROFESSIONAL DISCIPLINES. LITERACY KANSAS CITY HAS EXPERIENCED SUBSTANTIAL PROGRAM ENHANCEMENT, COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, AND DIVERSIFICATION IN THE PAST TWO YEARS. WE ARE IN THE MIDDLE OF AN AGGRESSIVE STRATEGIC PLAN AND FUNDRAISING INITIATIVE IN ORDER TO ENGAGE GREATER NUMBERS AND BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY. LITERACY KANSAS CITY'S MISSION IS TO ADVANCE LITERACY AMONG AREA ADULTS THROUGH DIRECT SERVICES, ADVOCACY AND COLLABORATION. OUR VISION IS LITERACY FOR ALL. LITERACY KANSAS CITY PROVIDES SMALL GROUP LITERACY INSTRUCTION FOR ADULT LEARNERS UTILIZING AN INSTRUCTOR-LED, TUTOR-DRIVEN FORMAT.  LITERACY KANSAS CITY HAS BEEN WORKING SINCE 1985 TO PUT A DENT IN WHAT THE UNITED WAY ESTIMATES AS 250,000 ADULTS READING AT OR BELOW THE BASIC LEVEL OF LITERACY- MEANING APPROXIMATELY FIFTH GRADE- THROUGHOUT THE GREATER KANSAS CITY METROPOLITAN AREA.  SO FAR, WE HAVE PARTNERED WITH A COMMUNITY COLLEGE, KANSAS CITY PUBLIC LIBRARY, MID-CONTINENT PUBLIC LIBRARY, THE KANSAS CITY PUBLIC SCHOOL DISTRICT, KANSAS CITY PARKS AND RECREATION AND OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO EXTEND OUR LITERACY PROGRAMS BEYOND THE WALLS OF OUR MAIN OFFICE.  
LITERACY KANSAS CITY HAS DEVELOPED AN AMBITIOUS THREE-YEAR PLAN FOR WHICH WE REQUEST THE COMMITMENT OF THREE VISTA MEMBERS PER YEAR, IN ORDER TO FULLY PUT INTO OPERATION THE OBJECTIVES OUTLINED ABOVE. ONE VISTA MEMBER WOULD BE ASSIGNED TO THE EXPANSION, GROWTH, AND EVALUATION OF ONE OF OUR NEWEST PROGRAMS- TICKET TO READ. THE SECOND AND THIRD VISTAS WOULD WORK TO INCREASE THE  OVERALL CAPACITY OF OUR MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS BY CREATING ALLURING ADULT LITERACY AWARENESS CAMPAIGNS AND INCREASING OUR OVERALL WEB PRESENCE AS WELL AS COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND AWARENESS IN THE GREATER KANSAS CITY AREA ABOUT THE NEED FOR MORE COLLABORATION AMONGST ADULT LITERACY PROGRAMMING. 
LITERACY KANSAS CITY NOW POSSES THE ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO BECOME A VISTA INTERMEDIARY. WE HAVE SUCCESSFULLY RUN VISTA PROJECTS AND ARE WELL ACQUAINTED WITH THE PROCESS OF RECRUITING, TRAINING, RETAINING, AND REPORTING ON VISTA ACTIVITIES. BECAUSE OUR CORE PROGRAMS DEPEND UPON COMMUNITY COLLABORATION, AS AN ORGANIZATION WE ARE WELL EQUIPPED TO WORK WITH PARTNER SUB-SITES TO REACH A COMMON GOAL.

"WHILE ADEQUATE AND APPROPRIATE INVESTMENT IN MENTAL HEALTH CARE SERVICES AND RESEARCH IS A NECESSITY, EFFORTS TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY ARE AN ESSENTIAL COMPONENT OF EMOTIONAL HEALTH." KURUVILLA, A. AND JACOB, K.S.  "POVERTY, SOCIAL STRESS & MENTAL HEALTH." INDIAN JOURNAL MEDICAL RESEARCH 126 (2007): 273-278. PRINT
AS A MEMBER OF THE MENTAL HEALTH CRIMINAL JUSTICE COLLABORATIVE, 232-HELP IS A VITAL PARTNER IN REALIZING THE VISION OF COMMUNITY HEALTH SERVICES THAT ARE COMPREHENSIVE, ACCESSIBLE AND RESULT IN IMPROVED WELL-BEING AND QUALITY OF LIFE BREAKING THE CYCLE OF POVERTY.
232-HELP IS PILOTING THE CRISIS CONNECTION CENTER (CCC) IN PARTNERSHIP WITH ACADIANA CARES, OUR LADY OF LOURDES, VIALINK, AND ULL-COUNSELOR EDUCATION PROGRAM.   THE CRISIS CONNECTION CENTER PROJECT HAS BEEN GRANTED A THREE YEAR GRANT BY THE FRANCISCAN MISSIONARIES FOR THE PILOT PROGRAM.   
232-HELP IS ALSO COLLABORATING WITH THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE AND LOCAL HOSPITALS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS TO IDENTIFY A LOCATION AND FUNDING FOR A 23HR CRISIS CARE UNIT TO BE PART OF THE CCC.  
THE VETERANS ACTION COALITION WAS ORGANIZED SEVEN YEARS AGO WITH THE GOAL OF GETTING A NEW CLINICS IN LAFAYETTE AND LAKE CHARLES, AND TO PROVIDE HEALTH INFORMATION TO VETERANS AS WELL AS LOOK AT ISSUES IMPORTANT TO AREA VETERANS, INCLUDING MENTAL HEALTH CARE.   
232-HELP BRINGS TOGETHER THESE THREE INITIATIVES SERVING OVERLAPPING POPULATIONS TO DEVELOP A HOLISTIC APPROACH WHICH ADDRESSES THE COMPLEX LINK BETWEEN MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES AND POVERTY.  THE UNINSURED, THE UNDER-INSURED, AND THE LOW-INCOME INCLUDING THE HOMELESS, THOSE LIVING IN SHELTERS AND OTHER ASSISTIVE PROGRAMS, PERSONS WITH LOW EDUCATIONAL LEVELS, DISABLED INDIVIDUALS AND OTHERS LIVING IN POVERTY,  INCLUDE BOTH CIVILIANS AND VETERANS WHO NEED SERVICES.
OUR THREE (3) VISTA VOLUNTEER'S WILL BE ASSIGNED AS FOLLOWS:  1) CRISIS CONNECTION CENTER VISTA VOLUNTEER, 2) MENTAL HEALTH CRIMINAL JUSTICE COLLABORATIVE VISTA VOLUNTEER, AND 3) VETERANS ACTION COALITION/VETERANS ASSISTANCE VISTA VOLUNTEER.

PREVENT CHILD ABUSE (PCA) LOUISIANA'S VISTA PROJECT SUPPORTS THE HEALTHY FUTURES PRIORITY AREA, SPECIFICALLY ACCESS TO CARE THROUGH PERFORMANCE MEASURE H4. THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO UTILIZE HEALTH EDUCATION TO REDUCE CHILDHOOD TRAUMA, THEREBY PREVENTING NEGATIVE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OUTCOMES IN ADULTHOOD. THE HEALTH EDUCATION PROGRAM UTILIZED IS THE NURTURING PARENTING PROGRAM, AN EVIDENCE-BASED PARENTING PROGRAM THAT TEACHES PARTICIPANTS TO MAKE HEALTHY CHOICES, INCREASES THE RESEARCH-BASED PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR CHILD MALTREATMENT, AND ALSO ADDRESSES THE VARIOUS ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES THAT HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO CONTRIBUTE TO POOR ADULT HEALTH. THREE VISTAS WILL BUILD CAPACITY FOR THE PROGRAM BY: FACILITATING COMMUNITY CONVERSATIONS WITH THE TARGET POPULATION; RECRUITING PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS, PROGRAM FACILITATORS, AND LOW-INCOME PARTICIPANTS; FOSTERING COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN THE PROGRAM; AND ANALYZING DATA AND MAKING PROGRAM ADJUSTMENTS. EXPANSION OF THIS PROGRAM IN THE TARGET AREA IS EXPECTED TO TAKE THREE YEARS, WITH INCREMENTAL GROWTH OBSERVED BEGINNING IN YEAR ONE. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO HELP LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS CONNECT TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES THROUGH KIDLINE (1-800-CHILDREN), PCA LOUISIANA'S PARENTING HOTLINE. KIDLINE PROVIDES CRISIS INTERVENTION, PARENTING SUPPORT, AND REFERRALS TO RESOURCES SUCH AS CHILD CARE ASSISTANCE, FOOD, SHELTER AND BASIC NEEDS, MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES, AND LEGAL AID. VISTAS WILL ASSIST IN BUILDING AND MAINTAINING THE KIDLINE RESOURCE DATABASE AND INFORMING COMMUNITY MEMBERS OF THE AVAILABILITY OF THE SERVICE AND HOW IT CAN BE ACCESSED.

SINCE 1986, PREVENT CHILD ABUSE LOUISIANA HAS BEEN DEDICATED TO ACCOMPLISHING OUR MISSION: PREVENTING THE ABUSE AND NEGLECT OF LOUISIANA'S CHILDREN. FROM HELP WITH POTTY TRAINING TO KEEPING KIDS SAFE FROM SEXUAL ABUSE, PCA LOUISIANA SUPPORTS PARENTS AND CHILDREN THROUGH INTENSIVE, EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS AND COMMUNITY-BASED EDUCATION. EXPECTED TO BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT ARE 900 CHILDREN, FAMILIES AND PROFESSIONALS IN THE THIBODAUX, LAKE CHARLES AND LAFAYETTE REGIONS.

THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF LAWRENCE MISSION IS TO ENABLE ALL YOUNG PEOPLE, ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO NEED US MOST, TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AS PRODUCTIVE, CARING, RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS.  
THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE THE FUNDRAISING DEVELOPMENT, HR/FINANCE TOOLS DEVELOPMENT, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, TRAINING DEVELOPMENT, COMPLIANCE/SAFETY DEVELOPMENT, FOSTER CARE PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, AND SPORTS DEVELOPMENT PROCESS FOR THE 1,500 MEMBERS AT THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF LAWRENCE.  
THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF LAWRENCE IS REQUESTING SEVEN AMERICORPS VISTAS. THE VISTAS WILL TAKE ON SEVEN DIFFERENT PROJECTS AT THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB.  
THE CLUB WILL HAVE SEVEN VISTA'S; FUNDRAISING VISTA, VISTA FINANCE/HUMAN RESOURCES MANAGEMENT ANALYST, CURRICULUM VISTA, TRAINING/ETRAINING VISTA, COMPLIANCE/SAFETY VISTA, FOSTER CARE PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT VISTA, AND SPORTS VISTA. 
THE VISTAS WILL BE RESEARCHING THE CURRENT AND NEW MEASUREMENT TOOLS, ASSISTING WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION AND UTILIZATION OF THE ASSESSMENT TOOLS, ANALYZING AND FORMATTING THE DATA, AND CREATING PROGRAM MODIFICATION PLANS. EACH OF THESE PROJECTS WILL TAKE PLACE OVER A ONE-YEAR TIME SPAN.

COMMUNITIES IN SCHOOLS (CIS) OF MID-AMERICA?S MISSION IS TO SURROUND STUDENTS WITH A COMMUNITY OF SUPPORT, EMPOWERING THEM TO STAY IN SCHOOL AND ACHIEVE IN LIFE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD CAPACITY THROUGH LEVERAGING FINANCIAL AND EXTERNAL PROVIDER RESOURCES AND ENHANCING INTERNAL INFRASTRUCTURES, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 30,000 STUDENTS THROUGHOUT KANSAS AND KANSAS CITY, MISSOURI. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: PREPARING INTERNAL TRAINING MATERIALS AND CURRICULA, DEVELOPING PROCEDURES AND RELATED RESOURCES, INFORMING/ESTABLISHING PARTNERSHIPS WITH STAKEHOLDERS, IDENTIFYING AND PURSUING FUNDRAISING OPPORTUNITIES, AND DEVELOPING/ENHANCING RESOURCES FOR STAFF WHO DIRECTLY SERVICE LOW-INCOME STUDENTS OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

FOUNDED IN 1956, CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF NORTHEAST KANSAS IS A HUMAN SERVICE NONPROFIT THAT ASSISTS HIGH-RISK, LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT THE 21 COUNTIES OF NORTHEAST KANSAS. THE ORGANIZATION'S VISION IS THAT PEOPLE IN NEED REGARDLESS OF FAITH OR CREED WILL FIND OPEN THE DOORS OF THE AGENCY AND BE MET WITH HELP, HOSPITALITY AND HOPE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS
WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREAS.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO PROVIDE MAJOR HOUSING ASSISTANCE TO THE HOMELESS AND NEAR-HOMELESS POPULATIONS OF THE COUNTIES IN OUR SERVICE AREA THAT ARE MOST IN NEED, EMERGENCY FOOD AND HOUSING SUPPORT TO LOW-INCOME FAMILIES IN THE TOPEKA AREA, EXPANSION OF FREE TAX PREPARATION AND SUMMER FOOD SERVICES TO IMPOVERISHED RURAL COMMUNITIES, AND CRUCIAL HELP WITH EDUCATION, COMMUNITY SUPPORTS AND EMPLOYMENT TO STRUGGLING LEGAL IMMIGRANTS. ALTOGETHER, THIS PROJECT, IF FUNDED,  WOULD DIRECTLY SERVE OVER 7,000 PEOPLE IN OR NEAR POVERTY AND MAKE IMPORTANT CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE EFFICIENCY AND EFFICACY WITH WHICH WE SERVE ALL OF THE 80,000 PEOPLE WHO RECEIVE OUR SERVICES EACH YEAR. OVER THE COURSE OF THE COMING YEAR, EIGHT VISTAS, THREE FILLING NEW POSITIONS AND FIVE CONTINUING THEIR CURRENT PROJECTS, WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING DOZENS OF SUSTAINABLE, CAPACITY-BUILDING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ESTABLISHING ADDITIONAL VITA PROGRAM AND SUMMER FOOD SITES IN RURAL FOOD DESERTS, CREATING EDUCATIONAL PROCESSES AND MATERIALS FOR NEW IMMIGRANTS, RECRUITING AND TRAINING SKILLED VOLUNTEERS, AND IMPROVING THE EFFICIENCY OF FOOD DISTRIBUTION ACROSS 21 COUNTIES.

DEVELOPMENTAL SERVICES OF NORTHWEST KANSAS (DSNWK) HAS SERVED PERSONS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES (I/DD) FOR OVER 50 YEARS. DSNWK SERVES THE COMMUNITIES IN 18 RURAL COUNTIES IN RURAL NORTHWEST KANSAS OVER AN AREA OF 21,000 SQUARE MILES. DSNWK HAS PARTNERED WITH THE KANSAS FOOD BANK AND FEEDING AMERICA PROGRAM FOR MANY YEARS.  OVER 87% PERCENT OF OUR INDIVIDUALS SERVED AND 39% OF STAFF FALL INTO THE LOW INCOME CATEGORY. DSNWK HAS CONSISTENTLY PROVIDED FOOD ASSISTANCE EFFORTS TO BOTH GROUPS.  FOOD BANK AND FEEDING AMERICA PROGRAM HAS EXPANDED AND PROVIDES FOOD FOR ELLIS CO. FOOD BANK SITE WHICH CAN BE ACCESSED BY ANY COMMUNITY MEMBER IN NEED EVERY OTHER SATURDAY AND THE COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE CENTER WHICH CAN BE ACCESSED BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS THAT ARE BELOW POVERTY.  THESE EFFORTS MUST BE EXPANDED AND A DIETARY IMPROVEMENT INITIATIVE ADDED. THESE QUALITY OF LIVING EFFORTS HAVE BEEN CORE COMPONENTS IN OUR SERVICE THROUGHOUT ALL 18 COUNTIES SERVED.

DSNWK ALSO INITIATED AN EFFORT TO FUND RAISE THROUGH GRANTS FROM FOUNDATIONS AND CORPORATIONS AND WILL REQUIRE VISTA SUPPORT TO EXPAND THIS INITIATIVE IN ORDER TO RAISE FUNDS TO EFFECTIVELY CONTINUE THE MISSION OF SERVICE AND SUPPORT TO INDIVIDUALS WITH I/DD BECAUSE THERE HAVE BEEN FEW INCREASES IN FUNDING FROM KANSAS SINCE 2008 AND LACK OF FUNDS IS CAUSING CONSOLIDATION AND CLOSING OF SERVICES.  GRANT AND FUND SEARCHING IS NECESSARY TO FIND FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR RESIDENTIAL IMPROVEMENTS FOR THOSE SERVED AS WELL AS INCREASE ACCESSIBILITY AND NEEDED MEDICAL EQUIPMENT TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF INDIVIDUALS AS WELL AS THEIR SAFETY.

DSNWK WILL SEEK A VISTA VOLUNTEER FOR SOFTWARE SUPPORT.  ASSISTING INDIVIDUALS ON MEDICAID/KANCARE TO ENSURE THAT HEALTH AND MEDICAL INFORMATION IS CAPTURED IS VITAL TO THE WELLBEING OF THOSE SERVED.  HAVING THE ABILITY TO LOG AND TRACK MEDICAL HISTORY WILL REQUIRE VISTA SUPPORT TO INCREASE THE EFFECTIVENESS AND MAINTAIN INDIVIDUAL HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF THOSE SERVED ON MEDICAID/KANCARE.

DSNWK HAS BEEN AROUND FOR OVER 50 YEARS PROVIDING SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS ON THE I/DD HOME AND COMMUNITY BASED WAIVER FOR THOSE THAT QUALIFY BASED ON THEIR INCOME.  MANY PEOPLE IN THE COUNTIES SERVED ARE NOT AWARE OF WHAT DSNWK IS AND WHAT THE MISSION IS.  VISTA SUPPORT IS NEEDED TO INCREASE THE MARKETING & EVENTS EFFORT TO HELP WITH ADDITIONAL PARTNERSHIPS IN COMMUNITIES.  THIS WOULD ALSO ASSIST WITH COLLABORATING WITH EVENTS THAT ALREADY HAPPEN IN THE COMMUNITIES TO HELP IN FINDING ADDITIONAL SPONSORSHIP AND CREATE OPPORTUNITY FOR SERVICE AREAS AS WELL AS VISTA MEMBERS TO SHARE WHAT IS HAPPENING WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION.

CURRICULUM SUPPORT VISTA MEMBER HAS ENHANCED OPPORTUNITIES FOR EMPLOYMENT THAT MATCH TO AN INDIVIDUAL'S SKILL AND CAPACITY.  THERE ARE RECOMMENDATION PROCESSES FOR IMPROVEMENTS THAT NEED TO BE EXPANDED UPON TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WISHING TO SEEK EMPLOYMENT WHICH WILL INCREASE THE LIKELIHOOD OF EMPLOYMENT AND INCREASE THE INCOME OF THESE INDIVIDUALS WHO LIVE IN POVERTY UNDER MEDICAID.  THIS AREA IS EXPANDING TO HELP REACH MORE INDIVIDUALS BEING SERVED IN THE DSNWK "COLLEGE FOR LIVING" DAY SERVICE AREA TO ADD TO THEIR CURRICULUM TO MEET INDIVIDUAL SKILLS.

THERE ARE TWO OTHER NON-PROFITS, LEARNING CROSS PRESCHOOL & UNITED WAY OF ELLIS CO., THAT WILL BENEFIT FROM A YEAR TERM VISTA.  LEARNING CROSS PRESCHOOL IS A UNIQUE SCHOOL INSIDE OF A NURSING AND ASSISTED LIVING HOME.  THIS MEMBER WILL PROVIDE RESEARCH THAT HAS WORKED BEST TO CONNECT AN OLDER POPULATION WITH YOUNG CHILDREN THAT PROVIDES A HEALTHY LEARNING ENVIRONMENT FOR CHILDREN AS WELL AS PROVIDING MEANING FOR THOSE IN THE NURSING HOME FACILITY.  UNITED WAY OF ELLIS CO. WILL BE ACTIVE IN THE COMMUNITY IN IMPLEMENTING COMMUNITY IMPACT PROGRAMS, PARTICIPATING IN FUNDRAISING EVENTS, IDENTIFYING ENLISTING VOLUNTEERS, AND ASSISTING IN COMMUNITY PRESENTATIONS.  SEVEN TOTAL VISTA VOLUNTEERS ARE REQUESTED TO ASSIST IN EACH OF THE AREAS.  ESTABLISHING, EXPANDING, AND MAINTA

THE MISSION OF THE INTERNATIONAL RESCUE COMMITTEE, INC. (IRC) IS TO RESPOND TO THE WORLD'S WORST HUMANITARIAN CRISES AND HELP PEOPLE SURVIVE AND REBUILD THEIR LIVES.  IN THE UNITED STATES, IRC RESTORES SAFETY, DIGNITY AND HOPE BY RESETTLING REFUGEES THAT HAVE FLED VIOLENT CONFLICT AND PERSECUTION. IN 26 REGIONAL U.S. OFFICES, INCLUDING THE IRC OFFICES IN WICHITA AND GARDEN CITY, THE IRC PROVIDES REFUGEES WITH AN ARRAY OF SERVICES INCLUDING CASE MANAGEMENT, COMMUNITY ORIENTATION, ENGLISH LANGUAGE CLASSES, EMPLOYMENT ASSISTANCE, AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES. 
  
THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THE GOALS OF THE VISTA PROJECT ARE TO: (1) INCREASE THE SCALE AND REACH OF THE IRC'S ADULT EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES IN WICHITA; (2) INCREASE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF IRC'S IMMIGRATION SERVICES TO PROVIDE LOW COST IMMIGRATION SERVICES TO NOT ONLY REFUGEES RESETTLING IN WICHITA AND SOUTHWEST KANSAS, BUT ALSO TO ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CITIZENS LIVING IN KANSAS; AND (3) LEVERAGE VOLUNTEER AND IN-KIND RESOURCES TO SUPPORT EMPLOYABILITY, HOUSING AND CLIENT SELF-SUFFICIENCY. IN THE THIRD YEAR OF THE PROJECT, THE IRC IN KANSAS HOPES TO RESETTLE 252 REFUGEES.  

TEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING COMMUNITY-ORIENTED ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING: COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT, COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT, EXPANSION/STRENGTHENING OF PARTNERSHIPS/NETWORKS, MATERIAL DEVELOPMENT, OUTREACH, AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY.  IN MAY 2017, THE IRC BECAME A MULTI-SITE PROJECT AS IT AMENDED ITS VISTA GRANT PROJECT TO INCLUDE A VOLUNTEER COORDINATION VISTA FROM EPISCOPAL MIGRATION MINISTRIES (EMM). IN THE COMING PROJECT YEAR, THE KANSAS REFUGEE ECONOMIC EMPOWERMENT PROGRAM (KREEP) HOPES TO EXPAND UPON ITS CURRENT HOST SITES AND WILL WORK TOWARDS HAVING 10 VISTA VOLUNTEERS WORK WITH THE PROJECT.

ASIAN PACIFIC DEVELOPMENT CENTER'S MISSION IS TO ADVANCE THE WELL-BEING OF ASIAN AMERICAN PACIFIC ISLANDER COMMUNITIES OF COLORADO BY PROVIDING CULTURALLY APPROPRIATE AND INTEGRATED HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND ADVOCACY SERVICES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE EDUCATION AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 1000 OF OUR COMMUNITY MEMBERS EXPERIENCING LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENCY. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS FUNDRAISING AND SOCIAL ENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

ROCKY MOUNTAIN PREPARATORY SCHOOL'S MISSION IS TO EDUCATE CHILDREN IN GRADES PRE-K TO 5 WITH THE RIGOROUS ACADEMIC PREPARATION, CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT AND INDIVIDUALIZED SUPPORT NECESSARY TO SUCCEED IN AND GRADUATE FROM HIGH SCHOOL AND A FOUR YEAR COLLEGE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO:
1.  SUPPORT STUDENT ENROLLMENT TARGETS AT ALL FOUR CAMPUSES AND RECRUIT FOR OUR FOURTH CAMPUS, WHICH WILL BE PURPOSELY UNDER ENROLLED WHEN IT OPENS IN 2018.
2.   ENSURE THAT 5TH GRADE FAMILIES ARE WELL-INFORMED AND EQUIPPED TO CHOOSE A HIGH-QUALITY MIDDLE SCHOOL FOR THEIR CHILDREN.
3.  SUPPORT HIRING TARGETS TO ENSURE A SELECTIVE PROCESS WITH STRONG LEAD TEACHER AND FELLOWSHIP CANDIDATES.
4.  ENSURE THAT SCHOOLS ARE ACCESSING AND USING TITLE I-III FUNDING ACCURATELY AND EFFICIENTLY TO SUPPORT NEEDS AT THEIR CAMPUSES.
5.  CREATE AND STRENGTHEN INTERNAL SYSTEMS FOR DATA, OPERATIONS AND TECHNOLOGY.
THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BUILD CAPACITY, EFFECTIVENESS AND EFFICIENCY IN THE AREAS OF ENROLLMENT, ADVOCACY, HIRING, OPERATIONS, TECHNOLOGY, DATA AND BUSINESS MANAGEMENT ACROSS THE NETWORK AND AMONG BOTH SCHOOLS.  DOING SO WILL IMPROVE OUTCOMES FOR STUDENTS AND FAMILIES FACING THE CHALLENGES OF POVERTY BY EQUIPPING THEM WITH AN EXCELLENT EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE WORK OF OUR MISSION. 5 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING AND ENROLLING FAMILIES IN OUR SCHOOLS, ASSISTING 5TH GRADE FAMILIES TO NAVIGATE THE APPLICATION PROCESS FOR MIDDLE SCHOOL, SUPPORTING THE HIRING OF STAFF MEMBERS, BUILDING INTERNAL SYSTEMS FOR TECHNOLOGY AND DATA, AND SUPPORTING THE FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT OF OUR ORGANIZATION OVER THE COURSE OF THE SCHOOL YEAR.

EARTHLINKS' MISSION IS TO CULTIVATE TRANSFORMATION AND SELF-WORTH WITH PEOPLE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS AND POVERTY. BY CREATING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH EARTH-CENTERED PROGRAMS, INDIVIDUALS STEP OUT OF ISOLATION AND INTO COMMUNITY--RESTORING EACH OTHER AND THE PLANET. 

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA, SPECIFICALLY RELATED TO HOUSING, AS WELL AS HEALTHY FUTURES BY IMPROVING FOOD ACCESS AND WORKING WITH LOW-INCOME VETERANS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE THE EFFECTIVENESS AND EFFICIENCY OF OUR ORGANIZATION SO WE CAN SERVE MORE PEOPLE WITH MORE EFFECTIVE PROGRAMS. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING MORE EFFICIENT TRACKING AND DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, DEVELOPING NEW FUNDRAISING STRATEGIES AND IMPROVING EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS, AND IMPLEMENTING NEW INTERVENTIONS WITHIN OUR CURRENT PROGRAMS.

THE ADDITION OF TWO ADDITIONAL VISTA MEMBERS WILL FURTHER THE REACH OF OUR ORGANIZATION IN ESTABLISHING AND SUPERVISING A NEW PROJECT WITHIN EARTHLINKS ADDRESSING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND HEALTH FUTURES THROUGH A NEW SOCIAL ENTERPRISE COFFEE SHOP WHERE HOMELESS AND UNDERSERVED YOUTH WILL BE EMPLOYED AS WELL AS THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A NEW FLOWER AND HERB CSA TYPE PROJECT WITHIN OUR ORGANIZATION.  BOTH OF THESE PROJECTS WILL CREATE NEW EARNING OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADULTS IN POVERTY.

THE FIFTH VISTA MEMBER WILL BE WORKING IN IMPROVING FOOD ACCESS FOR THE SUN VALLEY NEIGHBORHOOD, AND WILL BE PLACED AT A NEIGHBORING NONPROFIT, THE SUN VALLEY KITCHEN.  SUN VALLEY RESIDENTS ARE NEARLY ALL BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL, LIVE IN SUBSIDIZED HOUSING AND OCCUPY A KNOWN FOOD DESERT.  SUN VALLEY KITCHEN ADDRESSES THE LACK OF FOOD ACCESS THROUGH A FOOD BANK, COOKING CLASSES, AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR NEIGHBORS TO ACT AS A VISITING CHEF WEEKLY IN THEIR FACILITY.

COLORADO COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION ASSOCIATION (D.B.A. DOWNTOWN COLORADO, INC. OR DCI), A NONPROFIT MEMBERSHIP ASSOCIATION, AIMS TO REVITALIZE DOWNTOWN DISTRICTS IN RURAL COLORADO COMMUNITIES. DCI'S VISTA PROGRAM CURRENTLY OPERATES AT 12 HOST SITES IN RURAL COMMUNITIES AND SUPPORTING RURAL DOWNTOWN DEVELOPMENT, THROUGHOUT COLORADO. AS OF JANUARY, 2017, SITES INCLUDE: TOWN OF BUENA VISTA, CANYONS AND PLAINS OF SOUTHEAST COLORADO, CENTRAL CITY, DOWNTOWN COLORADO, INC., HUERFANO COUNTY, CITY OF LEADVILLE, TOWN OF LIMON, LOCAL FIRST (LA PLATA COUNTY), LONGMONT DOWNTOWN DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY, CITY OF MONTROSE, CITY OF STEAMBOAT SPRINGS, CITY OF TRINIDAD. WE THESE SITES, WE WILL HAVE 8 VISTA SITES AND 1 VISTA LEADER.. IN 2018, WE WILL ALSO BE RECRUITING FOR ADDITIONAL SITES AS WELL. 
DCI'S VISTA PROGRAM FOCUSES ON ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, WITH A FOCUS ON RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT. THIS WAS IDENTIFIED BY CNCS AS A PROGRAM PRIORITY AREA, AND A PRIORITY POPULATION. AT EACH OF THE DCI VISTA SITES, VISTAS ARE WORKING TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR DOWNTOWN REVITALIZATION, TO CREATE RESILIENT DOWNTOWN COMMERCIAL DISTRICTS AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT AND HOUSING FOR LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS.

THE GOVERNOR'S OFFICE OF YOUTH, FAITH AND FAMILY'S (GOYFF) MISSION IS TO CREATE A BRIGHTER FUTURE FOR YOUTH AND FAMILIES BY PROVIDING ARIZONA WITH PROGRAMMING, RESOURCES AND EXPERTISE. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE ARIZONA COALITION FOR MILITARY FAMILIES (ACMF), THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTH FUTURES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES (OPIOID EPIDEMIC) AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO STRENGTHEN KEY NETWORKS OF ORGANIZATIONS AND EXPAND CAPACITY, AWARENESS AND IMPACT FOR FIVE INITIATIVE AREAS IMPORTANT TO ARIZONA, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THOUSANDS OF CITIZENS IN MANY COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE. SIX AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING AND DELIVERING CRITICAL IN-PERSON AND VIRTUAL TRAINING, DEVELOPING AND PUBLISHING OUTREACH MATERIALS, MILITARY VETERAN SUICIDE PREVENTION EXPANDING NETWORKS AND SUPPORTING THE STRENGTHENING OF ORGANIZATIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND CAPACITY BUILDING OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS.

THE MISSION OF THE CIVIC SERVICE INSTITUTE (CSI) IS TO INSPIRE PEOPLE OF ALL AGES THROUGHOUT ARIZONA TO VOLUNTEER AND CONNECT THEM WITH SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES TO MAKE POSITIVE IMPACTS IN OUR COMMUNITIES.  THE VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK A TOTAL OF 17 VISTA MEMBERS; 5 MEMBERS FOR STEM EDUCATION SERVING WITH EDUCATIONAL AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE THE INTEREST OF 2,500 LOW-INCOME AND NONTRADITIONAL YOUTH ANNUALLY IN STEM FIELDS LEADING TO PURSUING STEM CAREERS; 5 VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE INVOLVED IN CSI'S ALTERNATIVES TO MANAGING PAIN (AMP) OPIOID DEPENDENCY REDUCTION PROGRAM RESEARCHING, DEVELOPING, PRODUCING AND TRAINING 40 AMP AMERICORPS MEMBERS AND PRESENTING TRAININGS ANNUALLY TO 1,000 GENERAL PUBLIC MEMBERS; 5 VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE SERVING IN COLLEGE ACCESS ASSISTING CSI'S ARIZONA READY FOR COLLEGE AND CAREER (ARCC) PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS IN RECRUITMENT, TRAINING, AND OTHER ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COLLEGE ACCESS, AND ONE VISTA LEADER.  STEM VISTA MEMBERS WILL SERVE IN COCONINO COUNTY; AMP AND ARCC VISTA MEMBERS WILL SERVE THROUGHOUT ARIZONA INCLUDING COCONINO, MARICOPA, MOHAVE, NAVAJO, PIMA, AND YAVAPAI COUNTIES.  ESTIMATED TIME FOR COMPLETION IS BY FEBRUARY 2, 2020.

LUCIE'S PLACE PROVIDES HOMELESS LGBTQ YOUNG ADULTS IN CENTRAL ARKANSAS WITH SAFE LIVING ENVIRONMENTS, JOB TRAINING AND COUNSELING SERVICES IN ORDER TO ENSURE LIFELONG STABILITY AND SUCCESS, AND WORKS TO PROMOTE EQUALITY AND ACCEPTANCE FOR LGBTQ YOUNG ADULTS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO: CREATE A STABLE AND SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY VOLUNTEER PROGRAM; RESEARCH AND CREATE PROGRAMMING FOR A HOST HOME PROGRAM; ASSIST THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IN WRITING GRANTS. THESE GOALS WILL BENEFIT 70 HOMELESS LGBT YOUNG ADULTS IN THE AREA. 1 VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PROGRAM CREATION/IMPLEMENTATION AND GRANT WRITING OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

THE MISSION OF LEGAL AID OF ARKANSAS IS TO CHAMPION EQUAL JUSTICE FOR LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES AND TO REMEDY THE CONDITIONS THAT BURDEN AND MARGINALIZE THEM. THE VISTA MEMBERS' EFFORTS WILL HAVE MEASURABLE IMPACTS ON CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, HEALTHY FUTURES, EDUCATION, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. LEGAL AID REQUESTS SIX VISTA MEMBERS TO BUILD ORGANIZATION CAPACITY AND TO HELP STRENGTHEN THE STATEWIDE ACCESS TO JUSTICE INFRASTRUCTURE. MEMBERS WILL SUPPORT RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT; PLAN FOR EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATIONS, OUTREACH, AND EDUCATION; STRENGTHEN STATEWIDE VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT; STAFF STATEWIDE TASKFORCES; IMPROVE ARKANSAS ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES SCORE; AND HELP DEVELOP A STATEWIDE ACCESS TO JUSTICE PLAN, ASSESSING STATEWIDE LEGAL NEEDS AND EVALUATING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF LEGAL INTERVENTIONS. WE ANTICIPATE THE PROJECTS CAN BE COMPLETED AND BECOME SELF-SUSTAINING WITHIN 24 TO 36 MONTHS AFTER IMPLEMENTATION.

TRI CYCLE FARMS' MISSION IS TO GROW 'COMMUNITY THROUGH SOIL' AS WE STEWARD FOOD AWARENESS, EDUCATION AND EMPOWERMENT. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES CNCS FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONAL SYSTEMS FOR COHESIVE PERFORMANCE AND EFFICIENCIES IN THE AREAS OF MEDIA AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH; VOLUNTEER COORDINATION; GRANTS/DATA MANAGEMENT; BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT AND EVENTS. THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT AT LEAST FIVE HUNDRED NEW LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY MEMBERS INCLUDING FAMILIES, AT-RISK TEENS, SCHOOL CHILDREN, UNIVERSITY STUDENTS, VETERANS AND MULTI-DEMOGRAPHIC MINORITY GROUPS. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CONSISTENT COMMUNITY OUTREACH, RESOURCE AND DATA MANAGEMENT AND IMPACTFUL CAPACITY BUILDING OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT PERIOD APRIL 28, 2019-APRIL 25, 2020.

THE CENTER FOR COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT'S MISSION IS TO 'EMPOWER STUDENTS TO BECOME ENGAGED CITIZENS THROUGH SERVICE, EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING, AND PRACTICING SOCIAL VALUE.? THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT WOULD BE HOSTED BY THE CENTER FOR COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, WITH MEMBERS ALSO PLACED AT THE CENTER FOR MULTICULTURAL AND DIVERSITY EDUCATION, AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ARKANSAS WITH THE GOAL OF FURTHERING OUR MISSION TO PRODUCE CITIZENS ENGAGED IN THE WORK OF BETTERING THEIR COMMUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION AND WOULD HOST FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WHO WOULD FOCUS ON: EXPANDING CAPACITY FOR OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT WITH COMMUNITY AGENCIES, FACILITATING THE DEVELOPMENT OF COMMUNITY SERVING EDUCATIONAL ENRICHMENT PROJECTS, DEVELOPING ENGAGEMENT STRATEGIES FOR UNDER-SERVED STUDENT POPULATIONS, AND ENGAGING FAMILIES AND PARENTS IN SUPPORTING THE SUCCESS OF UNDER-SERVED STUDENT POPULATIONS. THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THESE PROJECTS BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING RELATIONSHIPS WITH CAMPUS AND NON-CAMPUS PARTNERS, CREATING AND SUPPORTING VOLUNTEER ROLES, COACHING COLLEGE STUDENT VOLUNTEER ROLES, FACILITATING LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, CREATING CURRICULUM AND ENGAGEMENT STRATEGIES FOR FAMILIES, AND INTEGRATING VISTA WORK INTO THE OVERALL GOALS OF EACH DEPARTMENT.

THE RURAL IMPACT DEMONSTRATION PROJECT IS A NATIONAL PARTNERSHIP INCLUDING THE WHITE HOUSE RURAL COUNCIL, THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, THE AMERICAN PEDIATRICS ASSOCIATION, COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP, THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICE.  LOCALLY, EACH OF THE RURAL IMPACT BACKBONE AGENCIES BRING A CADRES OF COMMUNITY PARTNERS WHO WILL COLLABORATE TO SUPPORT THIS INITIATIVE AIMED TO DECREASE RURAL AND TRIBAL CHILD POVERTY BY USING THE TWO GENERATION APPROACH. 

RURAL IMPACT IS, AT THE HIGHEST LEVEL, A STRATEGY TO REDUCE CHILD POVERTY IN RURAL AND TRIBAL AREAS.  RURAL IMPACT HYPOTHESIZES THAT WITH A VARIETY OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE SERVICES AND INTENTIONAL EFFORTS BY THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TO BREAK POLICY BARRIERS AND ENCOURAGE COOPERATION AND ALIGNMENT AMONG FEDERAL PROGRAMS, RURAL AND TRIBAL COMMUNITIES WILL MAKE CHANGES IN THE WAY SERVICES ARE DELIVERED AND TRACKED SUCH THAT THE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME CHILDREN AND PARENTS ARE ADDRESSED TOGETHER IN A TWO-GENERATION APPROACH.  WHILE ADDRESSING THE NEEDS OF FAMILIES IS NOT A NEW APPROACH TO FIGHTING POVERTY, THE CURRENT WAVE OF TWO-GENERATION STRATEGIES IS CUTTING-EDGE IN THAT IT SEEKS TO INTENTIONALLY INTEGRATE HIGH-QUALITY SERVICES FOR CHILDREN AND PARENTS IN NEW AND EXPLICIT WAYS.  AT THE END OF THE PROJECT, THE GOAL IS TO HAVE A SET OF 10 INNOVATIVE TWO-GENERATION MODELS, 4 OR 5 ACTUAL INNOVATIONS TESTED DURING THE SIX-MONTH IMPLEMENTATION PHASE, AND A NUMBER OF EXAMPLES OF FAMILIES THAT HAVE RECEIVED SERVICES IN A WAY THEY WOULD NOT HAVE RECEIVED THEM PRIOR TO RURAL IMPACT.

THE LONGER TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED ENROLLMENT IN QUALITY EARLY CHILDHOOD PROGRAMS, INCREASED HIGH SCHOOL / GED AND POST-SECONDARY CREDENTIALS FOR PARENTS, INCREASED PARENTAL EMPLOYMENT, INCREASED CHILD AND FAMILY WELL-BEING, AND ULTIMATELY, A REDUCTION IN RURAL AND TRIBAL CHILD POVERTY. 

RURAL IMPACT IS A SUSTAINED CAMPAIGN TO ADDRESS RURAL CHILD POVERTY BY SUPPORTING IMPROVED WELL-BEING AND UPWARD ECONOMIC MOBILITY OF CHILDREN IN RURAL AND TRIBAL PLACES. THERE ARE SEVERAL GOALS FOR THE PROPOSED EFFORT WHICH ARE AS FOLLOWS: 
*	ENHANCE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF RURAL CHILD POVERTY AND ITS IMPACT ON THE FUTURE OF RURAL COMMUNITIES AND AMERICA'S GLOBAL COMPETITIVENESS; 
*	AMPLIFY THE ADMINISTRATION'S ANTI-POVERTY AND ECONOMIC MOBILITY AGENDA THROUGH A RURAL LENS; 
*	IMPROVE IMPLEMENTATION AND ACCESSIBILITY OF PROGRAMS TO BETTER SERVE RURAL CHILDREN AND FAMILIES; AND 
*	DEVELOP A MODEL FOR FUTURE FEDERAL ACTION AROUND CHILD POVERTY THROUGH FOCUSED INVESTMENTS IN RURAL PLACES ENGAGING IN TWO-GENERATION, BUNDLED SERVICES APPROACHES.
THE COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP, THROUGH ITS LEARNING COMMUNITY RESOURCE CENTER, WILL WORK WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO THE WHITE HOUSE RURAL COUNCIL'S RURAL IMPACT EFFORT.  THE PARTNERSHIP WILL WORK WITH CNCS TO MANAGE THE VISTA SELECTION, PLACEMENT, AND VISTA VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PROCESSES.

NORTHWEST GEORGIA HEALTHCARE PARTNERSHIP (NGHP) WAS ORGANIZED IN 1992 IN COLLABORATION WITH HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS, BUSINESS AND INDUSTRY LEADERS, LOCAL GOVERNMENT, EDUCATION, AND PUBLIC HEALTH AGENCIES TO CREATE FUNDAMENTAL CHANGES IN THE DELIVERY OF HEALTH SERVICES IN WHITFIELD AND MURRAY COUNTIES. NGHP'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE COMMUNITY HEALTH BY IDENTIFYING SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO SIGNIFICANT HEALTH ISSUES VIA INNOVATION, BENCHMARKING, AND APPLICATION OF BEST PRACTICES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES, EDUCATION, AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY PRIORITIES, AS WELL AS THE FY16 PRIORITY PROGRAMMING AREA OF NEW AMERICANS/IMMIGRANT AND REFUGEE INTEGRATION. 
WE ARE REQUESTING 14 VISTA WORKERS FOR A FIVE-YEAR PROJECT; ONE LEADER, ELEVEN VISTAS, AND TWO COST-SHARE. TWO VISTAS WILL BE HOUSED WITH NGHP AND THE OTHER EIGHT WILL BE HOUSED WITHIN EIGHT DIFFERENT PARTNER AGENCIES, FOR WHICH NGHP WILL SERVE AS INTERMEDIARY. EACH SERVICE SITE TARGETS LOW-INCOME, UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS, TO INCLUDE FOCUS WITHIN THE LARGE, LOCAL HISPANIC POPULATION. WHILE PROGRAMMATIC FOCUS VARIES FROM SITE TO SITE, ALL 14 VISTAS WILL WORK TOWARD COMMON OUTCOMES IN THE AREAS OF VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE HOURS COMPLETED, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO FACILITATE AN INCREASE IN NEW BENEFICIARIES RECEIVING SERVICES, AND COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENTS AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT TO CREATE NEW SERVICES OFFERINGS FOR THOSE IN NEED WITHIN THE COMMUNITY. 
ACTIVITIES TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT/ENHANCEMENT OF VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT PLANS, INCLUDING RECRUITMENT MATERIALS; DEVELOPMENT/ENHANCEMENT OF COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PLANS, TO INCLUDE PRESENTATIONS TO THE COMMUNITY AND ATTENDANCE AT COMMUNITY EVENTS; CREATION OF DATABASES TO TRACK OUTCOMES; COMPILATION OF POTENTIAL FUNDING SOURCES; CREATION/REVISION OF AGENCY MARKETING PLAN AND/OR MATERIALS; PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND/OR PROGRAM ASSESSMENT AND REVISION TO ADDRESS UNMET AND/OR SHIFTING COMMUNITY NEEDS; DEVELOPMENT OF SURVEYS TO GENERATE OUTCOME DATA, AS WELL AS GAUGE COMMUNITY NEED.

THE GOAL OF THIS VISTA PROJECT IS TO INCREASE OUR ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO STRENGTHEN OUR SERVICES TO OUR OVER 100 YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES IN THE AREAS OF YOUTH EDUCATION, COMMUNITY MEMBER SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND FAMILY EDUCATION, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH, UNITY AND VOICE.  THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS 1) VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT TO INCREASE TUTORING AND MENTORING SERVICES FOR YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES, 2) RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT AND FUNDRAISING TO DIVERSIFY YELLS'S FUNDING BASE FOR PROGRAM SERVICES THROUGH IDENTIFYING AND GENERATING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH NEW GRANT, FOUNDATION, AND INDIVIDUAL DONORS, AS WELL AS GENERATING MORE IN-KIND SUPPORT FOR PROGRAMS AND SERVICES, AND 3) MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS TO ENHANCE YELLS'S MARKETING AND PUBLIC RELATIONS INITIATIVES BY DEVELOPING A COMMUNITY DATABASE, ESTABLISHING MEDIA PARTNERSHIPS AND COMMUNICATION TOOLS, AND INCREASING SOCIAL MEDIA OPPORTUNITIES TO BETTER INFORM THE COMMUNITY SERVED ABOUT YELLS PROGRAM SERVICES.  OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS THROUGH THE EFFORTS OF THE VISTA PROGRAM THE CAPACITY OF YELLS WILL BE ENHANCED BY HAVING A MORE STRUCTURED VOLUNTEER PROGRAM, A LARGER VOLUNTEER POOL, A DIVERSE FUNDING STREAM (INCLUDING FINANCIAL AND IN-KIND ASSISTANCE), AND A MORE VISIBLE MARKETING PRESENCE.  THROUGH THESE RESOURCES, YELLS WILL BE ABLE TO STRENGTHEN OUR SERVICES TO "AT RISK" YOUTH AND FAMILIES.

FLORIDA, WERE DESIGNATED A RURAL PROMISE ZONE BY PRESIDENT BARACK OBAMA IN SUMMER 2016. THE

GOVERNMENT, AND PRIVATE ENTITIES, HAS OUTLINED A STRATEGIC PLAN WHICH SEEKS TO ACHIEVE: 1.
ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT; 2. IMPROVED EDUCATION; 3. CRIME REDUCTION; AND 4. JOB CREATION. SWFRPC
REQUESTS TEN VISTA VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN ACHIEVING THESE GOALS. THREE VISTA VOLUNTEER WILL SERVICE

WILL SERVE WITHIN THE SWFRPC- THE LEAD APPLICANT AND PROGRAM COORDINATOR OF THE PROMISE ZONE.

VOLUNTEERS.

SWFRPC BEGAN ITS WORK IN 1973 AS A REGIONAL ORGANIZATION OF SIX COUNTIES AND 17 MUNICIPAL
GOVERNMENTS LOCATED THEREIN. THE MISSION OF THE COUNCIL IS TO WORK ACROSS NEIGHBORING COMMUNITIES
TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF ITS RESIDENTS THROUGH PROTECTING AND IMPROVING THE PHYSICAL, ECONOMIC
AND SOCIAL ASPECTS OF THE REGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF FUTURE GENERATIONS. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK OF
THE SWFRPC ARE THE GOVERNMENT ENTITIES REPRESENTED BY THE COUNCIL AND ALL OF THEIR RESIDENTS
THROUGHOUT THE SOUTHWEST FLORIDA REGION.

THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE CAPACITY OF THE PARTNERS AND CAUSE IMPROVED OUTCOMES IN THE AREAS OF
EDUCATION, JOB CREATION, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, CRIME REDUCTION AND INFRASTRUCTURE THROUGH GRANTS
AND FUNDING OBTAINED WITH THE SERVICE OF VISTA VOLUNTEERS, INCREASED INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES
DEVELOPED BY VISTA VOLUNTEERS FOR IMMOKALEE FOUNDATION STUDENTS, AND EDUCATION, COMMUNITY
OUTREACH, AND AWARENESS BUILDING BY VISTA VOLUNTEERS.

THIS FIVE YEAR PROJECT INCLUDES THE STRATEGIC GOALS OF THE SOUTHWEST FLORIDA PROMISE ZONE. THESE GOALS
ARE:

1. CRIME REDUCTION- WITH AN INITIAL FOCUS ON HUMAN TRAFFICKING (HT)

-EDUCATING PROFESSIONALS AND STAFF LIKELY TO COME INTO CONTACT WITH HT VICTIMS.

-EDUCATING ALL FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN IN AT RISK AREAS ABOUT HUMAN TRAFFICKING WITHIN FIVE YEARS.

-DEVELOPMENT OF GREATER RESOURCES FOR HT VICTIMS.

3. IMPROVED EDUCATION- WITH AN INITIAL FOCUS ON EXPANSION OF THE IMMOKALEE FOUNDATION'S TIME-TESTED
PROGRAMS
-GOAL OF IMPROVING HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION RATES TO 90% IN 5 YEARS.

-INCREASE KINDERGARTEN READINESS.

-INCREASE PERCENTAGE OF THIRD GRADE STUDENTS MEETING OR EXCEEDING READING PROFICIENCY

4. JOB CREATION WITH THE GOAL OF REDUCING BY 50% THE CURRENT OF UNEMPLOYMENT RATE FROM 15.6% BY

5. IMPROVED ECONOMIC CONDITIONS- WITH AN INITIAL CONCENTRATION ON ESTABLISHMENT OF FOOD MARKETS AND
IMPROVED ECOTOURISM.

OUR COMMUNITIES SUCCEED WHEN ALL OF OUR CHILDREN SUCCEED IN SCHOOL; WHEN ADULTS CAN SECURE A GOOD JOB, MANAGE THEIR FINANCES AND HAVE ACCESS TO QUALITY HEALTHCARE. OUR MISSION ALIGNS STRONGLY WITH THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL HELP UWB ATTAIN THE GOAL OF PROVIDING CARING, TRAINED MENTORS TO STUDENTS STRUGGLING WITH READING IN SECOND AND THIRD GRADE; DEVELOP ADDITIONAL RESOURCES AND OPPORTUNITIES AS WELL AS COMMUNITY AWARENESS TO HELP REDUCE THE ACHIEVEMENT GAP FOR STUDENTS OF COLOR; PROMOTE INCREASED READING ACTIVITY FOR ALL LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS OF BREVARD WITH A FOCUS ON LOW-INCOME YOUTH; PROVIDE ACCESS TO QUALITY FINANCIAL EDUCATION TOOLS AND GUIDANCE.  THE LONG-TERM PROJECT GOAL IS TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SUCCESS WITH OUR YOUTH IN ORDER TO STRENGTHEN THEIR CHANCES FOR A SECURE FUTURE THROUGH MULTIPLE APPROACHES WHICH EXPANDS AND IMPROVES EXISTING PROGRAMS AND IDENTIFIES GAPS IN SERVICE FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT. WE EXPECT OUR EFFORTS TO IMPACT 4,800 OF CHILDREN IN BREVARD THROUGH OUR WORK IN LITERACY AND WELLNESS AND AT LEAST 4,500 ADULTS THROUGH OUR FINANCIAL STABILITY PROGRAMS. THE SIX VISTA'S WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING OF MENTORS; COORDINATING EFFORTS TO STRENGTHEN AND INCREASE RESOURCES TO MINORITY CHILDREN, PROMOTE THE COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF FINANCIAL WELLNESS RESOURCES AVAILABLE IN THE COMMUNITY AND IMPROVE METHODS OF DELIVERY FOR EACH OF THE EXISTING PROGRAMS OVER A ONE YEAR PERIOD. THE LONG-TERM GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO REDUCE POVERTY THROUGH OUR EFFORTS IN EDUCATION, INCOME AND HEALTH.

AS THE BACKBONE OF HUNGER RELIEF, FEEDING TAMPA BAY IS THE LARGEST FOOD RESCUE AND DISTRIBUTION ORGANIZATION IN OUR COMMUNITY, SERVING A FOOD-INSECURE POPULATION OF MORE THAN 600,000 PEOPLE IN A 10-COUNTY REGION. FEEDING TAMPA BAY RECOVERS SURPLUS FOOD FROM LOCAL GROWERS, MANUFACTURERS, SUPERMARKETS, AND ORGANIZED COMMUNITY FOOD DRIVES AND DISTRIBUTES IT TO THOSE IN NEED THROUGH DIRECT PROGRAMS AND A PARTNERSHIP NETWORK OF 600 AGENCY PARTNERS. LAST YEAR, FEEDING TAMPA BAY SUPPLIED NEARLY 55 MILLION MEALS TO OUR NEIGHBORS, 4.5 MILLION MEALS EVERY MONTH TO THOSE WHO WOULD OTHERWISE GO HUNGRY. WE APPRECIATE YOUR SUPPORT AND WORKING ALONGSIDE US AS WE WORK TOWARDS A HUNGER-FREE TAMPA BAY - PROVIDING 115 MILLION MEALS WITH DIGNITY EVERY YEAR BY 2025.  

THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO RAISE AWARENESS OF ISSUE OF HUNGER AND RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO THOSE IN NEED, TO DEVELOP CAPACITY OF THE FEEDING TAMPA BAY AGENCY PARTNER FOOD BANKS TO SERVE THEIR LOCAL COMMUNITY, AND TO RECRUIT, MANAGE AND DEVELOP VOLUNTEERS TO BETTER SERVE THE COMMUNITY OF HUNGRY RESIDENTS.  VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, DEVELOPING COMMUNICATION PLANS, PROVIDING RESEARCH ON FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES AND TRAINING AGENCY PARTNERS ON HOW THEY CAN INCORPORATE SNAP TO EXPAND OUR CAPABILITIES ACROSS OUR AGENCY NETWORK.

UNITED WAY OF ESCAMBIA COUNTY HAS BEEN SERVING ESCAMBIA COUNTY SINCE 1924.  IN THAT TIME, WE HAVE CLOSELY EVALUATED THE NEEDS IN OUR COMMUNITY AND ADJUSTED OUR PRIORITIES TO MAXIMIZE THE USE OF LOCAL RESOURCES THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS THAT LEVERAGE COMMUNITY ASSETS TO RETURN OUTCOMES THAT CREATE SUSTAINABLE POSITIVE CHANGE. IN OUR 93 YEARS, WE HAVE LAUNCHED SEVERAL PROJECTS THAT HAVE EVOLVED INTO KEY COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE GROWN THE IMPACTS THAT ORIGINATED WITH UNITED WAY'S VISION OF HOW TO BEST MEET A COMMUNITY NEED THROUGH SUSTAINABLE CHANGE.  
SOME OF THE ENTITIES THAT UNITED WAY PLAYED A ROLE IN BIRTHING LOCALLY INCLUDE: 
BRACE (BE READY ALLIANCE COORDINATING FOR EMERGENCIES) --AN ORGANIZATION BIRTHED OUT OF THE RECOGNITION THAT OUR COMMUNITY WAS UNPREPARED TO RECOVER FROM AN EVENT LIKE HURRICANE IVAN THAT DEVASTATED CITIZENS IN 2004.  BRACE NOW HELPS ENSURE THAT WE ARE READY TO CONVENE PARTNERS NECESSARY FOR LONG-TERM RECOVERY FROM THE NATURAL DISASTERS THAT PLAGUE FLORIDA'S GULF COAST.  
* NATURAL DISASTERS HAVE HISTORICALLY DEVASTATED LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS AND CAN BE THE TRIGGER FOR ENTRY INTO BANKRUPTCY, HOMELESSNESS AND/OR POVERTY.  WITH 41% OF LOCAL HOUSEHOLDS STRUGGLING TO MEET CURRENT BILLS AND FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS, NATURAL DISASTERS ARE SOMETHING THAT BRACE HELPS CITIZENS FACE AND RECOVER FROM.  
BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF NORTHWEST FLORIDA STARTED LOCALLY FROM A PARTNERSHIP HOUSED WITHIN UNITED WAY AND LAUNCHED TO SUSTAIN THE ONE-ON-ONE MENTORING SERVICES FOR CHILDREN IN ESCAMBIA, SANTA ROSA, OKALOOSA, WALTON AND BAY COUNTIES.   
* A SOLID EDUCATION AND SUPPORT STRUCTURE ARE OFTEN THE BARRIERS THAT PREVENT STUDENTS FROM ENTERING CRIMINAL ACTIVITY AND CAN RESCUE THEM FROM A FUTURE OF LIMITED OPPORTUNITIES THAT EXIST WHEN A STUDENT DROPS OUT OF SCHOOL.  BIG BROTHERS AND SISTERS MENTORING PROGRAMS ARE BASED ON PROVEN CASE MANAGEMENT PROTOCOLS THAT SEE CHILDREN FROM SINGLE PARENT HOUSEHOLDS THROUGH THE STRUGGLES THAT THEY FACE WHEN THERE IS NO POSITIVE ADULT ROLE MODEL IN THE HOME.  BY ENCOURAGING EDUCATION, STUDY HABITS AND ACCEPTANCE, BIGS ENCOURAGE THEIR LITTLE TO SEE THE POSITIVES THAT LIFE CAN OFFER AND MODEL BEST PRACTICES THAT PREVENT A CHILD FROM CONTINUING A CYCLE OF GENERATIONAL POVERTY THAT MAY CONTINUE WITHOUT THEIR SUPPORT.
THE FIRST CALL FOR HELP LOCALLY EVOLVED INTO OUR CURRENT STATE AND NATIONALLY ACCREDITED SERVICE THAT PROVIDES THREE-DIGIT PHONE ACCESS AND COMPUTER ACCESS TO LOCAL RESOURCES AND REFERRAL MANAGEMENT NEEDED TO MEET SOCIAL AND HUMAN SERVICE NEEDS.  
* LOCALLY, OUR 211 TEAM SUSTAINS THE SERVICE TO OVER 30,000 CALLERS AND OVER 150,000 WEBSITE VIEWERS ANNUALLY.  THEY SERVE 7 COUNTIES IN NORTHWEST FLORIDA AND MAINTAIN OVER 2,000 LOCAL RESOURCES THAT ARE ACCESSIBLE TO LOCAL CITIZENS. 211 IS A HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICE HELPLINE THAT HELPS CITIZENS NAVIGATE THE COMPLEXITIES OF THE SERVICE SECTOR.  ADDITIONALLY, ADVOCACY FOR LOCAL CALLERS HELP CITIZENS TRANSITION FROM DESPERATION TO HOPE AS THEY PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO LOCAL RESOURCES CLIENTS CAN ACCESS TO HELP THEM BRIDGE THE GAP BETWEEN STABILITY AND HOPELESSNESS.  CURRENTLY, OUR LOCAL 211 TRACKS THE INSTANCES IN WHICH THEY ARE ABLE TO HELP RESOLVE EVICTION OR FORECLOSURE ISSUES THAT WOULD CATAPULT THEM FURTHER INTO POVERTY WITHOUT THIS SERVICE.  

WHILE THESE PROGRAMS AND ORGANIZATIONS STARTED AS VOLUNTEER DRIVEN, GRANT FUNDED OR COMMUNITY FUNDED INITIATIVES; THEY HAVE GROWN INTO INDEPENDENT 501C3 ORGANIZATIONS AND CORE PROGRAMS THAT HAVE THE CAPACITY TO SERVE LOCAL CITIZENS IN A WAY THAT PREVENTS THEIR ENTRY INTO POVERTY OR LIFTS THEM OUT OF THAT SITUATION. 
WE ARE EXCITED BY THE OPPORTUNITY TO SERVE AS A GEOGRAPHIC INTERMEDIARY FOR OUR LOCAL COMMUNITY.  CURRENTLY, OUR COMMUNITY IS POISED TO LAUNCH INTO A LONG-TERM PROCESS THAT HELPS MOVE CITIZENS ALONG THE CRADLE TO CAREER CONTINUUM UNTIL THEY REACH A COMMUNITY-HELD VISION OF PROSPERITY THAT SEES EACH INDIVIDUAL RECOGNIZE THEIR POTENTIAL FOR THE GREATER GOOD OF THE WHOLE.

COLLEGIATE PATHWAYS, INC.'S MISSION IS EMPOWER UNDERREPRESENTED MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS TO PURSUE SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING AND MATHEMATICS (STEM) FIELDS THROUGH COLLEGE PREPARATION, CAREER READINESS, AND MENTORING. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION (STEM EDUCATION) FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO THE GOAL OF THE PROPOSED COLLEGIATE PATHWAYS VISTA PROJECT IS TO FOSTER A SUSTAINABLE MODEL THAT INCREASES COLLEGE ACCESS, BUILDS PARTNERSHIPS, GENERATES SYSTEMS FOR DATA COLLECTION AND MANAGEMENT, ENHANCES VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, BUILDS CAPACITY FOR OUR SOCIAL MEDIA CAMPAIGNS AND FUNDRAISING WHILE ADDRESSING THE ACHIEVEMENT GAP AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 250 LOW-INCOME YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS MARKETING, FUNDRAISING AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT OVER THE COURSE OF 12 MONTHS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: LOCATED IN MADISON COUNTY, THE CITY OF HUNTSVILLE IS ONE OF ALABAMA'S MOST AFFLUENT AND FASTEST-GROWING AREAS IN THE STATE, RESULTING FROM GROWTH DUE TO HIGH TECHNOLOGY INDUSTRIES AND SPACE TECHNOLOGY. DESPITE THIS APPARENT OVERALL PROSPERITY, ONE PART OF THE REGION, CENSUS TRACT 12, PRESENTS A FAR DIFFERENT PICTURE. MORE THAN 80 PERCENT OF THE RESIDENTS LIVING IN HUNTSVILLE PUBLIC HOUSING COMMUNITIES ARE LOW INCOME. AT LEAST 81 PERCENT OF THE AREA'S POPULATION EARNS BETWEEN $5,000 AND $10,000 ANNUALLY IN A CITY WHERE THE 2010 ESTIMATED AVERAGE HOUSEHOLD INCOME WAS $58,032. OF THE 884 FAMILIES WHO LIVE IN THIS PARTICULAR TRACT, 93 PERCENT ARE AFRICAN AMERICAN, AND ONE-THIRD OF THESE FAMILIES ARE HEADED BY SINGLE FEMALES WHO HAVE CHILDREN LESS THAN 18 YEARS OLD. AS A RESULT, HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT RATES, BLIGHT, AND INADEQUATE HOUSING CHARACTERIZE THE AREA FOR MINORITY RESIDENTS.

IN COMPARISON MANY OF THE BLACK BELT AREAS OF ALABAMA REFLECT SIMILAR DEMOGRAPHICS AS URBAN AREAS IN THE NORTHERN PART OF THE STATE OF ALABAMA. WITH THIS PROGRAM WE WILL DEVELOP A PIPELINE OF RESOURCES AND TECHNOLOGICAL INFORMATION FROM NORTH ALABAMA TO THE SOUTHERN REGION OF THE STATE.

THE MISSION OF THE GIRL SCOUTS IS TO BUILD GIRLS OF COURAGE, CONFIDENCE, AND CHARACTER, WHO MAKE THE WORLD A BETTER PLACE; GIRL SCOUTING HELPS GIRLS DEVELOP THEIR FULL INDIVIDUAL POTENTIAL; RELATE TO OTHERS WITH INCREASING UNDERSTANDING, SKILL, AND RESPECT; DEVELOP VALUES TO GUIDE THEIR ACTIONS AND PROVIDE THE FOUNDATION FOR SOUND DECISION MAKING; AND CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPROVEMENT OF SOCIETY THROUGH THEIR ABILITIES, LEADERSHIP SKILLS, AND COOPERATION WITH OTHERS.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS BY ENHANCING THE GIRL SCOUTS' STEM, CUSTOMER ENGAGEMENT INITIATIVE, AT EACH OF THE THREE LOCAL COUNCILS, AS WELL AS OTHER NEW TECHNOLOGY SYSTEMS INITIATIVES AT ONE COUNCIL, AND ENSURING THAT THOSE IMPROVEMENTS ARE SUSTAINABLE BEYOND THE FEDERAL PROJECT PERIOD.  THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL FURTHER DEVELOP THE PROVEN GIRL SCOUT CURRICULUM IN RELATION TO STEM LEARNING AND MAKE THEM ACCESSIBLE TO A NEW COHORT OF PREVIOUSLY UNDERSERVED GIRLS AGES 5-17 IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES THAT ARE TRADITIONALLY BLACK, LATINA AND NATIVE AMERICAN ' A MINIMUM 1000 GIRLS (200 GIRLS PER OUTREACH VISTA) WOULD BE ENGAGED IN THE STEM PROGRAMMING.  A TOTAL OF 7 VISTA MEMBERS ( FOCUSED ON OUTREACH TO UNDERSERVED GIRLS,  TECHNOLOGY SUPPORT) WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THESE GOALS SUCH AS IMPROVING THE CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE FOR VOLUNTEERS AND CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND REFINING THE GSUSA'S STEM LEARNING MODELS TO WORK MORE EFFECTIVELY WITH GIRLS FROM COMMUNITIES IDENTIFIED AS LOW-INCOME AND UNDERSERVED.

THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUBS OF HAWK-HOUSTON MISSION IS TO PROVIDE A SUPPORT SYSTEM THAT WILL ENABLE, ENCOURAGE, AND GUIDE YOUTH, ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO NEED US THE MOST IN THE WIREGRASS AREA, TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AS PRODUCTIVE, CARING RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH  EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES. THE GOALS FOR YEAR TWO (2): 1) TO CONTINUE TO INCREASE AND EXPAND  PARTNERSHIPS WITH CHURCHES, BUSINESSES AND SCHOOLS; 2) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL YOUTH THAT PARTICIPATE IN THE DIPLOMAS2DEGREES PROGRAM; 3) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF YOUTH AND FAMILIES SERVED UNDER THE BREAKFAST. LUNCH AND SUPPER PROGRAM; 4) EXPAND THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES SERVED UNDER THE SUMMER AND SCHOOL-YEAR MEAL PROGRAMS; INCREASE AND EXPAND COMMUNITY OUTREACH PARTNERSHIPS TO SERVE AND BENEFIT FAMILIES; 5) SECURE MULTI-YEAR GRANTS AND OTHER FUNDING SOURCES FROM CORPORATIONS AND FOUNDATIONS TO SECURE THE ORGANIZATION'S SUSTAINABILITY.

VISTA PROJECT WAS OFF TO A SLOW START BUT BY SUMMER END OF SUMMER OF MET AND/SUCCEED MOST OF ITS GOALS. THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS, MOSTLY SHORT-TERM, HAVE BEEN TO CONDUCT PROGRAMS, CLASSES OR PERFORM JOB-RELATED COMMUNITY SERVICE PROJECTS.

NOW, THAT COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND AWARENESS OF THE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES OFFERED BY THE ORGANIZATION, EXPANSION SHOULD BE MUCH EASIER AND HAVE A DEEPER IMPACT.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:
THE CITY OF GREEN RIVER WILL PLACE UP TO 9 FULL-TIME VISTA MEMBERS TO SERVE IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:
1.  PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS IN RESEARCHING MARKETS AND IDENTIFYING OPPORTUNITIES FOR INCREASED RECYCLING PARTICIPATION IN ORDER TO REDUCE OVERALL OPERATIONAL COSTS WITHIN THE SOLID WASTE DIVISION.  THE CITY IS CURRENTLY TRANSITIONING FROM A WASTE LANDFILLING ORGANIZATION TO A WASTE EXPORTING ORGANIZATION, AND IDENTIFYING ALTERNATIVE MEANS FOR DISPOSAL WILL ASSIST IN CONTROLLING DISPOSAL COSTS.  THE VISTA WILL ASSIST IN DEVELOPING ALTERNATIVES TO CURRENT PROCESSES AND RECOMMENDING STRATEGIES FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THE CITY'S NEW TRANSFER STATION.  THE VISTA WILL ALSO DESIGN EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH MATERIALS TO INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF COST-SAVING OPPORTUNITIES.
2.	AT LEAST ONE (1) VISTA MEMBER IS REQUESTED FOR THE SOLID WASTE RECYCLING SUSTAINABILITY AND EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH PROJECT.
3.	IT IS EXPECTED THAT THIS PROJECT WILL TAKE 24-36 MONTHS TO COMPLETE.
4.	THE MISSION OF THE CITY OF GREEN RIVER DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS IS TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN THE INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT OUR VIBRANT CITY AND TO ENCOURAGE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.  THE SOLID WASTE DIVISION OF PUBLIC WORKS IS TASKED WITH THE COLLECTION AND DISPOSAL OF SOLID WASTE GENERATED WITHIN OUR BEAUTIFUL CITY IN AN ENVIRONMENTALLY AND FISCALLY RESPONSIBLE MANNER.  THE CITY BEGAN ACTIVELY MANAGING SOLID WASTE IN THE 1970'S, AND THE SOLID WASTE DIVISION CONTINUES TO EVOLVE AS TECHNOLOGIES AND ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS CHANGE.  THE CITY BEGAN RECYCLING IN THE 1980'S, AND WILL CLOSE ITS LANDFILL IN 2017.  ALL RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF GREEN RIVER, AS WELL AS VISITORS AND TOURISTS, BENEFIT FROM THE COLLECTION, RECYCLING, AND DISPOSAL PROGRAMS OFFERED BY THE SOLID WASTE DIVISION.
1.	PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE CITY ADMINISTRATOR, AS WELL AS CITY DEPARTMENT HEADS, WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW MUNICIPAL FUNDING PROPOSALS; TO MONITOR AND REPORT ON CURRENT GRANT PROJECTS UNDERWAY; AND TO ENHANCE SOCIAL MEDIA AND TRADITIONAL MEDIA INITIATIVES TO ENGAGE MORE INDIVIDUALS IN CRITICAL ISSUES FACING THEIR COMMUNITY.  THE VISTA MEMBER WILL LEARN VALUABLE NEW SKILLS IN GRANT WRITING AND PROJECT DEVELOPMENT AND ORGANIZATION.  ALL OF THE PROJECTS FOR WHICH THE CITY SEEKS GRANT FUNDING ARE INTEGRAL TO THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF THE COMMUNITY OR DIRECTLY IMPACT THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL CITIZENS OF GREEN RIVER. 
2.	AT LEAST ONEE (1) VISTA MEMBER IS REQUESTED TO ASSIST THE ADMINISTRATION DEPARTMENT IN THE AREAS OF GRANT AND SOCIAL MEDIA OUTREACH.
3.	IT IS EXPECTED THAT THE PROJECT WILL TAKE 24-36 MONTHS TO COMPLETE.
4.	BECAUSE THE REQUESTING ORGANIZATION IS A MUNICIPALITY RATHER THAN A NON-PROFIT, IT DOES NOT HAVE A MISSION STATEMENT. HOWEVER THE CITY'S COMPREHENSIVE PLAN IDENTIFIES ITS VISION AS FOLLOWS.  'OUR VISION FOR GREEN RIVER IS AN ATTRACTIVE, WELL PLANNED CITY WITH AN ACTIVE DOWNTOWN AND RIVERFRONT, AND A VIBRANT ECONOMY, CULTURE AND TOURISM INDUSTRY.' 
GREEN RIVER WAS FORMED AS A UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD TOWN IN 1868 AS PART OF AMERICA'S GREAT WESTWARD EXPANSION.  IN THE 1970'S THE COMMUNITY TRIPLED IN SIZE DUE TO A BOOM IN MINERAL EXTRACTION, PRIMARILY TRONA. THE COMMUNITY IS STILL ROOTED IN ITS IDENTITY AS AN INDUSTRIAL COMMUNITY WHERE PEOPLE WORK HARD ON THE RAILROAD OR IN THE MINES. GENERALLY PEOPLE HERE ENJOY HIGH STANDARDS OF LIVING BUT THE RECENT ECONOMIC DOWNTURN IN WYOMING HAS MADE LIFE MORE DIFFICULT FOR GREEN RIVER'S MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS.    
AS A MUNICIPALITY, PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN ARE DESIGNED TO BENEFIT ALL CITIZENS OF THE COMMUNITY, SPECIFICALLY IN REGARD TO WATER QUALITY, SEWER SERVICE, ROAD INFRASTRUCTURE, AND PUBLIC AMENITIES.  THIS SUMMER THE CITY WILL ALSO BE REDESIGNING SEVERAL STREET CURB SYSTEMS TO BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR DISABLED CITIZENS.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ESTABLISH ONLINE TRAINING PROGRAMS ACCESSIBLE TO RURAL UTAH WOMEN AND COMMUNITY-BASED IN-PERSON ENTREPRENEURIAL EDUCATION TRAINING FOR LOCAL MINORITY WOMEN. THE ROAD HOME (TRH) IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY THAT ASSISTS INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS IN SALT LAKE COUNTY AND ALONG THE WASATCH FRONT. AS THE LARGEST OPERATOR OF EMERGENCY SHELTER SERVICES IN UTAH, WE ARE ADEPT AT PROVIDING EMERGENCY SERVICES, SHELTER, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND HOUSING SOLUTIONS. IN FISCAL YEAR 2015, WE SERVED 7,219 MEN, WOMEN AND CHILDREN BY PROVIDING LOW BARRIER EMERGENCY SHELTER. ADDITIONALLY, WE SERVED 1,301 HOUSEHOLDS THROUGH THE ROAD HOME HOUSING PROGRAMS.

THE FOUR PROPOSED AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECTS: HEALTHY FUTURES; DISASTER PREPAREDNESS; PAY FOR SUCCESS; AND CHILD AND FAMILY SUPPORT WILL HELP THE ROAD HOME ADDRESS ISSUES SURROUNDING SERVING THOSE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS WHILE BUILDING THE ROAD HOME'S CAPACITY TO BETTER SERVE CLIENTS.  THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECTS WILL SEEK TO HELP US: BETTER UNDERSTAND MEDICAID SERVICES ALLOWING US TO HELP CLIENTS ACCESS SERVICES; CREATE AND DISSEMINATE A STRATEGIC EMERGENCY PLAN FOR ALL SITES IN WHICH CLIENTS RESIDE; CREATE PROCEDURES AND PROCESSES TO LAUNCH OUR NEW PAY FOR SUCCESS PROGRAM; AND DEVELOP CHILD AND FAMILY SUPPORT PROGRAMS FOR THE MIDVALE CENTER. THESE AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECTS ARE EXPECTED TO BENEFIT THOSE SERVED BY THE ROAD HOME EMERGENCY SHELTER AND THOSE SERVED IN THE ROAD HOME HOUSING PROGRAMS. 

FOUR AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECTS BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: IDENTIFICATION OF AVAILABLE MEDICAID RESOURCES AND WAYS TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO THOSE SERVICES; CONDUCT A NEEDS ASSESSMENT AS IT RELATES TO DISASTER PLANNING FOR CLIENTS LIVING IN SHELTER AND TRH HOUSING; ESTABLISH PROCESSES AND SYSTEMS TO BETTER SERVE PERSISTENTLY HOMELESS IN OUR COMMUNITY; AND CREATE PARTNERSHIPS AND PROGRAMMING FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES AT THE MIDVALE CENTER. EACH PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO LAST THREE YEARS.

THE MISSION OF THE NEVADA CENTER FOR EXCELLENCE IN DISABILITIES (NCED) IS TO COOPERATIVELY WORK WITH CONSUMERS, AGENCIES, AND PROGRAMS TO ASSIST NEVADANS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES OF ALL AGES TO BE INDEPENDENT AND PRODUCTIVE CITIZENS WHO ARE INCLUDED IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.  
THE NEVADA CENTER FOR EXCELLENCE IN DISABILITIES IS REQUESTING YEAR TWO OF THE NCED STATEWIDE VISTA PROJECT, WHICH ADDRESSES THE PREVALENCE OF POVERTY FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.  MUCH OF THE EMPLOYMENT AND INDEPENDENT LIVING ADVANCEMENTS FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN OUR COUNTRY HAVE BEEN DUE TO THE ADVANCEMENTS AND AVAILABILITY OF EDUCATION, BEHAVIOR SUPPORTS AND ASSISTIVE TECHNOLOGY.   THE CONTINUATION OF THIS PROJECT WILL EXPAND THE AVAILABILITY OF THESE SERVICES BY:
1.	POSITIVE BEHAVIOR SUPPORTS (PBS) NEVADA WILL EXPAND THE AVAILABILITY OF SUPPORT AND TRAINING FOR FAMILIES WHO HAVE CHILDREN WITH DISABILITIES EXPERIENCING BEHAVIORAL ISSUES.  THESE SERVICES WILL ENABLE CHILDREN TO BE MORE FULLY INCLUDED IN SCHOOL AND THEIR COMMUNITY, WHICH IS NECESSARY FOR PEOPLE TO BE EMPLOYED AND INDEPENDENT.  THREE VISTA MEMBERS IN RENO, LAS VEGAS AND ELKO WILL CONTINUE TO COORDINATE STATEWIDE TRAINING AND MANAGE VOLUNTEERS.
2.	THE NEVADA ASSISTIVE TECHNOLOGY RESOURCE CENTER (NATRC) WILL EXPAND ITS BLIND USERS' ASSISTIVE TECHNOLOGY (AT) GROUPS.  THIS WILL ENABLE PEOPLE EXPERIENCING BLINDNESS TO FULLY PARTICIPATE IN THEIR COMMUNITY, INCLUDING SEEKING AND RETAINING EMPLOYMENT.  TWO VISTA MEMBERS IN RENO AND LAS VEGAS WILL CONTINUE TO COORDINATE AND GATHER DATA REGARDING THE ACTIVITIES OF THE USERS' GROUPS AS WELL AS RECRUIT AND MANAGE VOLUNTEERS.
3.	THINK COLLEGE NEVADA PROVIDES INCLUSIVE POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION (PSE) FOR STUDENTS WITH INTELLECTUAL/DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES (IDD).  TWO VISTA MEMBERS IN RENO AND LAS VEGAS WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP RELATIONSHIPS WITH CAMPUS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE INTERNSHIP AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS, DEVELOP TRAINING, WILL MONITOR AND COORDINATE THE GOALS OF EACH STUDENT'S PERSON-CENTERED PLAN AN WILL DEVELOP/IMPLEMENT A NEW VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.

THE MISSION OF KARIDAT, WHICH IS AFFILIATED WITH CATHOLIC CHARITIES USA IS TO PROVIDE SERVICE TO PEOPLE IN NEED, TO ADVOCATE FOR JUSTICE IN SOCIAL STRUCTURES, AND TO CALL THE ENTIRE CHURCH AND OTHER PEOPLE OF GOOD WILL TO DO THE SAME. CARE'S MISSION IS TO BUILD A RESILIENT COMMUNITY AND TO IDENTIFY, FACILITATE, AND DELIVER RESOURCES AND LONG-TERM SUPPORT TO ADDRESS THE UNMET NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IMPACTED BY DISASTER. THE STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY RESILIENCE THROUGH LONG-TERM DISASTER RECOVERY AND SUSTAINABLE FOOD ACCESS VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES AND HEALTHY FUTURES VISTA FOCUS AREAS. THE PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ASSESS, IDENTIFY, AND ACQUIRE RESOURCES INCLUDING FINANCIAL AND IN-KIND FOR CARE'S LONG TERM SUSTAINABILITY, PROVIDE VOLUNTEER AND PROGRAM COORDINATION FOR CARE, AND TO DEVELOP A SUSTAINABLE FOOD BANK THAT CAN SUPPORT REGULAR KARIDAT PROGRAMMING AS WELL AS BE AVAILABLE FOR IMMEDIATE DISASTER RESPONSE. THE PROJECT WILL AIM TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 3,000 INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES FROM LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS, ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO WERE MOST IMPACTED BY THE RECENT DISASTER. THESE THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES INCLUDING FACILITATING PARTNERSHIPS, RESEARCHING AND IMPLEMENTING BEST PRACTICES, ACQUIRING RESOURCES TO SUPPORT ONGOING PROGRAMMING, AND ESTABLISHING STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES AND DOCUMENTING ACCOMPLISHMENTS FOR THE LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY OF THE PROGRAMS OVER THE COURSE OF TWO YEARS (APRIL 1, 2016 TO MARCH 31, 2019), AND THEN BEYOND ONCE THE VISTA PROJECT COMES TO COMPLETION.

ALTHOUGH OPERATING AS SEPARATE PROGRAMS, VISTAS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING UNIVERSAL GOAL. THIS PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT ROUGHLY 900 MILITARY VETERANS, CURRENT SERVICE MEMBERS, AND THEIR LOVED ONES IN THE SECOND YEAR OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD (MARCH 2018 -- MARCH 2019). III-A. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY   
IN 1968, NORTH COAST OPPORTUNITIES (NCO) INCORPORATED AS A NONPROFIT WITH THE MISSION OF DEVELOPING AND PROVIDING SERVICES THAT STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY, ONE PERSON AT A TIME. WORKING WITH LOCAL PARTNERS, NCO STRENGTHENS THE SAFETY NET FOR LOW-INCOME PEOPLE AND COMMUNITIES THROUGH PROGRAMS THAT RANGE FROM VOLUNTEER COORDINATION AND FOOD SECURITY TO HELPING PEOPLE DEVELOP JOB SKILLS AND MICROBUSINESSES, AND FROM HEAD START TO SENIOR COMPANIONS. NCO IS REQUESTING SIX VISTA MEMBERS WHO WILL WORK ON TWO PRIORITY FOCUS AREAS: ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT (HOUSING) AND HEALTHY FUTURES (BOTH ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND OBESITY AND FOOD). THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO INCREASE THE COUNTY'S CAPACITY TO ADDRESS THE ISSUE OF HOMELESSNESS AND TO IMPROVE HEALTH AND QUALITY OF LIFE FOR LOW-INCOME FAMILIES. ONE MEMBER WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE LAKE COUNTY CONTINUUM OF CARE FOR THE HOMELESS WORKING TO ADDRESS HOMELESSNESS. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL WORK WITH NCO'S GARDENS PROJECT, ONE IN LAKE COUNTY AND ONE IN MENDOCINO COUNTY HELPING TO REBUILD FIRE DEVASTATED COMMUNITIES THROUGH GARDENING.  A FOURTH MEMBER WILL WORK WITH THE HOPE RISING INITIATIVE IN LAKE COUNTY AND A FIFTH MEMBER WILL WORK AS THE LOCAL FOOD ACCESS COORDINATOR. THE SIXTH MEMBER WILL WORK WALK BIKE MENDOCINO TO PROMOTE PHYSICAL EDUCATION AND HEALTHY HABITS.   ALL OF THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL WORK WITH ONGOING COMMUNITY EFFORTS THAT ARE NCO PROGRAMS, FISCALLY SPONSORED BY NCO, OR LED BY NCO STAFF. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL DIRECTLY IMPACT AN ESTIMATED 3,000 PEOPLE AND WILL BE IMPLEMENTED OVER A THREE-YEAR PERIOD.

THE MISSION OF LA'S BEST IS TO PROVIDE A SAFE AND SUPERVISED AFTER SCHOOL ENRICHMENT PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN AGES FIVE TO 12 IN LOS ANGELES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE'S EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENHANCE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S COMPREHENSIVE CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PLAN, ENHANCE AND INCREASE UTILIZATION OF THE LEARNING MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (LMS)--AN ONLINE TOOL FOR FIELD STAFF TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT--AND ORGANIZE A NETWORK OF LA'S BEST ALUMNI AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS/SUPPORTERS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE 25,000 CHILDREN FROM LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS WHO RELY UPON LA'S BEST DURING THE AFTER SCHOOL HOURS EVERY DAY, AS WELL AS CHILDREN WHO ARE CURRENTLY WAITLISTED TO JOIN LA'S BEST. THE FOUR AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CONDUCTING AND SUPPORTING FORMATIVE EVALUATION ACTIVITIES; ASSISTING IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF PRE- AND POST- PROGRAM PARTICIPATION PROTOCOLS; CONDUCTING PROGRAM OBSERVATIONS; GATHERING, CODING, ANALYZING, AND REPORTING ON DATA; REVIEWING NEWLY ISSUED CURRICULA PAPERS AND YOUTH DEVELOPMENT RESOURCES; DEVELOPING INTAKE CRITERIA AND GUIDING QUESTIONS PERTAINING TO THE LMS; CREATING AND UPDATING INTERACTIVE PAGES ON THE LMS; CREATING AND MAINTAINING A SYSTEM TO ORGANIZE NEW FINDINGS TO IDENTIFY WHICH AREAS REQUIRE THE MOST ATTENTION WHEN CONSIDERING NEWLY POSTED CONTENT AND RESOURCES TO THE LEARNING MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (LMS); DEVELOPING A THOROUGH WORKBOOK CONSISTING OF IDEAS AND OUTLINES FOR NEW LMS CONTENT GENERATED BY LEADING A TEAM THROUGH BRAINSTORMING AND WORKGROUP SESSIONS; IDENTIFYING, ENGAGING AND REACHING OUT TO LA'S BEST ALUMNI, CREATING A WEB-BASED ALUMNI SURVEYS AND NEWSLETTERS, ORGANIZING LA'S BEST CULMINATION EVENTS; ORGANIZING ALUMNI FOCUS GROUPS AND A SPEAKERS BUREAU; AND, COLLECTING AND ARCHIVING STORIES FROM LA'S BEST ALUMNI, STUDENTS, PARENTS, STAFF, PRINCIPALS, COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND TEACHERS ABOUT THE IMPACT OF LA'S BEST ON THEIR LIVES AND WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES; IDENTIFYING NEW VOLUNTEERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO SUPPORT LA?S BEST; MANAGING, TRACKING AND SUPPORTING THE ORGANIZATION'S EXISTING NETWORK OF VOLUNTEERS AND SUPPORTERS AND THE IMPLEMENTATION OF NEW SYSTEMS TO SUPPORT GREATER COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT.

OAKLAND PROMISE'S MISSION IS TO ENSURE THAT EVERY CHILD IN OAKLAND GRADUATES HIGH SCHOOL WITH THE EXPECTATIONS, RESOURCES, AND SKILLS TO COMPLETE COLLEGE AND BE SUCCESSFUL IN THE CAREER OF THEIR CHOICE. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREAS AND WILL CONTINUE TO IMPROVE ON THE SYSTEMS THAT HAVE BEEN PUT IN PLACE BY OUR CURRENT VISTA MEMBERS.  

OVER THE PAST TWO YEARS AND GOING INTO OUR THIRD YEAR THIS YEAR, OUR VISTA?S WORK FOCUS FOR THE OAKLAND PROMISE FOR THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS BRILLIANT BABY, KINDERGARTEN TO COLLEGE (K2C), FUTURE CENTERS AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT HAS BEEN IN THE FOLLOWING BUCKETS AND WE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD OUT THESE BUCKETS: 

1) RECRUIT COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE OAKLAND PROMISE PROGRAMS; 2) DEVELOP SYSTEMS FOR ROBUST COMMUNITY AND PARENT ENGAGEMENT; 3) PLAN OUTREACH EVENTS TO ENGAGE PARENTS, STUDENTS, SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY BASED ORGANIZATIONS IN THE PROGRAMS OF THE OAKLAND PROMISE; 4) IDENTIFY POTENTIAL COLLABORATORS/PARTNERS AND PLAN INFORMATIONAL MEETINGS; 5) HELP IMPROVE COMMUNICATION ABOUT COMMUNITY PROJECTS AMONG PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS; 6) DEVELOP OR MODIFY MATERIALS/COLLATERAL TO STRENGTHEN PROGRAMMING AND PROVIDE RELEVANT AND UPDATED INFORMATION; 7) IMPROVE OUR OUTREACH PLANS FOR TARGET BENEFICIARIES AND PARTICIPANTS; 8) HELP ENSURE PROGRAM IS RELEVANT TO POTENTIAL PARTICIPANTS; 9) DEVELOP/IMPROVE PRESENTATIONS, COMMUNICATION TOOLS AND METHODS OF CONDUCTING OUTREACH TO POTENTIAL PARTICIPANTS; 10) HELP STAFF USE FINDINGS FROM PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT EFFORTS TO INFORM IMPROVEMENTS OF EXISTING AND NEW PROGRAM OFFERINGS; 11) RECRUIT/MANAGE COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS; AND 12) DEVELOP PARTNERSHIPS FOR RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS. 

THROUGH OUR WORK, WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT AN INCREASING NUMBER OF STUDENTS IN OAKLAND PUBLIC SCHOOLS AS WELL AS THEIR FAMILIES.  THE OAKLAND PROMISE HAS DEMONSTRATED GROWTH OVER THE PAST FEW YEARS AS MORE SCHOOLS, STUDENTS AND STAFF ARE ENROLLED IN OUR KINDERGARTEN TO COLLEGE PROGRAM. WE?VE DOUBLED THE NUMBER OF BABIES WHO HAVE RECEIVED $500 COLLEGE SAVINGS ACCOUNTS.  WE HAVE A STRONGER BASE OF AMBASSADORS AND VOLUNTEERS TO HELP US WITH INCREASING NUMBER OF OAKLAND PROMISE COMMUNITY EVENTS THROUGHOUT THE CITY.  LASTLY, MORE STUDENTS HAVE COMPLETED THEIR FINANCIAL AID APPLICATIONS, THE FAFSA/DREAM ACT APPLICATIONS. 

AS WE GO INTO OUR FOURTH YEAR OF THE OAKLAND PROMISE, OUR GOAL IS TO CONTINUE TO BUILD SUSTAINABLE AND SCALABLE SYSTEMS TO IMPROVE ON OUR SERVICES TO SCHOOLS, FAMILIES, AND STUDENTS AND FINE TUNE OUR PRACTICE.  ONE OF THE BIGGEST CHALLENGE WILL BE TO BUILD SUSTAINABLE SYSTEMS WITH DRAMATIC GROWTH IN THE SCHOOLS, STUDENTS AND FAMILIES WE SERVE. THUS, WE ARE REQUESTING APPROVAL FOR 7 VISTA MEMBERS FOR 2019-2020.



SEVEN (7) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SUPPORTING WITH THE CREATION OF SYSTEMS FOR FAMILIES TO SAVE AND PLAN FOR COLLEGE, RESEARCHING AND SHARING RESOURCES ON FINANCIAL EDUCATION WITH SCHOOLS, STUDENTS, AND FAMILIES, DEVELOPING PROCESSES TO INCREASE THE PERCENTAGE OF STUDENTS APPLYING TO COLLEGES, FINANCIAL AID, AND SCHOLARSHIPS, AND RECRUITING AND TRAINING COMMUNITY LEADERS TO ENSURE THIS PROGRAM IS ROOTED IN OAKLAND OVER THE COURSE OF THE YEAR. THE NEED FOR VISTA SUPPORT IS ESPECIALLY CRITICAL RIGHT NOW AS THE OAKLAND PROMISE SCALES TO SERVE ALL STUDENTS AND FAMILIES IN OAKLAND.

THE MISSION OF UNITED WAY OF MERCED COUNTY (UWMC) IS TO IMPROVE LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF THE COMMUNITY, IS THE DRIVING PHILOSOPHY BEHIND ALL ORGANIZATIONAL INITIATIVES. PROJECT PREVENTION COALITION HAS BEEN A FISCALLY SPONSORED ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED WAY SINCE 2011. PROJECT PREVENTION COALITION'S MISSION IS TO ELIMINATE DISPARITIES THAT DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECT THE HMONG COMMUNITY IN MERCED, CA THROUGH AWARENESS, EDUCATION, RESEARCH, AND ADVOCACY.  THESE DISPARITIES INCLUDE HEALTH, EDUCATION, EMPLOYMENT, AND OTHER CONDITIONS. THE PROPOSED CONTINUATION VISTA PROJECTS ALIGN WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. ONE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTINUE WITH THE FOCUS ON CAPACITY BUILDING FOR THE HMONG CULTURAL AND WELLNESS CENTER. THIS VISTA WILL HELP THE CENTER TO DEVELOP, SUPPORT AND MAINTAIN VOLUNTEERS, AND IN-KIND AND DIRECT SUPPORT FOR THE CENTERS EDUCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY-BUILDING ACTIVITIES FOR HEALTH AND HEALTHCARE. ONE VISTA WILL HELP ESTABLISH A LOCAL HMONG POLICY GROUP FOR HEALTHCARE TO HELP ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES TO ADOPT AND IMPLEMENT POLICIES THAT IMPROVE ACCESS, QUALITY, AND EQUITY IN HEALTHCARE FOR OUR HMONG COMMUNITY. THIS VISTA WILL WORK THROUGH OUR STRONG NETWORK OF RELATIONSHIPS WITH OUR COUNTY HOSPITAL, DEPARTMENTS OF PUBLIC HEALTH, MENTAL HEALTH, AND HUMAN SERVICES, AND OTHER CITY AND COUNTY HEALTHCARE ORGANIZATIONS. THE HMONG POLICY GROUP WILL DEVELOP NEW OR MODIFY EXISTING INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES REGARDING LANGUAGE AND CULTURAL BARRIERS AND FACILITATORS TO HEALTHCARE SERVICES (E.G., HTTPS://WWW.THINKCULTURALHEALTH.HHS.GOV/CLAS). TOGETHER, THE TWO VISTAS WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD ON THE WORK AND LESSONS FROM OUR FIRST YEAR OF SERVICE TO IMPROVE SYSTEMS FOR MORE ACCESSIBLE, QUALITY, AND EQUITABLE HEALTHCARE FOR OUR HMONG COMMUNITY.
