GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH ATHLETICS, LEARNING, AND SERVICE - GOALS IS A 501(C)3 NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO CREATE TEAM ORIENTED, FREE, LONG TERM DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW INCOME YOUTH WITHIN HIGH RISK COMMUNITIES IN ORANGE COUNTY. THE CENTRAL FOCUS OF GOALS IS TO PROVIDE YOUTH WITH AFTER-SCHOOL ATHLETIC, LEARNING, AND SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES THAT HELP DIMINISH THE EXISTING OPPORTUNITY GAP BETWEEN PRIVILEGED AND UNDERPRIVILEGED COMMUNITIES. THROUGH GOALS MISSION AND FOCUS, THE GOALS-AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATIONAL K-12 SUCCESS FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO ENCOURAGE AND PROPEL THE YOUTH?S POTENTIAL TOWARDS THEIR SCHOLASTIC ENDEAVORS BY PROVIDING THE NECESSARY TOOLS AND SKILLS FOR THEIR SUCCESS, WHICH WILL BENEFIT OVER 200 YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES. IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL CENTER ON DEVELOPING AND ENHANCING THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF EXTRACURRICULAR ENRICHMENT AND SERVICES AVAILABLE TO YOUTH PARTICIPATING IN GOALS, AS WELL AS ONE OF GOALS RECENT INITIATIVES, GOALS ACADEMY: ANAHEIM?S FIRST FREE PUBLIC CHARTER ELEMENTARY SCHOOL. EACH PORTION OF THE PROJECT WILL ALSO FOCUS ON EQUIPPING PARENTS WITH VIABLE RESOURCES AND EXPERTISE TO PROVIDE OUT-OF-SCHOOL SUPPORT FOR THEIR CHILDREN, BREAKING THE BARRIER OF THE LACK OF OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE TO IMPOVERISHED FAMILIES. 

THE THREE (3) DESIGNATED AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE OBJECTIVES AND EXPECTATIONS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING SPECIFIC-RELATED ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS:

(1) INCREASING RECRUITMENT AND RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS TO STRENGTHEN GOALS AND GOALS ACADEMY CORE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO THE PARTICIPANTS AND ENSURE SUSTAINABILITY.
(2)  INCREASE RECRUITMENT AND RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS TO SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN CORE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES OFFERED IN GOALS PROGRAMS FOR FAMILIES AND YOUTH TO ENSURE PROGRAM QUALITY AND SUSTAINABILITY. 
(3)  MARKETING, BUILDING, AND SUSTAINING THE GOALS AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAM CAPACITY FOR YOUTH PARTICIPANTS TO BE FULLY INTEGRATED INTO THE PROGRAM AND ADOPT THE MISSION AND VALUES OF GOALS FOR ATHLETICS, LEARNING, AND VOLUNTEER SERVICES.
 
THE MENTIONED VISTA MEMBERS WILL PERFORM THEIR DESIGNATED TASKS AND ACTIVITIES OVER THE DESIRED TIME LAPSE OF THEIR SERVICE TERM, TYPICALLY BETWEEN THE REQUIRED ONE (1) YEAR TO THE MAXIMUM ALLOTTED TIME FRAME OF TWO (2) YEARS.

THE SACRAMENTO HOUSING AND REDEVELOPMENT AGENCY (SHRA) IS A JOINT POWERS AUTHORITY CHARGED WITH CARRYING OUT THE HOUSING AND REDEVELOPMENT FUNCTIONS OF THE CITY AND COUNTY OF SACRAMENTO, THE REDEVELOPMENT AGENCIES OF THE CITY AND COUNTY OF SACRAMENTO, AND THE HOUSING AUTHORITIES OF THE CITY AND COUNTY OF SACRAMENTO.  OUR MISSION IS TO REVITALIZE COMMUNITIES, PROVIDE AFFORDABLE HOUSING OPPORTUNITIES AND TO SERVE AS THE HOUSING AUTHORITY FOR THE CITY AND COUNTY OF SACRAMENTO.  THE CITY OF SACRAMENTO RECEIVED A 10 YEAR PLACED BASED DESIGNATION.  OUR PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP THE PLACE BASED INITIATIVE FRAMEWORK, ADMINISTER AND COORDINATE THE GOALS OF INDIVIDUAL ACTION TEAMS INCLUDING EDUCATION, HEALTH, JOBS/ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITIES.  THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITIES THAT MOST CLOSELY ALIGN WITH OUR PROJECT ARE EDUCATION, JOBS AND ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE.  OUR GOAL IS TO INCREASE COMMUNITY PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS TO BENEFIT OUR PARTNER AGENCIES IN THE PROVISION OF SERVICES, SUPPORTS AND PRODUCING OUTCOMES THAT DEMONSTRATE THE IMPROVED ECONOMIC CONDITION OF THE RESIDENTS IN THE PLACE BASED INITIATIVE AREA THROUGH WELL-COORDINATED SERVICES, PARTNER SUPPORTS AND SUSTAINABILITY PLANNING. 


DURING 2016, THE SHRA PLACE BASED INITIATIVE TEAM WAS FULLY ASSEMBLED WITH THE SELECTION OF OUR FEDERAL LIAISON, AN AMERICORPS VISTA LEADER, AND 4 AMERICORPS VISTAS.  THE RESIDENT COUNCIL WAS ALSO ESTABLISHED AND RAN REGULAR MEETINGS. THE U.S. ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AGENCY DESIGNATED SACRAMENTO AN "INVESTING IN MANUFACTURING COMMUNITIES PARTNERSHIP" COMMUNITY. SHRA HOSTED SEVERAL EVENTS INCLUDING: THE USDA CONVENING WITH COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, A LOCAL PARTNERS CONVENING, A FEDERAL PARTNERS CONVENING, TWO SEPARATE GRANT WRITING WORKSHOPS AND A VISIT  BY THE FEDERAL REGIONAL DIRECTOR OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT.

IN 2017, THE SHRA VISTAS INCREASED THE CAPACITY OF SHRA, SOME OF THE PLACE BASED INITIATIVE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS, AND THE ABILITY FOR THE FOCUS AREA PARTNERS TO CONVENE AND PERFORM ACTIONS TO WORK TOWARD THE FOCUS AREA SPECIFIC GOALS.  SHRA VISTA MEMBERS HANDLE MEETING LOGISTICS, HANDLE COMMUNICATIONS VIA VOICE, PHONE, EMAIL, SOCIAL MEDIA, AND WEBSITES, FACILITATE MEETINGS, CONNECT PARTNERS TO ORGANIZATIONS AND RESOURCES, RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS AND PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS, SUPPORT DATA COLLECTION AND EVALUATION EFFORTS, AND HELP TO BUILD PROGRAM INFRASTRUCTURE.  

IN 2018, THE SHRA VISTAS CONTINUED TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF SHRA, SOME OF THE PLACE BASED INITIATIVE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS, AND THE ABILITY FOR THE FOCUS AREA PARTNERS TO CONVENE AND PERFORM ACTIONS TO WORK TOWARD THE FOCUS AREA SPECIFIC GOALS.  THEY ALSO HELP TO INCREASE AND IMPROVE INTERNAL OPERATIONS, INCLUDING REDESIGNING THE PROJECT WEBSITE, CREATING A DATA COLLECTION INFRASTRUCTURE, IMPROVE PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES, DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING A COMMUNICATIONS PLAN, AND INCREASING INTERNAL PARTNERSHIPS.

THE MISSION OF KETCHIKAN YOUTH INITIATIVES (KYI), THE PROJECT SPONSOR, IS:  OUR YOUTH-DIRECTED AND ADULT-MENTORED PROGRAMS PROMOTE HEALTHY ACTIVITIES, DEVELOP LEADERSHIP SKILLS AND CREATE A CAPABLE WORKFORCE OF TEENS AND YOUNG ADULTS. 
THE KETCHIKAN COMMUNITY CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT ADDRESSES THREE CNCS FOCUS AREAS INCLUDING: EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.
FROM ACTIVITY UNDERTAKEN AT THE SEVEN VISTA SITE AND SUB-SITES, THIS PROJECT TARGETS A MINIMUM OF 200 BENEFICIARIES INCORPORATING:  KYI  WORK READY TRAINEES, SAIL SOAR (SSI.SSDIA OUTREACH) RECIPIENTS, KWC UNDERPRIVILEGED TASK FORCE MEMBERS, WISH VIOLENCE PREVENTION PARTICIPANTS, COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS RECIPIENTS WHO ARE  CHILDREN AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES, AND HISTORIC KETCHIKAN LOW INCOME PERSONS RECRUITED FOR JOBS NEWLY AVAILABLE THROUGH THE MEANS OF AFFORDABLE SITING FOR BUSINESSES.
SEVEN VISTA MEMBERS ARE REQUESTED TO ENGAGE IN THE CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES REQUIRED TO REACH THE PARTICIPANTS DEFINED HEREIN.  THESE GOALS ARE INTENDED TO BE REACHED WITHIN A ONE YEAR PERIOD.
ALL OF THESE IMPRESSIVE OBJECTIVES ARE REACHED THROUGH CAREFULLY PLANNED PROGRAMS DEDICATED TO MAKING PERMANENT CHANGES IN OUR COMMUNITY TO REDUCE THE POVERTY RATE OF PEOPLE WHO HAVE BEEN HELD BACK BY THEIR INABILITY:  TO GAIN LIVING WAGE JOBS, RECEIVE SUPPORT FOR LIVING WITH DISABILITIES, DEVELOP HEALTHY FUTURES AND ACCESS EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES.

THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN- PARKSIDE IS COMMITTED TO HIGH-QUALITY EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS, CREATIVE AND SCHOLARLY ACTIVITIES, AND SERVICES RESPONSIVE TO ITS DIVERSE STUDENT POPULATION, AND ITS LOCAL, NATIONAL AND GLOBAL COMMUNITIES. THE PROPOSED SECOND YEAR OF THIS VISTA PROJECT IS RESPONSIVE TO UW-PARKSIDE'S LOCAL COMMUNITY AND ALIGNS WITH CNCS FOCUS AREAS OF EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO CONTRIBUTE TO BUILDING AN EDUCATED WORKFORCE IN RACINE COUNTY FROM CAREER TO CRADLE, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT AT LEAST EIGHT ORGANIZATIONS WORKING COLLECTIVELY ALONG THE CONTINUUM TO REACH THIS GOAL. OF THE TEN VISTAS (WHICH INCLUDES ONE VISTA LEADER) PROPOSED IN THIS APPLICATION, WE EXPECT THREE TO BE COST SHARE, AND SEVEN TO BE STANDARD. OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT TWO YEARS, AT LEAST FIFTEEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THIS PROJECT  BY PERFORMING SUCH CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES AS BEST PRACTICE RESEARCH, DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, PROGRAM RECRUITMENT AND OUTREACH, CREATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF COMMUNICATIONS STRATEGIES, PLANNING AND LAUNCHING NEW PROGRAMS, GRANT WRITING AND IMPLEMENTING OTHER SUSTAINABILITY MEASURES. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL ADDRESS THE NEEDS AND BUILD ON THE ASSETS OF LOW-INCOME PRE-SCHOOL, ELEMENTARY, MIDDLE SCHOOL AND POST-SECONDARY STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES AS WELL AS VETERANS, PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OTHER LOW INCOME ADULTS SEEKING EMPLOYMENT.

MILWAUKEE SUCCEEDS IS A COLLECTIVE IMPACT PARTNERSHIP WITH A SHARED VISION OF SUCCESS FOR EVERY CHILD, IN EVERY SCHOOL, CRADLE TO CAREER. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND CAPACITY FOR: SCALING EARLY LITERACY STRATEGIES, INTEGRATING SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL LEARNING CURRICULUM, STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, IMPROVING USE OF DATA BY PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS, AND ADDRESSING THE NEEDS OF OPPORTUNITY YOUTH. THE ROSEBUD ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (REDCO) IS THE PRIMARY BUSINESS HOLDING COMPANY FOR THE ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE, AND MANAGES 20 DIFFERENT SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES ON THE ROSEBUD INDIAN RESERVATION. THE COMPANY IS ALSO TASKED WITH IMPROVING THE OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS, THROUGH BOTH ECONOMIC AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT.

IN ANSWERING THIS CALL, REDCO CREATED THE FOOD SOVEREIGNTY INITIATIVE (FSI) AND TATANKA FUNDS, INC.

THE FSI?S MISSION IS TO BRING ABOUT A SELF-DETERMINED INDIGENOUS FOOD SYSTEM FOR THE SICANGU LAKOTA OYATE (ROSEBUD RESERVATION). WORKING ON THE INDIVIDUAL AND COMMUNITY LEVELS, WE ARE COMMITTED TO DECOLONIZING THE FOOD SYSTEM OF THE SICANGU LAKOTA THROUGH EDUCATION, EMPOWERMENT, PROGRAMMING, AND INSTITUTIONAL CHANGE IN ORDER TO RECLAIM OUR HEALTH AS A SOVEREIGN INDIGENOUS NATION. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE ACCESS TO HEALTHY AND TRADITIONAL FOODS, AND INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE OF HEALTHY FOODS AND LIFESTYLES, BENEFITTING OVER 1,000 LOW INCOME, FOOD INSECURE RESIDENTS OF THE ROSEBUD RESERVATION. FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS FUNDRAISING DEVELOPMENT, CREATING MEASUREMENT TOOLS, ASSISTING IN THE DEVELOPMENT & IMPLEMENTATION OF PUBLIC AWARENESS CAMPAIGN, AND HELPING TO INCREASE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT.

TATANKA FUNDS, INC. IS AN EMERGING NATIVE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT FINANCIAL INSTITUTION. ITS PRIMARY MISSION IS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO FAIR AND AFFORDABLE FINANCIAL SERVICES FOR THE SICANGU LAKOTA OYATE AND OTHERS LIVING IN THE ROSEBUD RESERVATION OR ON TRIBAL TRUST LAND IN THE SURROUNDING FOUR COUNTIES. THIS AREA HAS HISTORICALLY BEEN UNDERSERVED BY FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS, FORCING RESIDENTS TO DEPEND ON PAYDAY LENDERS AND OTHER PREDATORY OPTIONS. TATANKA FUNDS CURRENT PROGRAMMATIC FOCUS IS: FINANCIAL LITERACY TRAINING, CREDIT BUILDING AND REPAIR, BUSINESS PLANNING SERVICES AND HOME OWNERSHIP PREPARATION. ALIGNING WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA, TWO VISTA?S IN THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST IN IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL SOURCES OF FUNDING AND GRANT WRITING, CREATING AND CONDUCTING FINANCIAL LITERACY AND BUSINESS PLANNING TRAININGS, AND CREATING AND MANAGING OTHER TRAINING SCHEDULES.

THE CITY OF DETROIT DEPARTMENT OF NEIGHBORHOODS IS CHARGED WITH WORKING WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO ADDRESS SOME OF THE MANY QUALITY OF LIFE ISSUES THAT FACE DETROIT RESIDENTS EVERY DAY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND COMMUNITY RESILIENCE FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF BLOCK CLUBS AND BLOCK CAPTAINS IN EACH DISTRICT, AND BROADEN THE REACH OF THE DISTRICT MANAGERS BY WORKING ONE-ON-ONE TO INCREASE BLOCK CLUBS CAPACITY TO HOST VOLUNTEER PROJECTS IN THEIR NEIGHBORHOODS. VISTA MEMBERS WILL ALSO BROADEN THE REACH OF THE DISTRICT BLIGHT STRIKE TEAMS BY INCREASING EACH OF THE BLIGHT ELIMINATION METRICS CURRENTLY MEASURED BY THE DON. IN ADDITION, MEMBERS WILL SUPPORT NEIGHBORHOOD LEVEL EFFORTS TO ASSIST IN PROPERTY TAX FORECLOSURE PREVENTION, KEEPING LOW INCOME FAMILIES FROM LOSING THEIR HOME AND WORKING TO GET LOW INCOME RENTERS TO PURCHASE THEIR TAX FORECLOSED HOME, IN CASES WHERE THE LANDLORD DID NOT PAY PROPERTY TAXES.   THERE WILL BE 8 STANDARD VISTA MEMBERS AND 1 VISTA LEADER.

THE VISTA LEADER MAY ALSO PLAY A SUPPORT ROLE IN RECRUITING, MENTORING, AND COORDINATING AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS.

THE MISSION OF THE GREATER CHICAGO FOOD DEPOSITORY IS "PROVIDING FOOD FOR HUNGRY PEOPLE WHILE STRIVING TO END HUNGER IN OUR COMMUNITY." THE ORGANIZATION'S PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT SUPPORTS THIS MISSION IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. MEMBER ROLES WILL EMPHASIZE HEALTH AND NUTRITION VIA THE FOOD DEPOSITORY'S HUNGER RELIEF INITIATIVES AS WELL AS FOCUSING ON THE ALLEVIATION OF CHILDHOOD HUNGER THROUGH THE PROVISION OF SCHOOL BREAKFAST. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO REDUCE HUNGER, IMPROVE HEALTH AND ELIMINATE FINANCIAL TRADEOFFS THAT OFTEN LEAD TO POVERTY; THE PROJECT WILL ACHIEVE THESE GOALS BY INCREASING ACCESS TO FRESH PRODUCE AND SCHOOL MEALS AS WELL AS PROMOTING THE CONSUMPTION OF HEALTHIER FOOD THROUGH NUTRITION EDUCATION. THE FOOD DEPOSITORY'S VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 30 FOOD PANTRIES AND MOBILE DISTRIBUTION SITES, SERVING AN ESTIMATED 3,000 INDIVIDUALS; THE PROJECT WILL ALSO SERVE MORE THAN 80 SCHOOLS AND 12,000 CHILDREN IN COOK COUNTY. 

THE FOOD DEPOSITORY PROPOSES TO HOST FIVE AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS DURING THE 2018-2019 PROGRAM YEAR, THE THIRD YEAR OF THE ORGANIZATION'S CURRENT VISTA PROJECT. THREE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CREATE AND ASSEMBLE A MENU OF HEALTH AND NUTRITION CURRICULA TO IMPLEMENT THROUGHOUT THE FOOD DEPOSITORY'S NETWORK OF MEMBER AGENCIES AND COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS, PROVIDING AGENCY REPRESENTATIVES AND PARTNERS WITH RESOURCES FOR UNDERSTANDING HEALTHY EATING AND PREPARING NUTRITIOUS FOOD. FURTHERMORE, TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL COMPLETE THEIR YEAR OF SERVICE PERFORMING OUTREACH AND BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF COOK COUNTY SCHOOL DISTRICTS, WITH THE GOAL OF INCREASING STUDENT PARTICIPATION IN SCHOOL BREAKFAST PROGRAMS. THIS WORK WILL TAKE PLACE OVER THE COURSE OF A 12-MONTH SERVICE YEAR.

ALIANZA MUNICIPAL DE SERVICIOS INTEGRADOS, INC. IS A TAX-EXEMPT UNDER ?501(C) (3)], NON-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION, ORGANIZED UNDER THE LAWS OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF PUERTO RICO. AMSI IS PART OF THE NETWORK OF THE NATION-WIDE STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES THAT OPERATE FOUR ONE-STOP CENTERS (OSC) PROVIDING EMPLOYMENT, TRAINING AND WORKFORCE INFORMATION SERVICES IN LOCAL COMMUNITIES. AMSI PROVIDES TRAINING AND JOB PLACEMENT SERVICES ISLAND-WIDE. 
AMSI'S MISSION IS TO DEVELOP HUMAN TALENT FOR SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND SELF-MANAGEMENT, AS WELL AS TO EMPLOYERS, WITH RESOURCES, INNOVATIVE SERVICES AND ALLIANCES, RESPONDING TO GLOBAL ECONOMY CHANGES AND TRENDS. 
THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT IS ALIGNED WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THIS PROJECT WILL SEEK TO:
1.	PLAN, DEVELOP, AND IMPLEMENT A HIGH PERFORMANCE VOLUNTARY TEAM COMPOSED OF PEOPLE FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUND AND EXPERTISE TO BRING UNIQUE SKILL SETS, EXPERIENCES, AND PERSPECTIVES TO HELP ACHIEVE OUR GOALS.  VOLUNTEERS RECRUITED WOULD HELP IN ANY AREA OF NEED SUCH AS: ADMINISTRATIVE, PROGRAMMATIC OR CUSTOMER SERVICE. AN EXAMPLE OF A VOLUNTEER TASK IS A "JOB COACH".  
2.	CREATE, AND IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES TO DEVELOP AN ENTREPRENEUR'S CULTURE OF COOPERATIVE HYDROPONIC SMALL BUSINESS BETWEEN LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS WITH INTENT TO CONTRIBUTE TO SELF EMPLOYMENT AND CREATE RELATIVES JOBS AND CONTRIBUTE WITH THE AVAILABILITY OF MORE FRESH FOOD.
3.	CREATE AND IMPLEMENT A HIGH QUALITY AND PERFORMANCE TRAINING INSTITUTE TO PROVIDE THE NEEDED SKILLS TO UNEMPLOYED AND UNDER EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS AND THE NEEDED SKILLS FOR THE JOBS THAT THE EMPLOYERS CREATE.
4.	REVIEW, SUPPORT AND DEVELOP, AMSI'S FUNDRAISING ACTION PLAN FOR THE VOLUNTEER TEAM, TRAINING INSTITUTE AND ENTREPRENEUR PROJECTS AND ALL ITS COMPLIANCE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS.  
THIS PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT DIRECTLY ABOUT 80 PARTICIPANTS. AMSI IS REQUESTING 10 VISTA MEMBERS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE THREE YEAR PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: 

1.	WRITE DOWN A PROJECT MANAGEMENT.
2.	MAKE A LIST OF ALL PUBLIC, GOVERNMENTAL, NONPROFIT AND PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS WE CAN USE TO RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS.
3.	CONTACT ORGANIZATIONS TO ORIENT THEM AND PARTICIPATE IN THEIR MEETINGS OR EVENTS. 
4.	PROMOTE RECRUITMENT THROUGH THE SOCIAL NETWORKS AND NEWSPAPERS.
5.	RECRUIT 10 VOLUNTEERS IN THE FIRST YEAR.
6.	DEVELOP AN ORIENTATION AND MAKE A RECORDED TO KEEP IT.
7.	PROVIDE PROGRESS REPORTS.  
8.	PREPARE A MANUAL INCLUDING THE TRAINING PHASES.
9.	DEVELOP AN RFP. 
10.	PREPARE A MANUAL. 
11.	IDENTIFY PROCEDURES, FORMS, PROMOTIONS AND EXISTING DOCUMENTS. 
12.	INTERVIEW INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL CUSTOMERS.
13.	CREATE A PROCEDURE.
14.	EVALUATE MARKETING MEDIA.
15.	IDENTIFY "CUSTOMER SERVICE" TRAINING NEEDS. 
16.	DEVELOP A COMPLIANCE REPORTING SCHEDULE.

LONG KNOWN AS NEW YORK STATE'S KEEPER OF RECORDS, DOS, IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF GOVERNOR ANDREW M. CUOMO, HAS BEEN RE-IMAGINED AS A VEHICLE TO HELP REINVIGORATE THE STATE'S ECONOMY AND MAKE OUR COMMUNITIES MORE LIVABLE. THIS MISSION DOVETAILS PERFECTLY WITH THE GOALS AND MISSION OF ESPRI AND THE VISTA PROGRAM.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF ANTI-POVERTY ORGANIZATIONS, CENTERING EFFORTS ON JOB PLACEMENT SERVICES AND OTHER FOCUS AREAS ULTIMATELY IDENTIFIED BY EACH LOCAL ANTI-POVERTY TASK FORCE.  THE PROPOSED PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED OR UNDEREMPLOYED; HAVE A LOW EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT; ARE DISCONNECTED YOUTH; HAVE LIMITED ACCESS TO ADEQUATE HEALTH CARE; AND/OR ARE FOOD INSECURE, IN 16 LOCALITIES ACROSS NEW YORK STATE.  AS PART OF THE EMPIRE CORPS, SEVENTEEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL ENSURE THE SUSTAINABILITY OF ESPRI'S POVERTY REDUCTION GOALS BY HELPING THE TASK FORCES AND THE NOT-FOR-PROFITS COORDINATORS DEFINE THEIR MISSION AND DESIGN INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS THAT CAN ALIGN SERVICES AND REDUCE IDENTIFIED BARRIERS TO ECONOMIC SECURITY.  EXAMPLES OF ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, STAFF AND VOLUNTEER TRAINING, CREATION OF A PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT SYSTEM TO BE USED ACROSS THE LOCALITIES, AND DESIGN OF A COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT.  THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE UNDERTAKEN BY THESE 17 MEMBERS OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR, BUT THE ENTIRE PROJECT WILL SPAN THREE YEARS.

PROJECT M.O.V.E. BUFFALO - MOBILIZING OPPORTUNITIES FOR VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCE IS A PROGRAM THAT BRINGS TOGETHER AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS, WHO DEDICATE A YEAR TO SERVE FULL-TIME IN THE CITY OF BUFFALO, ASSESS CAPACITY GAPS, IDENTIFY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECTS AND DELIVER VALUABLE SERVICES TO PEOPLE LIVING IN POVERTY. THE PURPOSE OF THE PROGRAM IS TO EXAMINE THESE ONGOING EFFORTS THAT HELPS STRENGTHEN OUR CITY?S SOCIAL FABRIC AND BUILDS ON A RESILIENT FUTURE, WHILE DRAWING UPON STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS THAT HAVE CULTIVATED OPPORTUNITIES TO SERVE THE DIVERSE POPULATIONS IN BUFFALO. ALTHOUGH MANY OF THE EXAMPLES PROVIDED THROUGHOUT THE REPORT FOCUS ON SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES, THE CONCEPTS IN THE REPORT ARE APPLICABLE TO A WIDE RANGE OF DEMOGRAPHICS AND VULNERABLE POPULATION.

CITY HALL IS THE CENTER FOR MUNICIPAL GOVERNMENT IN THE CITY OF BUFFALO. BEING A GOVERNMENT INSTITUTION, IT BECOMES MORE CRITICAL TO SERVE AS THE HUB FOR COMMUNITY COLLABORATORS AND PUBLIC DISCOURSE. CITY GOVERNMENT AND CITY MANAGERS INVOLVED IN THE EFFORTS TO ERADICATE POVERTY AND SOLVE COMPLEX SOCIAL PROBLEMS IN BUFFALO ARE PULLING THEIR RESOURCES TO MAKE SUBSTANTIAL CAPACITY-BUILDING INVESTMENTS IN PROGRAMS SERVING UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOODS. IN COLLABORATION WITH SEVERAL PHILANTHROPIC ORGANIZATIONS AND EXPERTS, BUFFALO CITY HALL PROJECT MOVE IS CONTRIBUTING TO THIS DIALOGUE. PROJECT M.O.V.E. BUFFALO EXPECTS TO DIRECT VISTA RESOURCES IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT TO LEVERAGE EXISTING EFFORTS IN LIFTING PEOPLE OUT OF POVERTY.  PROJECTS WILL ALSO BE DEVELOPED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL FOUR OF THE KEY VISTA CORE PRINCIPLES:  ANTI-POVERTY FOCUS, COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT, SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS AND CAPACITY BUILDING. BUFFALO CITY HALL AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL SUPPORT PROJECT M.O.V.E. BUFFALO BY CAPTURING VALUABLE LESSONS FROM PARTNERS THAT HAVE ENGAGED IN SUCCESSFUL CAPACITY BUILDING. IN THIS MODEL, THE DESIRED OUTCOME IS TO CREATE A POOLED COLLABORATIVE EFFORT THAT TIES IN ALL OF THE WORK DONE WITH EACH ORGANIZATION INTO A LONG-LASTING INITIATIVE TO DECREASE POVERTY AND INCREASE QUALITY OF LIFE IN BUFFALO.

THE MISSION OF HEART TO HEART: COMIENZOS EAST IS TO PROVIDE TRANSFORMATIVE EDUCATION IN JAILS, PRISONS, AND COMMUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA AND RESPONDS TO THE MY BROTHER'S KEEPER GOAL OF SUPPORTING MEN OF COLOR IN BECOMING INCREASINGLY SAFE FROM CRIME AND VIOLENCE. 

THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BRING INDIVIDUALS AND OUR COMMUNITY OUT OF POVERTY THROUGH AN INCREASE IN ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. WE WILL DO THIS THROUGH FOCUSING OUR LIFE-CHANGING EDUCATION ON THE HIGH CONCENTRATION OF PEOPLE WITH LOWER INCOMES WHO ARE INCARCERATED AT THE CAMDEN COUNTY JAIL AND OTHER NEARBY CORRECTIONAL FACILITIES AND ON PEOPLE WITH LOWER INCOMES WHO PARTICIPATE IN OUR PROGRAMS IN THE COMMUNITY. WE EXPECT TO DIRECTLY BENEFIT OVER TWO HUNDRED MEN AND WOMEN A YEAR WHO ARE INCARCERATED, AT RISK OF INCARCERATION, FORMERLY INCARCERATED, HAVE LOVED ONES WHO ARE INCARCERATED, OR WERE VICTIMS OF CRIME OR VIOLENCE. OVER THE NEXT YEAR, TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT THROUGH ACTIVITIES WHICH GROW OUR ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY. 

THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DEVELOPING AND MANAGING OUR WEBSITE AND SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE; DEVELOPING A ROBUST SYSTEM FOR LOCATING, CONTACTING, AND INTERACTING WITH RETURNING CITIZENS; DEVELOPING AWARENESS AND INVOLVEMENT IN RESTORATIVE JUSTICE; CONDUCTING, ORGANIZING, AND REPORTING OUT ON INDUSTRY RESEARCH AND STATISTICS; AND IMPROVING THE EFFICACY OF OUR ENGAGEMENT WITH THOSE WHO BELIEVE IN AND SHARE OUR VISION.

THE HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT NETWORK OF NEW JERSEY?S MISSION IS TO PROMOTE ECONOMIC JUSTICE AND THE EMPOWERMENT OF LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES THROUGH ACCESS TO SAFE AND DECENT SHELTER FOR LOW- AND MODERATE-INCOME RESIDENTS IN NEW JERSEY.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CAPACITY BUILDING FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SUPPORT 200+ MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS WHO ARE ADDRESSING HOMELESSNESS, FORECLOSURE PREVENTION, AND HEALTHY HOME ISSUES AND PROVIDE SUPPORT AND INFRASTRUCTURE TO HELP BUILD THEIR CAPACITY AND BETTER SERVE THE THOUSANDS OF CLIENTS THAT COUNT ON THEM FOR SERVICES.  FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS WORKING ALONGSIDE SEASONED HOUSING, PLANNING AND NON-PROFIT EXPERTS ON THE ISSUES INCLUDING ENGAGING SERVICE PROVIDERS, INFRASTRUCTURE, AND EDUCATION; PRODUCE ONGOING ISSUE COMMUNICATIONS (INCLUDING TRADITIONAL AND EMERGING MEDIA TOOLS); ENGAGE IN EFFORTS TO INTEGRATE ISSUES WITH OTHER LOCAL, STATEWIDE AND NATIONAL NETWORK AND PARTNER ACTIVITIES; PLAN AND EXECUTE EVENTS TO HIGHLIGHT THE NEED FOR CHANGES TO HOMELESSNESS, FORECLOSURE, AND HEALTHY HOUSING ISSUES; PROMOTE FUNDING STREAMS TO SERVE OUR MEMBERS, INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THAT CREATE AFFORDABLE HOMES AND ADDRESS THE LONG TERM NEEDS OF NJ RESIDENTS; DEVELOP, PREPARE, AND EXECUTE FUNDRAISING AND RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS; AND CONDUCT ONGOING RESEARCH ABOUT AND PROMOTING BEST-PRACTICES IN THE FIELD.  THIS WORK WILL BE CONDUCTED OVER THE COURSE OF 12 MONTHS.

NORWESCAP, THE NORTHWEST NJ COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP WAS INCORPORATED BY LOCAL CITIZENS IN 1965 AND CELEBRATED ITS? 50TH ANNIVERSARY IN 2015. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES A PORTFOLIO OF EMERGENCY SERVICES AND OTHER INITIATIVES THAT LEAD TO SELF-RELIANCE TO OVER 35,000 UNDER-RESOURCED INDIVIDUALS IN HUNTERDON, MORRIS, PASSAIC, SOMERSET, SUSSEX AND WARREN COUNTIES. WITH AN ADMINISTRATIVE COST OF LESS THAN 5%, THE AGENCY MANAGES OVER 35 MILLION DOLLARS FROM 60 DIFFERENT SOURCES, PLUS INVESTMENTS FROM OVER 300 COMMUNITY PARTNERS. A DIVERSE 15-MEMBER BOARD OF TRUSTEES, 250 EMPLOYEES AND 1400 VOLUNTEERS ARE DEDICATED TO OUR MISSION; "STRENGTHENING COMMUNITIES BY CREATING OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPACT POVERTY." 

NORWESCAP HAS HAD A LONG TERM RELATIONSHIP WITH CNCS OPERATING RSVP AND SEVERAL AMERICORPS PROJECTS IN THE PAST. THEY HAVE PROVED TO BE A VALUABLE RESOURCE TO THE COMMUNITY AND TO THE AGENCY.  IN THE ORGANIZATION'S STRATEGIC PLAN, COMMUNITY BUILDING AND CAPACITY BUILDING WERE ITEMS THAT WERE IDENTIFIED TO BE ADDRESSED. 

AS PART OF THAT STRATEGY, IT WAS RECOGNIZED THAT THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE THE FINANCIAL RESOURCES OR STAFF TO ACCOMPLISH THOSE NEEDS. AS A RESULT, TOOLS LIKE AMERICORPS VISTA ARE BEING SOUGHT TO HELP MAKE THESE IMPORTANT CHANGES.

CHILDREN'S COVE'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE COORDINATED AND COMPREHENSIVE MULTIDISCIPLINARY SERVICES TO CHILD VICTIMS OF SEXUAL ABUSE/SERIOUS PHYSICAL ABUSE AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT WILL BUILD CAPACITY FOR THE ORGANIZATION TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC AND HELP MITIGATE THE PREVALENCE OF CHILD SEXUAL ABUSE BY RECRUITING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS WHO REPRESENT THE LOW-INCOME AND DIVERSE POPULATIONS IN BARNSTABLE, DUKES AND NANTUCKET COUNTIES IN MASSACHUSETTS.  THE PROJECT, COMMUNITY OUTREACH THROUGH VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT (COVE) WILL INCREASE AWARENESS, PROMOTE ACTION, AND BENEFIT ALL SECTORS AND STAKEHOLDERS WITHIN THE REGION. ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY MAINTAINING CURRICULA, RECRUITING, TRAINING AND MANAGING VOLUNTEERS, SCHEDULING AND IMPLEMENTING EVENTS, ACTIVITIES, AND FORUMS, DEVELOPING ONLINE PUBLICITY AND SOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING IN COLLABORATION WITH THE COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION COORDINATOR AT THE COVE, MAINTAINING A DATABASE AS AN  ASSESSMENT TOOL, AND ENHANCING AND BUILDING COMMUNITY RELATIONSHIPS. THE MEMBER WILL SERVE WITH COLLABORATING ORGANIZATIONS THAT ADDRESS ISSUES FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN NEED. THIS WILL BE A 12 MONTH PROJECT THAT ESTABLISHES A SUSTAINABLE, CAPACITY-BUILDING MODEL FOR CHILDREN'S COVE.

THE MISSION OF THE HOMELESS PREVENTION COUNCIL IS TO PROVIDE CASE MANAGEMENT SOLUTIONS TO SUPPORT SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND STABILITY IN OUR COMMUNITY OF LOWER CAPE COD. EXPERIENCED CASE MANAGERS ASSIST AND CONNECT OUR CLIENTS TO THE RESOURCES THEY NEED TO SUCCEED. 

THIS PROJECT WIL ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES BY SPECIFICALLY SUPPORTING OUR SPECIFIC PROGRAM AND COMPREHENSIVE CASE MANAGEMENT NEEDS. IT WILL HELP HPC BUILD ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO CONTINUE THE PROJECT ONCE VISTA RESOURCES ARE WITHDRAWN. ALL EFFORTS SPECIFICALLY RELATE TO THE AMERICORP VISTA PROGRAMMING PRIORITY OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.   

HPC IS REQUESTING A SECOND YEAR VISTA WHO WILL SUPPORT OUR ANNUAL COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND MARKETING EFFORTS AND THE IMPLEMENTATION OF OUR YOUTH COUNT, ADOPT A FAMILY AND BACKPACK TO SCHOOL PROGRAMS. THIS POSITION WILL ALSO HELP TO IMPROVE OUR AGENCY SYSTEMS AROUND HOW PROGRAM SUCCESS IS MEASURED AND EVALUATED AND BEST PRACTICES TO IMPROVE ORGANIZATIONAL EFFECTIVENESS. OUR GOAL IS TO HAVE DEVELOPED BETTER COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT STRATEGIES AND BETTER SYSTEMS AND PROCEDURES IN PLACE FOR SPECIFIC PROGRAMS. WE ALSO HOPE TO SEE ENHANCED PROCEDURES AND SYSTEMS TO HELP FUTURE VOLUNTEERS IMPLEMENT THESE PROGRAMS IN FUTURE YEARS.

THE SOUTH SHORE YMCA IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ASSOCIATION OF INDIVIDUALS DEDICATED TO IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL THROUGH PROGRAMS THAT PROMOTE HEALTHY SPIRIT, MIND, AND BODY. ROOTED IN CHRISTIAN TRADITION AND VALUES, THE YMCA SEEKS TO SERVE ALL PEOPLE, REGARDLESS OF AGE, GENDER, RACE, RELIGION, OR ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES. OUR VISION IS TO BE A PLACE WHERE EVERYONE HAS THE OPPORTUNITY TO GROW, LEARN, AND THRIVE THROUGH OUR SERVICES AND PROGRAMS. WE ARE ALWAYS STRIVING TO ENRICH OUR MEMBER EXPERIENCE AND FOSTER A SENSE OF COMMUNITY THROUGH INCLUSION AND OUTREACH. WE STRENGTHEN OUR VOLUNTEER AND FINANCIAL RESOURCES AND OUR INTERNAL OPERATIONS TO MANAGE CURRENT NEEDS AND SUPPORT FUTURE GROWTH. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA MEMBER WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE THE EDUCATIONAL ACHIEVEMENT OF LOW-INCOME YOUTH IN THE GERMANTOWN AREA OF QUINCY. WE EXPECT TO SERVE AT LEAST 200 YOUNG PEOPLE AT PROGRAMS IN GERMANTOWN. THE VISTA MEMBER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY ASSISTING IN CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT AND DEVELOPING PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS MEASUREMENTS AND EVALUATION PROCEDURES FOR THE GERMANTOWN NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER. THE VISTA MEMBER WILL SERVE CLOSELY WITH PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS TO RECRUIT AND TRAIN MENTORS TO WORK WITH STUDENTS ATTENDING AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS IN OUR MUSIC CENTER; WILL FIND NEW WAYS TO MARKET YOUTH DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS, AND THEN INSTRUCT STAFF ON HOW TO IMPLEMENT THE MARKETING STRATEGY; DEVELOP SURVEYS AND EVALUATIONS INTENDED TO GATHER INFORMATION ABOUT THE NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER AND ITS YOUTH PROGRAMS; KEEP AND INTERPRET DATA FROM THOSE SURVEYS AND EVALUATIONS; AND USE THOSE EVALUATIONS TO INFORM STAFF ABOUT POTENTIAL CHANGES TO DRIVE FUTURE GROWTH OF THE MUSIC CENTER.

THE MISSION OF THE UNITED WAY OF PIONEER VALLEY (UWPV) IS TO MOBILIZE PEOPLE AND RESOURCES TO STRENGTHEN OUR COMMUNITIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, RURAL, AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ULTIMATELY STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY AND BRING INDIVIDUALS OUT OF POVERTY BY MITIGATING THE IMPACT OF THE ROOT CAUSES OF POVERTY IN THE GREATER HAMPDEN COUNTY COMMUNITY AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT HUNDREDS OF LOW-INCOME PEOPLE. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RESOURCE MAPPING, ASSESSING CURRENT PROGRAM MATERIALS, MODIFYING MATERIALS TO STRENGTHEN PROGRAMMING, DEVELOPING COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT PLANS AND GENERATING REPORTS OF NEED/RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON FINDINGS, IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL COLLABORATORS AND PLANNING INFORMATIONAL MEETINGS OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

FOUNDED IN 1990, THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF BROCKTON HAS BEEN SERVING THE YOUTH OF THE GREATER BROCKTON REGION FOR MORE THAN A QUARTER CENTURY THROUGH OUR MISSION TO NURTURE STRONG MINDS, HEALTHY BODIES AND COMMUNITY SPIRIT THROUGH YOUTH-DRIVEN, QUALITY PROGRAMMING IN A SAFE AND FUN ENVIRONMENT. OUR VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. OUR VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO CONTINUE INCREASING OUR ORGANIZATION'S CAPACITY TO SERVE AT-RISK YOUTH BY SUPPORTING OUR RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT THE NEARLY 2,000 YOUTH WE SERVE EACH YEAR. OUR 2 STANDARD VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS GRANT WRITING, EVENT PLANNING, DONOR CULTIVATION, AND THE RESOURCE LEVERAGING AND COMMUNITY COLLABORATION FUNCTIONS OF THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

FOUNDED 115 YEARS AGO, THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF TAUNTON IS ONE OF THE OLDEST BOYS & GIRLS CLUBS IN THE COUNTRY. THE TAUNTON CLUB'S MISSION IS TO GIVE YOUTH IN THE GREATER TAUNTON REGION - NO MATTER WHAT NEIGHBORHOOD THEY'RE FROM OR SCHOOL THEY ATTEND - A SENSE OF HOPE, BELONGING AND PURPOSE, AS WELL AS THE SKILLS THEY NEED TO OVERCOME LIFE'S CHALLENGES AND GIVE BACK TO THEIR COMMUNITY. FOR MORE THAN A CENTURY THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF TAUNTON HAS BEEN AN UNPARALLELED RESOURCE FOR YOUTH IN OUR COMMUNITY, WITH PROGRAMS EVOLVING TO MEET THE CHALLENGES POSED BY AN EVER-CHANGING WORLD WHILST REMAINING TRUE TO OUR MISSION. ANNUALLY, OUR CLUB SERVES MORE THAN 500 YOUTH AGES 6-18 THROUGH A COMBINATION OF AFTER-SCHOOL, WEEKEND, AND SUMMER PROGRAMS AIMED AT HELPING YOUNG PEOPLE ACHIEVE GREAT FUTURES.

FOR SEVERAL YEARS THE TAUNTON CLUB HAS STRUGGLED MIGHTILY TO RAISE THE REVENUE NEEDED TO COVER THE EXPENSES OF OPERATING ITS PROGRAMS. THOUGH THE CLUB HAS BEEN SUCCESSFUL IN IMPLEMENTING FEE-BASED PROGRAMMING (SUMMER CAMP, AQUATICS, ETC.) TO SUPPLEMENT THE MINIMAL REVENUE GENERATED FROM MEMBERSHIPS, IT CURRENTLY LACKS DIVERSITY IN ITS FUNDRAISING EFFORTS, WITH LITTLE TO NO EXISTING GRANT SUPPORT FROM FOUNDATIONS, LACKLUSTER BOARD ENGAGEMENT, LIMITED COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP, AND BAREBONES DONOR STEWARDSHIP. IN AN EFFORT TO HELP THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF TAUNTON USHER IN A NEW ERA OF SUCCESS AND IMPROVED PROGRAMMING, THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF BROCKTON BEGAN PROVIDING CONSULT IN JULY 2017 THROUGH A FORMAL MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT IN HOPES OF REVERSING THE TREND OF DEFICIT THAT HAS STRAINED THE TAUNTON CLUB AS OF LATE. THE TWO CLUBS HAVE WORKING HAND-IN-HAND EVER SINCE TO INCREASE FUNDING TO THE TAUNTON CLUB AND SHARE RESOURCES (LIKE TAUNTON'S 45-ACRE SUMMER CAMP) TO ENSURE THAT THE YOUTH IN BOTH COMMUNITIES WILL CONTINUE TO BE ABLE TO RELY UPON THEIR LOCAL BOYS & GIRLS CLUB AS AN UNPARALLELED RESOURCE AIDING THEIR ACADEMIC SUCCESS AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT.

WE ARE THRILLED TO SHARE THAT IN DECEMBER 2018 THE BOARDS OF DIRECTORS OF THE BROCKTON AND TAUNTON CLUB EACH VOTES UNANIMOUSLY TO MERGE OUR TWO ORGANIZATIONS EFFECTIVE JULY, 1 2019 AT THE START OF OUR 2020 FISCAL YEAR. WITH A SHARED MISSION TO NURTURE STRONG MINDS, HEALTHY BODIES, AND COMMUNITY SPIRIT THROUGH YOUTH-DRIVEN, QUALITY PROGRAMS IN SAFE AND FUN ENVIRONMENTS, THESE TWO STORIED CLUBS AND COMMUNITIES ARE COMING TOGETHER TO PROVIDE OUR MEMBERS WITH MORE AND EVEN BETTER PROGRAMS. THROUGH THE SHARING OF BEST PRACTICES, 
PARTNERSHIPS, AND RESOURCES, COMES EXPANDED OPPORTUNITIES TO BROADEN THE SCOPE AND REACH OF OUR CORE AFTER-SCHOOL, WEEKEND, AND SUMMER CAMP PROGRAMS. AS WE VENTURE FORWARD TOGETHER WITH OUR NEW VISION OUR HIGHEST PRIORITY IS TO ENSURE THE GREATEST POSSIBLE IMPACT FOR OUR CLUB MEMBERS. 

THE MERGER HAS BEEN AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE SIGNIFICANT FOR BOTH AFFECTED COMMUNITIES. FOR TAUNTON,  MERGER WITH BROCKTON PROVIDES LONG-TERM STABILITY THROUGH ACCESS TO EXPERIENCED SENIOR STAFF AND BOARD LEADERSHIP, PROVEN PROGRAMS, AND A BEVY OF STRONG COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS THROUGHOUT THE REGION TO SUPPORT BOTH FUNDRAISING AND PROGRAM QUALITY. SINCE 1971, THE REGIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL COUNCIL, INC.'S MISSION HAS BEEN TO BRING PEOPLE TOGETHER TO BUILD HEALTHY, SUSTAINABLE, AND JUST COMMUNITIES IN WORCESTER, MASSACHUSETTS--NEW ENGLAND'S SECOND LARGEST CITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. REC IS REQUESTING 2 VISTAS TO HELP BUILD OUR ORGANIZATION'S CAPACITY TO END FOOD INSECURITY AND HUNGER AND TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR JOB GROWTH, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND LEADERSHIP, AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP IN WORCESTER'S LOWEST INCOME, MOST VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES WHILE HELPING TO BUILD REC'S BASE OF TRAINED, ENGAGED COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS, MEMBERS, AND DONORS. THERE IS CURRENTLY A CRISIS OF FOOD INSECURITY AND HUNGER IN WORCESTER; THE CITY HAS A HIGHER OVERALL RATE OF POVERTY THAN OTHER COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE. REC ADDRESSES THIS CRISIS BY WORKING WITH LOW-INCOME FAMILIES TO CREATE URBAN GARDENS AND FARMS; TRAINING TEEN FOOD SYSTEM LEADERS; AND CONNECTING LOW-INCOME CONSUMERS TO LOCAL, AFFORDABLE FOOD THROUGH FARMERS MARKETS' AND BY BUILING A SUPPORT FOR A CAPITAL CAMPAIGN TO PURCHASE AN OFFICE THE THE REC AND SUPPORT REC WITH THE CREATION OF EN ENDOWMENT. THESE ACTIVITIES PROVIDE A PATHWAY OUT OF POVERTY BECAUSE URBAN GARDENING AND FARMING AND IMPROVING PRODUCTION AND ACCESS TO AFFORDABLE, LOCAL FOOD CREATES JOBS AND SAVES LOW-INCOME FAMILIES MANY "FOOD DOLLARS," THEREBY INCREASING THEIR ECONOMIC CAPACITY AND SELF-RELIANCE. IN ADDITION, THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD OUR ORGANIZATION'S CAPACITY BY HELPING RESEARCH, CREATE AND DEVELOP A CAPTIAL CAMPAIGN. THIS WILL BE THE FIRST ONE REC HAS DONE. THIS CAPITAL CAMPAIGN IS WORKING TO PURCHASE THE LAND AND BUILDINGS NEAR THE REC URBAN FARM. TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS BY EXPANDING OUR OF DONORS & SUPPORTERS. VISTAS MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY DEVELOPING SYSTEMS FOR CAPITAL CAMPAIGN GIVING, NEW CAMPAIGN DONOR RECRUITMENT, AND RECRUIT NEW DONORS TO REC.  IN ADDITION, VISTA VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK TO INCREASE THE COMMUNICATION OF REC'S WORK THRU THE CAPITAL CAMPAIGN IN THE COMMUNITY WE SERVE THRU CREATING TEMPLATES FOR E-NEWSLETTERS, SOCIAL MEDIA POSTINGS, CULTURALLY APPROPRIATE STORYTELLING AND STORY COLLECTION. CREATING SYSTEMS FOR IMAGE COLLECTION AND BEST USE PRACTICE STORAGE OF IMAGES AND STORIES.  THE CREATION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THESE SYSTEMS OVER THE PROPOSED PERIOD OF SUPPORT WITH CLEARLY DEFINED WORKPLANS FOR STAFF, BOARD, AND VOLUNTEERS WILL ENABLE THE PROJECT TO BE FOLDED SEAMLESSLY INTO REC'S OVERALL WORK ONCE VISTA SUPPORT IS WITHDRAWN.

THE BOSTON HOUSING AUTHORITY (BHA) WELLNESS CONNECT PROGRAM, UNDER THE AUSPICES OF ITS CENTER FOR COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND CIVIL RIGHTS (CCECR), HAS EFFECTIVELY UTILIZED LANGUAGE ACCESS AS A MEANS TO CONNECT PUBLIC HOUSING FAMILIES WHO ARE LIMITED ENGLISH SPEAKERS TO HEALTH/NUTRITION BENEFITS AND SERVICES. THROUGH VOLUNTEER INTERPRETERS AND BILINGUAL PRESENTERS, ELDERLY/DISABLED RESIDENTS WHO SPEAK ONLY SPANISH OR CHINESE (TWO OF BHA'S LARGEST LINGUISTIC GROUPS) ARE GAINING KNOWLEDGE OF HEALTHY LIVING AND EATING, AND BEING CONNECTED TO MOBILITY RESOURCES AND GROUP ACTIVITIES THAT REDUCE THEIR ISOLATION. 

THE PROPOSED WELLNESS CONNECT VISTA PROJECT AIMS TO BUILD BHA'S VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING CAPACITY TO REMOVE LANGUAGE BARRIERS AND INCREASE ACCESS TO HEALTH RESOURCES, SPECIFICALLY WITH THE FOCUS ON HEALTHY FUTURES AND THE OBJECTIVES OF ACCESS TO CARE.

DURING THE LAST TWO AND HALF VISTA PROJECT YEARS, THE PROJECT TEAM HAS SUBSTANTIAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS. THE PROJECT TEAM WAS TRAINING CLOSE TO 200 NEW VOLUNTEERS EVERY YEAR. THESE BILINGUAL VOLUNTEERS HAVE GENERATED A TOTAL OF MORE THAN 5900 SERVICE-HOURS SINCE THE BEGINNING OF THE PROJECT. IN ADDITION, THE VISTA PROJECT TEAM HAS BEEN CONSISTENTLY MEETING THE PERFORMANCE MEASURE TARGETS FOR SERVICE DELIVERY AND EXPANDED WELLNESS CONNECT SERVICES FROM FIVE (5) PUBLIC HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS TO ELEVEN (11) DEVELOPMENTS IN BOSTON, INCLUDING THOSE IN THE SOUTHWEST CORRIDOR NEIGHBORHOODS (SOUTH END, ROXBURY, AND JAMAICA PLAIN). THE PROJECT TEAM HAS ALSO FORMED NEW PARTNERSHIPS WITH EIGHTEEN (18) EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS FOR PURPOSES OF VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, AS WELL AS SIX (6) NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND FIVE (5) HEALTH SERVICES PROVIDERS FOR THE PROVISION OF SERVICES AND WORKSHOPS ON HEALTH/WELLNESS / FOOD ACCESS FOR BHA RESIDENTS. AS THE PROJECT HAS BUILT SUBSTANTIAL VOLUNTEER CAPACITY IN THE FIRST TWO YEARS, THE TEAM WAS ABLE TO REDUCE PROJECTED EFFORTS AND SPONSORING ONE VISTA MEMBER INSTEAD OF TWO IN PROJECT YEAR 3 AND STILL EXPANDED THE PROJECT TO TWO MORE PUBLIC HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS IN PROJECT YEAR 3 AND BEGAN TO TARGET HAITIAN CREOLE AND CAPE VERDEAN RESIDENTS WITH LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENCY (LEP).  

FURTHER TO THE ABOVE ACHIEVEMENTS, THE WELLNESS CONNECT PROJECT HAS SUBSTANTIALLY BENEFITTED FROM THE CREATIVITY OF VISTA MEMBERS. A YEAR 2 VISTA MEMBER GREATLY IMPROVED PROJECT INFORMATION ACCESS BY CREATING AN E-BINDER THAT OPERATES LIKE A WEBSITE. THE YEAR 3 VISTA MEMBER SINGLEHANDEDLY PLANNED AND ORGANIZED THE VERY FIRST VISTA MEMBERS GATHERING OF VISTA MEMBERS FROM MASSACHUSETTS FOR VISTA MEMBERS IN THE AREA TO SHARE THEIR EXPERIENCES AND TO NETWORK. 

IN THE UPCOMING PROJECT YEAR, UPON THE APPROVAL OF THE EXTENSION OF THE VISTA PROJECT, THE TEAM WILL FOCUS ON TACKLING HURDLES THAT CROPPED UP. ONE SIGNIFICANT CHALLENGE THAT CAME UP IN PROJECT YEAR 3 WAS THE EXPIRATION OF GRANT FUNDING WHICH WAS SPONSORING THE LOGISTICS COST OF THE DELIVERY AND HEALTH/WELLNESS WORKSHOPS AND THEREBY REDUCED BHA'S RESIDENTS' ACCESS TO HEALTH/WELLNESS INFORMATION. COUPLED WITH THE CONSTANT CHALLENGES IN SECURING SPONSORSHIP, YEAR 4 VISTA MEMBER WILL FOCUS SPECIFICALLY IN RE-ESTABLISHING THESE LOST RESOURCES THROUGH GRANT WRITING. 

IN ADDITION, IN PROJECT YEAR 4, THE PROJECT TEAM WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN THE TARGETED NUMBER OF RESIDENTS SERVED BY THE PROJECT. THUS IN THE TEAM WILL ENGAGE 1200 BHA RESIDENTS VARIOUS BHA PUBLIC HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS, OF WHOM MORE THAN 50% ARE LIMITED ENGLISH SPEAKING WITH THE PREDOMINANT LANGUAGES BEING SPANISH, CHINESE, HAITIAN CREOLE, AND CAPE VERDEAN. THE VISTA MEMBER WILL RECRUIT 50 NEW BILINGUAL VOLUNTEERS TO CONTRIBUTE 1,000 HOURS AS INTERPRETERS AND WELLNESS INFORMATION PRESENTERS. THE VOLUNTEER INTERPRETERS AND PRESENTERS WILL IN TURN PROVIDE, IN 6 OF THE HOUSING SITES, 80 MONTHLY/FORTNIGHTLY SESSIONS OF ASSISTANCE WITH INTERPRETATION AND TRANSLATION TO UNDERSTAND THEIR GOVERNMENT BENEFITS APPLICATION/RECERTIFICATION, WELLNESS SCREENINGS, H

THE NORTH HARTFORD COLLABORATIVE (NHC) IS A COLLECTIVE IMPACT PROJECT INVOLVING LEADERS FROM GOVERNMENT, LOCAL INSTITUTIONS, NON-PROFITS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS THAT TARGETS RESOURCES TO CREATE JOBS, BOOST ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, IMPROVE PUBLIC SAFETY, EXPAND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES, STRENGTHEN HEALTH OUTCOMES, AND STIMULATE BETTER HOUSING OPPORTUNITIES FOR RESIDENTS OF NORTH HARTFORD. 

THE VISTA PROJECT WILL BE FOCUSED ON FACILITATING ACCESS TO SERVICES AND RESOURCES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPROVED ECONOMIC WELL-BEING AND FINANCIAL SECURITY OF NORTH HARTFORD RESIDENTS AND THEREFORE, ALIGN WITH VISTA PROGRAMMATIC PRIORITIES RELATED TO "ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY". 

VISTAS WILL ACHIEVE THIS BY FOCUSING ON SEVEN KEY AREAS: COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, EDUCATION, HOUSING, PUBLIC SAFETY, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, HEALTH AND WELLNESS, AND DATA AND EVALUATION.

EL PASO, TEXAS IS A VERY POOR COMMUNITY WITH LIMITED RESOURCES FOR THE GENERAL POPULATION. PROJECT AMISTAD PROPOSES TO CONTINUE WORKING WITH 3 VISTA MEMBERS, WHICH INCLUDES ONE COST SHARE TO PROVIDE OVERSIGHT TO THE SUSTAINABILITY TO THE VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT PROGRAM (VRP), WHILE CONTINUING TO DEVELOP AND SUSTAIN A FUND DEVELOPMENT PROCESS. THE VISTA'S WILL CONTINUE TO SUSTAIN THE VRP, THEREFORE BUILDING A SYSTEM THAT WILL ALLOW THE PROCESS OF ADVOCATING AND MENTORING VETERANS, THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO ENSURE THEY HAVE ALL SERVICES THEY ARE ENTITLED TO.  VETERANS ARE REQUIRED TO CHECK IN WITH THE VETERAN'S ASSOCIATION ANNUALLY TO CONTINUE RECEIVING SERVICES. WHEN THIS HAS LAPSED (DUE TO MISINFORMATION, IGNORANCE REGARDING REQUIREMENTS, OR INDIGENCE AND THE LOSS OF ALL PERSONAL IDENTIFICATION INFORMATION), THE DOCUMENTS VERIFYING PRIOR SERVICE ARE ESSENTIAL IN THE PROCESS OF REINSTATING THEIR SUPPORT SERVICES.  OUR CONCERN IS THAT MOST OF OUR VETERANS THAT ARE INDIGENT AND/OR HOMELESS HAVE LIMITED AWARENESS OF THE OPTIONS AVAILABLE TO THEM. THE VISTAS WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES AND SYSTEMS THEREBY IMPROVING THE LIVES OF ALL THAT WE SERVE AT PROJECT AMISTAD. THE VRP WILL THEN SUPPORT THE ADDITIONAL PROGRAMS. THE GUARDIANSHIP PROGRAM HAS APPROXIMATELY 400 INDIVIDUALS THAT HAVE BEEN DEEMED AS INDIGENT AND INCAPACITATED AND NOT ABLE TO CARE FOR THEMSELVES. THE COUNTY OF EL PASO PROBATE COURT CONTRACTS WITH PROJECT AMISTAD TO ENSURE THESE INDIVIDUALS HAVE PROFESSIONAL GUARDIANS THAT CAN ADVOCATE FOR THEIR DAILY NEEDS. HAVING VOLUNTEERS FOR THIS PROGRAM WILL ALLOW MORE ACCOUNTABILITY AND OVERSIGHT WITHIN A VERY VULNERABLE POPULATION. MANY OF OUR CLIENTS ARE VULNERABLE DUE TO LACK OF TRANSPORTATION, THE INABILITY TO PAY FOR THEIR MEDICATIONS DUE TO POVERTY, ACCESS TO THEIR FOLLOW-UP APPOINTMENTS POST-DISCHARGE FROM THE HOSPITAL, LIVING ARRANGEMENTS, ETC. BUILDING UPON THE VOLUNTEER AND INTERN PROGRAM WILL PROVE TO BE ADVANTAGEOUS TO ALL INVOLVED. ANOTHER COMPONENT TO PROJECT AMISTAD IS THE TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM. TRANSPORTATION IS A COMPLEX SYSTEM THAT THROUGH VARIOUS ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS HAS PROVEN TO BE ONE OF THE GREATEST NEEDS THAT MANY OF OUR CLIENTS HAVE. MANY OF THE CLIENTS THAT QUALIFY FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ARE VERY VULNERABLE TO THEIR DISABILITY OR HEALTH DISPARITIES. BEING ABLE TO BUILD A POOL OF VOLUNTEERS THAT CAN ASSIST OUR CLIENTS ON THE BUS, WOULD ALSO BE BENEFICIAL. MANY OF THE CLIENTS COME FROM THEIR DIALYSIS APPOINTMENTS, THEREFORE HAVING A VOLUNTEER ON THE BUS WOULD ASSIST THE DRIVER IN KNOWING UP TO DATE INFORMATION REGARDING HOW THE CLIENTS ARE DOING. IN ALL THE AFOREMENTIONED PROGRAMS, MANY OF OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE BEING SERVED. THIS WOULD INCLUDE WORKING WITH THE VOLUNTEERS AND INTERNS THAT HAVE BEEN RECRUITED TO ENSURE THE MISSION IS MET, WHICH IS TO SERVE AND ADVOCATE FOR VETERANS, ELDERLY, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND PERSONS AT RISK, THEREFORE, IMPROVING THEIR OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE. THE VISTAS WILL CONTINUE TO BROADEN THE VRP TO ALL PROGRAMMATIC ASPECTS OF VOLUNTEERISM WITH THE AGENCY AND ASSIST WITH THE PLANNING OF VARIOUS FUNCTIONS FOR OUR CLIENTS. THE MAJORITY OF OUR CLIENTS ARE INDIGENT, ELDERLY AND/OR HAVE A DISABILITY THEREFORE THE 3 REQUESTED VISTAS OVER A 12 MONTH TIME SPAN WILL ULTIMATELY STRENGTHEN A COMMUNITY THAT IS RIDDLED WITH LESS OPPORTUNITIES. MINDDRIVE'S MISSION IS TO INSPIRE STUDENTS TO LEARN THROUGH MENTORING AND PROJECT-BASED LEARNING, TO EXPAND THEIR VISION OF THE FUTURE, AND FOR THEM TO BE A POSITIVE INFLUENCE ON THE COMMUNITY.. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS MOST CLOSELY WITH THE STATED 2015FY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION BUT ALSO ALIGNS WITH ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENGAGE HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS AND RECENT GRADUATES IN OUR OF SCHOOL EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO AWAKEN THEIR INNOVATIVE SPIRIT. MEETING STUDENTS WHERE THEY ARE, MINDDRIVE TRIES TO UNLOCK CREATIVE POTENTIAL BY PROVIDING PROGRAMS THAT OFFER A SAMPLE OF MANY DIFFERENT OPPORTUNITIES IN TECHNOLOGY, CREATIVITY, INNOVATION, COMMUNICATIONS AND DESIGN. UNLIKE OTHER EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING ACTIVITIES, MINDDRIVE IS ORIENTED AS A PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATION, NOT STRICTLY AN EDUCATIONAL ONE. CULTIVATING SKILLS IN MATH, SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, FINANCIAL LITERACY AND WRITING ARE IMPORTANT AND DEVELOP NATURALLY AS A SECOND STEP AFTER GETTING THE KIDS EXCITED TO LEARN. THE VISTA PROJECT WOULD ALLOW SUPPORT MINDDRIVE AS IT GROWS BY HELPING DEVELOP A VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, ENHANCE FUND DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES AND IMPROVE COMMUNICATION TO NOT ONLY SHARE INFORMATION WITH PARTNERS AND STAKEHOLDERS BUT ALSO HELP DEVELOP A SYSTEM FOR TRACKING AND REPORTING ON PROGRAM OUTCOMES. WHEN WE APPLIED THREE YEARS AGO WE WERE SERVING ROUGHLY 60 YOUTH. LAST YEAR, APPROXIMATELY 200 STUDENTS ARE SERVED BY MINDDRIVE PROGRAMS AND WE EXPECT THAT NUMBER TO INCREASE. OUR EXPANSION IS IN LARGE PART DUE TO THE CAPACITY BUILDING WORK DONE BY VISTAS IN THEIR SERVICE YEARS. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL SERVE IN THE ROLES OF VOLUNTEER AND DEVELOPMENT COORDINATOR, MARKETING COORDINATOR AND PROGRAM COORDINATOR AND COMMUNITY RELATIONS COORDINATOR OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR. WE WOULD LIKE TO REQUEST AN INVESTMENT FOR THESE ROLES.

TWELVE VISTAS AND TEN SUMMER ASSOCIATES ARE REQUESTED TO JOIN GENERATION SCHOOLS NETWORK AND ITS PARTNER SCHOOLS IN COLORADO AND NEW YORK IN THEIR WORK OF ENSURING THAT ALL STUDENTS, REGARDLESS OF LIFE CIRCUMSTANCE, HAVE ACCESS TO A GREAT EDUCATION.  THE GSN TEAM IS PARTNERING WITH THE FOLLOWING SCHOOLS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO PLACE THE VISTAS ON THE GROUND TO COMPLETE CRITICAL WORK: ENGLEWOOD SCHOOL DISTRICT (ENGLEWOOD, CO), TURNING POINT OF THE CITY, AND BROOKLYN GENERATION SCHOOL (BROOKLYN, NY).  THE GSN TEAM PROVIDES COACHING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THESE SCHOOLS IN ORDER TO ENSURE THAT TEACHERS AND STUDENTS ARE ACCESSING THE FULL BENEFITS OF GSN'S SCHOOL MODEL AND RESOURCES.  GSN FOCUSES ITS SUPPORT IN FIVE AREAS: STRUCTURAL REDESIGN, LEADERSHIP & ACCOUNTABILITY, LEARNING AND TEACHING, HEALTH & WELLNESS, AND COLLEGE & CAREER READINESS.  TOOLS AND PROCEDURES ARE BEING DEVELOPED AND IMPLEMENTED AT ALL OF THESE SCHOOLS AND MORE. THE GENERATION SCHOOLS MODEL IS CURRENTLY IMPACTING OVER 20,000 STUDENTS AND 1,500 TEACHERS NATIONALLY. 

THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL DEVELOP TOOLS AND PROCEDURES SPECIFICALLY IN THE AREAS OF PARENT ENGAGEMENT, VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, PROGRAM EVALUATION, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT AND SOCIAL MEDIA THAT CAN BE UTILIZED AND IMPLEMENTED LONG AFTER THE VISTA MEMBERS HAVE COMPLETED THEIR TERMS. THE REQUESTED VISTA ACTIVITIES AT ALL LOCATIONS WILL INCLUDE DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING STRATEGIES FOR SOCIAL MEDIA COMMUNICATIONS, CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, DEVELOPING TRAINING MATERIALS AND BEST PRACTICES FOR TEACHERS AND ADMINISTRATORS TO FURTHER PARENT ENGAGEMENT, AND HELPING TO SOLIDIFY THE ON-BOARDING PROCESS, TRAINING MATERIALS, SUPERVISION, AND APPRECIATION OF THE VOLUNTEERS COMING TO WORK WITH GSN AND ITS AFFILIATE SCHOOLS.

GENERATION SCHOOLS NETWORK (GSN) IS AN AWARD-WINNING NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE INNOVATIVE EDUCATION MODEL OFFERS UP TO 30% "MORE AND BETTER" LEARNING TIME WITHOUT INCREASING COSTS OR TEACHER WORKLOAD. GSN'S MISSION IS TO TRANSFORM PUBLIC EDUCATION THROUGH SUSTAINABLE, SCALABLE STRATEGIES THAT DRIVE STUDENT ACHIEVEMENT AND TEACHER EFFECTIVENESS FOR ALL STUDENTS AND TEACHERS. THE VISION IS TO ENSURE THAT ALL STUDENTS- REGARDLESS OF LIFE CIRCUMSTANCES -- ARE PREPARED FOR SUCCESS IN SCHOOL, WORK AND LIFE. 
THE GENERATION SCHOOLS MODEL HAD ITS ORIGINS IN 1990 WHEN FOUNDER FURMAN BROWN BEGAN TEACHING IN THE FIRST-EVER CORPS OF TEACH FOR AMERICA IN SOUTH-CENTRAL LOS ANGELES. THE CHALLENGING REALITIES HE DISCOVERED THROUGH THE EXPERIENCE MOTIVATED HIM TO SPEND MORE THAN A DECADE DEVELOPING AND TESTING EDUCATION REFORM STRATEGIES IN A VARIETY OF SETTINGS. HE THEN LAUNCHED GENERATION SCHOOLS NETWORK IN 2004. IN COLLABORATION WITH NEW YORK CITY DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, HE LAUNCHED BROOKLYN GENERATION SCHOOL IN 2007. WITHIN THE FIRST FEW YEARS, AS THEY IMPLEMENTED CRITICAL ELEMENTS OF THE GENERATIONS SCHOOLS MODEL, THEY OBSERVED SIGNIFICANT GAINS IN ATTENDANCE, CREDITS ACCUMULATED, AND PASS RATES IN THE NEW YORK STATE REGENTS EXAMS.  SUBSEQUENTLY, GENERATION SCHOOLS NETWORK CHOSE TO PILOT THE PROGRAM IN COLORADO AND IN THE FALL OF 2012, WEST GENERATION ACADEMY OPENED.

THE BENEFICIARIES OF OUR ORGANIZATION'S PROGRAMS INCLUDE THE TEACHERS, STUDENTS, ADMINISTRATORS, FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITIES OF THE SCHOOLS THAT WE WORK WITH, WHICH ARE HIGH-NEED, HIGH-POVERTY SCHOOLS NATION-WIDE. HERE IS DATA ON THE SITES THAT WILL BE HOSTING VISTAS:

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMENDMENT IS TO SHIFT FOUR (4) VISTA POSITIONS PREVIOUSLY DESIGNATED TO YOUTH CO-OP (POSITIONS THAT WERE LOCATED IN BROWARD, MIAMI, AND PALM BEACH COUNTIES) TO OTHER PROVIDERS/SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THE FOUR POSITIONS WILL BE SHIFTED TO INTERNATIONAL RESCUE COMMITTEE (TALLAHASSEE), LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES (JACKSONVILLE), WORLD RELIEF (JACKSONVILLE), AND CATHOLIC CHARITIES (ORLANDO). ALL FOUR OF THESE PROVIDERS/SITES HAVE ALREADY BEEN PREVIOUSLY APPROVED AND HAVE RECEIVED AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS IN THE PAST.

THE OVERALL PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH CNCS' ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL CONTINUE PARTNERING WITH AMERICORPS VISTA TO INCREASE SERVICES TO REFUGEES LIVING IN THE JACKSONVILLE, TAMPA BAY/CLEARWATER, TALLAHASSEE, AND ORLANDO. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS GOAL, DCF/REFUGEE SERVICES WILL SERVE AS THE SPONSOR AND PROVIDE OVERSIGHT AND OVERALL COORDINATION FOR THE PROJECT. THE PROJECT WILL ENGAGE THIRTEEN (13) VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE (1) VISTA LEADER. THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL SERVE IN NONPROFIT COMMUNITY PARTNER AGENCIES ON A VARIETY OF PROJECTS TO HELP RESETTLED REFUGEES ACHIEVE ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND COMMUNITY INTEGRATION. THIS COORDINATED EFFORT WILL HELP SEVEN (7) ORGANIZATIONS AT SEVEN (7) DISTINCT SITES PROVIDE INCREASED SERVICES TO REFUGEES WHO ARE MAKING THE DIFFICULT TRANSITION OF ADJUSTING TO LIFE IN AMERICA. THE ROLE OF THE VISTA LEADER IS TO EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF THE VISTA MEMBERS AND TO ASSIST THE PROJECT IN RECRUITING, RETAINING, AND IMPROVING THE PERFORMANCE OF THE VISTA MEMBERS. THE 13 VISTAS WILL CONDUCT A WIDE RANGE OF CAPACITY BUILDING AND RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT FEW YEARS IN SUCH AREAS AS RECRUITING AND ASSISTING IN TRAINING AND MANAGING VOLUNTEERS, DEVELOPING REFUGEE YOUTH MENTORING AND TUTORING PROGRAMS, WRITING AND SUBMITTING GRANT PROPOSALS AND INCREASING VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT IN ORDER TO ENHANCE THE INTEGRATION AND SELF-SUFFICIENCY OF NEWLY ARRIVED REFUGEES.

BIRMINGHAM CITY SCHOOLS' MISSION IS TO GUIDE ALL STUDENTS TO ACHIEVE EXCELLENCE IN A SAFE, SECURE AND NURTURING ENVIRONMENT. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL CONTINUE TO SEEK TO DEVELOP STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS AND ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR PARENTS AND COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS; DEVELOP PROGRAMMING AND MATERIALS TO SUPPORT THE USE OF TECHNOLOGY TO ENHANCE THE EDUCATIONAL PROCESS AND TO SUPPORT STUDENT ACHIEVEMENT; AND TO ASSIST IN THE COMPILATION AND INTERPRETATION OF DATA TO DRIVE STUDENT ACHIEVEMENT; SIX (6) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION, MATERIALS DEVELOPMENT, RESOURCE RESEARCH AND IDENTIFICATION.

COMMUNITIES OF TRANSFORMATION (COT) IS A FAITH-BASED INITIATIVE THAT IS SPONSORED BY A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, THE ALABAMA-WEST FLORIDA CONFERENCE OF THE UNITED METHODIST CHURCH (AWFUMC).   THE MISSION OF COT IS TO BREAK THE GENERATIONAL CYCLE OF POVERTY, WHICH IS DONE THROUGH THE BUILDING OF INTENTIONAL, LONG-TERM FRIENDSHIPS THAT PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR FAMILIES WHO WANT TO BUILD A STABLE FINANCIAL FUTURE.  COT IS A COMMUNITY-WIDE, INTERDENOMINATIONAL EFFORT DESIGNED TO CHANGE THE CONVERSATION ABOUT ISSUES OF POVERTY, TO SEEK TO BREAK THE GENERATIONAL GRIP OF POVERTY, AND TO FIND WAYS TO IDENTIFY AND REMOVE THOSE SYSTEMIC BARRIERS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY.  COT ALIGNS WITH THE PROGRAMMING PRIORITY OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.  
WE BEGAN YEAR 4 WITH TWELVE VISTA MEMBERS WHO ARE CURRENTLY ENGAGED IN SERVICE; NINE OF THOSE MEMBERS COORDINATE THE PROJECT IN COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE REGION AND THREE OF THOSE MEMBERS PROVIDE ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT TO THE PROJECT.  THEY ARE BUILDING CAPACITY FOR COMMUNITIES OF TRANSFORMATION TO REACH NINE DIFFERENT COT COMMUNITIES, AS WELL AS REGION WIDE COT EFFORTS.  VISTA MEMBERS ARE ASSISTING IN BUILDING THE REQUIRED INFRASTRUCTURE IN EACH OF THE COT COMMUNITIES, IDENTIFYING AND EXPANDING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, PROVIDING PUBLICITY AND COMMUNICATION WITHIN THE COMMUNITIES AND THROUGHOUT THE REGION, RECRUITING AND PREPARING TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE VOLUNTEERS, AND MEASURING PERFORMANCE OUTCOMES.   IN NOVEMBER, WE ADDED A 13TH VISTA WHO WILL FOCUS ON THE PARTICIPANTS/FAMILIES SERVED BY COT.  THIS VISTA WILL WORK WITH PARTICIPANT TRAINERS AT EACH OF OUR SITES AND PROVIDE STRUCTURE TO OUR PROGRAMMING.  WE RECENTLY ADDED A VISTA LEADER POSITION TO OUR PROJECT AND WILL CONTINUE THAT POSITION INTO YEAR 5. THIS VISTA LEADER WILL WORK TO STRENGTHEN AND BUILD THE LEADERSHIP SKILL OF CURRENT VISTAS, DEVELOP IN-SERVICE TRAININGS AND STRENGTHEN THE OVERALL CAPACITY OF THE VISTA PROJECT.  PER CONVERSATIONS WITH OUR STATE OFFICER, WE HAVE BEEN AUTHORIZED TO REQUEST A TOTAL OF 10 STANDARD SLOTS AND 6 COST SHARE SLOTS PLUS A VISTA LEADER POSITION FOR YEAR 5 OF OUR GRANT.  THESE ADDITIONAL SLOTS WILL BE USED FOR EXPANSION INTO THE NORTHWEST FLORIDA PANHANDLE AREA AND FOR PLANTING OF NEW SITES WITHIN ALABAMA.   WE UNDERSTAND THAT WE HAVE ALL OF 2019 TO RECRUIT FOR AND FILL THESE SLOTS.
THE BENEFICIARIES WILL BE FAMILIES IN POVERTY IN EACH OF THE COMMUNITIES IN ALABAMA AND THE WEST FLORIDA PANHANDLE, AS WELL AS THOSE VOLUNTEERS AND COMMUNITY LEADERS WHO WILL GAIN NEW UNDERSTANDING ABOUT THE LIVES OF THOSE WHO LIVE DAILY IN THE QUAGMIRE OF POVERTY.

EQUAL JUSTICE WYOMING'S MISSION IS TO SERVE THE LEGAL NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME PERSONS IN WYOMING THROUGH COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, EDUCATION, INFORMATION, AND EXPANSION OF LEGAL SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO EXPAND THE AVAILABILITY OF LEGAL ASSISTANCE AND INFORMATION TO LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT HUNDREDS OF LOW-INCOME CLIENTS BY HELPING MANAGE VOLUNTEERS AND BUILDING OUR CAPACITY TO CONNECT LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WITH VOLUNTEER ATTORNEYS FOR LEGAL ASSISTANCE OR NON-ATTORNEY VOLUNTEERS FOR LEGAL INFORMATION AND/OR REFERRAL TO APPROPRIATE LEGAL SELF-HELP RESOURCES.  

OUR SUBSITE, THE WYOMING CHILDREN'S TRUST FUND (WCTF), IS FOCUSED ON A JUSTICE RELATED ISSUE OF PREVENTING CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT AND KEEPING FAMILIES OUT OF THE CHILD WELFARE COURT SYSTEM.  THE FOCUS AREAS WOULD BE HEALTHY FUTURES, AND RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT.  THIS PROGRAM ALSO ALIGNS WITH EJW AS LOW-INCOME FAMILIES ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY INVOLVED WITH THE JUSTICE SYSTEM THROUGH CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT CASES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:

THE SALT LAKE COUNTY DIVISION OF COMMUNITY RESOURCES AND DEVELOPMENT'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR SALT LAKE COUNTY RESIDENTS BY STRENGTHENING FAMILIES AND NEIGHBORHOODS WHICH ARE THE FOUNDATION OF A STRONG AND VIBRANT COMMUNITY.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT REQUESTS FIVE MEMBERS AND ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA.  

USE OF VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPROVED ECONOMIC WELLBEING AND HOUSING STABILITY OF HOMELESS AND RECENTLY HOMELESS PERSONS.  TARGETING THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY OBJECTIVES OF HOUSING AND EMPLOYMENT WILL BE KEY ACTIVITIES OF THE VISTA MEMBERS.

KEY ACTIVITIES OF VISTA MEMBERS WOULD INCLUDE:
1) VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT - WORKING AT A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY BASED NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO RECRUIT, TRAIN AND MANAGE VOLUNTEERS IN ORDER TO INCREASE AGENCY CAPACITY.
2) DATA ANALYSIS - COLLECT AND ANALYZE DATA ON A MONTHLY AND QUARTERLY BASIS ON CLIENTS BEING SERVED AT COMMUNITY BASED  NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO REVIEW ACCOMPLISHMENT OF GOALS AND TRENDS WITH THE FOCUS OF IMPROVING SYSTEM PERFORMANCE.  DEVELOP DATA ANALYSIS CAPACITY BY IMPLEMENTING DATA COLLECTION FORMS SURVEYS AND ANALYSIS TOOLS.
3) COLLABORATION - DEVELOP PARTNERSHIPS AND NETWORK WITH OTHER SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES TO IDENTIFY RESOURCES THAT WOULD ENABLE HOMELESS AND FORMERLY HOMELESS TO INCREASE INCOME THROUGH MAINSTREAM SERVICES, EMPLOYMENT SKILLS, AND EMPLOYMENT.  

DATA DEMONSTRATES A HIGH NUMBER OF PEOPLE IN SALT LAKE COUNTY FALL INTO THE CATEGORY OF CURRENTLY OR RECENTLY HOMELESS.  FOR EXAMPLE: 
1) CURRENTLY HOMELESS - EACH YEAR A POINT IN TIME (PIT) COUNT IS CONDUCTED OF THOSE WHO ARE HOMELESS IN SALT LAKE COUNTY. THE 2014 PIT IDENTIFIED AN ANNUALIZED TOTAL OF 9,356 INDIVIDUALS IN SALT LAKE COUNTY THAT WERE HOMELESS WITH 332 OF THOSE BEING CHRONICALLY HOMELESS (HOMELESS FOR MORE THAN ONE YEAR OR HAVING HAD FOUR EPISODES OF HOMELESSNESS IN THE LAST THREE YEARS) AND  273 VETERANS.  
2) FORMERLY HOMELESS - EACH YEAR A HOUSING INVENTORY COUNT (HIC) IS TAKEN OF ALL THE HOUSING RESOURCES FOR THE HOMELESS PERSONS IN SALT LAKE COUNTY. THE 2014 HIC IDENTIFIED 2,000 PERSONS LIVING IN HOUSING DESIGNATED FOR FORMERLY HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES.  
3)  FORMERLY HOMELESS - EACH YEAR APPROXIMATELY 1,200 REFUGEES ARE RESETTLED IN SALT LAKE COUNTY, MANY COMING TO AMERICA AS HOMELESS HAVING LIVED MUCH OF THEIR IN REFUGEE CAMPS.  THEY ARE AT HIGH RISK OF RETURNING TO HOMELESSNESS.

BACKGROUND

SAN DIEGO HAS THE HIGHEST NUMBER OF ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY COMMANDS AND THE LARGEST NUMBER OF ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY PERSONNEL IN THE COUNTRY.  THERE ARE NINE MAJOR COMMANDS. THERE ARE 120,000 ACTIVE DUTY PERSONNEL WITH MORE THAN 150,000 DEPENDENTS.  WHEN 15,000 MILITARY MEMBERS LEAVE THE SERVICE A YEAR, 33% REMAIN IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY.  THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY 267,000 VETERANS IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY.  

VETS' COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS

VETS COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS (VCC) IS DESIGNED TO HOLISTICALLY SERVE THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY BY BRIDGING THE GAP BETWEEN THE VETERANS AND ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY PERSONNEL WHO SERVE AND THE LARGER COMMUNITY.  IN ADDITION, COLLABORATION IS REQUIRED TO BE SUCCESSFUL.  IT PROVIDES BUSINESSES AND INDIVIDUALS WHO WANT TO DO MORE THAN SAY "THANK YOU FOR YOUR SERVICE" THE CHANNEL TO USE THEIR OWN PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE AND EXPERTISE TO RESPOND TO VETERAN AND MILITARY FAMILY RELOCATION AND REINTEGRATION QUESTIONS IN A WIDE VARIETY OF FIELDS. ONLY APPROXIMATELY 1% OF AMERICANS HAVE SERVED IN THE ARMED FORCES, AND RECENT STUDIES SHOW THAT ONLY 5-10% OF AMERICANS PERSONALLY KNOW A VETERAN. THIS DIVIDE HIGHLIGHTS THE IMPORTANCE OF THE COMMUNITY BEING PART OF RE-INTEGRATION EFFORTS. VCC SPECIFICALLY SERVES VETERANS, ACTIVE DUTY AND THEIR IMMEDIATE FAMILY MEMBERS AS WELL AS BUSINESSES AND INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE INTERESTED IN OFFERING SERVICES OR PRODUCTS. THE GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO HAVE VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES MORE EASILY AND FULLY REINTEGRATE INTO COMMUNITIES FOLLOWING MILITARY SERVICE, FACILITATING THEIR ABILITY TO LEAD HAPPIER, HEALTHIER, FINANCIALLY SECURE LIVES. THE HEALTH TRUST (THT) IS A 501(C) (3) NON-PROFIT OPERATING FOUNDATION FOUNDED IN 1996 FROM THE SALE OF THREE LOCAL NON-PROFIT HOSPITALS. THE MISSION IS TO LEAD THE SILICON VALLEY COMMUNITY TO ADVANCE WELLNESS WITH A VISION TO MAKE SILICON VALLEY THE HEALTHIEST REGION IN AMERICA, WHERE EVERY RESIDENT CAN ACHIEVE OPTIMAL HEALTH THROUGHOUT HIS OR HER LIFETIME, IRRESPECTIVE OF BACKGROUND, INCOME, RACE, ETHNICITY, OR AGE. THT IS COLLABORATING WITH THREE COMMUNITY PARTNERS: SECOND HARVEST, VEGGIELUTION, AND LA MESA VERDE AT SACRED HEART COMMUNITY SERVICE. THESE SITES WILL CONTINUE TO IMPLEMENT THE HEALTHCORPS VISTA PROGRAM FOR A SECOND YEAR, WHICH WILL FOCUS ON HEALTHY FUTURES, SPECIFICALLY OBESITY AND FOOD ACCESS. THE HEALTHCORPS VISTA PROGRAM WILL SEEK TO CONTINUE TO INCREASE SEAMLESS ACCESS TO HEALTHY, AFFORDABLE FOOD IN LOW-INCOME, LOW-ACCESS COMMUNITIES AND BUILD/ STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS FOR THE THIRD YEAR. SPECIFICALLY, SEVEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL WORK AT 4 SEPARATE COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS IN SAN JOSE TO TRAIN STAFF AND COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS, CREATE NEW OR ENHANCE SYSTEMS AND BUSINESS PROCESSES, SERVE NEW BENEFICIARIES, INCREASE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING FOOD AND INCREASE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS REPORTING INCREASED FOOD SECURITY OF THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN THROUGH CONDUCTING CLIENT SURVEYS TO INDIVIDUALS. THE VISTA MEMBERS WILL WORK SEPARATELY AT THEIR HOSTING SITES AND MEET ON A MONTHLY BASIS TO LEARN ABOUT THE WORK THEIR VISTA COLLEAGUES ARE COMPLETING DURING THEIR SERVICE YEAR. THE SEVEN VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES INCLUDING: CONDUCTING COMMUNITY ASSESSMENTS, INCREASING COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT, EXPANDING OR STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS AND NETWORKS, SUPPORTING EFFORTS TO INCREASE FINANCIAL RESOURCES, DEVELOPING EDUCATIONAL/ TRAINING/ OUTREACH MATERIALS, CONDUCTING COMMUNITY OUTREACH, MEASURING PROGRESS THROUGH PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT, CONDUCTING PROGRAM EVALUATION/DEVELOPMENT/DELIVERY, AND RECRUITING AND MANAGING COMMUNITY AND ORGANIZATIONAL VOLUNTEERS.

NEW DOOR VENTURES PREPARES DISCONNECTED YOUTH FOR SUCCESS IN WORK AND LIFE THROUGH PAID JOBS, INTENSIVE CASE MANAGEMENT, SKILL-BUILDING WORKSHOPS AND EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT. NEW DOOR SERVES YOUTH AGES 16-24 WHO ARE OVERCOMING HISTORIES OF NEGLECT, INCARCERATION, HOMELESSNESS, SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND POVERTY.  NEW DOOR PROVIDES THE REAL JOBS AND DEEP SUPPORT THAT ENABLE YOUTH TO IDENTIFY GOALS, LEARN HEALTHY BEHAVIORS, IMPROVE THEIR COMMUNICATION AND LEADERSHIP SKILLS, AND MAKE A SUCCESSFUL TRANSITION TO A HEALTHY, FULFILLING AND SUSTAINABLE ADULTHOOD.  THE PROPOSED AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. 

EXPANDING CAPACITY FOR NEW DOOR BY ADDING 5 AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS WILL IMPROVE OUR EFFORTS TO CONTINUE GROWING THE NUMBER OF CLIENTS WE SERVE AND TO ACHIEVE OUR VISION OF PROVIDING 2,000 NEW JOBS TO DISCONNECTED YOUTH THIS DECADE.

CENTRO HISPANO OF DANE COUNTY'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR LATINOS AND OTHERS LIVING IN DANE COUNTY BY EMPOWERING YOUTH, STRENGTHENING FAMILIES, AND ENGAGING THE COMMUNITY. AN OVERARCHING GOAL IS TO INCREASE ITS CAPACITY BUILDING STRATEGIES TO ACCOMPLISH THE FIVE-YEAR STRATEGIC PLAN.  MORE SPECIFICALLY THIS VISTA PROJECT HAS MULTIFACETED GOALS, WHICH WILL SEEK TO ASSIST IN THE EXPANSION OF FIVE CURRENT PROGRAMS:
1) IMMIGRATION PROGRAM: THE GOAL OF THE EXPANSION OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO FULFILL A GAP IN IMMIGRATION SERVICES IN THE COUNTY, BY STRENGTHENING OUR BIA PROGRAM.  ONE PERSON IS CURRENTLY HANDLING MORE THAN 500 CASES/YEAR, WHICH IS NOT SUSTAINABLE NOR JUST.  FOR THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE, OBTAINING A WORK PERMIT AND SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER EXPONENTIALLY INCREASES THEIR CHANGES TO ACCESS BETTER JOBS, EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES, IMPROVE THEIR HOUSING SITUATION, ACCESS CREDIT, AMONG OTHERS.  BY INCREASING THIS PROGRAM CAPACITY, CENTRO WILL BE ABLE TO BUILD A STRONGER PROGRAM, WHICH IN RETURN REPRESENTS A STRONGER AND MORE PREPARE COMMUNITY.
2) COMMUNITY HEALTH ADVOCATE PROGRAM IS AIMING TO PUSH CENTRO HISPANO TO BECOME A CULTURALLY COMPETENT HUB ON THE SOUTHSIDE OF MADISON IN AREAS RELATED WITH HEALTH AND WELLNESS, BY USING THE COMMUNITY HEALTH WELLNESS (CHW) MODEL OF CARE DELIVERY. THIS PROGRAM INCLUDES THREE COMPONENTS: 1) TRAINING AND EDUCATION OF CHWS, 2) FOOD ACCESS AND FOOD JUSTICE ACTIVITIES AND EDUCATION, AND 3) COOPERATIVE DEVELOPMENT.  THE WELLNESS INITIATIVE OVERARCHING VISION IS TO DEVELOP COMMUNITY BASED HEALTH AND WELLNESS EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FUELED BY THE COMMUNITY, WHICH GOAL IS TO PROACTIVELY REDUCE THE OBSERVED AND DOCUMENTED HEALTH DISPARITIES IN THE LATINO POPULATION. 
3) CAPACITY BUILDER: IS AIMING TO DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE VOLUNTEER POSITION, WHICH WILL STREAMLINE CENTRO'S CAPACITIES TO RECRUIT, TRAIN, RETAIN, FUND, AND EMPOWER VOLUNTEERS, TARGETING VOLUNTEERS OF COLOR.  THE GOAL OF THIS APPROACH IS TO START INTEGRATING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES IN EACH OF CENTRO'S PROGRAMS, AS AN INTENTIONAL OUTCOME. IN ADDITION, THIS POSITION WILL WORK ON DEVELOPING STRATEGIC WAYS TO INCREASE AWARENESS AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR LATINOS IN THE COMMUNITY.   THE VISTA WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE DIRECTOR OF DEVELOPMENT TO STREAMLINE OUR MARKETING AND PR STRATEGIES. 
BY THE EXPANSION OF THESE PROGRAMS, CENTRO EXPECTS TO ENGAGE WITH AND REACH OUT TO A WIDER SECTOR OF THE COMMUNITY.  FURTHERMORE, BECAUSE OF THE INTRINSIC CHARACTERISTICS EACH PROGRAM THERE IS A DIFFERENTIATION IN THE NUMBERS OF EXPECTED BENEFICIARIES: 1) COMMUNITY HEALTH ADVOCATE (CHA) PROGRAM WILL SEEK TO ENGAGE 100 UNDUPLICATED COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN HEALTH, HOME VISITS, AND ONE CHA CONFERENCE, AND FACILITATE AT LEAST 12 COMMUNITY FOCUS GROUPS OR ACTIVITIES. 2) FUTURE VOLUNTEERS ENGAGED IN COMMUNITY ORGANIZING AND BUILDING CAPACITY. 
CENTRO HISPANO IS REQUESTING 4 VISTAS TO ASSIST IN THE PLANNING, PILOTING, AND IMPLEMENTATION PHASES DURING THEIR INVOLVEMENT WITH THE ORGANIZATION. 

THE OVERALL ACTIVITIES OF ALL THE PROGRAMS WILL FOCUS IN FOUR MAIN CATEGORIES: 1) VOLUNTEER AND MENTOR RECRUITMENT, TRAINING, AND DEVELOPMENT, 2) CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT AND QUALITY ASSESSMENT OF CURRENT TRAINING, 3) COMMUNITY AND STAKEHOLDER'S ENGAGEMENT AND OUTREACH, AND EVENT PLANNING, AND 4) EVALUATION OF PROGRAMS.

THE CITY OF GARY'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN GARY NEIGHBORHOODS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO A PUBLIC-PRIVATE BLIGHT ELIMINATION STRATEGY THAT WILL EFFECTIVELY IMPROVE COMMUNITIES, ATTRACTING PEOPLE WHO WANT A CLEAN, SAFE, AND AFFORDABLE PLACE TO LIVE AND RAISE FAMILIES. THE PLANNING AND REDEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT WILL ENGAGE RESIDENTS ON ECONOMIC SUSTAINABILITY AND RESTORING VACANT, DEMOLISHED, ABANDONED, AND BURNED OUT PROPERTIES FOR THE BEAUTIFICATION OF THE COMMUNITY. THE CONSTITUENT SERVICES DEPARTMENT WILL PROVIDE COORDINATION SERVICES AND RESOURCES TO RESIDENTS TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND BLIGHT ELIMINATION. THE PARKS AND GREEN URBANISM DEPARTMENTS WILL BOTH  FOCUS ON SAFE, CLEAN AND HEALTHY COMMUNITIES AND EDUCATING RESIDENTS ON CONNECTING TO NATURE, COMMUNITY GARDENING, AND STORM WATER MANAGEMENT IN LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES, UTILIZING THE OPPORTUNITY TO BEAUTIFY BLIGHTED AREAS. THE PARKS DEPARTMENT'S GOAL IS TO CREATE A CLEAN AND SAFE BEACH BY ENGAGING AND EDUCATING BEACH GOERS OF THE IMPORTANCE OF RECYCLING AND CLEAN WATER. THIS WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITY TO UNDERSERVED YOUTH. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO BUILD CAPACITY WITHIN DIFFERENT DEPARTMENTS  THEREBY LEVERAGING IN-KIND SERVICES, FUND DEVELOPMENT, AND VOLUNTEERISM, TO BENEFIT HUNDREDS OF LOW-INCOME YOUTH AND FAMILIES IN GARY. NINE (9) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COLLECTING AND MANAGING DATA, ENGAGING CITIZENS, RAISING AWARENESS, IMPLEMENTING PROJECTS, SEEKING AND APPLYING TO GRANTS, CREATING NEW PARTNERSHIPS, AND STRENGTHENING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES WITHIN DEPARTMENTS OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE EAST ST. LOUIS SCHOOL DISTRICT'S MISSION IS TO CULTIVATE THE POTENTIAL IN EVERY STUDENT TO THRIVE AS A GLOBAL CITIZEN BY INSPIRING A LOVE OF LEARNING AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT, BY CHALLENGING AND SUPPORTING EVERY STUDENT TO ACHIEVE ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, AND BY EMBRACING THE FULL RICHNESS OF OUR COMMUNITY.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ESTABLISH STACKABLE PATHWAYS FROM EDUCATION TO JOBS, WITH COORDINATED IN-SCHOOL AND OUT-OF-SCHOOL COMMUNITY ALIGNMENT, AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WHO ARE AT RISK OF ACADEMIC FAILURE DUE TO EXTREME POVERTY. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ENGAGING EMPLOYERS, DEVELOPING AND COORDINATING WORK-BASED LEARNING ACTIVITIES, DEVELOPING PUBLIC RELATIONS MATERIALS AND OTHER SUSTAINABILITY ACTIVITIES OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT YEAR.

NORTHERN ILLINOIS FOOD BANK?S  MISSION IS TO LEAD THE NORTHERN ILLINOIS COMMUNITY IN SOLVING HUNGER BY PROVIDING NUTRITIOUS MEALS TO THOSE IN NEED THROUGH INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS AND PARTNERSHIPS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA, BY INCREASING ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD FOR THOSE IN POVERTY AND REDUCING THEIR RISK OF OBESITY. THE VISTA PROJECT SEEKS TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR THE FOOD BANK AND OUR NETWORK MEMBERS WITH A FOCUS ON PRIORITY COUNTIES, WHERE WE WISH TO INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF NUTRITIOUS FOOD WE ARE DISTRIBUTING TO THE FOOD-INSECURE POPULATION IN HIGH NEED COMMUNITIES. THE PROJECT WILL ENGAGE THE SUPPORT OF NEW CORPORATE AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR FINANCIAL AND IN-KIND SUPPORT, TARGET THE GROWING SENIOR POPULATION AT RISK OF HUNGER, SUPPORT OUR BUILDING HEALTHY COMMUNITIES STRATEGY, ENGAGE NEW VOLUNTEERS AND ENHANCE OUR INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS. THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL HELP US CONTINUE TO DISTRIBUTE FOOD TO MORE THAN 70,000 FOOD-INSECURE INDIVIDUALS, AS WE WORK TOWARDS OUR 2020 STRATEGIC GOAL OF MEETING THE MEAL GAP IN EVERY CORNER OF OUR 13 COUNTY SERVICE AREA. EIGHT FULL-YEAR  VISTA MEMBERS AND SEVEN SUMMER VISTAS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES INCLUDING ASSESSMENT OF NEEDS FOR NETWORK MEMBERS, OUTREACH TO NEW CORPORATE DONORS AND COMMUNITY GROUPS, GRANT WRITING AND RESEARCH, COMMUNICATION ENHANCEMENTS, RESEARCH FOR NEW PROGRAMS AND ENGAGING ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS OVER THE COURSE OF THE ONE YEAR PROJECT.

VISTAS ASSIGNED TO TURNING THE PAGE (TTP) WILL WORK WITH SCHOOLS THAT SERVE DISADVANTAGED YOUTH IN THE NORTH LAWNDALE AREA OF CHICAGO. VISTAS ASSIGNED TO TURNING THE PAGE WILL DEVELOP AND SUSTAIN PARTNERSHIPS AMONG PUBLIC SCHOOLS, FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITIES TO ENSURE THAT ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS RECEIVE VALUABLE EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES AND A HIGH-QUALITY PUBLIC EDUCATION. VISTA MEMBERS WILL ORGANIZE SIX COMMUNITY NIGHTS PER TTP PARTNER SCHOOL IN 2018-2019, BRINGING EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS AND HIGH-QUALITY CHILDREN'S BOOKS TO HUNDREDS OF FAMILIES. VISTA MEMBERS WILL ADDITIONALLY PLAN AND IMPLEMENT LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOPS FOR AT LEAST 30 PARENTS AND PROVIDE THESE PARENTS WITH SUPPORT TO SIGNIFICANTLY EXPAND THEIR PARENT-TEACHER ORGANIZATIONS AND POSITIVELY IMPACT THEIR SCHOOL COMMUNITIES IN MULTIPLE WAYS. FOR EXAMPLE, PARENT LEADERS WILL ORGANIZE SERVICE PROJECTS, RESOURCE FAIRS, AND PARTICIPATE ON SCHOOL IMPROVEMENT TEAMS. VISTA MEMBERS WILL HELP TTP DEVELOP AND STRENGTHEN ITS PARTNERSHIPS SO THAT IT CAN OFFER INFORMATION TO FAMILIES ON HIGHER EDUCATION, STEM ACADEMIC AND CAREER PATHWAYS, SCHOLARSHIP INFORMATION, AS WELL AS COMMUNITY RESOURCES, SUCH AS PUBLIC LIBRARIES.

THE MISSION OF THE IMMIGRATION PROJECT IS TO STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES THROUGH ACCESS TO AFFORDABLE, HIGH QUALITY IMMIGRANT LEGAL SERVICES IN DOWNSTATE ILLINOIS.  THE IMMIGRATION PROJECT WILL PLACE 4 VISTA VOLUNTEERS DIRECTLY WITH OUR AGENCY, AND 1 VISTA VOLUNTEER WITH ANOTHER PARTNER AGENCY. THE IMMIGRATION PROJECT'S PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS GOAL OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES OF LOW-INCOME IMMIGRANTS IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN ILLINOIS, BY HELPING FOREIGN BORN RESIDENTS OBTAIN THE LAWFUL RIGHT TO WORK OR TO APPLY FOR CITIZENSHIP.  WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT BETWEEN 700-900 BENEFICIARIES.  VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO IMPROVING THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY IMPROVING EVALUATION AND DATA REPORTING METRICS, RECRUITING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST THE AGENCY'S LEGAL REPRESENTATIVES, IMPROVING THE AGENCY'S VISIBILITY, AND INCREASING INDIVIDUAL DONOR GIVING.

EMPOWERING PEOPLE FOR INCLUSIVE COMMUNITIES (EPIC) MISSION IS TO PREPARE YOUNG PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES TO BECOME ACTIVELY ENGAGED COMMUNITY LEADERS THROUGH EDUCATION, LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. EPIC OPERATES AS A 501(C)3 NONPROFIT THROUGH ITS FISCAL SPONSOR, TRIANGLE, INC.  TRIANGLE'S MISSION IS THROUGH SUPPORT, CHALLENGE, AND OPPORTUNITY; TRIANGLE EMPOWERS PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND THEIR FAMILIES TO ENJOY RICH, FULFILLING LIVES. TRIANGLE IS COMMITTED TO HELPING THE WORLD RECOGNIZE THAT WE ARE ALL PEOPLE WITH ABILITY. 

THE TWO PROPOSED VISTA PROJECTS ALIGN WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECTS WILL SEEK TO MAKE THE EPIC SERVICE WARRIOR PROGRAM A NATIONAL MODEL, WITH TEAMS OF YOUTH WITH DISABILITIES ENGAGING IN COMMUNITY SERVICE ACROSS THE COUNTRY. EPIC ORIGINALLY SET OUT TO HAVE ONE VISTA MEMBER A YEAR THAT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BUILDING SERVICE WARRIOR PROGRAM CAPACITY THROUGH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, CREATING A BEST PRACTICES MANUAL, CREATING A SITE REPLICATION MANUAL, AND EXPANDING THE SERVICE WARRIOR SITES OVER THE COURSE OF 5 YEARS. IN ADDITION TO THIS ORIGINAL PLAN, EPIC REQUESTED AND RECEIVED TWO VISTA POSITIONS IN 2018. THE SECOND POSITION WORKED TO CREATE BEST PRACTICES FOR THE REPLICATION AND EXECUTION OF EPIC'S TWO SIGNATURE EVENTS TO ENSURE THEIR SUCCESS WHEN DONE IN A NEW CITY. THIS YEAR EPIC IS REQUESTING TWO AMERICORPS VISTAS FOR THE UPCOMING YEAR TO FOCUS ON THE REPLICATION AND EXPANSION OF THE EPIC COMMUNITY TRAINING PROGRAM AND TO CREATE NEW PROGRAMS AND SYSTEMS TO INCREASE INDIVIDUAL GIVING TO SUPPORT EPIC'S PROGRAM EXPANSIONS.
THIS AWARD APPROVES FUNDING FOR THE 2022-2023 VISTA SUPPORT GRANT DESCRIBED IN THE APPROVED PROGRAM NARRATIVE AND BUDGET. THIS AWARD ALSO ADDS 12 STANDARD SUMMER ASSOCIATES DURING THE PROJECT PERIOD.

TEENSHARP PREPARES TALENTED LOW-INCOME, AFRICAN-AMERICAN AND LATINO STUDENT TO ATTEND AND THRIVE AT OUR NATION'S TOP COLLEGES. TO ACHIEVE THIS MISSION, TEENSHARP PROVIDES STUDENTS WITH TOP-QUALITY ADVISING, HIGHLY INTELLECTUALLY RIGOROUS EXPERIENCES, ACADEMIC SKILLS AND COLLEGE KNOWLEDGE-BUILDING, COLLEGE TOURS AND MEETINGS WITH COLLEGE REPRESENTATIVES, AND ANY RESOURCES REQUIRED TO ALLOW SCHOLARS GROW AS STRIVERS, STARTERS, APPLIERS, GIVERS, AND CONNECTORS.
TEENSHARP'S MISSION DIRECTLY ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION PRIORITY AREA, PROVIDING INTENSIVE TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT IN SCHOOL READINESS, K-12 SUCCESS, AND POST-SECONDARY SUCCESS BY MAINTAINING A STRONG SUPPORT SYSTEM FOR STUDENTS AND ENGAGEMENT OF THEIR PARENTS. WORKING CLOSELY WITH AREA SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND HIGH SCHOOLS, TEENSHARP-DELAWARE PROVIDES A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY FOR HIGH ACHIEVING, LOW-INCOME, UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS TO DEVELOP AS SCHOLARS AND LEADERS WHILE PREPARING FOR SELECTIVE INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION. TEENSHARP-DELAWARE ALSO SEEKS TO CREATE MORE CAPACITY WITHIN PARTNER DISTRICTS AND SCHOOLS AND COLLABORATE WITH NEIGHBORING YOUTH OUTREACH AND ENRICHMENT PROGRAMS TO PIPELINE STUDENTS WITH THE MOST COMPREHENSIVE COLLEGE READINESS AND SUCCESS TRAINING AVAILABLE. THE PROJECT GOALS FOR THE 2019-20 PROGRAM YEAR INCLUDE SUSTAINABLE GROWTH AND SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF COLLEGE ACCESS AMBASSADOR PROGRAM, INCLUDING RECRUITMENT OF SPANISH-SPEAKING STUDENTS AND FAMILIES, PARENT EMPOWERMENT AND ENGAGEMENT, AND INCREASED PRESENCE IN OUR PARTNER HIGH SCHOOLS. WE ARE ALSO SEEKING TO DRAMATICALLY SCALE THE STATEWIDE DELAWARE GOES TO COLLEGE ACADEMY AND DEVELOP ROBUST SYSTEMS OF SUPPORT AND IMPACT TRACKING. FINALLY, WE WILL MORE THAN DOUBLE THE NUMBER OF COLLEGE STUDENTS, TEENSHARP GRADUATES, THAT THE ORGANIZATION SUPPORTS, WHICH WILL NECESSITATE ONGOING EVALUATION OF EFFECTIVENESS OF INPUTS AND STRATEGIES TO ENSURE STUDENTS' CONTINUED ENGAGEMENT. TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS, TEENSHARP-DELAWARE REQUESTS EIGHT VISTAS FOR THE 2019-20 PROGRAM YEAR.

THE NATIONAL LAW CENTER ON HOMELESSNESS & POVERTY (THE LAW CENTER) IS THE ONLY NATIONAL ORGANIZATION DEDICATED SOLELY TO USING THE POWER OF THE LAW TO END AND PREVENT HOMELESSNESS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION. HOUSING AND K-12 SUCCESS ARE THE RESPECTIVE FOCUS AREAS. THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF COMMUNITIES USING RIGHT TO HOUSING SOLUTIONS TO END AND PREVENT HOMELESSNESS AND UPHOLD THE EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS OF CHILDREN CURRENTLY EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS. DOZENS OF COMMUNITIES, IN STATE AND/OR LOCAL JURISDICTIONS, WILL BENEFIT FROM OUR CAMPAIGN GOALS RELATED TO HOUSING AND EDUCATION ISSUES. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DATA MANAGEMENT, NETWORK DEVELOPMENT, AND BUILDING ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO EXPAND THE ACCOMPLISHMENTS THUS FAR RECOGNIZED THROUGH THE VISTA PROGRAM.

AUSTIN PARTNERS IN EDUCATION (APIE) AIMS TO IMPROVE STUDENT COLLEGE AND CAREER READINESS AND EXPAND STEM OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. THE PROPOSED RENEWAL OF APIE'S VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO EXPAND APIE PROGRAM CAPACITY FOCUSED ON AUSTIN ISD'S UNDER-RESOURCED SCHOOLS (INCLUDING THOSE IN THE DOVE SPRINGS NEIGHBORHOOD) TO MEET THE TREMENDOUS NEED FOR LOW-INCOME STUDENT ACADEMIC AND PERSONAL SUPPORT FROM ELEMENTARY THROUGH HIGH SCHOOL. CURRENTLY SERVING A STUDENT POPULATION THAT IS 90% ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, APIE EXPECTS TO SUPPORT UP TO 1150 STUDENTS IN YEAR FIVE OF THE PROJECT. TO MEET THE OVERARCHING OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT: A) DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING A VOLUNTEER AND COMMUNITY SUPPORT STRATEGY FOR TARGETED AUSTIN ISD SCHOOLS TO INCREASE STEM EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES AND B) STRATEGICALLY PLACING ADULT VOLUNTEERS IN THE CLASSROOM TO WORK WITH HIGH-NEEDS STUDENTS AT TITLE I SCHOOLS TO PROMOTE STEM EDUCATION, VISTA MEMBERS WILL PERFORM ACTIVITIES RELATED TO: 1. COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT 2. COMMUNICATIONS TO EXPAND AWARENESS OF APIE PROGRAMS AND ITS MISSION 3. FUNDRAISING STRATEGIES TO  PROVIDE APIE PROGRAMS TO MORE AUSTIN ISD SCHOOLS 4. VOLUNTEER AND MENTORING TRAINING TO ENHANCE EFFECTIVENESS 5. COLLEGE READINESS INTERVENTION STRATEGIES TO BETTER EQUIP STUDENTS FOR COLLEGE SUCCESS.
