THE CITY OF SAN ANTONIO'S OFFICE OF EASTPOINT PROPOSES THE CONTINUATION OF THE VISTA PROJECT TO SUPPORT THE SAN ANTONIO EASTSIDE REVITALIZATION TARGET AREA INITIATIVE AND COMMUNITY. WORKING WITH THE MAYOR OF SAN ANTONIO, SA2020 AND KEY PARTNERS IN EASTPOINT, THE EAST SIDE OF SAN ANTONIO, THE AMERICORPS VISTAS WILL HELP REFINE THE PLANNING OF EFFORTS ON THE EASTSIDE, SIX IMPLEMENTATION OF KEY STRATEGIES, FACILITATE COMMUNICATION AND EVALUATE IMPACT. VISTAS WILL BE FOCUSED IN SEVEN KEY AREAS OF WORK: COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, EDUCATION, HOUSING, PUBLIC SAFETY, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, HEALTH AND WELLNESS, AND DATA AND EVALUATION.  

2.	HOW MANY VISTAS AND LEADERS ARE YOU REQUESTING?
WE ARE REQUESTING 4 VISTAS AND 1 VISTA LEADER. 

3.	WHAT IS THE ESTIMATE LENGTH OF TIME REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THIS PROJECT?
 10 YEARS. 

4.	BRIEFLY DESCRIBE YOUR ORGANIZATION'S MISSION, HISTORY, AND THE BENEFICIARIES OF YOUR ORGANIZATION'S PROGRAMS.  

ACCORDING TO THE 2010 U.S. CENSUS, PER CAPITA INCOME FOR SAN ANTONIO RESIDENTS IS $22,568 -- ABOUT 19% LOWER THAN THE NATIONAL AVERAGE -- AND APPROXIMATELY 20% OF ALL HOUSEHOLDS LIVE BELOW THE NATIONAL POVERTY LEVEL. IN ADDITION, 20% OF ALL ADULT RESIDENTS OVER AGE 25 HAVE LESS THAN A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA. APPROXIMATELY 63% OF THE POPULATION IS HISPANIC AND NEARLY HALF OF ALL RESIDENTS SPEAK A LANGUAGE OTHER THAN ENGLISH AT HOME. POVERTY IN SAN ANTONIO IS CONCENTRATED WITHIN GEOGRAPHIC CLUSTERS THAT LIMIT ACCESS TO ESSENTIAL SERVICES SUCH AS EDUCATION, JOBS, HEALTH CARE, AND OTHER SERVICES TO ASSIST INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES IN OVERCOMING CYCLES OF POVERTY. 

THE EASTSIDE OF SAN ANTONIO'S TARGET FOOTPRINT, THE ERTA, THE VISTA PROJECT TARGET AREA, ENCOMPASSES 19 CONTIGUOUS CENSUS TRACTS WITH 64,125 RESIDENTS. THE OVERALL POVERTY RATE OF THE 14,864 FAMILIES LIVING IN ERTA IS 35.03%. THE MOST IMPOVERISHED CENSUS TRACT (1306) CONTAINS 522 FAMILIES, MORE THAN HALF (53.2%) OF WHOM LIVE IN POVERTY. 

FORMER MAYOR CASTRO AND FORMER HUD SECRETARY, RECOGNIZED THE NEED FOR NEED FOR CHANGE FOR SAN ANTONIO RESIDENTS. HE KNEW THAT TO BE SUCCESSFUL AND TO EMPOWER THE COMMUNITY CHANGE MUST COME FROM THE CITY'S FOUNDATION, ITS RESIDENTS. THAT IS WHY IN MAY 20101, MAYOR CASTRO FOUNDED SA2020 A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT SEEKS TO CATALYZE THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY INTO FOCUSED AND SUSTAINED ACTION TO ACHIEVE THE SHARED GOALS THAT WILL TRANSFORM SAN ANTONIO INTO A WORLD-CLASS CITY. THE ORGANIZATION IS ESTABLISHED SO THAT THE OWNERSHIP OF, AND RESPONSIBILITY AND ACCOUNTABILITY FOR ACHIEVING THIS VISION WOULD ALWAYS BELONG TO SAN ANTONIANS THEMSELVES. SA2020 IS COMMUNITY VISION AND MOVEMENT BORN FROM A SERIES OF PUBLIC FORUMS IN 2010 TO DEVELOP GOALS FOR IMPROVING SAN ANTONIO BY THE YEAR 2020. THE MISSION OF SA2020:

TO CATALYZE THE ENTIRE SAN ANTONIO COMMUNITY INTO PASSIONATE, FOCUSED, AND SUSTAINED ACTION TO ACHIEVE THE SHARED GOALS THAT WILL TRANSFORM SAN ANTONIO INTO A WORLD-CLASS CITY BY THE YEAR 2020 IN ELEVEN KEY VISION AREAS.

JANUARY 2014, TO FURTHER SUPPORT THE EASTSIDE REVITALIZATION TARGET AREA (ERTA), THE MAYOR AND CITY MANAGER, SHERYL SCULLEY, ELECTED TO CREATE A NEW CITY OFFICE CALLED THE OFFICE OF EASTPOINT TO FOCUS ON THE COMPREHENSIVE REVITALIZATION OF THE EASTSIDE OF SAN ANTONIO. THE EASTPOINT OFFICE IS SPECIFICALLY CHARGED WITH LEADING THE EASTSIDE REVITALIZATION EFFORTS TO TRANSFORM THE EASTPOINT NEIGHBORHOOD, A SMALLER SUBSET OF THE LARGER EASTSIDE TARGETED FOOTPRINT, INTO AN AREA OF TOWN RESIDENTS CAN EAT, WORK AND PLAY IN.  AS SAN ANTONIO'S DEDICATED EASTSIDE REVITALIZATION TEAM, THE EASTPOINT OFFICE IS POSITIONED FOR SUCCESS AND WILL SERVE AS THE SUPPORTIVE INFRASTRUCTURE TO THE MUTLI-AGENCY EFFORTS TO EDUCATE, FIGHT POVERTY, EMPOWER THE COMMUNITY THOUGH EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND REDUCE CRIME.

THE CITY OF AUSTIN VISTA PROGRAM WILL SERVE THE ANTI-POVERTY EFFORTS OF THE FOLLOWING DEPARTMENTS, OFFICES AND PROGRAMS:

SMALL AND MINORITY BUSINESS RESOURCES (SMBR):
THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO HELP BREAK THE CYCLE OF POVERTY BY PROMOTING AND ENCOURAGING DISADVANTAGED BUSINESS OWNERS TO PARTICIPATE IN BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES WITH THE CITY OF AUSTIN AS WELL AS TO ENSURE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY FOR THEM TO COMPETE FOR CONTRACTS AWARDED BY THE CITY. THERE IS A NEED FOR INCREASED PARTICIPATION AS IT HAS BEEN CONFIRMED THROUGH DISPARITY STUDIES THAT SMALL FIRMS EXPERIENCE A DISADVANTAGE IN ACCESS TO CAPITAL THROUGH CONTRACTING. THE VISTA WILL BUILD CAPACITY BY IDENTIFYING AND CREATING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH CRITICAL GROUND WORK, BASELINE ASSESSMENTS, OUTREACH AND RECOMMENDATIONS NEEDED TO IDENTIFY AND APPROVE VARIOUS ADMINISTRATIVE PROCESSES THAT WILL HELP THE CITY IDENTIFY, GROW AND MAINTAIN DISADVANTAGED BUSINESSES IN AUSTIN THEREFORE INCREASING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.

OBJECTIVES OF THE ASSIGNMENT ARE TO RESEARCH AND PERFORM BASELINE ASSESSMENTS TO IDENTIFY ADMINISTRATIVE PROCESSES THAT LIMIT OPPORTUNITIES FOR DISADVANTAGED BUSINESSES USING RECOMMENDATIONS FROM THE PRELIMINARY DRAFT OF THE MOST RECENT DISPARITY STUDY CONDUCTED BY THE CITY, DEVELOP VARIOUS PROCEDURES AND INITIATIVES TO INCREASE DISADVANTAGED BUSINESS PARTICIPATION ON CITY CONTRACTS. TO ASSIST WITH IDENTIFYING BASELINE MEASURES TO CAPTURE DATA THAT THE REPORT GAPS AND OPPORTUNITIES TO ASSIST DISADVANTAGED BUSINESSES. TO WORK DIRECTLY WITH THE BUSINESS PROCESS CONSULTANT TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A SYSTEM WHERE SMALL BUSINESS CONTRACTING INFORMATION CAN BE CAPTURED, STORED, AND EXTRACTED. FOLLOWING SMBR'S APPROVED RECORDS CONTROL SCHEDULE, THE VISTA WILL INCORPORATE INDUSTRY BEST PRACTICES IN DEVELOPING A SYSTEM/PLAN TO CAPTURE ALL OCCURRENCES WHERE CONTRACTING OPPORTUNITIES WERE EVALUATED (GOAL DETERMINATION REVIEW OR GDR) FOR SMALL BUSINESS PARTICIPATION. THE VISTA WILL GATHER INFORMATION FOR VARIOUS REPORTING NEEDS AND UTILIZING THE INFORMATION PROVIDED, IDENTIFY TRENDS IN SMALL BUSINESS CONTRACTING OPPORTUNITIES AND DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS TO ASSIST LOW INCOME BUSINESS OWNERS.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT AND FAIR HOUSING (EEFHO)

THE EQUAL EMPLOYMENT AND FAIR HOUSING OFFICE ENFORCES EQUAL OPPORTUNITY IN HOUSING, EMPLOYMENT, AND PUBLIC ACCOMMODATIONS IN AUSTIN, ALIGNED WITH THE CNCS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREAS. THE PROJECT GOAL IS TO INCREASE AWARENESS AMONG APPROXIMATELY 6,000 LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS, OR ABOUT 10% OF THE TOTAL TARGET POPULATION, OF THEIR RIGHTS TO EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES AND THE ENFORCEMENT SERVICES AVAILABLE TO THEM OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR. THE VISTA WILL WORK IN THE AREA OF COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PLANS TO ENSURE MODES OF OUT REACH ARE BEING UTILIZED IN ORDER TO REACH THE TARGETED POPULATION.

AUSTIN PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT (APHD)

THE AUSTIN/TRAVIS COUNTY HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT MISSION IS TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT THE HEALTH OF OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH THE USE AND BEST PRACTICES AND COMMUNITY COLLABORATIONS.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECTS ALIGN WITH THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA OF  HEALTHY FUTURES (OBESITY AND FOOD, ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE).  WE PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNINSURED, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED, OR LIVING IN RURAL AREAS UTILIZING PREVENTATIVE AND PRIMARY HEALTH CARE SERVICES AND PROGRAMS. FOUR VISTA MEMBERS WILL WORK IN THE FOLLOWING HHS AREAS: COMMUNICABLE DISEASES PROGRAM, CHA CHIP PROGRAM, DIGITAL SIGNAGE/WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, AND 1115 WAIVER PROJECT. THESE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT THE ABOVE PROJECTS OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR.

THE MISSION OF THE CITY OF SAN ANTONIO IS TO DELIVER QUALITY HUMAN SERVICES WHILE ACHIEVING SAN ANTONIO'S VISION OF PROSPERITY FOR OUR DIVERSE, VIBRANT AND HISTORIC COMMUNITY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT CONTINUATION APPLICATION ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES. VISTA PROJECT CONTINUATION WILL ASSIST IN STRENGTHENING ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY AND INCREASING COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN PROGRAMS FOCUSED ON ANTI-POVERTY EFFORTS WITHIN THE DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES (FAITH-BASED INITIATIVE AND HEAD START), SAN ANTONIO METROPOLITAN HEALTH DISTRICT, THE CITY'S OFFICE OF IMMIGRATION, PRE-K 4 SA, MY BROTHER'S KEEPER SAN ANTONIO, AND THE CITY'S INTERDEPARTMENTAL RE-ENGAGEMENT CENTER INITIATIVE DESIGNED TO RECONNECT YOUTH WHO ARE NOT EMPLOYED OR IN SCHOOL.  IT IS EXPECTED THAT OVER 4,000 SAN ANTONIO RESIDENTS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CONTRIBUTIONS OFFERED BY THE TEN VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER IN THE AREAS OF: 1) INCREASING OUTREACH TO CLIENTS, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND/OR FUNDERS; 2) BUILDING NEW, SUSTAINABLE PROGRAM INFRASTRUCTURE, AND/OR; 3) INCREASING CAPACITY OF EXISTING CITY PROGRAMMING OVER THE NEXT YEAR.

THE MISSION OF THE SOCIAL MEDIA WORKGROUP (SMW) IS TO PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE TO STUDENTS WORKING IN DIGITAL MEDIA, TECHNOLOGY AND SUSTAINABILITY THROUGH THE DESIGN AND CREATION OF PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT AND ENACT POSITIVE SOCIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE.  FACULTY, EXCEPTIONAL UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS, COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND OUTSIDE EXPERTS WORK IN INTERDISCIPLINARY COLLABORATIVE TEAMS TO DESIGN AND DEVELOP A WIDE VARIETY OF MEDIA TOOLS, ASSETS AND EVENTS FOR VARIOUS AUDIENCES. THROUGH THIS PRACTICE-BASED RESEARCH, THE GROUP AIMS TO INVESTIGATE AND ANALYZE THE SOCIAL AND ECOLOGICAL IMPACTS OF MEDIA TECHNOLOGIES NOW AND IN THE FUTURE.  

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT CONTINUATION ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA AND SEEKS TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR THE SMW TO SUPPORT MORE STUDENTS, TO HELP EMPLOY AND EDUCATE THEM ALONG WITH EMERGING PROFESSIONALS, YOUTH, PARENTS AND OTHER COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGHOUT THE STATE IN STEAM (STEM + ART) FIELDS.  BASED ON OUR PREVIOUS TRACK RECORD, FOR THIS YEAR WE EXPECT TO INCREASE OUR CAPACITY TO BENEFIT 200-400 UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS, 100 EMERGING PROFESSIONALS AND TO IMPACT OVER 2500 COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND YOUTH.  

OVER THE COURSE OF THIS YEAR, WE WOULD LIKE TO PROPOSE A CONTINUING TOTAL OF 14 VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WHO WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES INCLUDING COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT OF SMW AND COLLABORATIVE STEAM PROGRAMS, COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT, EXPANDING AND STRENGTHENING PARTNERSHIPS AND NETWORKS, CONTINUING TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT FUNDRAISING PLANS, AND DEVELOPING OUR SOCIAL MEDIA TOOLS AND OTHER CAPACITY BUILDING TECHNOLOGIES. IN ADDITION TO SUPPORTING THE WRITING AND SUBMISSION OF GRANTS AND OTHER FUNDING PROPOSALS, AND OUR LONG-TERM GOAL IS FOR VISTA MEMBERS TO WORK TOWARDS LAUNCHING A CAMPAIGN FOR AN SMW ENDOWMENT THAT WILL HELP SUSTAIN FUTURE COMMUNITY ANTIPOVERTY STEAM EDUCATION PROJECTS IN THE STATE IN THE LONG-TERM BY FUNDING AT LEAST ONE GRADUATE STUDENT RESEARCHER OR POST-DOCTORAL FELLOW.

THE UNIFIED GOVERNMENT HAS MADE A COMMITMENT TO CIVIC INNOVATION, JOB CREATION AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, AND THE HEALTH OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY RESIDENTS. THE UNIFIED GOVERNMENT VISTA PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, WHICH AUGMENT LOCAL INITIATIVES AND SUPPORTS THREE CNCS STRATEGIC PLAN FOCUS AREAS: HEALTHY FUTURES, EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE UNIFIED GOVERNMENT VISTA PROJECT WILL UTILIZE 15 AMERICORPS VISTA MEMBERS, AND 1 VISTA LEADER. FOUR VISTAS AND THE VISTA LEADER WILL WORK WITH THE HEALTHY COMMUNITIES WYANDOTTE (HCW) INITIATIVE, AND ONE WILL WORK WITHIN THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT. TWO MEMBERS WILL SUPPORT A UNIFIED GOVERNMENT INITIATIVE CALLED THE STABILIZATION OCCUPATION AND REVITALIZATION (SOAR) PROJECT. TWO VISTAS WILL WORK IN THE UNIFIED GOVERNMENT'S KNOWLEDGE DEPARTMENT CONNECTING COMMUNITY INITIATIVES TO DATA ANALYSIS. FIVE STANDARD VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE PLACED WITH PARTNER AGENCIES THAT ARE IMPLEMENTING STRATEGIES FOR THE COMMUNITY HEALTH IMPROVEMENT PLAN. THE FINAL VISTA WILL SUPPORT THE MAYOR'S OFFICE FROM OUR NEIGHBORHOODS UP INITIATIVE THAT FOCUSES ON IMPROVING QUALITY OF LIFE AND PROPERTY VALUES IN NEIGHBORHOODS ACROSS THE COUNTY. WE EXPECT THESE EFFORTS WILL BENEFIT THE 24.4% OF OUR COUNTY'S POPULATION WHO LIVE BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL WHICH IS APPROXIMATELY 40,000 RESIDENTS. THESE VISTA MEMBERS WILL PERFORM CAPACITY-BUILDING ACTIVITIES LIKE EVENT MANAGEMENT, VOLUNTEER TRAINING, PUBLIC EDUCATION, PROMOTIONAL MATERIAL DEVELOPMENT, GRANT WRITING AND MANAGEMENT, PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT, COMMUNITY OUTREACH, PARTNER ENGAGEMENT AND DATABASE MANAGEMENT. THE RESULT WILL BE INCREASED ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD, INCREASED ACCESS TO PRIMARY AND PREVENTATIVE HEALTH CARE, REDUCED USE OF TOBACCO, REDUCED UNINTENTIONAL INJURIES, AND AN INCREASED ABILITY FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE TO TRANSITION INTO OR REMAIN IN SAFE, HEALTHY, AFFORDABLE HOUSING.

THE METROPOLITAN DENVER HOMELESS INITIATIVE (MDHI) SERVES AS CONTINUUM OF CARE (COC) FOR THE SEVEN COUNTY METROPOLITAN DENVER REGION. MDHI WORKS CLOSELY WITH EACH COUNTY IN THE CONTINUUM TO ENSURE THAT STAKEHOLDERS HAVE THE RESOURCES AND SUPPORT NEEDED TO EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS HOMELESSNESS. MDHI PROPOSES TO CONTINUE LEADING THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT FOCUSED ON BUILDING CAPACITY BOTH WITHIN THE SPECIFIC COUNTIES AND REGIONALLY, TO PARTNER WITH THE ONEHOME HOUSING ASSISTANCE SYSTEM (PREVIOUSLY COORDINATED ASSESSMENT AND HOUSING PLACEMENT SYSTEM OR CAHPS)) THAT STREAMLINES ACCESS TO HOUSING FOR THOSE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS. THE PROJECT ENGAGES STAKEHOLDERS, INVESTORS AND THOSE IN NEED TO BUILD A SUSTAINABLE SYSTEM THAT WILL REDUCE AND PREVENT HOMELESSNESS IN THE DENVER METROPOLITAN AREA.

OUR PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY WITH OBJECTIVES FOCUSED ON HOUSING. OUR PROJECT SERVES INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES AT-RISK OF OR EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS IN THE SEVEN COUNTY METROPOLITAN DENVER REGION.

ACCORDING TO THE 2017 POINT-IN-TIME SURVEY ON MONDAY, JANUARY 30, 2017 THERE WERE 5,116 HOMELESS MEN, WOMEN AND CHILDREN COUNTED IN THE SEVEN COUNTY METRO DENVER AREA. THIS NUMBER INCLUDES PERSONS WHO FILLED OUT A SURVEY AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS, AS WELL AS INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILY MEMBERS STAYING IN TRANSITIONAL HOUSING PROGRAMS THAT PARTICIPATE IN THE HOMELESS MANAGEMENT INFORMATION SYSTEM (HMIS). THE POINT-IN-TIME PROVIDES A SNAPSHOT OF THOSE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS ON ONE NIGHT OF THE YEAR, AND WE KNOW IT TO BE AN UNDERCOUNT DUE TO THE DIFFICULTIES OF ENUMERATING THOSE LIVING UNSHELTERED IN OUR COMMUNITY.
2,014 VI-SPDAT ASSESSMENTS WERE COMPLETED IN 2017 FOR INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND YOUTH EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS. ALSO, IN 2017: 105 CHRONICALLY HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS, 526 VETERANS, 26 FAMILIES AND 35 YOUTH WERE HOUSED THROUGH THE ONEHOME HOUSING ASSISTANCE SYSTEM. IN TOTAL, 1,787INDIVIDUALS HAVE BEEN HOUSED THROUGH THE HOUSING ASSISTANCE SYSTEM.

SOLAR ENERGY INTERNATIONAL IS A 501(C)3 NON-PROFIT EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION WITH A MISSION TO PROVIDE INDUSTRY-LEADING TECHNICAL TRAINING AND EXPERTISE IN RENEWABLE ENERGY TO EMPOWER PEOPLE, COMMUNITIES, AND BUSINESSES WORLDWIDE. 

IN THE WAKE OF THE COAL MINE CLOSURES IN WESTERN COLORADO AND THE BOOMING SOLAR INDUSTRY ECONOMY, OUR PLAN IS TO CONTINUE TO HELP TRANSITION THE ECONOMY OF THE STATE OF COLORADO TO A MORE RESILIENT COMMUNITY AND DRIVE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT THROUGH SOLAR BY:

1.) INCREASE AWARENESS OF CAREERS AVAILABLE AND TRAINING NEEDED TO ENTER THE SOLAR INDUSTRY.
2.) FOCUS MARKETING AND OUTREACH EFFORTS TO INCLUDE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES OF SPANISH SPEAKERS, WOMEN, VETERANS, NATIVE AMERICANS, AND UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS TO PROVIDE CONNECTIONS TO CAREER RESOURCES, CAREER COUNSELING, AND TRAINING.  
3.) CAPTURE NARRATIVES OF EXISTING SEI STUDENTS AND ALUMNI TO TELL THE STORIES OF ADVANCEMENT AND SUCCESS IN THE SOLAR INDUSTRY FOR TARGETED POPULATIONS OF PEOPLE.

WE ARE REQUESTING TWO VISTAS PER YEAR FOR THE NEXT 3 YEARS.

SINCE 2004, HISPANIC COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. (HCSI) HAS PLAYED AN ESSENTIAL ROLE IN HELPING HISPANICS TO ASSIMILATE AND CONTRIBUTE TO COMMUNITIES IN NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. VISTA FACILITATES THIS ROLE BY EXPANDING HCSI'S CAPACITY TO SERVE AND SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS FROM LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS BY IMPROVING THEIR ACCESS TO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES. VISTA MEMBERS ARE CRUCIAL IN MAINTAINING A FUNDING STREAM FOR HCSI'S PROGRAMS AND SERVICES BY PREPARING COMPREHENSIVE FUNDRAISING PLANS, RESEARCHING AND WRITING FOR GRANT PROPOSALS, ASSISTING WITH FUNDRAISING AND MARKETING TASKS, AND DEVELOPING A GREATER VARIETY OF IMPACTFUL SERVICES AND PROGRAMS FOR THE COMMUNITY.  IN 2017, HCSI WILL BE TRANSITIONING ALL OPERATIONS TO A NEW, LARGER FACILITY BY EARLY FALL, AND THE TOTAL NUMBER OF CLIENTS SERVED AT THE NEW HISPANIC CENTER BY THE END OF 2018 IS CURRENTLY PROJECTED TO BE APPROXIMATELY 10,552. THE SUPPORT OF VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE INDISPENSABLE DURING THIS TIME AS MORE OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT WITH THE COMMUNITY BECOME ATTAINABLE AS GOALS FOR HCSI AND ALSO HIGHLY NECESSARY TO ITS LONG-TERM GROWTH AND SUSTAINABILITY. VISTAS WILL NOT ONLY PLAN WAYS TO STRENGTHEN THE RESOURCES AT HCSI'S DISPOSAL, BUT ALSO LEARN ABOUT THE PEOPLE IN THE COMMUNITY THEY WILL SERVE AND THE NEEDS THAT THEY WILL HELP MEET. ALSO, VISTAS WILL COMMUNICATE AND COOPERATE CLOSELY WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS IN THE COMMUNITY TO COLLECTIVELY PROVIDE BETTER SERVICES AND IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE.

THE CITY OF JONESBORO IS REQUESTING A 12 MONTH EXTENSION ON THE PARTNERSHIP WITH THE 2019-2020 VISTA PROGRAM TO ASSIST THE CITY IN INCREASING THE NUMBER OF PARTICIPATES IN THE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT BLOCK GRANT REHABILITATION AND FIRST TIME HOME OWNER PROGRAMS FOR LOW TO MODERATE INCOME RESIDENTS. PROGRAM WILL ALSO REACHING OUT TO NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE CLIENT BASE IS LOW INCOME AND MARGINALIZED RESIDENTS THAT CAN BENEFIT FROM THE CITIES PROGRAMS.  THE CITY OF JONESBORO IS DEVELOPING A CENTRALIZED RESOURCE AREA THAT NON PROFITS AND VOLUNTEERS CAN SEEK OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN THE CITY. VISTAS ASSIST IN RECRUITING COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT BLOCK GRANT GRANT PARTICIPANTS AND RETAINING CONTRACTORS FOR THESE PROGRAMS. THE PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE YEAR AFTER YEAR AND WITHOUT THE RESOURCES AND OUTREACH EFFORTS OF THE VISTA IT WILL NOT BE SUCCESSFUL.

THE NORTH ALABAMA AGRIPLEX, WHICH WORKS TO PROMOTE NORTH ALABAMA'S AGRICULTURE HERITAGE AND FUTURE, CREATED THE FOOD FOR LIFE PROGRAM WHICH PROMOTES HEALTHY FOOD ACCESS AND SUPPLEMENTS SCIENCE EDUCATION IN CULLMAN COUNTY, ALABAMA AND SURROUNDING AREAS. THESE GOALS, WHICH ALIGN WITH THE CNCS HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA, ARE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH DIRECTLY CONNECTING PEOPLE WITH LOCAL SOURCES OF FRESH PRODUCE AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS TARGETING CHILDREN AND ADULTS IN THE COMMUNITY. CULLMAN LIKE MANY RURAL AREAS IN ALABAMA HAS HIGH RATES OF CHILDHOOD AND ADULT OBESITY AMONG IMPOVERISHED GROUPS. CULLMAN ALSO HAS A SUCCESSFUL AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRY WITH MANY DIFFERENT TYPES OF CROPS AND LIVESTOCK PRODUCED LOCALLY. THE COMBINATION OF THESE TWO ELEMENTS MAKES CULLMAN UNIQUELY SUITED FOR A PROGRAM LIKE FOOD FOR LIFE THAT PROMOTES NUTRITIOUS AND LOCAL FOOD CHOICES AMONG THE COMMUNITY. 

FOOD FOR LIFE UTILIZES SEVEN AMERICORPS VISTAS TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING, CROP GLEANING AND FARMERS MARKET COORDINATION, GRANT WRITING, AND OTHER SERVICES TO HELP IMPROVE THE HEALTH OUTCOMES IN CULLMAN COUNTY AND SURROUNDING AREAS.

UAB SERVICE LEARNING CONNECTS UAB STUDENTS, FACULTY, AND COMMUNITY NONPROFIT PARTNERS TOGETHER TO ENRICH STUDENT ACADEMIC LEARNING, PROMOTE CIVIC ENGAGEMENT AND TO STRENGTHEN AND SUPPORT OUR LOCAL AND GLOBAL COMMUNITIES.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS PRIMARILY WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL DEVELOP PROJECTS DESIGNED TO INCREASE UAB STUDENT AND FACULTY INVOLVEMENT IN EDUCATION, HEALTH, AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY INITIATIVES IN COLLABORATION WITH COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND THE BIRMINGHAM CITY SCHOOLS.  THE VISTA PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT MORE THAN 900 INDIVIDUALS IN THE COMING, PRIMARILY LOW-INCOME K-12 STUDENTS.  FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS INCREASING UAB STUDENT INVOLVEMENT WITHIN BIRMINGHAM SCHOOLS AS WELL AS COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND ESTABLISHING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN UAB FACULTY AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO CREATE AND STRENGTHEN PROJECTS DESIGNED TO ADDRESS EDUCATION ISSUES (INCLUDING STEM EDUCATION), ESPECIALLY THROUGH THE BIRMINGHAM CITY SCHOOL SYSTEM.  THESE ACTIVITIES WILL TAKE PLACE OVER THE COURSE OF A THREE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD.

THE AMERICAN RED CROSS COLORADO-WYOMING REGION HAS DESIGNED A PROJECT WITH THE OVERALL GOAL OF MAKING THE STATES OF COLORADO AND WYOMING THE MOST DISASTER-PREPARED STATES IN THE NATION. 

ACCORDING TO DATA FROM THE UNITED STATES CENSUS BUREAU, MANY OF THE RESIDENTS IN OUR TWO-STATE REGION ARE LIVING IN RURAL AREAS, WITH LIMITED ACCESS TO EMERGENCY RESPONSE SERVICES, EVACUATION ROUTES, AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES TO SUPPORT THEM WHEN DISASTER STRIKES. IN ADDITION, MANY OF THESE RURAL COMMUNITIES ARE ALSO LIVING IN POVERTY.  WHEN THESE ISOLATED AND ECONOMICALLY-DEPRESSED COMMUNITIES ARE AFFECTED BY DISASTER, THEIR RESILIENCY LEVELS ARE SIGNIFICANTLY LOWER THAN COMMUNITIES IN WHICH SUPPORT SERVICES ARE READILY AVAILABLE.  MANY HOUSEHOLDS DO NOT HAVE THE RESOURCES TO BOUNCE BACK FOLLOWING A DISASTER ? THE RESULTING HOME REPAIRS & LOST WAGES DUE TO TIME AWAY FROM WORK ALONE ARE DAUNTING FOR MANY OF OUR NEIGHBORS. 

THE GOAL OF OUR PROGRAM IS TO REDUCE POVERTY BY INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF LOCAL COMMUNITIES TO RESPOND AND RECOVER EFFECTIVELY WHEN AFFECTED BY DISASTERS. WE DO SO BY FOCUSING ON PREPAREDNESS ACTIVITIES. INCREASING COMMUNITY RESILIENCE AND A COMMUNITY?S ABILITY TO BOUNCE-BACK AFTER A DISASTER?RATHER THAN REMAIN IN RECOVERY MODE-- LEADS TO FEWER HOUSEHOLDS RELYING ON GOVERNMENT ASSISTANCE OR OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES POST-DISASTER.  THE OLD ADAGE OF AN OUNCE OF PREVENTION IS TRULY APPLICABLE WHEN IT COMES TO DISASTER PREPAREDNESS.

ACTIVITIES OF THE REQUESTED VISTAS MAY INCLUDE: 
●	IDENTIFY LOCAL LEADERS WHO COULD SUPPORT PREPAREDNESS WORK IN THE COMMUNITY WITH AN EYE TO BUILDING AN ONGOING, SUSTAINABLE PROGRAM FOR THAT COMMUNITY
●	TRAIN LOCAL VOLUNTEERS TO DELIVER INFORMATION ON PERSONAL, HOUSEHOLD, YOUTH, AND BUSINESS PREPAREDNESS
●	WORK CLOSELY WITH THE RED CROSS DISASTER CYCLE SERVICES TEAM AND LOCAL DISASTER PROGRAM MANAGER TO IDENTIFY THE PREPAREDNESS NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. 
●	COLLABORATE WITH THE REGIONAL COMMUNITY PREPAREDNESS AND RESILIENCY SERVICES TEAM TO DEVELOP PREPAREDNESS TRAININGS AND PROGRAMS FOR USE AT THE LOCAL LEVEL
●	ENGAGE THE WHOLE COMMUNITY IN PREPAREDNESS ACTIVITIES AND PROJECTS INCLUDING EDUCATION (BOTH IN THE CLASSROOM AND DURING OUT-OF-SCHOOL-TIME ACTIVITIES), DISASTER SERVICES INITIATIVES, AND HEALTHY AND SUSTAINABLE PATHWAYS TO DISASTER READINESS 
●	DEVELOP AND CULTIVATE RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS AND WORK TO STANDARDIZE THE PREPAREDNESS MESSAGING IN THE COMMUNITY

THE IDAHO CHILDREN?S TRUST FUND (ICTF), ESTABLISHED BY THE IDAHO LEGISLATURE IN 1985 TO PROVIDE FUNDING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND COORDINATION FOR EFFORTS DESIGNED TO PREVENT CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT, HAS BEEN DESIGNATED BY THE GOVERNOR OF THE STATE OF IDAHO TO BE LEAD AGENCY RESPONSIBLE TO ADMINISTER THE COMMUNITY-BASED GRANTS FOR THE PREVENTION OF CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT BY THE ADMINISTRATION FOR   CHILDREN AND FAMILIES.  THE ICTF IS ALSO THE STATE AFFILIATE OF PREVENT CHILD ABUSE AMERICA.  ICTF SEES ITSELF AS THE CONNECTIVE TISSUE BETWEEN THE PEOPLE AND GROUPS WORKING TO PREVENT CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT IN IDAHO.  A TEN-MEMBER INTERDISCIPLINARY BOARD, APPOINTED BY THE GOVERNOR, OVERSEES THE CHILDREN?S TRUST FUND ACTIVITIES, IN CONCERT WITH THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.

ICTF EXERCISES ITS LEADERSHIP IN PREVENTION OF CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT IN IDAHO THROUGH
PROVIDING FUNDING
PROVIDING TEACHING, TRAINING, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
CONVENING TO BUILD A STRONG PREVENTION NETWORK
BUILDING STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY BASED, PUBLIC, PRIVATE AND SYSTEMIC ORGANIZATIONS  
ENHANCING COMMUNICATION/NETWORKING INFRASTRUCTURE
ACTIVELY ENGAGING IN NATIONAL PREVENTION EFFORTS
GOVERNANCE AND AN ABILITY TO PROVIDE OVERSIGHT

ICTF ACTS AS A CATALYST FOR COMMUNITY BASED PREVENTION EFFORTS BY CHALLENGING PRACTITIONERS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES THAT BUILD PROTECTIVE FACTORS TO STRENGTHEN FAMILIES SO THAT PREVENTION OF CHILD ABUSE BECOMES THE NORM.    IT INTEGRATED STRENGTHENING FAMILIES AND PREVENTION STRATEGIES INTO A WIDE RANGE OF ORGANIZATIONS, AGENCIES AND OTHER ENTITIES AT THE COMMUNITY LEVEL; HELPING THEM BUILD PROTECTIVE FACTORS INTO THEIR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT SYSTEMS AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH PLANS ICTF STRIVES TO STRENGTHEN IDAHO FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES BY INCREASING KNOWLEDGE OF AND BUILDING PROTECTIVE FACTORS WITHIN ALL SYSTEMS THAT TOUCH THE LIVES OF FAMILIES AND CHILDREN:  PARENTAL RESILIENCY; SOCIAL CONNECTIONS; KNOWLEDGE OF PARENTING AND CHILD DEVELOPMENT; CONCRETE SUPPORTS IN TIMES OF NEED; AND SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF CHILDREN. ICTF WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT COMMUNITIES IN BUILDING THEIR CAPACITY TO PLAN, DEVELOP, AND IMPLEMENT OUTCOME-BASED NETWORKS OF COORDINATED SERVICES BY PROVIDING GRANT AWARDS, LEADERSHIP, TRAINING, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON BEST PRACTICES AND EVALUATION.  ICTF?S LEADERSHIP ROLE IS ABOUT BUILDING PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATIONS THAT WILL ULTIMATELY CREATE FAMILY AND COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTS WHERE ALL CHILDREN CAN THRIVE.  ICTF?S WORK IS ROOTED IN THE PROTECTIVE FACTORS FRAMEWORK.

CHILDREN WHO ARE ABUSED AND NEGLECTED OFTEN EXPERIENCE PROBLEMS LATER IN LIFE INVOLVING JUVENILE AND ADULT CRIME, POOR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, DRUG AND ALCOHOL ABUSE, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, TEEN PREGNANCY, POOR PHYSICAL HEALTH, AND SUICIDE. THE EFFECTS OF CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT ARE WIDE AND FAR-REACHING.
PREVENTING ABUSE AND NEGLECT IS CRITICAL TO MINIMIZING THE COSTS OF LONG TERM INTERVENTION FOR CRIME, CORRECTIONS, TRUANCY, HOSPITALIZATION, SPECIAL EDUCATION, PHYSICAL HEALTH CARE, AND MENTAL HEALTH CARE.  CHILD SEXUAL ABUSE IS ONE OF THE MOST SIGNIFICANT RISKS FACING CHILDREN TODAY. ONE IN TEN CHILDREN WILL BE A VICTIM OF SEXUAL ABUSE, AND THE CONSEQUENCES OF THIS ABUSE CAN BE DEVASTATING AND LIFELONG.  RESEARCH DEMONSTRATES THAT CHILDREN WHO ARE SEXUALLY ABUSED PERFORM AT FAR LOWER LEVELS THAN THEIR NON-ABUSED COUNTERPARTS. COGNITIVE ABILITY, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND MEMORY ARE LOWER AMONG SEXUALLY ABUSED CHILDREN (FRIEDRICH, ET AL., 1994; SADEH, ET AL., 1994; TRICKETT, ET AL., 1994; WELLS, ET AL., 1997).

SEXUALLY ABUSED CHILDREN HAVE HIGHER RATES OF ABSENTEEISM (LEITER, ET AL., 1997), GRADE RETENTION (REYOME, 1994), AND SPECIAL EDUCATION SERVICES (REYOME, 1994). IN A STUDY OF SEXUALLY ABUSED 7-12 YEAR-OLD GIRLS, 39% DISPLAYED ACADEMIC DIFFICULTIES, 24% HAD REPEATED A GRADE, 15% WERE ENROLLED IN A REMEDIAL CLASS, 48% REPORTED BELOW AVERAGE GRADES, AND OVER 37% DISPLAYED COGNITIVE ABILITY

THE MISSION OF THE YOUTH POLICY INSTITUTE (YPI) IS TO TRANSFORM LOS ANGELES NEIGHBORHOODS USING A HOLISTIC APPROACH TO REDUCE POVERTY BY ENSURING FAMILIES HAVE ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY SCHOOLS, WRAPAROUND EDUCATION AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, ENABLING A SUCCESSFUL TRANSITION FROM CRADLE TO COLLEGE AND CAREER. YPI IS THE LEAD IMPLEMENTATION PARTNER TO THE CITY OF LA'S PROMISE ZONE INITIATIVE, WHICH AIMS TO TRANSFORM DISTRESSED COMMUNITIES IN CENTRAL LOS ANGELES BY IMPROVING EDUCATION AND SAFETY, INCREASING ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, CREATING JOBS, AND PRESERVING HOUSING AFFORDABILITY. THE PROMISE ZONE PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AS IT IS A COMPREHENSIVE NEIGHBORHOOD REVITALIZATION INITIATIVE COVERING THE TWO CNCS OBJECTIVES IN THIS PRIORITY: HOUSING AND EMPLOYMENT/WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT. THE YEAR 6 GOALS OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT ARE TO 1) STRENGTHEN STRATEGIC PLANNING AND BUILD CAPACITY IN LAPZ PARTNERS; 2) INCREASE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT IN THE LAPZ; AND 3) ALIGN LAPZ EVALUATION ACTIVITIES. THE PROMISE ZONE WILL BENEFIT THE ZONE'S 165,000 RESIDENTS, WHO WILL BE MORE ENGAGED IN THEIR LOCAL NEIGHBORHOOD AND CONNECTED TO EDUCATIONAL AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES. YPI REQUESTS FOUR VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER, WHO WILL BUILD CAPACITY BY ALIGNING IMPLEMENTATION OF THE STRATEGIC PLAN; ENHANCING AND SHARING DATA AND ASSESSMENTS; SUPPORTING GOVERNANCE OF THE INITIATIVE; AND IMPROVING COLLABORATION FOR SERVICE DELIVERY OVER A 12 MONTH PERIOD.

ASIAN AMERICANS ADVANCING JUSTICE-CHICAGO (ADVANCING JUSTICE-CHICAGO) HAS A MISSION TO EMPOWER THE ASIAN AMERICAN COMMUNITY THROUGH ADVOCACY, EDUCATION, RESEARCH, AND COALITION-BUILDING. ADVANCING JUSTICE-CHICAGO LEADS THE PAN-ASIAN VOTER EMPOWERMENT (PAVE) COALITION, A COALITION OF 14 ORGANIZATIONS THAT SERVE AND COMBINE ADVOCACY EFFORTS ACROSS DIVERSE ASIAN AMERICAN AND PACIFIC ISLANDER COMMUNITIES IN THE METRO CHICAGO AND GREATER CHICAGOLAND AREA. EIGHT PAVE COALITION MEMBERS ARE PART OF THIS VISTA PROJECT APPLICATION ALONG WITH 3 ASIAN AMERICAN COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS THAT MAY BECOME A PART OF THE PAVE COALITION. THE PROPOSED PAVE COALITION VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO A) EXPAND THE BASE OF VOLUNTEERS WITHIN AT LEAST 4 MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS; B) INSPIRE A SPIRIT OF VOLUNTEERISM WITHIN THE GREATER ASIAN AMERICAN COMMUNITY; C) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUAL DONORS THROUGH RECRUITMENT AND CONVERSION OF VOLUNTEERS INTO DONORS, WITHIN AT LEAST 5 MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS; D) DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN CONSISTENT TRACKING SYSTEMS FOR THE MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS; E) INCREASE COMMUNITY OUTREACH EFFORTS WITHIN AT LEAST 5 MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, SUCH THAT THERE IS AN INCREASE OF CONSTITUENTS WHO UTILIZE ORGANIZATIONAL SERVICES THAT ALLEVIATE POVERTY; AND F) DEVELOP SHARED COMMUNITY OUTREACH STRUCTURES WITHIN 10 MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, INCLUDING SUPPORTING MATERIALS AND RESOURCES THAT ENHANCE THE EFFECTIVE UTILIZATION OF THESE CREATED OUTREACH STRUCTURES.  THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 22,000 INDIVIDUALS AND 6,900 FAMILIES. TWELVE (12) VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING A JOINT VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT STRATEGY, DEVELOPING AN OUTREACH PLAN, AND RECRUITING A FUNDRAISING COMMITTEE, OVER THE COURSE OF THIS PROJECT.

THE WEST PHILADELPHIA PROMISE ZONE INITIATIVE IS A FEDERALLY-DESIGNATED, PLACE-BASED EFFORT TO ASSIST A TWO SQUARE MILE AREA OF PHILADELPHIA WHERE RESIDENTS EXPERIENCE HIGH LEVELS OF POVERTY. THE MAYOR'S OFFICE OF COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT AND OPPORTUNITY (CEO) LEADS A COLLECTIVE IMPACT MODEL TO COORDINATE THE EFFORTS OF ROUGHLY 100 PARTNERS, WHICH INCLUDE NEIGHBORHOOD GROUPS, CITY AGENCIES, NON-PROFIT SERVICE PROVIDERS, AND ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS. THESE PARTNERS COLLABORATE IN COMMITTEES THAT ADVANCE STRATEGIES IN ONE OF SIX AREAS: WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTH AND WELLNESS, EDUCATION, PUBLIC SAFETY, AND HOUSING. THE AMERICORPS VISTAS ASSIGNED TO THE WEST PHILADELPHIA PROMISE ZONE STAFF THESE COMMITTEES, BUILDING AND IMPROVING SYSTEMS FOR CROSS-ORGANIZATIONAL COMMUNICATION, COLLABORATION, DATA SHARING, AND RESIDENT ENGAGEMENT. FOR THE PAST THREE YEARS, VISTAS HAVE BUILT, MONITORED, AND IMPROVED THE ORGANIZATIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE THAT IS NEEDED TO APPROACH A PAN-DISCIPLINARY PROBLEM LIKE POVERTY, AND IDENTIFY SPECIFIC PRIORITIES WHICH CAN BE IMPLEMENTED.  WHILE SOME OF THIS WORK WILL CONTINUE IN FUTURE YEARS, VISTAS WILL BEGIN PLAYING A STRONGER ROLE IN ENSURING THE ORGANIZATIONAL SYSTEMS THAT ARE USED ARE SUSTAINABLE. THIS WILL ENTAIL ?RIGHT-SIZING? SOME OF THE SYSTEMS THAT HAVE BEEN BUILT IN A MANNER THAT ENABLES THEIR TRANSFER TO OTHER PARTNERS INVOLVED IN THE PROMISE ZONE INITIATIVE. WHILE CEO WILL CONTINUE TO PLAY ITS ROLE AS LEAD AGENCY, THE LONGEVITY OF THIS WORK WILL REQUIRE INCREASING OWNERSHIP BY IMPLEMENTATION PARTNERS. VISTAS WILL, STARTING IN 2017, HELP TO FACILITATE THIS SHARED OWNERSHIP. 

2. HOW MANY VISTAS AND LEADERS ARE YOU REQUESTING?
 
WE ARE REQUESTING 5 VISTAS.  
 
3. WHAT IS THE ESTIMATE LENGTH OF TIME REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THIS PROJECT?
 
THE DESIGNATION IS INTENDED TO LAST THROUGH 2024. THE WORK THAT VISTAS WILL PROVIDE IN HELPING TO ENSURE THE LONGEVITY OF THE COLLABORATIVE WORK OF THE PROMISE ZONE WILL TAKE TWO TO THREE YEARS. 
 
4. BRIEFLY DESCRIBE YOUR ORGANIZATION'S MISSION, HISTORY, AND THE BENEFICIARIES OF YOUR ORGANIZATION'S PROGRAMS.

OUR CITY'S POVERTY RATE NOW STANDS AT 26.4%, AND THOSE IN POVERTY INCLUDE 39% OF OUR CHILDREN, AND 17% OF OUR SENIORS. THE POVERTY RATE FOR AFRICAN-AMERICANS, HISPANICS, DISABLED PHILADELPHIANS AND FEMALE-HEADED HOUSEHOLDS HOVERS AROUND 40% OR GREATER.  

MAYOR MICHAEL NUTTER RECOGNIZED THAT THE SCALE OF POVERTY IN PHILADELPHIA REQUIRES COLLECTIVE ACTION OF AN EQUAL SCALE. THERE IS NO SINGLE CAUSE OF POVERTY, SO MYRIAD CITY AGENCIES AND NONPROFITS WORKING IN SILOS COULD HOPE ONLY TO HAVE ISOLATED IMPACT ON A PARTICULAR ISSUE OR SEGMENT OF THE POPULATION AFFECTED BY POVERTY. TRULY EFFECTIVE SOLUTIONS REQUIRE COORDINATED, LARGE-SCALE SOCIAL CHANGE.  THAT IS WHY, IN JANUARY 2013, HE LAUNCHED THE MAYOR'S OFFICE OF COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT AND OPPORTUNITY (CEO).  MAYOR JIM KENNEY CONTINUES TO SUPPORT THE WORK OF CEO, HAVING TAKEN OFFICE IN 2016. MAYOR KENNEY AND MANAGING DIRECTOR MICHAEL DIBERNADINIS ESTABLISHED THE HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES CABINET, WHICH INCLUDES CEO AND THE CITY?S DEPARTMENTS OF PUBLIC HEALTH, COMMUNITY AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, HOMELESS SERVICES, AND HUMAN SERVICES.

CEO'S MISSION:  
ALIGN THE CITY'S EFFORTS TO LIFT INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES OUT OF POVERTY AND INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES.  
AS PHILADELPHIA'S COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, CEO IS WELL-POSITIONED TO BE A CATALYST AND SERVE AS THE SUPPORTIVE INFRASTRUCTURE TO THE CITY'S CROSS-SECTOR EFFORTS TO FIGHT POVERTY.

VITAL VILLAGE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT NETWORK'S MISSION IS TO MAXIMIZE CHILD, FAMILY AND COMMUNITY WELL-BEING BY CULTIVATING COMMUNITY RESIDENT AND ORGANIZATION COLLABORATION USING A COLLECTIVE IMPACT FRAMEWORK.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNED WITH THE HEALTH, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, AND COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO MOBILIZE COLLECTIVE INVESTMENT FROM RESIDENTS, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, AND INSTITUTIONS TO SEED SCALABLE AND SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY CHANGE TO PROMOTE HEALTHY SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN EARLY CHILDHOOD, PREVENT ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES, AND CULTIVATE RESILIENT COMMUNITIES ACROSS THREE BOSTON NEIGHBORHOODS.  WE DEFINE CHILD WELL-BEING AS A STATE WHEREIN A CHILD'S PHYSICAL, COGNITIVE, EMOTIONAL, BEHAVIORAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL FUNCTIONING IS HEALTHY AND ALLOWS THEM TO DEVELOP SKILLS AND CAPACITIES. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS (1) SUPPORTING TWO-GENERATION STRATEGIES FOR PARENTS AND CHILDREN BY COORDINATING AND EVALUATING TRAINING AND COMMUNITY LEADERSHIP OPPORTUNITIES, (2) SUSTAINING AND GROWING NETWORK MEMBER INVOLVEMENT TO ADVANCE COLLECTIVE ACTIONS; (3) SUPPORTING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A COMMUNITY DATA DASHBOARD THAT SERVES AS A CATALYST FOR COMMUNITY ACTION, AND (4) AMPLIFYING COMMUNITY-STRENGTHS AND NETWORK ACTIVITIES THROUGH DIGITAL AND TRADITIONAL MEDIA.

VITAL VILLAGE IS A PLACE-BASED, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT NETWORK OF RESIDENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS COMMITTED TO MAXIMIZING CHILD, FAMILY, AND COMMUNITY WELL-BEING.  THE VITAL VILLAGE NETWORK STRIVES TO DEVELOP COMMUNITY-BASED STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE CHILD WELL-BEING AND REDUCE CHILD MALTREATMENT USING A COLLECTIVE IMPACT APPROACH IN THREE BOSTON NEIGHBORHOODS.  WE DEFINE CHILD WELL-BEING AS A STATE WHERE A CHILD'S PHYSICAL, COGNITIVE, EMOTIONAL, BEHAVIORAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL FUNCTIONING IS HEALTHY AND THEY ARE ABLE TO DEVELOP SKILLS AND CAPACITIES.  OUR NETWORK IS MOBILIZING COLLECTIVE INVESTMENT FROM RESIDENTS, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS (CBOS) AND INSTITUTIONS TO SEED SCALABLE AND SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY CHANGE AROUND CHILD PROTECTION AND PROMOTING HEALTHY SOCIO-EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN EARLY CHILDHOOD.  VITAL VILLAGE IS SUPPORTING DEEPER COLLABORATION AMONG EDUCATORS, CLINICIANS, SERVICE PROVIDERS, LAWYERS, AND RESIDENTS TO STRENGTHEN PRENATAL, EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION, AND ECONOMIC STABILIZATION AND PREVENTIVE LEGAL RESOURCES THAT SUPPORT FAMILY AND COMMUNITY PROTECTIVE FACTORS.  THE VITAL VILLAGE NETWORK IS FUNDED BY THE DORIS DUKE CHARITABLE FOUNDATION TO CONTINUE TO DEVELOP COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT WITHIN, AND A FORMAL COLLABORATIVE NETWORK ACROSS THREE NEIGHBORHOODS IN BOSTON: DUDLEY (ROXBURY/NORTH DORCHESTER), MATTAPAN, AND CODMAN SQUARE (DORCHESTER).  
THE PROPOSED PROJECT AIMS TO ENHANCE NETWORK CONNECTIONS, ACTIVITIES, AND INVOLVEMENT SO THAT CONNECTIONS ARE STRENGTHENED AND DEEPENED AND CHAMPION RESIDENTS AND ORGANIZATION PARTNERS CAN LEAD. WE SEEK TO STRENGTHEN THE SYSTEMS AND SUSTAINABLE PRACTICES THAT HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED SO THAT OUR NETWORK MEMBERS FEEL SUPPORTED IN COLLABORATIVE ACTIONS TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT CHILD AND COMMUNITY WELLBEING.
WE ARE REQUESTING TWO VISTA MEMBERS TO FUNCTION IN THE ROLE OF "COMMUNITY MOBILIZATION COORDINATOR" FOR THE VITAL VILLAGE NETWORK. THE LIFE OF A SINGLE MOM, HEADQUARTERED IN BATON ROUGE, LOUISIANA IS AN AWARD-WINNING 501(C)(3) NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT EXISTS TO SEE THAT NO SINGLE PARENT WALKS ALONE. OUR LOCAL SINGLE PARENT PROGRAMS EDUCATE SINGLE PARENTS IN CRITICAL AREAS, INCLUDING PARENTING, MONEY MANAGEMENT, AND OVERALL HEALTH & WELLNESS. WE HAVE USED THE SUCCESS OF OUR LOCAL MODEL (ESTABLISHED IN JANUARY 2007) AS A CATALYST TO LAUNCH SUPPORT GROUPS IN 1500 CHURCHES & COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE GLOBE. WE SERVE MORE THAN 50,000 SINGLE PARENTS IN THE UNITED STATES EACH YEAR. WE ARE PROJECTED TO LAUNCH 100 SUPPORT GROUPS PER YEAR IN COMMUNITIES AROUND THE NATION. WE ALSO PROVIDE LONG-TERM EDUCATION AND SUPPORT FOR CHURCH/COMMUNITY LEADERS ON HOW TO BEST MEET THE NEEDS OF SINGLE PARENT HOMES, WHILE FOCUSING ON MENTORSHIP, EDUCATION, AND ELIMINATING POOR STATISTICAL DATA IN THESE HOMES.

OUR MISSION AT THE LIFE OF A SINGLE MOM IS TO EDUCATE CHURCH AND COMMUNITY LEADERS, AS WELL AS THE GENERAL PUBLIC ON THE PLIGHT OF THE SINGLE PARENT FAMILY, SO AS TO OFFER TANGIBLE SOLUTIONS ON HOW TO ERADICATE NEGATIVE STATISTICS, WHILE EMPOWERING SAID FAMILIES TO ACHIEVE SUCCESS IN PARENTING, FINANCES, AND OVERALL HEALTH & WELLNESS. WE PROVIDE TRAINING, RESOURCES, EDUCATION SYMPOSIUMS, CONFERENCES, WEBINARS, EVENTS, LAY COUNSELING, NEEDS-ASSESSMENT REFERRALS, AND PRINT MATERIALS FOR BOTH SINGLE PARENTS AND THOSE WHO WORK WITH THEM.

THE LIFE OF A SINGLE MOM IS GOVERNED BY ITS BOARD OF DIRECTORS, WHICH IS COMPRISED OF HIGHLY-KNOWLEDGEABLE, DIVERSE LEADERS WHO BRING A VARIETY OF SKILL SETS TO OUR FOUNDATION. OUR BOARD WORKS TOGETHER TO FURTHER THE VISION OF TLSM. OUR BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE VOLUNTEERS WHO SERVE A TWO-YEAR TERM TO PROVIDE OVERSIGHT AND ACCOUNTABILITY FOR THE STAFF OF TLSM. OUR BOARD MEETS ON A QUARTERLY BASIS, AND ALL FINANCIALS, REPORTS, SALARIES, AND POLICIES ARE APPROVED BY SAID BOARD. 

OUR CEO, JENNIFER MAGGIO, IS CONSIDERED ONE OF THE NATION'S LEADING AUTHORITIES ON SINGLE PARENT ISSUES. SHE IS A CRITICALLY-ACCLAIMED AUTHOR AND SPEAKER WHO IS A FREQUENT GUEST IN NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL MEDIA VENUES. SHE HAS A PROVEN TRACK-RECORD OF SUCCESS IN CORPORATE AMERICA.

THE COLORADO SPRINGS COMMUNITY CENTERS HAVE IMPLEMENTED PROGRAMMING TO ADDRESS FOOD SECURITY, INCREASE YOUTH SCIENCE AND HEALTH EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES, AND TARGET HEALTH AND WELLNESS ISSUES THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY. THESE PROGRAMS DIRECTLY TARGET SYSTEMIC ISSUES OF POVERTY AND HELP LIFT THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES OUT OF POVERTY.  CURRENTLY, COLORADO SPRINGS HAS THREE COMMUNITY CENTERS:  HILLSIDE, DEERFIELD HILLS, AND MEADOWS PARK.  THE THREE FACILITIES, LOCATED IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES, PROVIDE AFFORDABLE PROGRAMS AND RESOURCES, INCLUDING YOUTH AND ADULT ENRICHMENT, FITNESS AND EXERCISE, HEALTH AND WELLNESS, AND SENIOR PROGRAMS.  OUR NEW PROGRAM, WHOLE AND HEALTHY YOUTH, PROVIDES AN INTERACTIVE EDUCATIONAL MODEL FOR HEALTH AND SCIENCES, MITIGATES THE SYSTEMIC CAUSES OF CHILDHOOD OBESITY AND ADDRESSES FOOD SECURITY IN OUR REGION.  OUR PROGRAM ALIGNS WITH VISTA'S EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES PRIORITY PROGRAMMING BY IMPROVING FOOD SECURITY, ADDRESSING SIGNIFICANT HEALTHCARE PROBLEMS, AND TEACHING CHILDREN ABOUT NUTRITION, SCIENCES AND THE ENVIRONMENT. 

THE MISSION OF THE WHOLE AND HEALTHY YOUTH PROGRAM AIMS AT TARGETING THE CHILDHOOD OBESITY EPIDEMIC BY DEVELOPING CAPACITY BUILDING RELATIONSHIPS AND ADDRESSING THE ROOT PROBLEMS OF OBESITY: ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD, EDUCATION, AND EXERCISE AND FITNESS.  TO EXPAND HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS FOR YOUTH AND COMMUNITY. VISTA VOLUNTEERS WILL CAPACITATE STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS AT THE COMMUNITY CENTERS TO BUILD UPON EDUCATIONAL AND WELLNESS PROGRAMMING, EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS, AND IDENTIFY PROGRAMMING GAPS/TRENDS TO BEST SERVE THE HEALTH AND WELLNESS NEEDS OF THE AREA.

THE DELTA EDUCATION AND HOUSING PROJECT WILL STRIVE TO IMPROVE THE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND HOUSING OPPORTUNITIES OF FAMILIES IN THE MARVELL-ELAINE SCHOOL IN PHILLIPS COUNTY, ARKANSAS. 

THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE AS FOLLOWS:

*	TO INCREASE THE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF STUDENTS K-12,
*	TO INCREASE ACADEMIC RETENTION IN GRADES 9-12)
*	TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF ADULTS RECEIVING THEIR G.E.D
*	TO INCREASE PARENTAL ENGAGEMENT IN THEIR CHILD LEARNING
*	TO INCREASE ACCESS TO THE NUMBER OF ADULTS ENTERING HIGHER EDUCATION


AMERICORPS MEMBERS WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:

1.	EVALUATE, PLAN AND COORDINATE TUTORIAL AND CAREER RELATED ACTIVITIES. 2.	EVALUATE, PLAN AND COORDINATE HOUSING COUNSELING AND FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION ACTIVITIES. (1 MEMBER)  SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SCHEDULING HOUSING AND FINANCIAL LITERACY ACTIVITIES, AND ASSESSING OVERALL PROGRAM IMPACT OF   FINANCIAL LITERACY ACTIVITIES AND PROGRAMS FOR YOUTH AND FAMILIES. IN ADDITION, THIS MEMBER WILL ASSIST WITH COORDINATING WORK EXPERIENCE AND CAREER EXPOSURE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH INCLUDING VOLUNTEER COMMUNITY SERVICE LEARNING PROJECTS SUCH AS NEIGHBORHOOD IMPROVEMENT, OR COMMUNITY GARDENING.

THE MISSION OF THE LATIN AMERICAN ASSOCIATION (LAA) IS TO EMPOWER LATINOS TO ACHIEVE THEIR ASPIRATIONS FOR ACADEMIC, SOCIAL, AND ECONOMIC ADVANCEMENT. THE ROLE OF THE LAA, IN TANDEM WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS), IS TO STRATEGICALLY BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE LAA PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING CNCS VISTA FOCUS AREAS: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, AND HEALTHY FUTURES. THE LAA INVESTS IN INDIVIDUALS' AND FAMILIES' ABILITIES TO PURSUE EDUCATION, EMPLOYMENT, AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT LEAD TO IMPROVED ECONOMIC STABILITY AND QUALITY OF LIFE.  

THE LATIN AMERICAN ASSOCIATION SEEKS TO HAVE NINE VISTA VOLUNTEERS. HERE ARE THE AREAS AND TIME FRAMES IN WHICH VISTAS WILL BE ASSIGNED IN 2019. 
*	JANUARY 2019: THE VISTA ECONOMIC EMPOWERMENT COORDINATOR
*	FEBRUARY 2019: THE VISTA VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR, VISTA CORPORATE RELATIONS COORDINATOR, VISTA COMMUNICATIONS COORDINATOR, AND THE VISTA OUTREACH COORDINATOR
*	SEPTEMBER 2019: THE VISTA EDUCATION COORDINATOR, VISTA PARENT ENGAGEMENT COORDINATOR, AND THE VISTA FAMILY WELL-BEING COORDINATOR
*	NOVEMBER 2019: VISTA INDIVIDUAL GIVING COORDINATOR

THE CAMPBELL COUNTY COMMUNITY ADVOCACY, RESOURCES, EDUCATION BOARD (CARE BOARD) IS A COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION FORMED AS A TRIPARTITE BOARD WHOSE PURPOSE IS TO ENSURE THE COMMUNITY SERVICES BLOCK GRANT (CSBG) FUNDS ARE FAIRLY AND APPROPRIATELY DISTRIBUTED TO HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES; NEEDED SERVICES ARE MADE KNOW; AND NEEDED SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE BASED ON DEMONSTRATED NEED AND ARE FAIRLY, EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY MADE AVAILABLE TO LOW INCOME RESIDENTS WHO NEED THEM.
THE CARE BOARD SERVES MANY COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES.  THESE AGENCIES INCLUDE AMERICAN RED CROSS, THE CAMPBELL COUNTY SENIOR CENTER, GILLETTE ABUSE REFUGE FOUNDATION, CAMPBELL COUNTY BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB, GILLETTE HEALTH SERVICES, SALVATION ARMY, SECOND CHANCE MINISTRIES, REHABILITATE NORTHEAST WYOMING AND PERSONAL FRONTIERS ARE A FEW OF THE COMMUNITY AGENCIES THE CARE BOARD SUPPORTS.  
THE CARE BOARD IS SEEKING TO EXPAND THE SERVICES IT CURRENTLY PROVIDES TO COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES. THESE EXPANDED SERVICES INCLUDE TRAININGS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF ORGANIZATIONS TO EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY DELIVER SERVICES, DEVELOPING FUNDRAISING STRATEGIES, DEVELOPMENT OF A COMMUNITY HUMAN SERVICE RESOURCE MANUAL AND TO HELP DEVELOP SUSTAINABLE LINKAGES OF SERVICES IN CAMPBELL COUNTY.
THE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES THE CARE BOARD IS SEEKING TO INCORPORTATE WILL INCLUDE TRAININGS FOCUSED ON DEVELOPING TRAINERS-OF-TRAINERS (TOT).  ONE SUCH TOT TRAINING THE CARE BOARD WOULD LIKE TO INCLUDE IS A FUNDRAISING STRATEGIES.  BY OFFERING THIS TYPE OF TRAINING IN THE COMMUNITY WE WOULD BE BUIDING SKILLS AND EXPERTS IN THE COMMUNITY WHO CAN ASSIST OTHER ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES BUILD THEIR FUNDRAISING SKILLS.  BY HAVING THIS ASSEST IN THE COMMUNITY IT WILL HELP ORGANIZATIONS REDUCE THEIR COSTS FOR TRAVEL TO OUT-OF-STATE CONFERENCES.
IN ADDITION TO TOT TRAININGS THE CARE BOARD IS SEEKING TO OFFER TRAININGS FOCUSED ON SKILL DEVELOPMENT OF THE BROADER BASE OF DIRECT SERVICE WORKERS, THIS IN TURN WILL HELP ORGANIZATIONS BE MORE EFFECTIVE IN THEIR CAPACITY BUILDING AND THEIR SERVICE DELIVERY.  TRAINING THE CARE BOARD HAS IDENTIFIED AS NEEDED AND BENEFICIAL INCLUDES UNDERSTANDING POVERTY, THIS IS BASED ON RUBY PAYNE'S BRIGDES OUT OF POVERTY; CULTURAL COMPETENCY AND DIVERSITY; AND DEVELOPING LOGIC MODELS.  IT IS RECOGINZED THERE ARE SIGNIFICANT ADDITIONAL TRAININGS WHICH WOULD BENEFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES SERVING THE LOW-INCOME POPULATION IN CAMPBELL COUNTY.  WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF THE AMERICORP VISTA, THE CARE BOARD WILL BE ABLE TO MORE THOROGHLY SEARCH OUT AND PROVIDE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES.
IN ORDER TO SUCCESSFULLY EXPAND ITS SERVICES AS DETAILED BELOW THE CARE BOARD IS REQUESTING THE ASSISTANCE OF ONE VISTA VOLUNTEER.  IT IS ESTIMATED THE LENGTH OF TIME TO EFFECTIVELY ACCOMPLISH THE GOALS OF THE OUTLINED PROJECT WILL BE THREE YEARS.

1.PROVIDE A BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT INCLUDING THE PROJECT GOAL(S) AS WELL AS AN OVERVIEW OF THE ACTIVITIES THE REQUESTED VISTAS AND LEADERS WILL PERFORM.

THE VISTA PROGRAM WE ARE PROPOSING IS TO SUPPORT AND EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF THE SUMMER BRIDGE ENRICHMENT PROGRAM . THIS PROGRAM INVOLVES HIGH SCHOOLS IN THE HAWAII ACADEMIES CONSORTIUM WORKING ON BUILDING ACADEMIC SKILLS OF TRANSITIONING STUDENTS (8TH TO 9TH GRADE AND HIGH SCHOOL TO COLLEGE).  IN ADDITION, MORE EMPHASIS WILL BE PUT ON COLLEGE AND CAREERS USING COMMUNITY RESOURCES SUCH AS THE COMMUNITY COLLEGES, UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII, AND LOCAL BUSINESSES.  BECAUSE OF THE RECENT OPIOID EPIDEMIC, THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO ADDRESS DRUG ABUSE PREVENTION AND EDUCATION.  WE ARE APPLYING FOR ONE FULL-TIME VISTA MEMBER WHO WILL DEVELOP TOOLS AND RESOURCES TO ENABLE THE SCHOOLS TO IMPLEMENT SUCCESSFUL SUMMER BRIDGE PROGRAMS.  ASIDE FROM THE FULL-TIME VISTA MEMBER, IF THE OPPORTUNITY BECOMES AVAILABLE, WE WILL ALSO REQUEST SUMMER ASSOCIATES TO ASSIST AS TUTORS DURING THE PROGRAM.  DURATION OF THE PROGRAM WILL BE 4-6 WEEKS (DEPENDING UPON THE CAPABILITIES AT EACH SCHOOL). EMPHASIS:  (1) BRIDGE ACADEMICS WITH REAL WORLD APPLICATIONS; (2) DEVELOP STUDY SKILLS (ORGANIZATION, NOTE TAKING, EXTENDED RESPONSE FORMAT); (3) DEVELOP PERSONAL AWARENESS ON LEARNING STYLES AND INTERESTS AS WELL AS LIFE SKILLS; (4) DEVELOP RESILIENCY SKILLS TO HELP WITH TRANSITION TO HIGH SCHOOL; (5) AWARENESS AND PREVENTION OF DRUG ABUSE; AND (6) FOCUS ON COLLEGE AND CAREER AWARENESS THROUGH EXTENDED LEARNING EXPERIENCES
STUDENTS TARGETED WILL BE INCOMING 9TH GRADERS AS WELL AS HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS TAKING COLLEGE CLASSES.  MOST OF THE SCHOOLS ARE IN POVERTY AREAS AND EFFORTS TO HELP STUDENTS ACHIEVE SUCCESS IN HIGH SCHOOL AND BEYOND IS OUR ANTI-POVERTY FOCUS.  
PROJECT GOALS: 
STUDENTS WILL:  
1.BUILD ACADEMIC PROFICIENCY IN AREAS OF MATH, SCIENCE, AND LANGUAGE ARTS THROUGH AUTHENTIC LEARNING EXPERIENCES
2.EXPLORE CAREERS THROUGH CAREER TECHNICAL EDUCATION (CTE) PATHWAYS
3.PREPARE FOR COLLEGE AND/OR CAREERS THROUGH JOB SHADOWING AND VISITATIONS INCLUDING WORK-READINESS SKILLS
4.DEVELOP SKILLS FOR SUCCESS IN HIGH SCHOOL AS WELL AS POST SECONDARY EDUCATION
5.DEVELOP SKILLS OF GOOD CITIZENSHIP
6.GAIN KNOWLEDGE AND EXPOSURE TO THE DANGERS OF OPIOID DRUG ADDICTION

ONE VISTA MEMBER:  TO BE SELECTED IN APRIL 2018: 
A.COORDINATE CURRICULUM FOR MATH, SCIENCE, LANGUAGE ARTS AND TRANSITION TO HIGH SCHOOL AMONG SCHOOLS: ENHANCE PROGRAM TO INCLUDE AUTHENTIC LEARNING EXPERIENCES WITH CAREER TECHNICAL EDUCATION EMPHASIS; EXPAND PROGRAM TO INCLUDE COMMUNITY SERVICE PROJECTS THAT EMPHASIZE GIVING BACK TO THE COMMUNITY IN THE SPIRIT OF PHILANTHROPY
B.ASSIST IN SECURING COMMUNITY MEMBERS AS VOLUNTEERS TO IMPLEMENT AND SUPPORT THE SUMMER BRIDGE PROGRAM (INCLUDING SUMMER ASSOCIATES)
C.COORDINATE COMMUNICATION WITH COMMUNITY RESOURCES (BUSINESSES AND COLLEGES)
D.BUILD CAPACITY WITHIN THE SCHOOLS TO CONTINUE SUMMER BRIDGE ENRICHMENT PROGRAM; ASSIST IN APPLYING AND SECURING FUNDING ; PROMOTE SUMMER BRIDGE ENRICHMENT PROGRAM WITHIN THE COMMUNITIES
E.ASSEMBLE ALL DATA MEASURING IMPACT OF PROGRAM ON STUDENTS. ANALYZE AND REPORT DATA TO SCHOOLS.

BOYS & GIRLS CLUBS OF INDIANAPOLIS (BGCI) BELIEVES THAT EVERY YOUNG PERSON DESERVES TO LIVE A LIFE FILLED WITH HOPE AND OPPORTUNITY.  BECAUSE WE CARE ABOUT OUR YOUNG PEOPLE, WE PROVIDE A SAFE, EDUCATIONAL AND POSITIVE ATMOSPHERE WHERE THEY CAN PROSPER AND REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF CAPACITY BUILDING AND WILL SUPPORT THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO GROW AND SUSTAIN THE RESOURCES THROUGH COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND MARKETING & COMMUNICATIONS EFFORTS.  THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 5,800 BGCI CLUB MEMBERS. TWO VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ENGAGING COMMUNITY SUPPORTERS IN THE BGCI MISSION, IMPLEMENTING NEW MARKETING STRATEGIES, ENHANCING ORGANIZATIONAL COMMUNICATIONS, AND SUPPORTING MARKETING, DESIGN, AND VOLUNTEERS FOR SPECIAL EVENTS.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. WITH OUR VISTA PROJECT, WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT THOUSANDS OF INDIVIDUALS IN CHICAGO AND LAKE COUNTY'S LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS.  OUR VISTAS CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND VOLUNTEER COORDINATING. FOR ITS SEVENTH YEAR OF OPERATION, THE PROPOSED "REBUILDING LIVES" PROJECT WILL EMPLOY A TEAM OF THREE VISTA MEMBERS TO BUILD EMMAUS' ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO FIGHT HOMELESSNESS, FOOD INSECURITY, POVERTY, AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE THROUGH: 1) FUNDRAISING/MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS, 2) COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, 3) DEVELOPMENT OF HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO IMPROVE OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS, WITH A FOCUS ON HOMELESS ADULTS AND CHILDREN, 4) DEVELOPMENT OF OUT-OF-SCHOOL EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR HOMELESS CHILDREN, AND 5) DEVELOPMENT OF ADULT EMPOWERMENT PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO IMPROVE ECONOMIC OUTCOMES FOR HOMELESS ADULTS, PRIMARILY SINGLE MOTHERS. 

THE "REBUILDING LIVES" PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND EDUCATION. EACH VISTA MEMBER WILL SERVE A ONE YEAR TERM. THIS WILL BE THE SEVENTH YEAR OF OPERATION FOR THIS PROJECT. TWO OF THE ORIGINAL POSITIONS (FUNDRAISING AND HEALTH AND WELLNESS) UNDERWENT MAJOR CHANGES IN 2016 TO REFLECT THE PROGRESS MADE IN ACHIEVING PROJECT GOALS OVER THE FIRST THREE YEARS. TWO NEW POSITIONS WERE ADDED IN 2016 TO DEVELOP THE NEW D'YOUVILLE PROGRAM INCLUDING PROGRAM DEVELOPER FOR THE EMMAUS EXPLORERS CHILDREN'S ENRICHMENT PROGRAM AND PROGRAM DEVELOPER FOR THE D'YOUVILLE EMPOWERMENT PROJECT FOR HOMELESS ADULTS, PRIMARILY SINGLE MOTHERS. EMMAUS  COMBINED THESE TWO POSITIONS INTO ONE POSITION IN 2018 TO CONTINUE THE PROGRESS THAT HAS BEEN MADE IN THE PAST THREE YEARS IN DEVELOPING THESE LIFE-CHANGING PROGRAMS. 

EMMAUS SEEKS A TEAM OF THREE VISTA MEMBERS TO COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS OVER THE UPCOMING YEAR:
1) FUNDRAISING/MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS SPECIALIST: ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL FOCUS ON GENERATING CRITICALLY NEEDED FUNDS TO SUPPORT EMMAUS' HOUSING PROGRAMS AND SERVICES (ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY). S/HE WILL SEEK TO FURTHER ENHANCE THE EMMAUS BRAND THROUGH MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS PROJECTS, WITH A FOCUS ON INCREASING EMMAUS' PRESENCE ON SOCIAL MEDIA OUTLETS, TO REACH NEW AUDIENCES AND INCREASE AWARENESS ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION AND THE SOCIAL PROBLEMS OF HOMELESSNESS, FOOD INSECURITY, AND POVERTY ;
2) HEALTH AND WELLNESS: ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL DEVELOP A WIDE RANGE OF PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO PROMOTE HEALTH AND WELLNESS AMONG BOTH HOMELESS AND FORMERLY HOMELESS HOUSEHOLDS (HEALTHY FUTURES). S/HE WILL BUILD RELATIONSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND WORK CLOSELY WITH THEM TO EXECUTE VALUABLE HEALTH-RELATED PROGRAMS FOR EMMAUS CLIENTS.  S/HE WILL SEEK TO CULTIVATE RELATIONSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS THAT WILL BRING NEEDED HEALTH AND WELLNESS RESOURCES TO HOMELESS AND LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS ENGAGED WITH EMMAUS. 
3) EMMAUS PARENTS' AND CHILDREN'S PROGRAM COORDINATOR: ONE VISTA MEMBER WILL COORDINATE BOTH EMMAUS EXPLORERS CHILDREN'S ENRICHMENT PROGRAM THAT WAS INITIATED BY THE 2015- 2016 AMERICORPS VISTA TEAM DURING THE SUMMER OF 2015 (EDUCATION) AND THE ADULT EMPOWERMENT PROJECT ESTABLISHED IN 2016 (ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY). S/HE WILL SEEK TO DEVELOP AND REFINE ALL ASPECTS OF THE PROGRAM, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT (CASH AND IN-KIND SUPPORT), COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING, OUTREACH, CURRICULUM DESIGN, AND PROGRAM EVALUATION. 

EMMAUS INC., A NON-PROFIT 501(C) 3 ORGANIZATION, WAS INCORPORATED IN 1985 AND SEEKS TO RELIEVE THE PLIGHT OF THE HOMELESS THROUGH EMERGENCY SHELTER, PERMANENT AFFORDABLE HOUSING, JOB READINESS AND LIFE SKILLS TRAINING, AND COMPREHENSIVE SUPPORT SERVICES. IN SEPTEMBER 2018, EMMAUS WAS CERTIFIED BY THE POINTS OF LIGHT FOUNDATION AND THE MASSACHUSETTS SERVICE ALLIANCE AS A SERVICE ENTERPRISE. EMMAUS IS ALSO A CERTIFIED WOMEN NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION (W/NPO) AND A CERTIFIED COMMUNITY HOUSING DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATION (CHDO).  

EMMAUS VIEWS ITS MISSION AS A CALL TO REBUILD AND RENEW COMMUNITY.  WE ARE COMMITTED TO SERVE THOSE IN NEED -- THE HOMELESS, HUNGRY, UNEMPLOYED, DISABLED, AND OPPRESSED.  WE PROVIDE HOUSING AND A CONTINUUM OF SERVICES TO AS

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:

TRI-COUNTY HEALTH NETWORK'S (TCHNETWORK) MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY AND COORDINATION OF HEALTH IN OUR RURAL REGION BY INCREASING ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE AND HEALTH SERVICES AT LOWER COSTS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. 

THE VISTA PROJECT WILL HELP DEVELOP, EVALUATE AND INCREASE THE SUSTAINABILITY OF TCHNETWORK'S COMMUNITY-BASED HEALTH CARE ACCESS PROGRAMS (PROGRAMS) THAT FOCUS ON ASSURING THAT HEALTHCARE IS ACCESSIBLE, AFFORDABLE AND AVAILABLE TO ALL MEMBERS OF OUR RURAL, LOW INCOME COMMUNITY, REGARDLESS OF SOCIOECONOMIC STATUS. BENEFICIARIES OF THESE PROGRAMS INCLUDE NOT ONLY TCHNETWORK PARTNERS BUT THE MAJORITY OF THE 83,495PEOPLE LIVING IN OUR RURAL AND GEOGRAPHICALLY CHALLENGING FOUR-COUNTY REGION OF SOUTHWEST COLORADO CONSISTING OF DELTA, OURAY, MONTROSE AND SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES. 

THREE (3) VISTA MEMBERS (TWO STANDARD AND ONE COST-SHARE) WILL CONTRIBUTE TO MEETING THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES TO COMPLEMENT TCHNETWORK'S PROGRAMS BY CREATING MUCH NEEDED ANALYSIS, EVALUATION, IMPROVING OUTREACH EFFORTS, ENHANCING OUR COMMUNICATION PROGRAMMING, DEVELOPING A VOLUNTEER PROGRAM AND ASSISTING IN EFFORTS TO SECURE LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY OVER THE NEXT YEAR. 

AN ADDITIONAL COST-SHARE VISTA MEMBER ASSISTS THE TELLURIDE FOUNDATION, A NONPROFIT COMMUNITY FOUNDATION COMMITTED TO ENRICHING THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF REGIONAL RESIDENTS THAT HAS A HISTORY OF PARTNERING WITH HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS TO MEET COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS, WITH ITS PARADOX COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE LOCATED IN THE PARADOX BASIN OF SOUTHWEST COLORADO.  THIS VISTA MEMBER FOCUSES ON COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AS WELL AS BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF THE INITIATIVE. 

THE PARADOX BASIN INCLUDES THE WESTERN PORTIONS OF MONTROSE AND SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES AS WELL AS PORTIONS OF DOLORES COUNTY. THE FOUNDATION IS WORKING SPECIFICALLY IN FIVE COMMUNITIES, DOVE CREEK, NORWOOD, NUCLA, NATURITA, PARADOX AND RICO, WHICH ARE RURAL, ECONOMICALLY DISTRESSED AREAS IMPACTED BY THE BOOM AND BUST CYCLES OF RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT.  POVERTY RATES IN THESE TOWNS ARE HIGHER THAN BOTH STATE AND NATIONAL RATES AND JOB OPPORTUNITIES ARE MINIMAL.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

THE GEORGE A. AND RUTH B. OWENS HEALTH AND WELLNESS CENTER (OHWC) IS THE HEALTH AND WELLNESS CENTER FOR TOUGALOO COLLEGE (TC). THE MISSION OF THE GEORGE A. AND RUTH B. OWENS HEALTH AND WELLNESS CENTER (OHWC) IS TO FOSTER A HOLISTIC APPROACH TO HEALTH AND WELLNESS, AT THE INSTITUTION AND IN THE COMMUNITY.THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT AT (TC) WILL BE CALLED THE COMMUNITY HEALTH CORPS AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT. OHWC IS REQUESTING THE  FIVE (5)  AMERICORPS VISTA VOLUNTEERS FROM  AMERICORPS VISTA OFFICE TO CONTINUE OUR PROJECT.   THE COMMUNITY HEALTH CORPS AMERICORPS VISTA PROJECT GOALS, OF WHICH ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREAS EDUCATION/HEALTHY FUTURES ARE TO (1) STRENGTHEN AND/OR EXPAND PRIMARY, MENTAL  CARE AND DENTAL HEALTH SERVICES AND PROGRAMS THAT SERVE LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS(2) ORGANIZE AND IMPLEMENT COMMUNITY OUTREACH INTERVENTIONS AND DEVELOP A DATABASE TO TRACK ALL HEALTH EDUCATION INTERVENTIONS, (3) REACH AND SERVE LOW-INCOME YOUTH WHO ARE AT RISK OF FALLING BEHIND IN THE EDUCATIONAL SYSTEM OR DROPPING OUT OF SCHOOL, AND (4) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAM TAILORED TO FIT THE NEEDS OF DISADVANTAGED RESIDENTS AGES 50 AND OLDER.

THE MAROON VOLUNTEER CENTER'S MISSION IS TO ENCOURAGE AND SUPPORT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AND VOLUNTEER SERVICE BY PROVIDING SERVICES, PROGRAMS, AND EVENTS THAT ALLOW THE MSU AND STARKVILLE COMMUNITY TO UTILIZE THEIR TALENTS AND SKILLS TO ASSIST OTHERS IN NEED. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THIS VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO LINK COMMUNITY-MINDED VOLUNTEERS WITH COMMUNITY-BASED AGENCIES FIGHTING POVERTY, DEVELOP THE EDUCATIONAL AND ECONOMIC SKILL-SETS AND OPPORTUNITIES OF CITIZENS WHO LIVE IN POVERTY, AND PROVIDE HOUSING, AND FOOD ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN POVERTY. THIS PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT OVER 7,000 INDIVIDUALS OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR. SEVENTEEN (17) VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE (1) VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING AND MANAGING VOLUNTEERS FOR OVER 85 AGENCIES WITHIN OKTIBBEHA COUNTY AND THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI, AND ASSISTING WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS (INCLUDING GED/ADULT EDUCATION, STEM, AND ECONOMIC EDUCATION), FOOD SECURITY PROGRAMS, HOUSING PROGRAMS, PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AWARENESS PROGRAMS, MENTORING AND TUTORING PROGRAMS, AND FINANCIAL LITERACY PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST INDIVIDUALS LIVING  IN POVERTY. VISTA MEMBERS WILL BE MITIGATING POVERTY IN OKTIBBEHA COUNTY AND THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROGRAM.
 
VISTAS WILL BE COORDINATED THROUGH THE MAROON VOLUNTEER CENTER AT MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY. THE MVC PARTNERS WITH OVER 85 DIFFERENT COMMUNITY-BASED AGENCIES AND NONPROFITS, PROVIDES DIRECT AND INDIRECT SERVICES TO MITIGATE POVERTY. IT ALSO COORDINATES THE MISSISSIPPI DELTA ALTERNATIVE SERVICE BREAK PROGRAM, THE STARKVILLE/MSU FOOD SECURITY NETWORK, AND NATIONAL DAYS OF SERVICE INCLUDING 9/11 NATIONAL DAY OF SERVICE AND REMEMBRANCE, AND MLK DAY. THE MVC OFFICIALLY PARTNERS WITH VOLUNTEER STARKVILLE, WHOSE MISSION IS TO CONNECT NONPROFITS WITH CITIZENS WHO WISH TO VOLUNTEER AND PROMOTE VOLUNTEERING IN STARKVILLE AND OKTIBBEHA COUNTY.
 
WE ARE REQUESTING SEVENTEEN (17) VISTAS AND ONE (1) VISTA LEADER TO COORDINATE THREE (3) COMPLIMENTARY PROJECT AREAS. EACH PROJECT WILL REQUIRE AT LEAST THREE YEARS TO CREATE, REVISE, AND INSTITUTIONALIZE; AFTER WHICH, THE PROJECTS SHOULD BE SELF-SUSTAINING. VISTAS WILL BE COORDINATED THROUGH THE MAROON VOLUNTEER CENTER AT MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY AND WILL BE PLACED AT VOLUNTEER STARKVILLE (1), STARKVILLE HABITAT FOR HUMANITY (2), MAROON VOLUNTEER CENTER (4), THE EMERSON FAMILY RESOURCE CENTER (2), MS. SMITH'S EDUCATION SERVICES (1), GLOBAL LINK LINK (2), THE EXTENSION CENTER HEALTHY HOMES INITIATIVE (1), THE NOXUBEE NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE (1), THE STARKVILLE AREA ARTS COUNCIL (1), CHRISTIAN WOMEN'S JOB CORPS (1), AND THE BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF THE GOLDEN TRIANGLE (1). THE VISTA LEADER WILL BE PLACED AT THE MAROON VOLUNTEER CENTER AND WILL HELP PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR ALL THE VISTA MEMBERS AND THEIR PROJECTS.

GENESIS AND LIGHT CENTER MISSION (G&L) IS TO ASSIST DISADVANTAGED YOUTH IN DEVELOPING POSITIVE SELF-ESTEEM AND MORAL VALUES, WHILE ENCOURAGING ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE.  G&LS GOALS ARE TO EMPOWER DISADVANTAGED YOUTH IN GRADES K-12 BY PROMOTING: ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, SUBSTANCE-FREE LIFESTYLES, AND PROVIDE PARTICIPANTS WITH AN ALTERNATIVE TO YOUTH CRIME.  SINCE 1992, GENESIS AND LIGHT CENTER HAS CONTINUED TO ENHANCE, EXPAND, AND DEVELOP SERVICES WHILE CREATING NEW INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS TO ASSIST UNDER ACHIEVING LOW INCOME YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES. GENESIS AND LIGHT HAS PROVIDED SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL SERVICES TO STUDENTS IN METRO JACKSON AREA FOR OVER TWENTY YEARS. GENESIS AND LIGHT PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES TO LOW ACHIEVING DISADVANTAGED STUDENTS WHO ATTEND LOW-PERFORMING SCHOOLS, OFFERING THEM ACADEMIC ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING TUTORING, MENTORING, COUNSELING, EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE, ARTS AND CRAFTS, DRAMA AND DANCE, AND EXTRACURRICULAR/ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES. QUALIFIED STAFF MEMBERS ASSIST STUDENTS IN MEETING STATE AND LOCAL ACHIEVEMENT/CONTENT STANDARDS IN CORE ACADEMIC SUBJECTS, SUCH AS READING, LANGUAGE ARTS, AND MATHEMATICS.  THESE SERVICE ACTIVITIES NOT ONLY FOCUS ON THE INDIVIDUAL CHILD BUT ALSO DEVELOP ACTIVITIES, PROVIDES ACCESS TO TECHNOLOGY TO THOSE WHO DO NOT HAVE A COMPUTER, PRINTER OR FAX, OFFER WORKSHOPS AND TRAINING SESSION TO IMPROVE THE ECONOMIC WELL-BEING OF ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED FAMILIES. 

THE GENESIS AND LIGHT CENTER EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE MENTORING (GLEAM) PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) EDUCATION FOCUS AREA.    OVER ONE HUNDRED ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED YOUTH ARE EXPECTED TO BENEFIT. WE ARE REQUESTING NINE VISTA MEMBERS.  VISTAS WILL PERFORM ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RECRUITING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS; COORDINATING SERVICES FOR LOW INCOME AT-RISK YOUTH; UPDATING AND ENHANCING PROGRAMMATIC SYSTEMS AND ESTABLISHING FUNDRAISING EVENTS TO HELP FUND PROJECT ACTIVITIES.  VISTA MEMBERS WILL ALSO ASSIST OUR AGENCY IN ORGANIZING A NEW SITE IN SOUTH JACKSON WHICH WILL PROVIDING SERVICES TO DISADVANTAGED YOUTH IN SOUTH JACKSON.

THE OFFICE OF SERVICE-LEARNING (OSL) IS A PUBLIC SERVICE AND OUTREACH UNIT OF THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA (UGA) WHOSE MISSION INCLUDES "A COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE IN PUBLIC SERVICE, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE DESIGNED TO ADDRESS THE STRATEGIC NEEDS OF THE STATE OF GEORGIA." THE OSL WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2005 WITH A MISSION TO PROMOTE AND SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF QUALITY ACADEMIC SERVICE-LEARNING EXPERIENCES THAT RESPOND TO CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE OSL IS REQUESTING 9 AMERICORPS VISTAS (5 STANDARD AND 4 COST-SHARE) AS PART OF THE UGA VISTA NETWORK TO BUILD CAPACITY AMONG PROGRAMS AND ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE WORK ALIGNS WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES AND EDUCATION CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREAS. DIFFERENT VISTAS WILL BE STARTING ON DIFFERENT PROJECT YEARS, BUT EACH SUB-SITE ACTIVITY IS ESTIMATED TO REQUIRE 3-5 YEARS IN TOTAL. THE REQUESTED VISTAS' GOALS, TARGET POPULATIONS, AND ACTIVITIES ARE AS FOLLOWS: 

1) THE CAMPUS KITCHEN VISTA (REGULAR VISTA): THIS VISTA HELPS SERVE HUNDREDS OF LOW-INCOME SENIORS IN ATHENS-CLARKE COUNTY, GA, IN ADDITION TO OTHER LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS IN THE AREA WITH THE GOAL OF REDUCING FOOD INSECURITY AND ITS ASSOCIATED HEALTH ISSUES. THE VISTA IS FOCUSED ON SUPPORTING CAMPUS KITCHEN AT UGA, A FOOD RECOVERY AND HUNGER RELIEF PROGRAM OF THE OSL. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE EXPANDING MEAL DISTRIBUTION NETWORKS; RECRUITING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS; DEVELOPING NEW PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS ROOT CAUSES OF HUNGER; ENHANCING SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE; AND SECURING IN-KIND AND CASH RESOURCES. 

2) THE UGARDEN VISTA (REGULAR VISTA): THIS VISTA ALSO HELPS SERVE LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WITH THE GOAL OF REDUCING FOOD INSECURITY AND ITS ASSOCIATED HEALTH ISSUES. THE VISTA IS FOCUSED ON TRAINING AND RECRUITMENT OF HUNDREDS OF STUDENTS AND OTHER VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT UGARDEN, A STUDENT RUN ORGANIC FARM THAT PROVIDES FRESH PRODUCE TO LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS THROUGH VARIOUS VENUES. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE RECRUITING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS; DEVELOPING COMMUNITY EDUCATION PROGRAMS; AND EXPANDING PARTNERSHIPS TO STRENGTHEN DISTRIBUTION NETWORKS IN ORDER TO REACH MORE FAMILIES. 

3) THE SENIOR HUNGER VISTA (REGULAR VISTA): THIS VISTA HELPS SERVE HUNDREDS OF LOW-INCOME SENIORS IN ACC AND THE SURROUNDING AREA WITH THE GOAL OF REDUCING FOOD INSECURITY AND ITS ASSOCIATED HEALTH ISSUES. THE VISTA IS FOCUSED ON SUPPORTING THE SENIOR HUNGER COALITION, A PROGRAM OF THE ATHENS COMMUNITY COUNCIL ON AGING THAT COLLABORATES WITH LOCAL PARTNERS TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY THROUGH A RANGE OF PROGRAMS AND INTERVENTIONS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE RECRUITING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEERS; SECURING IN-KIND AND CASH RESOURCES; RAISING AWARENESS OF THE ISSUES OF SENIOR HUNGER AND THE EFFORTS OF THE SENIOR HUNGER COALITION; AND DEVELOPING OUTREACH PROGRAMS. 

4) THROUGH 7) THE SCHOOL GARDEN VISTAS (2 COST-SHARE, 2 REGULAR VISTAS): THESE VISTAS HELP SERVE HUNDREDS OF AT-RISK MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS IN THE CLARKE COUNTY SCHOOL DISTRICT WITH THE GOAL OF IMPROVING EATING HABITS AND REDUCING FOOD INSECURITY. THE VISTAS WORK IN ALL FOUR LOCAL MIDDLE SCHOOLS TO ESTABLISH AND/OR EXPAND YEAR-ROUND ENTREPRENEURIAL GARDEN, FOOD RECOVERY, AND COOKING/NUTRITION PROGRAMS THROUGH PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING, AND PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT. 

THE CAMPUS KITCHEN, UGARDEN, SENIOR HUNGER, AND SCHOOL GARDEN VISTAS WORK COLLABORATIVELY ON THESE IMPORTANT ISSUES. 

8) THE CENTER FOR LEADERSHIP AND SERVICE VISTA (COST-SHARE VISTA): THIS VISTA, ALIGNED WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA, WORKS WITH THE UGA CENTER FOR LEADERSHIP AND SERVICE TO SUPPORT THE CLARKE COUNTY MENTOR PROGRAM BY ASSISTING WITH RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING OF UGA MENTORS AND BY ESTABLISHING AN INTERNSHIP FOR EXPERIENCED UGA MENTORS TO HELP SUPPORT OTHER MENTORS IN THE PROGRAM, WITH THE GOAL OF ENHANCING EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR AT-RISK K-12 YOUTH IN ATHENS.

STEP UP SAVANNAH IS A COLLABORATIVE MADE UP OF OVER 90 ORGANIZATIONS. WE BELIEVE SAVANNAH IS A COMMUNITY WHERE ALL PEOPLE HAVE HOPE AND OPPORTUNITY, WHERE WE CHALLENGE INJUSTICE, WHERE ALL COMMUNITY MEMBERS STEP UP TO REDUCE POVERTY. OUR MISSION IS TO ENGAGE ALL SECTORS OF THE COMMUNITY TO IMPROVE THE ECONOMIC MOBILITY AND FINANCIAL STABILITY OF FAMILIES IN SAVANNAH, CHATHAM COUNTY. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THAT MISSION AND THE CNCS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ENHANCE PROGRAMS RELATED TO CHILD DEVELOPMENT, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, WEALTH BUILDING, FOOD ACCESS, DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND CAPACITY BUILDING. WE EXPECT TO BENEFIT OVER 8,000 LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGH VISTA RESOURCES. TEN VISTA MEMBERS AND ONE VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS GRANT WRITING AND OTHER FUNDRAISING, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT, AND OUTREACH OVER THE NEXT YEAR (5.29.17-5.28.18). VISTA'S WOULD BE PLACED AT STEP UP SAVANNAH, GEORGIA LEGAL SERVICES PROGRAM, CONSUMER CREDIT COUNSELING SERVICES, CHATHAM EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT, LUTHERAN SERVICES OF GEORGIA, FORSYTH FARMERS' MARKET, CHATHAM COUNTY SAFETY NET PLANNING COUNCIL AND UNION MISSION. IN ADDITION SIX SUMMER ASSOCIATES WILL BE PLACED AT FORSYTH FARMERS' MARKET, PARK PLACE OUTREACH, HORIZONS SAVANNAH, CITY OF SAVANNAH, WESLEY COMMUNITY CENTER, AND PERFORMANCE INITIATIVES.

   PARRAMORE KIDZ ZONE (PKZ), A REPLICATION OF THE HARLEM CHILDREN'S ZONE NATIONAL MODEL, WAS LAUNCHED IN ORLANDO IN 2006 TO COMBAT THE EFFECTS OF POVERTY AND "MOVE THE NEEDLE" ON CHILD WELL-BEING IN ORLANDO'S HIGHEST POVERTY NEIGHBORHOOD, INCLUDING REDUCING JUVENILE CRIME RATES AND INCREASING HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION RATES. THE PKZ STRATEGY IS TO INVEST IN A CONTINUUM OF CRADLE-TO-CAREER EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD, INCLUDING PRE-KINDERGARTEN PROGRAMS, AFTER SCHOOL ACTIVITIES, PARENTING PROGRAMS, ACADEMIC SUPPORTS, HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS, AND YOUTH EMPLOYMENT AND COLLEGE ACCESS PROGRAMS, AND TO CONNECT "A CRITICAL MASS" OF THE NEIGHBORHOOD'S CHILDREN TO THESE SERVICES.  
   PKZ CELEBRATED 11 YEARS OF IMPLEMENTATION IN JULY 2017 HAVING MADE SIGNIFICANT PROGRESS IN BUILDING A STRONG COALITION OF PARTNERS; INVESTING FUNDING IN YOUTH PROGRAMS IN PARRAMORE; DEVELOPING BASIC DATA SYSTEMS THAT PERMIT TRACKING OF SERVICE DELIVERY AND OUTCOMES; BRANDING THE PROJECT AMONG NEIGHBORHOOD RESIDENTS; AND ENGAGING MORE THAN 4,400 CHILDREN IN "NEEDLE-MOVING" PROGRAMS SINCE 2006.
   ALTHOUGH WE HAVE MADE GAINS IN MANY AREAS, SUCH AS REDUCING THE NUMBER OF SPECIFIED JUVENILE ARRESTS AMONG PARRAMORE YOUTH BY 76.2%, THERE IS MORE TO BE DONE TO CLOSE THE GAP BETWEEN PARRAMORE YOUTH AND OTHER ORLANDO YOUTH WHEN IT COMES TO KEY MEASURES OF CHILD WELL-BEING.  TO THIS END, PKZ VISTA'S GOAL WILL BE TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF PKZ'S COALITION OF PARTNERS IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:
A) COMMUNICATIONS/OUTREACH ASSISTANCE.  COMMUNICATION WITH YOUTH AND PARENTS AS WELL AS PARTNERS IS AN IMPORTANT COMPONENT IN THE RECRUITING AND RETAINING INVOLVEMENT IN PKZ PROGRAMMING. THIS PKZ VISTA WOULD DEVELOP TEMPLATES, SCHEDULES AND FORMATS FOR SOCIAL MEDIA AND PAPER MEDIA FOR GETTING INFORMATION OUT TO INTERESTED GROUPS AS WELL AS PROVIDING CONTENT FOR ONLINE EXPOSURE AND UPDATES TO YOUTH, PARENTS AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS. THIS PKZ VISTA WILL SERVE TO IMPROVE COALITION MEMBERS' ABILITY TO INFORM YOUTH AND OTHER PARTIES OF PROGRAMMING AND INVOLVEMENT EVENTS AND MEETINGS BY PREPARING MATERIALS FOR AND IMPLEMENTING INFORMATION STRATEGIES.  COMMUNICATION WITH YOUTH AND PARENTS AS WELL AS PARTNERS IS AN IMPORTANT COMPONENT IN THE RECRUITING AND RETAINING INVOLVEMENT IN PKZ PROGRAMMING. 
B) YOUTH DEVELOPMENT/TRAINING AND DATA MANAGEMENT. YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING PROGRAMS ARE IMPORTANT TOOLS THAT RESULT IN SEVERAL POSITIVE OUTCOMES FOR YOUTH INVOLVED IN THESE ACTIVITIES. FOR EXAMPLE, YOUTH WILL BE INVOLVED IN POSITIVE ACTIVITIES UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF CARING ADULTS, INCREASE THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS OF SUBJECTS AND IMPROVE THEIR SELF CONFIDENCE AND SENSE OF WORTH WHEN COMPLETING PROJECTS AND TRAININGS. IN ADDITION, STEM (SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, MATHEMATICS) EDUCATION IS BEING EMPHASIZED NATION-WIDE TO IMPROVE U.S. STATUS AMONG LEADING NATIONS AND MANY OF THE BEST-PAYING JOBS FALL INTO THESE FIELDS. EARLY AND CONTINUED EXPOSURE TO STEM CURRICULUM HELP TO READY INTERESTED YOUTH IN PURSUIT OF CAREERS IN THESE FIELDS. THE PKZ VISTA WILL RESEARCH AND DEVELOP STEM CURRICULUM, PROJECTS, COMPETITIONS, AND LEARNING MATERIALS FOR ELEMENTARY THROUGH HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS AND HELP TO TRAIN STAFF IN THEIR IMPLEMENTATION IN PKZ AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS AT CITY RECREATION CENTERS AND PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS. BOYS AND YOUNG MEN OF COLOR ARE PARTICULARLY PLAGUED BY LOW PERFORMANCE IN THE EDUCATION SYSTEM AND DISPROPORTIONATELY INVOLVED IN THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM. BECAUSE OF THIS, PKZ AND PARTNERS WILL FOCUS RESOURCES AND STAFF TOWARDS EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS AND PROGRAMS TO ENGAGE BOYS AND YOUNG MEN OF COLOR IN POSITIVE ACTIVITIES. THE PKZ VISTA WILL ASSIST WITH DEVELOPING PROGRAMS AND RESOURCES AND ENGAGING PARTNERS IN IMPROVING THESE RESULTS.  DATA/MEASUREMENT PLAYS A SIGNIFICANT ROLE

THE ALABAMA A&M UNIVERSITY COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (AAMU CDC) MISSION IS TO PROMOTE AND ASSIST CITIZENS AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS IN REVITALIZING NEIGHBORHOODS AND BUILDING VIABLE COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE CITY OF HUNTSVILLE AND MADISON COUNTY, ALABAMA.

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES PRIORITY AREAS. THE OVERALL PROJECT GOALS ARE TO ENHANCE THE AAMU CDCS EDMONTON HEIGHTS NEIGHBORHOOD REVITALIZATION EFFORTS BY A) FACILITATING ACCESS TO SERVICES AND RESOURCES THAT IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN IN EDMONTON HEIGHTS AND SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS; B) CONNECTING DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN EDMONTON HEIGHTS AND SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS TO JOB AND COMPUTER TRAINING PROGRAMS, AND HEALTH CARE SERVICES; AND C) PROMOTING AND PROVIDING ENVIRONMENTALLY SAFE AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING.

THE PROJECT BUILDS UPON FORMING STRONG WORKING PARTNERSHIPS WITH ALABAMA A&M AND OAKWOOD UNIVERSITIES, THE HUNTSVILLE SCHOOL SYSTEM, J.F. DRAKE COMMUNITY COLLEGE, THE UNITED WAY OF MADISON COUNTY, THE EDMONTON HEIGHTS NEIGHBORHOOD ORGANIZATION, AND LOCAL CHURCHES AND CIVIC GROUPS. THE PROGRAM OBJECTIVES ARE: 1. TO IMPROVE THE AFTER-SCHOOL TUTORING & MENTORING PROGRAM THAT SERVE EDMONTON HEIGHTS AND SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS BY IMPLEMENTING ONE OR MORE SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, ART, AND MATHEMATICS (STEAM) PROJECTS; 2. TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS IN AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAM AND THE ALABAMA COOPERATIVE EXTENSION SYSTEM'S (ACES) PARENT/YOUTH READING ENHANCEMENT PROGRAM BY 50% EACH; 3. TO PARTNER WITH COMMUNITY GROUPS TO REPAIR HOMES OF ELDERLY PERSONS, AND TO CREATE A HEALTHY NEIGHBORHOOD INITIATIVE THAT IMPROVES ACCESS TO PREVENTIVE AND PRIMARY HEALTH CARE SERVICES FOR 100% OF EDMONTON HEIGHT RESIDENTS; 4. TO PLAN AND DEVELOP A JOB AND COMPUTER TRAINING PROGRAM; 5. TO SEEK AND  OBTAIN TWO OR MORE GRANTS OR OTHER FINANCIAL RESOURCES TO BUILD/REHAB AND SALE FOUR OR MORE ENVIRONMENTALLY SAFE AND AFFORDABLE HOMES TO LOW & MODERATE INCOME FAMILIES.  THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE 30+ YOUTH, 50+ PARENTS AND 500 HOUSEHOLDS IN THE EDMONTON HEIGHTS AND SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS.

FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL: A. RESEARCH & DEVELOP EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL AND RECRUIT AND TRAIN VOLUNTEERS FOR AFTER SCHOOL TUTORING & MENTORING PROGRAMS, THE JOB & COMPUTER TRAINING PROGRAMS AND THE PARENT READING ENHANCEMENT PROGRAM; B. MEET AND WORK WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO DEVELOP, AND IMPLEMENT A HEALTHY NEIGHBORHOOD INITIATIVE BY PROMOTING AND BUILDING ENVIRONMENTALLY SAFE HOMES; C. MEET AND WORK WITH UNIVERSITY FACULTY & STAFF TO RESEARCH, DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT ONE OR MORE STEAM PROJECTS; AND D. ASSIST AAMU CDC STAFF IN RESEARCHING AND PREPARING APPLICATIONS FOR HOUSING AND OTHER SOCIO-ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS IN EDMONTON HEIGHTS AND SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS; E. PERFORM OTHER DUTIES AS ASSIGNED.

ANCHORAGE PUBLIC LIBRARY'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE RESOURCES TO ENRICH THE LIVES AND EMPOWER THE FUTURE OF OUR DIVERSE COMMUNITY, WHILE PRESERVING THE PAST FOR GENERATIONS TO COME.  

THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND EDUCATION FOCUS AREAS. 

THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A DYNAMIC JOB SKILLS AND EDUCATION PROGRAM AT THE Z. J. LOUSSAC PUBLIC LIBRARY AND CONTINUE THE CURRENT EFFORTS AT THE MOUNTAIN VIEW LIBRARY THROUGH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING, UTILIZING COMMUNITY PARTNERS WITH SIMILAR GOALS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 2000 BENEFICIARIES. 

ONE STANDARD VISTA AND 1 COST SHARE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING JOB SHOP PROGRAMS AT BOTH LIBRARIES AND POPUP LOCATIONS, UTILIZING COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS AND PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE JOB SKILLS TRAINING AND PLANNING AND PRESENTING JOB FAIRS OVER THE COURSE OF 2018-2019.  

FIVE SUMMER ASSOCIATE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO SUPPORT SUMMER LEARNING WHICH PLAYS AN ESSENTIAL ROLE IN MAINTAINING STUDENT PROGRESS OVER THE SUMMER MONTHS. SA?S WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN AND MANAGE A POOL OF TEEN VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT LIBRARY EVENTS RELATED TO SUMMER LEARNING AND OFFER ENTRY LEVEL JOB SKILLS INSTRUCTION TO THE VOLUNTEENS AND EXPECTS TO BENEFIT 3000 OVER THE MONTHS OF MID-MAY TO MID-AUGUST, 2018.
