OUR ORGANIZATION'S MISSION STATEMENT: FOCUS: HOPE'S MISSION STATEMENT, ADOPTED MARCH 8, 1968, READS: "RECOGNIZING THE DIGNITY AND BEAUTY OF EVERY PERSON, WE PLEDGE INTELLIGENT AND PRACTICAL ACTION TO OVERCOME RACISM, POVERTY AND INJUSTICE. AND TO BUILD A METROPOLITAN COMMUNITY WHERE ALL PEOPLE MAY LIVE IN FREEDOM, HARMONY, TRUST AND AFFECTION. BLACK AND WHITE, YELLOW, BROWN AND RED FROM DETROIT AND ITS SUBURBS OF EVERY ECONOMIC STATUS, NATIONAL ORIGIN AND RELIGIOUS PERSUASION WE JOIN IN THIS COVENANT." 

CNCS PROGRAMMING PRIORITY AREA THAT OUR PROJECT ALIGNS WITH: THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THREE OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE'S (CNCS) FOCUS AREAS: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, AND HEALTH FUTURES. 

DESCRIPTION OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT GOALS, AND WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PROJECT: THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BUILD CAPACITY AND MOBILIZE RESOURCES TO WORK TOWARD OUR GOAL THAT BY THE YEAR 2031, 100% OF RESIDENTS OF THE HOPE VILLAGE WOULD BE EDUCATIONALLY WELL-PREPARED, ECONOMICALLY SELF-SUFFICIENT, LIVING IN A SAFE AND SUPPORTIVE ENVIRONMENT. FOCUS: HOPE AND ITS VISTA PARTNERS HOPE TO BENEFIT AT LEAST 1,500 INDIVIDUALS AND EARN AT LEAST $20,000 IN GRANTS. 

NUMBER OF VISTAS AND LEADERS REQUESTING: 9 VISTA MEMBERS AND 1 VISTA LEADER WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS WORKING WITH FAMILIES TO INCREASE ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY, SUPPORT HOME-OWNERSHIP, PROMOTE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS, AND SUPPORTING CULTURALLY APPROPRIATE EARLY EDUCATION. TO SUPPORT OUR EFFORTS TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS, VISTA MEMBERS WILL ALSO BUILD CAPACITY BY EXPANDING VOLUNTEER NETWORKS AND OPPORTUNITIES, CREATING NEW COMMUNICATION TOOLS, AND WRITING GRANTS AND RESEARCHING FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT YEAR.

THE ESTIMATED TIME REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT: BASED ON THE DEPTH OF THE WORK REQUIRED, WE ESTIMATE THAT IT WILL TAKE 3 YEARS TO COMPLETE THIS PROJECT.

COMMUNITY ACTION NETWORK (CAN)'S MISSION IS TO PARTNER WITH CHILDREN, FAMILIES, AND INDIVIDUALS FROM UNDER-RESOURCED NEIGHBORHOODS IN WASHTENAW COUNTY TO CREATE BETTER FUTURES FOR THEMSELVES, AND TO IMPROVE THE COMMUNITIES IN WHICH THEY LIVE.
 
THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECTS ALIGN WITH THE EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT IN THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA WILL CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN AND EXPAND THE ACADEMIC TUTORING AND ENRICHMENT SUPPORT AND DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A COLLEGE ACCESS AND SUCCESS PROMOTING PROGRAM, BENEFITING THE OVER 250 STUDENTS CURRENTLY SERVED ANNUALLY BY CAN. THIS NUMBER IS INCREASING AS CAN CONTINUES TO EXPAND.
 
THE VISTA PROJECT IN THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA WILL STRENGTHEN AND EXPAND CAN'S WORK SKILLS DEVELOPMENT, CAREER EXPLORATION, INTERNSHIP, APPRENTICESHIP AND JOB SHADOWING AND PLACEMENT PROGRAMS, BENEFITING THE ~ 60+ TEENS CAN TRAINS ANNUALLY. THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STRONGER POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION COMPONENT HAS COMMENCED.
 
TWELVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROJECTS' GOALS BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS THE DEVELOPMENT OF TRAINING CURRICULA, TOOLKITS, PROTOCOLS AND OTHER RESOURCES, PILOTING AND REFINING NEW PROGRAM COMPONENTS, DESIGNING VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES, INCREASING THE NUMBER OF LOCATIONS AT WHICH CAN OFFERS ITS PROGRAMS, AND EXPANDING AND SOLIDIFYING RELATIONSHIPS WITH EXISTING AND POTENTIAL EMPLOYERS OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT TWO YEARS. VISTAS WILL ALSO ASSIST IN THE ADDITIONAL RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT NEEDED TO SUSTAIN THESE EXPANDED PROGRAMS IN THE FUTURE. THIS YEAR, 2017, IS AN ESPECIALLY IMPORTANT YEAR FOR CAN, AS IT IS CELEBRATING ITS 30TH ANNIVERSARY ? AND A SPECIAL SIGNATURE EVENT IS PLANNED FOR OCTOBER.

COMMUNITY ENCOMPASS IS A NON-PROFIT CHRISTIAN, COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATION IN DOWNTOWN MUSKEGON. WE ARE COMMITTED TO MOVEMENT OUT OF POVERTY THROUGH ASSET BASED COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT. OUR MISSION IS TO TRANSFORM DOWNTOWN MUSKEGON NEIGHBORHOODS BY ENGAGING AND EQUIPPING NEIGHBORS TO BUILD A HEALTHY COMMUNITY FROM THE INSIDE OUT BY SEEKING JUSTICE AND A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE THROUGH LONG-TERM, SUSTAINABLE CHANGES. OUR VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOLLOWING CNCS FOCUS AREAS: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND CAPACITY BUILDING. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL: INCREASE THE NUMBER OF DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS WITH IMPROVED HOUSING OUTCOMES; ADDRESS CRITICAL EDUCATION NEEDS AND BREAK THE CYCLE OF POVERTY BY IMPROVING EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES; ADDRESS UNMET NEEDS IN HEALTHY FUTURES TO ALLEVIATE HUNGER; AND STRENGTHEN OUR CAPACITY TO INCREASE, EXPAND, AND ENHANCE SERVICES THAT MAKE THE GREATEST IMPACT ON THE MOST PRESSING NEEDS IN MUSKEGON NEIGHBORHOODS.  NINE VISTA WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY OUTREACH, PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT, AND LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT YEAR.

THE INDY HUNGER NETWORK IS A COALITION OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM LEADING ANTI-HUNGER ORGANIZATIONS, BOTH PUBLIC AND PRIVATE, IN INDIANAPOLIS. THE MISSION OF IHN IS TO CREATE A SUSTAINABLE SYSTEM THAT ENSURES ANYONE WHO IS HUNGRY IN THE GREATER INDIANAPOLIS AREA CAN ACCESS THE FOOD THEY NEED. 
THE INDY HUNGER NETWORK (IHN) WAS ESTABLISHED IN MARCH 2009 AND WAS INCORPORATED IN FEBRUARY 2012. PARTNERS INCLUDE CICOA AGING & IN-HOME SOLUTIONS, CONNECT2HELP, DOW AGROSCIENCES, ELANCO, GLEANERS FOOD BANK OF INDIANA, MEALS ON WHEELS, MIDWEST FOOD BANK, SECOND HELPINGS, AND ST. VINCENT DE PAUL.

THE FOOD ASSISTANCE SYSTEM THAT FEEDS THE HUNGRY IS LARGE AND COMPLEX. THE MEMBERS OF THE INDY HUNGER NETWORK HAVE DEMONSTRATED THROUGH THEIR INDIVIDUAL ACTIONS AND BY WORKING TOGETHER THAT WE CAN MAKE THE SYSTEM MORE EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE.  IHN MEMBERS HAVE COLLECTIVELY INCREASED THE NUMBER OF MEALS PROVIDED TO PEOPLE FACING FOOD INSECURITY TO FACE THE GROWING DEMAND FOR FOOD ASSISTANCE.

KEY FUNCTIONS OF THE INDY HUNGER NETWORK INCLUDE:
-	FOSTER COLLABORATION AND BUILD ON THE STRENGTHS AND CAPABILITIES OF EXISTING FOOD-PROVIDING COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, ENCOURAGING PUBLIC SUPPORT OF THEM
-	RESEARCH TO IDENTIFY STRATEGIC OPPORTUNITIES TO MAKE THE SYSTEM WORK BETTER FOR HUNGRY PEOPLE
-	ESTABLISH PROJECTS TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS, UTILIZING COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS
-	SERVE AS ADVOCATES WHERE NEEDED AND APPROPRIATE

KEY ACTIVITIES CURRENTLY ON-GOING IN INDIANAPOLIS INCLUDE:

SUMMER SERVINGS ? THE INDY HUNGER NETWORK SUPPORTS THE FEDERAL SUMMER FOOD SERVICE PROGRAM VIA AN AWARENESS CAMPAIGN THROUGHOUT MARION COUNTY. IHN BRANDED THE PROGRAM ?SUMMER SERVINGS? IN 2011. EACH YEAR, IHN HAS USED GRANT FUNDS TO PRODUCE MARKETING MATERIALS FOR THE SPONSORS AND SERVING SITES, AND WE CONVENE AN ANNUAL MEETING OF THE ALL THE MEAL-SITE SPONSORS TO DISCUSS WAYS TO IMPROVE PARTICIPATION AND SHARE BEST PRACTICES.

FRESH BUCKS ? FRESH BUCKS PROVIDES UP TO A $20 MATCH ON PURCHASES OF FRESH FRUITS AND VEGETABLES USING SNAP DOLLARS AT AREA FARMERS? MARKETS. THIS PROGRAM ALLOWS SNAP RECIPIENTS TO PURCHASE MORE HEALTHY LOCAL PRODUCE BY DOUBLING THEIR SNAP DOLLARS. FRESH BUCKS IS CURRENTLY AVAILABLE AT 12 MARKETS, AND WE ARE EXPANDING THE PROGRAM INTO POGUE?S RUN GROCER, A CO-OP MARKET, AND A KROGER STORE.
 
COOKING AND NUTRITION EDUCATION ? IHN IS PROVIDING COOKING AND NUTRITION EDUCATION CLASSES, USING THE COOKING MATTERS CURRICULUM CREATED BY SHARE OUR STRENGTH. WE A SUCCESSFUL PILOT PROGRAM AT FIVE SITES THROUGHOUT THE CITY AND FOUND THAT CLASS PARTICIPANTS REPORTED INCREASES IN THE NUMBER OF MEALS THEY COOKED EACH WEEK, THE NUMBER OF SERVINGS OF FRUITS AND VEGETABLES THEY ATE, AND THEIR ABILITY TO STRETCH THEIR FUNDS IN PURCHASING HEALTHY FOODS AFTER PARTICIPATING IN THE CLASS. WE WILL BE TEACHING ADDITIONAL CLASSES IN EARLY 2017, AND WE ARE WORKING ON SECURING FUNDING TO SCALE UP THE PROGRAM TO MORE SITES.

RESEARCH TO GUIDE EFFECTIVENESS ? IN 2014, IHN WORKED WITH PARTNERS TO DEVELOP A TELEPHONE SURVEY METHODOLOGY TO DIRECTLY MEASURE HOW MUCH UNMET NEED FOR FOOD ASSISTANCE REMAINS IN THE COMMUNITY, WHICH FOOD ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS PEOPLE USE, AND BARRIERS TO THEIR PARTICIPATION IN KEY PROGRAMS. EXTENSIVE BENCHMARKING REVEALED THAT SUCH A METRIC HAD NOT BEEN ESTABLISHED BY ANYONE AROUND THE COUNTRY. THE STUDY BEGAN IN 2014, AND RESULTS ARE BEING USED TO STEER IHN?S WORK. WE ARE WORKING ON PLANS FOR CONDUCTING THE SURVEY AGAIN IN EARLY 2017. WE ARE ALSO STARTING WORK ON A MARKET RESEARCH SURVEY FOR SNAP TO DETERMINE WHY MORE ELIGIBLE PEOPLE ARE NOT ENROLLED IN SNAP.

WIC MARKETING ? IN 2015, WE CONDUCTED A MARKET RESEARCH STUDY OF WOMEN ELIGIBLE FOR WIC AND FOUND THAT WHILE PUBLIC PERCEPTIONS OF WIC WERE STRONGLY POSITIVE, ABOUT HALF OF THE PEOPLE ELIGIBLE FOR WIC THAT WERE NOT ENROLLED FIRMLY BELIEVED THEY WERE NOT ELIGIBLE. WE ARE WORKING WITH THE STATE AND MARION COUNTY WIC OFFICES ON STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE MARKETING FOR WIC AND ENABLE MORE ELIGIBLE PE

FORDHAM LAW SCHOOL'S FEERICK CENTER FOR SOCIAL JUSTICE PROMOTES THE RIGHTS AND ADDRESSES THE PROBLEMS FACING MARGINALIZED AND LOW-INCOME NEW YORKERS THROUGH THE CREATION OF STRATEGIES TO REFORM POLICIES, EDUCATE, AND PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO RIGHT WRONGS.  HIGHLY REGARDED FOR ITS EFFICACY AND DEDICATION TO COMBATING INEQUITIES, THE CENTER WORKS WITH WIDE-RANGING NETWORKS TO RALLY PARTNERS IN THE LEGAL COMMUNITY AND BEYOND TO RESPOND TO THE CHALLENGES OF THOSE IN NEED.  FORDHAM LAW FACULTY AND STUDENTS INVOLVED AT THE CENTER COLLABORATE WITH THE CITY'S NONPROFIT, LEGAL SERVICES, AND PUBLIC SECTORS TO CREATE LONG-TERM INNOVATIVE SOLUTIONS CRITICAL TO REAL CHANGE.
THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS DIRECTLY WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREAS OF EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES.  THE CENTER PROPOSES SEVERAL PRIMARY AREAS OF SERVICE:  (1) IN COLLABORATION WITH SUBSITE UNITED NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSES (UNH) PLACING AND SUPPORTING VOLUNTEERS THROUGH AN EXPANDED LEGAL ECONOMIC AND EDUCATIONAL ADVANCEMENT PROJECT (LEEAP) TO ASSIST LOW-INCOME NYC FAMILIES AND STUDENTS IN ACCESSING HIGH QUALITY EDUCATION FOR PRE-K, KINDERGARTEN, MIDDLE SCHOOL AND HIGH SCHOOL (ONE VISTA MEMBER AT UNH AND ONE VISTA MEMBER AT THE FEERICK CENTER); (2) PLACING AND SUPPORTING VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST LOW-INCOME VETERANS WITH LEGAL ISSUES, INCLUDING VETERANS' BENEFITS, FAMILY LAW, AND CONSUMER (ONE VISTA AT THE FEERICK CENTER); (3) LAUNCHING AN INITIATIVE TO RECRUIT SENIORS TO COUNSEL AND PLACE FELLOW SENIORS IN VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT BENEFIT LOW-INCOME NEW YORKERS, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON ATTORNEY VOLUNTEERS AND VETERAN SERVICE PROVIDERS (ONE VISTA AT THE FEERICK CENTER).  IN ADDITION, THE CENTER PROPOSES TWO ADDITIONAL SUB-SITES. THE FIRST, PRO BONO NET'S IMMIGRATION ADVOCATES NETWORK, WILL HAVE ONE VISTA WHO WILL HELP LAUNCH A CAMPAIGN TO SUPPORT LEGAL VOLUNTEER EFFORTS TARGETED TO VULNERABLE NEWCOMERS, INCLUDING DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURVIVORS, TRAFFICKING VICTIMS, AND UNACCOMPANIED IMMIGRANT CHILDREN.  THIS WORK IS NATIONAL IN SCOPE AND FOCUSES ON TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND CAPACITY BUILDING.  THE SECOND, VOLUNTEERS OF LEGAL SERVICE (VOLS), WILL HAVE ONE VISTA WHO WILL WORK WITH THE MICROENTERPRISE PROJECT TO RECRUIT VOLUNTEER ATTORNEYS AND OTHER PROFESSIONALS TO PROVIDE PRO BONO LEGAL AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO LOW-INCOME SMALL BUSINESS OWNERS, WHO ARE PRIMARILY IMMIGRANT, PERSONS OF COLOR AND WOMEN.

THE MISSION OF HANDSON NEW ORLEANS IS TO ENGAGE, EMPOWER, AND TRANSFORM OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE. IN 2006, THE NATIONAL HANDSON NETWORK ORGANIZED HURRICANE KATRINA RELIEF AND REBUILDING EFFORTS BY ESTABLISHING A PRESENCE IN NEW ORLEANS.  IN 2008, THE ORGANIZATION BECAME AN INDEPENDENTLY OPERATED AFFILIATE UNDER ITS OWN 501C3 STATUS.  IN 2009, HANDSON NETWORK MERGED WITH POINTS OF LIGHT, THE WORLD'S LARGEST VOLUNTEER ORGANIZATION.FROM 2009-2011, HANDSON NEW ORLEANS EVOLVED FROM A DISASTER RESPONSE PROJECT INTO A THRIVING VOLUNTEER ACTION CENTER FOR GRASSROOTS SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES. 

IN 2012, THE ORGANIZATION DEEPENED ITS COMMITMENT TO COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION THROUGH A SUITE OF SYNERGISTIC PROGRAMS AND COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS TO BENEFIT LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS.  BY LEVERAGING CORE STRENGTHS OF VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT, HIGH-IMPACT SERVICE PROJECTS, AND DISASTER MANAGEMENT, HANDSON STRENGTHENS FAMILIES AND TRANSFORMS NEIGHBORHOODS.  THE ORGANIZATION'S WORK IMPROVES ACCESS TO RESOURCES, SUPPORTS EDUCATIONAL EQUITY, PROMOTES HEALTHY EATING AND ACTIVE LIFESTYLES, AND SUSTAINS THE NATURAL AND BUILT ENVIRONMENT THROUGH BLIGHT REDUCTION AND CONSERVATION PROJECTS.  

THIS CONTINUATION PROJECT WILL FURTHER THE ORGANIZATION'S PROGRAMS IN VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT, COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION, AND DISASTER MANAGEMENT.   THE THREE-FOLD GOALS ARE 1) TO FACILITATE ACCESS TO SERVICES AND RESOURCES THAT IMPROVE FINANCIAL LITERACY WITH THE OUTCOME OF INCREASED NUMBER OF LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS USING VITA SERVICES; 2) TO REDUCE CHILDHOOD OBESITY BY INCREASING ACCESS TO SAFE, PHYSICAL ACTIVITY LOCATIONS AND BY INCREASING ACCESS TO FRESH FOODS; AND 3) TO INCREASE DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND COMMUNITY RESILIENCY.  

TO THIS END, HANDSON IS REQUESTING EIGHT VISTAS WITH THE CAPACITY BUILDING GOAL OF EXPANDING THE ORGANIZATION'S SCALE/REACH AS WE PROVIDE NEW/EXPANDED TYPES OF SERVICES.   THE VISTAS WILL CREATE AND IMPLEMENT PROCEDURES TO IMPROVE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF LOCAL VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT , DEVELOP COLLABORATIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS , IMPLEMENT DISASTER MANAGEMENT BEST PRACTICES, LEVERAGE FUNDING, SUPPORT COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT AND ENHANCE ORGANIZATIONAL EFFECTIVENESS.   

IN ADDITION, HANDSON IS REQUESTING 25 SUMMER ASSOCIATES VIA OUR PARTNERSHIP WITH SECOND HARVEST FOOD BANK TO SUPPORT SUMMER FEEDING PROGRAMS IN ORLEANS, EVANGELINE, IBERIA, JEFFERSON, LAFAYETTE, ST. TAMMANY, PLAQUEMINES, ST. CHARLES, ST. LANDRY AND TERREBONNE PARISH SUMMER CAMPS AND SENIOR CENTERS.

TRULY LIVING WELL'S MISSION IS TO ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY IN DEVELOPING LOCAL FOOD SYSTEMS THROUGH EDUCATION AND FOOD PRODUCTION.  TLW DEMONSTRATES URBAN AGRICULTURE AS A SUSTAINABLE AND ECONOMIC SOLUTION FOR HELPING PEOPLE TO EAT AND LIVE WELL.  THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION,HEALTHY FUTURES AND OPIOID CRISIS FOCUS AREAS. 

THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO PROMOTE URBAN AGRICULTURE AS A SOLUTION FOR POVERTY AND HUNGER, AND IMPROVING HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR ADULTS AND YOUTH.  THIS YEAR'S PROGRAM WILL DEVELOP REPLICABLE MODELS TO SUPPORT URBAN AGRICULTURE AS A TOOL TO REDUCE POVERTY AND HUNGER, INCREASE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD AND ADVANCE THE HUMAN CONDITION.  FIVE VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY WORKING IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:

1) BUILD CAPACITY TO INCREASE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD, INFLUENCE PEOPLE TO MAKE BETTER DECISIONS AND PARTAKE IN PRACTICES THAT WILL IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH AND THEIR LIVES THROUGH TLW MARKETS, FRESH STOP MARKETS;
2) DEVELOP A ROBUST HORTICULTURAL THERAPY PROGRAM TO PROVIDE OPIOID CRISIS INTERVENTION STRATEGIES THAT INCLUDE PREVENTION AND INTERVENTION AND AMONG YOUTH AND ADULTS;
3) DEEPEN ENGAGEMENT OF VOLUNTEERISM TO INCREASE RETENTION AND USING URBAN AG AS TRANSFORMATIONAL TOOL
4) BUILDING ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO PROMOTE, EXPAND AND IMPROVE PROGRAMS THROUGH DATA COLLECTION AND DOCUMENTATION OF SUCCESS. 

TLW HAS A TREMENDOUS OPPORTUNITY TO SERVE AS A DEMONSTRATION OF SUCCESSFUL STRATEGIES TO REDUCE HUNGER AND INCREASE FOOD ACCESS. THE PROJECT SHOULD TAKE UP TO 12 MONTHS TO ACHIEVE MEASURABLE RESULTS. BY PROVIDING MUCH NEEDED SUPPORT FOR MEASURING SUCCESS AND DOCUMENTING FINDINGS, TLW WILL BE IN A POSITION TO SHARE BEST PRACTICES AND LESSONS LEARNED.  OUR GOAL IS TO SHARE OUR KNOWLEDGE OF THE BENEFITS OF URBAN AGRICULTURE TO HELP OTHERS WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY AND ACROSS THE STATE AND THE NATION.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

ACCORDING TO THE NATIONAL ASSESSMENT OF EDUCATIONAL PROGRESS, ONLY ABOUT ONE-THIRD OF OUR NATION'S FOURTH GRADERS CAN READ PROFICIENTLY. ONCE STUDENTS START TO FALL BEHIND IN READING, THEY TEND TO FALL FASTER AND FURTHER BEHIND THEIR PEERS EVERY YEAR. READING PARTNERS' MISSION IS TO HELP CHILDREN BECOME LIFELONG READERS BY EMPOWERING COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE INDIVIDUALIZED INSTRUCTION WITH MEASURABLE RESULTS. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE CNCS EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO SERVE 11,313 STUDENTS BY RECRUITING 14,000 VOLUNTEERS DURING THE 2019-2020 SCHOOL YEAR. 8 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY RELATIONS, RESOURCE AND TEMPLATE CREATION, TRAINING, RESEARCH AND PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION.

SOUTH OAKLAND SHELTER IS A NON-PROFIT 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO END HOMELESSNESS THROUGH MOBILIZING INTERFAITH AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES. SOS OFFERS A COMPREHENSIVE SET OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES FOCUSED ON PROVIDING EMERGENCY SHELTER, HOUSING ASSISTANCE, AND COUNSELING AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO MEN, WOMEN AND CHILDREN IN A SAFE, DRUG-FREE ENVIRONMENT. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT CLOSELY ALIGNS WITH THE SEVERAL OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICE'S FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL WORK TO END HOMELESSNESS IN METRO-DETROIT BY BUILDING SOS'S CAPACITY TO ASSIST INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. ADDITIONALLY, THE VISTA PROJECT WILL ASSIST IN ACHIEVING GOALS IN THE HEALTH CARE FOCUS AREA BY AIDING HOMELESS AND FORMERLY HOMELESS HOUSEHOLDS WITH ACCESSING HEALTH CARE BENEFITS. THROUGHOUT FY 2016, THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BENEFIT OVER 500 INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES EXPERIENCING OR RECOVERING FROM HOMELESSNESS. THE PROJECT ALSO EXPECTS TO RAISE SIGNIFICANT IN-KIND AND CASH DONATIONS AND STEWARD OVER 150 NEW COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS. 

IN THE FY 2016 YEAR, 5 VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING SUCH ACTIVITIES AS: IDENTIFYING NEW AND EXISTING HOUSING RESOURCES FOR THOSE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS IN THE COMMUNITY; PARTNERING WITH AREA BUSINESSES, ORGANIZATIONS, AND INDIVIDUALS TO INCREASE AGENCY CAPACITY TO PROVIDE HOUSING SERVICES; CONNECTING WITH PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS ON HEALTH CARE BENEFIT ACCESS FOR THOSE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS; AND STEWARDING NEW AND CURRENT COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS TO AID IN ENDING HOMELESSNESS IN OUR COMMUNITY.

THE IONIA COUNTY INTERMEDIATE SCHOOL DISTRICT'S MISSION STATEMENT STATES THAT THE ORGANIZATION WILL "COOPERATE AND PROVIDE SERVICES AND LEADERSHIP AS A PARTNER WITH ITS LOCAL DISTRICTS, PUBLIC AND PRIVATE AGENCIES, OTHER ISDS, THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, AND HIGHER EDUCATION, TO DELIVER QUALITY TEACHING AND LEARNING TO STUDENTS AND STAFF."  THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM PROVIDES AN OPPORTUNITY TO SUPPORT THIS MISSION BY ITS COLLABORATION WITH THE LOCAL SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND OTHER COMMUNITY ENTITIES WITH A FOCUS ON TEACHING, MENTORING, AND THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION-RELATED SERVICES FOR CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA.  THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO BENEFIT 11,000 AT-RISK, LOW INCOME CHILDREN BY: 

-PROVIDING STUDENTS WITH COMPREHENSIVE, MULTIFACETED, AND INTEGRATED SUPPORTS THAT ARE ACCESSIBLE, TIMELY, AND STRENGTH-BASED SO STUDENTS CAN ACHIEVE IN SCHOOL, BE CONFIDENT AND CARING, AND BECOME CONTRIBUTING CITIZENS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES;
-INVOLVING FAMILIES, FELLOW STUDENTS, EDUCATORS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS AS INTEGRAL PARTNERS IN THE PROVISION OF A SUPPORTIVE, RESPECTFUL LEARNING ENVIRONMENT; AND
-INTEGRATING THE HUMAN AND FINANCIAL RESOURCES OF PUBLIC AND PRIVATE AGENCIES TO CREATE CARING COMMUNITIES AT EACH SCHOOL.

IONIA COUNTY INTERMEDIATE SCHOOL DISTRICT IS REQUESTING AN EXTENSION OF THE FULL-TIME VISTA PROGRAM AND 6-8 SUMMER VISTA ASSOCIATES AT THIS TIME.  DURING THE EXTENSION, VISTA MEMBERS WILL WORK WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO COMPLETE TRANSITION OF ACTIVITIES SUCH AS: VOLUNTEER MOBILIZATION, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT IN THE AREAS OF SCHOOL READINESS, K-12 EDUCATION, COLLEGE ACCESS, YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND BASIC NEEDS (FOOD INSECURITY).

SEEDS MISSION IS TO PROVIDE LOCAL SOLUTIONS AND WORK AT THE INTERSECTION OF ECOLOGY, EDUCATION AND DESIGN. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THREE OF THE CNCS FOCUS AREAS:ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY (YOUTH EMPLOYABILITY), EDUCATION (K12 SUCCESS),  AND HEALTHY FUTURES (OBESITY PREVENTION AND ACCESS TO FOOD). THIS VISTA PROJECT GOAL IS TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC AND BEHAVIOR TRENDS IN INDIVIDUAL YOUTH AND PROVIDE AVENUES TOWARD SECONDARY SCHOOL AND EMPLOYMENT. WE EXPECT VISTA MEMBER EFFORTS TO DIRECTLY BENEFIT OVER 250 YOUNG PEOPLE WITH TARGETED, LONGITUDINAL IMPACT AND CREATE CAPACITY FOR THE ANCILLARY SUPPORT TO BENEFIT HUNDREDS OF ADDITIONAL STUDENTS AND THEIR LARGER FAMILIES. VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS FUNDRAISING, RESEARCH, RESOURCE MAPPING, COORDINATION AND LOGISTICS FOR THE DURATION OF THE GRANT CYCLE.  WHILE THE WORK IN THIS PROJECT AREA WILL NEVER BE COMPLETE, ANOTHER YEAR OF VISTA MEMBERS WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF OUR PROGRAM AREAS TO REACH MORE YOUTH AND CREATE GREATER IMPACT.  WE ARE REQUESTING 12 TOTAL MEMBERS BROKEN INTO THE CATEGORIES OF 1 LEADER, 3 STANDARD, AND 8 COST SHARE VISTAS.

THE MISSION OF GEORGIA 4-H IS TO ASSIST YOUTH IN ACQUIRING KNOWLEDGE, DEVELOPING LIFE SKILLS, AND FORMING ATTITUDES THAT WILL ENABLE THEM TO BECOME SELF-DIRECTING, PRODUCTIVE AND CONTRIBUTING MEMBERS OF SOCIETY. THIS MISSION IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH "HANDS ON" LEARNING EXPERIENCES, FOCUSED ON AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, AGRICULTURE AWARENESS, LEADERSHIP, COMMUNICATION SKILLS, FOODS AND NUTRITION, HEALTH, ENERGY CONSERVATION, AND CITIZENSHIP. THE PROPOSED VISTA PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE EDUCATION AND CAPACITY BUILDING FOCUS AREAS. THE VISTA PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE PARTICIPATION OF LOW INCOME YOUTH IN RESEARCH BASED 4-H PROGRAMMING, WHICH HAS BEEN SHOWN TO IMPROVE SCHOOL PERFORMANCE, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND HEALTHY DECISION MAKING. OUR GOAL IS TO ENGAGE 300 LOW-INCOME YOUTH PER YEAR, IN RURAL AND URBAN AREAS ACROSS GEORGIA. TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF RESOURCES TO SUPPORT YOUTH, 6 VISTA MEMBERS (4 STANDARD AND 2 COST SHARE) WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS DEVELOPING OR EXPANDING FUNDING STREAMS (THROUGH GRANTS AND SUSTAINABLE FUNDRAISERS) AND EXPANDING THE VOLUNTEER-LED CLUBS (THROUGH INVOLVEMENT AS CLUB LEADERS).  NEWLY FORMED CLUBS WILL FOCUS ON SCHOOL READINESS, IMPROVING STUDENT PERFORMANCE, AND REDUCTION OF SUMMER LEARNING LOSS.

BUILDING SKILLS PARTNERSHIP (BSP) RESPECTFULLY REQUESTS THE SUPPORT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FOR A 10TH AND FINAL YEAR OF SUPPORT TO CONTINUE TO DEEPEN, INCREASE PROGRAMMING, AND EXPORT OUR EFFECTIVE PROGRAMMING. THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST IN BUILDING WITH THE EXPANSION OF PROGRAMMING TO A WIDER ARRAY OF WORKING FAMILIES IN THE SERVICE INDUSTRY, WHICH INCLUDE A HIGH CONCENTRATION OF AFRICAN-AMERICAN WORKERS AND THEIR FAMILIES.  THE WORK OF VISTAS WILL BE IMPERATIVE AS BSP EXPANDS ITS INFRASTRUCTURE AND CAPACITY TO NOT ONLY REACH THESE POPULATIONS, BUT TO BE ABLE TO BUILD BRIDGES AND ALLIANCES BETWEEN ALL SERVICE WORKERS TO CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR UPWARD INCOME MOBILITY. DURING THIS NEAR YEAR OF THE PROJECT, BUILDING SKILLS PARTNERSHIP IS PROPOSING TO COST-SHARE FIVE PLACEMENTS (5 COST-SHARE AND 2 REGULAR). 

THIS REQUEST IS FOR A 10TH AND FINAL YEAR CONTINUATION PROJECT THAT WILL BEGIN ON 09/03/2018 AND CONCLUDE ON 08/02/2020.  BSP PROPOSES TO WORK IN MOUNTAIN VIEW, OAKLAND, SAN DIEGO, SANTA CLARA, ORANGE COUNTY, AND LOS ANGELES COUNTIES BY PROVIDING A MULTIFACETED APPROACH TO UPLIFTING FAMILIES FROM POVERTY. THIS APPLICATION PROPOSES TO CLOSE SPECIFIC PROGRAMMING, WHICH HAS BEEN SUPPORTED THROUGH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE AND HAS NOW BEEN INSTITUTIONALIZED AND WILL CONTINUED TO BE SUSTAINED AT BSP.  FOR THIS APPLICATION, WE ARE CONTINUING TO PROPOSE TO NOT HOST A VISTA MEMBER IN OUR SAN JOSE OFFICE. BSP HAS ABSORBED PROGRAMMING AND SUSTAINED THIS OFFICE SINCE FY 2016-2017. IN ADDITION, BSP PROPOSES TO CONTINUE WITH OUR RESPONSIBILITY FOR COST-SHARE.

FOR THIS PROJECT CONTINUATION, BSP PROPOSES TO CONTINUE OUR COST-SHARES TO 5 MEMBERS. COST-SHARE CITIES INCLUDE SAN DIEGO, ORANGE, AND LOS ANGELES. BSP IS REQUESTING THE SUPPORT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FOR 7 VISTA'S 2 REGULAR AND 5 COST-SHARES. THESE VISTA'S WILL CONTINUE WORKING ON EXPANDING PROVEN EFFECTIVE PROGRAMMING TO RELATIVELY NEW REGIONS, WHICH INCLUDE SAN DIEGO, OAKLAND, AND MOUNTAIN VIEW. FOR THESE SITES, BSP IS REQUESTING THE FOLLOWING VISTA PLACEMENTS: 1 IN SAN DIEGO, 1 IN OAKLAND AND 2 IN MOUNTAIN VIEW (AT GOOGLE).  FOR EXISTING SITES WHICH INCLUDE LOS ANGELES AND ORANGE COUNTY, BSP IS PROPOSING TO CONTINUE WITH IS STRATEGY TO BUILDING ITS COLLEGE ACCESS PROGRAM WHILE ALSO EXPANDING THE PROGRAM TO A WIDER ARRAY OF WORKING FAMILIES IN THE SERVICE INDUSTRY. ALL VISTAS WILL WORK TOWARDS DEVELOPING, STRENGTHENING, AND EXPANDING BSP'S COLLEGE ACCESS PROGRAMS, WHICH INCLUDE THE SUCCESSFUL TRANSITION FROM YOUTH TO ADULTHOOD. VISTAS WILL ASSIST IN DEVELOPING AN INFRASTRUCTURE THROUGH VOLUNTEERS, SYSTEMS, PARTNERSHIPS AND GRANTS TO SUPPORT OUR OBJECTIVE TO HELP STUDENT'S COMPLETE HIGH SCHOOL, ENROLL IN COLLEGE, AND ENTER IN THE WORKFORCE. WE STRONGLY BELIEVE THE ABOVE STRATEGY ALIGNS CLOSELY WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE TO BREAK CYCLES OF POVERTY.  IN ADDITION, BSP WILL PROVIDE TRAINING AND SERVICES TO HELP BOTH IMMIGRANT WORKERS AND AFRICAN-AMERICAN WORKERS TRANSITION FROM OUR VOCATIONAL PROGRAMS TO SUBSEQUENTLY CONTINUE TO HIGHER EDUCATION OR CAREER TRAINING, THUS INCREASING THEIR INCOME AND SOCIAL MOBILITY FOR THEMSELVES AND THEIR FAMILIES. 

SINCE RECEIVING ITS FIRST GRANT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE IN 2008, BSP HAS BEEN ABLE TO ACHIEVE IMPORTANT OPERATIONAL AND INFRASTRUCTURAL GOALS BECAUSE OF THE CONTRIBUTIONS MADE BY VISTA MEMBERS. BSP'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES, TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM THAT IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR LOW-WAGE PROPERTY SERVICE WORKERS AND THEIR FAMILIES BY INCREASING THEIR SKILLS, ACCESS TO EDUCATION, AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR CAREER AND COMMUNITY ADVANCEMENT. THE VISTA GRANT AND VISTA MEMBERS HAVE BEEN AN ESSENTIAL ELEMENT OF BSP'S SUCCESS.
